TEXT.English: 3D Body Atlas

The human body revealed, all in an interactive 3D web application. The application is a revolutionary 3D visualization and learning tool used to explore the systems of the human body. It contains more than 3,600 anatomical structures, including all major organs and systems of the male and female body. This application is used by healthcare professionals, patients, students, and all others interested in detailed visualization of human anatomy. For the 500 years that we have been teaching Human Anatomy there has been no other way to look inside the living human body other than actually opening it during surgery.
TEXT.French: The human body revealed, all in an interactive 3D web application. The application is a revolutionary 3D visualization and learning tool used to explore the systems of the human body. It contains more than 3,600 anatomical structures, including all major organs and systems of the male and female body. This application is used by healthcare professionals, patients, students, and all others interested in detailed visualization of human anatomy. For the 500 years that we have been teaching Human Anatomy there has been no other way to look inside the living human body other than actually opening it during surgery.
TEXT.Polish: Anatomia człowieka, antropotomia (starogr. anthropos - człowiek) - nauka o budowie narządów i układów ciała człowieka, wchodzi w skład morfologii i posługuje się metodami na poziomie makroskopowym (np. obserwacji żywych organizmów i badań sekcyjnych zwłok). Obecnie anatomia ściśle wiąże się z fizjologią, poświęcając dużo uwagi funkcji i działaniu poszczególnych narządów. Jest to anatomia czynnościowa. Anatomia i fizjologia stanowią podstawę medycyny, gdyż nie można skutecznie udzielić pomocy w chorobie nie znając dokładnie budowy i czynności organizmu zdrowego. Nowoczesne techniki rezonansu magnetycznego i USG umożliwiają obrazowanie bez szkodliwego wpływu promieniowania rentgenowskiego na organizm.

TEXT.English: Build a 3D Body Atlas to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atlas du Corps en 3D[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj 3D Body Atlas by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Abu Simbel
TEXT.French: Abou Simbel

TEXT.English: Abu Simbel is an archaeological site comprising two massive rock temples in southern Egypt on the western bank of Lake Nasser. The twin temples were originally carved out of the mountainside during the reign of Pharaoh Ramesses II in the 13th century BC, as a lasting monument to himself and his queen Nefertari, to commemorate his alleged victory at the Battle of Kadesh, and to intimidate his Nubian neighbors. However, the complex was relocated in its entirety in the 1960s, on an artificial hill made from a domed structure, high above the Aswan dam reservoir. The relocation of the temples was necessary to avoid their being submerged during the creation of Lake Nasser, the massive artificial water reservoir formed after the building of the Aswan dam on the Nile River. Abu Simbel remains one of Egypt's top tourist attractions.
TEXT.French: Les temples d'Abou Simbel sont deux temples de l'Égypte antique construits par le pharaon Ramsès II (-1304 / -1213, XIXe dynastie) pour son culte ainsi que celui de dieux égyptiens et de son épouse Néfertari à Abou Simbel, en Égypte, au nord du lac Nasser sur le Nil, à environ soixante-dix kilomètres de la deuxième cataracte du Nil.
TEXT.German: Abu Simbel nennt man die zwei gewaltigen Felsentempel am Westufer des Nassersees in Südägypten am südöstlichen Ende des gleichnamigen Ortes. Das Areal wurde wahrscheinlich zwischen 1260 und 1250 v.Chr. zur Regierungszeit von Ramses II. erbaut. Der große Tempel ist dem ruhmreichen Herrscher selbst geweiht. In seinem Inneren sind viele Darstellungen der Kriegszüge Ramses II. zu finden. Der kleine Tempel ist seiner zur Bauzeit verstorbenen Hauptgemahlin Nefertari gewidmet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Abu Simbel ist bekannt für das sogenannte Sonnenwunder. Zweimal im Jahr fallen die Sonnenstrahlen durch den Tempeleingang für etwa 20 min auf drei der vier sitzenden Götterstatuen im inneren Heiligtum, die von Amun-Re, Re-Harachte und des vergöttlichten Ramses. Einzig der mit dem Totenreich assoziierte Ptah bleibt außerhalb des Sonnenlichts.[PARAGRAPH:2]Abu Simbel befindet sich inzwischen nicht mehr an seinem ursprünglichen Standort. Beide Tempel mussten vor dem mit Hilfe des Assuan-Staudamms künstlich angestauten Wasser des Nassersees in Sicherheit gebracht werden. Sie wurden in den Jahren 1963 bis 1968 abgetragen und auf der Hochebene von Abu Simbel 64 m höher wieder aufgebaut. So stehen sie seither auf einer Insel im Nassersee, die durch einen befahrbaren Damm mit dem gleichnamigen Ort verbunden ist. Seit 1979 steht der Tempelkomplex von Abu Simbel auf der Weltkulturerbeliste der UNESCO.
TEXT.Polish: Abu Simbel - stanowisko archeologiczne w południowym Egipcie, w muhafazie Asuan. Położone niegdyś nad Nilem, teraz nad Jeziorem Nasera, w Dolnej Nubii, około 300 km na południe od Asuanu. W starożytności miasto rozwijało się prężnie dzięki znajdującym się w okolicy pokładom sjenitu (czerwonego granitu), miedzi i kamieni szlachetnych. W Abu Simbel znajduje się kompleks świątynny złożony z dwóch świątyń zbudowanych przez faraona Ramzesa II. Świątynie zbudowano w XIII wieku p.n.e., prawdopodobnie w latach 1274-1250 p.n.e., w czasie panowania Ramzesa II. Miały one ukazywać potęgę Egiptu przybyszom z Nubii.

TEXT.English: Reduce maintenance costs of nearby cities.
TEXT.French: Réduit le coût d'entretien des villes voisines.
TEXT.German: Abu Simbel senkt die Verwaltungskosten in allen nahegelegenen Städten drastisch.
TEXT.Spanish: Reduce el coste de mantenimiento de las ciudades cercanas.
TEXT.Polish: Zmniejsza wydatki na utrzymanie miast w pobliżu.

TEXT.English: Academy

An academy is a school for advanced learning. Though China, Egypt, and India had such institutes earlier, the term "academy" was first applied to the Athenian school of philosophy, founded by Plato in approximately 390 BC. The school was built near a sacred grove named "Hekademia." [PARAGRAPH:1]An academy was an important asset for a city. It attracted both brilliant scholars and the children of wealthy or noble parents, who might then decide to settle in the city permanently. The academy could provide a broad, general education to its students, or it might concentrate upon a specific subject such as philosophy, mathematics, art, natural philosophy (the world and everything in it), or the martial arts. [PARAGRAPH:1]Today there are many educational facilities which bear the name "academy." The term is used loosely now, and in addition to its original meaning, is often applied to schools for children and teenagers.
TEXT.French: Une académie est une école d'enseignement supérieur. Si la Chine, l'Egypte et l'Inde connaissaient déjà ce type d'instituts, le terme "académie" est appliqué pour la première fois à l'école de philosophie d'Athènes, fondée par Platon vers 390 av. J.-C. Cette école était construite dans un jardin nommé "Académie". [PARAGRAPH:1]Une académie constitue un atout important pour une ville. Elle attire de brillants érudits et les enfants de nobles ou de riches familles qui peuvent ensuite décider de s'installer définitivement dans la ville. L'académie peut offrir un enseignement général très vaste à ses étudiants ou se concentrer sur une matière spécifique telle que la philosophie, les mathématiques, l'art, la philosophie naturelle (le monde et tout ce qu'il comporte) ou les arts martiaux. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aujourd'hui, de nombreuses structures d'enseignement portent le nom d'"académie". Le terme est désormais utilisé assez librement et son sens originel a été élargi, s'appliquant souvent aux écoles pour enfants et adolescents.
TEXT.German: Eine Akademie ist eine Schule der höheren Wissenschaften. Obwohl es in China, Ägypten und Indien bereits früher vergleichbare Einrichtungen gab, stammt der Begriff "Akademie" von der 390 vor Christus von Platon gegründeten Philosophenschule in Athen. Diese befand sich in der Nähe eines heiligen Hains mit dem Namen "Hekademia".[PARAGRAPH:1] Eine Akademie war eine wichtige Errungenschaft für eine Stadt. Sie lockte brilliante Gelehrte und die Kinder der Reichen und Adligen an, die sich vielleicht dauerhaft in der Stadt niederließen. Die Akademie bot ihren Schülern eine breite Allgemeinbildung oder spezialisierte sich auf ein bestimmtes Fach, wie Philosophie, Mathematik, Kunst, Naturkunde (die Welt und was sich darin befindet) oder Kampfkunst. [PARAGRAPH:1]Heute tragen viele Lehranstalten den Namen "Akademie". Der Begriff wird weitläufig verwendet und bezeichnet oft Schulen für Kinder und Teenager.
TEXT.Italian: Un'accademia è una scuola per l'apprendimento avanzato. Malgrado Cina, Egitto e India avessero fondato questi istituti molto tempo prima, il termine "accademia" fu coniato per la prima volta nella scuola Ateniese di filosofia istituita da Platone verso il 390 a. C. La scuola venne costruita presso un luogo sacro di nome "Hekademia." [PARAGRAPH:1]L'accademia rappresentava un luogo importante per la città poiché attirava studiosi brillanti con le proprie famiglie benestanti e nobili, che potevano decidere di trasferirsi definitivamente. L'accademia forniva un'educazione generale ai propri studenti e si concentrava sull'approfondimento di materie come la filosofia, la matematica, l'arte, la percezione del mondo e della natura o le arti marziali. [PARAGRAPH:1]Al giorno d'oggi esistono molti edifici dedicati all'istruzione che si fregiano del nome "accademia": questo termine viene oramai utilizzato in modo inappropriato e viene spesso citato a proposito degli istituti di istruzione per bambini e ragazzi.
TEXT.Spanish: Una academia es una escuela en la que se imparten conocimientos avanzados. Aunque este tipo de institución apareció primero en China, Egipto y la India, el término "academia" se aplicó por primera vez a la escuela de filosofía de Atenas, fundada por Platón en el año 390 d. C. La escuela se levantaba cerca de una sagrada arboleda llamada "Hekademia." [PARAGRAPH:1]La academia era un importante activo en una ciudad. Atraía a brillantes eruditos y a los hijos de los ricos o los aristócratas, quienes podían tomar la decisión de instalarse en la ciudad de forma permanente. Podía proporcionar una educación amplia y general a sus estudiantes, o podía concentrarse en materias más específicas, como la filosofía, las matemáticas, el arte, la filosofía natural (el mundo y todo cuanto contiene) o las artes materiales. [PARAGRAPH:1]Hoy en día existen muchas instituciones educativas que llevan el nombre de "academia". El término se emplea con libertad en nuestros días, y además de su acepción original, suele aplicarse a las escuelas para niños y adolescentes.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Academies[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's scientific research as well as its cultural output.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Académies[COLOR_REVERT] améliorent la recherche scientifique et la production de culture des villes.
TEXT.German: verbessert deutlich die städtische [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forschung[COLOR_REVERT], trägt auch zur [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kultur[COLOR_REVERT] bei.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]accademia[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la ricerca scientifica e la cultura della città.
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Academias[COLOR_REVERT] aumentan la investigación científica de la ciudad, así como su producción cultural.

TEXT.English: Accelerator
TEXT.French: Accélérateur
TEXT.Italian: Acceleratore di particelle

TEXT.English: A particle accelerator is a device that uses electric fields to propel electrically-charged particles to high speeds and to contain them. An ordinary CRT television set is a simple form of accelerator. There are two basic types: linear accelerators and circular accelerators. [PARAGRAPH:2]In a linear accelerator (linac), particles are accelerated in a straight line with a target of interest at one end. Linacs are very widely used - every cathode ray tube contains one. They are also used to provide an initial low-energy kick to particles before they are injected into circular accelerators. The longest linac in the world is the Stanford Linear Accelerator, SLAC, which is 3 km (1.86 miles) long. SLAC is an electron-positron collider. [PARAGRAPH:2]Linear accelerators are also widely used in medicine, for radiotherapy and radiosurgery. Medical grade LINACs accelerate electrons using a klystron and a complex bending magnet arrangement which produces a beam of 6-30 million electron-volt (MeV) energy. The electrons can be used directly, or they can be collided with a target to produce a beam of X-rays. The reliability, flexibility and accuracy of the radiation beam produced has largely supplanted the older use of Cobalt-60 therapy as a treatment tool.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the circular accelerator, particles move in a circle until they reach sufficient energy. The particle track is typically bent into a circle using electromagnets. The advantage of circular accelerators over linear accelerators (linacs) is that the ring topology allows continuous acceleration, as the particle can transit indefinitely. Another advantage is that a circular accelerator is relatively smaller than a linear accelerator of comparable power (i.e. a linac would have to be extremely long to have the equivalent power of a circular accelerator).[PARAGRAPH:2]The earliest circular accelerators were cyclotrons, invented in 1929 by Ernest O. Lawrence at the University of California, Berkeley. Cyclotrons have a single pair of hollow 'D'-shaped plates to accelerate the particles and a single large dipole magnet to bend their path into a circular orbit. It is a characteristic property of charged particles in a uniform and constant magnetic field B that they orbit with a constant period, at a frequency called the cyclotron frequency, so long as their speed is small compared to the speed of light c. This means that the accelerating D's of a cyclotron can be driven at a constant frequency by a radio frequency (RF) accelerating power source, as the beam spirals outwards continuously. The particles are injected in the centre of the magnet and are extracted at the outer edge at their maximum energy.
TEXT.French: A particle accelerator is a device that uses electric fields to propel electrically-charged particles to high speeds and to contain them. An ordinary CRT television set is a simple form of accelerator. There are two basic types: linear accelerators and circular accelerators. [PARAGRAPH:2]In a linear accelerator (linac), particles are accelerated in a straight line with a target of interest at one end. Linacs are very widely used - every cathode ray tube contains one. They are also used to provide an initial low-energy kick to particles before they are injected into circular accelerators. The longest linac in the world is the Stanford Linear Accelerator, SLAC, which is 3 km (1.86 miles) long. SLAC is an electron-positron collider. [PARAGRAPH:2]Linear accelerators are also widely used in medicine, for radiotherapy and radiosurgery. Medical grade LINACs accelerate electrons using a klystron and a complex bending magnet arrangement which produces a beam of 6-30 million electron-volt (MeV) energy. The electrons can be used directly, or they can be collided with a target to produce a beam of X-rays. The reliability, flexibility and accuracy of the radiation beam produced has largely supplanted the older use of Cobalt-60 therapy as a treatment tool.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the circular accelerator, particles move in a circle until they reach sufficient energy. The particle track is typically bent into a circle using electromagnets. The advantage of circular accelerators over linear accelerators (linacs) is that the ring topology allows continuous acceleration, as the particle can transit indefinitely. Another advantage is that a circular accelerator is relatively smaller than a linear accelerator of comparable power (i.e. a linac would have to be extremely long to have the equivalent power of a circular accelerator).[PARAGRAPH:2]The earliest circular accelerators were cyclotrons, invented in 1929 by Ernest O. Lawrence at the University of California, Berkeley. Cyclotrons have a single pair of hollow 'D'-shaped plates to accelerate the particles and a single large dipole magnet to bend their path into a circular orbit. It is a characteristic property of charged particles in a uniform and constant magnetic field B that they orbit with a constant period, at a frequency called the cyclotron frequency, so long as their speed is small compared to the speed of light c. This means that the accelerating D's of a cyclotron can be driven at a constant frequency by a radio frequency (RF) accelerating power source, as the beam spirals outwards continuously. The particles are injected in the centre of the magnet and are extracted at the outer edge at their maximum energy.
TEXT.Polish: Akcelerator - urządzenie służące do przyspieszania cząstek elementarnych lub jonów do prędkości bliskich prędkości światła. Cząstki obdarzone ładunkiem elektrycznym są przyspieszane w polu elektrycznym. Do skupienia cząstek w wiązkę oraz do nadania im odpowiedniego kierunku używa się odpowiednio ukształtowanego, w niektórych konstrukcjach także zmieniającego się w czasie, pola magnetycznego lub elektrycznego.

TEXT.English: Increases science, commerce and spaceship production.
TEXT.French: Augmente la science, le commerce, et la production de vaisseaux.
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la producción científica, espacial y de comercio.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa postęp naukowy, przychody z handlu i produkcję statku kosmicznego.

TEXT.English: Adam Smith's Trading Company
TEXT.French: Compagnie de Commerce d'Adam Smith
TEXT.Italian: Compagnia commerciale di Adam Smith

TEXT.English: Adam Smith is generally regarded as the father of modern economics. In his book "The Wealth of Nations", he analyzed the economic processes of supply and demand, and discussed how free trade and individual ambition would lead to both economic and social growth. Smith favored a political environment where the government would only become involved in business and trade to preserve justice and order. Smith's ideas of economics and the lack of government involvement form the basis of modern economic liberalism.
TEXT.French: Adam Smith is generally regarded as the father of modern economics. In his book "The Wealth of Nations", he analyzed the economic processes of supply and demand, and discussed how free trade and individual ambition would lead to both economic and social growth. Smith favored a political environment where the government would only become involved in business and trade to preserve justice and order. Smith's ideas of economics and the lack of government involvement form the basis of modern economic liberalism.
TEXT.Polish: Adam Smith - szkocki myśliciel i filozof, autor Badań nad naturą i przyczynami bogactwa narodów (1776), które były jedną z pierwszych prób usystematyzowania wiedzy na temat historii rozwoju przemysłu i handlu w Europie. Dokonania Smitha były podstawą do wyodrębnienia przez Davida Ricarda ekonomii jako osobnej dziedziny nauki. Jego prace są jednymi z najbardziej znanych i cenionych opracowań na temat gospodarki rynkowej, kapitalizmu i liberalizmu. Smith był myślicielem o wszechstronnych zainteresowaniach i należał do najbardziej wykształconych Brytyjczyków XVIII wieku. Przez trzynaście lat wykładał na University of Glasgow przedmiot "filozofia moralna" (ang. moral philosophy).

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations[COLOR_REVERT] increases the commerce output of all specialists, increases all cities trade routes by 1 and allows 2 merchant specialists in city where it's built.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Compagnie de Commerce d'Adam Smith[COLOR_REVERT] augmente le commerce pour tous les spécialistes, ajoute une route commerciale pour toutes les villes, et permet 2 spécialistes marchands supplémentaires dans la ville possédant la merveille.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sociedad mercantil de Adam Smith[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta el rendimiento comercial de todos los especialistas, aumenta las rutas comerciales de todas las ciudades en 1 y permite convertir a 2 ciudadanos en Mercaderes en la ciudad donde se construya.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kompania Handlowa A. Smitha[COLOR_REVERT] zwiększa przychody z każdego specjalisty, zwiększa ilość szlaków handlowych we wszystkich miastach o 1 i dodaje dwóch darmowych Kupców w mieście w jakim została wybudowana.

TEXT.English: Advanced Quality Control
TEXT.Italian: Centro di controllo qualità avanzato

Spanish.Text: Agencia de control de calidad avanzado

TEXT.English: Quality control and quality engineering are used in developing systems to ensure products or services are designed and produced to meet or exceed customer requirements.[PARAGRAPH:2]Quality control is the branch of engineering and manufacturing which deals with assurance and failure testing in design and production of products or services, to meet or exceed customer requirements.
TEXT.French: Quality control and quality engineering are used in developing systems to ensure products or services are designed and produced to meet or exceed customer requirements.[PARAGRAPH:2]Quality control is the branch of engineering and manufacturing which deals with assurance and failure testing in design and production of products or services, to meet or exceed customer requirements.
TEXT.Polish: Uważa się, że po raz pierwszy pojęcie jakość (gr. poiotes) zdefiniował Platon jako "pewien stopień doskonałości". Było to wówczas pojęcie filozoficzne i jako takie pozostało do czasów współczesnych. W licznych sporach ustalono jedynie, że jakość posiada cechy obiektywne, mierzalne, jak masa i kształt oraz subiektywne, oceniane przez każdego inaczej, jak barwa lub zapach. Cyceron tworząc łaciński termin filozoficzny dla określenia greckiego pojęcia, wprowadził słowo qualitas, które przeszło do niektórych języków romańskich i germańskich jako: włoskie - qualita, francuskie - qualite, niemieckie - die Qualitśt, angielskie - quality.

TEXT.English: Advanced Quality Control increases production in city as well as spaceship production.
TEXT.French: L'Agence de Contrôle Qualité Avancé augmente la production de la ville, et la production pour les vaisseaux spatiaux.
TEXT.Spanish: La Agencia de control de calidad avanzado aumenta la producción de la ciudad, así como la producción de naves espaciales.
TEXT.Polish: Centrum Kontroli Jakości zwiększa produkcję w mieście oraz zmniejsza czas konstrukcji podzespołów statku kosmicznego.

TEXT.English: Advanced Shielding

Civil scientists and engineers are ever on the lookout for ways to improve a city's defense against enemy attack. Today's advanced shielding is a combination of several different successful lines of research. Advanced shields are made of far tougher semi-organic material designed to "scab over" and repair breaches in its surface. The electromagnetic shielding has been improved as well, increasing the overall strength of the shielding. While even the advanced shielding is less than perfect and can be overcome by determined attack, cities employing these defenses are far less vulnerable than unprotected cities.
TEXT.French: Les scientifiques et les ingénieurs civils ont toujours cherché des moyens d'améliorer les défenses d'une ville contre les attaques ennemies. Les boucliers de pointe que nous connaissons aujourd'hui sont la combinaison de plusieurs découvertes technologiques. Ils sont en effet fabriqués dans un matériau semi-organique très résistant et conçu pour "cicatriser" si une brèche s'ouvrait. Les boucliers électromagnétiques ont également été modernisés, ce qui accroît encore l'efficacité du dispositif. Le niveau de défense atteint par les boucliers de pointe n'est pas encore parfait, mais les villes qui les utilisent restent beaucoup moins vulnérables que les autres.
TEXT.German: Zivile Wissenschaftler und Ingenieure sind stets auf der Suche nach Möglichkeiten, die Verteidigungsfähigkeit einer Stadt gegen feindliche Angriffe zu verbessern. Die heute verfügbare fortgeschrittene Schildtechnologie ist das Resultat einer Reihe verschiedener Forschungsprojekte. Fortgeschrittene Schilde sind aus sehr widerstandsfähigem semi-organischen Material gefertigt, das es ermöglicht, Risse an der Oberfläche abzuschirmen und instand zu setzen. Und auch die elektromagnetische Schildgeneration wurde verbessert, so dass die Schilde nun eine erhöhte Gesamtstärke aufweisen. Die fortgeschrittenen Schilde sind zwar nach wie vor nicht perfekt, sondern können durch gezielte Angriffe überwunden werden, dennoch bieten sie Städten, in denen sie eingesetzt werden, deutlich mehr Sicherheit als dies in ungeschützten Städten der Fall ist.
TEXT.Italian: Scienziati e ingegneri civili sono sempre alla ricerca per trovare il modo di migliorare le difese cittadine contro gli attacchi nemici. Gli scudi avanzati attuali sono una combinazione di diverse linee di ricerca di successo. Gli scudi avanzati sono realizzati con un materiale semi-organico estremamente resistente e progettato per autoriparare le falle nella superficie. Anche la protezione elettromagnetica è migliorata, aumentando la forza totale degli scudi. Lo scudo avanzato non è certo perfetto e può essere distrutto da un attacco deciso, ma le città che utilizzano queste difese sono molto meno vulnerabili di quelle non protett
TEXT.Spanish: Los ingenieros y científicos civiles siempre están buscando nuevas maneras de mejorar la defensa de una ciudad contra los ataques. Los escudos de hoy en día son una combinación de varias líneas de investigación logradas. Están fabricados de material semiorgánico mucho más duro, diseñado para "costrificarse" y reparar las brechas que aparezcan en su superficie. La protección electromagnética también ha mejorado, aumentando así la fuerza total de los escudos. Aunque los escudos avanzados distan de ser perfectos y pueden ser derribados por un ataque decidido, las ciudades que emplean estas defensas son mucho menos vulnerables que las que están desprotegida
TEXT.Polish: Naukowcy oraz inżynierowie od zawsze lubili poszukiwać dróg do poprawy obronności miast przeciwko atakom przeciwnika. Dzisiejsze zaawansowane Pole Siłowe obronne są kombinacją kilkunastu różnych owoców badań. Są zrobione z dużo twardszego pół-organicznego materiału zaprojektowanego do samoistnego naprawiania swojej powierzchni. Także zbrojenie elektromagnetyczne zostało poprawione zwiększając ogólną wytrzymałość. Chociaż nawet zaawansowane Pole Siłowe jest mniej niż doskonałe i może zostać zniszczone przez silny atak, miasta z tymi strukturami są mniej wrażliwe niż osiedla niezabezpieczone.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Advanced Shielding[COLOR_REVERT] provides increased protection for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologies[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boucliers Atm. Avancés[COLOR_REVERT] offrent une meilleure protection aux [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologies[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortgeschrittene Schild[COLOR_REVERT] bietet besseren Schutz für [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arkologien[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scudi avanzanti[COLOR_REVERT] forniscono una maggiore protezione alle [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologie[COLOR_REVER
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Escudo arcológico avanzado[COLOR_REVERT] proporciona más protección a las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologías[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Aeroponics Lab

Aeroponics is the process of growing plants in an air or mist environment without the use of soil or an aggregate medium (known as geoponics). The word "aeroponic" is derived from the Greek meanings of aero- (air) and ponos (labour). Aeroponic culture differs from both conventional hydroponics, aquaponics, and in-vitro (plant tissue culture) growing. Unlike hydroponics, which uses a liquid nutrient solution as a growing medium and essential minerals to sustain plant growth; or aquaponics which uses water and fish waste, aeroponics is conducted without a growing medium. Because water is used in aeroponics to transmit nutrients, it is sometimes considered a type of hydroponics.
TEXT.French: Aeroponics is the process of growing plants in an air or mist environment without the use of soil or an aggregate medium (known as geoponics). The word "aeroponic" is derived from the Greek meanings of aero- (air) and ponos (labour). Aeroponic culture differs from both conventional hydroponics, aquaponics, and in-vitro (plant tissue culture) growing. Unlike hydroponics, which uses a liquid nutrient solution as a growing medium and essential minerals to sustain plant growth; or aquaponics which uses water and fish waste, aeroponics is conducted without a growing medium. Because water is used in aeroponics to transmit nutrients, it is sometimes considered a type of hydroponics.
TEXT.Polish: Aeroponika - system produkcji roślinnej bez zastosowania środowiska stałego (uprawa ziemna) lub ciekłego (hydroponika). Rośliny umieszczone są w płytach z tworzyw sztucznych, tak że ich korzenie znajdują się w powietrzu. Woda i sole mineralne są rozpylane bezpośrednio na korzenie roślin w postaci aerozolu. Optymalnie wytworzone sztuczne siedlisko pozwala na uzyskiwanie szybkiego wzrostu i rozwoju roślin. W szkółkarstwie aeroponika umożliwia łatwe przesadzanie roślin bez uszkadzania systemu korzeniowego. Wadą aeroponiki są wysokie koszty i skomplikowana elektroniczna aparatura. Dlatego stosowana jest tylko w produkcji roślin unikatowych.

TEXT.English: Build an Aeroponics Lab to increase your cities food.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire d'aéroponique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la nourriture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Laboratorium Aeroponiki by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Aerospace Complex
TEXT.French: Complexe Aérospatial
TEXT.Italian: Complesso aerospaziale

TEXT.English: Aerospace is the human effort in science, engineering and business to fly in the atmosphere of Earth (aeronautics) and surrounding space (astronautics). Aerospace organisations research, design, manufacture, operate, or maintain aircraft and/or spacecraft. Aerospace activity is very diverse, with a multitude of commercial, industrial and military applications.
TEXT.French: Aerospace is the human effort in science, engineering and business to fly in the atmosphere of Earth (aeronautics) and surrounding space (astronautics). Aerospace organisations research, design, manufacture, operate, or maintain aircraft and/or spacecraft. Aerospace activity is very diverse, with a multitude of commercial, industrial and military applications.
TEXT.Polish: Kosmodrom, port kosmiczny, centrum lotów kosmicznych (kosmo- + gr. dromos tor biegowy) - ośrodek przeznaczony do przeprowadzania startów statków kosmicznych oraz startów i lądowań promów kosmicznych. Zadania kosmodromu obejmują także montaż, przygotowanie do lotu oraz nadzór nad jego przebiegiem, choć centrum sterowania lotem może znajdować się w innym miejscu.

TEXT.English: Aesop's Fables
TEXT.French: Les Fables d'Esope

TEXT.English: Safety (Aesop's Fables)
TEXT.French: Sécurité (Fables d'Aesop)

TEXT.English: Aesop's Fables or the Aesopica is a collection of fables creditedto Aesop, a slave and story-teller believed to have lived in ancient Greece between 620 and 560 BCE. Of diverse origins, the stories associated with Aesop's name have descended to modern times through a number of sources. They continue to be reinterpreted in different verbal registers and in popular as well as artistic mediums.
TEXT.French: Aesop's Fables or the Aesopica is a collection of fables creditedto Aesop, a slave and story-teller believed to have lived in ancient Greece between 620 and 560 BCE. Of diverse origins, the stories associated with Aesop's name have descended to modern times through a number of sources. They continue to be reinterpreted in different verbal registers and in popular as well as artistic mediums.
TEXT.Polish: Bajki Ezopa lub Aesopica - zbiór dzieł Ezopa, bajkopisarza greckiego, niewolnika żyjącego w VI wieku p.n.e. Jego bajki są do dziś popularne. Bohaterami są zwykle zwierzęta posiadające cechy ludzkie. Bajki Ezopa napisane są głównie w formie opowieści moralizującej bądź satyrycznej. Znaczna ich część jest znana na całym świecie i została przetłumaczona na wiele języków.

TEXT.English: Agora
TEXT.Italian: Agorà

TEXT.English: [LINK=BUILDING_AGORA]Agora[\LINK]
TEXT.French: [LINK=BUILDING_AGORA]Agora[\LINK]
TEXT.Italian: [LINK=BUILDING_AGORA]Agorà[\LINK]
TEXT.Spanish: [LINK=BUILDING_AGORA]Ágora[\LINK]

TEXT.English: The Agora was an open "place of assembly" in ancient Greek city-states. Early in Greek history (900s - 700s BCE), free-born male land-owners who were citizens would gather in the agora for military duty or to hear statements of the ruling king or council. Later in Greek history, the agora served as a marketplace where merchants kept stalls or shops to sell their goods under colonnades.
TEXT.French: The Agora was an open "place of assembly" in ancient Greek city-states. Early in Greek history (900s - 700s BCE), free-born male land-owners who were citizens would gather in the agora for military duty or to hear statements of the ruling king or council. Later in Greek history, the agora served as a marketplace where merchants kept stalls or shops to sell their goods under colonnades.
TEXT.Polish: Agora (dosł. miejsce zgromadzeń) - główny plac, rynek w miastach starożytnej Grecji. Centrum wokół którego toczyło się życie polityczne i religijne.

TEXT.English: This building requires Republic civic.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agricultural Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives a +4% food bonus in all cities, as well as a happiness bonus in all cities.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accomplissement Agricole[COLOR_REVERT] requiert [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi qu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héros National [COLOR_REVERT] pour pouvoir être construit. Il procure un bonus de +4% en nourriture dans toutes les villes, et également un bonus de bonheur.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro agrícola[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da una bonificación de alimentos (+4%) y de felicidad en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Rolnicze[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Zwiększa ilość żywności o +4% oraz zwiększa szczęście o 1 we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: AI Surveillance

Once electronics became cheap, the world saw the rise of surveillance societies with cameras popping up in both public and private establishments; once AI became cheap, it was applied to those cameras. This meant the end of privacy outside one's head, since these cameras could identify dissidents, radicals, and other people who cause problems with the government, which allowed regimes to quash these figures before they could damage the government. This end of privacy also resulted in a tenfold reduction in crime, because AI surveillance was applied to the darkest back alleys and the seediest businesses.
TEXT.French: Once electronics became cheap, the world saw the rise of surveillance societies with cameras popping up in both public and private establishments; once AI became cheap, it was applied to those cameras. This meant the end of privacy outside one's head, since these cameras could identify dissidents, radicals, and other people who cause problems with the government, which allowed regimes to quash these figures before they could damage the government. This end of privacy also resulted in a tenfold reduction in crime, because AI surveillance was applied to the darkest back alleys and the seediest businesses.
TEXT.Polish: Komputer jest sztuczną inteligencją, której pierwotnym zadaniem było zarządzanie kompleksem tak, by mieszkańcy byli szczęśliwi. Maszyna wybrała proste rozwiązanie postawionego jej zadania: szczęście stało się obowiązkowe, bycie nieszczęśliwym równało się sabotażowi. Komputer był maszyną wojskową, więc na podstawie posiadanych wiadomości wydedukował sobie, że jest stan wojny, Alpha Complex jest enklawą otoczoną przez komunistycznych mutantów, a on ma obowiązek monitorować bezpieczeństwo habitatu. Do tego celu - oprócz rozbudowanego systemu kamer, podsłuchów, oraz robotów - powołał Rozprawiaczy, w których wcielają się gracze.

TEXT.English: Reduces Happiness, but also Maintenance and War Weariness. Increases Production. This building requires Technocracy civic.
TEXT.French: Réduit le bonheur, mais aussi l'entretien et le mécontentement lié à la guerre. Augmente la production. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Technocracie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Reduce la felicidad, pero también el mantenimiento y el hastío bélico. También aumenta la producción. Este edificio requiere el principio Tecnocracia.
TEXT.Polish: Redukuje szczęście, ale też utrzymanie i znużenie wojenne. Zwiększ też produkcję. Wymaga doktryny Technokracja.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Amount Aid in Overcoming %s2_Type Afflictions within the City

TEXT.English: Air Shipping Warehouse

Cargo is transported by air in specialized cargo aircraft and in the luggage compartments of passenger aircraft. Air freight is typically the fastest mode for long distance freight transport, but also the most expensive.
TEXT.French: Les marchandises sont transportés par les airs dans des avions spécialisés, ou dans les soutes des avions de ligne. C'est le mode de transport le plus rapide sur de longues distances, mais également le plus coûteux.
TEXT.Polish: Terminal cargo - wydzielona część portu lotniczego lub morskiego świadcząca usługi załadunku, wyładunku i magazynowania towarów przesyłanych drogą lotniczą lub morską.

TEXT.English: Build an Air Shipping Warehouse to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Entrepôt de fret aérien[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter les échanges de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Air Shipping Warehouse by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Airport

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airports[COLOR_REVERT] add an additional trade route, provide an experience bonus to all Air Units and increase the number of Air Units you may house in a city. A city with an [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airport[COLOR_REVERT] can also airlift one unit per turn to any of your other cities and house four extra Air Units for a total of eight. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airports[COLOR_REVERT] also add unhealthiness in cities.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aéroports[COLOR_REVERT] ajoutent une route commerciale, fournissent un bonus d'expérience à toutes les unités aériennes et augmentent le nombre d'unités aériennes par ville. Une ville disposant d'un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aéroport[COLOR_REVERT] peut transporter par avion une unité par tour vers une autre ville et accueillir quatre unités aériennes supplémentaires. Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aéroports[COLOR_REVERT] détériorent la santé dans les villes où ils sont construits.
TEXT.German: ergibt eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]zusätzliche Handelsverbindung[COLOR_REVERT], verschafft neu ausgebildeten Lufteinheiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]zusätzliche Erfahrungspunkte[COLOR_REVERT], vergrößert die mögliche [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zahl von Lufteinheiten in der Stadt[COLOR_REVERT], erlaubt die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Luftbeförderung einer Einheit[COLOR_REVERT] pro Runde zu einer anderen Stadt, beeinträchtigt jedoch die städtische Gesundheit.
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aeroporti[COLOR_REVERT] aggiungono una rotta commerciale extra, danno un bonus di esperienza a tutte le unità aeree e aumentano il numero di unità aeree ospitabili in città. Una città dotata di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aeroporto[COLOR_REVERT] può anche aviotrasportare un'unità per turno verso un'altra città alleata e ospitare fino a quattro unità aeree extra per un totale di otto. Gli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aeroporti[COLOR_REVERT] generano infelicità nella città.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuertos[COLOR_REVERT] añaden una ruta comercial más, proporcionan una bonificación a la experiencia a todas las unidades aéreas y aumentan el número de unidades aéreas que es posible albergar en una ciudad. Una ciudad con un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuerto[COLOR_REVERT] también puede aerotransportar una unidad por turno a cualquiera de tus demás ciudades y albergar cuatro unidades aéreas más, lo que da un total de ocho. Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuertos[COLOR_REVERT] también aumentan la insalubridad de las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Port Lotniczy[COLOR_REVERT] dodaję 1 szlak handlowy oraz dostarcza punkty XP dla każdej zbudowanej jednostce lotniczej w tym mieście. Miasto z [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Portem Lotniczym[COLOR_REVERT] może transportować drogą powietrzną jednostki do innych miast i fortów.

TEXT.English: Alhambra
TEXT.French: L'Alhambra

TEXT.English: The Alhambra is a palace and fortress complex of the Moorish monarchs of Granada, in southern Spain (known as Al-Andalus when the fortress was constructed), occupying a hilly terrace on the south-eastern border of the city of Granada. It was the residence of the Muslim kings of Granada and their court, but is currently a museum exhibiting exquisite Islamic architecture. A Renaissance palace was also inserted by Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor.[PARAGRAPH:1]The name Alhambra, signifying in Arabic the red, derives from the colour of the red clay of the surroundings of which the fort is made. The buildings of the Alhambra were originally whitewashed; however, the buildings now seen today are reddish. The first reference to the Qal'at al Hamra was during the battles between the Arabs and the Muladies during the rule of the Abdallah (who reigned from 888-912). In one particularly fierce and bloody skirmish, the Muladies soundly defeated the Arabs who were then forced to take shelter in a primitive red castle located in the province of Elvira, nowadays located in Granada. According to surviving documents from the era, the red castle was quite small and its walls were not capable of deterring army intent on conquering. The castle was then largely ignored until the eleventh century when its ruins were renovated and rebuilt by Samuel ibn Naghralla, vizier to the King Badis of the Zirid Dynasty, in an attempt to preserve the small Jewish settlement also located on the Sabikah hill. However, evidence from Arab texts indicates that the fortress was easily penetrated and that the actual Alhambra that survives today was built during the Nasrid Dynasty. -Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The Alhambra is a palace and fortress complex of the Moorish monarchs of Granada, in southern Spain (known as Al-Andalus when the fortress was constructed), occupying a hilly terrace on the south-eastern border of the city of Granada. It was the residence of the Muslim kings of Granada and their court, but is currently a museum exhibiting exquisite Islamic architecture. A Renaissance palace was also inserted by Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor.[PARAGRAPH:1]The name Alhambra, signifying in Arabic the red, derives from the colour of the red clay of the surroundings of which the fort is made. The buildings of the Alhambra were originally whitewashed; however, the buildings now seen today are reddish. The first reference to the Qal'at al Hamra was during the battles between the Arabs and the Muladies during the rule of the Abdallah (who reigned from 888-912). In one particularly fierce and bloody skirmish, the Muladies soundly defeated the Arabs who were then forced to take shelter in a primitive red castle located in the province of Elvira, nowadays located in Granada. According to surviving documents from the era, the red castle was quite small and its walls were not capable of deterring army intent on conquering. The castle was then largely ignored until the eleventh century when its ruins were renovated and rebuilt by Samuel ibn Naghralla, vizier to the King Badis of the Zirid Dynasty, in an attempt to preserve the small Jewish settlement also located on the Sabikah hill. However, evidence from Arab texts indicates that the fortress was easily penetrated and that the actual Alhambra that survives today was built during the Nasrid Dynasty. -Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: Alhambra (arab. "czerwona wieża") - dawna twierdza mauretańskich kalifów, zbudowana w XIII-XV w Grenadzie w andaluzyjskim regionie Hiszpanii. Zabytek arabskiego budownictwa w Europie. Składa się z pałacu z kilkoma dziedzińcami i dekorowanymi salami, Alkazaby, Generalife - letniej rezydencji z ogrodami oraz z samych ogrodów znajdujących się na całym wzgórzu. Wewnątrz jest Patio de los Leones (podwórze lwów) z wodotryskiem opartym na 12 lwach; do dziedzińca tego przylegają 4 sale: jedna z nich: Sala de las Dos Hermanas (sala dwóch sióstr), zwana tak z powodu dwóch jednakowych płyt marmurowych w podłodze. Dziedzińce okolone cienistymi kolumnadami; wiele chłodnych zakątków, ogródki z płynącą wodą, na zewnątrz zaś balkony, z których roztaczają się widoki. Alhambra była ostatnim punktem oparcia Arabów w Hiszpanii. Do roku 1492, w którym została zdobyta, była siedzibą emirów Grenady. Przez długi czas służyła za więzienie, później (w XIX w.) została odbudowana z zachowaniem pierwotnego stylu. Twierdza Alhambra została w 1984 roku wpisana na listę światowego dziedzictwa kultury UNESCO. Budowanie twierdzy oparto na prostej zależności matematycznej. Podstawą wszystkich elementów (budynków, elewacji) był kwadrat i kolejno tworzone prostokąty poprzez wykorzystanie długości przekątnej kwadratu jako boku kolejnej figury. W takim założeniu podstawa kwadrata a była podstawą kolejnych prostokątów, zaś boki wynosiły kolejne wartości przekątnych począwszy od a, pierwiastek z 2, pierwiastek z 3 itd.

TEXT.English: Alhambra requires Islam and it grants +1 gold per city with Islam. It acts as government center and reduces maintenance in nearby cities. Increases defense in all cities.
TEXT.French: L'Alhambra requiert la Religion Islam, et garantit +1 d'or par ville avec cette religion. Il agit comme un centre administratif, réduisant l'entretien lié à la distance. Augmente la défense de toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: La Alhambra requiere el Islamismo, y proporciona +1 de oro por cada ciudad con el Islamismo. Hace de centro de gobierno del imperio y reduce el mantenimiento en las ciudades cercanas. Aumenta la bonificación defensiva en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Alhambra wymaga Islamu do wybudowania oraz dostarcza 1 złota za każde miasto w którym wyznaje się Islam. Jako centrum lokalnej administracji, Alhambra zmniejsza koszty utrzymania w okolicznych miastach. We wszystkich miastach zwiększa się także obrona.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET] Opens trade routes to all other players
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET] Ouvre les routes commerciales à tous les autres joueurs
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET] Öffnet Handelsrouten mit allen anderen Spielern
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET] Apre le rotte commerciali con tutti i giocatori
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET] Abre rutas comerciales con todos los demás jugadores
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET] Otwiera szlaki handlowe u wszystkich innych graczy

TEXT.English: Alpha Female
Recommended as your first or second building.
TEXT.French: Il est recommandé de commencer par un de ces bâtiments.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Alphafrauen[COLOR_REVERT] sorgen für Stabilität in frühen Siedlungen. Mit ihrem Wissen können sie Krankheiten eindämmen und die Nahrungserträge steigern.
TEXT.Polish: Zalecany jako jeden z pierwszych budynków w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: In social animals, the alpha is the individual in the community with the highest rank. Male or female individuals or both can be alphas, depending on their species. Where one male and one female fulfill this role, they are referred to as the alpha pair. Other animals in the same social group may exhibit deference or other symbolic signs of respect particular to their species towards the alpha or alphas. In hierarchal social animals, alphas usually gain preferential access to [ICON_FOOD] and other desirable items or activities, though the extent of this social effect varies widely by species. Male and/or female alphas may gain preferential access to sex or mates, and in some species only alphas or an alpha pair is permitted to reproduce.
TEXT.French: In social animals, the alpha is the individual in the community with the highest rank. Male or female individuals or both can be alphas, depending on their species. Where one male and one female fulfill this role, they are referred to as the alpha pair. Other animals in the same social group may exhibit deference or other symbolic signs of respect particular to their species towards the alpha or alphas. In hierarchal social animals, alphas usually gain preferential access to [ICON_FOOD] and other desirable items or activities, though the extent of this social effect varies widely by species. Male and/or female alphas may gain preferential access to sex or mates, and in some species only alphas or an alpha pair is permitted to reproduce.
TEXT.German: Unter einem Alpha(tier) versteht man das Leittier einer Herde oder eines Rudels. Die Bezeichnung rührt vom ersten Buchstaben im griechischen Alphabet her und wurde gewählt, weil es sich in der Regel um die kräftigsten oder erfahrensten Exemplare der Gruppe handelt. Es gibt häufig eigene Hierarchien für männliche und weibliche Individuen und deshalb parallel Alphamännchen und Alphaweibchen, die zusammen das Alphapaar bilden. Alphas haben aufgrund ihrer Dominanz viele Vorteile, so dürfen sie sich häufig als erstes satt essen und haben freie Auswahl bei ihren Sexualpartnern. Bei manchen Spezies ist es nur den Alphatieren erlaubt, sich fortzupflanzen.
TEXT.Polish: Osobnik alfa, alfa - dominujący osobnik u zwierząt stadnych, posiadający najwyższą pozycję społeczną w stadzie, pełniący rolę jego przywódcy. Osobniki płci męskiej określane są jako samce alfa, a płci żeńskiej jako samice alfa. Jeśli rolę przewodników stada pełni samiec wraz z samicą to nazywani są oni parą alfa.

TEXT.English: Alpha Male
Recommended as your first or second building.
TEXT.French: Il est recommandé de commencer par un de ces bâtiments.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Alphamänner[COLOR_REVERT] sorgen für Stabilität in frühen Siedlungen. Sie halten die Kriminalität im Zaum und steigern gleichzeitig die Produktion.
TEXT.Polish: Zalecany jako jeden z pierwszych budynków w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: PC Cave of Altamira
TEXT.French: La Caverne d'Altamira

TEXT.English: Altamira (Spanish for 'high views') is a cave in Spain famous for its Upper Paleolithic cave paintings featuring drawings and polychrome rock paintings of wild mammals and human hands. Its special relevance comes from the fact that it was the first cave in which prehistoric cave paintings had been discovered. When the discovery was first made public in 1880, it led to a bitter public controversy betweenexperts which continued into the early 20th century, as many of them did not believe prehistoric man had the intellectual capacity to produce any kind of artistic expression. The acknowledgement of the authenticity of thepaintings, which finally came in 1902, changed forever the perception of prehistoric human beings. It is located near the town of Santillana del Mar in Cantabria, Spain, 30 km west of the city of Santander. The cave with its paintings has been declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO.
TEXT.French: Altamira (Spanish for 'high views') is a cave in Spain famous for its Upper Paleolithic cave paintings featuring drawings and polychrome rock paintings of wild mammals and human hands. Its special relevance comes from the fact that it was the first cave in which prehistoric cave paintings had been discovered. When the discovery was first made public in 1880, it led to a bitter public controversy betweenexperts which continued into the early 20th century, as many of them did not believe prehistoric man had the intellectual capacity to produce any kind of artistic expression. The acknowledgement of the authenticity of thepaintings, which finally came in 1902, changed forever the perception of prehistoric human beings. It is located near the town of Santillana del Mar in Cantabria, Spain, 30 km west of the city of Santander. The cave with its paintings has been declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO.
TEXT.Polish: Altamira - jaskinia krasowa w górach Kantabryjskich w północnej Hiszpanii, w pobliżu miejscowości Santillana del Mar. Odkryta w 1879 r. Jej wnętrze pokryte jest wielobarwnymi rysunkami należącymi do kultury magdaleńskiej.

TEXT.English: PREHISTORIC CAVES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.

TEXT.English: Aluminum Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Recykling, recyklizacja (ang. recycling) - jedna z metod ochrony środowiska naturalnego. Jej celem jest ograniczenie zużycia surowców naturalnych oraz zmniejszenie ilości odpadów. Materiały, które nadają się do ponownego wykorzystania, bywają opatrzone kodem recyklingu.

TEXT.English: Build an Aluminum Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Aluminum Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Malls[COLOR_REVERT], the American replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Supermarkets[COLOR_REVERT], increase the health of cities, especially if they have access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Deer[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cows[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT]. They also increase happiness from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Musicals[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Singles[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Movies[COLOR_REVERT].

Il augmente aussi le bonheur fourni par les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]comédies musicales populaires[COLOR_REVERT], les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]chansons populaires[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]films populaires[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: eignet sich als [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Spezialeinrichtung der Amerikaner[COLOR_REVERT] besser als einfache Supermärkte zur Steigerung der städtischen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gesundheit[COLOR_REVERT] bei Verfügbarkeit von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rotwild[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rindern[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schweinen[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schafen[COLOR_REVERT], da [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]zusätzliche kommerzielle Erträge[COLOR_REVERT] erwirtschaftet werden und sich auch die städtische [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zufriedenheit[COLOR_REVERT] verbessert bei Verfügbarkeit von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erfolgsmusicals[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hitsingles[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Blockbustern[COLOR_REVERT].

Esso inoltre incrementa la felicità derivante da [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]musical di successo[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]canzoni di successo[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]film di successo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centros comerciales[COLOR_REVERT], el equivalente estadounidense de los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Supermercados[COLOR_REVERT], aumentan la salud de las ciudades, especialmente si tienen acceso a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ciervos[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vacas[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cerdos[COLOR_REVERT] u [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ovejas[COLOR_REVERT]. También aumentan la felicidad que otorgan los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Musicales de éxito[COLOR_REVERT], las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Canciones de éxito[COLOR_REVERT], y las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Películas de éxito[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Centrum handlowe lub galeria handlowa - obiekt, w którym znajduje się wiele sklepów i punktów usługowych. Domy towarowe zaś często były zasadniczo budynkami jednej firmy, grupy, która zazwyczaj sama sprzedawała swoje produkty i de facto taki dom (jak np. istniejący Harrods w Londynie) wręcz nawet sprzedawał (sprzedaje) produkty pod własną marką. Jednakże te dość luksusowe sklepy (zazwyczaj największe i najwyższe, gdyż wówczas zakryte ulice były znacząco niższymi budynkami), zaczęły tracić rynek w XX wieku i wpuszczać inne marki (sklepów) pod własny dach.

TEXT.English: Amusement Park
TEXT.French: Parc d'Attraction
TEXT.Italian: Parco dei divertimenti

TEXT.English: Amusement park or theme park is the generic term for a collection of rides and other entertainment attractions assembled for the purpose of entertaining a large group of people. An amusement park is more elaborate than a simple city park or playground, usually providing attractions meant to cater to children, teenagers, and adults. A theme park is a type of amusement park which has been built around one or more themes, such as an American West theme, or Atlantis. Today, the terms amusement park and theme park are often used interchangeably.[PARAGRAPH:2]Amusement parks evolved in Europe from fairs and pleasure gardens which were created for people's recreation. The oldest amusement park of the world (opened 1583) is Bakken, at Klampenborg, north of Copenhagen, Denmark. In the United States, world's fairs and expositions were another influence on development of the amusement park industry.[PARAGRAPH:2]Most amusement parks have a fixed location, as compared to traveling funfairs and carnivals. These temporary types of amusement parks, are usually present for a few days or weeks per year, such as funfairs in the United Kingdom, and carnivals (temporarily set up in a vacant lot or parking lots) and fairs (temporarily operated in a fair ground) in the United States. The temporary nature of these fairs helps to convey the feeling that people are in a different place or time.[PARAGRAPH:2]Often a theme park will have various 'lands' (sections) of the park devoted to telling a particular story. Non-theme amusement park rides will usually have little in terms of theming or additional design elements while in a theme park all the rides go all with the theme of the park, for example Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World.
TEXT.French: Amusement park or theme park is the generic term for a collection of rides and other entertainment attractions assembled for the purpose of entertaining a large group of people. An amusement park is more elaborate than a simple city park or playground, usually providing attractions meant to cater to children, teenagers, and adults. A theme park is a type of amusement park which has been built around one or more themes, such as an American West theme, or Atlantis. Today, the terms amusement park and theme park are often used interchangeably.[PARAGRAPH:2]Amusement parks evolved in Europe from fairs and pleasure gardens which were created for people's recreation. The oldest amusement park of the world (opened 1583) is Bakken, at Klampenborg, north of Copenhagen, Denmark. In the United States, world's fairs and expositions were another influence on development of the amusement park industry.[PARAGRAPH:2]Most amusement parks have a fixed location, as compared to traveling funfairs and carnivals. These temporary types of amusement parks, are usually present for a few days or weeks per year, such as funfairs in the United Kingdom, and carnivals (temporarily set up in a vacant lot or parking lots) and fairs (temporarily operated in a fair ground) in the United States. The temporary nature of these fairs helps to convey the feeling that people are in a different place or time.[PARAGRAPH:2]Often a theme park will have various 'lands' (sections) of the park devoted to telling a particular story. Non-theme amusement park rides will usually have little in terms of theming or additional design elements while in a theme park all the rides go all with the theme of the park, for example Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World.
TEXT.Polish: Park Rozrywki to teren, na którym zgromadzone są urządzenia rekreacyjne, takie jak karuzele, kolejki górskie, diabelski młyn, beczka śmiechu, zjeżdżalnie, huśtawki, strzelnice, trampolina, symulatory ruchu, pałac strachów i inne inne obiekty służące rozrywce. Program wesołego miasteczka jest często uzupełniony o punkty gastronomiczne, sklepy z zabawkami, upominkami itp. Wesołe miasteczka podzielić można na trzy główne kategorie: przyjezdne (kilka karuzel i punktów z grami zręcznościowymi), parki rozrywki (stawiające na ilość i intensywność atrakcji) oraz parki tematyczne (stawiające na ilość i bogactwo dekoracji w kilku różnych tematach skupionych w różnych miejscach parku).

TEXT.English: Android Brothel

An Android is a robot or synthetic organism designed to look and act like a human, especially one with a body having a flesh-like resemblance. Until recently, androids have largely remained within the domain of science fiction, frequently seen in film and television. However, advancements in robot technology have allowed the design of functional and realistic humanoid robots.

Until recently, androids have largely remained within the domain of science fiction, frequently seen in film and television.
