TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Parrot[COLOR_REVERT] in a city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Assassin Bug Sanctuary[COLOR_REVERT]. It also requires its Gatherer Building from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sericulture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Perroquets[COLOR_REVERT] dans l'entourage de la ville pour construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refuge pour insectes réduviidés[COLOR_REVERT]. Il faut également la bâtiment du récolteur, de [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sériculture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Polish: Musisz posiadać [COLOR_GREEN]Papugi[COLOR_REVERT] w zasięgu swojego miasta by zbudować [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sakntuarium Pluskwiaków[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ekal Masharti
TEXT.French: Ekal Masharti

TEXT.English: The armies of Assyria had permanent bases called ekal masharti, which literally means "palace of the place for marshalling forces", in effect, "barracks". These were buildings with large courtyards for army purposes. They stored weapons, food and stationed men in these barracks.[PARAGRAPH:1]
TEXT.French: The armies of Assyria had permanent bases called ekal masharti, which literally means "palace of the place for marshalling forces", in effect, "barracks". These were buildings with large courtyards for army purposes. They stored weapons, food and stationed men in these barracks.[PARAGRAPH:1]
TEXT.German: Die Armeen von Assyrien hatten permanente Basen, genannt Ekal Masharti, wörtlich "Palast des Ortes der versammelten Streitkräfte", also "Kasernen". Es waren Gebäude mit größen Höfen für Zwecke der Armee. In diesen Kasernen wurden Waffen, Nahrung und stationierte Truppen untergebracht.[PARAGRAPH:1]
TEXT.Polish: W 664 r. p.n.e. elamicki król Urtaku (674-664) zaatakował Babilonię, lecz jego atak został szybko odparty. Po jego rychłej śmierci nastąpił kryzys w państwie, ponieważ władzę w Suzie objął Tempti-Khumma-In-Szuszinak (664-53, znany też jako Teumman), który nie był legalnym spadkobiercą. Część arystokracji elamickiej nie uznała tej sukcesji, widząc w Teumanie uzurpatora, dlatego zwrócili się do Aszurbanipala z prośbą o mediację. Dla asyryjskiego króla był to dogodny moment na wmieszanie się w wewnętrzne rozgrywki we wrogim państwie. Poparł najstarszego syna Urtaku, Humbannikasza II. Do rozstrzygnięcia doszło w bitwie nad rzeką Ulai. Wojska asyryjskie rozgromiły Teummana, który po doznanej klęsce popełnił samobójstwo. Jego odciętą głowę niesiono na czele wojsk asyryjskich w czasie pochodu przez Elam, a następnie zawieszono na jednej z bram Niniwy. Do dnia dzisiejszego zachował się też relief, na którym widzimy odpoczywającego w ogrodzie Aszurbanipala przyglądającego się wiszącej na drzewie głowie króla elamickiego. Na tron Elamu Asyryjczycy wprowadzili Humbannikasza II jako króla Madaktu. W 639 r. p.n.e. nastąpił ostatni atak asyryjski na Elam, który został gruntownie złupiony. Aszurbanipal opisał w inskrypcji to wydarzenie tak: Suza, wielkie święte miasto, dom ich boga, siedzenia ich tajemnic, zdobyłem. Wszedłem do jej pałaców, otworzyłem jej skarbce, gdzie srebro i złoto, dobra i bogactwo zostały nagromadzone... Zniszczyłem (...) Zredukowałem świątynie Elamu do niczego; ich bogowie i boginie rozproszył wiatr. Grobowce ich starożytnych i ostatnich królów, które zdewastowałem, wystawiłem do słońca i zabrałem ich kości do ziemi Aszura. Zdewastowałem prowincje Elamu i na ich ziemiach posiałem sól.[PARAGRAPH:1]

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ekal Masharti[COLOR_REVERT] (the Assyrian replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT]) Allows military units to be built slightly faster than regular barracks and grants experience points to troops built in Assyrian cities.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ekal Masharti[COLOR_REVERT] (la version Assyrienne de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caserne[COLOR_REVERT]) permet de construire les unités militaires beaucoup plus rapidement et leur attribue des points d'expérience dès le départ.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ekal Masharti[COLOR_REVERT] (der assyrische Ersatz für [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT]) Beschleunigt den Bau militärischer Einheiten etwas mehr als bei regulären Kasernen und gibt Truppen, die in assyrischen Städten gebaut wurden Erfahrungspunkte.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ekal Masharti[COLOR_REVERT] (el sustituto asirio de los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracones[COLOR_REVERT]) permite que las unidades militares sean entrenadas mucho más rápido que con los barracones normales, además de otorgar puntos de experiencia a las tropas entrenadas en ciudades asirias.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ekal Masharti[COLOR_REVERT] (zastępuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Koszary[COLOR_REVERT]) Pozwala wytrenować jednostki wojskowe szybciej niż w standardowych koszarach i dodaje punkty doświadczenia wojskom zbudowanym w Asyryjskich miastach.

TEXT.English: Athletic Fields
TEXT.Italian: Pista d'atletica

TEXT.English: Many cultures developed their own forms of sport as part of history. One of the most famous forms of sport was instituted in ancient Greece, where simple sprints eventually evolved into the Olympic Games.
TEXT.French: De nombreuses cultures ont développé leurs propres formes de sport au cours de leur histoire. Une des formes les plus célèbres du sport a été institué dans la Grèce antique, où les courses et petites épreuves ont finalement évolué vers les Jeux Olympiques.
TEXT.Italian: Molte culture hanno sviluppato le proprie forme di sport durant la loro storia. Uno degli sport più famosi nacque nell'antica Grecia, dove alcune semplici gare di corsa divennero poi i Giochi Olimpici.
TEXT.Polish: Bieżnia - specjalnie wydzielona część stadionu sportowego, w postaci pasa okalającego boisko. Służy do rozgrywania konkurencji biegowych podczas zawodów lekkoatletycznych. Część bieżni może być też wydzielona dlasportowców innych konkurencji niż biegowe, np. skoku w dal czy rzutu oszczepem.

Redesign parts of the genome to connect to electrical biotech cells. Implanted Software regulates cell activity and biochemical levels on the micrometer level. Before the time of Nanobiotics.

TEXT.English: Augur
TEXT.Italian: Augure

TEXT.English: An augur was a priest in ancient Rome who conducted divination rituals. The primary form of augury was watching the flights of birds. No major activity was performed without consulting an augur to ensure that the auspices were favorable. Other civilizations had their own forms of divination. The ancient Greeks had oracles and sibyls, the Germanic tribes had runes, and the Chinese had the I Ching.
TEXT.French: An augur was a priest in ancient Rome who conducted divination rituals. The primary form of augury was watching the flights of birds. No major activity was performed without consulting an augur to ensure that the auspices were favorable. Other civilizations had their own forms of divination. The ancient Greeks had oracles and sibyls, the Germanic tribes had runes, and the Chinese had the I Ching.
TEXT.Italian: Un augure era, nell'antica Roma, un sacerdote che compieva riti divinatori. La forma originale di divinazione era l'osservazione dei voli degli uccelli. Nessuna grande attività veniva intrapresa senza consultare un augure, per assicurarsi che gli auspici fossero favorevoli. Anche altre civiltà aveveano le loro forme di divinazione. Gli antichi greci avevano gli oracoli, le tribù germaniche avevano le rune, i cinesi avevano i Ching.
TEXT.Polish: Augur (łac.) - rzymski kapłan, który odczytywał wolę bogów z nieba nad miastem na podstawie zjawisk atmosferycznych i lotu ptaków. W okresie późnej republiki, gdy loty ptaków nad gęsto zaludnionym Rzymem były już rzadkie, do odczytania woli bogów używano specjalnie hodowane kury. Augurzy uczestniczyli także w wyprawach wojennych, na których również sprawowali auspicja. Żadne ważne wydarzenie społeczne, polityczne czy militarne w starożytnym Rzymie epoki przedchrześcijańskiej nie mogło odbyć się bez "inauguracji" (wprowadzenia przez augura).

TEXT.English: Build an Augur to create an early Priest specialist and cut the anger from war and whipping.
TEXT.French: Construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Augure[COLOR_REVERT] pour bénéficier de prêtre rapidement, et diminuer le mécontentement lié à la guerre et à l'esclavage.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un augure per ottenere uno specialista Sacerdote; questo edificio serve anche a contrastare la stanchezza della guerra, e quella per aver sacrificato la popolazione.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un Recinto del augur para recibir un Sacerdote gratis y reducir el descontento por guerras o sacrificios.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj chatę Augur by stworzyć wczesnych specjalistów - Kapłanów oraz zmniejszyć rozruchy w miastach stosujących przyspieszoną produkcję.

TEXT.English: Sports Complex
TEXT.Italian: Complesso sportivo

TEXT.English: Sport plays a central role in many aspects of Australia's culture and lifestyle. Golf is the most commonly played competitive sport in Australia. Other sports that are most commonly played by Australians include tennis, netball, football (soccer) and swimming. Australian rules football is the most well-attended spectator sport in Australia as a whole.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two Olympic Games have been held in Australia; the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne and the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. Australia is one of only three countries to have sent athletes to every Summer Olympic Games. Australia is also currently the only southern hemisphere country to have won a gold Olympic medal in the Winter Olympics. Australia is also one of the nations to have attended every British Empire/Commonwealth Games event. It has played host four times.
TEXT.French: Sport plays a central role in many aspects of Australia's culture and lifestyle. Golf is the most commonly played competitive sport in Australia. Other sports that are most commonly played by Australians include tennis, netball, football (soccer) and swimming. Australian rules football is the most well-attended spectator sport in Australia as a whole.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two Olympic Games have been held in Australia; the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne and the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. Australia is one of only three countries to have sent athletes to every Summer Olympic Games. Australia is also currently the only southern hemisphere country to have won a gold Olympic medal in the Winter Olympics. Australia is also one of the nations to have attended every British Empire/Commonwealth Games event. It has played host four times.
TEXT.Polish: Sport odgrywa ważną rolę w wielu aspektach kultury Australii i stylu życia. Golf jest najpopularniejszą dyscypliną zawodów sportowych w Australii. Inne sporty, które są najczęściej uprawiane przez Australijczyków to tenis, siatkówka, piłka nożna i pływanie.

TEXT.English: Automated Defenses

Military planners decided that using androids and robotic mass production on civilian consumers decided that it could be applied to the military. Mass produced intelligent robots, which could perfectly follow orders and think like a person, replaced gate sentries, technicians, and of course, the people who produce military hardware. These robots also were applied to guns on greater military vehicles, such as battleships and dreadnought tanks, which allowed an increase in weaponry with keeping the size of these vehicles the same, since these guns do not require the men on board to operate them.
TEXT.French: Military planners decided that using androids and robotic mass production on civilian consumers decided that it could be applied to the military. Mass produced intelligent robots, which could perfectly follow orders and think like a person, replaced gate sentries, technicians, and of course, the people who produce military hardware. These robots also were applied to guns on greater military vehicles, such as battleships and dreadnought tanks, which allowed an increase in weaponry with keeping the size of these vehicles the same, since these guns do not require the men on board to operate them.
TEXT.Polish: Autonomiczne Systemy Sztucznej Inteligencji (ASSI) to zaawansowane systemy analityczno-decyzyjne stworzone do zarządzania i kontrolowania innych, podrzędnych systemów. Wykorzystywane są między innymi w wojskowości, głównie do automatyzacji działań i ograniczenia liczby ludzi, potrzebnych do wykonywania operacji wojskowych. Mogą znaleźć zastosowanie również w innych dziedzinach życia, uzależnionych od analizy przypadku i konieczności podjęcia możliwie najlepszych decyzji, np. medycyna, czy budowa zaawansowanych technologicznie maszyn.

TEXT.Polish: Obrona miasta i więcej XP dla jednostek przyszłości. Wymaga doktryny Post-Rzadkość.

TEXT.English: Automated Vehicle Dealership

An autonomous car, also known as a robotic car, or informally as driverless or self-driving, is an autonomous vehicle capable of fulfilling the human transportation capabilities of a traditional car. As an autonomous vehicle, it is capable of sensing its environment and navigating without human input. Robotic cars exist mainly as prototypes and demonstration systems, but are likely to become more widespread in the near future. Autonomous vehicles sense their surroundings with such techniques as radar, lidar, GPS, and computer vision. Advanced control systems interpret sensory information to identify appropriate navigation paths, as well as obstacles and relevant signage. Some autonomous vehicles update their maps based on sensory input, allowing the vehicles to keep track of their position even when conditions change or when they enter uncharted environments.
TEXT.French: An autonomous car, also known as a robotic car, or informally as driverless or self-driving, is an autonomous vehicle capable of fulfilling the human transportation capabilities of a traditional car. As an autonomous vehicle, it is capable of sensing its environment and navigating without human input. Robotic cars exist mainly as prototypes and demonstration systems, but are likely to become more widespread in the near future. Autonomous vehicles sense their surroundings with such techniques as radar, lidar, GPS, and computer vision. Advanced control systems interpret sensory information to identify appropriate navigation paths, as well as obstacles and relevant signage. Some autonomous vehicles update their maps based on sensory input, allowing the vehicles to keep track of their position even when conditions change or when they enter uncharted environments.
TEXT.Polish: Czas więc zastąpić kierowców komputerami! Przy okazji zniknie problem nietrzeźwych kierowców oraz poruszania się osób niepełnosprawnych ruchowo. Same zalety. Dotychczasowe systemy mające ułatwić kierowcom życie radzą sobie tylko z raczej typowymi sytuacjami - asystent parkowania znajduje i wciska samochód w wolną lukę przy drodze, a asystent jazdy w korku utrzymuje bezpieczny odstęp do poprzedzającego pojazdu.

TEXT.English: Automobile Dealership

A car dealership or vehicle local distribution is a business that sells new or used cars at the retail level, based on a dealership contract with an automaker or its sales subsidiary. It employs automobile salespeople to sell their automotive vehicles. It may also provide maintenance services for cars, and employ automotive technicians to stock and sell spare automobile parts and process warranty claims.

It employs automobile salespeople to sell their automotive vehicles. It may also provide maintenance services for cars, and employ automotive technicians to stock and sell spare automobile parts and process warranty claims.

TEXT.English: Azadi Tower
TEXT.French: La Tour Azadi

TEXT.English: The Azadi Tower, is the symbol of Tehran, the capital of Iran, and marks the west entrance to the city.
TEXT.French: La tour Azadi ou tour de la liberté (en persan: Borj-e Azadi) est l'un des symboles de la ville de Téhéran. Conçue par l'architecte Hossein Amanat qui gagne le projet en 1966 à l'âge de 24 ans, la tour marie les styles architecturaux sassanides et islamiques. Elle mesure 45 m de haut et est entièrement recouverte de quelque 25 000 plaques de marbre blanc d'Ispahan.
TEXT.Polish: Symbol Teheranu i Iranu, zbudowana w 1971 roku dla upamiętnienia 2500-lecie powstania Imperium Perskiego. Pierwotnie nazwana Wieżą Pamięci Królów, jednakże po Rewolucji Irańskiej w 1979 roku zmieniono nazwę na Azadi, co oznacza wolność. Wieża Azadi znajduje się w centrum Placu Azadi i wraz z fontannami oraz muzeami tworzy Kompleks Kulturalny Azadi zajmujący obszar 50000 metrów kwadratowych. Budowa finansowana była przez grupę składającą się z pięciuset irańskich przedsiębiorców, a uroczysta inauguracja miała miejsce 16 października 1971 roku.

Manipulated Bacteria can produce a substance that react with oxygen to a hard, concrete like surface. Bacteria seeded on broken streets can fix potholes and cracks easily and greatly reduce the maintenance for streets, sideways and plazas.
TEXT.French: Manipulated Bacteria can produce a substance that react with oxygen to a hard, concrete like surface. Bacteria seeded on broken streets can fix potholes and cracks easily and greatly reduce the maintenance for streets, sideways and plazas.
TEXT.Polish: Sporosarcina pasteurii a według starszej taksonomii Bacillus pasteurii - bakteria posiadająca zdolność wytrącaniakalcytu i zestalania piasku w środowisku zawierającym wapń oraz mocznik. Proces ten nazywany jest biologicznącementacją. S. pasteurii jest postrzegana jako hipotetyczny, ekologiczny materiał konstrukcyjny.

TEXT.English: Bacteriophage Therapy Clinic

Hage therapy is the therapeutic use of bacteriophages to treat pathogenic bacterial infections. Although extensively used and developed mainly in former Soviet Union countries circa 1920, the treatment is not approved in countries other than Russia and Georgia. Phage therapy has many potential applications in human medicine as well as dentistry, veterinary science, and agriculture. If the target host of a phage therapy treatment is not an animal the term "biocontrol" (as in phage-mediated biocontrol of bacteria) is usually employed, rather than "phage therapy". Bacteriophages are much more specific than antibiotics, so they can hypothetically be chosen to be indirectly harmless not only to the host organism (human, animal, or plant), but also to other beneficial bacteria, such as gut flora, reducing the chances of opportunistic infections. They would have a high therapeutic index, that is, phage therapy would be expected to give rise to few side effects. Because phages replicate in vivo, a smaller effective dose can be used. On the other hand, this specificity is also a disadvantage: a phage will only kill a bacterium if it is a match to the specific strain. Consequently, phage mixtures are often applied to improve the chances of success, or samples can be taken and an appropriate phage identified and grown.
TEXT.French: Hage therapy is the therapeutic use of bacteriophages to treat pathogenic bacterial infections. Although extensively used and developed mainly in former Soviet Union countries circa 1920, the treatment is not approved in countries other than Russia and Georgia. Phage therapy has many potential applications in human medicine as well as dentistry, veterinary science, and agriculture. If the target host of a phage therapy treatment is not an animal the term "biocontrol" (as in phage-mediated biocontrol of bacteria) is usually employed, rather than "phage therapy". Bacteriophages are much more specific than antibiotics, so they can hypothetically be chosen to be indirectly harmless not only to the host organism (human, animal, or plant), but also to other beneficial bacteria, such as gut flora, reducing the chances of opportunistic infections. They would have a high therapeutic index, that is, phage therapy would be expected to give rise to few side effects. Because phages replicate in vivo, a smaller effective dose can be used. On the other hand, this specificity is also a disadvantage: a phage will only kill a bacterium if it is a match to the specific strain. Consequently, phage mixtures are often applied to improve the chances of success, or samples can be taken and an appropriate phage identified and grown.
TEXT.Polish: Bakteriofag, fag - wirus atakujący bakterie. Przeważnie dany bakteriofag zdolny jest do infekcji tylko jednego gatunku (a czasem nawet tylko szczepu) bakterii. Bakteriofagi mogą przybierać kształty złożone (buławkowate), pałeczkowate lub wielościenne.

TEXT.English: Bakery
TEXT.Italian: Panetteria

TEXT.English: A baker is someone who primarily bakes and sells bread. Cakes and similar foods may also be produced, as the traditional boundaries between what is produced by a baker as opposed to a pastry chef have blurred in recent decades. The place where a baker works is called a bakehouse, bakeshop, or bakery. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first group of people to bake bread were ancient Egyptians, in 2600-2100 BC. It was believed that they learnt their skills from the Babylonians. In the royal bakery of Ramesses, bread and cakes were often made in shapes of animals and used for sacrifices. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Greek culture influenced the Romans a lot after the Egyptians. From there, Bakery was transformed and flourished. The Romans were lusty and festive, soon the art of Bakering were a highly respected profession during the fourth century (AD). The "job" was so profitable that in the time of Christ there were about three hundred Bakers around Rome. [PARAGRAPH:2]From the Roman Empire, the art of Bakery spread throughout Europe and the rest of the world. During the Middle Ages, it was common for each landlord to have a bakery, which was actually more of a public oven. Housewives would bring dough that they had prepared to the baker, who would use the oven to bake it into bread. As time went on, bakers began to bake their own goods, creating numerous tricks. For example, some bakers had trap doors that would allow a small boy to pinch off a bit of the dough to later sell off as his own. This practice eventually led in England to a regulation known as the Assize of Bread and Ale, which provided harsh punishments for bakers who were caught cheating. In response, bakers commonly threw in an extra loaf of bread; this tradition lives on in the modern "baker's dozen".
TEXT.French: A baker is someone who primarily bakes and sells bread. Cakes and similar foods may also be produced, as the traditional boundaries between what is produced by a baker as opposed to a pastry chef have blurred in recent decades. The place where a baker works is called a bakehouse, bakeshop, or bakery. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first group of people to bake bread were ancient Egyptians, in 2600-2100 BC. It was believed that they learnt their skills from the Babylonians. In the royal bakery of Ramesses, bread and cakes were often made in shapes of animals and used for sacrifices. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Greek culture influenced the Romans a lot after the Egyptians. From there, Bakery was transformed and flourished. The Romans were lusty and festive, soon the art of Bakering were a highly respected profession during the fourth century (AD). The "job" was so profitable that in the time of Christ there were about three hundred Bakers around Rome. [PARAGRAPH:2]From the Roman Empire, the art of Bakery spread throughout Europe and the rest of the world. During the Middle Ages, it was common for each landlord to have a bakery, which was actually more of a public oven. Housewives would bring dough that they had prepared to the baker, who would use the oven to bake it into bread. As time went on, bakers began to bake their own goods, creating numerous tricks. For example, some bakers had trap doors that would allow a small boy to pinch off a bit of the dough to later sell off as his own. This practice eventually led in England to a regulation known as the Assize of Bread and Ale, which provided harsh punishments for bakers who were caught cheating. In response, bakers commonly threw in an extra loaf of bread; this tradition lives on in the modern "baker's dozen".
TEXT.Polish: Piekarnia to zakład rzemieślniczy lub przemysłowy, który produkuje pieczywo. Główne działy: ciastownia, obrabialnia, piecownia.

TEXT.English: A bandit is someone that belongs to a group that attacks people travelling through the countryside. To avoid being caught by authorities bandits often stayed in hard-to-reach and easily defensible places thus the term Bandit's Hideout came to exist.

TEXT.Polish: Hajduk (z węgierskiego, w l.mn. hajdúk - rabusie) - u niemuzułmańskiej ludności Bałkanów, np. Bułgarów czy Serbów - rozbójnik, łupieżca w rodzaju opryszka, hajdamaka lub greckiego klefta, który z powodu panujących tam stosunków społecznych uznawany jest bardziej za bohatera i mściciela ludu niż złoczyńcę. Hajducy powstawali wskutek ucisku tureckich władców na miejscową ludność i sławieni byli przez nią w śpiewach i opowieściach. Oddziały hajduków latem kryły się w lasach i stamtąd prowadziły działania partyzanckie, pierwotnie przeciw tureckim poborcom podatków, później także napadając i łupiąc kupców i ludzi zamożnych.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bandit's Hideout[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production at the cost of extra [COLOR_RED]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] generation and reduction of [COLOR_RED]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also awards the promotion [COLOR_CYAN]Looter[COLOR_REVERT] to a few types of units ([COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Melee[COLOR_REVERT], for example). It can (albeit rarely) spawn a hidden barbarian [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Thief[COLOR_REVERT] unit that can further worsen a city's [COLOR_RED]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] situation if not caught.

TEXT.English: Barbwire Fence
TEXT.Italian: Barricata in filo spinato

TEXT.English: Barbed wire, also known as barb wire, is a type of fencing wire constructed with sharp edges or points arranged at intervals along the strand(s). It is used to construct inexpensive fences and is used atop walls surrounding secured property. It is also a major feature of the fortifications in trench warfare (as a wire obstacle).[PARAGRAPH:2]A person or animal trying to pass through or over barbed wire will suffer discomfort and possibly injury. Barbed wire fencing requires only fence posts, wire and fixing devices such as staples. It is simple to construct and quick to erect by an unskilled person.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first patent in the United States for barbed wire was issued in 1867 to Lucien B. Smith of Kent, Ohio, who is regarded as the inventor. Joseph F. Glidden of DeKalb, Illinois received a patent for the modern invention in 1874 after he made his own modifications to previous versions.[PARAGRAPH:2]Barbed wire was the first wire technology capable of restraining cattle. Wire fences were cheaper and easier to erect than their alternatives. (One such alternative was Osage orange, a thorny bush which was time-consuming to transplant and grow. The Osage orange later became a supplier of the wood used in making barbed wire fence posts). When wire fences became widely available in the United States in the late 19th century, they made it affordable to fence much larger areas than before. They made intensive animal husbandry practical on a much larger scale.

TEXT.Polish: Drut kolczasty -- liniowy element konstrukcyjny zapór (zasieków przeciwpiechotnych i ogrodzeń (płotów). Wykonywany jest w postaci dwóch (rzadziej trzech) skręconych spiralnie drutów stalowych (nośnych, właściwych). Na nich w odstępach nawinięte są w sposób uniemożliwiający przesuwanie wzdłuż i obracanie wokół drutu nośnego, krótkie odcinki drutu (zwoje) o wystających, ostro ściętych końcach długości kilkunastu milimetrów. Właściwości drutu kolczastego opisują: grubość drutów nośnych, odległość pomiędzy zwojami kolców i liczba wystających końców w zwoju (2 lub 4).

TEXT.English: Factory (Barrels)

A barrel, cask, or tun is a hollow cylindrical container, traditionally made of wooden staves bound by wooden or metal hoops. Traditionally, the barrel was a standard size of measure referring to a set capacity or weight of a given commodity. For example, in the UK a barrel of beer refers to a quantity of 36 imperial gallons. Wine was shipped in barrels of 119 litres (31 US gal). A small barrel is called a keg. Modern wooden barrels for wine-making are either made of French common oak (Quercus robur) and white oak (Quercus petraea) or from American white oak (Quercus alba) and have typically these standard sizes: "Bordeaux type" 225 litres (59 US gal) and "Cognac type" 300 litres (79 US gal). Modern barrels and casks can also be made of aluminum, stainless steel, and different types of plastic, such as HDPE. Someone who makes barrels is called a "barrel maker" or cooper. Barrels are only one type of cooperage. Other types include, but are not limited to: buckets, tubs, butter churns, hogsheads, firkins, kegs, kilderkins, tierces, rundlets, puncheons, pipes, tuns, butts, pins, and breakers. Barrels have a variety of uses, including storage of liquids such as water and oil, fermenting wine, arrack and sake, and maturing beverages such as wine, cognac, armagnac, sherry, port, whiskey and beer.
TEXT.French: A barrel, cask, or tun is a hollow cylindrical container, traditionally made of wooden staves bound by wooden or metal hoops. Traditionally, the barrel was a standard size of measure referring to a set capacity or weight of a given commodity. For example, in the UK a barrel of beer refers to a quantity of 36 imperial gallons. Wine was shipped in barrels of 119 litres (31 US gal). A small barrel is called a keg. Modern wooden barrels for wine-making are either made of French common oak (Quercus robur) and white oak (Quercus petraea) or from American white oak (Quercus alba) and have typically these standard sizes: "Bordeaux type" 225 litres (59 US gal) and "Cognac type" 300 litres (79 US gal). Modern barrels and casks can also be made of aluminum, stainless steel, and different types of plastic, such as HDPE. Someone who makes barrels is called a "barrel maker" or cooper. Barrels are only one type of cooperage. Other types include, but are not limited to: buckets, tubs, butter churns, hogsheads, firkins, kegs, kilderkins, tierces, rundlets, puncheons, pipes, tuns, butts, pins, and breakers. Barrels have a variety of uses, including storage of liquids such as water and oil, fermenting wine, arrack and sake, and maturing beverages such as wine, cognac, armagnac, sherry, port, whiskey and beer.
TEXT.Polish: Od prawie 2000 lat beczki są najwygodniejszą formą przewozu i przeładunku przy zapewnieniu niskich kosztów. Można w nich transportować wszystkie towary masowe. Zastosowanie worków czy skrzyń jest tańsze, lecz trudniejsze w przeładunku, bowiem nawet dosyć duże i ciężkie beczki mogą być przetaczane po ziemi nawet przez pojedynczego człowieka, gdy tymczasem do transportu podobnej wielkości skrzyń potrzeba albo kilku ludzi, albo dźwigu. Obecnie beczki stopniowo wychodzą z użycia na rzecz palet i kontenerów.

TEXT.English: Base Jumping Site

BASE jumping, also sometimes written as B.A.S.E. jumping, is an activity where participants jump from fixed objects and use a parachute to break their fall. "BASE" is an acronym that stands for four categories of fixed objects from which one can jump: buildings, antennas, spans (bridges), and earth (cliffs).
TEXT.French: BASE jumping, also sometimes written as B.A.S.E. jumping, is an activity where participants jump from fixed objects and use a parachute to break their fall. "BASE" is an acronym that stands for four categories of fixed objects from which one can jump: buildings, antennas, spans (bridges), and earth (cliffs).
TEXT.Polish: B.A.S.E., (BASE jumping) - nazwa pochodzi od angielskich słów: Building (budynek), Antenna (antena), Span (przęsło), Earth (ziemia) - jest to rodzajsportu ekstremalnego, polegającego na wykonywaniu skoków spadochronowych z obiektów takich jak: wieżowce, mosty, maszty, urwiska górskie, itp.

TEXT.English: Aerial Basket Ropeways

Ropeways have been used for more than 2,000 years, transporting both passengers and goods. The first sign of their use comes from the rugged Asiatic countries of China, India and Japan, where it is speculated that they may have been in operation since 250 BC. Men used rope to cross ravines, rivers and river-gorges, initially transferring themselves, hand over hand, with the body suspended by a crude harness. The harness eased the load and allowed a rest as the loop was slid along the rope track. Animal powered ropewaysSometimes, the rope was threaded through a hollow piece of bamboo before being attached, so that the person could slide down the rope without burning their hands. All that was needed to build a ropeway was a rope, knots to tie the rope to a rock or tree or anchor on both sides, and a bow and arrow to shoot the rope across. After the invention of the crossbow by the Chinese, heavier cables could be shot over longer distances. Sometimes the rope was supported on simple wooden trestles. These early aerial ropeways were the forerunners of later technologies such as the suspension bridge and the elevator. They were also the closest approach to aerial navigation at the time.
TEXT.French: Ropeways have been used for more than 2,000 years, transporting both passengers and goods. The first sign of their use comes from the rugged Asiatic countries of China, India and Japan, where it is speculated that they may have been in operation since 250 BC. Men used rope to cross ravines, rivers and river-gorges, initially transferring themselves, hand over hand, with the body suspended by a crude harness. The harness eased the load and allowed a rest as the loop was slid along the rope track. Animal powered ropewaysSometimes, the rope was threaded through a hollow piece of bamboo before being attached, so that the person could slide down the rope without burning their hands. All that was needed to build a ropeway was a rope, knots to tie the rope to a rock or tree or anchor on both sides, and a bow and arrow to shoot the rope across. After the invention of the crossbow by the Chinese, heavier cables could be shot over longer distances. Sometimes the rope was supported on simple wooden trestles. These early aerial ropeways were the forerunners of later technologies such as the suspension bridge and the elevator. They were also the closest approach to aerial navigation at the time.

TEXT.English: Basketmaker
TEXT.Italian: Capanna dell'intrecciatore di cesti

TEXT.English: Weaving, the art of forming a fabric by interlacing at right angles two or more sets of yarn or other material. It is one of the most ancient fundamental arts, as indicated by archaeological evidence. Discoveries in the early 1990s in the Czech Republic point to an origin in the Paleolithic period some 27,000 years ago. Moreover, the earliest literatures often mention the products of the loom. In primitive cultures weaving was practiced mainly by women.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although weaving sprang up independently in different parts of the world and was early known in Europe, its high development there in the Middle Ages was brought about by Eastern influences operating through Muslim and Byzantine channels of culture. Byzantium became a center of silk weaving in the 6th cent. In the 9th cent. Greece, Italy, and Spain became proficient. In Flanders a high degree of skill was attained by the 10th cent., especially in the weaving of wool. Flemish weavers brought to England by William the Conqueror and later by Queen Elizabeth I gave a great impetus to the craft there, and Lancashire became an important center. Tapestry weaving was brought to a high art in France. In colonial America weaving was a household industry allied with agriculture.[PARAGRAPH:2]The 18th-century weaving and spinning inventions marked the transition from the old era of domestic craftsmanship to the tremendous, organized industry of today. The factory system of machine weaving produces quantities of standardized material for mass consumption; the result is a loss of the distinctive elements of quality and design. Some of the finest silks, velvets, table linens, and carpets are still woven on handlooms.
TEXT.French: Weaving, the art of forming a fabric by interlacing at right angles two or more sets of yarn or other material. It is one of the most ancient fundamental arts, as indicated by archaeological evidence. Discoveries in the early 1990s in the Czech Republic point to an origin in the Paleolithic period some 27,000 years ago. Moreover, the earliest literatures often mention the products of the loom. In primitive cultures weaving was practiced mainly by women.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although weaving sprang up independently in different parts of the world and was early known in Europe, its high development there in the Middle Ages was brought about by Eastern influences operating through Muslim and Byzantine channels of culture. Byzantium became a center of silk weaving in the 6th cent. In the 9th cent. Greece, Italy, and Spain became proficient. In Flanders a high degree of skill was attained by the 10th cent., especially in the weaving of wool. Tapestry weaving was brought to a high art in France. In colonial America weaving was a household industry allied with agriculture.[PARAGRAPH:2]The 18th-century weaving and spinning inventions marked the transition from the old era of domestic craftsmanship to the tremendous, organized industry of today. The factory system of machine weaving produces quantities of standardized material for mass consumption; the result is a loss of the distinctive elements of quality and design. Some of the finest silks, velvets, table linens, and carpets are still woven on handlooms.
TEXT.Italian: L'intrecciatura è l'arte di creare un tessuto intrecciando con angoli precisi due o più fili di filato o di un altro materiale. E' un'arte tra le più antiche, come indicato dalle prove archeologiche. Alcune scoperte effettuate all'inizio degli anni 90 nella Repubblica Ceca fanno risalire le sue origini al periodo Paleolitico, circa 27000 anni fa. Oltretutto la letteratura antica parla spesso di quest'arte. Nelle culture primitive, l'intrecciatura è praticata prevalentemente dalle donne.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anche se l'intrecciatura comparve independentemente in diverse parti del mondo e venne ideata molto presto in Europa, il suo sviluppo nel vecchio continente durante il Medioevo è stato determinato da influenze orientali che operarono attraverso i canali della cultura bizantina e musulmana. Bisanzio divenne un centro di tessitura della seta nel 6° secolo; nel 9° secolo Grecia, Italia e Spagna raggiunsero un elevato grado di abilità. Nelle Fiandre un alto grado di abilità venne raggiunto nel decimo secollo soprattutto nella tessitura della lana. Tessitori fiamminghi portati in Inghilterra da Guglielmo il Conquistatore e poi dalla regina Elisabetta I diedero un grande impulso al mestiere lì, e Lancashire divenne un importante centro. La tessitura degli arazzi fu elevata a grande arte in Francia. Nell'America coloniale la tessitura era un'industria di famiglia collegata all'agricoltura.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le invenzioni del 18 ° secolo di tessitura e filatura hanno segnato il passaggio dalla vecchia era di artigianato domestico alla grande industria organizzata di oggi. Il sistema industriale delle macchine tessili produce quantità di materiale standardizzato per il consumo di massa, il risultato è una perdita di elementi distintivi di qualità e design. Alcune delle più belle sete, velluti, biancheria da tavola e tappeti sono ancora tessute su telai a mano.
TEXT.Polish: Koszykarstwo - rodzaj rzemiosla polegajacego na wykorzystywaniu surowych lub wczesniej odpowiednio przygotowanych wlókien roslinnych do wyplatania koszy. Przykladowe materialy, które moga byc wykorzystywane w koszykarstwie to m.in. wiklina, trawa, rattan sloma czy bambus. Kosz zazwyczaj sklada sie z denka, bocznych scian oraz obreczy ("warkocza"). Dodatkowo moze równiez posiadac raczki (uchwyty), zdobienia oraz pokrywe. Najpierw wykonuje sie denko, z którego wyprowadza sie pionowe i sztywniejsze prety a pomiedzy nie wplata odpowiedni material. Po zaplecieniu scian wykonuje sie obrecz (czesto jest to najbardziej ozdobny element kosza), która ma za zadanie wzmacniac cala konstrukcje. Do obreczy wplata sie równiez uchwyty. Do wyplatania kosza o skomplikowanym ksztalcie nierzadko uzywa sie specjalnych form, na których oplata sie cala konstrukcje.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Basketweaver's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Baskets[COLOR_REVERT] which enable some buildings ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fish Traps[COLOR_REVERT], for example) and help increase a city's total [COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] output if the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Omega Child Crew[COLOR_REVERT] is present.

TEXT.German: Kleiner Nahrungsmittelbonus mit Hanf und kleiner Goldbonus.
TEXT.Italian: Fornisce un piccolo bonus al cibo con la canapa, oltre a un bonus all'oro.

TEXT.English: Bath House
TEXT.Italian: Terme

TEXT.English: Public baths originated from a communal need for cleanliness. Often the term public is misleading to some people, as they will have restrictions based upon who can use the facility - elite members of the culture, men only, religious only. As societies advance, public baths often disappear as private washing stations become possible, or they become incorporated into the social system and now are 'meeting places'. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first Roman public thermae of 19 BC had a rotunda 25 meters across, circled by small rooms, set in a park with artificial river and pool. By AD 300 the Baths of Diocletian would cover 1.5 million square feet (140,000 square meters), its soaring granite and porphyry sheltering 3,000 bathers a day. Roman baths became "something like a cross between an aquacentre and a theme park," with pools, game rooms, gardens, even libraries and theatres. One of the most famous public bath sites is Aquae Sulis in Bath, England.
TEXT.French: Public baths originated from a communal need for cleanliness. Often the term public is misleading to some people, as they will have restrictions based upon who can use the facility - elite members of the culture, men only, religious only. As societies advance, public baths often disappear as private washing stations become possible, or they become incorporated into the social system and now are 'meeting places'. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first Roman public thermae of 19 BC had a rotunda 25 meters across, circled by small rooms, set in a park with artificial river and pool. By AD 300 the Baths of Diocletian would cover 1.5 million square feet (140,000 square meters), its soaring granite and porphyry sheltering 3,000 bathers a day. Roman baths became "something like a cross between an aquacentre and a theme park," with pools, game rooms, gardens, even libraries and theatres. One of the most famous public bath sites is Aquae Sulis in Bath, England.
TEXT.Polish: Kompleksy architektoniczne przeznaczone do kąpieli wodnych i parowych. Składały się one z łaźni i przylegających do nich terenów odkrytych. W budynku znajdowały się z reguły następujące pomieszczenia: apodyteron - westybul z szatnią; frigidarium - pomieszczenie zimne, czasami z basenem z zimną wodą do pływania (notatio); tepidarium - pomieszczenie ciepłe z gorąca wodą (caldarium); laconicum - łaźnia sucha; sudationes - łaźnia parowa. Najstarsze zachowane łaźnie znaleziono w Pompejach (termy stabiańskie - II w. p.n.e.), zaś coraz powszechniej zaczęto je budować w I w. p.n.e. W czasach cesarstwa niektóre termy osiągnęły olbrzymie rozmiary i zamieniły się w monumentalne zespoły pomieszczeń służących nie tylko higienie osobistej, ale także zajęciom intelektualnym.

TEXT.English: Bath Houses provide health and culture to cities. It also increases the rate at which its city produces [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great People[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: une Maison des Bainss provide health and culture to cities. It also increases the rate at which its city produces [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great People[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: Los Baños públicos proporcionan salud y cultura a las ciudades. También aumentan la tasa a la que las ciudades producen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Grandes personajes[COLOR_REVERT],
TEXT.Polish: Łaźnia zwiększa poziom zdrowia oraz kulturę w Twoich miastach. Dodatkowo powiększa przyrost punktów [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wielkich Ludzi[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Bathing Ritual

Bathing is the washing of the body with a fluid, usually water or an aqueous solution, or the immersion of the body in water. It may be practiced for personal hygiene, religious ritual or therapeutic purposes or as a recreational activity.
TEXT.French: Bathing is the washing of the body with a fluid, usually water or an aqueous solution, or the immersion of the body in water. It may be practiced for personal hygiene, religious ritual or therapeutic purposes or as a recreational activity.
TEXT.Polish: Rytuał - zespół specyficznych dla danej kultury symbolicznych sekwencji sformalizowanych czynów i wypowiedzi, wykonywanych w celu osiągnięcia pożądanego skutku, który jednakże może być znacznie oderwany od pozornie oczywistego celu funkcjonalnego.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bathing Ritual[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that provides a city with [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] while also lowering [COLOR_GREEN]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Procure de l'[ICON_HEALTHY].

TEXT.English: Gardens by the Bay
TEXT.French: Les Jardins volants

TEXT.English: Gardens by the Bay is a park spanning 101 hectares (250 acres) of reclaimed land in central Singapore, adjacent to the Marina Reservoir. The park consists of three waterfront gardens: Bay South Garden, Bay East Garden and Bay Central Garden. Gardens by the Bay is an integral part of a strategy by the Singapore government to transform Singapore from a "Garden City" to a "City in a Garden". The stated aim is to raise the quality of life by enhancing greenery and flora in the city. First announced to the public by Prime Minister, Mr Lee Hsien Loong during the National DayRally in August 2005, Gardens by the Bay is intended to become Singapore's premier urban outdoor recreation space, and a national icon. An international competition for the design of the master plan, held in January 2006,attracted more than 70 entries submitted by 170 firms from 24 countries. Two firms - Grant Associates and Gustafson Porter - were eventually awarded the master plan design for theBay South and Bay East Gardens respectively. The park has proven extremely popular for event planners, with demand so high that the park has to limit the number of events to three per week.
TEXT.French: Gardens by the Bay is a park spanning 101 hectares (250 acres) of reclaimed land in central Singapore, adjacent to the Marina Reservoir. The park consists of three waterfront gardens: Bay South Garden, Bay East Garden and Bay Central Garden. Gardens by the Bay is an integral part of a strategy by the Singapore government to transform Singapore from a "Garden City" to a "City in a Garden". The stated aim is to raise the quality of life by enhancing greenery and flora in the city. First announced to the public by Prime Minister, Mr Lee Hsien Loong during the National DayRally in August 2005, Gardens by the Bay is intended to become Singapore's premier urban outdoor recreation space, and a national icon. An international competition for the design of the master plan, held in January 2006,attracted more than 70 entries submitted by 170 firms from 24 countries. Two firms - Grant Associates and Gustafson Porter - were eventually awarded the master plan design for theBay South and Bay East Gardens respectively. The park has proven extremely popular for event planners, with demand so high that the park has to limit the number of events to three per week.
TEXT.Polish: Ogromne ogrody botaniczne w Singapurze. Otwarte w 2012 i zajmujące ponad 100 ha powierzchni Gardens by the Bay stanowią olbrzymią atrakcję turystyczną.

TEXT.English: Bazaar

As cities grew and prospered, trade between the farmers, artisans, and craftsmen who lived in the vicinity contributed to the economic health of the city. It soon became apparent that the best way for conducting trade within the city was to have a central location, or marketplace, where the people offering goods and services, or seeking them, could meet and conduct business. As a city's marketplace grew larger and more active, the economic vitality of the city grew as well.
TEXT.French: Lorsque les villes se sont agrandies et ont prospéré, le commerce entre les fermiers et les artisans des environs a contribué à la bonne santé économique de la ville. Rapidement, il est apparu que le meilleur moyen d'attirer le commerce dans la ville consistait à créer un emplacement central, une place du marché, où la population pouvait échanger ses biens et services, se rencontrer et faire des affaires. Lorsque la place du marché d'un village s'agrandissait et devenait plus active, la vitalité économique de la ville augmentait également.
TEXT.German: Je mehr eine Stadt sich vergrößerte, desto mehr trug der Handel zwischen Bauern, Kunsthandwerkern und Handwerkern, die im Stadtgebiet oder der näheren Umgebung ansässig waren, zum städtischen Wohlstand bei. Schnell erkannte man, dass es sinnvoll war, einen zentralen Ort - einen Marktplatz - für Handelsaktivitäten bereitzustellen. Hier konnten sich alle Bürger einfinden, die Waren und Dienstleistungen anboten oder suchten, um ihre Geschäfte zu tätigen. Je mehr ein Marktplatz genutzt wurde, desto stärker wurde auch die wirtschaftliche Situation der Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Quando le città crescevano e prosperavano, il commercio fra gli agricoltori, gli artigiani e gli artisti che vivevano nelle vicinanze contribuiva al benessere economico della città. Divenne presto chiaro che il modo migliore per condurre questi scambi nella città era di avere un'area centrale, il mercato, in cui la gente che offriva beni e servizi, oppure li cercava, potesse incontrarsi per condurre i suoi affari. Quando il mercato diventava più grande e più attraente in una città, anche la vitalità di quest'ultima ne risentiva positivamente.
TEXT.Spanish: A medida que las ciudades crecían y prosperaban, el comercio entre los agricultores y artesanos que vivían en sus inmediaciones contribuía a su salud económica. Pronto se hizo evidente que la mejor manera de llevar a cabo el intercambio en la ciudad era con un lugar central o mercado en el que pudiera reunirse la gente que ofrecía mercancías o servicios y la que iba en busca de los mismos. A medida que el mercado de la ciudad crecía y su actividad se intensificaba, la vitalidad económica también aumentaba.
TEXT.Polish: Bazar, inaczej: targ, targowisko - wydzielony teren przeznaczony do handlu, zazwyczaj na otwartej powierzchni (plac targowy). Targowiska mogą mieć charakter spontaniczny lub zorganizowany. W tym drugim przypadku teren przeznaczony do handlu może mieć wyznaczone płatne stanowiska dla osób oferujących swoje towary. Targowiska umożliwiają swobodny, bezpośredni kontakt handlowca z klientem i bezpośrednie negocjowanie ceny. W pewnym sensie rozwinięciem idei targowiska są giełdy, które od targowisk różnią się w zasadzie tylko bardziej sformalizowanym stylem negocjowania cen.

TEXT.English: Bazaar increases the city's wealth a small amount. They also increase the city's happiness with access to Ivory, Silk, Spices and Pearls.
TEXT.French: un Bazar augmente la richesse de la ville. Il améliore également le bonheur, avec les ressources [COLOR_GREEN]Ivoire[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_GREEN]Soie[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_GREEN]Epices[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_GREEN]Perles[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El Bazar aumenta un poco el oro de la ciudad. También incrementa la felicidad de la ciudad con acceso al Marfil, la Seda, las Especias o las Perlas.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Bazar by zwiększyć i bogactwo w Twoich miastach. Bazar zwiększa także zadowolenie jeśli posiadasz dostęp do Kości Słoniowej, Jedwabiu, Przypraw i Pereł.

TEXT.English: Beadworker
TEXT.Italian: Capanna dell'intrecciatore di perline

TEXT.English: Beadwork is the art or craft of attaching beads to one another or to cloth, usually by the use of a needle and thread or soft, flexible wire. Most beadwork takes the form of jewellery or other personal adornment, but beads are also used in wall hangings and sculpture. Beadwork techniques are broadly divided into loom and off-loom weaving, stringing, bead embroidery, bead crochet, and bead knitting. Most cultures have employed beads for personal adornment. Archaeological records show that people made and used beads as long as 5,000 years ago. Beads have also been used for religious purposes, as good luck talismans, and as curative agents.
TEXT.French: Beadwork is the art or craft of attaching beads to one another or to cloth, usually by the use of a needle and thread or soft, flexible wire. Most beadwork takes the form of jewellery or other personal adornment, but beads are also used in wall hangings and sculpture. Beadwork techniques are broadly divided into loom and off-loom weaving, stringing, bead embroidery, bead crochet, and bead knitting. Most cultures have employed beads for personal adornment. Archaeological records show that people made and used beads as long as 5,000 years ago. Beads have also been used for religious purposes, as good luck talismans, and as curative agents.
TEXT.Polish: Koraliki to podstawowe elementy najdawniejszej bizuterii - kulka (lub, w zasadzie, dowolny kształt) z dziurką przez środek, służąca do nawlekania na sznurek, rzemień, łańcuszek, szpilkę, drut.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Beadmaker's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production and having access to specific resources ([COLOR_CYAN]Pearls[COLOR_REVERT], for example) can further increase a city's total [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] output by a given percentage up to a maximum of [COLOR_GREEN]+6%[COLOR_REVERT]. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Beads[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn increases the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jewellery Store[COLOR_REVERT]'s [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production output.

TEXT.English: Palace of Beaulieu
TEXT.French: Le Palais de Beaulieu

TEXT.English: The Palace of Beaulieu is a former Royal Palace in Boreham, Essex, England, north-east of Chelmsford. The property is currently occupied by New Hall School. The estate on which it was built - the manor of Walhfare in Boreham - was granted to the Canons of Waltham Abbey in 1062. After various changes of possession, it was granted by the Crown to the Earl of Ormond in 1491. By this time, it had a house called New Hall.
TEXT.French: The Palace of Beaulieu is a former Royal Palace in Boreham, Essex, England, north-east of Chelmsford. The property is currently occupied by New Hall School. The estate on which it was built - the manor of Walhfare in Boreham - was granted to the Canons of Waltham Abbey in 1062. After various changes of possession, it was granted by the Crown to the Earl of Ormond in 1491. By this time, it had a house called New Hall.
TEXT.Polish: Pałac Beaulieu (znany także jako New Hall) - szesnastowieczna rezydencja królów Anglii, położona na północ od miasta Chelmsford. Pierwsze zapiski dotyczące posiadłości pochodzą z roku 1062 - wiadomo, że została wówczas przekazana kanonikom z opactwa Waltham. W Średniowieczu wiele razy zmieniała właścicieli, niejednokrotnie wracając do Korony, aby zaraz potem stać się przedmiotem kolejnego nadania. W 1491 została nadana książętom Ormond. W 1517 dziedzic tego tytułu i zarazem posiadłości, na której istniał wówczas drewniany gmach zwany New Hall, Thomas Boleyn, sprzedał dobra królowi Henrykowi VIII. Ten postanowił rozebrać drewnianą konstrukcję i zbudować nowy obiekt, tym razem ceglany. Tak powstały obiekt, nazwany Pałacem Beaulieu, stał się jego letnią rezydencją.

TEXT.English: Belief (Karma)

Karma means action, work or deed; it also refers to the principle of causality where intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual. Good intent and good deed contribute to good karma and future happiness, while bad intent and bad deed contribute to bad karma and future suffering.
TEXT.French: Karma means action, work or deed; it also refers to the principle of causality where intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual. Good intent and good deed contribute to good karma and future happiness, while bad intent and bad deed contribute to bad karma and future suffering.
TEXT.Polish: Karma - w buddyzmie, hinduizmie i religiach dharmicznych jest to przyczyna - rozumiana w sensie prawa przyczyny i skutku. Filozoficzne wyjaśnienie karmy różni się pomiędzy tradycjami, jednak główna idea głosi, że czyny tworzą przyszłe doświadczenia i przez to każdy jest odpowiedzialny za własne życie, cierpienie i szczęście jakie sprowadza na siebie i innych.

TEXT.English: This building is autobuild when you build National Belief (Karma).
TEXT.French: This building is autobuild when you build National Belief (Karma).
TEXT.Polish: Ten budynek powstaje automatycznie kiedy stworzysz Narodowe Wierzenia (Karma).

TEXT.English: Belief (Reincarnation)

Reincarnation is the religious or philosophical concept that the soul or spirit, after biological death, begins a new life in a new body that may be human, animal or spiritual depending on the moral quality of the previous life's actions.
TEXT.French: Reincarnation is the religious or philosophical concept that the soul or spirit, after biological death, begins a new life in a new body that may be human, animal or spiritual depending on the moral quality of the previous life's actions.
TEXT.Polish: Reinkarnacja (również: metempsychoza, transmigracja; łac. re+in+caro, carnis - ponowne wcielenie) - pogląd, według którego dusza (bądź świadomość) po śmierci ciała może wcielić się w nowy byt fizyczny. Np. dusza jednego człowieka może przejść w ciało nowonarodzonego dziecka lub zwierzęcia czy nawet według niektórych poglądówrośliny. Samo słowo reinkarnacja jest zestawieniem dwóch członów: inkarnacja (wcielenie) i przedrostka re (oznaczającego powtórzenie czegoś). Dosłownie więc reinkarnacja oznacza powtórne wcielenie.

TEXT.English: This building is autobuild when you build National Belief (Reincarnation).
TEXT.French: This building is autobuild when you build National Belief (Reincarnation).
TEXT.Polish: Ten budynek powstaje automatycznie kiedy stworzysz Narodowe Wierzenia (Reinkarnacja).

TEXT.English: Belief (Resurrection)
Resurrection (anglicized from Latin resurrectio) is the concept of a living being coming back to life after death.
TEXT.French: Resurrection (anglicized from Latin resurrectio) is the concept of a living being coming back to life after death.
TEXT.Polish: Zmartwychwstanie lub rezurekcja (z łac.; gr. anastasis) - inaczej powstanie z martwych, ponowne ożywienie. Koncepcja będąca jedną z ważniejszych prawd wiary w zaratusztrianizmie, judaizmie, chrześcijaństwie i islamie, zgodnie z którą - w eschatologii tych systemów wyznaniowych - wszyscy zmarli zostaną wskrzeszeni przez Boga w czasach ostatecznych. Elementy wiary w zmartwychwstanie występują również w hinduizmie i wielu religiach animistycznych.

TEXT.English: This building is autobuild when you build National Belief (Resurrection).
TEXT.French: Ce bâtiment est construit automatiquement lorsque vous adoptez la Croyance (Résurrection).
TEXT.Polish: Ten budynek powstaje automatycznie kiedy stworzysz Narodowe Wierzenia (Zmartwychwstanie).

TEXT.English: Bell Rock Lighthouse
TEXT.French: Le Phare de Bell Rock

TEXT.English: The Bell Rock Lighthouse, off the coast of Angus, Scotland, is theworld's oldest surviving sea-washed lighthouse. It was built by Robert Stevensonon the Bell Rock (also known as Inchcape) in the North Sea, 11 miles (17.7 km), east of the Firth of Tay, between 1807 and 1810, and standing at 35 m high, the light isvisible from 35 statute miles (56 km) inland. The masonry work on which the lighthouse rests was constructed to such a high standard thatit has not been replaced or adapted in 200 years. The lamps and reflectors were replacedin 1843, with the original equipment being used in the lighthouse at Cape Bonavista, Newfoundland, where they are currently on display. The working of the lighthouse has beenautomated since 1988.The lighthouse operated in tandem with a shore station, the Bell Rock Signal Tower, built in1813 at the mouth of Arbroath harbour. Today this building houses the Signal Tower Museum, a visitor centre detailing the history of the lighthouse. The challenges faced in the building of the lighthouse have led to it being described as one of the Seven Wonders of the Industrial World.
TEXT.French: The Bell Rock Lighthouse, off the coast of Angus, Scotland, is theworld's oldest surviving sea-washed lighthouse. It was built by Robert Stevensonon the Bell Rock (also known as Inchcape) in the North Sea, 11 miles (17.7 km), east of the Firth of Tay, between 1807 and 1810, and standing at 35 m high, the light isvisible from 35 statute miles (56 km) inland. The masonry work on which the lighthouse rests was constructed to such a high standard thatit has not been replaced or adapted in 200 years. The lamps and reflectors were replacedin 1843, with the original equipment being used in the lighthouse at Cape Bonavista, Newfoundland, where they are currently on display. The working of the lighthouse has beenautomated since 1988.The lighthouse operated in tandem with a shore station, the Bell Rock Signal Tower, built in1813 at the mouth of Arbroath harbour. Today this building houses the Signal Tower Museum, a visitor centre detailing the history of the lighthouse. The challenges faced in the building of the lighthouse have led to it being described as one of the Seven Wonders of the Industrial World.
TEXT.Polish: Latarnia morska Bell Rock - najstarsza na Wyspach Brytyjskich latarnia morska usytuowana na rafie, zwanej także Inchcape. Położona jest 18 km od wybrzeży Angus na Morzu Północnym oraz 18 km na wschód od wejścia do zatoki Firth of Tay. Latarnia została wpisana w 1998 roku na listę zabytków kategorii A Historic Scotland pod numerem 45197. Obiekt znajduje się także na liście Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Scotland pod numerem NO72NE 1.

TEXT.English: Mine (Berlinite)
TEXT.French: Mine de Berlinite

TEXT.English: Berlinite (aluminium phosphate, chemical formula AlPO4) is a rare phosphate mineral. It has the same crystal structure as quartz with a low temperature polytype isostructural with alpha-quartz and a high temperature polytype isostructural with beta-quartz. Berlinite can vary from colourless to greyish or pale pink and has translucent crystals.
TEXT.French: Berlinite (aluminium phosphate, chemical formula AlPO4) is a rare phosphate mineral. It has the same crystal structure as quartz with a low temperature polytype isostructural with alpha-quartz and a high temperature polytype isostructural with beta-quartz. Berlinite can vary from colourless to greyish or pale pink and has translucent crystals.
TEXT.Polish: Bezwodne fosforany, niezawierające anionów z innych grup.

TEXT.English: Build a Berlinite Mine to increase your cities production.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mine de Berlinite[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Berlinite Mine by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.Italian: Centro per i miglioramenti biologici

TEXT.English: A boienhancement centre is a place where enhancements, usually genetic or implants, are executed on organic beings.

TEXT.English: Bioinformatics Lab

In biology, bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary field that develops and improves upon methods for storing, retrieving, organizing and analyzing biological data. A major activity in bioinformatics is to develop software tools to generate useful biological knowledge. Bioinformatics has become an important part of many areas of biology. In experimental molecular biology, bioinformatics techniques such as image and signal processing allow extraction of useful results from large amounts of raw data. In the field of genetics and genomics, it aids in sequencing and annotating genomes and their observed mutations. It plays a role in the textual mining of biological literature and the development of biological and gene ontologies to organize and query biological data. It plays a role in the analysis of gene and protein expression and regulation. Bioinformatics tools aid in the comparison of genetic and genomic data and more generally in the understanding of evolutionary aspects of molecular biology. At a more integrative level, it helps analyze and catalogue the biological pathways and networks that are an important part of systems biology. In structural biology, it aids in the simulation and modeling of DNA, RNA, and protein structures as well as molecular interactions.
TEXT.French: In biology, bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary field that develops and improves upon methods for storing, retrieving, organizing and analyzing biological data. A major activity in bioinformatics is to develop software tools to generate useful biological knowledge. Bioinformatics has become an important part of many areas of biology. In experimental molecular biology, bioinformatics techniques such as image and signal processing allow extraction of useful results from large amounts of raw data. In the field of genetics and genomics, it aids in sequencing and annotating genomes and their observed mutations. It plays a role in the textual mining of biological literature and the development of biological and gene ontologies to organize and query biological data. It plays a role in the analysis of gene and protein expression and regulation. Bioinformatics tools aid in the comparison of genetic and genomic data and more generally in the understanding of evolutionary aspects of molecular biology. At a more integrative level, it helps analyze and catalogue the biological pathways and networks that are an important part of systems biology. In structural biology, it aids in the simulation and modeling of DNA, RNA, and protein structures as well as molecular interactions.

TEXT.English: Biological Warfare Lab

Italian.Text: Laboratorio per la guerra biologica:Laboratori per la guerra biologica

Spanish.Text: Laboratorio de guerra biológica:Laboratorios de guerra biológica

TEXT.English: Bio-war labs are designed to create and mass-produce bio-weapons. In addition, they also work to create antidotes to the enemy's bio-weapons (as well as to their own). Thus, these buildings are considered to be integral to a city's defenses. Despite this, and even though these Bio-war labs are equipped with sophisticated and layered defenses against containment breaches, such facilities are often quite unpopular with their neighbors.
TEXT.French: Les laboratoires de guerre biologique sont conçus pour créer et produire des armes biologiques. En outre, ils travaillent aussi à la mise au point d'antidotes, afin de lutter contre les effets des agents biologiques ennemis (ou alliés). Ces bâtiments font donc partie intégrante du dispositif de défense d'une ville. Toutefois, malgré la fiabilité de leur système de protection, ces installations restent très impopulaires auprès des populations riveraines.
TEXT.German: Labors für biologische Kriegsführung dienen der Entwicklung und Massenproduktion von biologischen Waffen. Außerdem werden hier auch Gegenmittel für feindliche (und eigene) biologische Waffen hergestellt. Dementsprechend sind diese Gebäude integraler Bestandteil der städtischen Verteidigung. Obwohl die Labors durch hoch entwickelte Abschirmsysteme gleich mehrfach geschützt sind, zeigen sich benachbarte Nationen in aller Regel nicht allzu begeistert von ihrer Existenz.
TEXT.Italian: I laboratori per la guerra biologica sono progettati per creare e produrre in massa armi biologiche. Inoltre lavorano per creare antidoti per le armi biologiche del nemico (oltre che per le proprie). Per questo gli edifici vengono considerati parte integrante delle difese di una città. Nonostante ciò, e anche se sono equipaggiati con misure di sicurezza per impedire contaminazioni, questi impianti non sono mai molto ben visti nel vicinato.
TEXT.Spanish: Los laboratorios de guerra biológica se han pensado para crear armas biológicas a gran escala. Además, también trabajan en la creación de antídotos contra las bioarmas enemigas (así como contra las propias). Por ello, dichos edificios se consideran esenciales para la defensa de una ciudad. A pesar de eso y, aunque dichos laboratorios biobélicos estén equipados con sofisticadas capas protectoras contra filtraciones, los vecinos no acostumbran a recibir bien a estas instalaciones.
TEXT.Polish: Laboratoria Broni Biologicznej zostały zaprojektowane aby tworzyć i produkować masowo bronie biologiczne. Ponadto potrafią produkować one szczepionki przeciwko mikrobom użytym w pociskach wroga (a także w swoich własnych).

TEXT.English: Factory (Biopolymers)

Biopolymers are polymers produced by living organisms. Since they are polymers, biopolymers contain monomeric units that are covalently bonded to form larger structures. There are three main classes of biopolymers, classified according to the monomeric units used and the structure of the biopolymer formed: polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), which are long polymers composed of 13 or more nucleotide monomers; polypeptides, which are short polymers of amino acids; and polysaccharides, which are often linear bonded polymeric carbohydrate structures.
TEXT.French: Biopolymers are polymers produced by living organisms. Since they are polymers, biopolymers contain monomeric units that are covalently bonded to form larger structures. There are three main classes of biopolymers, classified according to the monomeric units used and the structure of the biopolymer formed: polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), which are long polymers composed of 13 or more nucleotide monomers; polypeptides, which are short polymers of amino acids; and polysaccharides, which are often linear bonded polymeric carbohydrate structures.
TEXT.Polish: Biopolimery - polimery występujące naturalnie w organizmach żywych, które są przez nie produkowane. Znaczna część związków organicznych występujących w tych organizmach to właśnie biopolimery. Wchodzą w skład komórek, są też budulcem w obszarach międzykomórkowych. Szczególnie ważną rolę pełnią biopolimery, które mają wiele grup funkcyjnych.

TEXT.English: Bird Caller

A bird call (more commonly a duck call) may be either the sound-imitation process by which a hunter lures waterfowl, or the actual tool which the person uses to do so. Early duck call tools were basic woodwind instruments, while later innovations are constructed of rubber and plastic, and allow the hunter to adjust the volume and tone of the calls with reeds. The goal of a duck call is to sound like a realistic live duck.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are many schools of thought on what technique is best for imitating the sounds that ducks make, however, every duck call should be able to create four basic calls: the quack, the feed call, and the comeback or hail call. The quack is a short, sharp note that is the most used in waterfowl hunting. The feed is a sequence of rapid short notes of varying pitch that imitate ducks eating. The hail call or comeback call are the loudest and longest notes, typically used to attract the attention of far away ducks.
TEXT.French: A bird call (more commonly a duck call) may be either the sound-imitation process by which a hunter lures waterfowl, or the actual tool which the person uses to do so. Early duck call tools were basic woodwind instruments, while later innovations are constructed of rubber and plastic, and allow the hunter to adjust the volume and tone of the calls with reeds. The goal of a duck call is to sound like a realistic live duck.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are many schools of thought on what technique is best for imitating the sounds that ducks make, however, every duck call should be able to create four basic calls: the quack, the feed call, and the comeback or hail call. The quack is a short, sharp note that is the most used in waterfowl hunting. The feed is a sequence of rapid short notes of varying pitch that imitate ducks eating. The hail call or comeback call are the loudest and longest notes, typically used to attract the attention of far away ducks.
TEXT.Polish: Łowca wykorzystujący specjalny gwizdek do wabienia ptaków.

TEXT.English: Catcher (Birds-of-Paradise)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur d'oiseau du paradis

TEXT.English: Birds of paradise outshine other birds with their beautiful plumage and spectacular courtship displays. They are usually heavy-billed and rather stout birds, but there are many species, each having its own unique look and colors. Birds of paradise range from starling sized to the size of a crow. And that doesn't include the male's feathery tail that can be up to 3 feet (0.91 meters) long. Most of the male bird of paradise species come in a variety of bright colors while the females are generally dull brown. Some males also have wattles, bright-blue mouths, and colored patches of naked skin. These birds of paradise look like something you could find only in an imaginary land.
TEXT.French: Birds of paradise outshine other birds with their beautiful plumage and spectacular courtship displays. They are usually heavy-billed and rather stout birds, but there are many species, each having its own unique look and colors. Birds of paradise range from starling sized to the size of a crow. And that doesn't include the male's feathery tail that can be up to 3 feet (0.91 meters) long. Most of the male bird of paradise species come in a variety of bright colors while the females are generally dull brown. Some males also have wattles, bright-blue mouths, and colored patches of naked skin. These birds of paradise look like something you could find only in an imaginary land.
TEXT.Polish: Cudowronki, cudowronkowate, ptaki rajskie (Paradisaeidae) - rodzinaptaków z rzędu wróblowych (Passeriformes). Występują na Molukach,Nowej Gwinei i w północno-wschodniej Australii. Zamieszkują lasy tropikalne, nieliczne żyją na otwartej przestrzeni.

TEXT.English: Blacknet
The Blacknet is a side product of the internet.
TEXT.French: The Blacknet is a side product of the internet.
TEXT.Polish: Tor (ang. The Onion Router) - wirtualna sieć komputerowaimplementująca trasowanie cebulowe trzeciej generacji. Sieć zapobiegaanalizie ruchu sieciowego i w konsekwencji zapewnia użytkownikom prawieanonimowy dostęp do zasobów Internetu. Roger Dingledine, Nick Mathewson i Paul Syverson przedstawili pracę "Tor: The Second-Generation Onion Router" na 13. sympozjum bezpieczeństwa stowarzyszenia USENIX w piątek, 13 sierpnia 2004. Podobnie jak sieciFreenet, GNUnet czy MUTE, Tor może być wykorzystywany w celu ominięcia mechanizmów filtrowania treści, cenzury i innych ograniczeń komunikacyjnych.

TEXT.English: LL Blackwater Draw
TEXT.French: Site de Blackwater Draw

TEXT.English: Blackwater Draw, a 140 km dry stream channel, is today an important archaeological site. Evidence of "fluted" points, Clovis points and other stone and bone weapons, tools, and processing implements have been found there. These artifacts are in association with the remains of extinct Late Pleistocene megafauna, including Columbian mammoth, camel, horse, bison, sabertooth cat, sloths, and dire wolf, a good indication that these animals were hunted by the early peoples who visited the site. Generations of some of the earliest New World inhabitants lived at Blackwater Draw which created a layer of human settlement debris from those like Clovis, Folsom, Portales, and Archaic period occupants. The furthest back would be the Clovis culture with radiocarbon dating between 11,600-11,000 years before the present. Blackwater Draw is among the first places these points were found and provides some of the best dated examples.
TEXT.French: Blackwater Draw, a 140 km dry stream channel, is today an important archaeological site. Evidence of "fluted" points, Clovis points and other stone and bone weapons, tools, and processing implements have been found there. These artifacts are in association with the remains of extinct Late Pleistocene megafauna, including Columbian mammoth, camel, horse, bison, sabertooth cat, sloths, and dire wolf, a good indication that these animals were hunted by the early peoples who visited the site. Generations of some of the earliest New World inhabitants lived at Blackwater Draw which created a layer of human settlement debris from those like Clovis, Folsom, Portales, and Archaic period occupants. The furthest back would be the Clovis culture with radiocarbon dating between 11,600-11,000 years before the present. Blackwater Draw is among the first places these points were found and provides some of the best dated examples.

TEXT.English: Factory (Blender)

A blender (liquidiser in British English) is a kitchen and laboratory appliance used to mix, puree, or emulsify food and other substances. A stationary blender consists of a blender jar with blade at the bottom, rotated by a motor in the base. The newer immersion blender configuration has a motor on top connected by a shaft to a blade at the bottom, which can be used with any container.

A stationary blender consists of a blender jar with blade at the bottom, rotated by a motor in the base. The newer immersion blender configuration has a motor on top connected by a shaft to a blade at the bottom, which can be used with any container.

TEXT.English: Blogs

A blog (a contraction of the words web log) is a discussion or informational site published on the World Wide Web and consisting of discrete entries ("posts") typically displayed in reverse chronological order (the most recent post appears first). Until 2009 blogs were usually the work of a single individual, occasionally of a small group, and often covered a single subject. More recently "multi-author blogs" (MABs) have developed, with posts written by large numbers of authors and professionally edited. MABs from newspapers, other media outlets, universities, think tanks, interest groups and similar institutions account for an increasing quantity of blog traffic. The rise of Twitter and other "microblogging" systems helps integrate MABs and single-author blogs into societal newstreams. Blog can also be used as a verb, meaning to maintain or add content to a blog.
TEXT.French: A blog (a contraction of the words web log) is a discussion or informational site published on the World Wide Web and consisting of discrete entries ("posts") typically displayed in reverse chronological order (the most recent post appears first). Until 2009 blogs were usually the work of a single individual, occasionally of a small group, and often covered a single subject.
