TEXT.English: Factory (Calculators)

An electronic calculator is a small, portable, often inexpensive electronic device used to perform both basic and complex operations of arithmetic. The first solid state electronic calculator was created in the 1960s, building on the extensive history of tools such as the abacus, developed around 2000 BC, and the mechanical calculator, developed in the 17th century. It was developed in parallel with the analog computers of the day. Pocket sized devices became available in the 1970s, especially after the invention of the microprocessor developed by Intel for the Japanese calculator company Busicom.
TEXT.French: An electronic calculator is a small, portable, often inexpensive electronic device used to perform both basic and complex operations of arithmetic. The first solid state electronic calculator was created in the 1960s, building on the extensive history of tools such as the abacus, developed around 2000 BC, and the mechanical calculator, developed in the 17th century. It was developed in parallel with the analog computers of the day. Pocket sized devices became available in the 1970s, especially after the invention of the microprocessor developed by Intel for the Japanese calculator company Busicom.
TEXT.Polish: Kalkulator - niewielkich rozmiarów, przenośne (najczęściej kieszonkowe)elektroniczne urządzenie liczące (początkowo mechaniczne), służące do wykonywania obliczeń matematycznych. Dawniej zdolne do wykonywania jedynie podstawowych operacji arytmetycznych. Obecnie bardziej zaawansowane urządzenia umożliwiają pisanie programów, wykonywanie operacji algebraicznych, na funkcjach matematycznych oraz graficzną prezentację wykresów funkcji - a tym samym coraz bardziej upodobniają się do komputerów. Kalkulator jednak różni się od komputera okrojonymi możliwościami i interfejsem zoptymalizowanym pod kątem obliczeń interaktywnych, a nie programowania.

TEXT.English: Build a Calculator Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de calculateurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Calculator Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Catcher (Canary)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur de canari

TEXT.English: The quintessential pet bird, the canary has enjoyed steady popularity for more than a century. Its beautiful song and color and its charming nature have endeared it to many bird enthusiasts. All canaries originate from the same species, but there are three types, or breeds, popular in the United States: color-bred canaries, type canaries and song canaries. Their behavior is active, jaunty, alert, happy, The health concerns are where do you place their cage, it should NOT be in front of a window, at least 3 feet (0.91 m) away with indirect sun light, due to drafts which is the biggest killer of our little friends.
TEXT.French: The quintessential pet bird, the canary has enjoyed steady popularity for more than a century. Its beautiful song and color and its charming nature have endeared it to many bird enthusiasts. All canaries originate from the same species, but there are three types, or breeds, popular in the United States: color-bred canaries, type canaries and song canaries. Their behavior is active, jaunty, alert, happy, The health concerns are where do you place their cage, it should NOT be in front of a window, at least 3 feet (0.91 m) away with indirect sun light, due to drafts which is the biggest killer of our little friends.
TEXT.Polish: Kanarek (Serinus canaria) - niewielki gatunek ptaka z rodziny łuszczaków(Fringillidae). Dorosłe osobniki osiągają długość ciała od 12,5 cm do 13,5 cm. Występuje w rzadkich, gęsto zakrzewionych lasach Wysp Azorskich,Kanaryjskich i Madery. Nazwa kanarek pochodzi od Wysp Kanaryjskich.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Canary Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Wheat[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Cure for Cancer
TEXT.French: Centre contre le Cancer
TEXT.Italian: Cura contro il cancro

TEXT.English: Despite the huge outlays of cash for research and study, cancer still looms as a terrifying and deadly plague on the human race. Although scientists and doctors have discovered many different forms of cancer, and have identified some of the factors that can trigger the disease, a true cure still eludes modern science. A cure for cancer would put an end to the source of much suffering and anguish, and would allow millions of people who would otherwise be doomed to lead happy and productive lives.
TEXT.French: Despite the huge outlays of cash for research and study, cancer still looms as a terrifying and deadly plague on the human race. Although scientists and doctors have discovered many different forms of cancer, and have identified some of the factors that can trigger the disease, a true cure still eludes modern science. A cure for cancer would put an end to the source of much suffering and anguish, and would allow millions of people who would otherwise be doomed to lead happy and productive lives.
TEXT.Polish: Komórki nowotworów złośliwych nie trzymają się miejsca, w którym powstały. Potrafią oderwać się od rosnącego guza, dotrzeć do naczyń krwionośnych i zawędrować wraz z krwią lub chłonką w odległe miejsce organizmu, gdzie dają początek nowemu guzowi. W przypadku choroby nowotworowej powstanie nowych guzów, tzw. przerzutów, może doprowadzić do śmierci. Daje częste wznowy. Charakteryzuje się szybkim wzrostem, atypią i brakiem torebki, czym różni się od nowotworu niezłośliwego.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cure for Cancer[COLOR_REVERT] provides health and happiness bonuses to all your cities.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cure for Cancer[COLOR_REVERT] provides health and happiness bonuses to all your cities.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cura contra el cáncer[COLOR_REVERT] proporciona bonificaciones a la salud y a la felicidad en todas tus ciudades.

TEXT.English: Factory (Candles)
A candle is a solid block of wax with an embedded wick which is ignited to provide light, and sometimes heat, and historically was used as a method of keeping time.
TEXT.French: A candle is a solid block of wax with an embedded wick which is ignited to provide light, and sometimes heat, and historically was used as a method of keeping time.
TEXT.Polish: Świeca - źródło światła, zazwyczaj wykonane z paliwa stałegouformowanego w walec, wewnątrz którego, przez całą długość, umieszczony jest knot. Dawniej świece wykonywane były głównie z wosku pszczelego, przez co w tej formie były dostępne dla wyższych sfer. Biedniejsi używali źródeł oświetlenia wykonanych z tańszego tłuszczu zwierzęcego. Obecnie świece najczęściej produkowane są z parafiny lubstearyny.

TEXT.English: Build to increase [ICON_GOLD].
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Candlemaker's Shop
TEXT.Italian: Negozio di candele

TEXT.English: Candle making was developed independently in many countries throughout history. The Egyptians produced candles out of beeswax as early as 3000 BC. The Chinese made candles from whale fat during the Qin Dynasty (221-206 BC). In early China and Japan, tapers were made with wax from insects and seeds, wrapped in paper. In India, wax from boiling cinnamon was used for temple candles. During the first century AD, indigenous people of the Pacific Northwest fused oil from the eulachon, or "candlefish", for illumination. Excavations at Pompeii, Italy, revealed several candelabra.
TEXT.French: Candle making was developed independently in many countries throughout history. The Egyptians produced candles out of beeswax as early as 3000 BC. The Chinese made candles from whale fat during the Qin Dynasty (221-206 BC). In early China and Japan, tapers were made with wax from insects and seeds, wrapped in paper. In India, wax from boiling cinnamon was used for temple candles. During the first century AD, indigenous people of the Pacific Northwest fused oil from the eulachon, or "candlefish", for illumination. Excavations at Pompeii, Italy, revealed several candelabra.

TEXT.English: The ability to work at night allows extra Commerce and Production.
TEXT.French: La possibilité de travailler la nuit permet un bonus en commerce et en production.
TEXT.Spanish: La posibilidad de trabajar durante la noche aporta una bonificación al comercio y a la producción.
TEXT.Polish: Zdolność do pracy w nocy umożliwia dodatkowe złoto i produkcje.

TEXT.English: Cannery
TEXT.Italian: Conservificio

TEXT.English: Canning is a method of preserving food in which the food contents are processed and sealed in an airtight container. Canning provides a typical shelf life ranging from one to five years, although under specific circumstances a freeze-dried canned product can last as long as 30 years in an edible state. The process was first developed as a French military discovery by Nicolas Appert in 1810. The packaging prevents microorganisms from entering and proliferating inside. [PARAGRAPH:2]To prevent the food from being spoiled before and during containment, a number of methods are used: pasteurisation, boiling (and other applications of high temperature over a period of time), refrigeration, freezing, drying, vacuum treatment, antimicrobial agents that are natural to the recipe of the foods being preserved, a sufficient dose of ionizing radiation, submersion in a strong saline solution, acid, base, osmotically extreme (for example very sugary) or other microbe-challenging environments.
TEXT.French: Canning is a method of preserving food in which the food contents are processed and sealed in an airtight container. Canning provides a typical shelf life ranging from one to five years, although under specific circumstances a freeze-dried canned product can last as long as 30 years in an edible state. The process was first developed as a French military discovery by Nicolas Appert in 1810. The packaging prevents microorganisms from entering and proliferating inside. [PARAGRAPH:2]To prevent the food from being spoiled before and during containment, a number of methods are used: pasteurisation, boiling (and other applications of high temperature over a period of time), refrigeration, freezing, drying, vacuum treatment, antimicrobial agents that are natural to the recipe of the foods being preserved, a sufficient dose of ionizing radiation, submersion in a strong saline solution, acid, base, osmotically extreme (for example very sugary) or other microbe-challenging environments.

TEXT.English: Cannon Turret
TEXT.Italian: Torretta con cannoni

TEXT.English: Castles and forts were built with turrets, or small towers, to provide covering fire from archers or siege weapons. With the advent of gunpowder, these turrets could also be used to support cannon.
TEXT.French: Castles and forts were built with turrets, or small towers, to provide covering fire from archers or siege weapons. With the advent of gunpowder, these turrets could also be used to support cannon.
TEXT.Italian: Castelli e forti venivano costruiti con torrette per fornire copertura dagli arcieri e dalle armi da assedio. Con l'avvento della polvere da sparo, queste torrette venivano usate per piazzare dei cannoni.
TEXT.Polish: Wieża - konstrukcja o wymiarach poprzecznych znacznie mniejszych od wysokości, pracująca jako wspornik utwierdzony w fundamencie, obciążony działaniem wiatru w kierunku poziomym oraz obciążeniem grawitacyjnym. Wieże miały różne funkcje, szczególnie popularne były w architekturze średniowiecznej, przede wszystkim jako wieże obronne i kościelne - zarówno wolno stojące (kampanile, dzwonnice), jak i stanowiące część budynku kościoła. W średniowiecznym zamku występowała tzw. wieża ostatniej obrony (donżon).

W innym ujęciu może także oznaczać zarządzanie jakimikolwiek sprawami, własnymi (np. gospodarstwem domowym) lub cudzymi (np. czyimś przedsiębiorstwem).

TEXT.English: Capitol Records Tower
TEXT.French: La Tour de 'Capitol Records'

TEXT.English: The Capitol Records Tower, is a Hollywood Boulevard Commercial and Entertainment District building that is located in Hollywood, Los Angeles. The building is a thirteen-story tower that was designed by Welton Becket and is one of the city's landmarks. Construction occurred soon after British company EMI acquired Capitol Records in 1955 and the building was completed in April 1956. Located just north of the Hollywood and Vine intersection, the Capitol Records Tower houses the consolidation of Capitol Records' West Coast operations, and is also home to the recording studios and echo chambers of Capitol Studios. The building is included on the List of Registered Historic Places in Los Angeles.
TEXT.French: The Capitol Records Tower, is a Hollywood Boulevard Commercial and Entertainment District building that is located in Hollywood, Los Angeles. The building is a thirteen-story tower that was designed by Welton Becket and is one of the city's landmarks. Construction occurred soon after British company EMI acquired Capitol Records in 1955 and the building was completed in April 1956. Located just north of the Hollywood and Vine intersection, the Capitol Records Tower houses the consolidation of Capitol Records' West Coast operations, and is also home to the recording studios and echo chambers of Capitol Studios. The building is included on the List of Registered Historic Places in Los Angeles.
TEXT.Polish: Capitol Records - amerykańska wytwórnia płytowa będąca własnością EMI. Capitol Records została założona przez tekściarza Johnny'ego Mercera w 1942 roku z pomocą producenta filmowego Buddy'ego DeSylva oraz biznesmena Glenna Wallichsa, właściciela Music City - największego w tamtym czasie sklepu z płytami w Los Angeles.

TEXT.English: Capture the Flag

Capture the flag, commonly abbreviated as CTF, is a traditional outdoor game where two teams each have a flag (or other marker) and the object is to capture the other team's flag, located at the team's "base", and bring it safely back to their own base. Enemy players can be "tagged" by players in their home territory; these players are then, depending on the agreed rules, out of the game, members of the opposite team, sent back to their own territory, frozen in place until freed by a member of their own team, or "in jail". (One variation of the game includes a "jail" area in addition to the flag on each team's territory.
TEXT.French: Capture the flag, commonly abbreviated as CTF, is a traditional outdoor game where two teams each have a flag (or other marker) and the object is to capture the other team's flag, located at the team's "base", and bring it safely back to their own base. Enemy players can be "tagged" by players in their home territory; these players are then, depending on the agreed rules, out of the game, members of the opposite team, sent back to their own territory, frozen in place until freed by a member of their own team, or "in jail". (One variation of the game includes a "jail" area in addition to the flag on each team's territory.
TEXT.Polish: Zdobądź flagę (ang. capture the flag, CTF) - jeden z typów gier wieloosobowych, obecnie spotykany prawie wyłącznie w grach komputerowych z gatunku first-person shooter, w rozgrywkach paintballowych, ASG i zabawachharcerskich. Gracze dzielą się na dwie (czasami więcej) drużyny (nawet po jednym zawodniku na drużynę, ale zazwyczaj jest ich więcej) i mają swoje bazy. W każdej bazie jest flaga. Drużyna zdobywa punkt wtedy, gdy zabierze flagę z bazy wroga i zaniesie ją do swojej bazy. Zazwyczaj należy donieść ją do swojej flagi, znajdującej się w wyznaczonym dla niej miejscu i nie można tego zrobić, jeśli flaga ta jest w posiadaniu przeciwnika bądź znajduje się gdzieś na planszy. Wygrywa drużyna, która zdobędzie określoną liczbę punktów lub będzie miała więcej punktów po upływie czasu przeznaczonego na rozgrywkę.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Capture the Flag[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT]. It also grants [COLOR_GREEN]Experience[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Criminal[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hunter[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Augmente le bonheur, mais aussi l'espionnage dans votre ville.

TEXT.English: Capuchin Crypt
TEXT.French: La Crypte des Capucins

TEXT.English: The Capuchin Crypt is a small space comprising several tiny chapels located beneath the church of Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini on theVia Veneto near Piazza Barberini in Rome, Italy. It contains the skeletal remainsof 3,700 bodies believed to be Capuchin friars buried by their order. The Catholicorder insists that the display is not meant to be macabre, but a silent reminder ofthe swift passage of life on Earth and our own mortality. Described by Frommer's as "one of the most horrifying images in all of Christendom", largenumbers of the bones are nailed to the walls in intricate patterns, many are piled highamong countless others, while others hang from the ceiling as light fixtures.
TEXT.French: La Crypte des Capucins is a small space comprising several tiny chapels located beneath the church of Santa Maria della Concezione dei Cappuccini on theVia Veneto near Piazza Barberini in Rome, Italy. It contains the skeletal remainsof 3,700 bodies believed to be Capuchin friars buried by their order. The Catholicorder insists that the display is not meant to be macabre, but a silent reminder ofthe swift passage of life on Earth and our own mortality.Described by Frommer's as "one of the most horrifying images in all of Christendom", largenumbers of the bones are nailed to the walls in intricate patterns, many are piled highamong countless others, while others hang from the ceiling as light fixtures.

TEXT.English: Carhenge
TEXT.French: Le Monument Carhenge

TEXT.English: Carhenge is a replica of England's Stonehenge located near the city of Alliance, Nebraska on the High Plains. Instead of being built with large standing stones, as is the case with the original Stonehenge, Carhenge is formed from vintage American automobiles, all covered with gray spray paint. Built by Jim Reinders, it was dedicated at the June 1987 summer solstice. In 2006, a visitor center was constructed to service the site.[PARAGRAPH:2]Carhenge consists of 38 automobiles arranged in a circle measuring about 29 metres (95 ft) in diameter. Some are held upright in pits 1.5 metres (4.9 ft) deep, trunk end down, and arches have been formed by welding automobiles atop the supporting models. The heelstone is a 1962 Cadillac. Three cars were buried at Carhenge. Their "gravestone" is a car that reads: "Here lie three bones of foreign cars. They served our purpose while Detroit slept. Now Detroit is awake and America's great!"[PARAGRAPH:2]Carhenge replicates Stonehenge's current "tumble-down" state, rather than the original stone circle erected between 2500 BC and 2000 BC. In addition to the Stonehenge replica, the Carhenge site includes several other sculptures created from autos covered with various colors of spray paint. If you compare the original with Carhenge you will find several errors in their placement.
TEXT.French: Carhenge is a replica of England's Stonehenge located near the city of Alliance, Nebraska on the High Plains. Instead of being built with large standing stones, as is the case with the original Stonehenge, Carhenge is formed from vintage American automobiles, all covered with gray spray paint. Built by Jim Reinders, it was dedicated at the June 1987 summer solstice. In 2006, a visitor center was constructed to service the site.[PARAGRAPH:2]Carhenge consists of 38 automobiles arranged in a circle measuring about 29 metres (95 ft) in diameter. Some are held upright in pits 1.5 metres (4.9 ft) deep, trunk end down, and arches have been formed by welding automobiles atop the supporting models. The heelstone is a 1962 Cadillac. Three cars were buried at Carhenge. Their "gravestone" is a car that reads: "Here lie three bones of foreign cars. They served our purpose while Detroit slept. Now Detroit is awake and America's great!"[PARAGRAPH:2]Carhenge replicates Stonehenge's current "tumble-down" state, rather than the original stone circle erected between 2500 BC and 2000 BC. In addition to the Stonehenge replica, the Carhenge site includes several other sculptures created from autos covered with various colors of spray paint. If you compare the original with Carhenge you will find several errors in their placement.
TEXT.Polish: Carhange jest repliką Stonehange. Tylko zamiast ogromnych głazów jest zbudowany z samochodów amerykańskich i pomalowany na szaro. Zbudowany prze Jim Reinders w czerwcu 1987.

TEXT.English: Factory (Carpets)

A carpet is a textile floor covering consisting of an upper layer of "pile" attached to a backing. The pile is generally either made from wool or a manmade fibre such as polypropylene, nylon or polyester and usually consists of twisted tufts which are often heat-treated to maintain their structure.
TEXT.French: A carpet is a textile floor covering consisting of an upper layer of "pile" attached to a backing. The pile is generally either made from wool or a manmade fibre such as polypropylene, nylon or polyester and usually consists of twisted tufts which are often heat-treated to maintain their structure.
TEXT.Polish: Dywan podłogowy - tkanina dekoracyjna przeznaczona do pokrycia pewnych płaszczyzn (najczęściej podłóg, czasem także ścian). Dywany pojawiły się prawdopodobnie w Azji Centralnej między III a II tysiącleciem p.n.e. Dywan widnieje na fladze Turkmenistanu. Słowo dywan, według językoznawcy Aleksandra Brucknera, pochodzi od tureckiego diwan (rada, biuro), a to z kolei z języka perskiego, gdzie oznacza 'trybunał'. Dywany mają różne kształty, kolory i rozmiary.

TEXT.English: Casino
TEXT.French: Casino
TEXT.Italian: Casinò

TEXT.English: The term "Casino" is of Italian origin, the root word being "Casa" (house) and originally meant a small country villa, summerhouse or pavilion. The word changed to refer to a building built for pleasure, usually on the grounds of a larger Italian villa or palazzo. Such buildings were used to host civic town functions - including dancing, music listening and gambling.[PARAGRAPH:2]The precise origin of gambling is unknown. The Chinese recorded the first official account of the practice in 2300 B.C., but it is generally believed that activity of gambling, in some way or another, has been seen in almost every society in history. From the Ancient Greeks and Romans to Napoleon's France and Elizabethan England, much of history is filled with stories of entertainment based on the games of chance. One of the first known casinos was the Casinò di Venezia, established in Venice Italy around 1638, and is still in operation.
TEXT.French: The term "Casino" is of Italian origin, the root word being "Casa" (house) and originally meant a small country villa, summerhouse or pavilion. The word changed to refer to a building built for pleasure, usually on the grounds of a larger Italian villa or palazzo. Such buildings were used to host civic town functions - including dancing, music listening and gambling.[PARAGRAPH:2]The precise origin of gambling is unknown. The Chinese recorded the first official account of the practice in 2300 B.C., but it is generally believed that activity of gambling, in some way or another, has been seen in almost every society in history. From the Ancient Greeks and Romans to Napoleon's France and Elizabethan England, much of history is filled with stories of entertainment based on the games of chance. One of the first known casinos was the Casinò di Venezia, established in Venice Italy around 1638, and is still in operation.
TEXT.Polish: Kasyno - budynek przeznaczony do legalnego uprawiania hazardu. Zwykle gra odbywa się na specjalne żetony, które grający powinien zakupić przy wejściu. Ewentualna wygrana również jest w żetonach, które przy wyjściu obsługa kasyna wymienia na pieniądze.

TEXT.English: A garden is a planned space, usually outdoors, set aside for the display, cultivation, and enjoyment of plants and other forms of nature. The garden can incorporate both natural and man-made materials.
TEXT.French: A garden is a planned space, usually outdoors, set aside for the display, cultivation, and enjoyment of plants and other forms of nature. The garden can incorporate both natural and man-made materials.
TEXT.Italian: Un giardino è uno spazio progettato, di solito all'aperto, per la mostra, coltivazione e godimento delle piante e di altre forme della natura. Il giardino può incorporare sia materiali naturali che artificiali.

TEXT.English: Use elaborate Castle Garden's to awe citizen's and create a peaceful and calming aura around your city.
TEXT.French: Use elaborate Castle Garden's to awe citizen's and create a peaceful and calming aura around your city.
TEXT.Italian: Usa elaborati giardini del castello per impressionare i tuoi cittadini e creare un'aria pacifica e calmante attorno alla tua città.
TEXT.Spanish: Usa elaborados Jardines del castillo para impresionar a los ciudadanos y crear un aura de paz y tranquilidad en torno a tu ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Użyj wyszukanego Ogrodu Zamkowego by wzbudzać respekt u obywateli i utwórz spokojną i cichą aurę dookoła twojego miasta.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castles[COLOR_REVERT] increase your city's defenses against pre-gunpowder units, increase espionage output and generate a small amount of culture. Build them in cities near enemy civilizations.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Châteaux[COLOR_REVERT] améliorent les défenses de la ville contre les unités antérieures à la poudre à canon, augmentent la production de l'espionnage et génèrent une faible quantité de culture. Construisez-les dans les villes à proximité des civilisations ennemies.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Schlösser[COLOR_REVERT] verbessern den Verteidigungswert einer Stadt gegen Einheiten ohne Schusswaffen, steigern die Spionageleistung und erzeugen etwas Kultur. Errichten Sie Schlösser in der Nähe feindlicher Zivilisationen.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]castello[COLOR_REVERT] potenzia le difese di una città contro le unità precedenti alla polvere da sparo, aumenta la resa di Spionaggio e genera una piccola quantità di cultura. Costruiscilo nelle città vicine alle civiltà nemiche.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castillos[COLOR_REVERT] aumentan las defensas de la ciudad contra unidades anteriores a las armas de pólvora, aumentan el rendimiento del espionaje y generan una pequeña cantidad de cultura. Conviene construirlos en ciudades que estén cerca de las civilizaciones enemigas.

TEXT.French: Restes d'Ours des cavernes

TEXT.English: Cave Dwelling
TEXT.Italian: Abitazioni nelle caverne

TEXT.English: Around 2 million years ago, Homo habilis is believed to have constructed the first man-made structure in East Africa, consisting of simple arrangements of stones to hold branches of trees in position. A similar stone circular arrangement believed to be around 500 thousand years old was discovered at Terra Amata, near Nice, France. Several human habitats dating back to the Stone Age have been discovered around the globe.
TEXT.French: Around 2 million years ago, Homo habilis is believed to have constructed the first man-made structure in East Africa, consisting of simple arrangements of stones to hold branches of trees in position. A similar stone circular arrangement believed to be around 500 thousand years old was discovered at Terra Amata, near Nice, France. Several human habitats dating back to the Stone Age have been discovered around the globe.
TEXT.Polish: Uważa się, że około 2 miliony lat temu, we wschodniej Afryce Homo habilis skonstruował pierwszą budowlę wykonaną przez człowieka, składającą się z prostego ułożenia kamieni, tak by utrzymać w pozycji gałęzie drzewa. Podobny, kolisty układ kamieni sprzed ok. 500 tysięcy lat został odnaleziony w Terra Amata, niedaleko Nicei we Francji. Na świecie odnaleziono również nieliczne ludzkie siedziby datowane na epokę kamienia.

TEXT.English: Protection from the environment.
TEXT.French: Protection contre les intempéries.
TEXT.Spanish: Protección frente al medio.

TEXT.English: Cave Paintings
TEXT.Italian: Pitture rupestri

TEXT.English: Cave Paintings are paintings on cave walls and ceilings, and the term is used especially for those dating to prehistoric times. The earliest known European cave paintings date to 32,000 years ago. The purpose of the cave paintings is not known. The evidence suggests that they were not merely decorations of living areas, since the caves in which they have been found do not have signs of ongoing habitation. Also, they are often in areas of caves that are not easily accessed. Some theories hold that they may have been a way of transmitting information, while other theories ascribe them a religious or ceremonial purpose.
TEXT.French: Cave Paintings are paintings on cave walls and ceilings, and the term is used especially for those dating to prehistoric times. The earliest known European cave paintings date to 32,000 years ago. The purpose of the cave paintings is not known. The evidence suggests that they were not merely decorations of living areas, since the caves in which they have been found do not have signs of ongoing habitation. Also, they are often in areas of caves that are not easily accessed. Some theories hold that they may have been a way of transmitting information, while other theories ascribe them a religious or ceremonial purpose.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jaskinia z Malowidłami[COLOR_REVERT] rysunki i malowidła wykonane na ścianach lub sklepieniach jaskiń, najczęściej w czasach prehistorycznych. Powstawały od okresu górnego paleolitu, datowanego od 40 tys. lat p.n.e. W przypadku niektórych rysunków z Zachodniej Australii użyty pierwotnie pigment z biegiem czasu został zastąpiony koloniami grzybów (z rzędu Chaetothyriales) i bakterii dzięki czemu zachowały one intensywne kolory. Malowidłom naskalnym pierwotni ludzie przypisywali nadprzyrodzone moce. Nie wiadomo dokładnie, w jakim celu powstawały na ścianach jaskiń malowidła przedstawiające konie, krowy, bizony, bawoły i jelenie, ale prawdopodobnie miały znaczenie magiczne. Wierzono, że niszcząc wizerunki wroga, można spowodować jego chorobę, a nawet śmierć. Ludzie wierzyli też, że tworząc wizerunek np. zwierzęcia przejmą nad nim kontrolę, panowanie, władzę. Obrazy naścienne nie były przeznaczone do oglądania, a bardziej oddziaływania swą mocą. Większość malowideł powstała w głębokich korytarzach i grotach, gdzie nie dochodziło światło dzienne. Prawdopodobnie pełniły one funkcję kaplic i miejsc rytuałów

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cave Paintings[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. To build it a city needs to be in the vicinity of [COLOR_CYAN]Caves[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Peintures rupestres[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'influence culturelle de votre ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye unas [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pinturas rupestres[COLOR_REVERT] para incrementar la cultura de tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jaskinie z Malowidłami[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć kulturę w miastach.

TEXT.English: Circus Circus Casino
TEXT.French: Le Casino 'Circus Circus'

TEXT.English: Circus Circus Las Vegas is a hotel and 126,000 sq ft (11,700 m2) casinolocated on the Las Vegas Strip in Winchester, Nevada. It is owned and operated by MGM Resorts International. Circus Circus features circus acts and carnival type games dailyon the Midway. Circus Circus has the only RV park on the Strip providing additional accommodations in the 399 space park operated by Kampgrounds of America (KOA).Circus Circus is the largest permanent big top in the world. The Lucky The Clown marquee at the entrance was provided by Young Electric Sign Company, and was constructed in 1976.
TEXT.French: Circus Circus Las Vegas is a hotel and 126,000 sq ft (11,700 m2) casinolocated on the Las Vegas Strip in Winchester, Nevada. It is owned and operated by MGM Resorts International. Circus Circus features circus acts and carnival type games dailyon the Midway. Circus Circus has the only RV park on the Strip providing additional accommodations in the 399 space park operated by Kampgrounds of America (KOA).Circus Circus is the largest permanent big top in the world. The Lucky The Clown marquee at the entrance was provided by Young Electric Sign Company, and was constructed in 1976.
TEXT.Polish: Circus Circus Las Vegas - hotel i kasyno, położony przy ulicy Las Vegas Strip w Las Vegas, w stanie Nevada, stanowiący własność korporacji MGM Resorts International. Charakteryzuje się cyrkowym wystrojem, spektaklami oraz rozrywkami o tej tematyce. Circus Circus jest jedynym obiektem przy Strip, który posiada park dla pojazdów kempingowych z 399 miejscami parkingowymi.

TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Cellar

A basement or cellar is one or more floors of a building that are either completely or partially below the ground floor. Basements are typically used as a utility space for a building where such items as the boiler, water heater, breaker panel or fuse box, car park, and air-conditioning system are located; so also are amenities such as the electrical distribution system, and cable television distribution point. However, in cities with high property prices such as London, basements are often fitted out to a high standard and used as living space.
TEXT.French: A basement or cellar is one or more floors of a building that are either completely or partially below the ground floor. Basements are typically used as a utility space for a building where such items as the boiler, water heater, breaker panel or fuse box, car park, and air-conditioning system are located; so also are amenities such as the electrical distribution system, and cable television distribution point. However, in cities with high property prices such as London, basements are often fitted out to a high standard and used as living space.
TEXT.Polish: Piwnica - najniższa, całkowicie lub częściowo podziemna kondygnacjabudynku. Jej funkcja zależy od typu budynku. Nazwa pochodzi od piwa, które w warunkach piwnicznych było przechowywane - było zimne i nie psuło się zbyt szybko.

TEXT.English: Build a Cellar to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sous-sol aménageable[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cellar by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Factory (Cellphones)

A mobile phone (also known as a cellular phone, cell phone, and a hand phone) is a device that can make and receive telephone calls over a radio link while moving around a wide geographic area. It does so by connecting to a cellular network provided by a mobile phone operator, allowing access to the public telephone network. By contrast, a cordless telephone is used only within the short range of a single, private base station. In addition to telephony, modern mobile phones also support a wide variety of other services such as text messaging, MMS, email, Internet access, short-range wireless communications (infrared, Bluetooth), business applications, gaming and photography. Mobile phones that offer these and more general computing capabilities are referred to as smartphones.
TEXT.French: A mobile phone (also known as a cellular phone, cell phone, and a hand phone) is a device that can make and receive telephone calls over a radio link while moving around a wide geographic area. It does so by connecting to a cellular network provided by a mobile phone operator, allowing access to the public telephone network. By contrast, a cordless telephone is used only within the short range of a single, private base station. In addition to telephony, modern mobile phones also support a wide variety of other services such as text messaging, MMS, email, Internet access, short-range wireless communications (infrared, Bluetooth), business applications, gaming and photography. Mobile phones that offer these and more general computing capabilities are referred to as smartphones.

TEXT.English: Factory (Cellulase Capsules)

Humans do not be able to decay cellulase, a poly-sugar widespread in plants. Bacteria can be manipulated to produce huge amount of cellulase, an enzyme that catalyse the reaction from cellulase to glucose. These cellulasecapsules allow humans to completely digest even grass or leaves, greatly reducing world hunger.
TEXT.French: Humans do not be able to decay cellulase, a poly-sugar widespread in plants. Bacteria can be manipulated to produce huge amount of cellulase, an enzyme that catalyse the reaction from cellulase to glucose. These cellulasecapsules allow humans to completely digest even grass or leaves, greatly reducing world hunger.

TEXT.English: Cement Mill
TEXT.Italian: Cementeria

TEXT.English: A cement mill (or finish mill in North American usage) is the equipment used to grind the hard, nodular clinker from the cement kiln into the fine grey powder that is cement. Most cement is currently ground in ball mills.[PARAGRAPH:2]Early hydraulic cements, such as those of James Parker, James Frost and Joseph Aspdin were relatively soft and readily ground by the primitive technology of the day, using flat millstones. The emergence of Portland cement in the 1840s made grinding considerably more difficult, because the clinker produced by the kiln is often as hard as the millstone material. Because of this, cement continued to be ground very coarsely (typically 20% over 100 µm particle diameter) until better grinding technology became available. Besides producing unreactive cement with slow strength growth, this exacerbated the problem of unsoundness. This late, disruptive expansion is caused by hydration of large particles of calcium oxide. Fine grinding lessens this effect, and early cements had to be stored for several months to give the calcium oxide time to hydrate before it was fit for sale. From 1885 onward, the development of specialized steel led to the development of new forms of grinding equipment, and from this point onward, the typical fineness of cement began a steady rise. The progressive reduction in the proportion of larger, unreactive cement particles has been partially responsible for the fourfold increase in the strength of Portland cement during the twentieth century. The recent history of the technology has been mainly concerned with reducing the energy consumption of the grinding process.
TEXT.French: A cement mill (or finish mill in North American usage) is the equipment used to grind the hard, nodular clinker from the cement kiln into the fine grey powder that is cement. Most cement is currently ground in ball mills.[PARAGRAPH:2]Early hydraulic cements, such as those of James Parker, James Frost and Joseph Aspdin were relatively soft and readily ground by the primitive technology of the day, using flat millstones. The emergence of Portland cement in the 1840s made grinding considerably more difficult, because the clinker produced by the kiln is often as hard as the millstone material. Because of this, cement continued to be ground very coarsely (typically 20% over 100 µm particle diameter) until better grinding technology became available. Besides producing unreactive cement with slow strength growth, this exacerbated the problem of unsoundness. This late, disruptive expansion is caused by hydration of large particles of calcium oxide. Fine grinding lessens this effect, and early cements had to be stored for several months to give the calcium oxide time to hydrate before it was fit for sale. From 1885 onward, the development of specialized steel led to the development of new forms of grinding equipment, and from this point onward, the typical fineness of cement began a steady rise. The progressive reduction in the proportion of larger, unreactive cement particles has been partially responsible for the fourfold increase in the strength of Portland cement during the twentieth century. The recent history of the technology has been mainly concerned with reducing the energy consumption of the grinding process.
TEXT.Polish: Cement - to hydrauliczne spoiwo mineralne, otrzymywane z surowców mineralnych (margiel lub wapień i glina) wypalonych na klinkier w piecu cementowym a następnie zmielenie otrzymanego spieku z gipsem, spełniającym rolę regulatora czasu wiązania. Stosowany jest do przygotowywania zapraw cementowych, cementowo-wapiennych i betonów. Wykorzystywany jest do łączenia materiałów budowlanych.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Cement Mill produces Cement which is required for construction of other building types.
TEXT.French: Une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cimenterie[COLOR_REVERT] produit du [COLOR_GREEN]Ciment[COLOR_REVERT], qui est requis pour la construction d'un grand nombre de bâtiments.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]La Molienda de cemento produce Cemento, que se requiere para la construcción de otros edificios.

TEXT.English: Centers for Disease Control

Spanish.Text: Centro de Control de Enfermedades:Centros de Control de Enfermedades

TEXT.English: The Centers for Disease Control (or "CDC") are a group of linked government-supported facilities located in Atlanta, Georgia. The CDC is mandated to coordinate national anti-disease efforts, to develop and apply disease prevention techniques, to increase national awareness of disease, as well as to fund external research on disease prevention and control. [PARAGRAPH:1]Born in 1946, for most of its early history the CDC worked exclusively on naturally-created diseases such as typhus, malaria, influenza and the plague. However, as the twenty-first century has advanced, an ever-greater portion of its funding is being spent on countering man-made diseases. As population densities increase, citizens are at higher risk from so-called "designer plagues" deployed by terrorists or enemy missiles. A rapid response to such an attack may be all that saves a city from total annihilation.
TEXT.French: Les Centres de Contrôle et de Prévention des Maladies (ou CCPM) sont un ensemble d'installations financées par l'Etat et situées à Atlanta, en Géorgie. Les CCPM sont chargés de coordonner la recherche médicale au niveau national, de développer de nouvelles techniques de prévention, d'informer le grand public et de financer certains projets de recherche externes. [PARAGRAPH:1]Depuis leur fondation en 1946, les CCPM se sont surtout intéressés aux maladies naturelles telles que le typhus, la malaria, la grippe ou la peste. Mais depuis le vingt-deuxième siècle, une partie plus importante des recherches est consacrée aux maladies crées par l'homme. A mesure que la densité de population croît dans les grandes villes, les citoyens deviennent des cibles idéales pour les "pestes artificielles" déployées par les organisations terroristes ou les missiles ennemis. En cas d'attaque, seule l'existence d'antidotes pourrait sauver une ville entière de la destruction.
TEXT.German: Die Centers for Disease Control (kurz "CDC") sind eine mit dem Bundesgesundheitsamt vergleichbare staatliche Behörde der Vereinigten Staaten mit Sitz in Atlanta, Georgia. Zu den Hauptaufgaben der CDC gehören die Koordination des nationalen Seuchenschutzes, die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Methoden zur Seuchenprävention, medizinische Aufklärungsarbeit sowie die Finanzierung externer Forschungsprojekte für Krankheitsprävention und -bekämpfung. [PARAGRAPH:1]Im Jahr 1946 gegründet, konzentrierten sich die CDC zu Beginn ausschließlich auf die Bekämpfung von Krankheiten mit natürlichen Ursachen, wie Typhus, Malaria, Influenza und die Pest. Seit dem 21. Jahrhundert richtete sich ihr Augenmerk dann zunehmend auch auf die Bekämpfung von Krankheiten, die von Menschenhand verursacht wurden. Wegen steigender Bevölkerungsdichten sind die Bürger mittlerweile einem erhöhten Risiko ausgesetzt, einer so genannten "Designerkrankheit" zum Opfer zu fallen, die von Terroristen oder feindlichen Raketen ausgeht. Eine schnelle Reaktion auf einen solchen Angriff könnte ausschlaggebend dafür sein, dass eine Stadt vor der vollständigen Eliminierung bewahrt wird.
TEXT.Italian: Il Centro Controllo Malattie (Centers for Disease Control o CDC) è un gruppo di impianti che si trova ad Atlanta, Georgia, ed è stato realizzato col supporto del governo. Il compito del CDC è quello di coordinare i programmi nazionali anti malattia, di sviluppare e applicare tecniche di prevenzione delle malattie, di aumentare la consapevolezza nazionale sulle malattie e di finanziare ricerche esterne sulla prevenzione e sul controllo delle malattie. [PARAGRAPH:1]Sorto nel 1946, per la maggior parte della sua storia iniziale il CDC ha lavorato esclusivamente su malattie naturali come tifo, malaria, influenza e la peste. Con l'avanzare del ventunesimo secolo, però, una parte sempre più grande dei finanziamenti viene spesa per contrastare malattie create dall'uomo. Con l'incremento della densità degli abitanti, i cittadini sono più a rischio di contrarre "malattie progettate", diffuse da terroristi o da missili nemici. Una rapida reazione a questo tipo di attacco può essere l'unica speranza di salvare una città dallo stermini
TEXT.Spanish: El Centro de Control de Enfermedades (o "CCE") es un grupo de instalaciones intercomunicadas y financiadas por el gobierno que se encuentran en Atlanta, Georgia. El CCE tiene la orden de coordinar los esfuerzos contra enfermedades a escala nacional, de desarrollar técnicas preventivas, de incrementar la concienciación nacional sobre las enfermedades, así como de financiar la investigación externa sobre la prevención y el control de las mismas. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nacido en 1946, en sus orígenes el CCE trabajaba exclusivamente en enfermedades de origen natural, como el tifus, la malaria, la gripe o la peste. Sin embargo, a medida que ha avanzado el s. XXI, una porción cada vez mayor de sus fondos se está destinando a hacer frente a enfermedades creadas por el ser humano. A medida que crece la densidad de población, los ciudadanos están cada vez más expuestos a las llamadas "enfermedades de diseño", propagadas por los terroristas o misiles enemigos. Una respuesta rápida a un ataque de esta naturaleza puede salvar a una ciudad del exterminio tota
TEXT.Polish: Centrum Chorób Zakaźnych (CDC) to grupa połączonych ze sobą specjalistycznych zakładów znajdujących się w mieście Atlanta w USA. Organizacja ta została powołana w 1946 roku w celu koordynacji narodowych przedsięwzięć przeciwzakaźnych celem zwiększenia świadomości o niebezpiecznych chorobach oraz finansowania badań nad prewencją i kontrolą chorób zakaźnych. Początkowo zajmowała się chorobami naturalnymi takimi jak dur, malaria czy grypa. Obecnie często zajmuje się jednak głównie przeciwdziałaniem chorób wywołanych przez człowieka.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centers for Disease Control[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Heals[COLOR_REVERT] all units in the city an extra 25%/turn. It increases [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] in ALL cities by +2, and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] by +1. Two [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Citizens[COLOR_REVERT] can be turned into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scientists,[COLOR_REVERT] and the city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centers for Disease Control[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Heals[COLOR_REVERT] all units in the city an extra 25%/turn. It increases [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] in ALL cities by +2, and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] by +1. TEXT.Spanish: La maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centro de Control de Enfermedades[COLOR_REVERT] [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]curará[COLOR_REVERT] a todas las unidades presentes de la ciudad un 25% adicional por turno. Aumenta la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Salud[COLOR_REVERT] de todas las ciudades en +2, y la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Felicidad[COLOR_REVERT] en +1. TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrum Chorób Zakaźnych[COLOR_REVERT] [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]leczy[COLOR_REVERT] wszystkie jednostki w mieście o dodatkowe 25%/turę. Zwiększa [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zdrowie[COLOR_REVERT] we wszystkich miastach o 2 oraz[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Szczęście o[COLOR_REVERT] o 1. Dwóch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mieszkańców[COLOR_REVERT] może zostać przekształconych na [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Naukowców[COLOR_REVERT], miasto ma też większą szansę na wygenerowanie [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wielkiego Naukowca[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Centipede Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de centipèdes

TEXT.English: Also known as sowbugs, roly-polies, woodlice, these are actually terrestrial crustaceans, closely related to lobsters, crab and shrimp. When boiled, they are said to turn red.
TEXT.French: Also known as sowbugs, roly-polies, woodlice, these are actually terrestrial crustaceans, closely related to lobsters, crab and shrimp. When boiled, they are said to turn red.

TEXT.English: Central Bank
TEXT.Italian: Banca centrale

TEXT.English: A central bank, reserve bank, or monetary authority is the entity responsible for the monetary policy of a country or of a group of member states. It is a bank that can lend money to other banks in times of need. Its primary responsibility is to maintain the stability of the national currency and money supply, but more active duties include controlling subsidized-loan interest rates, and acting as a lender of last resort to the banking sector during times of financial crisis (private banks often being integral to the national financial system). It may also have supervisory powers, to ensure that banks and other financial institutions do not behave recklessly or fraudulently.[PARAGRAPH:2]Most richer countries today have an "independent" central bank, that is, one which operates under rules designed to prevent political interference. Examples include the European Central Bank (ECB) and the Federal Reserve System in the United States. Some central banks are publicly owned, and others are privately owned. For example, the United States Federal Reserve is a quasi-public corporation.
TEXT.French: A central bank, reserve bank, or monetary authority is the entity responsible for the monetary policy of a country or of a group of member states. It is a bank that can lend money to other banks in times of need. Its primary responsibility is to maintain the stability of the national currency and money supply, but more active duties include controlling subsidized-loan interest rates, and acting as a lender of last resort to the banking sector during times of financial crisis (private banks often being integral to the national financial system). It may also have supervisory powers, to ensure that banks and other financial institutions do not behave recklessly or fraudulently.[PARAGRAPH:2]Most richer countries today have an "independent" central bank, that is, one which operates under rules designed to prevent political interference. Examples include the European Central Bank (ECB) and the Federal Reserve System in the United States. Some central banks are publicly owned, and others are privately owned. For example, the United States Federal Reserve is a quasi-public corporation.
TEXT.Polish: Bank centralny - instytucja odpowiedzialna za funkcjonowanie systemu bankowego. Zazwyczaj działa jako jednostka państwowa, bądź podporządkowana państwu. W Polsce funkcję banku centralnego pełni Narodowy Bank Polski.

TEXT.English: CERN Accelerator
TEXT.French: L'Accélérateur de particules du CERN

TEXT.English: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is the world's largest and highest-energy particle accelerator, and considered "one of the great engineering milestones of mankind". It was built by the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) from 1998 to 2008, with the aim of allowing physicists to test the predictions of different theories of particle physics and high-energyphysics, and particularly prove or disprove the existence of the theorized Higgs boson and of the large family of new particles predicted by supersymmetric theories. The LHC is expected to address some of the still unsolved questions of physics, advancing human understanding of physical laws. It contains six detectors each designed for specific kinds of exploration.
TEXT.French: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is the world's largest and highest-energy particle accelerator, and considered "one of the great engineering milestones of mankind". It was built by the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) from 1998 to 2008, with the aim of allowing physicists to test the predictions of different theories of particle physics and high-energyphysics, and particularly prove or disprove the existence of the theorized Higgs boson and of the large family of new particles predicted by supersymmetric theories. The LHC is expected to address some of the still unsolved questions of physics, advancing human understanding of physical laws. It contains six detectors each designed for specific kinds of exploration.
TEXT.Polish: LEP (z ang. Large Electron Positron Collider, Wielki Zderzacz Elektronowo-Pozytonowy) - akcelerator pracujący wCERN pod Genewą w latach 1989-2000. Znajdował się on w tunelu o obwodzie 27 km. Akcelerator po wybudowaniu w 1989 roku potrafił rozpędzić elektrony do energii 45 GeV, a pod koniec swojego działania do 104,6 GeV.

TEXT.English: CGI Animation Studio

Computer animation or CGI animation is the process used for generating animated images by using computer graphics. The more general term computer-generated imagery encompasses both static scenes and dynamic images, while computer animation only refers to moving images. Modern computer animation usually uses 3D computer graphics, although 2D computer graphics are still used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time renderings. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.
TEXT.French: Computer animation or CGI animation is the process used for generating animated images by using computer graphics. The more general term computer-generated imagery encompasses both static scenes and dynamic images, while computer animation only refers to moving images. Modern computer animation usually uses 3D computer graphics, although 2D computer graphics are still used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time renderings. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.
TEXT.Polish: Animacja komputerowa - sztuka tworzenia ruchomych obiektów z wykorzystaniem komputerów. Jest poddziedziną grafiki komputerowej i animacji. W coraz większym zakresie jest ona realizowana jako animacja 3D (trójwymiarowa), choć w zastosowaniach dysponujących niską przepustowością sprzętową i wymagających przetwarzania obrazów w czasie rzeczywistym cały czas ważną pozycję utrzymuje animacja 2D (dwuwymiarowa, płaska). Czasami docelowym medium animacji jest sam system komputerowy, ale zdarza się, ze animacja przeznaczona jest dla innych mediów, takich jak film. Animację komputerową czasami określa się skrótem CGI (od ang. Computer Generated Imagery, lubComputer Generated Imaging) - szczególnie w zastosowaniach kinematograficznych.

TEXT.English: Changdeokgung
TEXT.French: Le Palais Changdeokgung

TEXT.English: Changdeokgung, also known as Changdeokgung Palace or Changdeok Palace, is set within a large park in Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea. It is one of the "Five Grand Palaces" built by the kings of the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1897). As it is locatedeast of Gyeongbok Palace, Changdeokgung, along with Changgyeonggung, is also referred to as the "East Palace" (Donggwol). Changdeokgung was the most favored palace of many Joseon princes and retained many elements dating from the Three Kingdoms of Korea period that were not incorporated in the more contemporaryGyeongbokgung. One such element is the fact that the buildings of Changdeokgung blend with the natural topography of the site instead of imposing themselves upon it. It, like the other FiveGrand Palaces in Seoul, was heavily damaged during the Japanese occupation of Korea (1910-1945). Currently, only about 30% of the pre-Japanese structures survive.
TEXT.French: Changdeokgung, also known as Changdeokgung Palace or Changdeok Palace, is set within a large park in Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea. It is one of the "Five Grand Palaces" built by the kings of the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1897). As it is locatedeast of Gyeongbok Palace, Changdeokgung, along with Changgyeonggung, is also referred to as the "East Palace" (Donggwol). Changdeokgung was the most favored palace of many Joseon princes and retained many elements dating from the Three Kingdoms of Korea period that were not incorporated in the more contemporaryGyeongbokgung. One such element is the fact that the buildings of Changdeokgung blend with the natural topography of the site instead of imposing themselves upon it. It, like the other FiveGrand Palaces in Seoul, was heavily damaged during the Japanese occupation of Korea (1910-1945). Currently, only about 30% of the pre-Japanese structures survive.
TEXT.Polish: Changdeokgung - pałac w Seulu z czasów dynastii Joseon.

TEXT.English: PC Charlie Lake Cave
TEXT.French: Caverne du Lac Charlie

TEXT.English: Charlie Lake Cave is located in the Peace River area in northeastern British Columbia. The site contains evidence of a series of temporary occupations, spanning the last 11,000 years. The lowest (earliest) level of the site contained several stone artifacts, including a fluted point, six retouched flakes and a small stone bead. This level has been dated to 10,770 years BP. Associated animal remainsincluded bison, snowshoe hare, large hare, ground squirrel and fish. The bison bones exhibited cut marks that researchers believe were created by humans using stone tools. Charlie Lake Cave is the only archaeological site inCanada in which fluted point tools and associated animal remains have been found in an undisturbed context. Charlie Lake Cave is situated right in the middle of the ice-free corridor region. However, evidence from the site suggests that people may not have moved from north to south down the corridor, but instead may have moved fromsouth to north, following herds of bison. This is suggested from DNA analysis of the bison remains, which indicates that some bison found at Charlie Lake originated in the southern regions of the North American continent. In addition, the fluted point found at Charlie Lake Cave is similar to points found at the Indian Creek and Mill Iron sites in Montana. These sites were occupied before Charlie Lake Cave, which suggests that perhaps the tooltechnology was developed in the south, and brought to Charlie Lake Cave at a later time when the tool makers and their descendants moved north.
TEXT.French: Charlie Lake Cave is located in the Peace River area in northeastern British Columbia. The site contains evidence of a series of temporary occupations, spanning the last 11,000 years. The lowest (earliest) level of the site contained several stone artifacts, including a fluted point, six retouched flakes and a small stone bead. This level has been dated to 10,770 years BP. Associated animal remainsincluded bison, snowshoe hare, large hare, ground squirrel and fish. The bison bones exhibited cut marks that researchers believe were created by humans using stone tools. Charlie Lake Cave is the only archaeological site inCanada in which fluted point tools and associated animal remains have been found in an undisturbed context. Charlie Lake Cave is situated right in the middle of the ice-free corridor region. However, evidence from the site suggests that people may not have moved from north to south down the corridor, but instead may have moved fromsouth to north, following herds of bison. This is suggested from DNA analysis of the bison remains, which indicates that some bison found at Charlie Lake originated in the southern regions of the North American continent. In addition, the fluted point found at Charlie Lake Cave is similar to points found at the Indian Creek and Mill Iron sites in Montana. These sites were occupied before Charlie Lake Cave, which suggests that perhaps the tooltechnology was developed in the south, and brought to Charlie Lake Cave at a later time when the tool makers and their descendants moved north.
TEXT.Polish: Jaskinia w pólnocno-wschodniej częśći Brytyjskiej Kolumbii w której odnaleziono ślady bytności człowieka sprzed 10 500 lat p.n.e.

TEXT.English: Checkpoint

Civilian checkpoints are distinguishable from border or frontier checkpoints in that they are erected and enforced within contiguous areas under military or paramilitary control. Civilian checkpoints have been employed within conflict-ridden areas all over the world to monitor and control the movement of people and materials in order to prevent violence.
TEXT.French: Civilian checkpoints are distinguishable from border or frontier checkpoints in that they are erected and enforced within contiguous areas under military or paramilitary control. Civilian checkpoints have been employed within conflict-ridden areas all over the world to monitor and control the movement of people and materials in order to prevent violence.
TEXT.Polish: Posterunek - ustalone na drodze umów międzypaństwowych miejsce na granicy pomiędzy państwamisłużące do jej przekraczania zarówno przez podróżnych, jak i pojazdy.

TEXT.English: Espionage, defense, and more experienced gunpowder units. This building requires Fascist civic.

TEXT.English: Chemical Plant
TEXT.Italian: Impianto chimico

TEXT.English: A chemical plant is an industrial process plant that manufactures (or otherwise processes) chemicals, usually on a large scale. The general objective of a chemical plant is to create new material wealth via the chemical or biological transformation and or separation of materials. Chemical plants use special equipment, units, and technology in the processes. Other kinds of plants, such as polymer, pharmaceutical, food, and some beverage production facilities, power plants, oil refineries or other refineries, natural gas processing and biochemical plants, water and wastewater treatment, and pollution control equipment use many technologies which have similarities to chemical plant technology such as fluid systems. Some would consider an oil refinery or a pharmaceutical or polymer manufacturer to be effectively a chemical plant. Petrochemical plants (plants using petroleum as a raw material) are usually located adjacent to an oil refinery to minimize transportation costs for the feedstocks produced by the refinery.
TEXT.French: A chemical plant is an industrial process plant that manufactures (or otherwise processes) chemicals, usually on a large scale. The general objective of a chemical plant is to create new material wealth via the chemical or biological transformation and or separation of materials. Chemical plants use special equipment, units, and technology in the processes. Other kinds of plants, such as polymer, pharmaceutical, food, and some beverage production facilities, power plants, oil refineries or other refineries, natural gas processing and biochemical plants, water and wastewater treatment, and pollution control equipment use many technologies which have similarities to chemical plant technology such as fluid systems. Some would consider an oil refinery or a pharmaceutical or polymer manufacturer to be effectively a chemical plant. Petrochemical plants (plants using petroleum as a raw material) are usually located adjacent to an oil refinery to minimize transportation costs for the feedstocks produced by the refinery.
TEXT.Polish: Zakłady chemiczne to zakład przemysłowy który przetwarza substancje chemiczne, zwykle na dużą skalę. Ogólnym celem zakładu chemicznego jest stworzenie nowych dóbr materialnych za pomocą chemicznych lub biologicznych i transformacji lub separacji materiałów.

TEXT.Spanish: La Planta química produce Productos químicos a partir de los Derivados del petróleo y el ácido sulfúrico (Azufre).

TEXT.English: Chemosynthesis Plant Farm

Chemosynthesis is the biological conversion of one or more carbon molecules (usually carbon dioxide or methane) and nutrients into organic matter using the oxidation of inorganic molecules (e.g. hydrogen gas, hydrogen sulfide) or methane as a source of energy, rather than sunlight, as in photosynthesis. Chemoautotrophs, organisms that obtain carbon through chemosynthesis, are phylogenetically diverse, but groups that include conspicuous or biogeochemically-important taxa include the sulfur-oxidizing gamma and epsilon proteobacteria, the aquificaeles, the methanogenic archaea and the neutrophilic iron-oxidizing bacteria.
TEXT.French: Chemosynthesis is the biological conversion of one or more carbon molecules (usually carbon dioxide or methane) and nutrients into organic matter using the oxidation of inorganic molecules (e.g. hydrogen gas, hydrogen sulfide) or methane as a source of energy, rather than sunlight, as in photosynthesis. Chemoautotrophs, organisms that obtain carbon through chemosynthesis, are phylogenetically diverse, but groups that include conspicuous or biogeochemically-important taxa include the sulfur-oxidizing gamma and epsilon proteobacteria, the aquificaeles, the methanogenic archaea and the neutrophilic iron-oxidizing bacteria.

TEXT.English: Build a Chemosynthesis Plant Farm to decrease your cities pollution.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ferme de plantes Chimico-synthétiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer la pollution de votre ville.

TEXT.English: Cheomseongdae
TEXT.French: Cheomseongdae

TEXT.English: Cheomseongdae is an astronomical observatory in Gyeongju, South Korea. Cheomseongdae means star-gazing tower in Korean. Cheomseongdae is one of the oldest surviving observatories in East Asia, and one of the oldest scientific installations on Earth. It dates to the 7th century to the time of kingdom of Silla, which had its capital in Gyeongju. Cheomseongdae was designated as the country's 31st national treasure on December 20, 1962.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] According to Samguk Yusa, Cheomseongdae was constructed under the reign of Queen Seondeok (632-647) near the capital of the kingdom. Cheomseongdae means "star gazing platform". The tower is built out of 362 pieces of cut granite which some claim represent the 362 days of the lunar year. Some surveys of the site have indicated that there are 366 blocks. It has 27 circular layers of stones (some associate it with the fact that Queen Seondeok was considered to be the 27th ruler of Silla) surmounted by a square structure. 12 of the layers are below the window level and 12 are above. There are 12 large base stones set in a square, with three stones on each side. These sets of 12 may symbolize the months of the year.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Cheomseongdae is one of the oldest surviving observatories in East Asia, though some claim that Cheomseongdae was not suitable for astronomical observation. Others posit that it was used for astrology rather than astronomy, though during that era there was little differentiation between the two. Some scholars have argued that the Cheomsongdae's design was heavily influenced by Buddhism, noting similarities between its design and Mount Sumeru, the center of the world according to Buddhist mythology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The tower is 5.7 meters wide at the base and 9.4 meters tall, and filled with earth up to the level of the window. Its construction style parallels that used at the Bunhwangsa Temple in Gyeongju.
TEXT.French: Cheomseongdae is an astronomical observatory in Gyeongju, South Korea. Cheomseongdae means star-gazing tower in Korean. Cheomseongdae is one of the oldest surviving observatories in East Asia, and one of the oldest scientific installations on Earth. It dates to the 7th century to the time of kingdom of Silla, which had its capital in Gyeongju. Cheomseongdae was designated as the country's 31st national treasure on December 20, 1962.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] According to Samguk Yusa, Cheomseongdae was constructed under the reign of Queen Seondeok (632-647) near the capital of the kingdom. Cheomseongdae means "star gazing platform". The tower is built out of 362 pieces of cut granite which some claim represent the 362 days of the lunar year. Some surveys of the site have indicated that there are 366 blocks. It has 27 circular layers of stones (some associate it with the fact that Queen Seondeok was considered to be the 27th ruler of Silla) surmounted by a square structure. 12 of the layers are below the window level and 12 are above. There are 12 large base stones set in a square, with three stones on each side. These sets of 12 may symbolize the months of the year.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The Cheomseongdae is one of the oldest surviving observatories in East Asia, though some claim that Cheomseongdae was not suitable for astronomical observation. Others posit that it was used for astrology rather than astronomy, though during that era there was little differentiation between the two. Some scholars have argued that the Cheomsongdae's design was heavily influenced by Buddhism, noting similarities between its design and Mount Sumeru, the center of the world according to Buddhist mythology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The tower is 5.7 meters wide at the base and 9.4 meters tall, and filled with earth up to the level of the window. Its construction style parallels that used at the Bunhwangsa Temple in Gyeongju.
TEXT.Italian: Cheomseongdae è un osservatorio astroomico a Gyeongju, Corea del sud. Cheomseongdae signfica torre di osservazione delle stelle, in coreano. Cheomseongdae è uno dei più antichi osservatori dell'Asia orientale, e una delle più antiche installazioni scientifiche su tutta la Terra. Risale al settimo secolo, al tempo del regno di Silla, che aveva la propria capitale a Gyeongju. Cheomseongdae fu designato trentunesimo tesoro nazionale il 20 Dicembre 1962.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Secondo Samguk Yusa, Cheomseongdae fu costruito sotto il regno della regina Seondeok (632-647) vicino alla capitale del regno. Cheomseongdae significa "piattaforma di osservazione delle stelle". La torre è costruita con 362 blocchi di granito, che secondo alcuni simboleggiano i 362 giorni dell'anno lunare. Alcuni sopralluoghi nel sito hanno indicato che ci sono 366 blocchi. Ha 27 strati circolari di pietre (alcuni lo associano al fatto che la regina Seondeok era considerata la ventisettesima regnante di Silla) sormontati da una struttura quadrata. 12 strai sono sotto il livello della finestra, e 12 sopra. Ci sono 12 grandi pietre alla base, tre pietre su ogni lato; esse simboleggiano i mesi dell'anno.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Cheomseongdae è uno dei più antichi osservatori in Asia orientale, anche se alcuni ritengono che Cheomseongdae non era adatto alle osservazioni astronomiche. Alcuni ritengono che fosse usato per astrologia invece che per astronomia, dato che in quell'era c'era una piccolissima differenza tra le due attività. Alcuni studiosi affermano che il design di Cheomsongdae fu pesantemente influenzato dal buddismo, notando somiglianze tra il suo design e Mount Sumeru, il centro del mondo secondo la mitologia buddista.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] La torre è larga 5.7 metri alla base e alta 9.4 metri, e riempita di terra fino al livello della finestra. Il suo stile di costruzione è simile a quello del tempio di Bunhwangsa a Gyeongju.

TEXT.English: Chichen Itza
Chief's Funeral Pyre
TEXT.French: Bucher Funéraire de Chef

TEXT.English: A pyre, also known as a funeral pyre, is a structure, usually made of wood, for burning a body as part of a funeral rite or execution. As a form of cremation, a body is placed upon or under the pyre, which is then set on fire.
TEXT.French: A pyre, also known as a funeral pyre, is a structure, usually made of wood, for burning a body as part of a funeral rite or execution. As a form of cremation, a body is placed upon or under the pyre, which is then set on fire.
TEXT.Polish: Kremacja była powszechną forma pochówku w większości systemówwierzeń pierwotnych, etnicznych. W Europie pochówek ciałopalny był m.in. dominującym w kręgu kultur popielnicowych, również w okresieśrodkowolateńskim 300 l. p.n.e. do 100 l. p.n.e. (regionalnie do ok. 150 l. p.n.e.). Wśród pochówków ciałopalnych, w których zastosowano kremację można wyróżnić groby popielnicowe z pochowanymi spopielonymi szczątkami ludzkimi w urnie (glinianym naczyniu - popielnicy) i groby jamowe z bezpośrednio wsypanymi spopielonymi szczątkami do jamy grobowej.

TEXT.English: Childcare Hut

Child care is the caring for and supervision of a child or children, usually from newborn to age thirteen. Child care is the action or skill of looking after children by a day-care center, babysitter, or other providers.
TEXT.French: Child care is the caring for and supervision of a child or children, usually from newborn to age thirteen. Child care is the action or skill of looking after children by a day-care center, babysitter, or other providers.

TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cabane des Enfants[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter de manière significative la [ICON_CULTURE].

TEXT.English: Cicada Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Cigales

TEXT.English: Periodical cicadas, primarily found in the Eastern US, live underground for 17 years before emerging and molting into adults. Just after they molt, they have soft, juicy bodies, and are said to be very tender and delicious. Different species of cicada are also eaten in many Asian countries, such as Japan, Thailand, and Malaysia.
TEXT.French: Periodical cicadas, primarily found in the Eastern US, live underground for 17 years before emerging and molting into adults. Just after they molt, they have soft, juicy bodies, and are said to be very tender and delicious. Different species of cicada are also eaten in many Asian countries, such as Japan, Thailand, and Malaysia.
TEXT.Polish: Cykadowate, piewikowate (Cicadidae) - rodzinapluskwiaków z podrzędu piewików, powszechnie nazywanych cykadami lub piewikami (zobacz: piewiki). Rozpoznawane głównie po dźwiękach, wydawanych przez samce za pomocą narządów (tymbali) u nasadyodwłoka, i rozmiarach - długość rozpostartych skrzydeł niektórych gatunków dochodzi do 18 cm, a długość ciała do 15 cm, choć na ogół mają od 2 - 5 cm. Oczy szeroko rozstawione na głowie, czułki krótkie, skrzydła na ogół przezroczyste, wyraźnie żyłkowane. Żyją na wszystkich kontynentach z wyjątkiem Antarktydy, głównie w cieplejszych krajach. Prawdopodobnie liczą 3 000 gatunków i dzieli się je na podrodziny: Tettigadinae, Cicadinae, Cicadettinae.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Almonds[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cicada Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Amandes[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Cigales[COLOR_REVERT].
