TEXT.English: Circadian Chamber

A circadian rhythm is any biological process that displays an endogenous, entrainable oscillation of about 24 hours. These rhythms are driven by a circadian clock, and rhythms have been widely observed in plants, animals, fungi and cyanobacteria. The term circadian comes from the Latin circa, meaning "around" (or "approximately"), and diem or dies, meaning "day". The formal study of biological temporal rhythms, such as daily, tidal, weekly, seasonal, and annual rhythms, is called chronobiology. Although circadian rhythms are endogenous ("built-in", self-sustained), they are adjusted (entrained) to the local environment by external cues called zeitgebers, commonly the most important of which is daylight. The Circadian Chamber manipulates the circadian clock so people need less sleep.
TEXT.French: A circadian rhythm is any biological process that displays an endogenous, entrainable oscillation of about 24 hours. These rhythms are driven by a circadian clock, and rhythms have been widely observed in plants, animals, fungi and cyanobacteria. The term circadian comes from the Latin circa, meaning "around" (or "approximately"), and diem or dies, meaning "day". The formal study of biological temporal rhythms, such as daily, tidal, weekly, seasonal, and annual rhythms, is called chronobiology. Although circadian rhythms are endogenous ("built-in", self-sustained), they are adjusted (entrained) to the local environment by external cues called zeitgebers, commonly the most important of which is daylight. The Circadian Chamber manipulates the circadian clock so people need less sleep.

TEXT.English: Build a Circadian Chamber to increase your cities productivity.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chambre Ciradienne[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la productivité de votre ville.

TEXT.English: Circus Maximus
TEXT.French: Cirque Maxime
TEXT.Italian: Circo Massimo

TEXT.English: The Circus Maximus (Latin for largest arena) is an ancient arena and mass entertainment venue located in Rome.[NEWLINE] [PARAGRAPH:1]Situated in the valley between the Aventine and Palatine hills, the location was first utilised for public games and entertainment by the Etruscan kings of Rome. Certainly, the first games of the Ludi Romani (Roman Games) were staged at the location by Tarquinius Priscus, the first Etruscan ruler of Rome. Somewhat later, the Circus was the site of public games and festivals influenced by the Greeks in the 2nd century BC. Meeting the demands of the Roman citizenry for mass public entertainment on a lavish scale, Julius Caesar expanded the Circus around 50 BC, after which the track measured approximately 600 metres in length, 225 metres in breadth and could accommodate an estimated 150,000 seated spectators (many more, perhaps an equal number again, could view the games by standing, crowding and lining the adjoining hills). In 81 AD, the Senate built a triple arch honoring Titus by the closed East end (not to be confused with the Arch of Titus over the Via Sacra on the opposite side of the Palatinum). The emperor Domitian connected his new palace on the Palatine to the Circus in order that he could more easily view the races. The emperor Trajan later added another 5000 seats and expanded the emperor's seating in order to increase his public visibility during the games. [NEWLINE] [PARAGRAPH:1]The most important event at the Circus was chariot racing. The track could hold 12 chariots, and the two sides of the track were separated by a raised median termed the spina. Statues of various gods were set up on the spina, and Augustus erected an Egyptian obelisk on it as well. At either end of the spina was a turning post, the meta, around which chariots made dangerous turns at speed. One end of the track extended further back than the other, to allow the chariots to line up to begin the race. Here there were starting gates, or carceres, which staggered the chariots so that each travelled the same distance to the first turn. [PARAGRAPH:1] From Wikipedia
TEXT.French: à Rome, le Circus maximus (en latin: Cirque le plus grand) ou Cirque Maxime (ou simplement Grand Cirque), dédié aux courses de chars, reste à ce jour la plus vaste enceinte sportive que le monde ait connu.[NEWLINE] [PARAGRAPH:1] Source: Wikipédia
TEXT.Polish: Circus Maximus (wł. Circo Massimo - cyrk największy) - najstarszy i największy cyrk starożytnego Rzymu. Był usytuowany pomiędzy wzgórzami Palatynu i Awentynu. Jego początki wiąże się z panowaniem Tarkwiniusza Starego. Od VI w. p.n.e. do IV w. cyrk wielokrotnie rozbudowywano i przebudowywano. W ostatecznym kształcie mieścił widownię na 250 000 osób i miał wymiary 544 x 129 m. Rozgrywano w nim przede wszystkim wyścigi rydwanów, ale nie tylko, np. Juliusz Cezar urządzał także polowania. Najstarszą częścią cyrku są pozostałości fundamentów drewnianego budynku stajni (carceres), pochodzące z 329 p.n.e. Budynek został zastąpiony murowaną budowlą w 174 p.n.e. W tym samym roku na spinie ustawiono 7 jaj informujących o rozgrywanym podczas zawodów okrążeniu. Na polecenie Agryppy, w 33 p.n.e. na spinie ustawiono 7 figurek delfinów, a za czasów Nerona pośrodku spiny umieszczono fontannę w kształcie delfinów. W 194 p.n.e. dobudowano miejsca na widowni przeznaczone dla senatorów. Za panowania Augusta dodano lożę dla cesarza (pulvinar) oraz ustawiono obelisk o wysokości 23,7 m przywieziony z Heliopolis (obelisk został przeniesiony w 1587 r. na polecenie papieża Sykstusa V na Plac del Popolo.) W 36 r. cyrk spłonął. Odbudowany został przez cesarza Klaudiusza. Po raz drugi zniszczony przez pożar w 64 r. został odbudowany na polecenie Nerona. Kolejny pożar miał miejsce za panowania Domicjana. Odbudowa została zakończona dopiero w 104 r. przez Trajana. W tym okresie budowla miała długość ok. 600 m i szerokość ok. 200 m. Podczas panowania Antoninusa Piusa miała miejsce katastrofa, w wyniku której część budowli zawaliła się. Po odbudowie dokonano kolejnych modyfikacji: Karakalla - poszerzył bramę, Aurelian - postawił na spinie świątynię słońca, Konstantyn Wielki - dodał dodatkowe portyki i ozdobił budynek złotymi kolumnami, Konstancjusz II ustawił na spinie obelisk o wysokości 32,5 m przywieziony z Teb (obelisk od 1587 r. stoi na Placu św. Jana na Lateranie). Ostatnie igrzyska w cyrku zostały rozegrane w 550 r. Obecnie na powierzchni nie ma zachowanych pozostałości cyrku, tylko wyniesienie terenu nad gruzami dawnego cyrku ukazuje obszar, który zajmowały jego zabudowania. Zobacz też: architektura starożytnego Rzymu.

TEXT.English: City Park
TEXT.Italian: Parco cittadino

TEXT.English: A City Park is a park in cities and other incorporated places to offer recreation and green space to residents of and visitors to the municipality. The design, operation and maintenance is usually done by government, typically on the local level, but may occasionally be contracted out to a private sector company. [NEWLINE] Common features of municipal parks include playgrounds, hiking, running and mixed use trails or paths, bridle paths, sports field and courts, public restrooms, boat ramps and/or picnic facilities, depending on the budget and natural features available.
TEXT.French: A City Park is a park in cities and other incorporated places to offer recreation and green space to residents of and visitors to the municipality. The design, operation and maintenance is usually done by government, typically on the local level, but may occasionally be contracted out to a private sector company. [NEWLINE] Common features of municipal parks include playgrounds, hiking, running and mixed use trails or paths, bridle paths, sports field and courts, public restrooms, boat ramps and/or picnic facilities, depending on the budget and natural features available.
TEXT.Italian: Un parco cittadino è un parco situato in città o aree urbane per offrire ricreazione e uno spazio verde ai residenti e ai visitatori della città. La progettazione, costruzione e manutenzione è fatta dal governo, di solito a livello locale, ma può essere occasionalmente affidata a una compagnia privata del settore. [NEWLINE] Caratteristiche comuni dei parchi municipali includono cambi da gioco, piste ciclabili, da corsa e per uso misto, campi sportvi, sale d'intrattenimento pubbliche, moli per le barche e/o aree da pic-nic, a seconda del budget e delle risorse naturali disponibili.
TEXT.Polish: Park miejski - publiczna zorganizowana miejska przestrzeń zielona pełniąca funkcje wypoczynkowe i rekreacyjne, a niekiedy także sportowe lub inne. Zazwyczaj zajmuje większą powierzchnię i pełni bardziej złożone funkcje niżogród miejski. W parku wyznaczone są ścieżki i trasy do spacerowania (zwykle wybrukowane lub wyasfaltowane), w jego obrębie znajdują się także obiekty małej architektury (kosze na śmieci, ławki, latarnie itp.), a często również szalety, place zabaw, amfiteatry, altany, fontanny czy pomniki. Niektóre zespoły parkowe mają status zabytków przyrody.

TEXT.English: City Parks allow denizens of your cities to relax in the most modern outdoor facilities. They also make excelland protest grounds.

TEXT.Italian: I parchi cittadini permettono agli abitanti della tua città di rilassarsi nelle più moderne strutture all'aperto. Sono anche un ottimo luogo per le manifestazioni di protesta.
TEXT.Spanish: Los parques públicos permiten a los habitantes de tus ciudades relajarse en las más modernas instalaciones al aire libre. También son excelentes lugares de protesta.
TEXT.Polish: Parki miejskie pozwalają mieszkańcom twoich miast odprężyć się w najbardziej nowoczesnych plenerowych udogodnieniach.

TEXT.English: Civil Servant's School

The Imperial examinations (in Imperial China determined who among the population would be permitted to enter the state's bureaucracy. The Imperial Examination System in China lasted for 1300 years, from its founding during the Sui Dynasty in 605 to its abolition near the end of the Qing Dynasty in 1905. On September 2, 1905, the throne endorsed a memorial which ordered that the old examination system be discontinued at all levels in the following year. The new system provided equivalents to the old degrees; the Bachelor's Degree, for instance, would be considered equivalent to the xiu cai. The details of the system remained to be worked out before the fall of the dynasty in 1911.
TEXT.French: The Imperial examinations (in Imperial China determined who among the population would be permitted to enter the state's bureaucracy. The Imperial Examination System in China lasted for 1300 years, from its founding during the Sui Dynasty in 605 to its abolition near the end of the Qing Dynasty in 1905. On September 2, 1905, the throne endorsed a memorial which ordered that the old examination system be discontinued at all levels in the following year. The new system provided equivalents to the old degrees; the Bachelor's Degree, for instance, would be considered equivalent to the xiu cai. The details of the system remained to be worked out before the fall of the dynasty in 1911.

TEXT.Spanish: Incrementa el comercio si la ciudad tiene acceso a los recursos necesarios por la corporación Standard Ethanol. Asimismo, aumenta el rendimiento de las rutas comerciales.

TEXT.English: Climatology Lab

Climate is the pattern of variation in temperature, humidity, atmospheric pressure, wind, precipitation, atmospheric particle count and other meteorological variables in a given region over long periods. Climate can be contrasted to weather, which is the present condition of these variables over shorter periods. A region's climate is generated by the climate system, which has five components: atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, land surface, and biosphere.
TEXT.French: Climate is the pattern of variation in temperature, humidity, atmospheric pressure, wind, precipitation, atmospheric particle count and other meteorological variables in a given region over long periods. Climate can be contrasted to weather, which is the present condition of these variables over shorter periods. A region's climate is generated by the climate system, which has five components: atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, land surface, and biosphere.
TEXT.Polish: Klimatologia - dział geografii fizycznej, nauka o klimacie. Zajmuje się następującymi zagadnieniami: procesy klimatotwórcze, wpływ czynników geograficznych na przebieg tych procesów, opisywanie i klasyfikacja klimatów kuli ziemskiej, zmiany klimatyczne w dziejach Ziemi.

TEXT.English: Build a Climatology Lab to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de Climatologie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Climatology Lab by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Cloning Factory

A cloning factory is a massive building containing hundreds (and sometimes thousands) of vats of murky and disgusting liquid, in which float human clones in varying stages of development. Humans and computers monitor each vat closely, ensuring that the clone within is getting the proper amount of nutrients, heat, light and oxygen necessary for successful maturation. [PARAGRAPH:1]In earlier experiments scientists were unable to grow clones any faster than humans themselves grow, but as technology has increased, so has the speed with which clones mature. At present, a clone's body will reach full maturity in just over six years, while a human requires eighteen to twenty years to achieve the same development. [PARAGRAPH:1]While a clone's mental capacity is negligible, their organs and other parts are identical to human and can be transplanted into a human body with ease. Further, advances in technology have allowed computers to interface with clones' underdeveloped brains, creating zombie-like creatures capable of rudimentary physical labor.
TEXT.French: Une usine de clonage est un grand bâtiment qui peut contenir des centaines (voire des milliers) de cuves remplies d'un liquide visqueux, dans lequel des corps de clones humains poursuivent leur croissance. Des ingénieurs et des ordinateurs contrôlent chaque cuve pour s'assurer que le clone reçoit les doses de nutriments, de chaleur, de lumière et d'oxygène nécessaires à sa maturation. [PARAGRAPH:1]Au début du clonage, les scientifiques ne savaient pas développer un clone plus rapidement que le rythme de croissance humain normal. Mais les progrès de la technologie ont révolutionné cette pratique. Aujourd'hui, le corps d'un clone atteint en à peine six ans le niveau de développement d'un humain de vingt ans. [PARAGRAPH:1]Si les capacités mentales d'un clone sont insignifiantes, ses organes sont en tous points identiques à ceux de son modèle et peuvent facilement lui être transplantés. En outre, de nouveaux progrès technologiques ont permis d'implanter des programmes informatiques dans le cerveau des clones, qui peuvent ainsi être transformés en ouvriers capables de travaux rudimentaires.
TEXT.German: Eine Klonfabrik ist ein gewaltiges Gebäude, in dem hunderte (manchmal sogar tausende) mit trüber, recht ekliger Flüssigkeit gefüllte Behälter aufbewahrt werden, in denen menschliche Klone in unterschiedlichen Entwicklungsstadien ihr Dasein fristen. Menschen und Computer überwachen jeden dieser Behälter sorgsam, um sicherzustellen, dass der darin eingeschlossene Klon mit der richtigen Menge an Nährstoffen, Wärme, Licht und Sauerstoff versorgt wird, die für eine erfolgreiche Reifung nötig ist. [PARAGRAPH:1]In früheren Experimenten hatten es die Wissenschaftler nicht geschafft, Klone schneller reifen zu lassen, als in der Zeit, die auch der Mensch zum Heranwachsen braucht. Nach weiteren technologischen Fortschritten konnte die Klonreifung jedoch beschleunigt werden und so erreicht ein Klonkörper gegenwärtig in knapp über sechs Jahren seine volle Reife, während ein Mensch etwa 18 bis 20 Jahre für eine vergleichbare Entwicklung benötigt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn man die mentale Kapazität eines Klons einmal außer Acht lässt, sind seine Organe und andere Körperteile mit denen des Menschen identisch und können daher problemlos in einen menschlichen Körper transplantiert werden. Außerdem ist es neuerdings dank moderner Technologie auch möglich, per Computerschnittstelle auf das unterentwickelte Gehirn eines Klons zuzugreifen, um ihn in ein Golem-artiges Wesen zu verwandeln, das auch rudimentäre körperliche Arbeiten verrichten kann.
TEXT.Italian: Una fabbrica di cloni è un enorme edificio contenente centinaia (e talvolta migliaia) di vasche di liquido opaco e disgustoso, in cui galleggiano cloni umani in diversi stadi di sviluppo. Umani e computer controllano attentamente ogni vasca, assicurandosi che il clone all'interno riceva la giusta quantità di nutrienti, calore, luce e ossigeno necessaria per la maturazione. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nei primi esperimenti, gli scienziati erano incapaci di far crescere i cloni più rapidamente degli stessi umani, ma con l'incremento della tecnologia c'è stato un aumento della velocità di maturazione dei cloni. Al momento, il corpo di un clone raggiunge la piena maturità in poco più di sei anni, mentre un umano ci mette da diciotto a vent'anni per raggiungere lo stesso sviluppo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Mentre la capacità mentale di un clone è irrisoria, gli organi e le altre parti sono identiche a quelle umane e possono essere facilmente trapiantati in un corpo umano. Inoltre gli sviluppi tecnologici hanno permesso di interfacciare i computer con i cervelli sottosviluppati dei cloni, creando creature tipo zombi in grado di svolgere rudimentali lavori di fatica.
TEXT.Spanish: Una planta de clonación es un enorme edificio que cuenta con centenares (y a veces miles) de contenedores de líquido turbio y repugnante en el que flotan clones humanos en diversas fases de desarrollo. Cada recipiente es controlado atentamente por humanos y ordenadores para asegurarse de que el clon que contiene cuente con la cantidad apropiada de nutrientes, calor, luz y oxígeno necesarios para madurar con éxito. [PARAGRAPH:1]Durante los primeros experimentos, los científicos fueron incapaces de hacer crecer clones a más velocidad que la del crecimiento humano, pero, a medida que la tecnología avanzaba, también lo hacía la velocidad a la que maduraban los clones. Actualmente, el cuerpo de un clon alcanza la madurez total en solo seis años, mientras que un humano precisa entre dieciocho y veinte años para alcanzar el mismo nivel. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque la capacidad mental de un clon es insignificantes, los órganos y otras partes del cuerpo son idénticas a los humanos y pueden transplantarse fácilmente. Además, los avances tecnológicos permiten conectar ordenadores a clones con cerebros atrofiados, creando así criaturas similares a zombis que son capaces de hacer trabajos físicos rudimentarios.
TEXT.Polish: Fabryka Klonów to masywny budynek zawierający setki (a czasami tysiące) komór wypełnionych cieczą, w której zanurzone są ludzkie klony w różnych etapach rozwoju. Ludzie oraz komputery monitorują każdą komorę i zapewniają tym organizmom pokarm, ciepło oraz tlen. [PARAGRAPH:1]We wcześniejszych eksperymentach naukowcy byli niezdolni do zapewnienia klonom szybszego wzrostu niż naturalny rozwój człowieka, ale dzięki rozwojowi nauki w końcu udało się osiągnąć pożądany efekt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Chociaż mentalny rozwój klonu jest nieistotny, jego kończyny oraz organy wewnętrzne są identyczne do ludzkich i mogą służyć do transplantacji. Co więcej, postępy w technologii pozwalają na używanie klonów do prac fizycznych.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cloning Factories[COLOR_REVERT] permit training of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clones, Automatons,[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cyborgs.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cloning Factories[COLOR_REVERT] permit training of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clones, Automatons,[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cyborgs.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plantas de clonación[COLOR_REVERT] permiten el entrenamiento de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clones, Autómatas[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ciborgs[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cloning Laboratory
TEXT.French: Laboratoire de Clonage
TEXT.Italian: Laboratorio di clonazione

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Klony otrzymane w procesie transferu jądrowego nie są w 100% genetycznie identyczne z dawcami. W trakcie tego procesu wymienia się bowiem tylko materiał genetyczny zawarty w jądrze komórkowym pozostawiając DNAmitochondrialny biorcy. Mitochondrialny DNA ma jednak minimalny wkład w dziedziczenie cech genetycznych.

TEXT.English: Cloning Laboratory increases science output in the city and permits training of Automatons and Clones. Causes unhappiness in the city.
TEXT.French: Cloning Laboratory increases science output in the city and permits training of Automatons and Clones. Causes unhappiness in the city.
TEXT.Spanish: El Laboratorio de clonación aumenta la producción científica en la ciudad y permite entrenar Autómatas y Clones. Causará infelicidad en la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Factory (Cloth)

A textile or cloth is a flexible woven material consisting of a network of natural or artificial fibres often referred to as thread or yarn. Yarn is produced by spinning raw fibres of wool, flax, cotton, or other material to produce long strands. Textiles are formed by weaving, knitting, crocheting, knotting, or pressing fibres together (felt). The words fabric and cloth are used in textile assembly trades (such as tailoring and dressmaking) as synonyms for textile. However, there are subtle differences in these terms in specialized usage. Textile refers to any material made of interlacing fibres. Fabric refers to any material made through weaving, knitting, spreading, crocheting, or bonding that may be used in production of further goods (garments, etc.). Cloth may be used synonymously with fabric but often refers to a finished piece of fabric used for a specific purpose (e.g., table cloth).
TEXT.French: A textile or cloth is a flexible woven material consisting of a network of natural or artificial fibres often referred to as thread or yarn. Yarn is produced by spinning raw fibres of wool, flax, cotton, or other material to produce long strands. Textiles are formed by weaving, knitting, crocheting, knotting, or pressing fibres together (felt). The words fabric and cloth are used in textile assembly trades (such as tailoring and dressmaking) as synonyms for textile. However, there are subtle differences in these terms in specialized usage. Textile refers to any material made of interlacing fibres. Fabric refers to any material made through weaving, knitting, spreading, crocheting, or bonding that may be used in production of further goods (garments, etc.). Cloth may be used synonymously with fabric but often refers to a finished piece of fabric used for a specific purpose (e.g., table cloth).
TEXT.Polish: Przemysł włókienniczy (inaczej przemysł tekstylny) - gałąź przemysłu lekkiego zajmująca się przetwórstwem surowców na włókna, tkaniny, dzianiny itp., obejmuje między innymi, przędzalnictwo, tkactwo, dziewiarstwo oraz w przypadku przetwórstwa włókien łykowych - roszarnictwo.

TEXT.English: Build a Cloth Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine textile[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cloth Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Cloud Observer's Hut

In meteorology, a cloud is a visible mass of liquid droplets or frozen crystals made of water or various chemicals suspended in the atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body. These suspended particles are also known as aerosols and are studied in the cloud physics branch of meteorology. Terrestrial cloud formation is the result of air in Earth's atmosphere becoming saturated due to either or both of two processes; cooling of the air and adding water vapor. With sufficient saturation, precipitation will fall to the surface; an exception is virga, which evaporates before reaching the surface.
TEXT.French: In meteorology, a cloud is a visible mass of liquid droplets or frozen crystals made of water or various chemicals suspended in the atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body. These suspended particles are also known as aerosols and are studied in the cloud physics branch of meteorology. Terrestrial cloud formation is the result of air in Earth's atmosphere becoming saturated due to either or both of two processes; cooling of the air and adding water vapor. With sufficient saturation, precipitation will fall to the surface; an exception is virga, which evaporates before reaching the surface.
TEXT.Polish: Chmury - obserwowane w atmosferze skupiskakondensatów substancji występującej w postaci pary. W atmosferze ziemskiej jest to para wodna. Ochładzanie zmniejsza zdolność powietrza do zatrzymywania pary wodnej. Ochładzanie dotemperatury punktu rosy powoduje nasycenie pary wodnej (saturację), dalsze ochładzanie wywołuje przesycenie i kondensację. Kondensacja i parowanie (w przypadku chmur wodnych) oraz depozycja isublimacja (w przypadku chmur lodowych) zachodzą w atmosferze na chmurowych lub lodowych jądrach (zarodkach)nukleacji.

TEXT.English: Build a Cloud Observer's Hut to increase your cities food.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hutte de l'Observateur des nuages[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la nourriture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Cloud Observer's Hut by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Coal Plant
Coast Guard Station

A coast guard or coastguard is a maritime security organization of a particular country. The term implies widely different responsibilities in different countries, from being a heavily armed military force with customs and security duties to being a volunteer organization tasked with search and rescue functions and lacking any law enforcement powers. However, a typical coast guard's functions are distinct from typical functions of both the navy (a pure military force) and a transportation police (a civilian law enforcement agency).
TEXT.French: A coast guard or coastguard is a maritime security organization of a particular country. The term implies widely different responsibilities in different countries, from being a heavily armed military force with customs and security duties to being a volunteer organization tasked with search and rescue functions and lacking any law enforcement powers. However, a typical coast guard's functions are distinct from typical functions of both the navy (a pure military force) and a transportation police (a civilian law enforcement agency).
TEXT.Polish: Zadaniem straży wybrzeża jest obrona narodowa, ochrona bezpieczeństwa morskiego, wsparcie przy egzekwowaniu amerykańskiego prawa na wodach okalających terytorium Stanów Zjednoczonych, oraz ochrona środowiska naturalnego. Łączy funkcje wojskowe i cywilne. Służy w niej około 40 tys. ludzi. Straż Wybrzeża podlega Departamentowi Bezpieczeństwa Krajowego, a nie Departamentowi Obrony, tak jak pozostałe rodzaje sił zbrojnych.

TEXT.English: Build a Coast Guard Station to increase your cities espionage.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Station de Gardes-côtes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'espionnage dans votre ville.

TEXT.English: Giant Cockroach Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de blattes

TEXT.English: Yes, you can eat cockroaches! Just not the ones you find around your house. Contrary to popular belief, cockroaches can actually be very clean and tasty insects, especially if they are fed on fresh fruits and vegetables. They can be eaten toasted, fried, sauteed, or boiled. Madagascar Hissing Cockroaches have a taste and texture like greasy chicken.
TEXT.French: Yes, you can eat cockroaches! Just not the ones you find around your house. Contrary to popular belief, cockroaches can actually be very clean and tasty insects, especially if they are fed on fresh fruits and vegetables. They can be eaten toasted, fried, sauteed, or boiled. Madagascar Hissing Cockroaches have a taste and texture like greasy chicken.
TEXT.Polish: Karaluch, karaczan wschodni (Blatta orientalis, przestarzałe z tur. -karakon) - owad synantropijny (żyjący w siedliskach człowieka). Żyje w kuchniach, magazynach, wyjadając produkty żywnościowe.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Coffee[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Giant Cockroach Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Café[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de blattes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Factory (Roasted Coffee)

Coffee is usually sold in a roasted state, and with rare exceptions all coffee is roasted before it is consumed. It can be sold roasted by the supplier, or it can be home roasted. The roasting process influences the taste of the beverage by changing the coffee seed both physically and chemically. The seed decreases in weight as moisture is lost and increases in volume, causing it to become less dense. The density of the seed also influences the strength of the coffee and requirements for packaging. The actual roasting begins when the temperature inside the seed reaches approximately 200 °C (392 °F), though different varieties of seeds differ in moisture and density and therefore roast at different rates. During roasting, caramelization occurs as intense heat breaks down starches, changing them to simple sugars that begin to brown, which alters the color of the seed. Sucrose is rapidly lost during the roasting process and may disappear entirely in darker roasts. During roasting, aromatic oils and acids weaken, changing the flavor; at 205 °C (401 °F), other oils start to develop. One of these oils, caffeol, is created at about 200 °C (392 °F), which is largely responsible for coffee's aroma and flavor.
TEXT.French: Coffee is usually sold in a roasted state, and with rare exceptions all coffee is roasted before it is consumed. It can be sold roasted by the supplier, or it can be home roasted. The roasting process influences the taste of the beverage by changing the coffee seed both physically and chemically. The seed decreases in weight as moisture is lost and increases in volume, causing it to become less dense. The density of the seed also influences the strength of the coffee and requirements for packaging. The actual roasting begins when the temperature inside the seed reaches approximately 200 °C (392 °F), though different varieties of seeds differ in moisture and density and therefore roast at different rates. During roasting, caramelization occurs as intense heat breaks down starches, changing them to simple sugars that begin to brown, which alters the color of the seed. Sucrose is rapidly lost during the roasting process and may disappear entirely in darker roasts. During roasting, aromatic oils and acids weaken, changing the flavor; at 205 °C (401 °F), other oils start to develop. One of these oils, caffeol, is created at about 200 °C (392 °F), which is largely responsible for coffee's aroma and flavor.
TEXT.Polish: Kawa - napój sporządzany z palonych, a następnie zmielonych lub poddanych instantyzacji ziaren kawowca, zwykle podawana na gorąco. Pochodzi z Etiopii, w Europie pojawiła się około XVI wieku. Jedna z najpopularniejszych używek na świecie i główne źródło kofeiny. Działa pobudzająco i orzeźwiająco oraz przyspiesza przemianę materii. Zawieraprzeciwutleniacze, które zapobiegają powstawaniu wolnych rodników. Spożywana w dużych ilościach może jednak być szkodliwa dla zdrowia. Rocznie produkuje się około 6,7 miliona ton kawy

TEXT.English: Build a Coffee Factory to increase your cities food.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de café[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la nourriture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Coffee Factory by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Colosseum
Colossus of Rhodes
Combat Simulator
TEXT.French: Simulateur de Combat
TEXT.Italian: Simulatore di combattimento

TEXT.English: Military training has been around since the invention of warfare. Computer technology has allowed the creation of training simulations that grow as close as possible to reality without all of the risks involved. Certain simulations are used to train battlefield units, while others test strategies, often accounting for political and social factors as well as raw military force.
TEXT.French: Military training has been around since the invention of warfare. Computer technology has allowed the creation of training simulations that grow as close as possible to reality without all of the risks involved. Certain simulations are used to train battlefield units, while others test strategies, often accounting for political and social factors as well as raw military force.
TEXT.Italian: L'addestramento militare esiste dall'invenzione della guerra. I computer hanno permesso la creazione di simulazioni di addestramento, che si avvicinano alla realtà ma senza i rischi ad essa correlati. Certe simulazioni vengono utilizzate per addestrare le unità sul campo di battaglia, mentre altre si occupano di testare nuove strategie, tenendo conto anche di fattori politici e sociali oltre alla semplice forza militare.
TEXT.Polish: Centrum jest instytucją zajmującą się organizacją ćwiczeń wspomaganych komputerowo (Computer Assisted Exercise - CAX) oraz wdrażaniem i wykorzystaniem systemów symulacyjnych w wielu dziedzinach działalności militarnej. Wspiera dowództwa i sztaby szczebla taktycznego i operacyjnego w przygotowaniu, przeprowadzeniu i ocenie ćwiczeń. We współpracy z Wydziałami oraz Centrami Akademii Obrony Narodowej współorganizuje także ćwiczenia dla słuchaczy akademii.

TEXT.English: Build a Combat Simulator to produce units with additional Experience Points.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Simulateur de Combat[COLOR_REVERT] pour donner de l'expérience supplémentaire à vos unités.
TEXT.Italian: Costrusci un Simulatore di combattimento per produrre unità con XP maggiore.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un Simulador de combate para que tus unidades entrenadas tengan más PX.

TEXT.English: Achievement (Commercial)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement Commercial
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo commerciale

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Commercial Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives a +8% gold bonus in all cities, as well as 1 free trade route.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Accomplissement Commercial[COLOR_REVERT] requiert [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi qu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héro National[COLOR_REVERT] pour être construit. Il donne +8% bonus d'or dans toutes les villes, ainsi que 1 route commerciale gratuite.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro comercial[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da una bonificación al comercio (+8%) y una ruta comercial en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Handlowe[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Zwiększa przychód handlu o +8% oraz dodaje 1 szlak handlowy we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: Commercial Airport
TEXT.French: Aéroport Commercial
TEXT.Italian: Aeroporto commerciale

TEXT.English: Increased aircraft traffic during World War I led to the construction of landing fields. Aircraft had to approach these from certain directions and this led to the development of aids for directing the approach and landing slope. Following the war, some of these military airfields added commercial facilities for handling passenger traffic. One of the earliest such fields was Paris - Le Bourget Airport at Le Bourget, near Paris. The first international airport to open was the Croydon Airport, in South London, although an airport at Hounslow had been temporarily operating as such for nine months. In 1922, the first permanent airport and commercial terminal solely for commercial aviation was built at Königsberg, Germany. The airports of this era used a paved "apron", which permitted night flying as well as landing heavier aircraft. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first lighting used on an airport was during the later part of the 1920s; in the 1930s approach lighting came into use. These indicated the proper direction and angle of descent. The colors and flash intervals of these lights became standardized under the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). In the 1940s, the slope-line approach system was introduced. This consisted of two rows of lights that formed a funnel indicating an aircraft's position on the glideslope. Additional lights indicated incorrect altitude and direction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Airports are divided into landside and airside areas. Landside areas include parking lots, public transportation train stations, tank farms and access roads. Airside areas include all areas accessible to aircraft, including runways, taxiways, ramps and tank farms. Access from landside areas to airside areas is tightly controlled at most airports. Passengers on commercial flights access airside areas through terminals, where they can purchase tickets, clear security, check or claim luggage and board aircraft through gates. The waiting areas which provide passenger access to aircraft are typically called concourses, although this term is often used interchangeably with terminal.[PARAGRAPH:2]Airports with international flights have customs and immigration facilities. However, as some countries have agreements that allow travel between them without customs and immigrations, such facilities are not a definitive need for an international airport. International flights often require a higher level of physical security, although in recent years, many countries have adopted the same level of security for international and domestic travel.
TEXT.French: Increased aircraft traffic during World War I led to the construction of landing fields. Aircraft had to approach these from certain directions and this led to the development of aids for directing the approach and landing slope. Following the war, some of these military airfields added commercial facilities for handling passenger traffic. One of the earliest such fields was Paris - Le Bourget Airport at Le Bourget, near Paris. The first international airport to open was the Croydon Airport, in South London, although an airport at Hounslow had been temporarily operating as such for nine months. In 1922, the first permanent airport and commercial terminal solely for commercial aviation was built at Königsberg, Germany. The airports of this era used a paved "apron", which permitted night flying as well as landing heavier aircraft. [PARAGRAPH:2]The first lighting used on an airport was during the later part of the 1920s; in the 1930s approach lighting came into use. These indicated the proper direction and angle of descent. The colors and flash intervals of these lights became standardized under the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO). In the 1940s, the slope-line approach system was introduced. This consisted of two rows of lights that formed a funnel indicating an aircraft's position on the glideslope. Additional lights indicated incorrect altitude and direction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Airports are divided into landside and airside areas. Landside areas include parking lots, public transportation train stations, tank farms and access roads. Airside areas include all areas accessible to aircraft, including runways, taxiways, ramps and tank farms. Access from landside areas to airside areas is tightly controlled at most airports. Passengers on commercial flights access airside areas through terminals, where they can purchase tickets, clear security, check or claim luggage and board aircraft through gates. The waiting areas which provide passenger access to aircraft are typically called concourses, although this term is often used interchangeably with terminal.[PARAGRAPH:2]Airports with international flights have customs and immigration facilities. However, as some countries have agreements that allow travel between them without customs and immigrations, such facilities are not a definitive need for an international airport. International flights often require a higher level of physical security, although in recent years, many countries have adopted the same level of security for international and domestic travel.
TEXT.Polish: Lotnisko, port lotniczy - obszar, na którym lądują, startują i kołują statki powietrzne (samoloty, śmigłowce, sterowce). Ich wyposażenie zróżnicowane jest w zależności od liczby odprawianych pasażerów i przeładowywanych towarów.

TEXT.English: Commercial Airport increases city's trade routes and overall commerce but the downside is decreased healthiness.
TEXT.French: Commercial Airport increases city's trade routes and overall commerce but the downside is decreased healthiness.
TEXT.Spanish: El Aeropuerto internacional aumenta las rutas comerciales y el comercio total de la ciudad, con la desventaja de reducir la salud.

TEXT.English: Commercial Port
TEXT.French: Port Commercial
TEXT.Italian: Porto commerciale

TEXT.English: A commerical port is one where ships come to dock and drop off/pick up goods to be delivered to a destination. They tend to be restricted to their nation of ownership.
TEXT.French: A commerical port is one where ships come to dock and drop off/pick up goods to be delivered to a destination. They tend to be restricted to their nation of ownership.
TEXT.Polish: Porty handlowe - porty, których dominującą funkcją jest transport morski, szczególnie ładunków. Można wśród nich wyróżnić porty uniwersalne, które przyjmują różne rodzaje towarów (masowe, toczne, kontenery, drobnica). Porty mogą być także specjalizowane, co wynika z ukierunkowanej polityki podmiotu zarządzającego i dostosowanej infrastruktury portowej do określonego typu ładunków.

TEXT.English: Commercial Ports increase coastal cities' trade routes and commerce and happiness. They are required to build International Ports.
TEXT.French: Commercial Ports increase coastal cities' trade routes and commerce and happiness. They are required to build International Ports.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Puertos comerciales aumentan las rutas comerciales de las ciudades costeras, el comercio y la felicidad. Se requieren para construir los Puertos internacionales.

TEXT.English: Communications Satellite
TEXT.French: Satellite de Communications
TEXT.Italian: Satelliti per comunicazione

TEXT.English: A communications satellite (sometimes abbreviated to SATCOM) is an artificial satellite stationed in space for the purposes of telecommunications. Modern communications satellites use a variety of orbits including geostationary orbits, Molniya orbits, other elliptical orbits and low (polar and non-polar) Earth orbits.[PARAGRAPH:2]For fixed (point-to-point) services, communications satellites provide a microwave radio relay technology complementary to that of submarine communication cables. They are also used for mobile applications such as communications to ships, vehicles, planes and hand-held terminals, and for TV and radio broadcasting, for which application of other technologies, such as cable, is impractical or impossible.
TEXT.French: A communications satellite (sometimes abbreviated to SATCOM) is an artificial satellite stationed in space for the purposes of telecommunications. Modern communications satellites use a variety of orbits including geostationary orbits, Molniya orbits, other elliptical orbits and low (polar and non-polar) Earth orbits.[PARAGRAPH:2]For fixed (point-to-point) services, communications satellites provide a microwave radio relay technology complementary to that of submarine communication cables. They are also used for mobile applications such as communications to ships, vehicles, planes and hand-held terminals, and for TV and radio broadcasting, for which application of other technologies, such as cable, is impractical or impossible.
TEXT.Polish: Satelita telekomunikacyjny otrzymuje sygnał ze stacji naziemnej, wzmacnia go i wysyła z powrotem na Ziemię. Sygnał taki może być odbierany zarówno na całym obszarze z którego zapewniona jest "widoczność" satelity, jak i w ściśle wyznaczonym obszarze. Satelity przekaźnikowe transmitują sygnały telewizyjne bezpośrednio do anten indywidualnych użytkowników, albo do dużych anten zbiorczych telewizji kablowych. Prawie wszystkie satelity telekomunikacyjne krążą po orbicie geostacjonarnej. Satelity nadają sygnały na Ziemię albo bezpośrednio, albo za pośrednictwem innego satelity.

TEXT.English: Community Discussions

Humans have always been social creatures. Once language was really developed, regular community discussions were instrumental in rapidly expanding mankind's knowledge base. Those tribes that quickly figured out they could benefit from sharing and understanding the experiences of other people were far more capable of surviving and thriving in the early Prehistoric Era. This building represents the growing custom of having regular discussions rather than simply taking place at intermittent intervals and only as needs demand. It may have taken some surprising degree of effort to get this to happen, at some sacrifice to other potential efforts.
TEXT.French: Humans have always been social creatures. Once language was really developed, regular community discussions were instrumental in rapidly expanding mankind's knowledge base. Those tribes that quickly figured out they could benefit from sharing and understanding the experiences of other people were far more capable of surviving and thriving in the early Prehistoric Era. This building represents the growing custom of having regular discussions rather than simply taking place at intermittent intervals and only as needs demand. It may have taken some surprising degree of effort to get this to happen, at some sacrifice to other potential efforts.
TEXT.German: Öffentliche Diskussionen und Gedankenaustausch waren für den Wissenserwerb des Menschen schon in Urzeiten von entscheidender Bedeutung. Zunächst traf man sich einfach an markanten Orten in der Siedlung oder in der näheren Umgebung. Später wurden spezielle Versammlungsplätze angelegt, die dann immer weiter ausgebaut werden mussten, um der steigenden Anzahl an Individuen genug Platz zu bieten.
TEXT.Polish: Dyskusja (od łac. discussio, aby to omówić) - jeden ze sposobów wymianypoglądów na określony temat, popartych argumentami, prowadzona w gronie dwóch lub więcej osób. Dyskusja może mieć formę ustną (komunikacja werbalna) lub pisemną. W wyniku dyskusji dochodzi do ścierania się różnych poglądów związanych z różnymi punktami widzenia osób prowadzących dyskusję. Określenie zbieżnego (wspólnego) stanowiska, o ile do tego dojdzie, może mieć formę kompromisu lub konsensu.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Community Discussions[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that raises a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production.
TEXT.French: L'Education peut être un problème épineux en tout début de jeu. La mise en place de Discussions Communautaires permet d'augmenter l'éducation, ou au moins de réduire l'hémoragie en mode de difficulté avancé.
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Versammlungsplatz[COLOR_REVERT] steigert den Bildungsstand und den Kulturausstoß der Stadt.

TEXT.English: Computer Center
TEXT.French: Centre Informatique
TEXT.Italian: Centro informatico

TEXT.English: A computer centre is a server building where internet-related data and other information is stored.
TEXT.French: A computer centre is a server building where internet-related data and other information is stored.

TEXT.English: Computer Center grants 1 free technology and increases science output in city by 100%. Assault mech units get +5 free experience when built in this city.
TEXT.French: Computer Center grants 1 free technology and increases science output in city by 100%. Assault mech units get +5 free experience when built in this city.
TEXT.Spanish: El Centro de computación otorga 1 tecnología gratis y aumenta la producción científica de la ciudad en un 100%. Los Robots de combate creados en esta ciudad obtendrán +5 puntos de experiencia gratis.

TEXT.English: Computer Network
TEXT.French: Réseau Informatique
TEXT.Italian: Rete di computer

TEXT.English: A computer network allows computers to communicate with many other and to share resources and information. The Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA) funded the design of the "Advanced Research Projects Agency Network" (ARPANET) for the United States Department of Defense. It was the first operational computer network in the world. Development of the network began in 1969, based on designs begun in the 1960s.[PARAGRAPH:2]Computer networks can be classified according to the hardware and software technology that is used to interconnect the individual devices in the network, such as Optical fiber, Ethernet, Wireless LAN, HomePNA, Power line communication or G.hn. Ethernet uses physical wiring to connect devices. Frequently deployed devices include hubs, switches, bridges and/or routers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Networks are often classified as Local Area Network (LAN), Wide Area Network (WAN), Metropolitan Area Network (MAN), Personal Area Network (PAN), Virtual Private Network (VPN), Campus Area Network (CAN), Storage Area Network (SAN), etc. depending on their scale, scope and purpose. Usage, trust levels and access rights often differ between these types of network - for example, LANs tend to be designed for internal use by an organization's internal systems and employees in individual physical locations (such as a building), while WANs may connect physically separate parts of an organization to each other and may include connections to third parties.
TEXT.French: A computer network allows computers to communicate with many other and to share resources and information. The Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA) funded the design of the "Advanced Research Projects Agency Network" (ARPANET) for the United States Department of Defense. It was the first operational computer network in the world. Development of the network began in 1969, based on designs begun in the 1960s.[PARAGRAPH:2]Computer networks can be classified according to the hardware and software technology that is used to interconnect the individual devices in the network, such as Optical fiber, Ethernet, Wireless LAN, HomePNA, Power line communication or G.hn. Ethernet uses physical wiring to connect devices. Frequently deployed devices include hubs, switches, bridges and/or routers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Networks are often classified as Local Area Network (LAN), Wide Area Network (WAN), Metropolitan Area Network (MAN), Personal Area Network (PAN), Virtual Private Network (VPN), Campus Area Network (CAN), Storage Area Network (SAN), etc. depending on their scale, scope and purpose. Usage, trust levels and access rights often differ between these types of network - for example, LANs tend to be designed for internal use by an organization's internal systems and employees in individual physical locations (such as a building), while WANs may connect physically separate parts of an organization to each other and may include connections to third parties.
TEXT.Polish: Sieć komputerowa - grupa komputerów lub innych urządzeń połączonych ze sobą w celu wymiany danych lub współdzielenia różnych zasobów, na przykład: korzystania ze wspólnych urządzeń, np. drukarek, skanerów, korzystania ze wspólnego oprogramowania, korzystania z centralnej bazy danych, przesyłania informacji między komputerami (komunikaty, listy, pliki).

TEXT.English: Computer Network increases city's wealth and science output but causes some unhealthiness. Required building in the city for many other advanced buildings.
TEXT.French: Computer Network increases city's wealth and science output but causes some unhealthiness. Required building in the city for many other advanced buildings.
TEXT.Spanish: La Red informática aumenta la producción científica y de ingresos de la ciudad, pero causa algo de insalubridad. Se requiere este edificio en la ciudad para otros muchos edificios avanzados.

TEXT.English: Confectioner's Workshop

Confectionery is related to the food items that are rich in sugar and often referred to as a confection. Confectionery refers to the art of creating sugar based dessert forms, or subtleties (subtlety or sotelty), often with pastillage. From the Old French confection, origin of Latin POO, from conficere, to "put together". The confectionery industry also includes specialized training schools and extensive historical records. Traditional confectionery goes back to ancient times, and continued to be eaten through the Middle Ages into the modern era. Confections include sweet foods, sweetmeats, digestive aids that are sweet, elaborate creations, and something amusing and frivolous.
TEXT.French: Confectionery is related to the food items that are rich in sugar and often referred to as a confection. Confectionery refers to the art of creating sugar based dessert forms, or subtleties (subtlety or sotelty), often with pastillage. Traditional confectionery goes back to ancient times, and continued to be eaten through the Middle Ages into the modern era. Confections include sweet foods, sweetmeats, digestive aids that are sweet, elaborate creations, and something amusing and frivolous.
TEXT.Polish: Cukiernik (ciastkarz) - osoba, która wykonuje czynności związane z wypiekiem ciast i ciastek.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Confectioner's Workshop by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Factory (Marzipan)

Confectionery is related to the food items that are rich in sugar and often referred to as a confection. Confectionery refers to the art of creating sugar based dessert forms, or subtleties (subtlety or sotelty), often with pastillage. From the Old French confection, origin of Latin POO, from conficere, to "put together". The confectionery industry also includes specialized training schools and extensive historical records. Traditional confectionery goes back to ancient times, and continued to be eaten through the Middle Ages into the modern era. Confections include sweet foods, sweetmeats, digestive aids that are sweet, elaborate creations, and something amusing and frivolous.

TEXT.Polish: Czekolada - wyrób cukierniczy sporządzany z miazgi kakaowej, tłuszczu kakaowego (masło kakaowe), środka słodzącego i innych dodatków. Według dyrektywy 2000/36/WE czekoladę definiuje się jako wyrób otrzymywany z wyrobów kakaowych i cukrów, który zawiera nie mniej niż 35% suchej masy kakaowej ogółem, w tym nie mniej niż 14% suchej odtłuszczonej masy kakaowej. Wytwarzana w postaci tabliczek czekolady. Pierwsza czekolada w tabliczkach powstała w 1839 r. w Niemczech, wyprodukowana została przez firmę Jordan and Timaeus z kakao, cukru i koziego mleka. W niektórych krajach, np. wMeksyku, powszechniejsza jest czekolada w postaci napoju na wodzie, mleku lub innym płynie. Rzadziej spotyka się czekoladę sproszkowaną lub w granulkach.

TEXT.English: Construction Firm
TEXT.Italian: Ditta di costruzioni

TEXT.English: In the fields of architecture and civil engineering, construction is a process that consists of the building or assembling of infrastructure. Far from being a single activity, large scale construction is a feat of multitasking. Normally the job is managed by the project manager and supervised by the construction manager, design engineer, construction engineer or project architect. For the successful execution of a project, effective planning is essential. Those involved with the design and execution of the infrastructure in question must consider the environmental impact of the job, the successful scheduling, budgeting, site safety, availability of materials, logistics, inconvenience to the public caused by construction delays, preparing tender documents, etc.
TEXT.French: In the fields of architecture and civil engineering, construction is a process that consists of the building or assembling of infrastructure. Far from being a single activity, large scale construction is a feat of multitasking. Normally the job is managed by the project manager and supervised by the construction manager, design engineer, construction engineer or project architect. For the successful execution of a project, effective planning is essential. Those involved with the design and execution of the infrastructure in question must consider the environmental impact of the job, the successful scheduling, budgeting, site safety, availability of materials, logistics, inconvenience to the public caused by construction delays, preparing tender documents, etc.
TEXT.Polish: Budownictwo to dziedzina działalności człowieka związana ze wznoszeniem obiektów budowlanych, podległa dziedzinie nauki jaką jest Inżynieria lądowa. Jest to również gałąź wiedzy praktycznej, techniki stosowanej przy budowaniu. Jego głównym zadaniem jest wznoszenie nowych obiektów budowlanych. Zajmuje się również przebudową, odbudową, modernizacją i konserwacją obiektów już istniejących.

TEXT.English: Increases Production for Buildings.
TEXT.French: Augmente la vitesse de Construction des Bâtiments.
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la producción de edificios.

TEXT.English: Control Center
TEXT.French: Centre de Contrôle
TEXT.Italian: Centro di controllo

TEXT.English: Control Centers are centralized command buildings.
TEXT.French: un Centre de Contrôles are centralized command buildings.

TEXT.English: Control Towers allow player to better manage and train Hi-Tech Units.
TEXT.French: La Tour de Contrôle parmet de mieux gérer et entrâiner les unités Hi-Tech.

TEXT.Spanish: Las Torres de control permiten al jugador una mejor gestión de las unidades de alta tecnología.

TEXT.English: Convention Centre
TEXT.French: Centre de Congrès
TEXT.Italian: Centro congressi

TEXT.English: A convention center, in American English, is an exhibition hall, or conference center, that is designed to hold a convention. In British English very large venues suitable for major trade shows are known as exhibition centers while the term "convention centre" is sometimes used for intermediate venues between exhibitions centers and "conference centers", which are much smaller and contain lecture halls and meeting rooms. Convention centers are typically large, cavernous public buildings with enough open space to host public and private business and social events for their surrounding municipal and metropolitan areas. Convention centers typically offer enough floor area to accommodate several thousand attendees. Convention centers rent space for meetings such as: corporate conferences, industry trade shows, formal dances entertainment spectacles and concerts. The largest in the United States is McCormick Place in Chicago. Large convention centers located in resort areas also host conventions that attract additional visitors to the municipality. It is not uncommon for large resort area hotels to include a convention center.
TEXT.French: A convention center, in American English, is an exhibition hall, or conference center, that is designed to hold a convention. In British English very large venues suitable for major trade shows are known as exhibition centers while the term "convention centre" is sometimes used for intermediate venues between exhibitions centers and "conference centers", which are much smaller and contain lecture halls and meeting rooms. Convention centers are typically large, cavernous public buildings with enough open space to host public and private business and social events for their surrounding municipal and metropolitan areas. Convention centers typically offer enough floor area to accommodate several thousand attendees. Convention centers rent space for meetings such as: corporate conferences, industry trade shows, formal dances entertainment spectacles and concerts. The largest in the United States is McCormick Place in Chicago. Large convention centers located in resort areas also host conventions that attract additional visitors to the municipality. It is not uncommon for large resort area hotels to include a convention center.
TEXT.Polish: Centrum Konferencyjne jest to sala wystawowa, lub centrum konferencyjna, które jest przeznaczone do prowadzenia konferencji.

TEXT.English: Convention Center increases city's culture and makes citizen's happier with higher culture rates
TEXT.French: Convention Center increases city's culture and makes citizen's happier with higher culture rates
TEXT.Spanish: El Pabellón de congresos aumenta la cultura de la ciudad, y hace a los ciudadanos más felices con el aumento del presupuesto cultural.

TEXT.English: Catcher (Cockatoo)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur de cacatoès

TEXT.English: With their perky crest and natural curiosity, cockatoos are among the most well-known and loved members of the parrot family. They are found in Australia and the smaller island countries to the north and west, and they live in forested areas of all types, from eucalyptus groves to pine forests to rain forests.
TEXT.French: With their perky crest and natural curiosity, cockatoos are among the most well-known and loved members of the parrot family. They are found in Australia and the smaller island countries to the north and west, and they live in forested areas of all types, from eucalyptus groves to pine forests to rain forests.
TEXT.Polish: Kakadu palmowa, żałobnica palmowa, kakadu wielka (Probosciger aterrimus) - gatunek ptaka z rodziny kakaduowatych (Cacatuidae), zamieszkujący niziny Nowej Gwinei, do wysokości 1300 m n.p.m.. Występuje także na pobliskich wyspach. W Australii zamieszkuje tylkopółwysep Jork. Jest jedynym przedstawicielem plemienia Microglossini i rodzaju Probosciger.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Canary Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Pistachio[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Copernicus' Observatory

Ancient astronomers originally put forth the theory that the Sun was the center of our solar system, and that the planets revolve around it. This knowledge was lost during the Dark Ages, but was re-introduced in the early 16th Century by Nicholas Copernicus. Copernicus' research and theories form the foundation for modern astronomy. Copernicus collected his data from his observatory, a small room in the spire of an East Prussian cathedral. His research methods and observations also marked the rebirth of the scientific method, and were an important step in the advance of knowledge. -Civ3
TEXT.French: Ancient astronomers originally put forth the theory that the Sun was the center of our solar system, and that the planets revolve around it. This knowledge was lost during the Dark Ages, but was re-introduced in the early 16th Century by Nicholas Copernicus. Copernicus' research and theories form the foundation for modern astronomy. Copernicus collected his data from his observatory, a small room in the spire of an East Prussian cathedral. His research methods and observations also marked the rebirth of the scientific method, and were an important step in the advance of knowledge. -Civ3
TEXT.German: Die Astronomen der Antike vertraten ursprünglich die Theorie, dass die Sonne das Zentrum des Sonnensystems war und die Planeten sie umkreisten. Diese Erkenntnis wurde im Mittelalter vernachlässigt, im frühen 16. Jahrhundert aber von Nikolaus Kopernikus wieder aufgegriffen. Seine Nachforschungen und Theorien lieferten die Grundlage für die moderne Astronomie. Kopernikus sammelte seine Daten in seiner eigenen Sternwarte, einem kleinen Zimmer im Turm einer Kathedrale in Ostpreussen. Seine Forschungsmethoden und Beobachtungen kennzeichneten auch die Wiedergeburt der wissenschaftlichen Methode und waren ein wichtiger Schritt auf dem Weg zur Erweiterung des Wissens. -Civ3
TEXT.Polish: Obserwatorium astronomiczne - zespół budynków i przyrządów służących do prowadzenia obserwacji astronomicznych ciał niebieskich.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Copernicus' Observatory[COLOR_REVERT] increases scientific output in the city in which it is built. Can not be built in same city as Isaac Newton's College or Leonardo's Workshop.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Copernicus' Observatory[COLOR_REVERT] increases scientific output in the city in which it is built. Can not be built in same city as Isaac Newton's College or Leonardo's Workshop.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorio de Copérnico[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta el rendimiento científico en la ciudad en la que se construya. No se puede construir en la misma ciudad que el Colegio de Isaac Newton o el Taller de Leonardo.

TEXT.English: Ancient astronomers originally put forth the theory that the Sun was the center of our solar system, and that the planets revolve around it. This knowledge was lost during the Dark Ages, but was re-introduced in the early 16th Century by Nicholas Copernicus. Copernicus' research and theories form the foundation for modern astronomy. Copernicus collected his data from his observatory, a small room in the spire of an East Prussian cathedral. His research methods and observations also marked the rebirth of the scientific method, and were an important step in the advance of knowledge.
TEXT.French: Ancient astronomers originally put forth the theory that the Sun was the center of our solar system, and that the planets revolve around it. This knowledge was lost during the Dark Ages, but was re-introduced in the early 16th Century by Nicholas Copernicus. Copernicus' research and theories form the foundation for modern astronomy. Copernicus collected his data from his observatory, a small room in the spire of an East Prussian cathedral. His research methods and observations also marked the rebirth of the scientific method, and were an important step in the advance of knowledge.
TEXT.Polish: Mikołaj Kopernik (łac. Nicolaus Copernicus, niem. Nikolaus Kopernikus; ur. 19 lutego 1473 w Toruniu, zm. 24 maja 1543 we Fromborku) - astronom, autor dzieła De revolutionibus orbium coelestium przedstawiającego szczegółowo i w naukowo użytecznej formie heliocentryczną wizję Wszechświata. Wprawdzie koncepcja heliocentryzmu pojawiła się już w starożytnej Grecji (jej twórcą był Arystarch z Samos), to jednak dopiero dzieło Kopernika dokonało przełomu i wywołało jedną z najważniejszych rewolucji naukowych od czasów starożytnych, nazywaną niekiedy "przewrotem kopernikańskim".

TEXT.English: Copper Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Proces odzyskiwania miedzi przebiega w ten sam sposób, jak w procesie jej otrzymywania, z wyjątkiem tego, że wymaga mniejszej ilości etapów. Wysokiej czystości złom jest topiony w piecu, a następnie redukowany i wylewany w postaci kęsów i sztabek; niskiej czystości złom jest poddawany elektrorafinacji w kąpieli kwasu siarkowego.

TEXT.English: Build a Copper Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de recyclage de Cuivre[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à la ressource correspondante.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Copper Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: Coral Castle
TEXT.French: Le Château de Corail

TEXT.English: Coral Castle is a stone structure created by the Latvian Americaneccentric Edward Leedskalnin (1887-1951) north of the city of Homestead, Floridain Miami-Dade County at the intersection of South Dixie Highway (U.S. 1) and SW 157th Avenue. The structure comprises numerous megalithic stones (mostly limestoneformed from coral), each weighing several tons. It currently serves as a privately operated tourist attraction. Coral Castle is noted for legendssurrounding its creation that claim it was built single-handedly by Leedskalnin usingreverse magnetism and/or supernatural abilities to move and carve numerous stones weighing many tons.
TEXT.French: Coral Castle is a stone structure created by the Latvian Americaneccentric Edward Leedskalnin (1887-1951) north of the city of Homestead, Floridain Miami-Dade County at the intersection of South Dixie Highway (U.S. 1) and SW 157th Avenue. The structure comprises numerous megalithic stones (mostly limestoneformed from coral), each weighing several tons. It currently serves as a privately operated tourist attraction. Coral Castle is noted for legendssurrounding its creation that claim it was built single-handedly by Leedskalnin usingreverse magnetism and/or supernatural abilities to move and carve numerous stones weighing many tons.
TEXT.Polish: Koralowy Zamek - budowla wzniesiona przez eskcentrycznego milionera w mieście Homestead na terenie stanu Floryda, USA, w pierwszej połowie XX wieku. Zamek zbudowany na podobieństwo koralowca otacza wiele legend.
