TEXT.English: Guild (Carpenters Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Charpentiers
TEXT.Italian: Sede della gilda dei carpentieri

TEXT.English: Guild (Clerks Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Clercs
TEXT.Italian: Sala della gilda degli scrivani

TEXT.English: Guild (Drapers Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Tailleurs
TEXT.Italian: Sede della gilda dei drappieri

TEXT.English: Guild (Equestrians Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des écuyers
TEXT.Italian: Sede della gilda dei cavalieri

TEXT.English: Guild (Fishmongers Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Poissoniers

TEXT.English: Guild (Glassblowers Master)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Souffleurs de Verre

TEXT.English: Guild (Goldsmiths Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Orfèvres

TEXT.English: Guild (Grocers Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Epiciers

TEXT.English: Guild (Masons Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Maçons

TEXT.English: Guild (Mercers Masters)
TEXT.French: Le Siège de la Guilde des Marchands

TEXT.English: The Council of Elders
TEXT.French: Conseil des Anciens
TEXT.Italian: Concilio degli anziani

TEXT.English: In Sparta the council of elders known as the Gerousia. The Gerousia consisted of 28 elders over the age of 60, elected for life and usually part of the royal households, and the two kings. High state policy decisions were discussed by this council who could then propose action alternatives to the Damos, the collective body of Spartan citizenry, who would select one of the alternatives by voting.
TEXT.French: In Sparta the council of elders known as the Gerousia. The Gerousia consisted of 28 elders over the age of 60, elected for life and usually part of the royal households, and the two kings. High state policy decisions were discussed by this council who could then propose action alternatives to the Damos, the collective body of Spartan citizenry, who would select one of the alternatives by voting.
TEXT.Italian: A Sparta il concilio deli anziani era noto come Gerousia; consisteva di 28 anziani con più di 60 anni, eletti a vita e parte della famiglia reale, e di due re. Le decisioni importanti venivano discusse da questo concilio, che poteva poi sottoporre le questioni al Damos, l'assemblea dei cittadini Spartani, che poteva esprimersi votando.
TEXT.Polish: Geruzja, rada starszych - w starożytnej Sparcie, główny organ władzy w oligarchii spartańskiej. W jej skład wchodziłodwóch królów, oraz 28 starszych obywateli - gerontów. Byli oni wybrani przez Zgromadzenie Ludowe z grona obywateli powyżej 60. roku życia. Najczęściej należeli do warstwy najbogatszych. Swą funkcję sprawowali dożywotnio. Do ich zadań należało przygotowywanie pod przewodnictwem eforów uchwał głosowanych później na zgromadzeniu. W wielu ważnych sprawach rada pełniła też funkcje trybunału najwyższej instancji.

TEXT.English: Build The council of elders to increase the science output of your cities.
TEXT.French: Construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Conseil des Anciens[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production scientifique de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Concilio degli anziani per incrementare la scienza delle tue città.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye el Consejo de ancianos para aumentar la producción científica de tus ciudades.

TEXT.English: National Courier System
TEXT.French: La Poste nationale
TEXT.Italian: Sistema postale nazionale

TEXT.English: A courier is a person or a company who delivers messages, packages, and mail. Couriers are distinguished from ordinary mail services by features such as speed, security, tracking, signature, specialization and individualization of services, and committed delivery times, which are optional for most everyday mail services. As a premium service, couriers are usually more expensive than usual mail services, and their use is typically restricted to packages where one or more of these features are considered important enough to warrant the cost. [PARAGRAPH:2]A courier system is one in which an individual or collection of people work to deliver packages and/or messages to the places they are intended to be delivered to. Older courier systems include the Pony Express, and newer include modern, motorised mail systems, and air mail.
TEXT.French: A courier is a person or a company who delivers messages, packages, and mail. Couriers are distinguished from ordinary mail services by features such as speed, security, tracking, signature, specialization and individualization of services, and committed delivery times, which are optional for most everyday mail services. As a premium service, couriers are usually more expensive than usual mail services, and their use is typically restricted to packages where one or more of these features are considered important enough to warrant the cost. [PARAGRAPH:2]A courier system is one in which an individual or collection of people work to deliver packages and/or messages to the places they are intended to be delivered to. Older courier systems include the Pony Express, and newer include modern, motorised mail systems, and air mail.

TEXT.English: With National Courier System the important military messages and news spread faster throughout your empire. This decreases the effects of anarchy periods and more great people appear among your citizens.
TEXT.French: Avec [COLOR_BUiLDING_TEXT]La Poste nationale[COLOR_REVERT], les messages importants et les nouvelles se répandent plus vite au sein de l'Empire. Réduit le temps d'anarchie, et encourage l'apparition des personnage illustres.
TEXT.Spanish: Con la Red postal nacional las misivas e informes militares importantes se transportarán más rápido a través de tu imperio. Esto reducirá los efectos de los periodos de anarquía, y aparecerán más Grandes personajes por tus ciudades.

TEXT.English: Courthouse

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouses[COLOR_REVERT] lower city maintenance costs, provide you with a bonus to espionage and are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouses[COLOR_REVERT] help manage the cost of controlling large empires.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribunaux[COLOR_REVERT] réduisent le coût d'entretien des villes, procurent un bonus en espionnage et facilitent la gestion des grands empires. Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribunaux[COLOR_REVERT] sont nécessaires pour construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cité interdite[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]reduziert städtische Unterhaltungskosten deutlich[COLOR_REVERT], besonders wichtig für größere Reiche, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]steigert die Geheimdienstleistung[COLOR_REVERT], erforderlich für das Nationalwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Verbotene Stadt[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunali[COLOR_REVERT] riducono i costi di mantenimento, danno un bonus di Spionaggio e sono necessari per la costruzione della Meraviglia Nazionale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palazzo Proibito[COLOR_REVERT]. I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunali[COLOR_REVERT] aiutano a ridurre il costo del controllo sugli imperi più vasti.
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Delegaciones[COLOR_REVERT] reducen los costes de mantenimiento de la ciudad, proporcionan una bonificación al espionaje y permiten construir la maravilla nacional de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ciudad Prohibida[COLOR_REVERT]. También ayudan a gestionar el coste que supone controlar un gran imperio.

TEXT.English: Crafts Hut
TEXT.Italian: Capanna dell'artigiano

TEXT.English: Arts and crafts comprise a whole host of activities and hobbies that are related to making things with one's hands and skill.
TEXT.French: Arts and crafts comprise a whole host of activities and hobbies that are related to making things with one's hands and skill.
TEXT.Italian: Arti e mestieri comprendono una serie di attività e hobby legati a costruire gli oggetti con abilità artigianali.
TEXT.Polish: Rzemiosło rozwijalo sie w Polsce juz w okresie wczesnopiastowskim. W XIII wieku powstaly pierwsze cechy. Po zakonczeniu II wojny swiatowej, w niesprzyjajacych warunkach politycznych i gospodarczych, rzemioslo przystapilo do odtwarzania swego potencjalu. W 1947 r. w Polsce dzialalo: 138 tys. zarejestrowanych zakladów z 311 tysiacami zatrudnionych, 1500 cechów branzowych, 300 powiatowych zwiazków cechów, 14 izb rzemieslniczych oraz Zwiazek Izb Rzemieslniczych.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Crafts Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production while also providing [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. Having access to specific resources ([COLOR_CYAN]Baskets[COLOR_REVERT], for example) can further increase a city's total [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] output by a given percentage up to a maximum of [COLOR_GREEN]+8%[COLOR_REVERT]. It also raises [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cabane d'Outilleur[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter vos richesses et la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una capanna dell'artigiano per incrementare la ricchezza e la cultura delle tue città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Crafts Hut by zwiększyć kulturę i bogactwo w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Creative Constructions Contractors
TEXT.Italian: Impresa edile di Costruzioni creative

TEXT.English: Increases production if the resources needed by the Creative Constructions corporation are present in the city.
TEXT.French: Augmente la production si les ressources requises par [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constructions Créatives[COLOR_REVERT] sont disponibles dans la ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Incrementa la producción si la ciudad tiene acceso a los recursos necesarios por la corporación Creative Constructions.

TEXT.English: Cricket Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de grillons

TEXT.English: Crickets are eaten fried, sauteed, boiled, and roasted, these are amongst the most common insects eaten. Eaten in Mexico, Thailand, Cambodia.
TEXT.French: Crickets are eaten fried, sauteed, boiled, and roasted, these are amongst the most common insects eaten. Eaten in Mexico, Thailand, Cambodia.
TEXT.Polish: Świerszczowate, świerszcze (Gryllidae) - rodzina owadów prostoskrzydłych (Orthoptera), długoczułkowych (Ensifera), obejmująca około 900 gatunków występujących na wszystkich kontynentach, poza Antarktydą. Większość gatunków występuje w strefie tropikalnej. W Europie stwierdzono występowanie 63 gatunków, a w Polsce 6. Typem nomenklatorycznym rodziny jest Gryllus.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Spices[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cricket Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Epices[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de grillons[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Cricket Sanctuary
TEXT.French: Refuge de Criquets

TEXT.English: Crickets are eaten fried, sauteed, boiled, and roasted, these are amongst the most common insects eaten. Eaten in Mexico, Thailand, Cambodia.
TEXT.French: Crickets are eaten fried, sauteed, boiled, and roasted, these are amongst the most common insects eaten. Eaten in Mexico, Thailand, Cambodia.
TEXT.Polish: Świerszczowate, świerszcze (Gryllidae) - rodzina owadówprostoskrzydłych (Orthoptera), długoczułkowych (Ensifera), obejmująca około 900 gatunków występujących na wszystkich kontynentach, pozaAntarktydą. Większość gatunków występuje w strefie tropikalnej. W Europie stwierdzono występowanie 63 gatunków, a w Polsce 6. Typem nomenklatorycznym rodziny jest Gryllus.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Spices[COLOR_REVERT] in a city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cricket Sanctuary[COLOR_REVERT]. It also requires its Gatherer Building from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sericulture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Epices[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de la ville pour pouvoir construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refuge de Criquets[COLOR_REVERT]. Il faut également avoir le bâtiment de récolteur provenant de [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sériculture[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Cristo Redentor
King Richard's Crusade
TEXT.French: Croisade du Roi Richard
TEXT.Italian: Crociata di Re Riccardo

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Crusader[COLOR_REVERT] Every Few Turns
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]Aide : [COLOR_REVERT]Un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Croisé[COLOR_REVERT] gratuit à chaque tour
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cruzado[COLOR_REVERT] gratis cada cierto número de turnos

TEXT.English: The Crusades were a series of military expeditions by European Christians between 1095 and 1270 A.D. intended to recapture the Christian Holy Land from Muslim control. The most successful was the Third Crusade, in which a tremendous force led by King Richard I and Philip Augustus managed to regain control over a number of cities along the Mediterranean coast and reconstitute the Latin Kingdom of Palestine. In addition to their more altruistic goals, the Crusades also served to extend the political and religious power of the Pope over a larger area of the world. This great burst of territorial expansion led to an increase in both the population and productivity of Europe. The ongoing wars provided lucrative business for Western European traders and merchants.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Knights Templar was a holy order devoted to defending the fledgling crusader states founded during the First Crusade against Muslim reconquest. The king of Jerusalem allowed them to make their headquarters in the main temple of Jerusalem, from which they took their name. In exchange for this hospitality they swore allegiance to the throne of Jerusalem. They participated in several major battles and did very well; this increased their numbers substantially. Eventually their power grew so much -- to the point where they could field an army of almost 10,000 knights and still uphold their promises to garrison individual towns -- that the Pope decided to place them under his direct control.[PARAGRAPH:2]Templar valor in the Holy Land resulted in many rewards back in Europe; knights who fought under the red cross and white field of the Templars often found themselves with new estates and castles in their native countries. As a result the order became fantastically wealthy, as the Grandmasters shrewdly invested the order's wealth, using plunder to buy goods and sell them throughout the Mediterranean.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kings, however, often become jealous of wealthy organizations over which they have little or no control. The French king Philip IV, his treasury emptied and his debts monstrous from constant warfare, accused the Templars of heresy and blasphemy, and confiscated almost all of their wealth in France. Other monarchs followed suit, embarking on a program of persecution and repression whose goal was mostly to secure the Templars' money for themselves. Hundreds of Templars gave false confessions of heresy under torture, and others were burned at the stake. The order died out completely in the early 14th century when the entire Templar leadership had been murdered.
TEXT.French: The Crusades were a series of military expeditions by European Christians between 1095 and 1270 A.D. intended to recapture the Christian Holy Land from Muslim control. The most successful was the Third Crusade, in which a tremendous force led by King Richard I and Philip Augustus managed to regain control over a number of cities along the Mediterranean coast and reconstitute the Latin Kingdom of Palestine. In addition to their more altruistic goals, the Crusades also served to extend the political and religious power of the Pope over a larger area of the world. This great burst of territorial expansion led to an increase in both the population and productivity of Europe. The ongoing wars provided lucrative business for Western European traders and merchants.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Knights Templar was a holy order devoted to defending the fledgling crusader states founded during the First Crusade against Muslim reconquest. The king of Jerusalem allowed them to make their headquarters in the main temple of Jerusalem, from which they took their name. In exchange for this hospitality they swore allegiance to the throne of Jerusalem. They participated in several major battles and did very well; this increased their numbers substantially. Eventually their power grew so much -- to the point where they could field an army of almost 10,000 knights and still uphold their promises to garrison individual towns -- that the Pope decided to place them under his direct control.[PARAGRAPH:2]Templar valor in the Holy Land resulted in many rewards back in Europe; knights who fought under the red cross and white field of the Templars often found themselves with new estates and castles in their native countries. As a result the order became fantastically wealthy, as the Grandmasters shrewdly invested the order's wealth, using plunder to buy goods and sell them throughout the Mediterranean.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kings, however, often become jealous of wealthy organizations over which they have little or no control. The French king Philip IV, his treasury emptied and his debts monstrous from constant warfare, accused the Templars of heresy and blasphemy, and confiscated almost all of their wealth in France. Other monarchs followed suit, embarking on a program of persecution and repression whose goal was mostly to secure the Templars' money for themselves. Hundreds of Templars gave false confessions of heresy under torture, and others were burned at the stake. The order died out completely in the early 14th century when the entire Templar leadership had been murdered.
TEXT.Polish: Krucjata, wyprawa krzyżowa, ( łac. Crux - Krzyż) to popularna nazwa wojny prowadzonej przez chrześcijan przeciw wyznawcom innych religii (np. islamu) lub wyznań (np. albigensi) ze względów religijnych, np. w celu odzyskania terytoriów o znaczeniu religijnym, takich jak Palestyna, choć często stanowić to mogło jedynie pretekst do grabieży i gwałtów. Przypadek taki w całej wyrazistości ilustruje IV krucjata.Najbardziej znanymi krucjatami były: Rekonkwista - wojny prowadzone od VIII do XV wieku na Półwyspie Iberyjskim przeciw istniejącym tam państwom arabskim. Wyprawy krzyżowe - prowadzone w XI, XII i XIII wieku w celu odzyskania Ziemi Świętej, a zwłaszcza Jerozolimy. Krucjaty połabskie - zbrojne próby chrystianizacji Słowian połabskich podejmowane w XII wieku. Krucjaty pruskie - zbrojne wyprawy chrystianizujące pogańskich Prusów i Jaćwingów. Wojny husyckie - zbrojne działania prowadzone głównie przez Zygmunta Luksemburskiego przeciwko powstaniu czeskich husytów. Krucjaty antytureckie - ogłaszane przez papieży do walki z postępującym w Europie Imperium Osmańskim Krucjaty przeciwko Katarom - na początku XIII w. na terenie południowej Francji, skierowane przeciwko Katarom Krucjata przeciwko waldensom - w drugiej połowie XV w. na pograniczu Francji i Sabaudii, skierowana przeciwko waldensom.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]King Richard's Crusade[COLOR_REVERT] grants you a production and commerce bonus in the city where it is built. It also increases your great general output within your borders.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]King Richard's Crusade[COLOR_REVERT] grants you a production and commerce bonus in the city where it is built. It also increases your great general output within your borders.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cruzada del Rey Ricardo[COLOR_REVERT] te otorga una bonificación a la producción y al comercio en la ciudad donde se construya. Además, aumenta la tasa de aparición de Grandes generales dentro de tus fronteras.

TEXT.English: Culinary School

A cooking school or culinary school is an institution devoted to education in the art and science of food preparation. It also awards degrees which indicate that a student has undergone a particular curriculum and therefore displays a certain level of competency. Cooking schools are often associated with public restaurants where a student can acquire experience in working in a real environment and perform in many roles.
TEXT.French: A cooking school or culinary school is an institution devoted to education in the art and science of food preparation. It also awards degrees which indicate that a student has undergone a particular curriculum and therefore displays a certain level of competency. Cooking schools are often associated with public restaurants where a student can acquire experience in working in a real environment and perform in many roles.
TEXT.Polish: Kucharz - osoba, która przyrządza zgodnie z zasadami sztuki kulinarnej potrawy w zakładach gastronomicznych, najczęściej według zamówienia przyjętego przez kelnera. Kucharze - w okresie wczesnego średniowiecza grupa książęcej ludności służebnej, która zajmowała się przygotowaniem jedzenia dla monarchy.

TEXT.English: Build a Culinary School to increase your cities food.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ecole de cuisine[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la nourriture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Culinary School by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Achievement (Cultural)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement Culturel
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo culturale

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cultural Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives a +8% culture bonus in all cities, as well as a +25% great people growth rate in all cities.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accomplissement Culturel[COLOR_REVERT] requiert [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi qu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héro National[COLOR_REVERT] pour être construit. Il donne +8% bonus de culture dans toutes les villes, ainsi que +25% taux d'apparition des personnages illustres dans toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro cultural[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da una bonificación a la cultura (+8%) y un aumento del 25% de la tasa de nacimiento de Grandes personajes en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Kulturowe[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Zwiększa kulturę o +8% oraz tempo narodzin wielkich ludzi o +25% we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: Cultural Inheritance
TEXT.Italian: Trasmissione della cultura

TEXT.English: Liangzhu
TEXT.French: Liangzhu

TEXT.English: In June 2006, archaeological excavations near Hangzhou, in Zhejiang province, led to the identification of the largest and earliest walled city in ancient China. Located south of the Yangzi River, the enormous settlement has been named Liangzhu after the modern site where evidence of the culture was first discovered in the early twentieth century. Following study of the many remarkable remains associated with these Neolithic (or New Stone Age) peoples, including palace foundations, royal tombs, craft workshops, and sophisticated jades, archaeologists date the influential Liangzhu culture from 3300 to 2250 BCE.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Liangzhu must have placed great value on jade, judging by the high number and outstanding quality of jades found in their tombs. Since they did not have a system of writing, no records remain describing their historic events, religious beliefs, or leaders. Consequently, the meaning of objects, their specific origins, and the significance of their shapes and surface decorations are still unknown. How the Liangzhu regarded these bi and cong in ritual burials is difficult to surmise, yet they obviously held jade in high esteem, considering the untold hours required to craft these disks, tubes, and blades from an unyielding material.[PARAGRAPH:2]Liangzhu patterns of jade use spread to other Neolithic cultures, including the Qijia and Sanxingdui, via Chinas vast river systems. The influence of the prehistoric Liangzhu culture continued for centuries and can be found in early Bronze Age centers, such as Anyang, the capital of the late Shang dynasty. [PARAGRAPH:2]Source: The Smithsonian' s Museums of Asian Art
TEXT.French: In June 2006, archaeological excavations near Hangzhou, in Zhejiang province, led to the identification of the largest and earliest walled city in ancient China. Located south of the Yangzi River, the enormous settlement has been named Liangzhu after the modern site where evidence of the culture was first discovered in the early twentieth century. Following study of the many remarkable remains associated with these Neolithic (or New Stone Age) peoples, including palace foundations, royal tombs, craft workshops, and sophisticated jades, archaeologists date the influential Liangzhu culture from 3300 to 2250 BCE.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Liangzhu must have placed great value on jade, judging by the high number and outstanding quality of jades found in their tombs. How the Liangzhu regarded these bi and cong in ritual burials is difficult to surmise, yet they obviously held jade in high esteem, considering the untold hours required to craft these disks, tubes, and blades from an unyielding material.[PARAGRAPH:2]Liangzhu patterns of jade use spread to other Neolithic cultures, including the Qijia and Sanxingdui, via Chinas vast river systems. The influence of the prehistoric Liangzhu culture continued for centuries and can be found in early Bronze Age centers, such as Anyang, the capital of the late Shang dynasty. [PARAGRAPH:2]Source: The Smithsonian' s Museums of Asian Art
TEXT.Polish: Starożytna kultura z terenów współczesnych Chin.

TEXT.English: Flavour culture for the Chinese culture. Allows special Jade buildings and trade goods.
TEXT.French: Flavour culture for the Chinese culture. Allows special Jade buildings and trade goods.

TEXT.English: Native Culture
Culture - a particular form or stage of civilization, as that of a certain nation or period.
TEXT.French: Culture - une forme ou état de la civilisation, correspondant à une nation ou période.
TEXT.German: Im weitesten Sinn ist [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kultur[COLOR_REVERT] im Gegensatz zur Natur all das, was der Mensch selbst erschaffen hat. Im engeren Sinn werden als Kulturen Gruppen von Menschen bezeichnet, die sich durch jeweils bestimmte Wertvorstellungen, soziale Normen, Sitten und Gebräuche auszeichnen und vor allem voneinander unterscheiden.
TEXT.Italian: Cultura - una certa forma o stadio di una civiltà, durante un certo periodo o un certo governo.
TEXT.Polish: Kultura - pewna forma lub poziom rozwoju cywilizacji w historii.

TEXT.English: Customs Office
TEXT.French: Bureau des Douanes
TEXT.Italian: Ufficio della dogana

TEXT.English: Cyber Chloroplastida Bloom
Cybernetic green algae, green seaweeds, and planktonic protists that are colonized near a water source by heavy industrial areas to remove air and water pollution.
TEXT.French: Cybernetic green algae, green seaweeds, and planktonic protists that are colonized near a water source by heavy industrial areas to remove air and water pollution.

TEXT.English: Build a Cyber Chloroplastida Bloom to decrease your cities pollution.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fleurs cybernétiques en chloroplastique[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer la pollution de votre ville.

TEXT.English: Cyberimmuniology Therapy Clinic

Cyberimmuniology Therapy uses nanorobots injected into the patient to perform work at a cellular level. Such nanorobots intended for use in medicine should be non-replicating, as replication would needlessly increase device complexity, reduce reliability, and interfere with the medical mission. Cyberimmuniology Therapy provides a wide range of new technologies for developing customized solutions that optimize the delivery of pharmaceutical products. Today, harmful side effects of treatments such as chemotherapy are commonly a result of drug delivery methods that don't pinpoint their intended target cells accurately. This directed method of drug delivery has great potential for treating cancer patients while avoiding negative effects (commonly associated with improper drug delivery). Another useful application of Cyberimmuniology Therapy is assisting in the repair of tissue cells alongside white blood cells. The recruitment of inflammatory cells or white blood cells (which include neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes and mast cells) to the affected area is the first response of tissues to injury. Because of their small size nanorobots could attach themselves to the surface of recruited white cells, to squeeze their way out through the walls of blood vessels and arrive at the injury site, where they can assist in the tissue repair process. Certain substances could be utilized to accelerate the recovery. The science behind this mechanism is quite complex. Passage of cells across the blood endothelium, a process known as transmigration, is a mechanism involving engagement of cell surface receptors to adhesion molecules, active force exertion and dilation of the vessel walls and physical deformation of the migrating cells. By attaching themselves to migrating inflammatory cells, the robots can in effect "hitch a ride" across the blood vessels, bypassing the need for a complex transmigration mechanism of their own.
TEXT.French: Cyberimmuniology Therapy uses nanorobots injected into the patient to perform work at a cellular level. Such nanorobots intended for use in medicine should be non-replicating, as replication would needlessly increase device complexity, reduce reliability, and interfere with the medical mission. Cyberimmuniology Therapy provides a wide range of new technologies for developing customized solutions that optimize the delivery of pharmaceutical products. Today, harmful side effects of treatments such as chemotherapy are commonly a result of drug delivery methods that don't pinpoint their intended target cells accurately. This directed method of drug delivery has great potential for treating cancer patients while avoiding negative effects (commonly associated with improper drug delivery). Another useful application of Cyberimmuniology Therapy is assisting in the repair of tissue cells alongside white blood cells. The recruitment of inflammatory cells or white blood cells (which include neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes and mast cells) to the affected area is the first response of tissues to injury. Because of their small size nanorobots could attach themselves to the surface of recruited white cells, to squeeze their way out through the walls of blood vessels and arrive at the injury site, where they can assist in the tissue repair process. Certain substances could be utilized to accelerate the recovery. The science behind this mechanism is quite complex. Passage of cells across the blood endothelium, a process known as transmigration, is a mechanism involving engagement of cell surface receptors to adhesion molecules, active force exertion and dilation of the vessel walls and physical deformation of the migrating cells. By attaching themselves to migrating inflammatory cells, the robots can in effect "hitch a ride" across the blood vessels, bypassing the need for a complex transmigration mechanism of their own.

TEXT.English: Factory (Neuroimplants)

Cybernetics is a transdisciplinary approach for exploring regulatory systems, their structures, constraints, and possibilities. Cybernetics is relevant to the study of systems, such as mechanical, physical, biological, cognitive, and social systems. Cybernetics is applicable when a system being analyzed is involved in a closed signaling loop; that is, where action by the system generates some change in its environment and that change is reflected in that system in some manner (feedback) that triggers a system change, originally referred to as a "circular causal" relationship. Some say this is necessary to a cybernetic perspective. System dynamics, a related field, originated with applications of electrical engineering control theory to other kinds of simulation models (especially business systems) by Jay Forrester at MIT in the 1950s.
TEXT.French: Cybernetics is a transdisciplinary approach for exploring regulatory systems, their structures, constraints, and possibilities. Cybernetics is relevant to the study of systems, such as mechanical, physical, biological, cognitive, and social systems. Cybernetics is applicable when a system being analyzed is involved in a closed signaling loop; that is, where action by the system generates some change in its environment and that change is reflected in that system in some manner (feedback) that triggers a system change, originally referred to as a "circular causal" relationship. Some say this is necessary to a cybernetic perspective. System dynamics, a related field, originated with applications of electrical engineering control theory to other kinds of simulation models (especially business systems) by Jay Forrester at MIT in the 1950s.

TEXT.English: Dattoo Parlor

Electronically injected nanogenerators that activate to form a "digital tattoo". They morph into an interactive display which can also monitor your health, social networks, financial stocks, and activate with tactile touch. The most common location are the arms for interaction, and chest for health information. They can sync to augmented reality glasses. When not in use, beautiful "tattoo screensavers" appear. With more sophisticated nanotechnology/synthetic biology we will be able to create more machines which can exist within the body and interact/control them externally. There is also a lot of potential for interfaces which can draw power from the body itself, saving on costly and bulky batteries.
TEXT.French: Electronically injected nanogenerators that activate to form a "digital tattoo". They morph into an interactive display which can also monitor your health, social networks, financial stocks, and activate with tactile touch. The most common location are the arms for interaction, and chest for health information. They can sync to augmented reality glasses. When not in use, beautiful "tattoo screensavers" appear. With more sophisticated nanotechnology/synthetic biology we will be able to create more machines which can exist within the body and interact/control them externally. There is also a lot of potential for interfaces which can draw power from the body itself, saving on costly and bulky batteries.

TEXT.English: Debtor's Prison

A debtors' prison is a prison for people who are unable to pay debt. These prisons have been used since ancient times. Through the mid 19th century, debtors' prisons were a common way to deal with unpaid debt in Western Europe. Though increasing access and lenience throughout the history of bankruptcy law have rendered debtors' prisons irrelevant over most of the world, as of May 2013, they persist in countries such as the United Arab Emirates, Hong Kong, and Greece.
TEXT.French: A debtors' prison is a prison for people who are unable to pay debt. These prisons have been used since ancient times. Through the mid 19th century, debtors' prisons were a common way to deal with unpaid debt in Western Europe. Though increasing access and lenience throughout the history of bankruptcy law have rendered debtors' prisons irrelevant over most of the world, as of May 2013, they persist in countries such as the United Arab Emirates, Hong Kong, and Greece.
TEXT.Polish: Więzienie specjalnie przeznaczone dla osób zalegających ze spłacaniem należności.

Te mają być dostarczane. dronami. Realizacja zamówienia będzie zajmować zaledwie kilkadziesiąt minut. CEO Amazona mówi, że opcja może wejść w życie już w 2015 roku. Niestety to nie tylko zbyt optymistyczne wizje, ale wręcz niemożliwe.

TEXT.English: Delta Assembler

The Delta Assembler uses multidimensional assembly language and visual recognition to design and manufacture complex electronics. It can mass produce, droids, nanoelectronics, androids, warmachines, and nanobots.
TEXT.French: The Delta Assembler uses multidimensional assembly language and visual recognition to design and manufacture complex electronics. It can mass produce, droids, nanoelectronics, androids, warmachines, and nanobots.
TEXT.Polish: Replikator to fikcyjne urządzenie istniejące w uniwersum Star Trek. Replikator potrafi tworzyć materię z energii, dzięki technologii zamieniania energii w molekuły według danego wzorca. Jest powszechnie wykorzystywany wGwiezdnej Flocie, najczęściej do "tworzenia" (powielania) żywności. W kilka sekund może powstać dowolnie wybrane danie, praktycznie nieróżniące się smakiem od oryginału.

TEXT.French: The Department of Energy is responsible for electricity production, use and distribution throughout the Empire.
TEXT.Italian: Il Ministero dell'energia ha la responsabilità della produzione, dell'uso e della distribuzione dell'elettricità nel tuo impero.
TEXT.Polish: Ministerstwo Energii zajmuje się zarządzaniem siecią energetyczną i elektrowniami w Twoim imperiun.

TEXT.Italian: Ministero dei trasporti

TEXT.English: In the United States of America, a Department of Motor Vehicles (or DMV) is a state-level government agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
TEXT.French: In the United States of America, a Department of Motor Vehicles (or DMV) is a state-level government agency that administers vehicle registration and driver licensing.
TEXT.Italian: Negli Stati Uniti, il Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) è un'agenzia federale che controlla la registrazione dei veicoli e le patenti di guida.
TEXT.Polish: Właściwością Ministra Transportu było kierowanie działem administracji rządowej "transport",

TEXT.English: Department of Water

The Department of Water provides information to industry, technical support and professional guidance to government on the status of water and the viability of new water source developments. It also issues licences for groundwater wells throughout the Empire.
TEXT.French: The Department of Water provides information to industry, technical support and professional guidance to government on the status of water and the viability of new water source developments. It also issues licences for groundwater wells throughout the Empire.

TEXT.English: Build Department of Water to get FREE Water Pipes in Every City.
TEXT.French: Construisez le Service des Eaux pour obtenir des Canalisations gratuites dans toutes vos villes.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Dipartimento dell'acqua potabile per ottenere tubi dell'acqua gratuiti in ogni città.

TEXT.English: Design Studio
TEXT.French: Studio de Design
TEXT.Italian: Studio di design

TEXT.English: A design studio is a place where video games and other software applications are designed and developed.
TEXT.French: A design studio is a place where video games and other software applications are designed and developed.
TEXT.Polish: Studio projektowe to miejsce w którym projektuje się gry i programy komputerowe.

TEXT.English: Design Studio increases city's wealth if city is provided with electricity. Grants +1 free scientist and access to Programmer units that can heal Tech units.
TEXT.French: Design Studio increases city's wealth if city is provided with electricity. Grants +1 free scientist and access to Programmer units that can heal Tech units.
TEXT.Spanish: El Estudio de diseño aumenta el oro de la ciudad si ésta se encuentra abastecida de electricidad. Otorga +1 Ingeniero gratis.

TEXT.English: Designer Probiotics Clinic

The body is highly dependent on bacteria living in and on it. The bacteria of every person is different and can vary greatly. To increase people's health, bacteria specially designed for their needs are seeded in and on them.
TEXT.French: The body is highly dependent on bacteria living in and on it. The bacteria of every person is different and can vary greatly. To increase people's health, bacteria specially designed for their needs are seeded in and on them.
TEXT.Polish: Probiotyki (gr. pro bios - dla życia), zwane również czynnościową żywnością - podawane doustnie wyselekcjonowane kultury bakteryjne lub drożdży, najczęściej bakterie kwasu mlekowego (Lactobacillus), których zadaniem jest korzystne dla zdrowia działanie w przewodzie pokarmowym, poprzez immunomodulację oraz zachowywanie prawidłowej flory fizjologicznej. W większości przypadków korzystne oddziaływania probiotyków dotyczą wyłącznie warunków in vitro. Zaproponowano, że jeżeli wpływ drobnoustrojów na leczenie choroby zostałzbadany naukowo i ma dowiedzioną skuteczność, należy używać nazwy czynnik bioleczniczy.

TEXT.English: Monument of the Dictator

A cult of personality arises when a country's leader uses mass media to create a heroic public image, often through unquestioning flattery and praise. Cults of personality are often found in dictatorships and Stalinist type governments. A cult of personality is similar to general hero worship, except that it is created specifically for political leaders. However, the term may be applied by analogy to refer to adulation of religious or non-political leaders.
TEXT.French: A cult of personality arises when a country's leader uses mass media to create a heroic public image, often through unquestioning flattery and praise. Cults of personality are often found in dictatorships and Stalinist type governments. However, the term may be applied by analogy to refer to adulation of religious or non-political leaders.

TEXT.English: Digital Advertising Firm

Online advertising, also called Internet advertising, uses the Internet to deliver promotional marketing messages to consumers. It includes email marketing, search engine marketing, social media marketing, many types of display advertising (including web banner advertising), and mobile advertising. Like other advertising media, online advertising frequently involves both a publisher, who integrates advertisements into its online content, and an advertiser, who provides the advertisements to be displayed on the publisher's content. Other potential participants include advertising agencies who help generate and place the ad copy, an ad server who technologically delivers the ad and tracks statistics, and advertising affiliates who do independent promotional work for the advertiser.
TEXT.French: Online advertising, also called Internet advertising, uses the Internet to deliver promotional marketing messages to consumers. It includes email marketing, search engine marketing, social media marketing, many types of display advertising (including web banner advertising), and mobile advertising. Like other advertising media, online advertising frequently involves both a publisher, who integrates advertisements into its online content, and an advertiser, who provides the advertisements to be displayed on the publisher's content. Other potential participants include advertising agencies who help generate and place the ad copy, an ad server who technologically delivers the ad and tracks statistics, and advertising affiliates who do independent promotional work for the advertiser.

Termin "multimedia" ma również zastosowanie w mediach elektronicznych służących do rejestrowania oraz odtwarzania treści multimedialnych. Multimedia posiadają cechy tradycyjnych technik mieszanych i sztuk pięknych, jednak mają szerszy zakres. Termin bogate media jest synonimem terminu multimedia interaktywne.

TEXT.English: Digital Art Museum

Digital art is a general term for a range of artistic works and practices that use digital technology as an essential part of the creative and/or presentation process. Since the 1970s, various names have been used to describe the process including computer art and multimedia art, and digital art is itself placed under the larger umbrella term new media art. After some initial resistance, the impact of digital technology has transformed activities such as painting, drawing, sculpture and music/sound art, while new forms, such as net art, digital installation art, and virtual reality, have become recognized artistic practices. More generally the term digital artist is used to describe an artist who makes use of digital technologies in the production of art. In an expanded sense, "digital art" is a term applied to contemporary art that uses the methods of mass production or digital media.
TEXT.French: Digital art is a general term for a range of artistic works and practices that use digital technology as an essential part of the creative and/or presentation process. Since the 1970s, various names have been used to describe the process including computer art and multimedia art, and digital art is itself placed under the larger umbrella term new media art. More generally the term digital artist is used to describe an artist who makes use of digital technologies in the production of art. In an expanded sense, "digital art" is a term applied to contemporary art that uses the methods of mass production or digital media.

TEXT.English: Factory (Digitized Membranes)

A membrane is a thin, film-like structure that separates two fluids. It acts as a selective barrier, allowing some particles or chemicals to pass through, but not others. In some cases, especially in anatomy, membrane may refer to a thin film that is primarily a separating structure rather than a selective barrier. Digitized Membranes are used in "artificial skin" for Robots and "digitized fabrics" that are responsive to touch and the environment.

TEXT.English: Dutch Dike
TEXT.French: Dutch Dike

TEXT.English: The earliest indications of dike building date from the late Iron Age. During excavations of terps in the Frisian villages of Peins and Dongjum, among others, dike bodies were found - small dikes predating the building of the terp. These little dikes, no more than 70 cm high, were composed of neatly-stacked peat sods against a core of loose bulk material. Later on the structure was reinforced by adding an outer wall with a gentler gradient. The evolvement of dikes of carefully stacked clay to pile dikes into high-tech sensor dikes did not happen overnight. Already in Roman times, small dikes and dams were created. [PARAGRAPH:1]A look into the long Dutch tradition of dike building gives us insight on a deeply rooted culture of trial and error in a country where the sea level rises and the ground level is dropping. History shows that either a big flood or a tiny worm, but also national welfare can lead to big consequences and shifts in the flood protection system. Key moments in the ever evolving dike network are described over different dike periods.
TEXT.French: The earliest indications of dike building date from the late Iron Age. During excavations of terps in the Frisian villages of Peins and Dongjum, among others, dike bodies were found - small dikes predating the building of the terp. These little dikes, no more than 70 cm high, were composed of neatly-stacked peat sods against a core of loose bulk material. Later on the structure was reinforced by adding an outer wall with a gentler gradient. The evolvement of dikes of carefully stacked clay to pile dikes into high-tech sensor dikes did not happen overnight. Already in Roman times, small dikes and dams were created. [PARAGRAPH:1]A look into the long Dutch tradition of dike building gives us insight on a deeply rooted culture of trial and error in a country where the sea level rises and the ground level is dropping. History shows that either a big flood or a tiny worm, but also national welfare can lead to big consequences and shifts in the flood protection system. Key moments in the ever evolving dike network are described over different dike periods.

TEXT.English: Factory (Dishwashers)

A dishwasher is a mechanical device for cleaning dishes and eating-utensils. Dishwashers can be found in restaurants and private homes. Unlike manual dishwashing, which relies largely on physical scrubbing to remove soiling, the mechanical dishwasher cleans by spraying hot water, typically between 55 and 75 °C (130 and 170 °F) at the dishes, with lower temperatures used for delicate items. A mix of water and detergent is circulated by a pump. Water is pumped to one or more rotating spray arms, which blast the dishes with the cleaning mixture. Once the wash is finished, the water is drained, more hot water is pumped in and a rinse cycle begins. After the rinse cycle finishes and the water is drained, a heating element in the bottom of the tub heats the air to dry the dishes. Sometimes a rinse aid is used to eliminate water spots for streak-free dishes.
TEXT.French: A dishwasher is a mechanical device for cleaning dishes and eating-utensils. Dishwashers can be found in restaurants and private homes. Unlike manual dishwashing, which relies largely on physical scrubbing to remove soiling, the mechanical dishwasher cleans by spraying hot water, typically between 55 and 75 °C (130 and 170 °F) at the dishes, with lower temperatures used for delicate items. A mix of water and detergent is circulated by a pump. Water is pumped to one or more rotating spray arms, which blast the dishes with the cleaning mixture. Once the wash is finished, the water is drained, more hot water is pumped in and a rinse cycle begins. After the rinse cycle finishes and the water is drained, a heating element in the bottom of the tub heats the air to dry the dishes. Sometimes a rinse aid is used to eliminate water spots for streak-free dishes.

TEXT.English: Factory (Diskettes)

A floppy disk, or diskette, is a disk storage medium composed of a disk of thin and flexible magnetic storage medium, sealed in a rectangular plastic carrier lined with fabric that removes dust particles. They are read and written by a floppy disk drive (FDD). Floppy disks, initially as 8-inch (200 mm) media and later in 5.25-inch (133 mm) and 3.5-inch (90 mm) sizes, were a ubiquitous form of data storage and exchange from the mid-1970s well into the first decade of the 21st century.
TEXT.French: A floppy disk, or diskette, is a disk storage medium composed of a disk of thin and flexible magnetic storage medium, sealed in a rectangular plastic carrier lined with fabric that removes dust particles. They are read and written by a floppy disk drive (FDD). Floppy disks, initially as 8-inch (200 mm) media and later in 5.25-inch (133 mm) and 3.5-inch (90 mm) sizes, were a ubiquitous form of data storage and exchange from the mid-1970s well into the first decade of the 21st century.

Freedom of the press consists of constitutional or statutory protections pertaining to the media and published materials.

TEXT.English: Great Mosque of Djenné
TEXT.French: La Grande Mosquée de Djenné
TEXT.Italian: La grande moschea di Djenné

TEXT.English: The Great Mosque of Djenné is the largest mud brick or adobe building in the world and is considered by many architects to be the greatest achievement of the Sudano-Sahelian architectural style, albeit with definite Islamic influences. The mosque is located in the city of Djenné, Mali on the flood plain of the Bani River. The first mosque on the site was built in the 13th century, but the current structure dates from 1907. As well as being the centre of the community of Djenné, it is one of the most famous landmarks in Africa. Along with the "Old Towns of Djenné" it was designated a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1988.
TEXT.French: The Great Mosque of Djenné is the largest mud brick or adobe building in the world and is considered by many architects to be the greatest achievement of the Sudano-Sahelian architectural style, albeit with definite Islamic influences. The mosque is located in the city of Djenné, Mali on the flood plain of the Bani River. The first mosque on the site was built in the 13th century, but the current structure dates from 1907. As well as being the centre of the community of Djenné, it is one of the most famous landmarks in Africa. Along with the "Old Towns of Djenné" it was designated a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1988.
TEXT.Polish: Wielki Meczet w Dżenne w środkowym Mali jest największą glinianą budowlą sakralną i największym wolno stojącym budynkiem z cegły suszonej na świecie - jego powierzchnia wynosi 75 x 75 m (5.625 m2). Budowlę tę uważa się za najważniejsze osiągnięcie sudańsko-sahelskiej architektury. Meczet zalicza się do najbardziej znanych budowli w Afryce i został w 1988 roku wraz z zabytkowym centrum Dżenne wpisany na listę światowego dziedzictwa UNESCO.

TEXT.English: Great Wall of China

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Wall[COLOR_REVERT] affects the area inside its owner's cultural borders on that continent, even if it is physically outside of the Great Wall. The effects are that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barbarians[COLOR_REVERT] cannot enter that area, and the owner receives more [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT] points from combat within that area.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande muraille[COLOR_REVERT] affecte la zone située au sein des frontières culturelles de son propriétaire sur ce continent, même si elle se trouve physiquement en dehors de la Grande muraille. Les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]barbares[COLOR_REVERT] ne peuvent alors plus entrer dans cette zone. Le propriétaire reçoit, quant à lui, davantage de points de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]général illustre[COLOR_REVERT] en combattant dans cette zone.
TEXT.German: Der Einflussbereich der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Großen Mauer[COLOR_REVERT] erstreckt sich über das innerhalb der kulturellen Grenzen der besitzenden Zivilisation befindliche Gebiet auf dem jeweiligen Kontinent - auch dann, wenn es sich physikalisch außerhalb der Großen Mauer befindet. Dadurch wird [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barbaren[COLOR_REVERT] der Zutritt zu diesem Territorium verwehrt und die besitzende Zivilisation gewinnt durch Kämpfe innerhalb dieses Gebiets mehr [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Großer General[COLOR_REVERT]-Punkte.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande Muraglia[COLOR_REVERT] produce effetti all'interno dei confini culturali presenti sul continente, anche su territori materialmente all'esterno della Grande Muraglia. Tali effetti si sostanziano nel fatto che i [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]barbari[COLOR_REVERT] non possono mettere piede in quei territori e che la civiltà riceve più punti da [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Grande Generale[COLOR_REVERT] per gli scontri combattuti all'interno dell'area.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran muralla[COLOR_REVERT] afecta al área situada dentro de las fronteras culturales de su propietario en ese continente, aunque ésta se encuentre fuera de la Gran muralla. Los efectos son que los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bárbaros[COLOR_REVERT] no pueden entrar en dicha área y que el propietario recibe más puntos de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gran general[COLOR_REVERT] por los combates que se libren en ella.

TEXT.English: The Great Wall of China is one of the largest and most famous man-made constructions in the entire world. Chinese rulers built the Great Wall to ward off attack from nomadic tribesmen living in modern Manchuria and Mongolia. Interestingly, the Great Wall was not designed to keep the nomads out - the Chinese knew it was all but impossible to defend such a long border - it was designed to make it difficult for the raiders to carry off loot, thus making raids far less profitable and thus less worth the risks involved. [PARAGRAPH:2]There have actually been five different "Great Walls" built by different Chinese dynasties. The first four were constructed of earth and have since all but disappeared. The current wall was built almost entirely by the Ming Dynasty between 1368 and 1640 AD. This wall was constructed on a grander scale, using more permanent materials (like stone). The Ming wall stretches for 3,948 miles (6,353.69 km) from Shanhai Pass on the Bohai Gulf in the east to Lop Nur in the southeast portion of Xinjiang's Uygur Autonomous Region in the west. This was the region where the Silk Road first entered China, and a series of watchtowers which could communicate via smoke signals were intended to pass messages rapidly along the vast length. [PARAGRAPH:2]In pure military terms, the Great Wall turned out to be something of a failure. The Manchus were able to bribe a Chinese general to let them pass through the wall, so it turned out to be of little value in stopping a major barbarian attack. After the Manchus conquered China, the borders of the country extended far to the north, rendering the wall irrelevant. The sheer cost of the wall was also staggering, and the cost in human lives is said to have exceeded over one million souls (the Great Wall is sometimes nicknamed "the long graveyard"). [PARAGRAPH:2]Today much of the Great Wall is in a state of disrepair - though the tourist regions are well-preserved, much of the rest of the structure is crumbling, and perhaps only 20%% of the wall is in good condition. Despite its decay, the Great Wall remains one of China's most popular tourist attractions and a true wonder of the world. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: La Grande muraille de Chine est l'une des plus grandes et des plus célèbres constructions humaines du monde. Les dirigeants chinois l'avaient construite pour repousser les attaques des tribus nomades vivant dans les territoires qui correspondent actuellement à la Mandchourie et à la Mongolie. Il est intéressant de noter que la Grande muraille n'a pas été conçue pour éviter les incursions des nomades, les Chinois savaient qu'il était impossible de défendre une si longue frontière, mais il était ainsi plus difficile pour les pilleurs de rapporter leur butin, ce qui rendait les pillages bien moins rentables et réduisait l'intérêt de prendre des risques. [PARAGRAPH:2]En réalité, il y a eu cinq "Grandes murailles", construites par plusieurs dynasties chinoises. Les quatre premières ont été construites en terre et ont entièrement disparu. La muraille actuelle a été pratiquement intégralement construite par la dynastie Ming entre 1368 et 1640 ap. J.-C. Elle a été construite sur une plus longue distance, à l'aide de matériaux plus résistants tels que la pierre. La muraille Ming s'étend sur 6352 km entre la passe Shanhai dans le Golfe de Bohai, à l'est, et Lop Nur, dans le sud-est de la région autonome du Xinjiang Uygur, à l'ouest. C'est cette région que traversait la Route de la soie pour accéder en Chine. Plusieurs tours de guet, communiquant à l'aide de signaux de fumée, servaient à transmettre des messages rapidement le long de cette vaste construction. [PARAGRAPH:2]En termes purement militaires, la Grande muraille s'est révélée plutôt un échec. Les Mandchous avaient réussi à soudoyer un général chinois pour les aider à franchir la muraille, qui a donc été de peu d'utilité pour stopper une grande attaque barbare. Après la conquête de la Chine par les Mandchous, les frontières du pays se sont décalées plus au Nord, rendant la muraille inutile. Le coût de la muraille a été tout simplement prodigieux, sans parler du coût en vies humaines que l'on estime à plus d'un million (la Grande muraille est parfois surnommée "le long cimetière"). [PARAGRAPH:2]Aujourd'hui, une vaste partie de la Grande muraille est dans un état de délabrement avancé : alors que dans les régions touristiques, elle est bien conservée, la plupart des autres portions sont sur le point de s'effondrer. Seuls 20%% de la muraille sont encore en bon état. Malgré son délabrement, la Grande muraille reste l'une des principales attractions touristiques en Chine et une véritable Merveille du monde. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: Die Chinesische Mauer ist eins der größten und berühmtesten Bauwerke der Welt, die je von Menschenhand erschaffen wurden. Die chinesischen Herrscher ließen sie errichten, um die Angriffe der Nomadenstämme aus der heutigen Mandschurei und Mongolei abwehren zu können. Interessanterweise war die Chinesische Mauer jedoch nicht dazu gedacht, den Nomaden von vornherein den Zugang zum chinesischen Reich zu verwehren. Immerhin war den Chinesen bewusst, dass es kaum möglich war, eine derartig lange Grenzlinie wie die ihre komplett abzuschotten. Vielmehr sollte den Angreifern lediglich der Abtransport ihrer Beute erschwert werden. Auf diese Weise wurden die feindlichen Beutezüge deutlich unrentabler und lohnten kaum noch das Risiko. [PARAGRAPH:2]Insgesamt wurden fünf unterschiedliche "Große Mauern" von verschiedenen chinesischen Dynastien errichtet. Die ersten vier waren aus Erde aufgeschüttet worden und sind mittlerweile restlos verschwunden. Der heute noch existierende Teil der Mauer wurde mit erheblichem Mehraufwand unter Verwendung haltbarer Materialien (wie Stein) zwischen 1368 und 1640 fast vollständig unter der Regie der Ming-Dynastie erbaut. Die Ming-Mauer verläuft auf etwa 6320 Kilometern vom Shanhai-Pass nahe der Bohai-Bucht im Osten bis nach Lop Nor im südöstlichen Teil der autonomen Region Xinjiang Uygur im Westen. In diesem Gebiet traf die Seidenstraße erstmals auf China. Hier wurden zahlreiche Wachtürme errichtet, damit mittels Rauchsignalen auf schnellstem Wege Nachrichten von einem Ende der Mauer zum anderen kommuniziert werden konnten. [PARAGRAPH:2]Aus militärischer Sicht stellte sich die Chinesische Mauer eher als Fehlschlag heraus. Die Mandschuren bestachen einen chinesischen General, damit er sie an der Mauer passieren ließ, so dass sie nun kaum noch Schutz vor einem größeren Barbarenangriff bot. Nach der Eroberung Chinas durch die Mandschuren wurden die Grenzgebiete weit nach Norden ausgedehnt und die Mauer damit völlig nutzlos. Überdies verschlang sie enorme Unterhaltskosten und soll mehr als eine Million Menschenleben gekostet haben (was ihr die Beinamen "Mauer der Tränen" und "Längster Friedhof der Welt" einbrachte). [PARAGRAPH:2]Heute sind große Teile der Chinesischen Mauer baufällig - lediglich die in den Touristenregionen befindlichen Teile sind gut erhalten, schätzungsweise etwa 20%% des gesamten Monuments, während der Rest des Bauwerks zusehends verfällt. Dennoch: Trotz des fortschreitenden Verfalls ist und bleibt die Chinesische Mauer eine der populärsten Touristenattraktionen Chinas und repräsentiert ein echtes Weltwunder. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Italian: La Grande Muraglia cinese è una delle costruzioni più famose e imponenti dell'intera umanità. Essa fu fatta costruire dagli imperatori cinesi per respingere gli attacchi delle tribù nomadi della Manciuria e della Mongolia. Curiosamente, la Grande Muraglia non aveva lo scopo di tenere i nomadi all'esterno dell'Impero (i Cinesi sapevano che sarebbe stato impossibile difendere compiutamente un confine tanto esteso) ma per ostacolare il trasporto dei bottini di guerra e scoraggiare perciò le incursioni: non ne sarebbe valsa la pena. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le "Grandi Muraglie" furono in realtà cinque, costruite da diverse dinastie. Le prime quattro erano costruite in terra e sono scomparse del tutto. Quella attuale, la più lunga di tutte, fu eretta dalla dinastia Ming tra il 1368 e il 1640 d.C. utilizzando materiali più resistenti, come la pietra. La Muraglia dei Ming si estende per 3.948 miglia, dal passo di Shanghai nel golfo di Bohai a est fino a Lop Nur, nella porzione sudorientale dell'Uygur, regione autonoma dello Xinjiang, a ovest, dove si fece strada inizialmente nell'entroterra cinese la via della seta e dove vennero erette una serie di torri di guardia in grado di comunicare con segnali di fumo per trasmettere rapidamente dei messaggi su grandi distanze. [PARAGRAPH:2]In termini puramente militari, la Grande Muraglia si rivelò un fallimento. I Manciù riuscirono a corrompere un generale cinese, che li fece passare, e la Muraglia fu così incapace di respingere l'invasione. Dopo la conquista della Cina da parte dei Manciù, i confini del Paese si allargarono di molto a nord, rendendo la Muraglia inutile. La Muraglia era inoltre molto costosa (anche in termini di vite: si calcolano oltre un milione di morti, tanto da farle meritare il soprannome di "lungo cimitero"). [PARAGRAPH:2]Oggi la Grande Muraglia è in rovina: se le parti che attraversano le regioni frequentate dai turisti sono in buono stato, il resto sta cadendo a pezzi. Forse solo il 20%% della Muraglia si trova in buone condizioni. Nonostante ciò, la Grande Muraglia continua a essere la più importante attrazione turistica della Cina e una vera meraviglia del mondo. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: La Gran Muralla china es una de las más grande y famosas construcciones del mundo. Los gobernantes chinos la construyeron para repeler los ataques de los nómadas que vivían en las actuales regiones de Manchuria y Mongolia. Es interesante resaltar que la Gran Muralla no se construyó para mantener a raya a los nómadas (los chinos sabían que era poco menos que imposible proteger una frontera tan larga como la suya) sino para que les fuera más difícil llevarse el botín y, por consiguiente, las incursiones fueran menos provechosas y menos atractivas. [PARAGRAPH:2]En realidad, existen cinco "grandes murallas", cada una de las cuales fue levantada por una dinastía diferente. Las primeras cuatro estaban hechas de tierra, así que han desaparecido prácticamente. La actual fue construida casi enteramente por la dinastía Ming entre los años 1368 y 1640 d. C. Esta muralla se construyó a mayor escala y usando materiales más duraderos. La muralla Ming se extiende a lo largo de más de seis mil kilómetros, desde el paso de Shanhai en el golfo de Bohai (al este) a Lup Nur, en la parte sureste de la región autónoma de Uygur en Xinjiang (al oeste). Ésta era la región por la que la ruta de la seda entraba en China, y estaba protegida por una serie de torres que podían comunicarse con señales de humo y transmitir rápidamente mensajes a lo largo de vastas distancias. [PARAGRAPH:2]En términos puramente militares, la Gran Muralla puede considerarse un intento más o menos fallido. Los manchúes sobornaron a un general chino para que les franqueara el paso, por lo que, a la hora de detener un ataque bárbaro de primera magnitud, no sirvió de mucho. Después de que los manchúes conquistaran China, las fronteras del país se extendieron más en dirección norte, por lo que la existencia de la muralla se volvió irrelevante. El coste de su construcción en términos monetarios fue enorme y se calcula que, en términos humanos, pudo haber excedido el millón de almas (a veces se la ha bautizado también como "el gran cementerio"). [PARAGRAPH:2]En nuestros días, la mayor parte de la muralla se encuentra en estado de abandono. Aunque las zonas más turísticas están en buen estado, el resto se encuentra en ruinas. Se calcula que solo el 20%% está en buenas condiciones. A pesar de todo, la Gran Muralla sigue siendo una de las principales atracciones turísticas de China y una de las auténticas maravillas del mundo. [PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: Nucleic Acid Lab

Nucleic acids are large biological molecules essential for all known forms of life. They include DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and RNA (ribonucleic acid). Together with proteins, nucleic acids are the most important biological macromolecules; each is found in abundance in all living things, where they function in encoding, transmitting and expressing genetic information. Nucleic acids were discovered by Friedrich Miescher in 1869. Experimental studies of nucleic acids constitute a major part of modern biological and medical research, and form a foundation for genome and forensic science, as well as the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries.
TEXT.French: Nucleic acids are large biological molecules essential for all known forms of life. They include DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and RNA (ribonucleic acid). Together with proteins, nucleic acids are the most important biological macromolecules; each is found in abundance in all living things, where they function in encoding, transmitting and expressing genetic information. Nucleic acids were discovered by Friedrich Miescher in 1869. Experimental studies of nucleic acids constitute a major part of modern biological and medical research, and form a foundation for genome and forensic science, as well as the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries.
TEXT.Polish: Kwasy nukleinowe - organiczne związki chemiczne, biopolimery zbudowane znukleotydów. Zostały odkryte w roku 1869 przez Johanna Friedricha Mieschera. Znane są dwa podstawowe typy naturalnych kwasów nukleinowych: kwasy deoksyrybonukleinowe (DNA) i rybonukleinowe (RNA). Komórki wszystkichorganizmów na Ziemi zawierają zarówno DNA i RNA, kwas nukleinowy znajduje się także w wirionach wirusów, co jest podstawą ich podziału na wirusy RNA i wirusy DNA.

TEXT.English: Build a Nucleic Acid Lab to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de culture d'Acides nucléiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nucleic Acid Lab by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Doctor's Office
TEXT.French: Cabinet de médecin
TEXT.Italian: Ufficio del dottore

TEXT.English: A doctor's office is where a doctor resides while he works. Until the Modern Era, with ambulances and more advanced medical equipment, many Doctors would travel to the homes of the sick and injured to administer treatment.
TEXT.French: A doctor's office is where a doctor resides while he works. Until the Modern Era, with ambulances and more advanced medical equipment, many Doctors would travel to the homes of the sick and injured to administer treatment.

TEXT.English: Doctor's Office provides health to the city and helps units recover health. It also enables the Doctor unit.
TEXT.French: Doctor's Office provides health to the city and helps units recover health. It also enables the Doctor unit.
TEXT.Spanish: La Consulta del doctor proporciona salud a la ciudad, y ayuda a las unidades a recuperarse.

TEXT.English: Dosan Seowon
TEXT.French: Dosan Seowon

TEXT.English: Dosan Seowon (alternatively, Tosansowon) was established in 1574 in what is present day Andong, South Korea, in memory of and four years after the death of Confucian scholar Yi Hwang by some of his disciples and other Confucian authorities. Yi Hwang had retired to the location in 1549 and begun construction on the facility, a private Confucian academy offering instruction in the classics and honouring the sages with regular memorial rites. Like other Confucian academies, Dosan Seowon serves two purposes: education and commemoration. The site was well-known in Korea as one of the leading academies and was home to the Toegye School of Thought for over 400 years. Although the educational function of the facility has long since ceased, the commemorative ceremonies have been and are still held twice a year.
TEXT.French: Dosan Seowon (ou, Tosansowon) a été fondé en 1574 dans la ville nommé à présent Andong, et Corée de Sud, en mémoire, et quatre années après la mort de l'érudit Confucéen Yi Hwang par quelques-uns de ses disciples et les autorités Confucéennes. Yi Hwang s'est retiré à cet endroit en 1549 et a commencé à construire cette institution: une académie privée Confucéenne offrant l'instruction des doctrines et honorant les sages par des rites funéraires réguliers. Comme les autres académies Confucéennes, Dosan Seowon conserve les deux objectifs: l'éducation et la comémoration. Le Site était très connu en Corée comme une des meilleures académies, et a été le siège de l'Ecole de l'Esprit de Toegye pendant plus de 400 ans. Bien que la fonction d'éducattion de l'édifice a cessé depuis longtemps à présent, les cérémonies comémoratives sont encore célébrées deux fois par an..
TEXT.Italian: Dosan Seowon (anche detto Tosansowon) fu fondato nel 1574 nell'attuale Andong, Corea del Sud, in memoria dell'erudito confuciano Yi Hwang, quattro anni dopo la sua morte, da parte di alcuni suoi discepoli a di altre autorità confuciane. Yi Hwang si era ritirato in questo luogo nel 1549 e aveva iniziato la costruzione dell'edificio, un'accademia confuciana privata che offriva un'istruzione classica e onorava i saggi con regolari riti memoriali. Come altre accademie confuciane, Dosan Seowon ha due scopi: educazione e commemorazione. Il sito era rinomato in Corea del Sud come una delle accademie più importanti ed era sede della scuola di pensiero Toegye per più di 400 anni. Anche se la funzione educativa del complesso è cessata da molto tempo, le cerimonie commemorative vengono ancora tenute due volte all'anno.
TEXT.Polish: Koreańska szkoła konfucjańska z XVI wieku.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] Increases Science and Reduces Maintenance in city.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] Augmente la science et réduit l'entretien de la ville.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] Erhöht die Forschung und reduziert den Unterhalt der Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la ricerca e riduce il mantenimento nella città.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la ciencia y reduce el mantenimiento de la ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dosan Seowon[COLOR_REVERT] Zwiększa nauke i redukuje utrzymanie w mieście.

TEXT.English: Downdraft Tower

The energy tower is a device for producing electrical power. The brainchild of Dr. Phillip Carlson, expanded by Professor Dan Zaslavsky and Dr. Rami Guetta from the Technion. Energy towers spray water on hot air at the top of the tower, making the cooled air fall through the tower and drive a turbine at the tower's bottom.
TEXT.French: The energy tower is a device for producing electrical power. The brainchild of Dr. Phillip Carlson, expanded by Professor Dan Zaslavsky and Dr. Rami Guetta from the Technion. Energy towers spray water on hot air at the top of the tower, making the cooled air fall through the tower and drive a turbine at the tower's bottom.
TEXT.Polish: Więża wiatrowa to specjalny rodzaj wiatraka zbudowany na zasadzie okrągłego walca (wieży) gdzie powietrze napędza wirniki znajdujące się w środku wieży.

TEXT.English: Build a Downdraft Tower to increase your cities electricity and therefore its production.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tour énergétique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production d'électricité dans votre ville.

TEXT.English: Draft Office
TEXT.French: Bureau de Recrutement
TEXT.Italian: Ufficio di reclutamento

TEXT.English: Draft Offices forcibly conscript ordinary citizens into military troops. This often generates unhappiness in the population, but drafts have been used effectively for thousands of years.
TEXT.French: Draft Offices forcibly conscript ordinary citizens into military troops. This often generates unhappiness in the population, but drafts have been used effectively for thousands of years.
TEXT.Polish: Pobór obejmuje całokształt przedsięwzięć związanych z oceną zdolności fizycznej i psychicznej (realizowane przez właściwe komisje lekarskie powoływane przez władze lokalne na czas trwania poboru) młodych ludzi do służby wojskowej oraz ujęciem ich w ewidencji wojskowej. Nie należy mylić poboru z powołaniem, kiedy to otrzymuje siękartę powołania (tzw. bilet) nakładającą obowiązek stawienia się w określonym miejscu i czasie do odbycia czynnej służby wojskowej.

TEXT.English: Draft Offices speed up military production, but at the cost of a city's population.
TEXT.French: Les bureaux de recrutement accélèrent la production militaire, mais au prix de population de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Gli uffici di reclutamento aumentano la produzione militare, ma riducono la popolazione cittadina.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Oficinas de reclutamiento aceleran la producción militar, pero a costa de la población de la ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Biuro Naboru przyśpiesza produkcje wojskową kosztem populacji miasta

TEXT.English: Dragonfly Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de libellules

TEXT.English: Eaten in Indonesia and China. Can be eaten in adult or larval form. In Indonesia, these are caught by dipping a reed in sticky palm sap and waving it through the air. Often eaten boiled or fried.
TEXT.French: Eaten in Indonesia and China. Can be eaten in adult or larval form. In Indonesia, these are caught by dipping a reed in sticky palm sap and waving it through the air. Often eaten boiled or fried.
TEXT.Polish: Ważki (Odonata) - rząd drapieżnych, starych ewolucyjnie owadów oprzeobrażeniu niezupełnym, smukłym ciele, dużych oczach złożonych, krótkim tułowiu, silnie wydłużonym odwłoku i dwóch parach skrzydeł. W stanie spoczynku utrzymują skrzydła rozłożone na boki lub podniesione do góry. Tradycyjnie zaliczane są wraz z jętkami (Ephemeroptera) do grupy prymitywnych owadów pierwotnoskrzydłych (Paleoptera), których większość już wymarła. Są związane ze środowiskiem wodnym - larwy żyją w wodzie, a osobniki dorosłe (imagines) przebywają w pobliżu zbiorników z wodą stojącą lub płynącą. Ważki są bardzo dobrymi lotnikami. Latają szybko i bezgłośnie. U większości gatunków jest wyraźnie zaznaczony dymorfizm płciowy.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Fish[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dragonfly Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Poissons[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de libellules[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Dragonfly Sanctuary
TEXT.French: Refuge pour Libellules

TEXT.English: Eaten in Indonesia and China. Can be eaten in adult or larval form. In Indonesia, these are caught by dipping a reed in sticky palm sap and waving it through the air. Often eaten boiled or fried.
TEXT.French: Eaten in Indonesia and China. Can be eaten in adult or larval form. In Indonesia, these are caught by dipping a reed in sticky palm sap and waving it through the air. Often eaten boiled or fried.
TEXT.Polish: Ważki (Odonata) - rząd drapieżnych, starych ewolucyjnie owadów oprzeobrażeniu niezupełnym, smukłym ciele, dużych oczach złożonych, krótkim tułowiu, silnie wydłużonym odwłoku i dwóch parach skrzydeł. W stanie spoczynku utrzymują skrzydła rozłożone na boki lub podniesione do góry. Tradycyjnie zaliczane są wraz z jętkami (Ephemeroptera) do grupy prymitywnych owadów pierwotnoskrzydłych (Paleoptera), których większość już wymarła. Są związane ze środowiskiem wodnym - larwy żyją w wodzie, a osobniki dorosłe (imagines) przebywają w pobliżu zbiorników z wodą stojącą lub płynącą. Ważki są bardzo dobrymi lotnikami. Latają szybko i bezgłośnie. U większości gatunków jest wyraźnie zaznaczony dymorfizm płciowy.

With advances in Mind Scanning, it is now possible to visualize thoughts and even dreams.
