TEXT.English: Iron Forge
TEXT.French: Forge de Fer
TEXT.Italian: Forgia per ferro

TEXT.English: About 2000 B.C. the Hittites appeared in northern Asia Minor, a region rich in iron. In 1650 B.C. the Hittites began building a powerful empire. They extended their control in Asia Minor, seized northern Syria from the Egyptians, and expanded into northern Mesopotamia, where they conquered the Babylonians. Hittite culture was greatly influenced by contacts with the Babylonians.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While they were less advanced than the peoples of Mesopotamia, they had learned to extract iron from ore - they were the first to make tools and weapons of iron. The Hittites heated iron ore and pounded out impurities before plunging it into cold water. The tools and weapons they made with iron were harder and had sharper edges than those made out of bronze or copper. Because iron was plentiful, the Hittites were able to arm more people at less expense.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Hittites tried to keep this valuable technology secret. But as their empire collapsed about 1200 B.C., Hittite ironsmiths migrated to serve customers elsewhere. The new knowledge thus spread across Asia, Africa, and Europe, ushering in the Iron Age.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: About 2000 B.C. the Hittites appeared in northern Asia Minor, a region rich in iron. In 1650 B.C. the Hittites began building a powerful empire. They extended their control in Asia Minor, seized northern Syria from the Egyptians, and expanded into northern Mesopotamia, where they conquered the Babylonians. Hittite culture was greatly influenced by contacts with the Babylonians.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While they were less advanced than the peoples of Mesopotamia, they had learned to extract iron from ore - they were the first to make tools and weapons of iron. The Hittites heated iron ore and pounded out impurities before plunging it into cold water. The tools and weapons they made with iron were harder and had sharper edges than those made out of bronze or copper. Because iron was plentiful, the Hittites were able to arm more people at less expense.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Hittites tried to keep this valuable technology secret. But as their empire collapsed about 1200 B.C., Hittite ironsmiths migrated to serve customers elsewhere. The new knowledge thus spread across Asia, Africa, and Europe, ushering in the Iron Age.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: Um 2000 v.Chr. erschienen die Hethiter im nördlichen Kleinasien, einer Region reich an Eisen. In 1650 B.C. the Hittites began building a powerful empire. They extended their control in Asia Minor, seized northern Syria from the Egyptians, and expanded into northern Mesopotamia, where they conquered the Babylonians. Hittite culture was greatly influenced by contacts with the Babylonians.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While they were less advanced than the peoples of Mesopotamia, they had learned to extract iron from ore - they were the first to make tools and weapons of iron. The Hittites heated iron ore and pounded out impurities before plunging it into cold water. The tools and weapons they made with iron were harder and had sharper edges than those made out of bronze or copper. Because iron was plentiful, the Hittites were able to arm more people at less expense.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Hittites tried to keep this valuable technology secret. But as their empire collapsed about 1200 B.C., Hittite ironsmiths migrated to serve customers elsewhere. The new knowledge thus spread across Asia, Africa, and Europe, ushering in the Iron Age.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Polish: Hetyci pojawili się około 2000 P.N.E. w północnej części Azji Mniejszej, regionie bogatym w żelazo. W 1650 P.N.E. rozpoczęli tworzenie potężnego imperium. Rozciągnęli swoją kontrolę w Azji Mniejszej, podbili północną Syrię należącą do Egiptu i rozszerzyli swoje wpływy na północną Mezopotamię, gdzie podbili Babilonię. Na kulturę hetycką olbrzymi wpływ wywarły kontakty z Babilonią.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Podczas gdy Hetyci nie dysponowali tak zaawansowaną techniką jak ludy Mezopotamii, nauczyli się oni uzyskiwac żelazo z rudy - jako pierwsi wytwarzali narzędzie oraz broń z żelaza. Hetyci podgrzewali rudę żelaza a następnie usuwali zanieczyszczenia przed zanurzeniem jej w zimnej wodzie. Narzędzia i broń, które wytwarzali z żelaza były twardsze i miały ostrzejsze krawędzie niż te zrobione z brązu czy miedzi. Ponieważ żelaza było pod dostatkiem, Hetyci mogli uzbroić więcej ludzi przy mniejszych kosztach.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Próbowali oni utrzymać tą wartościową technologię w sekrecie, jednakże kiedy ich imperium zostało zniszczone około 1200 P.N.E, hetyccy kowale zaczęli migrować w poszukiwaniu klientów. Nowa wiedza szerzyła się więc wzdłuż Azji, Afryki i Europy, zapoczątkowując Epokę żelaza.[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: Hollywood
Holographic Combat Simulator
TEXT.French: Simulateur de Combat Holographique
TEXT.Italian: Simulatore olografico di combattimento

TEXT.English: Applying holographic technology to combat simulators results in increasingly realistic simulations, including simulation of extreme environments that would be far too risky to re-create in reality. These simulations produce much better-trained units than ordinary military training or combat simulations.
TEXT.French: Applying holographic technology to combat simulators results in increasingly realistic simulations, including simulation of extreme environments that would be far too risky to re-create in reality. These simulations produce much better-trained units than ordinary military training or combat simulations.
TEXT.Italian: Applicando l'olografia ai simulatori di combattimento si ottengono simulazioni incredibilmente realistiche, inclusa la simulazione di ambienti estremi che potrebbero essere troppo rischiosi da essere ricreati nella realtà. Queste simulazioni producono unità molto più addestrate rispetto all'addestramento tradizionale, o alle simulazioni di combattimento.
TEXT.Polish: Holografia optyczna znalazła zastosowanie w medycynie i biologii, a także w informatyce np. w zakresie przechowywania dużych ilości danych na dyskach holograficznych HVD. Holografia akustyczna ma zastosowanie wdefektoskopii. Trwają badania nad zastosowaniem holografii w trójwymiarowym filmie i telewizji. Wirujące zwierciadła holograficzne są stosowane do przesuwania promienia laserowego po kodzie paskowym w kasach sklepów i domów towarowych.

TEXT.English: Build a Holographic Combat Simulator to increase the experience provided over a Combat Simulator.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Simulateur de Combat Holographique[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'expérience déjà acquise dans le Simulateur de Combat.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un Simulatore olografico di combattimento per ottenere ancora più XP rispetto a un normale simulatore.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un Simulador de combate holográfico para aumentar la experiencia proporcionada por un simulador de combate normal.

TEXT.English: Holographic Flight Simulator
TEXT.French: Simulateur de Vol Holographique
TEXT.Italian: Simulatore olografico di volo

TEXT.English: Applying holographic technology to flight simulators results in ever more realistic simulations, allowing pilots to train under virtually any conditions, even extreme conditions or different environments.
TEXT.French: Applying holographic technology to flight simulators results in ever more realistic simulations, allowing pilots to train under virtually any conditions, even extreme conditions or different environments.
TEXT.Italian: La tecnologia olografica applicata ai simulatori di volo permette la creazione di simulazione più realistiche, permettendo ai piloti di addestrarsi in ogni condizione, anche in condizioni estreme o ambienti diversi.
TEXT.Polish: Holografia optyczna znalazła zastosowanie w medycynie i biologii, a także w informatyce np. w zakresie przechowywania dużych ilości danych na dyskach holograficznych HVD. Holografia akustyczna ma zastosowanie wdefektoskopii. Trwają badania nad zastosowaniem holografii w trójwymiarowym filmie i telewizji. Wirujące zwierciadła holograficzne są stosowane do przesuwania promienia laserowego po kodzie paskowym w kasach sklepów i domów towarowych.

TEXT.English: Build a Holographic Flight Simulator to increase the experience of your Air and Helicopter units beyond that provided by a Flight Simulator.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Simulateur de Vol Holographique[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'expérience déjà acquise dans le Simulateur de Vol.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un Simulatore olografico di volo per fornire ad aerei ed elicotteri ancora più XP rispetto a un normale simulatore di volo.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un Simulador de combate holográfico para aumentar la experiencia proporcionada a los helicópteros y unidades aéreas por un simulador de vuelo normal.

TEXT.English: Holographic Gaming League
When Holographic gaming became mainstream, the Major League Gaming (MLG) company adapted and hosted holographic supported videogames from now on.

TEXT.English: Build a Holographic Gaming League to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ligue de Jeux Holographiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Holographic Gaming League by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Holographic Networks

Holography is a technique which enables three-dimensional images to be made. It involves the use of a laser, interference, diffraction, light intensity recording and suitable illumination of the recording. The image changes as the position and orientation of the viewing system changes in exactly the same way as if the object were still present, thus making the image appear three-dimensional. The holographic recording itself is not an image; it consists of an apparently random structure of either varying intensity, density or profile.
TEXT.French: Holography is a technique which enables three-dimensional images to be made. It involves the use of a laser, interference, diffraction, light intensity recording and suitable illumination of the recording. The image changes as the position and orientation of the viewing system changes in exactly the same way as if the object were still present, thus making the image appear three-dimensional. The holographic recording itself is not an image; it consists of an apparently random structure of either varying intensity, density or profile.
TEXT.Polish: Holografia optyczna znalazła zastosowanie w medycynie i biologii, a także w informatyce np. w zakresie przechowywania dużych ilości danych na dyskach holograficznych HVD. Holografia akustyczna ma zastosowanie wdefektoskopii. Trwają badania nad zastosowaniem holografii w trójwymiarowym filmie i telewizji. Wirujące zwierciadła holograficzne są stosowane do przesuwania promienia laserowego po kodzie paskowym w kasach sklepów i domów towarowych.

TEXT.English: Build Holographic Networks to increase your cities culture.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Réseaux holographiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Holographic Networks by zwiększyć kulturę w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Factory (Holographic Projectors)

A hologram can be made by shining part of the light beam directly onto the recording medium, and the other part onto the object in such a way that some of the scattered light falls onto the recording medium. A more flexible arrangement for recording a hologram requires the laser beam to be aimed through a series of elements that change it in different ways. The first element is a beam splitter that divides the beam into two identical beams, each aimed in different directions:One beam (known as the illumination or object beam) is spread using lenses and directed onto the scene using mirrors. Some of the light scattered (reflected) from the scene then falls onto the recording medium. The second beam (known as the reference beam) is also spread through the use of lenses, but is directed so that it doesn't come in contact with the scene, and instead travels directly onto the recording medium.Several different materials can be used as the recording medium. One of the most common is a film very similar to photographic film (silver halide photographic emulsion), but with a much higher concentration of light-reactive grains, making it capable of the much higher resolution that holograms require. A layer of this recording medium (e.g. silver halide) is attached to a transparent substrate, which is commonly glass, but may also be plastic.
TEXT.French: A hologram can be made by shining part of the light beam directly onto the recording medium, and the other part onto the object in such a way that some of the scattered light falls onto the recording medium. Holography is a technique which enables three-dimensional images to be made. The image changes as the position and orientation of the viewing system changes in exactly the same way as if the object were still present, thus making the image appear three-dimensional. The holographic recording itself is not an image; it consists of an apparently random structure of either varying intensity, density or profile.

TEXT.English: Holy Office
TEXT.French: Sainte Office
TEXT.Italian: Sant'Uffizio

TEXT.English: The principle of political, cultural and religious unity became the standard for many European governments in the Middle Ages. The inquisition was imposed to preserve the purity of the faith and the unquestioned authority of religious and state leaders. Heresy was a belief in something that conflicted with the official state religious doctrine. The Tribunal of the Holy Office of the Inquisition operated with the full authority of the state to enforce church doctrine by cracking down and rooting out heresy. The words Holy Office meant Holy Office Building or Branch Office Building of the Holy Inquisition. The right of inquisition was the right to inquire on matters of faith and morals. Inquisitors representing the Holy Office were greatly feared.
TEXT.French: Le principe d'une unité à la fois politique, culturelle et religieuse est devenu chose commune pour laplupart des gouvernements européens au Moyen Age. L'Inquisition a été imposée,pour préserver la pureté de la Foi et l'Autorité absolue de la religions et des Leaders de l'état. L'Hérésie est décrétée pour toute chose qui entre en conflit avec les doctrine de la religion officielle de l'état. Le Tribunal de la Sainte Office de l'Inquisition a opéré sous la complète autorité de l'état, pour renforcer les doctrines de l'église en débusquant et anéantissant l'hérésie. Le terme Sainte Office est dérivé du bâtiment du Bureau de la Sainte Office de la Sainte Inquisition. Les droits de l'Inquisition se résumaient au droit d'enquêter sur tout ce qui concerne la morale ou la Foi. Les Inquisiteurs représentant le Sainte Office étaient particulièrement craints.
TEXT.German: Das Prinzip der politischen, kulturellen und religiösen Einheit wurde im Mittelalter zum Standard für viele europäische Regierungen. Die Inquisition wurde eingesetzt, um die Reinheit des Glaubens und die unantastbare Autorität der religiösen und weltlichen Führer zu erhalten. Als Häresie wurde alles bezeichnet, was den Glaubenslehren der offiziellen Staatsreligion widersprach. Das Tribunal des Heiligen Amtes der Inquisition hatte die absolute Staatsgewalt hinter sich um die Häresie bis zu den Wurzeln auszulöschen. Der Begriff "Heiliges Amt" bedeutet "Heiliges Amtsgebäude" oder Zweigstelle der Heiligen Inquisition. Es war das Recht der Inquisition in Fragen von Glauben und Moral zu ermitteln. Die Inquisitoren als Repräsentanten des Heiligen Amtes waren gefürchtet.
TEXT.Italian: Il principio di unità politica, culturale e religiosa è diventò lo standard per molti governi europei nel Medioevo. L'inquisizione venne imposta per preservare la purezza della fede e l'autorità indiscussa di leader religiosi e statali. Eresia è la fede in qualcosa in contrasto con la dottrina ufficiale dello religione di Stato. Il Tribunale del Sant'Uffizio dell'Inquisizione operò con la piena autorità dello Stato per far rispettare la dottrina della Chiesa, contrastando e sradicando l'eresia. Il termine 'Sant'Uffizio' significa Edificio del Sant'Uffizio o Edificio dell'Agenzia della Santa Inquisizione. Il diritto di inquisizione era il diritto di indagare su questioni di fede e di morale. Gli Inquisitori che rappresentavano il Sant'Uffizio erano grandemente temuti.
TEXT.Spanish: El principio de unidad de los poderes político, cultural and religioso fue común en la mayoría de los gobiernos europeos en la Edad Media. La Inquisición fue creada para preservar la pureza de la fe y la incuestionable autoridad de los líderes religiosos y de estado. Las herejías eran creencias en algo que entraba en conflicto con la doctrina oficial del estado o de la religión. El Tribunal de la Santa Inquisición operaba con el completo beneplácito del estado para asegurar la doctrina eclesiástica persiguiendo y desenmascarando la herejía. Los poderes de la Inquisición consistían básicamente en poder investigar en materia de moralidad y de fe. Los inquisidores que representaban al Santo Oficio eran temidos allá por donde pasaban.
TEXT.Polish: Purytanizm - ruch religijno-społeczny w XVI i XVII-wiecznej Anglii, mający na celu "oczyszczenie" Kościoła anglikańskiego z pozostałości po katolicyzmie w liturgii i teologii. Początkowo działając jako ruch wewnątrz anglikanizmu, purytanie stopniowo oddzielali się od niego tworząc odrębne wspólnoty religijne, czasem nazywane nonkonformistycznymi.

TEXT.English: The HOLY OFFICE allows you to produce inquisitors. You must have a state religion, which is established in the city before you can build The HOLY OFFICE.
TEXT.French: Le Saint Office (ou Inquisition) permet le recrutement d'Inquisiteurs. Il faut adopter une Religion d'Etat qui soit établie dans la ville avant de pouvoir construire le Saint Office.
TEXT.German: Das HEILIGE AMT erlaubt Dir, Inquisitoren auszubilden. Das HEILIGE AMT kann nur in einer Stadt mit der aktuellen Staatsreligion gebaut werden.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sant'Uffizio[COLOR_REVERT] consente di produrre inquisitori. E' necessario disporre di una Religione di Stato, con sede in città prima di poter costruire il Sant'Uffizio.
TEXT.Spanish: El Santo Oficio permite la producción de Inquisidores. Debes tener una religión oficial establecida en la ciudad para poder construir el Santo Oficio.
TEXT.Polish: ŚWIETE OFICJUM pozwala produkować inkwizytorów. Musisz posiadać religię państwową, która jest przyjęta w mieście zanim zaczniesz budować ŚWIETE OFICJUM.

TEXT.English: Rathaus
Homeland Security Agency
TEXT.French: Le Labyrinthe de Knossos

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.German: Das Heimatschutzministerium (eigentlich Ministerium für Innere Sicherheit der Vereinigten Staaten), das 2002 in Folge der Terroranschläge vom 11. September 2001 geschaffen wurde, dient dem Schutz der Zivilbevölkerung und des Territoriums hauptsächlich vor terroristischen Bedrohungen. Während die innere Sicherheit in anderen Ländern im Zuständigkeitsbereich des Innenministeriums liegt, sah die USA die Gründung eines eigenen Ministeriums durch die beständige Gefahr von Anschlägen gegeben.[PARAGRAPH:2]Das Heimatschutzministerium verwendet ein als DefCon bekanntes, auf Farben basierendes, fünfstufiges Warnsystem, um die aktuelle Gefahrenlage zu verdeutlichen. Während Grün und Blau eine relativ sichere Lage kennzeichnen, ist bei Gelb ein signifikantes Gefahrenpotenzial vorhanden. Bei Orange und Rot ist das Risiko für einen Anschlag als hoch einzustufen. Das System steht in der Kritik, weil es keine klaren Festlegungen gibt, welche Kriterien zu den jeweiligen Warnstufen führen, und die Warnhinweise zu unkonkret sind. Außerdem soll die Anhebung der Gefahrenstufe auch als probates, medienwirksames Mittel verwendet worden sein, um von anderen Problemen und Ereignissen abzulenken.
TEXT.Polish: National Security Agency (NSA), (ang. Agencja Bezpieczeństwa Narodowego) - amerykańska wewnętrzna agencja wywiadowczakoordynująca m.in. zadania wywiadu elektronicznego, powstała w kwietniu 1952 roku na bazie struktury działającej od 1949 roku, Agencji Bezpieczeństwa Sił Zbrojnych (Armed Forces Security Agency - AFSA).

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: For centuries, mankind has been harnessing the power of rivers to move waterwheels for various purposes. With the advent of electrical power, it was found the rivers were also very useful for generating electricity. Hydroelectric power plants derive power from rivers by constructing dams to ensure a dependable supply of water. The overflow is then released through special chambers where the moving water turns giant turbines, generating electricity. When planned and engineered properly, this system provides an excellent power source with very limited environmental impact. The Hoover Dam, constructed on the Colorado River near Las Vegas, was one of the earliest hydroelectric power plants.
TEXT.French: For centuries, mankind has been harnessing the power of rivers to move waterwheels for various purposes. With the advent of electrical power, it was found the rivers were also very useful for generating electricity. Hydroelectric power plants derive power from rivers by constructing dams to ensure a dependable supply of water. The overflow is then released through special chambers where the moving water turns giant turbines, generating electricity. When planned and engineered properly, this system provides an excellent power source with very limited environmental impact. The Hoover Dam, constructed on the Colorado River near Las Vegas, was one of the earliest hydroelectric power plants.

TEXT.English: Hopscotch

Hopscotch is a children's game that can be played with several players or alone. Hopscotch is a popular playground game in which players toss a small object into numbered spaces of a pattern of rectangles outlined on the ground and then hop or jump through the spaces to retrieve the object.
TEXT.French: une Marelle is a children's game that can be played with several players or alone. une Marelle is a popular playground game in which players toss a small object into numbered spaces of a pattern of rectangles outlined on the ground and then hop or jump through the spaces to retrieve the object.
TEXT.Polish: Uczestnicy rysują kształt klas - chłopka. Ustalają w drodze wyliczanek kolejność udziału w grze. Gra polega na umiejętnym przejściu przez osiem pól chłopka tj. przez wszystkie osiem klas dawnej szkoły podstawowej, wrzucaniu szkiełka w kolejne pola "chłopka", na zgrabnym podskakiwaniu i utrzymaniu się przez dłuższy czas na jednej nodze. Każde dziecko prowadzi grę na własny rachunek. Uczestnik wrzuca szkiełko w "pierwszą klasę", staje na jednej nodze, wskakuje w pole, podnosi szkiełko, przeskakuje resztę pól i wyskakuje na zewnątrz chłopka, w ten sposób stara się zaliczyć wszystkie osiem pól. W ramiona wskakuje się obunóż, zarówno w drodze do celu i w drodze powrotnej. Do głowy wskakuje się obunóż, wykonuje obrót w powietrzu i skacze z powrotem. Jeśli gracz skusi, kolejkę rozpoczyna następna osoba. Następną kolejkę nie zaczynamy od 1 klasy, ale od tej, na której skusiliśmy.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hopscotch[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also provides [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hopscotch[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also provides [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Hospital
Hotel
TEXT.French: Hotel

TEXT.English: A hotel is an establishment that provides paid lodging, usually on a short-term basis. The provision of basic accommodation, in times past, consisting only of a room with a bed, a cupboard, a small table and a washstand has largely been replaced by rooms with modern facilities, including en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning or climate control. Additional common features found in hotel rooms are a telephone, an alarm clock, a television, and Internet connectivity; snack foods and drinks may be supplied in a mini-bar, and facilities for making hot drinks. Larger hotels may provide a number of additional guest facilities such as a restaurant, a swimming pool or childcare, and have conference and social function services.
TEXT.French: A hotel is an establishment that provides paid lodging, usually on a short-term basis. The provision of basic accommodation, in times past, consisting only of a room with a bed, a cupboard, a small table and a washstand has largely been replaced by rooms with modern facilities, including en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning or climate control. Additional common features found in hotel rooms are a telephone, an alarm clock, a television, and Internet connectivity; snack foods and drinks may be supplied in a mini-bar, and facilities for making hot drinks. Larger hotels may provide a number of additional guest facilities such as a restaurant, a swimming pool or childcare, and have conference and social function services.
TEXT.Polish: Hotel -- obiekt wchodzący w skład infrastruktury turystycznej, świadczący odpłatnie usługi noclegowe (przede wszystkim krótkookresowe).

TEXT.English: Hotel gives one free merchant to city and boosts commerce and culture.
TEXT.French: Hotel gives one free merchant to city and boosts commerce and culture.
TEXT.Spanish: El Hotel proporciona un Mercader gratis a la ciudad, e impulsa el oro y la cultura.

TEXT.English: Hot Potato

Hot potato is a party game that involves players gathering in a circle and tossing a small object such as a beanbag or tennis ball to each other while music plays. The player who is holding the "hot potato" when the music stops is out. Play continues until only one player is left. The game is designed to be fast-paced and high-pressure and is often played by children. The game can also be played without music where there is a designated leader who shouts out "hot!" and the player holding the object is eliminated.
TEXT.French: Hot potato is a party game that involves players gathering in a circle and tossing a small object such as a beanbag or tennis ball to each other while music plays. The player who is holding the "hot potato" when the music stops is out. Play continues until only one player is left. The game is designed to be fast-paced and high-pressure and is often played by children. The game can also be played without music where there is a designated leader who shouts out "hot!" and the player holding the object is eliminated.
TEXT.Polish: Kalambur (z języka francuskiego) - zabawna gra słów o zbliżonym (paronomazja) bądź identycznym brzmieniu (homonim), lecz o różnych znaczeniach. Efekt powstaje dzięki przeprowadzanym przekształceniom wyrazów, m.in. usamodzielnieniu lub przestawieniu członów.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hot Potato[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] at the cost of extra [COLOR_RED]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hot Potato[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] at the cost of extra [COLOR_RED]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation.

TEXT.English: House of Parliament

A parliament is a legislature, especially in those countries whose system of government is based on the Westminster system modeled after that of the United Kingdom. The name is derived from the French parlement, the action of parler (to speak): a parlement is a discussion. The term came to mean a meeting at which such a discussion took place. It acquired its modern meaning as it came to be used for the body of people (in an institutional sense) who would meet to discuss matters of state. [PARAGRAPH:2]The origins of the modern concept of prime ministerial government go back to the Kingdom of Great Britain (1707 - 1800) and The Parliamentary System in Sweden 1721 - 1772, that coincided with each other. [PARAGRAPH:2]In theory, power resided in the monarch, who chaired cabinet and chose ministers. In reality, King George I's inability to speak English led the responsibility for chairing cabinet to go to the leading minister, literally the prime or first minister. The gradual democratisation of parliament with the broadening of the voting franchise increased parliament's role in controlling government, and in deciding who the king could ask to form a government. By the nineteenth century, the Great Reform Act of 1832 led to parliamentary dominance, with its choice invariably deciding who was prime minister and the complexion of the government.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other countries gradually adopted what came to be called the Westminster Model of government, with an executive answerable to parliament, but exercising powers nominally vested in the head of state, in the name of the head of state. Hence, the use of phrases like Her Majesty's government or His Excellency's government. Such a system became particularly prevalent in older British dominions, many of whom had their constitutions enacted by the British parliament. Examples include Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the Irish Free State and the Union of South Africa, though these parliaments themselves have often evolved or were reformed from their British model: the Australian Senate, for instance, more closely reflects the US Senate than the British House of Lords; whereas there is no upper house in New Zealand.[PARAGRAPH:2]In very ancient India, during the Vedic civilization, there are mentions of two Parliament-like gatherings of the Indo-Aryan kingdoms called the Sabha and the Samiti. During the time of the Buddha, many states were even tribal republics, called the Sanghas. The Sabha has been interpreted by the historians as a representative assembly of the elect-the important men of the clan, which ran day-to-day business with the king. The Samiti seems to be a gathering of all the male members of the kingdom, and probably convened only for the ratification/election of a new king. The two largely democratic institutions, which kept a check on the absolutism of the king, were given a sacred position, and have been called the daughters of the deity Prajapati in the Vedas, the holiest of all Hindu scriptures and the earliest Indo-European literature. However, these democratic institutions became weaker as republics became larger and elected chieftainship moved towards hereditary and absolute monarchy. The Sabha and the Samiti bear almost no mention in later literature. After this, India would not have any democratic legislature till the British times, culminating in its modern democratic Parliament (whose two Houses still bear the name of Sabha).
TEXT.French: A parliament is a legislature, especially in those countries whose system of government is based on the Westminster system modeled after that of the United Kingdom. The name is derived from the French parlement, the action of parler (to speak): a parlement is a discussion. The term came to mean a meeting at which such a discussion took place. It acquired its modern meaning as it came to be used for the body of people (in an institutional sense) who would meet to discuss matters of state. [PARAGRAPH:2]The origins of the modern concept of prime ministerial government go back to the Kingdom of Great Britain (1707 - 1800) and The Parliamentary System in Sweden 1721 - 1772, that coincided with each other. [PARAGRAPH:2]In theory, power resided in the monarch, who chaired cabinet and chose ministers. In reality, King George I's inability to speak English led the responsibility for chairing cabinet to go to the leading minister, literally the prime or first minister. The gradual democratisation of parliament with the broadening of the voting franchise increased parliament's role in controlling government, and in deciding who the king could ask to form a government. By the nineteenth century, the Great Reform Act of 1832 led to parliamentary dominance, with its choice invariably deciding who was prime minister and the complexion of the government.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other countries gradually adopted what came to be called the Westminster Model of government, with an executive answerable to parliament, but exercising powers nominally vested in the head of state, in the name of the head of state. Hence, the use of phrases like Her Majesty's government or His Excellency's government. Such a system became particularly prevalent in older British dominions, many of whom had their constitutions enacted by the British parliament. Examples include Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the Irish Free State and the Union of South Africa, though these parliaments themselves have often evolved or were reformed from their British model: the Australian Senate, for instance, more closely reflects the US Senate than the British House of Lords; whereas there is no upper house in New Zealand.[PARAGRAPH:2]In very ancient India, during the Vedic civilization, there are mentions of two Parliament-like gatherings of the Indo-Aryan kingdoms called the Sabha and the Samiti. During the time of the Buddha, many states were even tribal republics, called the Sanghas. The Sabha has been interpreted by the historians as a representative assembly of the elect-the important men of the clan, which ran day-to-day business with the king. The Samiti seems to be a gathering of all the male members of the kingdom, and probably convened only for the ratification/election of a new king. The two largely democratic institutions, which kept a check on the absolutism of the king, were given a sacred position, and have been called the daughters of the deity Prajapati in the Vedas, the holiest of all Hindu scriptures and the earliest Indo-European literature. However, these democratic institutions became weaker as republics became larger and elected chieftainship moved towards hereditary and absolute monarchy. The Sabha and the Samiti bear almost no mention in later literature. After this, India would not have any democratic legislature till the British times, culminating in its modern democratic Parliament (whose two Houses still bear the name of Sabha).
TEXT.Polish: Parlament - w państwach o demokratycznych systemach władzy, jest to najwyższy organ przedstawicielski, a jednocześnie zasadniczy organ władzy ustawodawczej. Parlament - w myśl Monteskiuszowskiej teorii podziału władzy - jest jednym z trzech pionów władzy państwowej i w żaden sposób nie jest ważniejszy od dwóch pozostałych. W systemach parlamentarno-gabinetowych (np. Polska) parlament jest najwyższym organem władzy państwowej. Z kolei w państwach realnego socjalizmu, parlamenty w mniejszym lub większym zakresie były kontrolowane przez partie komunistyczne. Pozycja parlamentu na przestrzeni dziejów zmieniała się. Wraz z przechodzeniem z monarchii przez monarchię konstytucyjną do parlamentarnej zauważany był wzrost roli parlamentu. Jednak w pierwszej połowie XX wieku dostrzegane jest osłabianie organu przedstawicielskiego na rzecz władzy wykonawczej.

TEXT.English: Serves as a government center of your empire
TEXT.French: Utilisé en tant que centre du Gouvernement de votre Empire
TEXT.German: Dient als ein Regierungszentrum Deines Imperiums.
TEXT.Spanish: Se utiliza como un centro de gobierno de tu imperio.

TEXT.English: Factory (Hovercrafts)

A hovercraft, also known as an air-cushion vehicle or ACV, is a craft capable of travelling over land, water, mud or ice and other surfaces both at speed and when stationary. Hovercraft are hybrid vessels operated by a pilot as an aircraft rather than a captain as a marine vessel. They operate by creating a cushion of low-pressure, high volume air between the hull of the vessel and the surface below. Typically, this cushion is contained within a flexible "skirt". They typically hover at heights between 200 mm (7.9 in) and 600 mm (24 in) above any surface and operate above 20 knots (23 mph) and can clear gradients up to 20 degrees. The first practical design for hovercraft derived from a British invention in the 1950s to 1960s. They are now used throughout the world as specialised transports in disaster relief, coastguard, military and survey applications as well as for sport or passenger service. Very large versions have been used to transport hundreds of people and vehicles across the English Channel whilst others have military applications used to transport tanks, soldiers and large equipment in hostile environments and terrain.

TEXT.Polish: Poduszkowiec (ang. hovercraft) - pojazd poruszający się na poduszce powietrznej. Poduszka ta powstaje gdy wentylator zasysa powietrze z otoczenia i wtłacza je pod spód pojazdu. Powietrze sprężane jest wewnątrz komory powstałej pomiędzy dnem maszyny, gruntem i elastycznym fartuchem. Gdy komora wypełni się powietrzem i poduszkowiec uniesie się na odpowiednią wysokość, nadmiar powietrza wydostaje się na zewnątrz. Wentylator musi mieć wystarczającą wydajność aby uzupełniał ubytek powietrza. Dzięki temu wysokość poduszki powietrznej pozostaje stała.

TEXT.English: Build a Hovercraft Factory to get access to Hovercrafts.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hovercraft Factory to get access to Hovercrafts.

TEXT.English: Human Genome Project
TEXT.French: Projet du Génome Humain
TEXT.Italian: Progetto Genoma Umano

TEXT.English: The Human Genome Project (HGP) was an international scientific research project with a primary goal to determine the sequence of chemical base pairs which make up DNA and to identify and map the approximately 20,000-25,000 genes of the human genome from both a physical and functional standpoint. It was completed on June 22, 2000, by the UCSC Genome Bioinformatics Group, composed of Jim Kent (then a UCSC graduate student of molecular, cell and developmental biology), Patrick Gavin, Terrence Furey and David Kulp. [PARAGRAPH:2]The project began in 1990 initially headed by Jamelia D. Wilkinson at the U.S. National Institutes of Health. A working draft of the genome was released in 2000 and a complete one in 2003, with further analysis still being published. A parallel project was conducted outside of government by the Celera Corporation. Most of the government-sponsored sequencing was performed in universities and research centers from the United States, Canada, New Zealand and Britain. The mapping of human genes is an important step in the development of medicines and other aspects of health care.[PARAGRAPH:2]The HGP originally aimed to map the nucleotides contained in a haploid reference human genome (more than three billion). Several groups have announced efforts to extend this to diploid human genomes including the International HapMap Project, Applied Biosystems, Perlegen, Illumina, JCVI, Personal Genome Project, and Roche-454.[PARAGRAPH:2]The "genome" of any given individual (except for identical twins and cloned organisms) is unique; mapping "the human genome" involves sequencing multiple variations of each gene. The project did not study the entire DNA found in human cells; some heterochromatic areas (about 8% of the total) remain un-sequenced.
TEXT.French: Le Projet du Génome Humain (HGP) was an international scientific research project with a primary goal to determine the sequence of chemical base pairs which make up DNA and to identify and map the approximately 20,000-25,000 genes of the human genome from both a physical and functional standpoint. It was completed on June 22, 2000 by the UCSC Genome Bioinformatics Group, composed of Jim Kent (then a UCSC graduate student of molecular, cell and developmental biology), Patrick Gavin, Terrence Furey and David Kulp. [PARAGRAPH:2]The project began in 1990 initially headed by Jamelia D. Wilkinson at the U.S. National Institutes of un Santé. A working draft of the genome was released in 2000 and a complete one in 2003, with further analysis still being published. A parallel project was conducted outside of government by the Celera Corporation. Most of the government-sponsored sequencing was performed in universities and research centers from the United States, Canada, New Zealand and Britain. The mapping of human genes is an important step in the development of medicines and other aspects of health care.[PARAGRAPH:2]The HGP originally aimed to map the nucleotides contained in a haploid reference human genome (more than three billion). Several groups have announced efforts to extend this to diploid human genomes including the International HapMap Project, Applied Biosystems, Perlegen, Illumina, JCVI, Personal Genome Project, and Roche-454.[PARAGRAPH:2]The "genome" of any given individual (except for identical twins and cloned organisms) is unique; mapping "the human genome" involves sequencing multiple variations of each gene. The project did not study the entire DNA found in human cells; some heterochromatic areas (about 8% of the total) remain un-sequenced.
TEXT.Polish: Projekt poznania ludzkiego genomu (en. Human Genome Project, HUGO Project) był to program naukowy mający na celu poznanie sekwencji wszystkich komplementarnych par zasad tworzących ludzki genom, zawierający 3.3 Gbp, ok. 30 tys. genów.

TEXT.English: Human Genome Project increase health and happiness in all cities.
TEXT.French: Le Projet du Génome Humain améliore la santé et le bonheur de toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El Proyecto Genoma Humano aumenta la salud y la felicidad en todas las ciudades.

TEXT.English: Human Rights Declaration
TEXT.French: La Déclaration des Droits de l'Homme

TEXT.English: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is a declaration adopted by the United Nations General Assembly (10 December 1948 at the Palais de Chaillot, Paris). The Declaration arose directly from the experience of the Second World War and represents the first global expression of rights to which all human beings are inherently entitled. It consists of 30 articles which have been elaborated in subsequent international treaties, regional human rights instruments, national constitutions and laws.
TEXT.French: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights is a declaration adopted by the United Nations General Assembly (10 December 1948 at the Palais de Chaillot, Paris). The Declaration arose directly from the experience of the Second World War and represents the first global expression of rights to which all human beings are inherently entitled. It consists of 30 articles which have been elaborated in subsequent international treaties, regional human rights instruments, national constitutions and laws.
TEXT.German: Die Allgemeine Erklärung der Menschenrechte (auch: Deklaration der Menschrenrechte oder UN-Menschenrechtscharta) wurde am 10. Dezember 1948 von der Generalversammlung der Vereinten Nationen im Palais de Chaillot in Paris verkündet. Sie enthält grundlegende Ansichten über die Rechte, die jedem Menschen unabhängig von Rasse, Hautfarbe, Geschlecht, Sprache, Religion, politischer Überzeugung, Herkunft, Vermögen oder Stand zustehen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Menschenrechtscharta entstand als Reaktion auf die Gräuel des Zweiten Weltkriegs und die Barbarei, die durch die Verachtung der Menschenrechte ausgelöst wurde.[PARAGRAPH:2]Seit der Verkündung der Charta wird der 10. Dezember als Tag der Menschenrechte begangen.

TEXT.English: Catcher (Hummingbird)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur de Colibris

TEXT.English: When early Spanish explorers first encountered hummingbirds in the New World, they called them joyas voladoras--or "flying jewels." But the hummingbird is more than just beautiful: Its physical capabilities put the toughest human being to shame. Like bees, hummingbirds carry pollen from one plant to another while they are feeding, thus playing an important role in plant pollination. Each bird can visit between 1,000 and 2,000 blossoms every day. There are about 330 different species of hummingbirds. Most of them live and remain in Central and South America, never venturing any farther north. Only 16 species of hummingbirds actually breed in North America.
TEXT.French: When early Spanish explorers first encountered hummingbirds in the New World, they called them joyas voladoras--or "flying jewels." But the hummingbird is more than just beautiful: Its physical capabilities put the toughest human being to shame. Like bees, hummingbirds carry pollen from one plant to another while they are feeding, thus playing an important role in plant pollination. Each bird can visit between 1,000 and 2,000 blossoms every day. There are about 330 different species of hummingbirds. Most of them live and remain in Central and South America, never venturing any farther north. Only 16 species of hummingbirds actually breed in North America.
TEXT.Polish: Kolibrowate (Trochilidae) - rodzina ptaków z rzędu lelkowych(Caprimulgiformes), a według taksonomii Sibley'a-Ahlquista tworząca osobny rząd (Trochiliformes) lub zaliczana do rzędu jerzykowych(Apodiformes). Obejmuje gatunki lądowe, zamieszkujące Amerykę, głównie w strefie międzyzwrotnikowej.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hummingbird Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Flax[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Hunting Instructions
TEXT.Italian: Istruzioni di caccia

TEXT.English: Hunting has an extremely long history and may well pre-date the rise of species Homo sapiens. While our earliest Hominid ancestors were probably frugivore or omnivore, there is evidence that early Homo, and possibly already Australopithecine species have used larger animals for subsistence, and that hunting may have been one of the multiple environmental factors leading to replacement of Holocene megafauna by smaller herbivores.
TEXT.French: Hunting has an extremely long history and may well pre-date the rise of species Homo sapiens. While our earliest Hominid ancestors were probably frugivore or omnivore, there is evidence that early Homo, and possibly already Australopithecine species have used larger animals for subsistence, and that hunting may have been one of the multiple environmental factors leading to replacement of Holocene megafauna by smaller herbivores.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szałas Łowcy[COLOR_REVERT] to miejsce gdzie gromadzą się myśliwi plemienia. Gdzie wymienia się opowieści i doświadczenia z polowań. Gdzie przekazuje się wiedzę o zwierzętach i uczy umiejętności ich tropienia i polowania.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunting Instructions[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that awards the promotion [COLOR_CYAN]Hunter I[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hunter[COLOR_REVERT] units trained in a city. It also raises [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Construisez des[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Instructions de Chasse[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer l'expérience de vos Chasseurs.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Instrucción de caza[COLOR_REVERT] para aumentar la eficacia de tus cazadores.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szałas Łowcy[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć efektywność Twoich myśliwych.

TEXT.English: Factory (Exoskeletons)

Hydraulics is a topic in applied science and engineering dealing with the mechanical properties of liquids. At a very basic level hydraulics is the liquid version of pneumatics. Fluid mechanics provides the theoretical foundation for hydraulics, which focuses on the engineering uses of fluid properties. In fluid power, hydraulics is used for the generation, control, and transmission of power by the use of pressurized liquids. Hydraulic topics range through some part of science and most engineering modules, and cover concepts such as pipe flow, dam design, fluidics and fluid control circuitry, pumps, turbines, hydropower, computational fluid dynamics, flow measurement, river channel behavior and erosion.
TEXT.French: Hydraulics is a topic in applied science and engineering dealing with the mechanical properties of liquids. At a very basic level hydraulics is the liquid version of pneumatics. Fluid mechanics provides the theoretical foundation for hydraulics, which focuses on the engineering uses of fluid properties. In fluid power, hydraulics is used for the generation, control, and transmission of power by the use of pressurized liquids. Hydraulic topics range through some part of science and most engineering modules, and cover concepts such as pipe flow, dam design, fluidics and fluid control circuitry, pumps, turbines, hydropower, computational fluid dynamics, flow measurement, river channel behavior and erosion.
TEXT.Polish: Siłownik to rodzaj silnika, w którym energia strugi czynnika roboczego jest zamieniana na energię mechanicznąruchu postępowego, kątowego bądź krzywoliniowego nazywanego skokiem. Ruch kątowy w siłownikach jest rozumiany jako powtarzalny obrót, nieprzekraczający najczęściej 360o.

TEXT.English: Build a Hydraulic Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine Hydraulique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Hydraulik Fabrik um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hydraulic Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Hydro Plant
Hydrocarbon Refinery

In organic chemistry, a hydrocarbon is an organic compound consisting entirely of hydrogen and carbon. Hydrocarbons from which one hydrogen atom has been removed are functional groups, called hydrocarbyls. Aromatic hydrocarbons (arenes), alkanes, alkenes, cycloalkanes and alkyne-based compounds are different types of hydrocarbons. The majority of hydrocarbons found on earth naturally occur in crude oil, where decomposed organic matter provides an abundance of carbon and hydrogen which, when bonded, can catenate to form seemingly limitless chains. They store a lot of energy and can be used to power cars or powerplants.
TEXT.French: In organic chemistry, a hydrocarbon is an organic compound consisting entirely of hydrogen and carbon. Hydrocarbons from which one hydrogen atom has been removed are functional groups, called hydrocarbyls. Aromatic hydrocarbons (arenes), alkanes, alkenes, cycloalkanes and alkyne-based compounds are different types of hydrocarbons. The majority of hydrocarbons found on earth naturally occur in crude oil, where decomposed organic matter provides an abundance of carbon and hydrogen which, when bonded, can catenate to form seemingly limitless chains. They store a lot of energy and can be used to power cars or powerplants.
TEXT.Polish: Węglowodory - organiczne związki chemiczne zawierające w swojej strukturze wyłącznie atomy węgla i wodoru. Wszystkie one składają się z podstawowego szkieletu węglowego (powiązanych z sobą atomów węgla) i przyłączonych do tego szkieletu atomów wodoru.

TEXT.English: Build a Hydrocarbon Refinery to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Raffinerie d'Hydrocarbone[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hydrocarbon Refinery by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Hypermarket
TEXT.French: Hypermarché
TEXT.Italian: Ipermercato

TEXT.English: In commerce, a hypermarket is a superstore which combines a supermarket and a department store. The result is a very large retail facility which carries an enormous range of products under one roof, including full lines of groceries and general merchandise. In theory, hypermarkets allow customers to satisfy all their routine weekly shopping needs in one trip.
TEXT.French: In commerce, a hypermarket is a superstore which combines a supermarket and a department store. The result is a very large retail facility which carries an enormous range of products under one roof, including full lines of groceries and general merchandise. In theory, hypermarkets allow customers to satisfy all their routine weekly shopping needs in one trip.
TEXT.Polish: Hipermarket - duży sklep wielkopowierzchniowy, często też ze względu na swoje rozmiary znajdujący się na obrzeżach miasta. Hipermarket w ścisłym tego znaczeniu to sklep (market) o bardzo dużej powierzchni, sprzedający szeroki asortyment towarów codziennego użytku, takich jak żywność, ubrania, kosmetyki, środki czyszczące, produkty FMCG (produkty szybkozbywalne z ang. Fast Moving Consumer Goods). Przyjmuje się że hipermarket ma powierzchnię przekraczającą 2,5 tys m2.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Hypocausts
TEXT.French: Hypocaustes

TEXT.English: A hypocaust was an ancient Roman system of underfloor heating, used to heat houses with hot air. The word derives from the Ancient Greek hypo meaning "under" and caust, meaning "burnt" (as in caustic). The Roman architect Vitruvius, writing about the end of the 1st century B.C., attributes their invention to Sergius Orata.
TEXT.French: A hypocaust was an ancient Roman system of underfloor heating, used to heat houses with hot air. The word derives from the Ancient Greek hypo meaning "under" and caust, meaning "burnt" (as in caustic). The Roman architect Vitruvius, writing about the end of the 1st century B.C., attributes their invention to Sergius Orata.
TEXT.Polish: Hypocaustum (łac. hypocaustum) - rzymski system centralnego ogrzewania /ogrzewania podłogowego. Stosowany od IV w. p.n.e. w starożytnej Grecji i od I w. p.n.e. w starożytnym Rzymie. System hypocaustum wykorzystywany był do ogrzewania domów, term publicznych i prywatnych gorącym powietrzem. Słowo dosłownie oznacza "podogień", od greckiego słowa hypo - poniżej lub pod spodem, i kaiein - spalić lub rozpalić ogień. W centralnym pomieszczeniu pod posadzką ustawiony był piec, który ogrzewał powietrze. Posadzkę układano na szeregu podpórek wysokości około 80 cm. Przestrzeń pomiędzy podpórkami tworzyła system kanałów wypełnianych gorącym powietrzem. Dodatkowo pomieszczenia były niekiedy ogrzewane przez kanały utworzone w ścianach wykonanych ze specjalnych pustaków. Przyjmuje się, że hypocastum zostało wynalezione przez Sergiusza Orata, choć nie jest to w pełni potwierdzone.

TEXT.English: Build Hypocausts to increase your cities happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hypocauste[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hypocausts by zwiększyć zadowolenie w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Factory (Hyposprays)

A jet injector is a type of medical injecting syringe that uses a high-pressure narrow jet of the injection liquid instead of a hypodermic needle to penetrate the epidermis. It is powered by compressed air or gas, either by a pressure hose from a large cylinder, or from a built-in gas cartridge or small cylinder.
TEXT.French: A jet injector is a type of medical injecting syringe that uses a high-pressure narrow jet of the injection liquid instead of a hypodermic needle to penetrate the epidermis. It is powered by compressed air or gas, either by a pressure hose from a large cylinder, or from a built-in gas cartridge or small cylinder.

TEXT.English: Build a Hypospray Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine d'Hypospray[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Hypospray Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: SnowCastle of Kemi
TEXT.Italian: Castello di neve di Kemi

TEXT.English: The SnowCastle of Kemi is the biggest snow fort in the world. It is rebuilt every winter with a different architecture in Kemi, Finland. In 1996 the first snow castle drew 300,000 visitors.[NEWLINE]The area covered by the castle has varied from 13,000 to over 20,000 square meters. The highest towers have been over 20 meters high and longest walls over 1,000 meters long, and the castle has had up to three stories. Despite its varying configurations, the snow castle has a few recurring elements: a chapel, a restaurant and a hotel.
TEXT.French: The Snowun Château of Kemi is the biggest snow fort in the world. It is rebuilt every winter with a different architecture in Kemi, Finland. In 1996 the first snow castle drew 300,000 visitors.[NEWLINE]The area covered by the castle has varied from 13,000 to over 20,000 square meters. The highest towers have been over 20 meters high and longest walls over 1,000 meters long, and the castle has had up to three stories. Despite its varying configurations, the snow castle has a few recurring elements: a chapel, a restaurant and a hotel.
TEXT.Italian: Il castello di neve di Kemi è la più grande costruzione in neve del mondo. Viene ricostruito ogni anno con una differente forma a Kemi, Finlandia. Nel 1996 il primo edifico attirò 300,000 visitatori.[NEWLINE]L'area coperta dal castello è variata da 13,000 a più di 20,000 metri quadri. Le torri più alte hanno superato i 20m, i muri più lunghi hanno superato 1000m e il castello ha avuto fino a 3 piani. Nonostante la sua configurazione variabile, il castello ha alcuni elementi ricorrenti: una cappella, un ristorante e un hotel.
TEXT.Polish: Lodowy hotel z północnej finlandii. Ściąga turystów z całego świata

TEXT.English: The SnowCastle of Kemi offers an excellent source of income and provides tourism for colder places.
TEXT.French: Les Châteaux de Glace de Kemile of Kemi constitue une source de revenus excellente, en tant que destination touristique attirante pour ceux qui aiment les endroits plus froids.
TEXT.German: Das Schneeschloss von Kemi ist eine hervorragende Einkunftsquelle und ein wunderbare Touristenattraktion in den kälteren Regionen.
TEXT.Italian: Il castello di neve di Kemi offre un'eccellente fonte di guadagno, ed è un'eccellente destinazione turistica per i posti più freddi.
TEXT.Spanish: El Castillo de hielo de Kemi ofrece una excelente fuente de ingresos, y es un fantástico destino turístico para los lugares más fríos.
TEXT.Polish: Hotel Śnieżny oferuje świetne źródło dochodu i idealne miejsce dla turystów na zimniejszych terenach.

TEXT.English: Icehouse
TEXT.Italian: Ghiacciaia

TEXT.English: Build an Icehouse to increase your cities health.
TEXT.French: Construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Maison de Glace[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una ghiacciaia per incrementare la salute delle tue città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Icehouse by poprawić jakość zdrowia Twoich poddanych w miastach.

TEXT.English: Ice houses originally invented in Persia were buildings used to store ice throughout the year, prior to the invention of the refrigerator.
TEXT.French: Ice houses originally invented in Persia were buildings used to store ice throughout the year, prior to the invention of the refrigerator.
TEXT.Italian: Le ghiacciaie vennero originalmente inventate in Persia; erano edifici destinati alla conservazione del ghiaccio durante l'anno, prima dell'invenzione del frigorifero.
TEXT.Polish: Lodownia - chłodnia, w której efekt chlodzenia uzyskuje sie za pomocą lodu naturalnego lub sztucznego. Równiez środek transportu izolowany cieplnie, który pozwala obniżać (i otrzymywać) temperaturę wewnątrz nadwozia bez użycia urządzenia chłodniczego.

TEXT.English: Shrine

Idolatry is usually defined as worship of any cult image, idea, or object, as opposed to the worship of a monotheistic God. It is considered a major sin in the Abrahamic religions whereas in religions where such activity is not considered as sin, the term "idolatry" itself is absent. Which images, ideas, and objects, constitute idolatry, and which constitute reasonable worship, is a matter of contention with some religious authorities and groups using the term to describe certain other religions apart from their own.
TEXT.French: Idolatry is usually defined as worship of any cult image, idea, or object, as opposed to the worship of a monotheistic God. It is considered a major sin in the Abrahamic religions whereas in religions where such activity is not considered as sin, the term "idolatry" itself is absent. Which images, ideas, and objects, constitute idolatry, and which constitute reasonable worship, is a matter of contention with some religious authorities and groups using the term to describe certain other religions apart from their own.
TEXT.Polish: Kapliczka - niewielka budowla kultowa, wznoszona przy drogach lub rozdrożach w celach wotywnych, dziękczynnych, obrzędowych itp., w najprostszej formie drewniana skrzynka z obrazem lub rzeźbą - świątkiemJezusa, Matki Bożej lub świętego zawieszona na drzewie lub słupie. W formie rozbudowanej niewielka forma architektoniczna drewniana lub murowana, czasami mała kaplica.

TEXT.English: Commerce boost with resources, however, this building becomes obsolete fast. This building requires Folklore civic.
TEXT.French: Bonus de commerce provenant des ressources. Cependant, le batiment est très vite obsolète. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Folklore[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Aumento de la bonificación al comercio de los recursos. Sin embargo, el edificio caerá en desuso rápidamente. Este edificio requiere el principio Folclore.
TEXT.Polish: Złoto od surowców, tak czy inacej szybko staje się przestarzały. Wymaga doktryny Folklor.

TEXT.English: Igloo

An igloo, or snowhouse, is a type of shelter built out of snow, originally built by the Inuit. Iglu is the Inuit word for a house or home built out of any material, and is not restricted exclusively to snowhouses but includes traditional tents, sod houses, homes constructed of driftwood and modern buildings.[NEWLINE]When referring to a snowhouse, igloos are shelters constructed from blocks of snow, generally in the form of a dome. Although igloos are usually associated with all Inuit, they were predominantly constructed by people of Canada's Central Arctic and Greenland's Thule area. Other Inuit people tended to use snow to insulate their houses which consisted of whalebone and hides. Snow was used because the air pockets trapped in it make it an insulator. On the outside, temperatures may be as low as -45 °C (-49 °F), but on the inside the temperature may range from -7 °C (19 °F) to 16 °C (61 °F) when warmed by body heat alone.
TEXT.French: An igloo, or snowhouse, is a type of shelter built out of snow, originally built by the Inuit. Iglu is the Inuit word for a house or home built out of any material, and is not restricted exclusively to snowhouses but includes traditional tents, sod houses, homes constructed of driftwood and modern buildings.[NEWLINE]When referring to a snowhouse, igloos are shelters constructed from blocks of snow, generally in the form of a dome. Although igloos are usually associated with all Inuit, they were predominantly constructed by people of Canada's Central Arctic and Greenland's Thule area. Other Inuit people tended to use snow to insulate their houses which consisted of whalebone and hides. Snow was used because the air pockets trapped in it make it an insulator. On the outside, temperatures may be as low as -45 °C (-49 °F), but on the inside the temperature may range from -7 °C (19 °F) to 16 °C (61 °F) when warmed by body heat alone.
TEXT.Italian: Un igloo, o casa di neve, è un tipo di riparo costruito in neve, ideato in origine dagli Inuit. Iglu è la parola Inuit che indica una casa costruita con qualsiasi materiale, e non è riferito solamente alle case di neve, ma include anche le tradizionali tende, case di erba, case costruite in legno di mare e edifici moderni.[NEWLINE]Riferendosi alle case di neve, gli igloo sono rifugi costruiti con blocchi di neve, generalmente a forma di cupola. Anche se gli igloo sono solitamente associati con tutti gli Inuit, essi venivano costruiti principalmente dalle tribù dell'Artico centrale canadese e dell'area della Groenlandia di Thule. Le altre tribù Inuit tendevano ad usare la neve per isolare le loro case, costruite con ossi di balena e pelli. La neve veniva usata perchè le bolle d'aria intrappolate in essa la rendono un ottimo isolante. All'esterno le temperature posso scendere fino a -45 °C (-49 °F), ma all'interno variano da -7 °C (19 °F) a 16 °C (61 °F) quando riscaldate dal calore corporeo.
TEXT.Polish: Igloo to konstrukcja mieszkalna budowana z bloków śniegu, zazwyczaj przybierająca formę kopuły zbudowanej na planie koła. Igloo są najbardziej znane wśród Inuitów z kanadyjskiej Arktyki (na wschód od rzeki Mackenzie) i okolic Qaanaaq na Grenlandii, gdzie od stuleci służyły jako tymczasowe schronienie dla myśliwych w ciągu zimy, sezonowe domy zamieszkiwane przez jedną lub kilka rodzin (wówczas złożone z kilku połączonych ze sobą pomieszczeń) lub przeznaczone na zgromadzenia mieszkańców wioski spore hale, w których organizowano narady, ceremonie, zawody sportowe, śpiewy i tańce.

TEXT.English: Igloos are useful for expanding cities in artic territory.
TEXT.French: Les Igloo sont utilisés pour étendre les Villes situées dans le territoire arctique.
TEXT.German: Iglos sind nützlich, um Städte in arktischen Regionen wachsen zu lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Gli igloo sono utili per espandere le città in territorio artico.
TEXT.Spanish: Los iglús son útiles para expandir las ciudades situadas en territorio ártico.
TEXT.Polish: Igloo są przydatne dla rozwijających się miast na terenach arktycznych.

TEXT.English: Factory (Immunity Drugs)
No idea what Hydro meant by this...
TEXT.French: No idea what Hydro meant by this...
TEXT.Polish: Lek - każda substancja, niezależnie od pochodzenia (naturalnego lub syntetycznego), nadająca się do bezpośredniego wprowadzania do organizmu w odpowiedniej postaci farmaceutycznej w celu osiągnięcia pożądanego efektu terapeutycznego, lub w celu zapobiegania chorobie, często podawana w ściśle określonej dawce. Lekiem jest substancja modyfikująca procesy fizjologiczne w taki sposób, że hamuje przyczyny lub objawy choroby, lub zapobiega jej rozwojowi. Określenie lek stosuje się też w stosunku do substancji stosowanych w celach diagnostycznych (np.metoklopramid w diagnostyce hiperprolaktynemii) oraz środków modyfikujących nie zmienione chorobowo funkcje organizmu (np. środki antykoncepcyjne).

TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de Médicaments immunisants[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Immunity Drug Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Imperial Mint

Mercantilism is based around accumulation of precious metals; however, if these metals are in bullion form instead of coin, the only beneficiaries of mercantilism are the government treasuries. If these metals are minted into standardized coins, it allows citizens of the country to use these precious metals as money, and share in this wealth (even though it is at the expense of every other country).
TEXT.French: Mercantilism is based around accumulation of precious metals; however, if these metals are in bullion form instead of coin, the only beneficiaries of mercantilism are the government treasuries. If these metals are minted into standardized coins, it allows citizens of the country to use these precious metals as money, and share in this wealth (even though it is at the expense of every other country).
TEXT.Polish: Typowa średniowieczna mennica była zespołem paru budynków, zwykle osadzonym w miejscu dobrze chronionym ze względu na ilość przetrzymywanego tam kruszcu. W budynkach trzymano narzędzia służące do przetopu kruszcu, formowania krążków (względnie "płacideł" innego kształtu) czy obrabiania ich. W zależności od swej wielkości mennica mogła posiadać jeden lub więcej tzw. warsztatów menniczych, z których każdy był samowystarczalny w procesie produkcji monet.

TEXT.English: Provides Gold and increases Gold production. This building requires Mercantile civic.
TEXT.French: Procure de l'or et augmenta la production d'or. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercantilisme[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Proporciona oro y aumenta su producción. Este edificio requiere el principio Mercantilismo.
TEXT.Polish: Daje złoto i zwiększa produkcję złota. Wymaga doktryny merkantylizm.

TEXT.English: Independence Hall
TEXT.French: Le Hall de l'Indépendance

TEXT.English: The Declaration of Independence was adopted in 1776 in this fine 18th century building in Philadelphia, to be followed in 1787 by the framing of the Constitution of the United States of America. Although conceived in a national framework and hence of fundamental importance to American history, the universal principles of freedom and democracy set forth in these documents were to have a profound impact on lawmakers and political thinkers around the world. They became the models for similar charters of other nations, and may justly be considered to have heralded the modern era of government.
TEXT.French: The Declaration of Independence was adopted in 1776 in this fine 18th century building in Philadelphia, to be followed in 1787 by the framing of the Constitution of the United States of America. Although conceived in a national framework and hence of fundamental importance to American history, the universal principles of freedom and democracy set forth in these documents were to have a profound impact on lawmakers and political thinkers around the world. They became the models for similar charters of other nations, and may justly be considered to have heralded the modern era of government.
TEXT.Polish: Independence Hall - historyczny budynek położony w Filadelfii w Stanach Zjednoczonych. Najbardziej znany jest jako miejsce, w którym podpisanoDeklarację Niepodległości oraz Konstytucję Stanów Zjednoczonych. Tutaj także odbywały się posiedzenia Kongresu Kontynentalnego. W budynku znajdował się również Dzwon Wolności, chociaż współcześnie jest on eksponatem w muzeum znajdującym się po drugiej stronie ulicy.

TEXT.English: East India Company
TEXT.French: La Companie de l'Inde de l'Est

TEXT.English: The East India Company was an early English joint-stock company that was formed initially for pursuing trade with the East Indies, but that ended up trading with the Indian subcontinent and China.
TEXT.French: Un La Companie de l'Inde de l'Est was an early English joint-stock company that was formed initially for pursuing trade with the East Indies, but that ended up trading with the Indian subcontinent and China.
TEXT.German: Als Ostindien-Kompanien bezeichneten sich mehrere spezielle Handelsgesellschaften einzelner Nationen Europas, über die diese den Handel mit Indien und Ostasien abwickelten. Sie entstanden größtenteils im 17. und frühen 18. Jahrhundert.[PARAGRAPH:2]Welthistorische Bedeutung erlangte vor allem die Britische Ostindien-Kompanie. Sie entstand Ende 1600 durch einen Handelsfreibrief Königin Elisabeths an reiche Londoner Kaufleute und gewann innerhalb kürzester Zeit immer mehr Einfluss und bekam immer neue Rechte zugestanden, so auch Zivilgerichtsbarkeit und Militärgewalt, um gegen die "Ungläubigen" in Indien Krieg zu führen. Im 18. Jahrhundert konnte sie durch kluge Handels- und Kriegspolitik alle anderen Ostindien-Kompanien ausstechen und das Handels- und Kolonialmonopol in Indien erlangen. Die einstige Handelgesellschaft entwickelte sich mehr und mehr zu einem eigenen Staat. Sie regierte Indien mit eiserner Hand, konnte aber trotzdem ein so riesiges Gebiet nicht angemessen verwalten. Es kam zu finanziellen Engpässen, Hungersnöten und immer häufiger auch zu blutigen Aufständen, die mit äußerster Brutalität niedergeschlagen wurden. 1833 verlor die Kompanie ihr Handelsmonopol und wurde wieder zu einer reinen Handelsgesellschaft. Nach einer Meuterei der indischen Soldaten 1857 wurde sie auch all ihrer Verwaltungsfunktionen enthoben, die damit direkt an die britische Krone übergingen. Übrig blieb der Ostindien-Kompanie nur der Teehandel, den sie zumindest bis 1873 weiterführen durfte. Am 1. Januar 1874 wurde die Britische Ostindien-Kompanie offiziell aufgelöst.

TEXT.English: Achievement (Industrial)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement Industriel
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo industriale

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Industrial Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives a +8% production bonus in all cities, as well as a +15% defense bonus.

Da una bonificación a la producción (+8%) y a la defensa (+15%) en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągniecię Przemysłowe[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Zwiększa produkcję o +8% oraz obronę o +15% we wszystkich miastach.
