Część gatunków jest padlinożerna. Ponadto zdarzają się gatunki drapieżne, jak Spilophorus maculatus polujący na pluskwiaki. W literaturze często błędnie określa się gatunki z rodzajów Trichillum i Uroxys jakoektopasożyty. Błąd ten wynika z występowania tych chrząszczy w futrzeleniwców. Gilmore i inni określili ich związek z leniwcami jako komensalizm.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Indigo[COLOR_REVERT] in a city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Junebug Sanctuary[COLOR_REVERT]. It also requires its Gatherer Building from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sericulture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Indigo[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de la ville pour pouvoir construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refuge pour Doryphores[COLOR_REVERT]. Il faut également avoir le bâtiment de récolteur provenant de [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sériculture[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Jungle Treehouse Hotel
A Jungle Treehouse is a hotel in the trees where people can observe the jungle from above.
TEXT.French: A Jungle Treehouse is a hotel in the trees where people can observe the jungle from above.
TEXT.Polish: Hotel - obiekt wchodzący w skład infrastruktury turystycznej, w którym świadczone są odpłatnie usługi noclegowe (przede wszystkim krótkookresowe).

TEXT.English: Build a Jungle Treehouse Hotel to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hotel de jungle[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Jungle Treehouse Hotel by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Catcher (Junglefowl)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur de Coq bankiva

TEXT.English: Junglefowl are the four living species of bird from the genus Gallus in the Gallinaceous bird order, which occur in India, Sri Lanka, Southeast Asia and Indonesia. These are large birds, with colourful male plumage, but are nevertheless difficult to see in the dense vegetation they inhabit. As with many birds in the pheasant family, the male takes no part in the incubation of the egg or rearing of the precocial young. These duties are performed by the drab and well-camouflaged female. The junglefowl are seed-eaters, but insects are also taken, particularly by the young birds. One of the species in this genus, the Red Junglefowl, is of historical importance as the likely ancestor of the domesticated chicken, although it has been suggested the Grey Junglefowl was also involved. The Sri Lanka Junglefowl is the National Bird of Sri Lanka.
TEXT.French: Junglefowl are the four living species of bird from the genus Gallus in the Gallinaceous bird order, which occur in India, Sri Lanka, Southeast Asia and Indonesia. These are large birds, with colourful male plumage, but are nevertheless difficult to see in the dense vegetation they inhabit. As with many birds in the pheasant family, the male takes no part in the incubation of the egg or rearing of the precocial young. These duties are performed by the drab and well-camouflaged female. The junglefowl are seed-eaters, but insects are also taken, particularly by the young birds. One of the species in this genus, the Red Junglefowl, is of historical importance as the likely ancestor of the domesticated chicken, although it has been suggested the Grey Junglefowl was also involved. The Sri Lanka Junglefowl is the National Bird of Sri Lanka.
TEXT.Polish: Kur bankiwa (Gallus gallus) - gatunek ptaka z rodziny kurowatych(Phasianidae), uważany za dzikiego przodka kury domowej. Udomowiony został 4000 lat p.n.e. Występuje w północno-wschodnich Indiach i południowo-wschodniej Azji.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Junglefowl Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Banana[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Castle Keep
TEXT.Italian: Mastio

TEXT.English: A keep is a strong central tower which is used as a dungeon or a fortress. Often, the keep is the most defended area of a castle, and as such may form the main habitation area, or contain important stores such as the armoury, food, and the main water well, which would ensure survival during a siege.
TEXT.French: A keep is a strong central tower which is used as a dungeon or a fortress. Often, the keep is the most defended area of a castle, and as such may form the main habitation area, or contain important stores such as the armoury, food, and the main water well, which would ensure survival during a siege.
TEXT.Italian: Un mastio è una grande torre centale, usata come prigione o fortezza. Spesso il mastio è l'area più difesa del castello e perciò cosituisce l'area principale di abitazione, e contiene importanti locali come l'armeria, la dispensa e il pozzo d'acqua principale, che permette la sopravvivenza durante un assedio.
TEXT.Polish: Stołp (wieża ostatecznej obrony lub bergfried, bergfrit) - średniowiecznawieża na planie koła, owalu, prostokąta lub wieloboku o znacznej wysokości (30-50 m) i dużej grubości murów (3-5 m). Charakterystyczne było to, że wieża ta nie była zamieszkiwana podczas pokoju. Początkowo wieże typu stołp były wolnostojące i przeznaczone do obrony pasywnej, z czasem zaczęto je włączać w obwód obronny zamku i zaopatrywać w elementy zwiększające możliwości aktywnej obrony. Stanowiła ostateczny punkt obrony. Dolna część wnętrza wieży była sklepiona, przeznaczona zazwyczaj na więzienie, dostępna była tylko od góry. Zasadą było umieszczanie wejścia do stołpu tylko w wyższej kondygnacji, poprzez ganek prowadzący z murów lub połączenie z domem pana feudalnego. Po przesuwaniu stołpów coraz bardziej na zewnątrz linii murów, wraz z ewolucją sztuki fortyfikacyjnej, zostały wyparte przez baszty i basteje, a w nowożytnej sztuce fortyfikacyjnej rolę ich przejął tzw. śródszaniec).

TEXT.English: Use the Keep to protect vital Cities and ensure that the enemy pays dearly for every victory
TEXT.French: Utilisez l'Enceinte du château pour protéger votre ville et la région aux alentours. Les victoires de l'adversaire auront moins d'impact sur votre population.
TEXT.Italian: Usa il mastio per proteggere le città-chiave e assicurarti che il nemico paghi caro per ogni vittoria.
TEXT.Spanish: Usa el Torreón para proteger las ciudades principales y asegurarte de que el enemigo paga cara su victoria.
TEXT.Polish: Używaj Stołpu by bronić strategiczne miasta oraz by wróg słono płacił za każde zwycięstwo

TEXT.English: Kerala School of Mathematics
TEXT.French: L'Ecole de mathématiques de Kérala

TEXT.English: The Kerala school of astronomy and mathematics was a school of mathematics and astronomy founded by Madhava of Sangamagrama in Kerala, India, which included among its members: Parameshvara, Neelakanta Somayaji, Jyeshtadeva, Achyuta Pisharati, Melpathur Narayana Bhattathiri and Achyuta Panikkar. The school flourished between the 14th and 16th centuries and the original discoveries of the school seems to have ended with Narayana Bhattathiri (1559-1632). In attempting to solve astronomical problems, the Kerala school independently created a number of important mathematics concepts. Their most importantresults-series expansion for trigonometric functions-were described in Sanskrit verse in a book byNeelakanta called Tantrasangraha, and again in a commentary on this work, called Tantrasangraha-vakhya, ofunknown authorship. The theorems were stated without proof, but proofs for the series for sine, cosine, andinverse tangent were provided a century later in the work Yuktibhasa (c.1500-c.1610), written in Malayalam, by Jyesthadeva, and also in a commentary on Tantrasangraha. Their work, completed two centuries before the invention of calculus in Europe, provided what is now considered the first example of a power series (apart from geometric series). However, they did not formulate a systematic theory of differentiation and integration, nor is there any direct evidence of their results being transmitted outside Kerala.
TEXT.French: The Kerala school of astronomy and mathematics was a school of mathematics and astronomy founded by Madhava of Sangamagrama in Kerala, India, which included among its members: Parameshvara, Neelakanta Somayaji, Jyeshtadeva, Achyuta Pisharati, Melpathur Narayana Bhattathiri and Achyuta Panikkar. The school flourished between the 14th and 16th centuries and the original discoveries of the school seems to have ended with Narayana Bhattathiri (1559-1632). In attempting to solve astronomical problems, the Kerala school independently created a number of important mathematics concepts. Their most importantresults-series expansion for trigonometric functions-were described in Sanskrit verse in a book byNeelakanta called Tantrasangraha, and again in a commentary on this work, called Tantrasangraha-vakhya, ofunknown authorship. The theorems were stated without proof, but proofs for the series for sine, cosine, andinverse tangent were provided a century later in the work Yuktibhasa (c.1500-c.1610), written in Malayalam, by Jyesthadeva, and also in a commentary on Tantrasangraha. Their work, completed two centuries before the invention of calculus in Europe, provided what is now considered the first example of a power series (apart from geometric series). However, they did not formulate a systematic theory of differentiation and integration, nor is there any direct evidence of their results being transmitted outside Kerala.
TEXT.Polish: W XII wieku Bhaskara pierwszy rozważał rachunek różnicowy, a także ideę pochodnej funkcji. Sformułował teżtwierdzenie Rolle'a (szczególny przypadek twierdzenia Lagrange'a), badał równanie Pella, i pochodną funkcji sinus. W XIV wieku oraz później Madhawa i inni matematycy ze szkoły Kerala rozwinęli jego idee. Stworzyli koncepcje analizy matematycznej, liczby zmiennoprzecinkowej, a także fundamentalne idee rachunku różniczkowego, włącznie z twierdzeniem Lagrange'a, całkowaniem wyraz po wyrazie, związkiem pomiędzy polem powierzchni pod wykresem funkcji a funkcją pierwotną (podstawowe twierdzenie rachunku całkowego), kryterium całkowym, oraz iteracyjnemetody rozwiązywania równań nieliniowych, szeregi nieskończone, szeregi potęgowe, szereg Taylora i szeregi trygonometryczne. W XVI wieku Jyeshtadeva zebrał wiele osiągnięć i twierdzeń Szkoły Kerala w Yuktibhasa, pierwszym w historii opracowaniu rachunku różnicowego, w którym wprowadził także idee rachunku całkowego. Postęp matematyczny w Indiach został skutecznie zahamowany w końcu XVI wieku w związku z zawieruchami politycznymi.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Factory (Kevlar)

Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fiber, related to other aramids such as Nomex and Technora. Developed at DuPont in 1965, this high strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically, it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components. Currently, Kevlar has many applications, ranging from bicycle tires and racing sails to body armor because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel on an equal weight basis. It is also used to make modern drumheads that withstand high impact. When used as a woven material, it is suitable for mooring lines and other underwater applications.
TEXT.French: Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fiber, related to other aramids such as Nomex and Technora. Developed at DuPont in 1965, this high strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically, it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components. Currently, Kevlar has many applications, ranging from bicycle tires and racing sails to body armor because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel on an equal weight basis. It is also used to make modern drumheads that withstand high impact. When used as a woven material, it is suitable for mooring lines and other underwater applications.
TEXT.Polish: Kevlar został wynaleziony w laboratoriach DuPont w 1965 przez zespół badaczy pod kierunkiem Stephanie Kwolek. "Kevlar" jest nazwą handlową firmy DuPont. Inne zarejestrowane nazwy handlowe to "Twaron" firmyTeijin Twaron.

TEXT.English: Build a Kevlar Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de Kevlar[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Kevlar Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Baray
LL Kilgii Gwaay
TEXT.French: Le Site de Kilgii Gwaay

TEXT.English: The Kilgii Gwaay site is located on Ellen Island in southern Haida Gwaii, off the west coast of British Columbia. At the time of its occupation, about 9,500 years BP, Kilgii Gwaay was situated on the ocean shore. Rising seas flooded the site within about 100 years, creating a waterlogged environment that sealed and preserved the archaeological remains. Kilgii Gwaay is situated today in the intertidal zone, and this unique setting presented challenging working conditions for the archaeologists who excavated the site. Work could only take place at low tide, and the excavation units had to be pumped full of water at the end of each day in an effort to minimize the damage caused by the incoming tide. The excellent preservation conditions at this waterlogged site resulted in the survival of a great deal of organic material. These materials included wooden artifacts such as a carved wedge used for splitting planks, and a small piece of 3-strand braided cordage made from spruce root. Large numbers of animal bones were also preserved at Kilgii Gwaay. These included the bones of more than a dozen species of birds including loon, albatross, duck and snow goose, numerous fish species including salmon, herring and rockfish and several species of mammals such as bear, otter and sea lion.
TEXT.French: The Kilgii Gwaay site is located on Ellen Island in southern Haida Gwaii, off the west coast of British Columbia. At the time of its occupation, about 9,500 years BP, Kilgii Gwaay was situated on the ocean shore. Rising seas flooded the site within about 100 years, creating a waterlogged environment that sealed and preserved the archaeological remains. Kilgii Gwaay is situated today in the intertidal zone, and this unique setting presented challenging working conditions for the archaeologists who excavated the site. Work could only take place at low tide, and the excavation units had to be pumped full of water at the end of each day in an effort to minimize the damage caused by the incoming tide. The excellent preservation conditions at this waterlogged site resulted in the survival of a great deal of organic material. These materials included wooden artifacts such as a carved wedge used for splitting planks, and a small piece of 3-strand braided cordage made from spruce root. Large numbers of animal bones were also preserved at Kilgii Gwaay. These included the bones of more than a dozen species of birds including loon, albatross, duck and snow goose, numerous fish species including salmon, herring and rockfish and several species of mammals such as bear, otter and sea lion.
TEXT.Polish: Kilgii Gwaay to stanowisko archeologiczne sprzed 9.500 lat, zlokalizowane na Wyspie Ellen na terenie zachodniego wybrzeża Kanady (Kolumbia Brytyjska)

TEXT.English: LEGENDARY LANDSCAPES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.
TEXT.French: LEGENDARY LANDSCAPES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.

TEXT.English: King's Council
TEXT.Italian: Consiglio del re

TEXT.English: The ancestors of modern parliaments date back to the English Witenagamot, a meeting of advisors to the king. After the Norman Conquest of England, this was replaced by the Curia Regis, or King's Council, composed of the greatest nobles and clerics in the land. In 1295, the first meeting of the Model Parliament was held, comprising the Curia Regis and elected persons from the Commons, or representatives of the boroughs.
TEXT.French: Les ancêtres des parlements modernes remontent à la Witenagamot anglaise, une réunion de conseillers du roi. Après la conquête normande de l'Angleterre, elle a été remplacée par la Curia Regis, ou le Conseil du roi, composé des plus grands seigneurs et des clercs dans la terre. En 1295, la première réunion du Parlement modèle a eu lieu, comprenant la Curia Regis et les personnes élues de la Chambre des communes, ou des représentants des arrondissements.
TEXT.Italian: I predecessori dei parlamenti moderni sono i Witenagamot inglesi, una riunione dei consiglieri del re. Dopo la conquista normanna dell'Inghilterra, essi vennero sosituiti dalla Curia Regis, o Consiglio del re, composta dai nobili e dagli esponenti del clero delle grandi prorpietà terriere. Nel 1295 venne tenuta la prima riunione del Parlamento modello, comprendente la Curia Regis e persone elette dai Sommons, corrispondenti ai rappresentanti dei distretti.
TEXT.Polish: Rada królewska, rada koronna, rada książęca (łac. Curia Regis) - w średniowiecznych monarchiach europejskich grupa najwyższych dostojników, w których gronie panujący podejmował najważniejsze decyzje; w wielu krajach przekształciła się w wyższą izbę parlamentu.

TEXT.English: Build the King's Council to increase your gold production at the cost of additional war weariness.
TEXT.French: Construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]le Conseil du roi[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre production d'or au coût de la lassitude de la guerre supplémentaire.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il consiglio del re per incrementare la tua produzione d'oro, al costo di stanchezza per la guerra aggiuntiva.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye el Consejo Real para incrementar tu producción de oro a costa de soportar hastío bélico adicional.

TEXT.English: PC Klasies River Caves
TEXT.French: Les Grottes souterraines de Klasies

TEXT.English: The Klasies River Caves are a series of caves located to the east of the Klasies River mouth on the Tsitsikamma coast in the Humansdorp district of Eastern Cape Province, South Africa. The three main caves and two shelters at the base of a high cliff have revealed evidence of middle stone age-associated human habitation from approximately 125,000 years ago. The 20 m thick deposits were accumulated from 125,000 years ago. Around 75,000 years ago during cave remodelling the stratigraphic sediments were moved out into external middens. In 1998, the South African government submitted a proposal to add the caves to the list of World Heritage Sites. From 1960 Ronald Singer, Ray Inskeep, John Wymer, Hilary Deacon, Richard Klein and others suggested the excavation yielded the earliest known remains of anatomically modern humans and behaviourally modern humans in the world. Further analysis suggested that those specimens fall "outside the range of modern variation".
TEXT.French: The Les Grottes souterraines de Klasies are a series of caves located to the east of the Klasies River mouth on the Tsitsikamma coast in the Humansdorp district of Eastern Cape Province, South Africa. The three main caves and two shelters at the base of a high cliff have revealed evidence of middle stone age-associated human habitation from approximately 125,000 years ago. The 20 m thick deposits were accumulated from 125,000 years ago.Around 75,000 years ago during cave remodelling the stratigraphic sediments were moved out into external middens.In 1998, the South African government submitted a proposal to add the caves to the list of World Heritage Sites.From 1960 Ronald Singer, Ray Inskeep, John Wymer, Hilary Deacon, Richard Klein and others suggested the excavation yielded the earliest known remains of anatomically modern humans and behaviourally modern humans in the world. Further analysis suggested that those specimens fall "outside the range of modern variation".
TEXT.German: Die Klasies-River-Höhlen sind ein Höhlenkomplex an der Mündung des Klasies-Flusses an der Tsitsikamma-Küste im Humansdorp-Distrikt der Ostkap-Provinz in Südafrika. Archäologische Funde in den drei wichtigsten Höhlen und zwei Unterständen an der Basis einer hohen Klippe belegen, dass hier bereits vor ca. 125.000 Jahren im Mittelpaläolithikum moderne Homo sapiens lebten. Schon kurz nach der Entdeckung wurde klar, dass es sich um die bis dahin ältesten Überreste von modernen Menschen handelte. Interessant war die Tatsache, dass diese Menschen auf die Jagd gingen und auch schon über Feuerstellen zum Braten und Kochen verfügten. 1998 hat die südafrikanische Regierung vorgeschlagen, die Höhlen in die Liste der Stätten des UNESCO-Welterbes aufzunehmen.
TEXT.Polish: W okresie MSA broń miotana - oszczepy - coraz częściej wyposażana była w ostrza liściowate jak i specjalnie odbijane odłupki o wcześniej zamierzonym trójkątnym kształcie które służyły jako groty. Zastosowanie kamiennych grotów znacznie zwiększało efektywność podejmowanych przez człowieka działań łowczych. W okresie MSA w zasadzie niepoświadczone jest stosowanie padlinożerstwa, zaś śladów zorganizowanych polowań ludzkich dostarcza wiele stanowisk, tj. Klasies River Mouth w RPA. Na stanowisku tym znaleziono szczątki bowida którego zabito za pomocą broni wyposażonej w kamienny grot. Kolejną cechą MSA jest rozwój narzędzi wykonywanych z kości i kościanych ostrzy broni miotanej grotów i harpunów. Na stanowisku Klasies River Mouth oraz w jaskiniach Border i Montagu odkryto właśnie tego typu zbrojniki, datowane na okres między 80 a 66 tys. lat temu. Na stanowisku Katanda (Demokratyczna Republika Konga) odkryto szereg płaskich ostrzy i harpunów datowanych na ok. 80 tys. lat temu. Na stanowisku Katanda odkryto szczątki dużych ryb słodkowodnych oraz szczątki większych ryb z gatunku Clarias, do których upolowania najprawdopodobniej używano wspomnianych wyżej harpunów. Innowacją technologiczną w okresie trwania MSA jest pojawienie się technologii wiórowej, w wyniku stosowania której otrzymywano wydłużone odłupki o równoległych bądź zbieżnych krawędziach.

TEXT.English: PREHISTORIC CAVES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.
TEXT.French: PREHISTORIC CAVES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.
TEXT.German: ACHTUNG! Gruppenwunder - nur ein Wunder der Gruppe kann je Nation gebaut werden[NEWLINE]Bei den [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Klasies-River-Höhlen[COLOR_REVERT] handelt es sich um das früheste Wunder der Gruppe "Prähistorische Höhlen". Sie sorgen in der Stadt für einen guten Nahrungs-, Produktions- und Wirtschaftsbonus, die späteren Höhlen bieten aber noch zusätzliche Vorteile, sodass sich das Abwarten durchaus lohnen kann.

TEXT.English: Knight's Stable
TEXT.Italian: Stalla dei cavalieri

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Stajnia - budynek w którym trzyma się konie lub ogół koni należących do jednego właściciela. W prawidłowym wyposażeniu stajni powinno się znajdować; sprzęt pożarowy, czyli gaśnice, węże, sprzęt do sprzątania. Powinien obowiązywać rygorystyczny zakaz palenia, ze względu na zagrożenie pożarowe. Stajnia składa się przeważnie z kilku pomieszczeń, z których każde ma określoną funkcję. Najważniejsze to stajnia główna, gdzie znajdują się boksy lub stanowiska, w których stoją konie. Drugim takim pomieszczeniem jest siodlarnia, gdzie trzyma się sprzęt jeździecki. Oba te pomieszczenia powinny mieć zapewnioną doskonałą wentylację, a siodlarnia dodatkowo ogrzewanie, aby można było wysuszyć zawilgocony sprzęt. Kolejnym pomieszczeniem może być paszarnia, gdzie przechowuje się i przygotowuje paszę (jedzenie) dla koni. Często w stajniach znajdują się pomieszczenia pomocnicze, w których trzyma się np. narzędzia do sprzątania lub przybory do podkuwania koni.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Knight's Stables[COLOR_REVERT] provide your mounted units with additional experience.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]une Ecurie des Chevalierss[COLOR_REVERT] provide your mounted units with additional experience.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Establo de caballeros[COLOR_REVERT] brinda experiencia adicional a tus unidades montadas.

TEXT.English: Knowledge Inheritance
TEXT.Italian: Trasmissione della conoscenza

TEXT.English: Knowledge is defined variously as (i) expertise, and skills acquired by a person through experience or education; the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject, (ii) what is known in a particular field or in total; facts and information or (iii) awareness or familiarity gained by experience of a fact or situation. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Knowledge acquisition involves complex cognitive processes: perception, learning, communication, association and reasoning. The term knowledge is also used to mean the confident understanding of a subject with the ability to use it for a specific purpose if appropriate.
TEXT.French: Knowledge is defined variously as (i) expertise, and skills acquired by a person through experience or education; the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject, (ii) what is known in a particular field or in total; facts and information or (iii) awareness or familiarity gained by experience of a fact or situation. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Knowledge acquisition involves complex cognitive processes: perception, learning, communication, association and reasoning. The term knowledge is also used to mean the confident understanding of a subject with the ability to use it for a specific purpose if appropriate.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tradycja[COLOR_REVERT] - przekazywane z pokolenia na pokolenie treści kultury (takie jak: obyczaje, poglądy, wierzenia, sposoby myślenia i zachowania, normy społeczne), uznane przez zbiorowość za społecznie doniosłe dla jej współczesności i przyszłości.[PARAGRAPH:1]W ten sposób prehistoryczni ludzie dbali o to by nie przepadała gromadzona przez nich wiedza.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Knowledge Inheritance[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Science[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also raises [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Construire la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Transmission de connaissances [COLOR_REVERT] permet d'augmenter la science de votre ville. Cela permet également de construire ensuite les Mythes.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Herencia del saber[COLOR_REVERT] para incrementar la producción científica de tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szałas Przekazywania Tradycji[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć przyrost nauki w mieście.

TEXT.English: Kotoku-in
TEXT.French: Kotoku-in

TEXT.English: The statue probably dates from 1252, in the Kamakura period, when temple records report the construction of a bronze statue. However, it is unclear whether that is the present statue. The statue was built inside a wooden temple, but that building washed away in the tsunami of September 20th, 1498 during the Muromachi period; the statue remains.
TEXT.French: The statue probably dates from 1252, in the Kamakura period, when temple records report the construction of a bronze statue. However, it is unclear whether that is the present statue. The statue was built inside a wooden temple, but that building washed away in the tsunami of September 20th, 1498 during the Muromachi period; the statue remains.
TEXT.Italian: La statua risale probabilmente al 1252, nel periodo Kamakura, quando i documenti del tempio registrano la costruzione di una statua in bronzo. Comunque, non è chiaro se quella fosse la statua attuale. La statua venne costruita all'interno di un tempio in legno, ma questo edificio fu distrutto da uno tsunami il 20 settembre 1498, durante il periodo Muromachi; la statua invece si salvò.
TEXT.Polish: Daibutsu z Kamakury - wykonany w 1252 r. przez Ono Goroemona brązowy posąg Buddy stojący w japońskim mieście Kamakura. Jego wymiary to: 14 m - wysokość; 11 m - szerokość, oraz 3 m - wysokość twarzy, waga: 103 tony. Budda siedzi w pozycji lotosu. Maksymalna grubość płyt brązu, z jakich jest wykonana rzeźba - 10 cm. Z tyłu posągu drzwi i dwa okna widokowe, wewnątrz - drabiny sięgające linii barków. Rzeźba stoi pod gołym niebem.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kotoku-in[COLOR_REVERT] No Unhealthiness from Population and reduced Maintenance in city. Spreads Buddhism.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kotoku-in[COLOR_REVERT] No Unhealthiness from Population and reduced Maintenance in city. Spreads Buddhism.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kotoku-in[COLOR_REVERT] Keine Verschlechterung der Gesundheit durch Bevölkerung und reduzierter Unterhalt in der Stadt. Verbreitet Buddhismus.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kotoku-in[COLOR_REVERT] Nessuna insalubrità dalla popolazione; mantenimento della città ridotto; diffonde il buddhismo.
TEXT.Spanish: El templo de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kotoku-in[COLOR_REVERT] eliminará la insalubridad por población y reducirá el mantenimiento de la ciudad. Propagará el budismo.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Daibutsu[COLOR_REVERT] Brak choroby od budowli oraz obniża utrzymanie. Rozprowadza buddzym.

TEXT.English: Moscow Kremlin
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT] reduces the cost of hurrying production and it increases its city's chances of generating [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Spies[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT] réduit le coût de l'accélération de la production et favorise l'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espion illustre[COLOR_REVERT] dans la ville où il se trouve.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kreml[COLOR_REVERT] senkt die Kosten der Produktionsbeschleunigung und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Große Spione[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cremlino[COLOR_REVERT] riduce il costo della produzione accelerata e aumenta la probabilità di generare [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grandi Spie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT] reduce el coste de acelerar la producción y aumenta las posibilidades de que en su ciudad se generen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grandes espías[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: La Brea Tar Pits
TEXT.French: Le Puits de goudron 'La Brea'

TEXT.English: The La Brea Tar Pits (or Rancho La Brea Tar Pits) are a group of tar pits around which Hancock Park was formed, in urban Los Angeles. Asphaltum or tar (brea in Spanish) has seeped up from the ground in this areafor tens of thousands of years. The tar is often covered with dust, leaves, or water. Over many centuries, the bones of animals that were trapped in the tar were preserved. The George C. Page Museum is dedicated to researching the tar pits and displaying specimens from the animals that died there. The La Brea Tar Pits are a registered National Natural Landmark.
TEXT.French: The Le Puits de goudron 'La Brea' (or Rancho Le Puits de goudron 'La Brea') are a group of tar pits around which Hancock un Parc was formed, in urban Los Angeles. Asphaltum or tar (brea in Spanish) has seeped up from the ground in this areafor tens of thousands of years. The tar is often covered with dust, leaves, or water. Over many centuries, the bones of animals that were trapped in the tar were preserved. The George C. Page un Musée is dedicated to researching the tar pits and displaying specimens from the animals that died there. The Le Puits de goudron 'La Brea' are a registered National Natural Landmark.
TEXT.Polish: Jezioro Asfaltowe (ang. Pitch Lake) - miejsce wypływu naturalnego asfaltuna powierzchnię Ziemi znajdujące się na wyspie Trynidad w pobliżu miasta La Brea. Powierzchnia tego "jeziora" wynosi 46 ha, maksymalna głębokość ustalona za pomocą pomiarów grawimetrycznych - 106 m. Zasilane z płytkiego, podpowierzchniowego złoża bituminów, składa się z mieszaninywody, bituminów i gazów, w formie półpłynnej emulsji. Na powierzchniowej partii mieszanina ta twardnieje, tworząc przy brzegach twardą asfaltową skorupę.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Brea Tar Pits[COLOR_REVERT] grants Science and Commerce boosts.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Puits de goudron 'La Brea'[COLOR_REVERT] donne un bonus de science et de commerce.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXTLa Brea Tar Pits[COLOR_REVERT] grants Science and Commerce boosts.

TEXT.English: Alchemist's Lab
TEXT.French: Atelier d'Alchimiste
TEXT.Italian: Laboratorio dell'alchimista

TEXT.English: A laboratory is a facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. The title of laboratory is also used for certain other facilities where the processes or equipment used are similar to those in scientific laboratories. These notably include: [PARAGRAPH:2]the film laboratory or darkroom [PARAGRAPH:2]the computer lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the medical lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the public health lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the clandestine lab for the production of illegal drugs [PARAGRAPH:2]In recent years government and private centers for innovation in learning, leadership and organization have adopted "lab" in their name to emphasize the experimental and research-oriented nature of their work. [PARAGRAPH:2]Scientific laboratories can be found in schools and universities, in industry, in government or military facilities, and even aboard ships and spacecraft. A laboratory might offer work space for just one to more than thirty researchers depending on its size and purpose.
TEXT.French: A laboratory is a facility that provides controlled conditions in which scientific research, experiments, and measurement may be performed. The title of laboratory is also used for certain other facilities where the processes or equipment used are similar to those in scientific laboratories. These notably include: [PARAGRAPH:2]the film laboratory or darkroom [PARAGRAPH:2]the computer lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the medical lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the public health lab [PARAGRAPH:2]the clandestine lab for the production of illegal drugs [PARAGRAPH:2]In recent years government and private centers for innovation in learning, leadership and organization have adopted "lab" in their name to emphasize the experimental and research-oriented nature of their work. [PARAGRAPH:2]Scientific laboratories can be found in schools and universities, in industry, in government or military facilities, and even aboard ships and spacecraft. A laboratory might offer work space for just one to more than thirty researchers depending on its size and purpose.
TEXT.Polish: Alchemia - przednaukowa praktyka łącząca elementy zawarte obecnie w chemii, fizyce, sztuce, semiotyce,psychologii, parapsychologii, metalurgii, medycynie, astrologii, mistycyzmie i religii. Wspólnym celem alchemików było odkrycie metody transmutacji ołowiu w złoto (kamień filozoficzny), lekarstwa na wszelkie choroby (panaceum) oraz eliksiru nieśmiertelności. Alchemię można uważać za bezpośredniego przodka współczesnej chemii.

TEXT.English: An early research facility, grants a science bonus to your city and increase specialist birth rate.
TEXT.French: An early research facility, grants a science bonus to your city and increase specialist birth rate.
TEXT.Spanish: Uno de los primeros complejos de investigación; proporciona una bonificación a la investigación en tu ciudad, y aumenta la tasa de nacimiento de Grandes personajes.

TEXT.English: Labor Union
TEXT.French: Syndicat
TEXT.Italian: Sindacato

TEXT.English: A trade union (or labour union) is an organization of workers who have banded together to achieve common goals in key areas, such as working conditions. The trade union, through its leadership, bargains with the employer on behalf of union members (rank and file members) and negotiates labor contracts (Collective bargaining) with employers. This may include the negotiation of wages, work rules, complaint procedures, rules governing hiring, firing and promotion of workers, benefits, workplace safety and policies. The agreements negotiated by the union leaders are binding on the rank and file members and the employer and in some cases on other non-member workers.
TEXT.French: A trade union (or labour union) is an organization of workers who have banded together to achieve common goals in key areas, such as working conditions. The trade union, through its leadership, bargains with the employer on behalf of union members (rank and file members) and negotiates labor contracts (Collective bargaining) with employers. This may include the negotiation of wages, work rules, complaint procedures, rules governing hiring, firing and promotion of workers, benefits, workplace safety and policies. The agreements negotiated by the union leaders are binding on the rank and file members and the employer and in some cases on other non-member workers.
TEXT.Polish: Podstawowym zadaniem związków zawodowych jest obrona interesów pracowników i działanie na rzecz poprawy ich sytuacji ekonomicznej i społecznej. Związki próbują więc przeciwdziałać zwolnieniom, kontrolują przestrzeganie kodeksu pracy przez pracodawców, zabiegają o wyższe pensje i lepsze warunki pracy dla pracowników. Często prowadzą również działalność samopomocową (np. fundusze strajkowe), edukacyjną (np. kursy przekwalifikowujące) i oświatową (np. kampanie informacyjne o prawach przysługujących pracownikom). Związki zawodowe nie muszą się kierować dobrem firmy, w której pracują przez co czasem firma z powodu negatywnych działań może upaść lub ponieść dotkliwe straty zarówno finansowe ale też wizerunkowe. Związki zawodowe powstały w Wielkiej Brytanii w roku 1824.

TEXT.English: Labor union national wonder increases happiness and healthiness on whole continent.
TEXT.French: La Merveille nationale du Syndicat améliore le bonheur et la santé sur tout le continent.
TEXT.Spanish: La maravilla nacional del Sindicato aumenta la salud y la felicidad en todo el continente.

TEXT.English: Laboratory
Labyrinth of Knossos
TEXT.French: Le Labyrinthe de Knossos

TEXT.English: The ruins of the palace of Knossos are often called "the labyrinth of Knossos". A found at Knossos, dating from around 1200 BC, connected with an oblation inscription, may mean a maze or the palace as one.
TEXT.French: The ruins of the palace of Knossos are often called "the labyrinth of Knossos". A found at Knossos, dating from around 1200 BC, connected with an oblation inscription, may mean a maze or the palace as one.
TEXT.German: Die Ruinen des Palastes von Knossos werden häufig als "Labyrinth von Knossos" bezeichnet. Eine in Knossos gefundene, aus der Zeit um 1200 v. Chr. im Zusammenhang mit einer Opfergabe stehende Inschrift meint möglicherweise ein Labyrinth oder den Palast als Ganzes.
TEXT.Italian: Le rovine del palazzo di Cnosso sono spesso chiamate "il labirinto di Cnosso". Una di queste, databile intorno al 1200 a.C. e collegata ad un'iscrizione, può indicare che il labirinto e il palazzo fossero una cosa sola.
TEXT.Polish: Knossos (łac. Cnossus, Gnossus) - miejscowość na greckiej wyspieKrecie, położona około 6 km na południowy wschód od Heraklionu(Iraklion), u stóp gór Ida. Fragment ruin pałacu (tzw. wschodnie wejście) zostało odkryte w 1878 roku przez Kreteńczyka z Heraklionu, archeologa i antykwariusza Minosa Kalokairinosa. Po zmianie prawa archeologicznego wykopaliska na wielką skalę rozpoczął w 1899 r. sirArthur Evans - od 1884 roku dyrektor Ashmolean Museum w Oksfordzie, który odkupił teren całego wzgórza. Odsłonięto wtedy rozległe ruiny pałacu pochodzącego z okresu 2000-1400 p.n.e. (kultury minojskiej), zwanego pałacem Minosa lub labiryntem kreteńskim. Około1450 p.n.e. Achajowie zajęli Kretę, pałac został ostatecznie zniszczony pod koniec XIV w. p.n.e.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Labyrinth of Knossos[COLOR_REVERT] increases the defense value of the city and provides land units an additional experience bonus of +2.
TEXT.French: Augmente la défense de la ville et accorde +2 EXP aux unités terrestres produites.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Labyrinth von Knossos[COLOR_REVERT] erhöht den Verteidigungswert der Stadt und liefert Landeinheiten einen zusätzlichen Erfahrungsbonus von +2.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Labirinto di Cnosso[COLOR_REVERT] incrementa il valore difensivo della città e fornisce 2 XP alle nuove unità di terra.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laberinto de Cnosos[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la bonificación defensiva de las ciudades y proporciona +2 puntos de experiencia a las nuevas unidades terrestres.

TEXT.English: Ladybug Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Coccinelles

TEXT.English: Ladybugs, also called lady beetles or ladybird beetles, are a very beneficial group. They are natural enemies of many insects, especially aphids and other sap feeders. A single lady beetle may eat as many as 5,000 aphids in its lifetime. Many species of lady beetles are present in Kentucky, and they are common in most habitats.
TEXT.French: Ladybugs, also called lady beetles or ladybird beetles, are a very beneficial group. They are natural enemies of many insects, especially aphids and other sap feeders. A single lady beetle may eat as many as 5,000 aphids in its lifetime. Many species of lady beetles are present in Kentucky, and they are common in most habitats.
TEXT.Polish: Biedronkowate (Coccinellidae) - rodzina obejmująca niewielkiechrząszcze o owalnym, wypukłym ciele. Przeszło 5,2 tysiąca gatunków na całym świecie, w Polsce ok. 80.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Sugar[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ladybug Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Sucre[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Coccinelles[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ladybug Sanctuary
TEXT.French: Refuge pour Coccinelles

A single lady beetle may eat as many as 5,000 aphids in its lifetime. Many species of lady beetles are present in Kentucky, and they are common in most habitats.
TEXT.French: Ladybugs, also called lady beetles or ladybird beetles, are a very beneficial group. They are natural enemies of many insects, especially aphids and other sap feeders. A single lady beetle may eat as many as 5,000 aphids in its lifetime. Many species of lady beetles are present in Kentucky, and they are common in most habitats.

TEXT.French: Les Peintures de la Grotte de Lascaux
TEXT.Italian: Grotte di Lascaux

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT][ICON_CULTURE] Boost in Cities when [ICON_GREATPEOPLE] Born. Bonus Doubles in Cities with [LINK=SPECIALIST_GREAT_ARTIST]Great Artists[\LINK]
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Bonus de [ICON_CULTURE] dans les Villes lors de la naissance d'un [ICON_GREATPEOPLE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Le Bonus est doublé dans les villes avec un [LINK=SPECIALIST_GREAT_ARTIST]Artiste Illustre[\LINK]
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET][ICON_CULTURE] Boost nelle città quando nascono [ICON_GREATPEOPLE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Bonus doppio nelle città con [LINK=SPECIALIST_GREAT_ARTIST]Grandi Artisti[\LINK]

TEXT.Polish: Lascaux - jaskinia krasowa w Akwitanii, w południowo-zachodniej częściFrancji, w której w 1940 roku odkryto rysunki i malowidła wykonane na ścianach w okresie paleolitu. Wpisana na listę światowego dziedzictwaUNESCO. Od 1963 r. jest zamknięta dla zwiedzających; turystom udostępniana jest znajdująca się w pobliżu wierna kopia jaskini (otwarta w 1983).

TEXT.English: Lascaux Paints
TEXT.Italian: Grotta di Lascaux

TEXT.English: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] is the setting of a complex of caves in southwestern France famous for its prehistoric cave paintings. The original caves are located near the village of Montignac, in the Dordogne département. They contain some of the most well-known Upper Palaeolithic art. These paintings are estimated to be 16,000 years old. They primarily consist of realistic images of large animals, most of which are known from fossil evidence to have lived in the area at the time. In 1979, Lascaux was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites list along with other prehistoric sites in the Vézere valley.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The cave was discovered on 12 September 1940 by four teenagers, Marcel Ravidat, Jacques Marsal, Georges Agnel, and Simon Coencas, as well as Ravidat's dog, Robot. Public access was made easier after World War II. By 1955, the carbon dioxide produced by 1,200 visitors per day had visibly damaged the paintings. The cave was closed to the public in 1963 in order to preserve the art. After the cave was closed, the paintings were restored to their original state, and are now monitored on a daily basis. Rooms in the cave include The Great Hall of the Bulls, the Lateral Passage, the Shaft of the Dead Man, the Chamber of Engravings, the Painted Gallery, and the Chamber of Felines.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] is the setting of a complex of caves in southwestern France famous for its prehistoric cave paintings. The original caves are located near the village of Montignac, in the Dordogne département. They contain some of the most well-known Upper Palaeolithic art. These paintings are estimated to be 16,000 years old. They primarily consist of realistic images of large animals, most of which are known from fossil evidence to have lived in the area at the time. In 1979, Lascaux was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites list along with other prehistoric sites in the Vézere valley.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The cave was discovered on 12 September 1940 by four teenagers, Marcel Ravidat, Jacques Marsal, Georges Agnel, and Simon Coencas, ainsi que Ravidat's dog, Robot. Public access was made easier after World War II. By 1955, the carbon dioxide produced by 1,200 visitors per day had visibly damaged the paintings. The cave was closed to the public in 1963 in order to preserve the art. After the cave was closed, the paintings were restored to their original state, and are now monitored on a daily basis. Rooms in the cave include The Great Hall of the Bulls, the Lateral Passage, the Shaft of the Dead Man, the Chamber of Engravings, the Painted Gallery, and the Chamber of Felines.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] to jaskinia krasowa w Akwitanii, w południowo-zachodniej części Francji, w której w 1940 roku odkryto rysunki i malowidła wykonane na ścianach w okresie paleolitu. Jaskinia została przypadkowo odkryta w roku 1940 przez dwóch chłopców wyciągających psa ze szczeliny. Czas powstania malowideł określany jest na wczesny okres kultury magdaleńskiej (15 000 - 13 000 p.n.e.). Zespół malowideł zdobiący ściany jaskini pochodzi z różnych epok i przedstawia przede wszystkim zwierzęta. Na około 150 metrach korytarzy umieszczonych jest około 150 malowideł i ponad 15 000 rytów skalnych. Naskalne rysunki przedstawiają głównie zwierzęta roślinożerne (jelenie, byki, bizony i konie). Można zaobserwować stopniowe doskonalenie rysunków przez paleolitycznych artystów - poszczególne rysunki powstawały prawdopodobnie w dużych odstępach czasu (nawet dziesiątek lat).[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Szczególnie interesująca jest tak zwana Sala Byków, w której przedstawiono cztery monumentalne byki (tury) obrysowane czarnym, grubym konturem wypełnionym plamami czerwieni i czerni. Twórca zastosował elementy tzw. perspektywy skręconej: np. w malowidle przedstawiającym byka (rysunek wielkości 3 m) artysta ukazuje z profilu biegnącego byka, którego rogi ukazane są od przodu. Największy fryz powstały w okresie paleolitu, w centralnej części ukazuje trzy zwierzęta: konia, byka i rena. Jest to najbardziej znany fragment malowidła należącego do ciekawszych elementów tego wspaniałego zabytku. Rzadko pojawiała się postać człowieka, jeżeli już jest to pokazana w prymitywny sposób.

TEXT.English: Build the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lascaux Paintings[COLOR_REVERT] to have one happy citizen in every city.
TEXT.French: Construisez les [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Peintures de Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour obtenir un citoyen content dans chaque ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye las [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Pinturas de Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] para tener un ciudadano feliz en cada ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Jaskinię Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć kulture w państwie.

TEXT.English: Lascaux is the setting of a complex of caves in southwestern France famous for its Paleolithic cave paintings. The original caves are located near the village of Montignac, in the Dordogne département. They contain some of the best-known Upper Paleolithic art. These paintings are estimated to be 17,000 years old. They primarily consist of realistic images of large animals, most of which are known from fossil evidence to have lived in the area at the time. In 1979, Lascaux was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites list along with other prehistoric sites in the Vézere valley.
TEXT.French: Lascaux is the setting of a complex of caves in southwestern France famous for its Paleolithic cave paintings. The original caves are located near the village of Montignac, in the Dordogne département. They contain some of the best-known Upper Paleolithic art. These paintings are estimated to be 17,000 years old. They primarily consist of realistic images of large animals, most of which are known from fossil evidence to have lived in the area at the time. In 1979, Lascaux was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites list along with other prehistoric sites in the Vézere valley.
TEXT.Italian: Lascaux è una località nel sud-ovest della Francia in cui è presente un complesso di grotte famosoper i dipinti rupestri del Paleolitico presenti al suo interno. Le grotte si trovano vicino al villaggio di Montignac, nel Dipartimento della Dordogna; contengono alcuni degli esempi più noti di arte dell'Alto Paleolitico. Approssimativamente, questi dipinti risalgono a 17,000 anni fa; rappresentano perlopiù immagini realistiche di grandi animali, la maggior parte dei quali vivevano in quell'area a quel tempo, basandosi sui ritrovamenti di fossili. Nel 1979, Lascaux è stata aggiunta dall'UNESCO al Patrimonio mondiale dell'umanità, assieme ad altri siti nella valle di Vézere.
TEXT.Polish: Lascaux - jaskinia krasowa w Akwitanii, w południowo-zachodniej częściFrancji, w której w 1940 roku odkryto rysunki i malowidła wykonane na ścianach w okresie paleolitu. Wpisana na listę światowego dziedzictwaUNESCO. Od 1963 r. jest zamknięta dla zwiedzających; turystom udostępniana jest znajdująca się w pobliżu wierna kopia jaskini (otwarta w 1983).

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] grants a huge early cultural boost.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] permet un bonus important de culture.

TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pinturas de Lascaux[COLOR_REVERT] dan un notable impulso cultural al inicio.

TEXT.English: Laser Tag Arena

Laser tag is a team or individual sport or recreational activity where players attempt to score points by tagging targets, typically with a hand-held infrared-emitting targeting device. Infrared-sensitive targets are commonly worn by each player and are sometimes integrated within the arena in which the game is played. Since its birth in 1984, with the release of the Star Trek Electronic Phasers toy manufactured by the South Bend Electronics brand of Milton Bradley, laser tag has evolved into both indoor and outdoor styles of play, and may include simulations of combat, role play-style games, or competitive sporting events including tactical configurations and precise game goals.
TEXT.French: Laser tag is a team or individual sport or recreational activity where players attempt to score points by tagging targets, typically with a hand-held infrared-emitting targeting device. Infrared-sensitive targets are commonly worn by each player and are sometimes integrated within the arena in which the game is played. Since its birth in 1984, with the release of the Star Trek Electronic Phasers toy manufactured by the South Bend Electronics brand of Milton Bradley, laser tag has evolved into both indoor and outdoor styles of play, and may include simulations of combat, role play-style games, or competitive sporting events including tactical configurations and precise game goals.
TEXT.Polish: Laser tag - zespołowy lub indywidualny sport, podobny do paintballa. Z tego względu często nazywany jest również "laserowym paintballem". Gracze zdobywają punkty poprzez trafienie innego gracza urządzeniem z opcją podczerwieni LED. Namierza ona specjalny nadajnik (zazwyczaj umieszczony w kamizelce), który dostaje każdy z graczy. W laser tag gra się zarówno w specjalnie przygotowanych pomieszczeniach lub też na zewnątrz. Gra w laser tag jest bezbolesna, ponieważ nie używa się tu pocisków.

TEXT.English: Build a Laser Tag Arena to increase your cities health and happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arène de Laser-quest[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé et le bonheur de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Laser Tag Arena to increase your cities health and happiness.

TEXT.English: Laundry Hut

Laundry is the washing of clothing and linens. Laundry processes are often done in a business, room or area in a home or apartment building, reserved for that purpose; this is also sometimes referred to as a laundry. The material that is being washed, or has been laundered is also generally referred to as laundry.
TEXT.French: Laundry is the washing of clothing and linens. Laundry processes are often done in a business, room or area in a home or apartment building, reserved for that purpose; this is also sometimes referred to as a laundry. The material that is being washed, or has been laundered is also generally referred to as laundry.
TEXT.Polish: Zwykła chata w której mieszka wioskowa praczka.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laundry Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that lowers a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation while also providing [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La Cabane de Blanchissage améliore la santé de votre ville et réduit le risque de maladies.

TEXT.English: Lava Rock Gatherer

Volcanic rock (often shortened to volcanics in scientific contexts) is a rock formed from magma erupted from a volcano. In other words, it differs from other igneous rock by being of volcanic origin. Like all rock types, the concept of volcanic rock is artificial, and in nature volcanic rocks grade into hypabyssal and metamorphic rocks and constitute an important element of some sediments and sedimentary rocks. For these reasons, in geology, volcanics and shallow hypabyssal rocks are not always treated as distinct. In the context of Precambrian shield geology, the term volcanic rock is applied to what are strictly metavolcanic rocks. Volcanic rocks are among the most common rock types on Earth's surface, particularly in the oceans. On land, they are very common at plate boundaries and in flood basalt provinces.
TEXT.French: Volcanic rock (often shortened to volcanics in scientific contexts) is a rock formed from magma erupted from a volcano. In other words, it differs from other igneous rock by being of volcanic origin. Like all rock types, the concept of volcanic rock is artificial, and in nature volcanic rocks grade into hypabyssal and metamorphic rocks and constitute an important element of some sediments and sedimentary rocks. For these reasons, in geology, volcanics and shallow hypabyssal rocks are not always treated as distinct. In the context of Precambrian shield geology, the term volcanic rock is applied to what are strictly metavolcanic rocks. Volcanic rocks are among the most common rock types on Earth's surface, particularly in the oceans. On land, they are very common at plate boundaries and in flood basalt provinces.
TEXT.German: Neben Feuerstein waren vulkanische Gesteine wie Bimsstein und Obsidian wichtige Werkstoffe für die frühen Menschen. Man konnte sie leicht einsammeln und gut bearbeiten. Aus Obsidian ließen sich gefährliche Waffen fertigen, während der leichte Bimsstein eher als Baumaterial verwendet wurde. Wie auch beim Feuerstein wurden am Anfang einfach herumliegende Steine mitgenommen. Diese geringe Ausbeute reichte aber für größere Stämme irgendwann nicht mehr aus, weswegen man dem Gestein später mit Steinbrüchen und Minen zu Leibe rückte.
TEXT.Polish: Skały magmowe - jeden z trzech głównych typów skał (obokskał osadowych i metamorficznych) budujących skorupę ziemską, powstałych wskutek krystalizacji lub zakrzepnięciamagmy w głębi skorupy ziemskiej lub lawy na powierzchniZiemi. Geolodzy opisali ponad 700 odmian skał magmowych.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lava Rock Quarry[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] production but withthe cost of causing [COLOR_RED]Unhealthiness[COLOR_REVERT]. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Obsidian[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Pumice Stone[COLOR_REVERT], the first being the resource that enables the training of obsidian [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Melee[COLOR_REVERT] units. The building is also quite important for being the prerequisite for building the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Waterproof Cement Maker[COLOR_REVERT] that gives [COLOR_CYAN]Waterproof Cement[COLOR_REVERT], which reduces the time to build water-based buildings quite considerably. To build it a city needs to be in the vicinity of an active or dormant [COLOR_CYAN]Volcano[COLOR_REVERT] (this includes a few [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wonder of Nature[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carrière de Roches de Lave[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production de votre ville.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lavasteinsammler[COLOR_REVERT] steigern die Produktion und den Reichtum früher Städte in der Nähe von Vulkanen und stellen außerdem die Rohstoffe [COLOR_CYAN]Bimsstein[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_CYAN]Obsidian[COLOR_REVERT] zur Verfügung, haben aber einen negativen Einfluss auf die städtische Gesundheit.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lava Rock Quarry by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Laxminarayan Temple
TEXT.French: Le Temple de Lakshmi Narayan

TEXT.English: The Laxminarayan Temple, also known as the Birla Mandir, is a Hindu temple dedicated to Laxminarayan in Delhi, India. Laxminarayan usually refers to Vishnu, Preserver in the Trimurti, also known as Narayan, when he is with his consort Lakshmi. The temple, inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi, was built by B. R. Birla and Jugal Kishore Birla between 1933 and 1939. The side temples are dedicated to Shiva, Krishna and Buddha. The temple, spread over 7.5 acres, is adorned with many shrines, fountains, and a large garden, and also houses Geeta Bhawan for discourses. The temple is one of the major attractions of Delhi, and attracts thousands of devotees on the Hindu festivals of Janmashtami and Diwali.
TEXT.French: Le Temple de Lakshmi Narayan (also known as the Birla Mandir) is a Hindu temple dedicated to Laxminarayan in Delhi, India.Laxminarayan usually refers to Vishnu, Preserver in the Trimurti, also known as Narayan, when he is with his consort Lakshmi. The temple, inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi, was made built by B. R. Birla and Jugal Kishore Birla from 1933 and 1939. The side temples are dedicated to Shiva, Krishna and Buddha.The temple spread over 7.5 acres, is adorned with many shrines, fountains, and a large garden, and also houses Geeta Bhawan for discources. The temple is one of the major attractions of Delhi and attracts thousands of devotees on the Hindu festivals of Janmashtami and Diwali.
TEXT.Polish: Świątynia Laxminarayan to hinduska świątynia wybudowana w Delhi, w Indiach, w latach 30-tych XX wieku.
