TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Mine (Lazulite)
Lazulite is a blue, phosphate mineral containing magnesium, iron, and aluminium phosphate. Lazulite forms one endmember of a solid solution series with the darker iron rich scorzalite.
TEXT.French: Lazulite is a blue, phosphate mineral containing magnesium, iron, and aluminium phosphate. Lazulite forms one endmember of a solid solution series with the darker iron rich scorzalite.
TEXT.Polish: Lazulit - rzadki minerał z gromady fosforanów. Nazwa pochodzi od arab. azul = niebo; pers. lazhward = niebieski oraz łac. lazulum = błękit, połączonego z gr. lithos = kamień (skała), nawiązując do charakterystycznej barwy tego minerału.

TEXT.English: Build a Lazulite Mine to increase your cities production.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mine de Lazulite[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lazulite Mine by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Lead Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Ołów (Pb, łac. plumbum) - pierwiastek chemiczny, metal z bloku p wukładzie okresowym. Ołów znalazł szerokie zastosowanie w przemyśle.

TEXT.English: Build a Lead Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de recyclage de Plomb[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à la ressource correspondante.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lead Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: New League of Nations

Spanish.Text: Nueva Sociedad de Naciones:Nueva Sociedad de Naciones

TEXT.English: The original League of Nations was created after World War I in an effort to ensure that such a calamitous event could never recur. Although the League was largely a brainchild of US president Woodrow Wilson, the United States Congress wanted nothing to do with the new organization, and, lacking any military force or financial support from the Great Powers, the League was unable to stop the world from the horrible chaos of the Second World War, and so the organization died. [PARAGRAPH:1]After that war, the concept of the League of Nations was revived in the United Nations, an organization backed - at least at first - by the full support of the United States. And while the UN was notably inefficient and (some said) corrupt, and though it had no military force of its own, it survived for many years, during which time the world did not fall prey to yet another world war. With the rise of the One World Government, the UN lost the reason for its existence, and it too was relegated to the "dustbin of history." [PARAGRAPH:1]As the One World Government has collapsed and humanity seems to be moving inexorably towards another worldwide conflict, there have been recent efforts to create a "New League of Nations" based in large upon the at least semi-successful UN model. It is yet unsure whether this effort will succeed, and if it does, whether the New League of Nations will be able to deflect the planet from its march toward self-destruction.
TEXT.French: La première Société des Nations fut fondée après la première guerre mondiale afin de s'assurer qu'un tel événement ne se reproduirait jamais. Cette Société devait en grande partie son existence au président des Etats-Unis, Woodrow Wilson, mais le Congrès américain refusa de collaborer avec elle. Dépourvue de toute force militaire et disposant de moyens financiers dérisoires, la Société des Nations ne fut pas en mesure de prévenir le terrible chaos de la deuxième guerre mondiale et fut dissoute. [PARAGRAPH:1]Après la guerre, le concept de Société des Nations se trouva à nouveau exploité lors de la création de l'Organisation des Nations Unies, qui obtint dans un premier temps l'assentiment total des Etats-Unis. L'ONU, disposant de sa propre armée, resta en place pendant de nombreuses années, malgré une réputation entachée d'accusations d'inefficacité et de corruption. Avec la création du Gouvernement Mondial, l'ONU cessa d'exister. [PARAGRAPH:1]Depuis la chute du Gouvernement Mondial, la crainte de voir l'humanité à nouveau sur la voie d'un conflit mondial mena à la création d'une Nouvelle Société des Nations, sur le modèle de ce qu'avait été l'ONU. Toutefois, nul ne peut affirmer que cela suffira à apaiser les tensions, ni si la Nouvelle Société des Nations sera en mesure d'empêcher la planète de courir à l'autodestruction.
TEXT.German: Der ursprüngliche Völkerbund wurde nach dem Ersten Weltkrieg in dem Bestreben gegründet, sicherzustellen, dass ein derartig verhängnisvolles Ereignis nie wieder stattfinden würde. Obwohl diese neue Organisation größtenteils auf eine Idee des U.S.-amerikanischen Präsidenten Woodrow Wilson zurückzuführen war, wollte der amerikanische Kongress jedoch nichts damit zu schaffen haben. Und weil es auch an militärischer und finanzieller Unterstützung seitens der Großmächte mangelte, war der Völkerbund am Ende nicht in der Lage, die Welt vor der verheerenden Katastrophe des Zweiten Weltkrieges zu bewahren und wurde aufgelöst. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nach dem Krieg wurde das Konzept des Völkerbundes dann in Form der Vereinten Nationen wiederbelebt, einer Organisation, die dieses Mal - endlich und erstmals - auch die volle Unterstützung der Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika erhielt. Zwar herrschte in den Vereinten Nationen mitunter ein spürbares Maß an Ineffizienz und (wie manche behaupteten) Korruption vor und sie unterhielten auch keine eigenen Militärtruppen, dennoch blieben sie viele Jahre lang bestehen, in denen die Welt keinen weiteren Weltkrieg erdulden musste. Durch die Bildung der Weltregierung verloren die Vereinten Nationen allerdings ihre Daseinsberechtigung und wurden somit ebenfalls in den "Abfalleimer der Geschichte" befördert. [PARAGRAPH:1]Da die Menschheit seit dem Zerfall der Weltregierung mittlerweile wieder scheinbar unaufhaltsam auf einen neuen weltweiten militärischen Konflikt zusteuert, gab es in jüngster Vergangenheit Bemühungen, einen "Neuen Völkerbund" zu bilden, der vorwiegend auf dem zumindest halbwegs erfolgreichen Modell der Vereinten Nationen basieren soll. Noch steht allerdings nicht fest, ob diese Bemühungen von Erfolg gekrönt sein werden, und, wenn ja, ob der Neue Völkerbund wirklich in der Lage sein wird, den Planeten vor der Selbstzerstörung zu bewahren.
TEXT.Italian: La Società delle Nazioni originale venne creata dopo la Prima Guerra Mondiale nel tentativo di evitare che cose simili accadessero ancora. Anche se la Società era principalmente frutto dell'impegno del presidente USA Woodrow Wilson, il Congresso degli Stati Uniti non volle averci nulla a che fare e, mancando una qualsiasi forza militare o un supporto finanziario da parte delle Grandi Potenze, la Società non riuscì a impedire l'orribile caos della Seconda Guerra Mondiale e si sfaldò. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dopo quella guerra l'idea della Società delle Nazioni venne fatta rivivere nelle Nazioni Unite, un'organizzazione supportata, almeno inizialmente, appieno dagli Stati Uniti. E l'organizzazione, pur essendo poco efficiente e (alcuni dicono) corrotta, e non avendo un proprio esercito, sopravvisse per molti anni durante i quali il mondo non ricadde in un'altra guerra mondiale. Con la creazione di un governo mondiale, le nazioni Unite non ebbero più motivo di esistere e vennero relegate nel "cestino della storia." [PARAGRAPH:1]Col crollo del governo mondiale, l'umanità sembra muoversi inesorabilmente verso un altro conflitto globale, ma ci sono stati dei tentativi di creare una "Nuova Società delle Nazioni" basata in gran parte sul modello semi-riuscito delle Nazioni Unite. Non si sa ancora se questo tentativo andrà a buon fine e, se ce la fa, se la Nuova Società delle Nazioni sarà in grado di distogliere il pianeta dalla marcia verso l'autodistruzion
TEXT.Spanish: La Sociedad de Naciones original se creó tras la Primera Guerra Mundial en un esfuerzo por que esa calamidad nunca volviera a ocurrir. Aunque la Sociedad era en gran parte hija del presidente norteamericano Woodrow Wilson, el congreso de los Estados Unidos no quiso saber nada de esa organización y, a falta de la fuerza militar o el apoyo económico de las grandes potencias, la Sociedad fue incapaz de impedir que el mundo cayera en el horrible caos de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, por lo que se disolvió. [PARAGRAPH:1]Tras la guerra, la idea de las Sociedad se reencarnó en las Naciones Unidas, una organización respaldada, al menos al principio, incondicionalmente por los Estados Unidos. Y, pese a que la ONU fue notablemente ineficaz y (a decir de algunos) corrupta, y a que carecía de fuerzas militares propias, sobrevivió durante muchos años, tiempo durante el cual la Tierra no cayó presa de otra guerra mundial. Con el auge del Gobierno Único Mundial, la ONU perdió la razón de su existencia y quedó relegada a la "papelera de la historia". [PARAGRAPH:1]Como el Gobierno Único Mundial ha caído y la humanidad parece avanzar inexorablemente hacia otro conflicto global, ha habido esfuerzos recientes para crear una "Nueva Sociedad de Naciones" basada a grandes rasgos en el modelo semiexitoso de la ONU. Se desconoce aún si estos esfuerzos se materializarán y, si de hacerlo, la Nueva Sociedad de Naciones conseguirá apartar al planeta de su marcha hacia la autodestrucció
TEXT.Polish: Oryginalna Liga Narodów została utworzona po zakończeniu Pierwszej Wojny Światowej w celu zapewnienia, że taka zagłada nigdy już więcej się nie powtórzy. Chociaż była ona głównie dzieckiem prezydenta USA Woodrowa Wilsona, Kongres Stanów Zjednoczonych nie zdecydował się na jakiekolwiek "zajęcie się" tą organizacją. Pozbawiona militarnego i finansowego wsparcia, Liga nie byłą w stanie uchronić świat przed Drugą Wojną Światową.[PARAGRAPH:1]Po wojnie koncepcja Ligi Narodów została wskrzeszona pod nazwą Organizacji Narodów Zjednoczonych, już pod pełnym wsparciem USA. I chociaż ONZ była dość nieefektywna i nie posiadała własnych sił zbrojnych, przetrwała wiele lat, podczas których świat nie popadł w żadną wojną światową. Wraz z pojawieniem się Rządu światowego ONZ stracił swój sens istnienia i został rozwiązany.[PARAGRAPH:1]Odkąd Rząd Światowy załamał się, ludzkość zdaje się zbliżać do kolejnego ogólnoświatowego konfliktu, istnieje wiele prób stworzenia "Nowej Ligi Narodów" opartej na modelu ONZ. Nie jest niczym pewnym to, że starania te się powiodą, a jeżeli nawet tak się stanie, to czy NLN będzie w stanie uchronić ludzkość przed samo-zagładą.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]New League of Nations[COLOR_REVERT] world wonder triggers [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Global Elections.[COLOR_REVERT] It guarantees eligibility for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Votes[COLOR_REVERT] (It is identical to the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]United Nations[COLOR_REVERT] wonder from the main game.)
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nouvelle Société des Nations[COLOR_REVERT] déclenche des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elections mondiales[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle garantit l'éligibilité pour les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]votes diplomatiques[COLOR_REVERT] (son fonctionnement est identique à celui des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nations unies[COLOR_REVERT] dans le jeu classique).
TEXT.German: Das Wunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuer Völkerbund[COLOR_REVERT] löst [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Globale Wahlen[COLOR_REVERT] aus und garantiert das Recht auf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatische Wahlen[COLOR_REVERT]. (Identisch mit dem Wunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vereinte Nationen[COLOR_REVERT] aus dem Hauptspiel.)
TEXT.Italian: La Meraviglia Mondiale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nuova Società delle Nazioni[COLOR_REVERT] attiva le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elezioni globali.[COLOR_REVERT] Garantisce l'idoneità per i [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Voti diplomatici[COLOR_REVERT]. (È identica alla Meraviglia Mondiale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nazioni Unite[COLOR_REVERT] del gioco principal
TEXT.Spanish: La gran maravilla de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nueva Sociedad de Naciones[COLOR_REVERT] activa el [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sufragio mundial[COLOR_REVERT] y garantiza la validez de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]votos diplomáticos[COLOR_REVERT] (es idéntica a la maravilla de las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Naciones Unidas[COLOR_REVERT] del juego principal).
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nowa Liga Narodów[COLOR_REVERT] wywołuje [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wybory Światowe[COLOR_REVERT]. Gwarantuje także [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Głosy Dyplomatyczne[COLOR_REVERT] (jest identyczna do cudu [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]ONZ[COLOR_REVERT] w grze głównej).

TEXT.English: Leonardo's Workshop
TEXT.French: Atelier de Léonard de Vinci
TEXT.Italian: Bottega di Leonardo

TEXT.English: Leonardo da Vinci was one of the most celebrated painters of the Italian Renaissance. His most famous works include the "Mona Lisa" and "The Last Supper". Although best known for his art, da Vinci was also an accomplished observer and designer. Preserved in his sketchbooks are ideas for dozens of inventions, many of them centuries ahead of their time. These include designs for such devices as drawbridges, construction equipment, parachutes, and even helicopters. His scientific and technical drawings became the basis for the development of many of these modern devices. -Civ3
TEXT.French: Leonardo da Vinci was one of the most celebrated painters of the Italian Renaissance. His most famous works include the "Mona Lisa" and "The Last Supper". Although best known for his art, da Vinci was also an accomplished observer and designer. Preserved in his sketchbooks are ideas for dozens of inventions, many of them centuries ahead of their time. These include designs for such devices as drawbridges, construction equipment, parachutes, and even helicopters. His scientific and technical drawings became the basis for the development of many of these modern devices. -Civ3
TEXT.German: Leonardo da Vinci war einer der gefeiertsten Maler der italienischen Renaissance. Zu seinen berühmtesten Werken zählen die "Mona Lisa" und "Das Abendmahl". Seinen Bekanntheitsgrad verdankt er zwar seiner Kunst, aber da Vinci war auch ein viel beschäftigter Forscher und Erfinder. In seinem Skizzenbuch dokumentierte er Ideen für Dutzende von Erfindungen, von denen viele ihrer Zeit Jahrhunderte voraus waren, so z.B. die Entwürfe von Zugbrücken, Baugeräten, Fallschirmen und sogar Hubschraubern. Die Entwicklung vieler moderner Gerätschaften basiert auf seinen wissenschaftlichen und technischen Aufzeichnungen. -Civ3
TEXT.Polish: Leonardo da Vinci, właściwie Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci -/i (ur. 15 kwietnia 1452 w Anchiano niedaleko Vinci we Włoszech, zm. 2 maja 1519 w Clos Lucź we Francji) - włoski renesansowy malarz, architekt, filozof, muzyk, pisarz, odkrywca, matematyk, mechanik, anatom, wynalazca, geolog.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Leonardo's Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] starts a golden age upon completion, provides two free scientists and increases scientific output from all specialists. Can not be built in same city as Copernicus Observatory or Isaac Newton's College.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Atelier de Léonard de Vinci[COLOR_REVERT] starts a golden age upon completion, provides two free scientists and increases scientific output from all specialists. Can not be built in same city as Copernicus un Observatoire or Le Collège d'Isaac Newton.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller de Leonardo[COLOR_REVERT] inicia una Edad de Oro una vez acabado, proporciona dos Científicos gratis y aumenta el rendimiento científico de todos los especialistas. No se puede construir en la misma ciudad que el Observatorio de Copérnico o el Colegio de Isaac Newton.
TEXT.Polish: Leonardo's Workshop grants 2 free technologies and increases city's science output by 50%. Can not be built in same city as Isaac Newton's College or Copernicus Observatory.

TEXT.English: Lepenski Vir
TEXT.Italian: Sito di Lepenski Vir

TEXT.English: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] is an important Mesolithic archaeological site located in Serbia in the central Balkan peninsula. It consists of one large settlement with around ten satellite villages. The evidence suggests the first human presence in the locality around 7000 BC with the culture reaching its peak between 5300 BC and 4800 BC. Numerous piscine sculptures and peculiar architecture are testimony to a rich social and religious life led by the inhabitants and the high cultural level of these early Europeans.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]This is clearly evident in the layout of the Lepenski Vir Ia-e settlement. The village is well planned. All houses are built according to one complex geometric pattern. These remains of houses constitute the distinct Lepenski Vir architecture, one of the important achievements of this culture. The main layout of the village is clearly visible. The dead were buried outside the village in an elaborate cemetery. The only exceptions were apparently a few notable elders who were buried behind the fireplaces in houses, according to a religious ritual.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The complex social structure was dominated by a religious cult which probably served as a binding force for the community and a means of coordination of activity for its members. Numerous sacral objects that were discovered in this layer support this theory. The most remarkable examples are piscine sculptures, unique to the Lepenski Vir culture, which represent one of the first examples of monumental sacral art on European soil.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] is an important Mesolithic archaeological site located in Serbia in the central Balkan peninsula. It consists of one large settlement with around ten satellite villages. The evidence suggests the first human presence in the locality around 7000 BC with the culture reaching its peak between 5300 BC and 4800 BC. Numerous piscine sculptures and peculiar architecture are testimony to a rich social and religious life led by the inhabitants and the high cultural level of these early Europeans.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]This is clearly evident in the layout of the Lepenski Vir Ia-e settlement. The village is well planned. All houses are built according to one complex geometric pattern. These remains of houses constitute the distinct Lepenski Vir architecture, one of the important achievements of this culture. The main layout of the village is clearly visible. The dead were buried outside the village in an elaborate cemetery. The only exceptions were apparently a few notable elders who were buried behind the fireplaces in houses, according to a religious ritual.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The complex social structure was dominated by a religious cult which probably served as a binding force for the community and a means of coordination of activity for its members. Numerous sacral objects that were discovered in this layer support this theory. The most remarkable examples are piscine sculptures, unique to the Lepenski Vir culture, which represent one of the first examples of monumental sacral art on European soil.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] Jedna z najstarszych ludzkich osad na świecie, obecnie najważniejsze stanowisko archeologiczne na terenie Serbii - historia tej mezolitycznej osady sięga około 7000 roku p. n. e. W dawnych czasach miejsce to stanowiło centralną, dość dużą osadę otoczoną licznymi satelickimi ośrodkami mniejszej wielkości. Szczytowy okres rozwoju tego regionalnego centrum przypada na lata 5300 - 4800 przed nasza erą, oryginalna architektura i znalezione rzeźby świadczą natomiast o wysokim poziomie kultury zamieszkałych w tym miejscu pierwotnych Europejczyków, wysokim stopniu rozwoju ich religii, struktur społecznych i sztuki.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Początek eksploracji stanowiska przez archeologów przypada na lata 60. XX wieku, lecz dopiero po kilku latach wykopalisk naukowcy w pełni zdali sobie sprawę z doniosłości swoich odkryć. Na początku lat 70. XX wieku całość odsłoniętych zabudowań przeniesiono niemal 30 metrów wyżej, a samo stanowisko zostało zatopione przez wody sztucznego zbiornika wodnego.

TEXT.English: Build the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] to get a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sacrificial Altar[COLOR_REVERT] in every city.
TEXT.French: Construisez les the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] to get a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]un Autel de sacrifices[COLOR_REVERT] in every city.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye el [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] para conseguir un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Altar de sacrificios[COLOR_REVERT] gratis para todas tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Lepenski Vir[COLOR_REVERT] daje darmowy [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ołtarz Ofiarny[COLOR_REVERT] w każdym mieście.

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET] -%d1 routes commerciales dans le Monde

TEXT.English: Levee
Liangzhu Jade Carver
TEXT.French: Ciseleur de Jade Liangzhu

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Liangzhu Jade Carver[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Liangzhu Jades[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Liangzhu Jade Carver[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Liangzhu Jades[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The Liangzhu were the last Neolithic jade culture in the Yangtze River Delta of China. The jade from this culture is characterized by finely worked large ritual jades, commonly incised with the taotie motif. The most exemplary artifacts from the culture were its cong (cylinders). The largest cong discovered weighed 3.5 kg. Bi (discs) and Yue axes (ceremonial axes) were also found. Jade pendants were also found, designed with engraved representations of small birds, turtles and fish. Many Liangzhu jade artefacts had a white milky bone-like aspect due to its tremolite rock origin and influence of water-based fluids at the burial sites, although jade made from actinolite and serpentine were also commonly found. Most of Liangzhu's contemporaries have some jades, but 90 per cent of all the cong and bi jades recovered, and by far the best in quality, are from Liangzhu sites. Jade artifacts unearthed from Liangzhu sites are said to have been influential on the development of other neolithic cultures in China.
TEXT.French: The Liangzhu were the last Neolithic jade culture in the Yangtze River Delta of China. The jade from this culture is characterized by finely worked large ritual jades, commonly incised with the taotie motif. The most exemplary artifacts from the culture were its cong (cylinders). The largest cong discovered weighed 3.5 kg. Bi (discs) and Yue axes (ceremonial axes) were also found. Jade pendants were also found, designed with engraved representations of small birds, turtles and fish. Many Liangzhu jade artefacts had a white milky bone-like aspect due to its tremolite rock origin and influence of water-based fluids at the burial sites, although jade made from actinolite and serpentine were also commonly found. Most of Liangzhu's contemporaries have some jades, but 90 per cent of all the cong and bi jades recovered, and by far the best in quality, are from Liangzhu sites. Jade artifacts unearthed from Liangzhu sites are said to have been influential on the development of other neolithic cultures in China.

TEXT.English: Library
Lichen Burner

Burning lichen with animal fat helped people who lived in the Tundra to melt ice, so they could have drinking water. They had no other way of getting fresh water, and ice used up too many calories to eat.
TEXT.French: Burning lichen with animal fat helped people who lived in the Tundra to melt ice, so they could have drinking water. They had no other way of getting fresh water, and ice used up too many calories to eat.
TEXT.Polish: Porosty - tradycyjna nazwa organizmów składających się z grzybów(Fungi), tworzących obligatoryjne symbiozy - głównie z prokariotycznymi cyjanobakteriami (Cyanobacteria) lub eukariotycznymi zielenicami (Chlorophyta). Jako samodzielna jednostka taksonomiczna przestała istnieć w 1981 roku w wyniku zmian wprowadzonych przez Międzynarodowy Kodeks Nomenklatury Botanicznej. Pojęcie to ujmowane jest obecnie w kategoriach ekologicznych (podobnie jak grzyby mikoryzowe), a nie systematycznych. Systematyka i nomenklatura porostów dotyczy ich komponentu grzybowego.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lichen Burner[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] at the cost of raising [COLOR_RED]Flammability[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lichen Burner[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] at the cost of raising [COLOR_RED]Flammability[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Lichen Gatherer

Lichens occur in some of the most extreme environments on Earth-arctic tundra, hot deserts, rocky coasts, and toxic slag heaps. However, they are also abundant as epiphytes on leaves and branches in rain forests and temperate woodland, on bare rock, including walls and gravestones, and on exposed soil surfaces in otherwise mesic habitats. The roofs of many buildings have lichens growing on them. Lichens are widespread and may be long-lived; however, many are also vulnerable to environmental disturbance, and may be useful to scientists in assessing the effects of air pollution, ozone depletion, and metal contamination. Lichens have also been used in making dyes and perfumes, as well as in traditional medicines.
TEXT.French: lichens occur in some of the most extreme environments on Earth-arctic tundra, hot deserts, rocky coasts, and toxic slag heaps. However, they are also abundant as epiphytes on leaves and branches in rain forests and temperate woodland, on bare rock, including walls and gravestones, and on exposed soil surfaces in otherwise mesic habitats. The roofs of many buildings have lichens growing on them. Lichens are widespread and may be long-lived; however, many are also vulnerable to environmental disturbance, and may be useful to scientists in assessing the effects of air pollution, ozone depletion, and metal contamination. Lichens have also been used in making dyes and perfumes, ainsi que in traditional medicines.
TEXT.German: Unter Flechten (Lichen) versteht man symbiotische Lebensgemeinschaften aus Pilzen und Grünalgen oder Cyanobakterien. Weltweit gibt es rund 25000 Flechtenarten, in Mitteleuropa etwa 2000.[NEWLINE]Flechten wurden zunächst gesammelt, um sie als Nahrungsmittel zu verwenden. Ab dem Altertum wurden sie auch als Heilmittel für die verschiedensten Krankheiten eingesetzt. Noch heute ist z.B. isländisches Moos in Hustenmitteln enthalten. In der Neuzeit sind noch viele weitere Einsatzmöglichkeiten hinzugekommen, so werden verschiedene Flechten in der Parfüm- oder Alkoholherstellung verwendet.
TEXT.Polish: Porosty - tradycyjna nazwa organizmów składających się z grzybów(Fungi), tworzących obligatoryjne symbiozy - głównie z prokariotycznymi cyjanobakteriami (Cyanobacteria) lub eukariotycznymi zielenicami (Chlorophyta). Jako samodzielna jednostka taksonomiczna przestała istnieć w 1981 roku w wyniku zmian wprowadzonych przez Międzynarodowy Kodeks Nomenklatury Botanicznej. Pojęcie to ujmowane jest obecnie w kategoriach ekologicznych (podobnie jak grzyby mikoryzowe), a nie systematycznych. Systematyka i nomenklatura porostów dotyczy ich komponentu grzybowego.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lichen Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT]. It also lowers [COLOR_GREEN]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Utile pour réduire les maladies et augmenter la production de votre ville dans l'Ere préhistorique
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Flechtensammler[COLOR_REVERT] sind wichtig für das Überleben früher Städte. Sie vermindern die Wahrscheinlichkeit für Krankheitsausbrüche und steigern zusätzlich die allgemeine Gesundheit. Außerdem kurbeln sie die Produktion an.

TEXT.English: Lighthouse
Liquid Metals Foundry

Liquidmetal alloys contain atoms of significantly different sizes. They form a dense mix with low free volume. Unlike crystalline metals, there is no obvious melting point at which viscosity drops suddenly. Vitreloy behaves more like other glasses, in that its viscosity drops gradually with increased temperature. At high temperature, it behaves in a plastic manner, allowing the mechanical properties to be controlled relatively easily during casting. The viscosity prevents the atoms moving enough to form an ordered lattice, so the material retains its amorphous properties even after being heat-formed. The alloys have relatively low softening temperatures, allowing casting of complicated shapes without need of finishing. The material properties immediately after casting are much better than that of conventional metals; usually, cast metals have worse properties than forged or wrought ones. The alloys are also malleable at low temperatures (400 °C or 752 °F for the earliest formulation), and can be molded. The low free volume also results in low shrinkage during cooling. For all of these reasons, Liquidmetal can be formed into complex shapes using processes similar to thermoplastics, which makes Liquidmetal a potential replacement for many applications where plastics would normally be used.
TEXT.French: Liquidmetal alloys contain atoms of significantly different sizes. They form a dense mix with low free volume. Unlike crystalline metals, there is no obvious melting point at which viscosity drops suddenly. Vitreloy behaves more like other glasses, in that its viscosity drops gradually with increased temperature. At high temperature, it behaves in a plastic manner, allowing the mechanical properties to be controlled relatively easily during casting. The viscosity prevents the atoms moving enough to form an ordered lattice, so the material retains its amorphous properties even after being heat-formed. The alloys have relatively low softening temperatures, allowing casting of complicated shapes without need of finishing. The material properties immediately after casting are much better than that of conventional metals; usually, cast metals have worse properties than forged or wrought ones. The alloys are also malleable at low temperatures (400 °C or 752 °F for the earliest formulation), and can be molded. The low free volume also results in low shrinkage during cooling. For all of these reasons, Liquidmetal can be formed into complex shapes using processes similar to thermoplastics, which makes Liquidmetal a potential replacement for many applications where plastics would normally be used.

TEXT.English: Build a Liquid Metals Foundry to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fonderie de métaux liquides[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Liquid Metals Foundry by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Lizard Hunter's Camp
TEXT.French: Camp du chasseur de reptiles

TEXT.English: Lizards are a widespread group of squamate reptiles, with more than 9,766 species, ranging across all continents except Antarctica, as well as most oceanic island chains. The group, traditionally recognized as the suborder Lacertilia, is defined as all extant members of the Lepidosauria (reptiles with overlapping scales) that are neither sphenodonts (i.e., tuatara) nor snakes - they form an evolutionary grade. While the snakes are recognized as falling phylogenetically within the Toxicofera clade from which they evolved, the sphenodonts are the sister group to the squamates, the larger monophyletic group, which includes both the lizards and the snakes.
TEXT.French: Lizards are a widespread group of squamate reptiles, with more than 9,766 species, ranging across all continents except Antarctica, as well as most oceanic island chains. The group, traditionally recognized as the suborder Lacertilia, is defined as all extant members of the Lepidosauria (reptiles with overlapping scales) that are neither sphenodonts (i.e., tuatara) nor snakes - they form an evolutionary grade. While the snakes are recognized as falling phylogenetically within the Toxicofera clade from which they evolved, the sphenodonts are the sister group to the squamates, the larger monophyletic group, which includes both the lizards and the snakes.
TEXT.Polish: Jaszczurki (Lacertilia, dawniej Sauria) - grupa gadów łuskonośnychobejmująca czworonożne lub beznogie zwierzęta lądowe o wydłużonym ciele, oczach posiadających powieki, mocnych szczękach i diapsydalnejczaszce. Występują na wszystkich kontynentach poza Antarktydą oraz na wielu wyspach oceanicznych. Są najliczniejszą grupą gadów obejmującą ponad 4000 gatunków.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lizard Hunter's Camp[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Science[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Lizards[COLOR_REVERT] which later enable the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Herpetology Lab[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Silk[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Stone[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lizard Hunter's Camp[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Science[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Lizards[COLOR_REVERT] which later enable the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Herpetology Lab[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Silk[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Stone[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.

TEXT.English: Local Courthouse
TEXT.French: Tribunal Local
TEXT.Italian: Tribunale locale

TEXT.English: A local courthouse is a court that has limited jurisdiction over minor civil and criminal matters, as matters of contract not exceeding a particular amount of money, usually $50,000.
TEXT.French: A local courthouse is a court that has limited jurisdiction over minor civil and criminal matters, as matters of contract not exceeding a particular amount of money, usually $50,000.
TEXT.Polish: Sąd rejonowy (skr. "SR") - w polskim systemie wymiaru sprawiedliwościjeden z sądów powszechnych powołanych do rozpoznawania wszystkich spraw należących do sądów powszechnych, z wyjątkiem spraw zastrzeżonych dla sądów wyższych instancji.

TEXT.English: Local Courthouses lower city maintenance costs and provide you with a bonus to espionage.
TEXT.French: Local un Tribunals lower city maintenance costs and provide you with a bonus to espionage.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Juzgados locales reducen los costes de mantenimiento de la ciudad, y te aportan una bonificación al espionaje.

TEXT.English: Log Roller System

Log Rollers were prehistoric "conveyor belts" were heavy cargo was put on top of logs and rolled to its destination. A log would represent a foot or three of width, so between 300 and 1,000 logs were required to make a Log Roller System that covered several hundred feet.
TEXT.French: Log Rollers were prehistoric "conveyor belts" were heavy cargo was put on top of logs and rolled to its destination. A log would represent a foot or three of width, so between 300 to 1,000 logs were required to make a un Troncs à rouler that covered several hundred feet.
TEXT.Polish: Specjalny sposób przemieszczania cięzkich ładunków na platformie poruszającej się po drewnianych palikach - prymitywnych kołach.

TEXT.English: Build a Log Roller System to increase Production.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Troncs à rouler[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Log Roller System to increase Production.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]+%d1_Amount%% Support Strength from any Long Range Support Unit aiding in city defense.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+%d1_Amount%% de Puissance en soutien, des unités de longue portée participant à la défense de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+%d1_Amount%% di Supporto ad ogni unità da supporto a lungo raggio che partecipa alla difesa cittadina.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]+%d1_Amount%% do Siły Wspomagania z jakiejkolwiek jednostki Strzelniczej broniącej miasta.

TEXT.English: Longevity
TEXT.French: Longévité
TEXT.Italian: Longevità

TEXT.English: As the lifespan of a human being has slowly increased over the centuries, a shift in medical focus began to take place. Infectious diseases, once the leading cause of death, began to be tamed by modern vaccinations. This allowed the field to spend more time combating those ailments associated with advanced aging, such as cancer and heart disease. This trend shows no signs of slowing, but rather accelerating. Modern technology permits sophisticated diagnosis and treatment of illness, while at the same time identifying their genetic roots.
TEXT.French: As the lifespan of a human being has slowly increased over the centuries, a shift in medical focus began to take place. Infectious diseases, once the leading cause of death, began to be tamed by modern vaccinations. This allowed the field to spend more time combating those ailments associated with advanced aging, such as cancer and heart disease. This trend shows no signs of slowing, but rather accelerating. Modern technology permits sophisticated diagnosis and treatment of illness, while at the same time identifying their genetic roots.
TEXT.Polish: Jakość życia człowieka powoli wzrosła na przestrzeni wieków. Choroby zakaźne przestały być zagrożeniem wraz z pojawieniem się szczepionek. Pozwoliło to na poświęcenie badań nad zwalczaniem problemu starzenia się. Tendencja ta nie wykazuje żadnych oznak spowolnienia, ale raczej przyspiesza. Nowoczesna technologia pozwala na zaawansowane diagnostyki i leczenia chorób, a jednocześnie pozwalające na identyfikację ich genetyczne korzenie.

TEXT.English: Building [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longevity[COLOR_REVERT] will give you a large health bonus in all cities.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT] Longévité[COLOR_REVERT] vous donnera un bonus important de santé dans toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: Completar la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longevidad[COLOR_REVERT] te dará una importante bonificación a la salud en todas las ciudades.

TEXT.English: Lookout Post
TEXT.French: Poste d'Observation
TEXT.Italian: Posto di osservazione

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lookout Post[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] production while also lowering [COLOR_GREEN]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] generation. It increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Defence[COLOR_REVERT] by [COLOR_GREEN]+5%[COLOR_REVERT] and makes it more likely to catch enemy spies while making enemy espionage actions more expensive as well.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Poste d'Observation[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le respect de la loi dans votre ville, et ainsi réduire la criminalité.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un posto di osservazione per incrementare l'ordine pubblico della tua città.

TEXT.English: A person in charge of the observation and reporting of crimes.
TEXT.French: A person in charge of the observation and reporting of crimes.
TEXT.Polish: Osoba odpowiedzialna za obserwację okolicy i zgłaszanie wszelkich niepokojących zdarzeń.

TEXT.English: Louvre Museum
TEXT.French: Musée du Louvre

TEXT.English: The Musée du Louvre - in English the Louvre Museum - is a historic monument in Paris and the national museum of France. It is a central landmark of the city, located on the Right Bank of the Seine in the 1st arrondissement (neighbourhood). It's the most visited museum in the world and arguably the most famous one. Nearly 35,000 objects from the 6th millennium BC to the 19th century AD are exhibited over an area of 60,600 square metres.
TEXT.French: Le Musée du Louvre - in English the Louvre Museum - is a historic monument in Paris and the national museum of France. It is a central landmark of the city, located on the Right une Banque of the Seine in the 1st arrondissement (neighbourhood). It's the most visited museum in the world and arguably the most famous one. Nearly 35,000 objects from the 6th millennium BC to the 19th century AD are exhibited over an area of 60,600 square metres.
TEXT.German: Der Louvre ist eines der Wahrzeichen von Paris. Früher war er Königspalast, heute beherbergt er mit dem Musée du Louvre das drittgrößte und meistbesuchte Museum der Welt. Seit dem Abriss des während des Aufstandes der Pariser Kommunen 1871 abgebrannten Tuilerienpalastes ist er der einzig erhaltene Teil des Pariser Stadtschlosses.[PARAGRAPH:2]Erbaut wurde der Louvre ursprünglich schon im 12. Jahrhundert unter Philipp-August, damals noch als Trutzburg zum Schutz des rechten Seineufers. Später ließ Karl V. die Festung zur Residenz umbauen. Bis zum Umzug des Hofstaates nach Versailles 1682 wurde der Louvre beständig umgebaut und erweitert, danach verlor er seine Funktion und verfiel zusehends, bis die Stadt Paris ihn übernahm und zunächst als Akademie und später als Museum nutzte.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die markante Glaspyramide, die heute als Eingang in das Museum dient, wurde 1989 im Rahmen einer vom damaligen Staatspräsident François Mitterrand initiierten Generalüberholung des Louvre errichtet. Sie kam bei den Parisern zunächst nicht gut an und wurde als Käseglocke und Gewächshaus verspottet. Heute hat sie sich aber trotz allem zum Markenzeichen des Louvre entwickelt.
TEXT.Polish: Luwr - dawny pałac królewski w Paryżu, obecnie muzeum sztuki. Jedno z największych muzeów na świecie, najczęściej odwiedzana placówka tego typu na świecie. Stanowi jedno z ważniejszych punktów orientacyjnych stolicy Francji. Luwr położony jest między Rue de Rivoli i prawym brzegiem Sekwany oraz ogrodamiTuileries i Rue du Louvre w obrębie Pierwszej Dzielnicy. W kompleksie budynków o całkowitej powierzchni wynoszącej 60,600 metrów kwadratowych znajdują się zbiory liczące około 300,000 dzieł sztuki od czasów najdawniejszych po połowę wieku XIX, dzieła światowego dziedzictwa o największej sławie takie jak np. stela z kodeksem Hammurabiego, Nike z Samotraki, Mona Lisa pędzla Leonarda.

TEXT.English: LSD Lab

Clandestine chemistry is chemistry carried out in secret, and particularly in illegal drug laboratories. Larger labs are usually run by gangs or organized crime intending to produce for distribution on the black market. Smaller labs can be run by individual chemists working clandestinely in order to synthesize smaller amounts of controlled substances or simply out of a hobbyist interest in chemistry, often because of the difficulty ascertaining the purity of other, illegally synthesized drugs obtained on the black market. The term clandestine lab is generally used in any situation involving the production of illicit compounds, regardless of whether the facilities being used qualify as a true laboratory.
TEXT.French: Clandestine chemistry is chemistry carried out in secret, and particularly in illegal drug laboratories. Larger labs are usually run by gangs or organized crime intending to produce for distribution on the black market. Smaller labs can be run by individual chemists working clandestinely in order to synthesize smaller amounts of controlled substances or simply out of a hobbyist interest in chemistry, often because of the difficulty ascertaining the purity of other, illegally synthesized drugs obtained on the black market. The term clandestine lab is generally used in any situation involving the production of illicit compounds, regardless of whether the facilities being used qualify as a true laboratory.
TEXT.Polish: Jest to jedna z najaktywniejszych substancji psychodelicznych - 100 razy bardziej czynna biologicznie niż psylocybina i 4000 razy bardziej niż meskalina. Po raz pierwszy LSD zostało zsyntetyzowane w 1938 r. przez szwajcarskiego chemika Alberta Hofmanna w laboratoriach firmy Sandoz (obecnie Novartis). Początkowo planowano wykorzystać tę substancję jako lek działający pobudzająco na układ krwionośny ioddechowy. W trakcie dalszych badań poznano jego psychodeliczne właściwości. Lek był w latach 40. i 50. XX wieku stosowany w psychiatrii. W latach 60. i 70. XX w. jako narkotyk LSD uzyskało popularność w pewnych kręgach młodzieży szczególnie związanych zruchem hipisowskim.

TEXT.English: Build an LSD Lab to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de production de LSD[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj LSD Lab by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Lumber Camp
TEXT.Italian: Campo dei taglialegna

TEXT.English: A lumberjack is a worker in the logging industry who performs the initial harvesting and transport of trees for ultimate processing into forest products.
TEXT.French: A lumberjack is a worker in the logging industry who performs the initial harvesting and transport of trees for ultimate processing into forest products.
TEXT.Italian: Un taglialegna è un lavoratore dell'industria della legna che esegue il taglio e il trasporto degli alberi per trasformarli in prodotti dell'industria della legna.
TEXT.Polish: Drwal to człowiek pracujacy w lesnictwie, który scina drzewa i dostarcza drewno np. dla przemyslu budowlanego i papierniczego.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lumber Camp[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Wood[COLOR_REVERT] which enable a lot of buildings ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carpenter's Workshop[COLOR_REVERT], for example).
TEXT.French: Construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]camp de bûcherons[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un campo dei taglialegna per incrementare la produzione della tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Lumber Camp by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Luxor Casino
TEXT.French: Le Casino Luxor

TEXT.English: Luxor Las Vegas is a hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada. The 30-story hotel, owned and operated by MGM Resorts International, has a 120,000-square-foot (11,000 m2) casino with over 2,000 slot machines and 87 table games. In the 2008 to 2009 renovation, it has a new, highly modernized, and contemporary design and contains a total of 4,400 rooms, including 442 suites, lining the interior walls of a pyramid style tower and within twin 22-story ziggurat towers that were built as later additions.[The hotel is named after the city of Luxor (ancient Thebes) in Egypt. Luxor is the second largest hotel in Las Vegas (the largest being the MGM Grand) and the eighth largest in the world. As of 2010, the Luxor has a 4 Key rating from the Green Key Eco-Rating Program, which evaluates "sustainable" hotel operations.
TEXT.French: Luxor Las Vegas is a hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada. The 30-story hotel, owned and operated by MGM Resorts International, has a 120,000-square-foot (11,000 m2) casino with over 2,000 slot machines and 87 table games. In the 2008 to 2009 renovation, it has a new, highly modernized, and contemporary design and contains a total of 4,400 rooms, including 442 suites, lining the interior walls of a pyramid style tower and within twin 22-story ziggurat towers that were built as later additions.[The hotel is named after the city of Luxor (ancient Thebes) in Egypt. Luxor is the second largest hotel in Las Vegas (the largest being the MGM Grand) and the eighth largest in the world. As of 2010, the Luxor has a 4 Key rating from the Green Key Eco-Rating Program, which evaluates "sustainable" hotel operations.
TEXT.Polish: Luxor Las Vegas - luksusowy hotel z kasynem, położony przy ulicy Las Vegas Strip w Paradise, w stanie Nevada. Został nazwany na cześć egipskiego miasta Luksoru, do którego nawiązuje wizualnie oraz tematycznie. Złożony z 4407 apartamentów, budynek odzwierciedla starożytną piramidę. Poza tym w jego skład wchodzą również bliźniacze wieże zigguraty. Kompleks jest własnością MGM Resorts International i stanowi jeden z największych hoteli na świecie.

TEXT.English: Factory (Lye)

Lye is a term that can refer to the liquid obtained by leaching ashes (containing largely potassium carbonate or "potash"), or to a strong alkali which is highly soluble in water producing caustic basic solutions. It is commonly the alternative name of sodium hydroxide (NaOH) or historically potassium hydroxide (KOH).
TEXT.French: Lye is a term that can refer to the liquid obtained by leaching ashes (containing largely potassium carbonate or "potash"), or to a strong alkali which is highly soluble in water producing caustic basic solutions. It is commonly the alternative name of sodium hydroxide (NaOH) or historically potassium hydroxide (KOH).

TEXT.English: Catcher (Lyrebird)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur de Ménures

TEXT.English: The Lyrebird has been around for millions of years, fossils having been found dated to 15 million years ago. This wonderful Australian bird can be found in rain forest habitats in Victoria and New South Wales. It was also brought to Tasmania in the 19th century. There are two different species of Lyrebirds: the Superb Lyrebird and Albert's Lyrebird. The male Superb Lyrebird is the third largest songbird with a length of 80 to 98 centimeters, (31.5 38.5 inches). The female is slightly smaller with a body measuring 74 to 84 centimeters, (29 to 33 inches). Albert's Lyrebird is a little bit smaller and can be found in Southern Queensland. This bird was given it's name in honor of Queen Victoria's husband Prince Albert.
TEXT.French: The Lyrebird has been around for millions of years, fossils having been found dated to 15 million years ago. This wonderful Australian bird can be found in rain forest habitats in Victoria and New South Wales. It was also brought to Tasmania in the 19th century. There are two different species of Lyrebirds: the Superb Lyrebird and Albert's Lyrebird. The male Superb Lyrebird is the third largest songbird with a length of 80 to 98 centimeters, (31.5 38.5 inches). The female is slightly smaller with a body measuring 74 to 84 centimeters, (29 to 33 inches). Albert's Lyrebird is a little bit smaller and can be found in Southern Queensland. This bird was given it's name in honor of Queen Victoria's husband Prince Albert.
TEXT.Polish: Lirogony (Menuridae) - monotypowa rodzina ptaków z rzęduwróblowych (Passeriformes). Lirogony potrafią naśladować ludzkie dźwięki, a także dźwięki mechaniczne każdego rodzaju, eksplozje i dźwięki instrumentów muzycznych. Zdolność tych ptaków do naśladownictwa (ptaki mimetyczne) jest praktycznie nieograniczona - od dźwięku gwizdu po dźwięk piły ręcznej czy łańcuchowej, a także odgłos silnika samochodu, syreny alarmowej, wystrzałów strzelby, odgłosów migawki aparatu, szczekania psów, płaczących dzieci itd.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lyrebird Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Kangaroo[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Catcher (Macaw)
TEXT.French: Attrapeur d'Ara

TEXT.English: Myth - Macaw
TEXT.French: Mythe de l'Ara

TEXT.English: Myth Effect - Macaw
TEXT.French: Effet (Mythe de l'Ara)

TEXT.English: Macaws are king-sized members of the parrot family and have typical parrot features. Their large, strong, curved beaks are designed to crush nuts and seeds. Their strong, agile toes are used like hands to grasp things. Loud, screeching and squawking voices help make their presence known in dense rain forests. They are also famous for their bright colors, which seem bold and conspicuous to us but actually blend in well with the green leaves, red and yellow fruits, and bluish shadows of the forest homes.
TEXT.French: Macaws are king-sized members of the parrot family and have typical parrot features. Their large, strong, curved beaks are designed to crush nuts and seeds. Their strong, agile toes are used like hands to grasp things. Loud, screeching and squawking voices help make their presence known in dense rain forests. They are also famous for their bright colors, which seem bold and conspicuous to us but actually blend in well with the green leaves, red and yellow fruits, and bluish shadows of the forest homes.
TEXT.Polish: Ptaki te charakteryzują się dużymi rozmiarami i bardzo długim ogonem, kolorowym upierzeniem oraz dużym, hakowato zakończonym dziobem. Przedstawiciele obu płci wyglądają podobnie. Odżywiają się owocami iorzechami, których skorupę kruszą za pomocą bardzo silnego dzioba, a następnie wydobywają zawartość językiem. Łatwo się oswajają i dobrze współżyją w hodowli z innymi papugami, mogą jednak atakować inne zwierzęta lub obce osoby. Pojedyncze osobniki osiągały w hodowli wiek do 65 lat.

TEXT.English: Stories - Macaw
TEXT.French: Histoires des Aras

TEXT.English: Stories Effect - Macaw
TEXT.French: Effet (Histoires des Aras

TEXT.English: Story - Macaw
TEXT.French: Histoire de l'Ara

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Macaw Catcher[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Feathers[COLOR_REVERT] which in turn provide [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs [COLOR_CYAN]Parrots[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Coffee[COLOR_REVERT], both requiring to be in the vicinity, improved and connected.
TEXT.French: A construire pour augmenter l'[ICON_GOLD].

TEXT.English: Magellan's Voyage
TEXT.French: Le Voyage de Magellan
TEXT.Italian: Viaggio di Magellano

TEXT.English: In 1519, Ferdinand Magellan sailed from Spain with the intention of reaching the spice-rich Malouccas Islands of Indonesia by sailing west, instead of east. Although natives in the Philippines killed Magellan, his expedition went on to prove conclusively that the world was round. More importantly, it proved that the Americas were indeed a New World. Magellan's expedition was one of the great sea voyages of history, and it inspired further expeditions by other explorers. The discoveries made along the way reduced the dangers to all the sea expeditions that followed.
TEXT.French: In 1519, Ferdinand Magellan sailed from Spain with the intention of reaching the spice-rich Malouccas Islands of Indonesia by sailing west, instead of east. Although natives in the Philippines killed Magellan, his expedition went on to prove conclusively that the world was round. More importantly, it proved that the Americas were indeed a New World. Magellan's expedition was one of the great sea voyages of history, and it inspired further expeditions by other explorers. The discoveries made along the way reduced the dangers to all the sea expeditions that followed.
TEXT.Polish: Ferdynand Magellan (port. Fernao de Magalhaes, hiszp. Fernando de Magallanes; ur. wiosną 1480, zm. 27 kwietnia 1521) - żeglarz portugalski w służbie hiszpańskiej, odkrywca i morski podróżnik.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Magellan's Voyage[COLOR_REVERT] increases the move rate of all naval units and increases the trade yield of its city by 50%.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Voyage de Magellan[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la distance parcourue par toutes vos unités navales, et améliore de 50% les revenus liés au commerce dans la ville d'origine.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Viaje de Magallanes[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta los puntos de movimiento de todas las unidades acuáticas, y aumenta el rendimiento de las rutas comerciales de su ciudad en un 50%.

TEXT.English: Magic Shop

The belief in magic anc magical powers dates back to the earliest recorded history. In Egypt, for example, large number of magical papyri, in Greek, Coptic, and Demotic, have been recovered. These sources contain early instances of much of the magical lore that later became part of Western cultural expectations about the practice of magic, especially ceremonial magic.
TEXT.French: The belief in magic anc magical powers dates back to the earliest recorded history. In Egypt, for example, large number of magical papyri, in Greek, Coptic, and Demotic, have been recovered. These sources contain early instances of much of the magical lore that later became part of Western cultural expectations about the practice of magic, especially ceremonial magic.
TEXT.Polish: Klasyczny strój iluzjonisty stanowi garnitur, cylinder, "magiczna" pałeczka i mniejsze rekwizyty, jednak współczesny wygląd iluzjonisty znacznie różni się od tego klasycznego i jest o wiele nowocześniejszy.

TEXT.English: Build a Magic Shop to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boutique de Magie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Magic Shop by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Maize Ceremony
Maize Ceremonies were held to praise a goddess.

TEXT.Polish: Kukurydza (Zea) - rodzaj roślin należący do rodziny wiechlinowatych. Przedstawiciele występują naturalnie w Meksyku, Gwatemali i Nikaragui. Liczy 5 gatunków, wśród których najważniejsza pod względem ekonomicznym jest kukurydza zwyczajna (Zea mays), która jest zarazemgatunkiem typowym rodzaju.

TEXT.English: Build a Maize Ceremony to increase your cities happiness.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Maize Ceremony by zwiększyć zadowolenie w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Wet Nurse

Breast milk is the milk produced by the breasts (or mammary glands) of a human female for her infant offspring. Milk is the primary source of nutrition for newborns before they are able to eat and digest other [ICON_FOOD]s; older infants and toddlers may continue to be breastfed, either exclusively or in combination with other [ICON_FOOD]s. A woman can produce breast milk for twenty, thirty or more years, as long as there is a constant need for it. In today's society, there are Milk Banks, just like Blood Banks. Excess milk from lactating mothers is often donated to the bank. It is available to infants in need, and may either be free or offered at a minimal charge.
TEXT.French: Breast milk is the milk produced by the breasts (or mammary glands) of a human female for her infant offspring. Milk is the primary source of nutrition for newborns before they are able to eat and digest other [ICON_FOOD]s; older infants and toddlers may continue to be breastfed, either exclusively or in combination with other [ICON_FOOD]s. A woman can produce breast milk for twenty, thirty or more years, as long as there is a constant need for it. In today's society, there are Milk Banks, just like Blood Banks. Excess milk from lactating mothers is often donated to the bank. It is available to infants in need, and may either be free or offered at a minimal charge.
TEXT.Polish: Mamka - kobieta zawodowo trudniąca się karmieniem własną piersią cudzych dzieci (noworodki i niemowlęta), które nie są z nią biologicznie spokrewnione. Zwykle pełni też rolę ich niani i opiekunki i pobiera za te czynności wynagrodzenie. W związku z taką funkcją okres laktacji mamki bywa znacznie przedłużony w stosunku do okresu typowego dla przeciętnej matki.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wet Nurse's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that provides a city with [COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] while also lowering [COLOR_GREEN]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Sacrifie un peu de [ICON_FOOD]pour gagner en [ICON_HEALTHY] et en bonus contre les maladies.

TEXT.English: Manhattan Project
TEXT.French: Le Projet Manhattan
TEXT.Italian: Progetto Manhattan

TEXT.English: The Manhattan Project was the code name for a joint project undertaken by the United States, Great Britain and Canada during World War II, the objective being to build an atomic weapon before Germany. While various laboratories had been independently studying nuclear physics for a number of years, the Manhattan Project would be on an entirely different scale; hundreds of the allies' top scientists and engineers were, along with their families, taken to various secret locations around the country where they would stay until the project succeeded. [PARAGRAPH:1]Working conditions were extremely primitive and security was incredibly tight. The United States Army was in overall charge of the Manhattan Project, while the scientists remained in control over the actual research. The scope of the Manhattan Project was immense, and it involved solving some of the most difficult scientific and engineering projects of the day. The men and women, a collection of soldiers and scientists, endured harsh conditions and physical and mental exhaustion, which were compounded by security so tight that many never saw the outside of the base on which they were stationed. They were sustained by their patriotism and by fear of what would happen to them, their families, and their countries if Germany created the bomb first. [PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually, of course, the effort paid off. By the middle of 1945 the US had two working atomic bombs. Germany, the original target, had already surrendered, but Japan was still in the fight. The two weapons were dropped on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki early in August, and the Japanese Empire surrendered shortly thereafter. [PARAGRAPH:1]From our perspective some decades later, it isn't clear whether the Manhattan Project helped to save the world for democracy or brought it closer to fiery destruction. But the men and women involved believed they were fighting to stop a terrible dictatorship from gaining a new weapon and destroying everything they loved, and they were willing to sacrifice everything to succeed.
TEXT.French: Le projet Manhattan était le nom de code d'un projet commun entrepris par les Etats-Unis, la Grande-Bretagne et le Canada pendant la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, l'objectif étant de construire une arme nucléaire avant l'Allemagne. Alors que différents laboratoires avaient étudié indépendamment la physique nucléaire pendant des années, le projet Manhattan devait fonctionner à une échelle complètement différente. Des centaines de scientifiques et d'ingénieurs alliés, parmi les meilleurs, avaient été conduits dans divers lieux secrets du pays où ils devaient rester jusqu'à l'aboutissement du projet. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les conditions de travail étaient extrêmement primitives et la sécurité excessivement stricte. L'armée des Etats-Unis contrôlait le projet Manhattan dans son ensemble tandis que les scientifiques restaient en charge des recherches effectives. Le projet Manhattan était de très grande envergure et impliquait de trouver une solution aux problèmes les plus difficiles de cette époque en matières de science et d'ingénierie. Ces hommes et femmes, soldats ou scientifiques, endurèrent les pires conditions et connurent une fatigue physique et morale intense. Ils furent par ailleurs soumis à une sécurité si stricte que beaucoup ne virent jamais les environs de la base dans laquelle ils vivaient. Cependant, leur patriotisme et la crainte de ce qui pouvait leur arriver, ainsi qu'à leur famille et à leur pays, si l'Allemagne créait la bombe la première leur redonnaient forces et courage. [PARAGRAPH:1]Leurs efforts ont fini, bien sûr, par être récompensés. Mi-1945, les Etats-Unis disposaient de deux bombes atomiques en état de fonctionner. L'Allemagne, qui constituait l'objectif initial, avait déjà capitulé mais le Japon continuait à se battre. Début août, les deux bombes ont été lâchées sur Hiroshima et Nagasaki et l'empire japonais a capitulé peu de temps après. [PARAGRAPH:1]De notre point de vue, quelques décennies plus tard, on ne peut pas clairement dire si le projet Manhattan a contribué à sauver le monde de la démocratie ou s'il l'a pratiquement conduit à une destruction explosive. Cependant, les hommes et les femmes impliqués dans ce projet étaient convaincus qu'ils se battaient pour empêcher une terrible dictature de se doter d'une nouvelle arme et de détruire tout ce qu'ils aimaient. Ils étaient donc prêts à tout sacrifier pour y parvenir.
TEXT.German: "Manhattan Project" war der Deckname für ein Geheimprojekt der USA, Großbritanniens und Kanadas zum Bau der ersten Atombombe ab 1942. Nachdem verschiedene Wissenschaftler bereits in den 30er Jahren auf dem Feld der Atomphysik geforscht hatten, begann mit dem Manhattan Project eine neue Ära. Hunderte der besten Wissenschaftler und Ingenieure der Alliierten wurden mit ihren Familien zu geheimen Forschungszentren im ganzen Land gebracht, um dort bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss des Projektes zu arbeiten und zu leben. [PARAGRAPH:1]Zunächst mussten sich die Wissenschaftler mit den primitiven Arbeitsbedingungen und den enormen Sicherheitsvorkehrungen arrangieren. Während die US Army für die Überwachung des Manhattan Projects verantwortlich war, konzentrierten sich die Wissenschaftler auf die eigentliche Forschung. Schließlich mussten im Rahmen des Projektes die größten wissenschaftlichen und technischen Probleme der damaligen Zeit gelöst werden. Schon bald wurden die Arbeitsbedingungen für die Männer und Frauen unerträglich, da sie aufgrund der hohen Sicherheitsvorkehrungen ihren Stützpunkt nicht verlassen durften! Allein ihre Entschlossenheit, die Atombombe vor den Deutschen fertig zu stellen, ließ sie weitermachen. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Entbehrungen sollten sich auszahlen. Am 16. Juli 1945 zündeten die USA auf einem Testgelände bei Los Alamos die erste Atombombe. Am 6. bzw. 9. August warfen amerikanische Bomber die beiden ersten Atombomben auf Hiroshima und Nagasaki ab. Unmittelbar nach den Bombenabwürfen erklärte Japan seine Kapitulation. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aus heutiger Sicht ist fraglich, ob das Manhattan Project zur Rettung der freien Welt beigetragen oder diese an den Rand der Vernichtung getrieben hat. Die beteiligten Wissenschaftler hatten freilich nur ein Ziel: Einem wahnsinnigen deutschen Diktator zuvorzukommen, der bereit war, alles, was ihnen lieb und teuer war, zu vernichten.
TEXT.Italian: Manhattan Project era il nome in codice di un progetto di ricerca intrapreso da Stati Uniti, Gran Bretagna e Canada durante la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, che aveva come obiettivo la realizzazione di una bomba atomica prima della Germania. Mentre svariati laboratori avevano studiato indipendentemente la fisica nucleare per anni, il Manhattan Project era pensato in larga scala: centinaia di scienziati e ingegneri alleati vennero trasferiti, assieme alle famiglie, in diversi luoghi segreti della nazione fino al completamento del progetto. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le condizioni di lavoro erano estremamente primitive e controllate da uno stretto sistema di sicurezza. L'esercito degli Stati Uniti era al comando del Manhattan Project, mentre gli scienziati erano al controllo della ricerca. La portata del Manhattan Project era immensa e ha coinvolto scienziati ed ingegneri in uno dei progetti più difficili di sempre: uomini, donne, soldati e scienziati sono sopravvissuti a condizioni dure, esaurimenti fisici e nervosi, molti dei quali derivati dalla strettissima sicurezza, al punto che molti non riuscirono mai a vedere l'esterno del luogo nel quale venivano ospitati. Ciò che li mandò avanti fu un profondo senso di patriottismo e la paura di quello che sarebbe successo se la Germania fosse riuscita a realizzare la bomba atomica per prima. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ma gli sforzi vennero premiati: verso la metà del 1945, gli Stati Uniti possedevano due bombe atomiche funzionanti. La Germania, il bersaglio iniziale, si era già arresa ma il Giappone non ne aveva intenzione. Le due bombe vennero lanciate sulle città giapponesi di Hiroshima e Nagasaki all'inizio di agosto. L'Impero Giapponese si arrese subito dopo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Decine di anni dopo, non sappiamo se il Manhattan Project sia servito per far trionfare la democrazia nel mondo oppure l'abbia portato verso la potenziale distruzione. Ma uomini e donne coinvolti nel progetto erano convinti di lottare per fermare una spietata dittatura che, se fosse riuscita a costruire per prima la bomba, avrebbe cancellato tutto ciò che amavano; si sarebbero sacrificati, pur di riuscire nell'impresa.
TEXT.Spanish: El Proyecto Manhattan fue el nombre en clave de la investigación llevada a cabo durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial por Estados Unidos, Gran Bretaña y Canadá con el objeto de construir una bomba atómica antes que Alemania. Aunque varios laboratorios llevaban varios años investigando de forma independiente la física atómica, la escala del Proyecto Manhattan fue algo completamente nuevo; cientos de los más importantes científicos de los países aliados fueron trasladados junto con sus familias a varios laboratorios secretos donde permanecerían confinados hasta el fin del proyecto. [PARAGRAPH:1]Las condiciones de trabajo eran extremadamente primitivas y las medidas de seguridad eran extraordinarias. Aunque se trataba de un proyecto dirigido por el ejército de los Estados Unidos, el control de las investigaciones estuvo en todo momento en manos de los científicos. La magnitud del Proyecto Manhattan fue inmensa, y requirió de la resolución de algunos de los mayores problemas científicos y técnicos de la época. Los protagonistas, un grupo de científicos y soldados, soportaron unas condiciones durísimas y un estado de agotamiento físico y mental, unas medidas de seguridad tan estrictas que muchos de ellos no llegaron a salir ni una sola vez de la base en la que estaban destinados. Si lo soportaron fue por patriotismo y por miedo a lo que les ocurriría a ellos, a sus familias y a sus países si Alemania creaba la bomba primero. [PARAGRAPH:1]Al final, todo este esfuerzo dio sus frutos. A mediados de 1945, el ejército americano tenía dos bombas atómicas operativas. El objetivo original, Alemania, ya se había rendido, pero Japón seguía resistiendo. Las dos armas se lanzaron sobre las ciudades japoneses de Hiroshima y Nagasaki, y el imperio japonés se rindió poco después. [PARAGRAPH:1]Desde nuestra perspectiva, a varias décadas de distancia, no está claro si el Proyecto Manhattan contribuyó a salvar la democracia o estuvo a punto de provocar su destrucción. Pero los hombres y las mujeres involucrados creían que estaban luchando por impedir que una terrible dictadura se hiciera con una nueva arma y destruyera todo lo que amaban, y estaban dispuestos a hacer lo que fuera necesario para conseguirlo.
