TEXT.English: Manufacturing Plant
TEXT.French: Complexe Industriel
TEXT.Italian: Impianto di produzione

TEXT.English: Manufacturing plant is an industrial building where workers manufacture goods or supervise machines processing one product into another. Most modern factories have large warehouses or warehouse-like facilities that contain heavy equipment used for assembly line production. Typically, factories gather and concentrate resources: workers, capital and plant.
TEXT.French: Manufacturing plant is an industrial building where workers manufacture goods or supervise machines processing one product into another. Most modern factories have large warehouses or warehouse-like facilities that contain heavy equipment used for assembly line production. Typically, factories gather and concentrate resources: workers, capital and plant.
TEXT.Polish: Zakład produkcyjny; zorganizowanie na dużą skalę cyklu produkcyjnego w oparciu o pracę maszyn i ludzi. W ujęciu historycznym, przejście od wytwarzania produktów w warsztatach rzemieślniczych i manufakturach do ich produkcji w fabrykach oznaczało początek kapitalizmu.

TEXT.English: Manufacturing Plants increase cities' production by 50% with power.
TEXT.French: un Complexe Industriels increase cities' production by 50% with power.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Plantas de producción en masa aumentan la producción de las ciudades en un 50% con energía.

TEXT.English: Marble Shrine
TEXT.Italian: Santuario in marmo

TEXT.English: Parade Grounds
TEXT.French: Champs Elysés
TEXT.Italian: Piazza per parate militari

TEXT.English: A military parade is a formation of soldiers whose movement is restricted. The American usage is "formation or military review". The military parade is now mostly ceremonial, though soldiers from time immemorial up until the late 19th century fought in formation.
TEXT.French: A military parade is a formation of soldiers whose movement is restricted. The American usage is "formation or military review". The military parade is now mostly ceremonial, though soldiers from time immemorial up until the late 19th century fought in formation.
TEXT.Polish: Parada wojskowa - przegląd wojsk zakończony uroczystym przemarszem defiladą, organizowany w celu uczczenia świąt i ważnych wydarzeń państwowych lub wojskowych. Paradę wojskową zarządza dowódca garnizonu na podstawie rozkazu swoich przełożonych lub ich zezwolenia. Rozróżnia się pw. centralne (organizowane na rozkaz Ministra Obrony Narodowej), okręgowe, garnizonowe, morskie i lotnicze.

TEXT.English: Parade Grounds are an excellent way to remind your population of your military might, and educate your troops; but citizen's anger over ongoing war's may use the Parade Grounds as a focus for their anger.
TEXT.French: Les Champs Elysés sont un excellent moyen de rappeler à votre population votre puissance militaire, et éduquer vos troupes. Cependant, le mécontement lié à la guerre peut être focalisé également dans ces lieux.
TEXT.Italian: Le piazze per parate militari sono un ottimo mezzo per ricordare alla tua popolazione della tua forza militare, oltre che per addestrare le truppe; tuttavia, i cittadini potrebbero usare la piazza per protestare contro la guerra....
TEXT.Spanish: La construcción de la Avenida del desfile militar es una excelente forma de exhibir tu poderío militar a la población, y de educar a tus tropas; sin embargo podría ser utilizada por tus ciudadanos para expresar su descontento con las guerras mantenidas.
TEXT.Polish: Pomnik Wojskowy jest dobrym sposobem na przypomnienie populacji o Twojej sile wojskowej i edukuje Twoich żołnierzy

TEXT.English: Marco Polo's Embassy
TEXT.French: Ambassade de Marco Polo
TEXT.Italian: Ambasciata di Marco Polo

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Establishes Contact With All Civilizations on Same Continent
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Etablit le Contact avec toutes les Civilisations du Continent
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Stellt Kontakt mit allen Zivilisationen des Kontinents her
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Stabilisce un contatto con tutte le civiltà sullo stesso continente
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Establece contacto con todas las civilizaciones del mismo continente
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Kontaktuje ze wszystkimi Cywilizacjami na tym samym kontynencie

TEXT.English: Marco Polo was a trader, writer, and world traveler who lived in the late 13th and early 14th centuries. Starting as a young boy, he began traveling with his father and uncle, who were merchants and traders in Venice, along a route that would take him throughout Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. Throughout his life, he visited many places, bringing back detailed information concerning lands that no European before him had visited. Polo's book, "The Travels of Marco Polo", was the only source of reliable information on such exotic locales as Siam, Japan, Java, Tibet, and India that existed in Medieval Europe.
TEXT.French: Marco Polo was a trader, writer, and world traveler who lived in the late 13th and early 14th centuries. Starting as a young boy, he began traveling with his father and uncle, who were merchants and traders in Venice, along a route that would take him throughout Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. Throughout his life, he visited many places, bringing back detailed information concerning lands that no European before him had visited. Polo's book, "The Travels of Marco Polo", was the only source of reliable information on such exotic locales as Siam, Japan, Java, Tibet, and India that existed in Medieval Europe.
TEXT.Polish: Marco Polo - ur. 15 września 1254 w Wenecji lub Koreuli, zm. 8 stycznia 1324 w Wenecji - wenecki kupiec i podróżnik. Wraz z ojcem i stryjem dotarł do Chin, przemierzając Jedwabny Szlak. Byli oni jednymi z pierwszych przedstawicieli Zachodu, którzy dotarli do Państwa Środka. Jego podróże zostały spisane w książce znanej jako Opisanie świata przez Rustichella z Pizy, w czasie gdy Marco Polo przebywał w niewoli w Genui po przegranej bitwie morskiej pomiędzy Wenecją i Genuą. Obecnie Marco Polo jest uważany za jednego z największych podróżników, choć współcześni uznawali go raczej za gawędziarza, a jego opowieści za fantastyczne. Pewne elementy jego relacji oraz brak bezpośrednich śladów jego obecności na dworze cesarskim w kronikach chińskich sprawiły jednak, że pojawiają się głosy powątpiewające w podróże Marco Polo.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Marco Polo's Embassy[COLOR_REVERT] gives you three free trade routes and all merchant specialists give +1 gold.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]L'Ambassade de Marco Polo[COLOR_REVERT] vous donne trois routes commerciales gratuites, et tous les spécialistes marchands donnent +1 en or.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Embajada de Marco Polo[COLOR_REVERT] te proporciona tres rutas comerciales gratis, y hará que todos los Mercaderes produzcan +1 de oro.

TEXT.English: Marina

A marina is a sheltered harbor where boats and yachts are kept in the water and where services geared to the needs of recreational boating are found. The marina may have re-fueling, washing and repair facilities, ship chandlers, stores and restaurants. Slipways are used to get a trailered boat into the water. Marinas may offer a boat hoist well, a type of traveling crane, instead of a more space-wasteful slipway, operated by service center personnel. Marinas may offer out-of-water-storage, which is useful out of season and important in latitudes susceptible to freezing waters. Marinas may include ground facilities such as parking lots for vehicles and boat trailers.
TEXT.French: A marina is a sheltered harbor where boats and yachts are kept in the water and where services geared to the needs of recreational boating are found. The marina may have re-fueling, washing and repair facilities, ship chandlers, stores and restaurants. Slipways are used to get a trailered boat into the water. Marinas may offer a boat hoist well, a type of traveling crane, instead of a more space-wasteful slipway, operated by service center personnel. Marinas may offer out-of-water-storage, which is useful out of season and important in latitudes susceptible to freezing waters. Marinas may include ground facilities such as parking lots for vehicles and boat trailers.
TEXT.Polish: Mały port przystosowany do przybijania, cumowania i postoju jachtów i innych niewielkich jednostek pływających. Obszar portu osłonięty jest zazwyczaj od strony otwartego akwenu falochronem w sposób naturalny lub sztuczny.

TEXT.English: Upgrade to Boatyard.
TEXT.French: Amélioration du Hangar à Bâteaux
TEXT.Italian: Migliora in cantiere navale.
TEXT.Spanish: Mejora del Embarcadero.

TEXT.English: Grand Marine Festival
TEXT.French: Le Grand Festival de la Mer

TEXT.English: The Marine Festival is a seasonal event celebrated on a beach or coast. It usually lasts for two weeks, with massive sea hunting. A big feast takes place and both hunting and sea hunting are celebrated.
TEXT.French: The Marine Festival is a seasonal event celebrated on a beach or coast. It usually lasts for two weeks, with massive sea hunting. A big feast takes place and both hunting and sea hunting are celebrated.
TEXT.Polish: Wielka uroczystość na cześć duchów morza i oceanu.

TEXT.English: This World Wonder allows you to keep +30% of your Food as Storage. [COLOR_RED]You can only have one Grand Festival type in a city. Choose wisely.[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Mine (Mascagnite)

Mascagnite is a rare ammonium sulfate mineral. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic system typically forming as stalactitic masses exhibiting good cleavage. It is soft (not higher than 2.5 on the Mohs Scale) and water-soluble. Optical properties are variable; the purest form is transparent and colorless, but opaque gray or yellow deposits are also known.
TEXT.French: Mascagnite is a rare ammonium sulfate mineral. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic system typically forming as stalactitic masses exhibiting good cleavage. It is soft (not higher than 2.5 on the Mohs Scale) and water-soluble. Optical properties are variable; the purest form is transparent and colorless, but opaque gray or yellow deposits are also known.

TEXT.English: Build a Mascagnite Mine to increase your cities production.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mine de Mascagnite[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Mascagnite Mine by zwiększyć produkcję w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Ha'amonga 'a Maui
TEXT.French: Ha'amonga 'a Maui

TEXT.English: Ha-amonga -a Maui (Burden of Maui) - is a stone trilithon located in Tonga, in the north of the island of Tongatapu, near the village of Niutoua, in Heketa. Trilithon is constructed from three coral limestone slabs, and is up to 5.2 m high, 1.4 m wide, 5.8 m long. The weight of the visible part of each upright stone is approximately 30 - 40 tons. There are hewn deep mortises in the top of each upright stone to fit in the lintel. Ha'amonga 'a Maui was built at the beginning of the 13th century under the 11th Tu-i Tonga Tu-itatui(king strike the knee), most likely as a gateway to his royal compound Heketa. One can pass through the portal and walk the short distance towards the -esi maka faakinanga (stone to lean against), which served as the king's throne. Sitting with his back to that stone he was safe from assassins from behind and with his long stick he could hit every potential foe from the front on his knees.
TEXT.French: Ha-amonga -a Maui (Burden of Maui) - is a stone trilithon located in Tonga, in the north of the island of Tongatapu, near the village of Niutoua, in Heketa. Trilithon is constructed from three coral limestone slabs, and is up to 5.2 m high, 1.4 m wide, 5.8 m long. The weight of the visible part of each upright stone is approximately 30 - 40 tons. There are hewn deep mortises in the top of each upright stone to fit in the lintel. Ha'amonga 'a Maui was built at the beginning of the 13th century under the 11th Tu-i Tonga Tu-itatui(king strike the knee), most likely as a gateway to his royal compound Heketa. One can pass through the portal and walk the short distance towards the -esi maka faakinanga (stone to lean against), which served as the king's throne. Sitting with his back to that stone he was safe from assassins from behind and with his long stick he could hit every potential foe from the front on his knees.

TEXT.English: Mausoleum of Mausollos
Mausoleum of Maussollos

The tomb of King Mausollos of Caria (from whose name the generic term "mausoleum" derives), a local Persian ruler, was not especially remarkable in its construction or size. Its status as one of the Ancient Wonders of the World comes from the dozens of painstakingly carved statues and sculptures that surrounded it. They depicted legendary and real people, and the noble animals of mythology and history. Inside the mausoleum was a great frieze, or wall-carving, depicting an epic battle between the Greeks and the Amazons, and topping the mausoleum's dome was a huge statue of a four-horse chariot. The Mausoleum and its statues survived until after the Crusades, when Christian knights founded a new crusader kingdom in Asia Minor, and used the already-carved stones of the Mausoleum to build castles. The statues, in turn, spread around the world, until British archaeologists began to collect and recover them. Some can be seen today in museums, but most have been lost or destroyed. -Civ3
TEXT.French: The tomb of King Mausollos of Caria (from whose name the generic term "mausoleum" derives), a local Persian ruler, was not especially remarkable in its construction or size. Its status as one of the Ancient Wonders of the World comes from the dozens of painstakingly carved statues and sculptures that surrounded it. They depicted legendary and real people, and the noble animals of mythology and history. Inside the mausoleum was a great frieze, or wall-carving, depicting an epic battle between the Greeks and the Amazons, and topping the mausoleum's dome was a huge statue of a four-horse chariot. The Mausoleum and its statues survived until after the Crusades, when Christian knights founded a new crusader kingdom in Asia Minor, and used the already-carved stones of the Mausoleum to build castles. The statues, in turn, spread around the world, until British archaeologists began to collect and recover them. Some can be seen today in museums, but most have been lost or destroyed. -Civ3
TEXT.German: Das Grabmal des Königs Mausolos von Caria, von dessen Namen das Wort "Mausoleum" abgeleitet ist, war weder von der Grösse noch von der Konstruktion her besonders bemerkenswert. Seinen Status als Weltwunder verdankt es den Dutzenden von extrem detailliert geschnitzten Statuen und Skulpturen, die es umgaben. Sie stellten legendäre und reale Personen dar, sowie wichtige Tiere der Mythologie und Geschichte. Im Inneren des Mausoleums stellte ein grosses Wandgemälde eine epische Schlacht zwischen den Griechen und den Amazonen dar, und oben in der Kuppel stand die riesige Statue eines vierspännigen Streitwagens. Das Mausoleum und seine Statuen überstanden die Jahrhunderte bis nach den Kreuzzügen, als christliche Ritter ein neues Königreich in Kleinasien errichteten und die bereits behauenen Steine des Mausoleums für den Bau ihrer Festungen verwendeten. Die Statuen wurden über den ganzen Erdball verstreut, bis britische Archäologen begannen, sie aufzustöbern und zu sammeln. Heute kann man einige davon noch in Museen bewundern, die meisten jedoch sind verschollen oder zerstört. -Civ3
TEXT.Polish: Mauzoleum (gr. mausoleion, łac. mausoleum) - rodzaj grobowca w formie monumentalnej, samodzielnej budowli o bogatym wystroju architektonicznym. Pierwszym znanym mauzoleum jest wybudowany w IV wieku p.n.e. grobowiec króla Mauzolosa w Halikarnasie. Od imienia tego króla pochodzi nazwa wzorowanych na jego grobowcu późniejszych obiektów tego typu.

TEXT.English: LL McCallum
TEXT.French: Le Site de McCallum

TEXT.English: The McCallum Site is located on a river terrace near Mount Agassiz in the Fraser Valley in southwestern British Columbia. This ancient village site contains the remains of numerous pit houses, as well as later plank houses. Archaeologists briefly excavated and mapped the site in 1950, and it is under investigation again in 2004 by a group that includes representatives of the StÃ-³:lo Nation, Simon Fraser University and other Canadian and American universities. The site was occupied about 5000 years BP and as recently as 250 years BP, but investigating archaeologist Dana Lepofsky believes the site may prove to be much older than that. Depressions which may represent semi-subterranean houses were revealed during road construction and these structures may date to 10,000 years BP.
TEXT.French: The McCallum Site is located on a river terrace near Mount Agassiz in the Fraser Valley in southwestern British Columbia. This ancient village site contains the remains of numerous pit houses, as well as later plank houses. Archaeologists briefly excavated and mapped the site in 1950, and it is under investigation again in 2004 by a group that includes representatives of the StÃ-³:lo Nation, Simon Fraser University and other Canadian and American universities. The site was occupied about 5000 years BP and as recently as 250 years BP, but investigating archaeologist Dana Lepofsky believes the site may prove to be much older than that. Depressions which may represent semi-subterranean houses were revealed during road construction and these structures may date to 10,000 years BP.

TEXT.English: LL Meadowcroft Rockshelter
TEXT.French: Le site de Meadowcroft

TEXT.English: Meadowcroft Rockshelter is an archaeological site located near Avella in Jefferson Township, Washington County, in southwestern Pennsylvania, United States. The site, a rock shelter in a bluff overlooking Cross Creek (a tributary of the Ohio River), is located 27 miles (43.45 km) west-southwest of Pittsburgh in the Pittsburgh metropolitan area. The site, including a museum and re-creation of a circa 1570s Monongahela Culture Indian village, operates as a division of the Heinz History Center. The artifacts from the site show the area has been continually inhabited for over 19,000 years, since Paleo-Indian times. The Rockshelter was named a National Historic Landmark in 2005. It is also recognized as a Pennsylvania Commonwealth Treasure and is an official project of Save America's Treasures. It is designated as a historic public landmark by the Washington County History and Landmarks Foundation.
TEXT.French: Le site de Meadowcroft, dans le sud-ouest de la Pennsylvanie, est l'un des sites archéologiques les plus publiés, en Amérique du Nord. Le site a été fouillé entre 1973 et 1978 par une équipe de l'université de Pittsburg, dirigée par l'archéologue James Adovasio. Les premières datations par le radiocarbone 14 indiquaient que l'abri sous roche aurait pu être occupé entre 16 000 ans et 19 000 ans. Le site de Meadowcroft détiendrait le record de la plus longue présence d'occupation humaine dans les Amériques. Les nombreuses couches d'occupations (pas moins de onze strates) contenaient plus de 2 000 éclats et outils en pierre (parmi les artéfacts, des bifaces, des couteaux, des pointes de projectile ainsi que de petites lames prismatiques), 150 foyers et un million d'ossements d'animaux. Les restes d'un cerf, découpé et brÃ-»lé, furent datés Ã- 17 000 ans, soit le plus vieil ossement découvert sur le site.
TEXT.Polish: Meadowcroft - nawis skalny znajdujący się w Pensylwanii, około 48 kilometrów na południowy zachód od Pittsburgha. Stanowisko archeologiczne zawierające jedne z najwcześniejszych śladów pobytu ludności paleoindiańskiej na kontynencie amerykańskim. W 2005 roku wpisane zostało na listę National Historic Landmark.

TEXT.English: Mechanical Organs Lab

An artificial organ is a man-made device that is implanted or integrated into a human to replace a natural organ, for the purpose of restoring a specific function or a group of related functions so the patient may return to as normal a life as possible. The replaced function doesn't necessarily have to be related to life support, but often is. Implied by this definition is the fact that the device must not be continuously tethered to a stationary power supply, or other stationary resources, such as filters or chemical processing units. (Periodic rapid recharging of batteries, refilling of chemicals, and/or cleaning/replacing of filters, would exclude a device from being called an artificial organ.) Thus, a dialysis machine, while a very successful and critically important life support device that completely replaces the duties of a kidney, is not an artificial organ. At this time an efficient, self-contained artificial kidney has not become available.
TEXT.French: An artificial organ is a man-made device that is implanted or integrated into a human to replace a natural organ, for the purpose of restoring a specific function or a group of related functions so the patient may return to as normal a life as possible. The replaced function doesn't necessarily have to be related to life support, but often is. Implied by this definition is the fact that the device must not be continuously tethered to a stationary power supply, or other stationary resources, such as filters or chemical processing units. (Periodic rapid recharging of batteries, refilling of chemicals, and/or cleaning/replacing of filters, would exclude a device from being called an artificial organ.) Thus, a dialysis machine, while a very successful and critically important life support device that completely replaces the duties of a kidney, is not an artificial organ. At this time an efficient, self-contained artificial kidney has not become available.

TEXT.English: Mechatronics Lab

Mechatronics is a design process that includes a combination of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, control engineering and computer engineering. Mechatronics is a multidisciplinary field of engineering, that is to say, it rejects splitting engineering into separate disciplines. Originally, mechatronics just included the combination of mechanics and electronics, hence the word is a combination of mechanics and electronics; however, as technical systems have become more and more complex the word has been "updated" during recent years to include more technical areas.
TEXT.French: Mechatronics is a design process that includes a combination of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, control engineering and computer engineering. Mechatronics is a multidisciplinary field of engineering, that is to say, it rejects splitting engineering into separate disciplines. Originally, mechatronics just included the combination of mechanics and electronics, hence the word is a combination of mechanics and electronics; however, as technical systems have become more and more complex the word has been "updated" during recent years to include more technical areas.
TEXT.Polish: Słowo mechatronika pojawiło się po raz pierwszy w roku 1969 w Japonii. Zostało wprowadzone przez T. Mori z japońskiej firmyYaskawa. Do wczesnych lat 80. XX wieku termin mechatronika oznaczał mniej więcej tyle co zelektryfikowany mechanizm. W połowie lat 80. XX wieku w Europie przez mechatronikę zaczęto rozumieć nową dziedzinę, która zapełniła lukę, jaka istniała wówczas między inżynierią mechaniczną aelektroniką. W Stanach Zjednoczonych jednak niechętnie odnoszono się do samego terminu mechatronika preferując zamiast niego określenie inżynieria systemów. W kolejnych latach definiowano mechatronikę na różne sposoby. Zgodnie z definicją przyjętą przez International Federation for the Theory of Machines and Mechanism mechatronika jest "synergiczną kombinacją mechaniki precyzyjnej, elektronicznego sterowania i systemowego myślenia przy projektowaniu produktów i procesów produkcyjnych".

TEXT.English: Build a Mechatronics Lab to increase your cities science.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Mechatronics Lab by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Medicine is the field of applied science related to the art of healing by diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. It encompasses a variety of health care practices evolved to maintain and restore health by the prevention and treatment of illness in human beings.

TEXT.Polish: Medycyna (łac. medicina "sztuka lekarska") - nauka empiryczna (oparta na doświadczeniu) obejmująca całość wiedzy o zdrowiu i chorobach człowieka oraz sposobach ich zapobiegania, oraz ich leczenia. Medycyna weterynaryjna rozszerza zakres zainteresowań medycyny na stan zdrowia zwierząt. Za prekursora medycyny starożytnej uważa się Hipokratesa, a nowożytnej Paracelsusa. W czasach najnowszych wprowadza się zasadymedycyny opartej na faktach.

TEXT.English: Medical Diagnostat

A self enclosure 360 degree chamber that can diagnose and treat most human and veterinary ailments of Organic Life without the need to visit a hospital. It can perform basic and intermediate surgery procedures. It was featured in the movie Prometheus where it surgically removes the alien baby from the woman.

It can perform basic and intermediate surgery procedures. It was featured in the movie Prometheus where it surgically removes the alien baby from the woman.

TEXT.English: Medical Prosthetics Lab

In medicine, a prosthesis, is an artificial device that replaces a missing body part lost through trauma, disease, or congenital conditions. Over the years there have been significant advancements in artificial limbs. New plastics and other materials, such as carbon fiber, have allowed artificial limbs to be stronger and lighter, limiting the amount of extra energy necessary to operate the limb. This is especially important for transfemoral amputees. Additional materials have allowed artificial limbs to look much more realistic, which is important to transradial and transhumeral amputees because they are more likely to have the artificial limb expose.
TEXT.French: In medicine, a prosthesis, is an artificial device that replaces a missing body part lost through trauma, disease, or congenital conditions. Over the years there have been significant advancements in artificial limbs. New plastics and other materials, such as carbon fiber, have allowed artificial limbs to be stronger and lighter, limiting the amount of extra energy necessary to operate the limb. This is especially important for transfemoral amputees. Additional materials have allowed artificial limbs to look much more realistic, which is important to transradial and transhumeral amputees because they are more likely to have the artificial limb expose.
TEXT.Polish: Protetyka - dziedzina wiedzy z pogranicza medycyny i techniki, zajmująca się uzupełnianiem ubytków tkankowych, narządowych lub czynnościowych przy pomocy sztucznego materiału zastępczego (protezy).

TEXT.English: Factory (Medical Tricoders)

A medical tricorder is a handheld portable scanning device to be used by consumers to self-diagnose medical conditions within seconds and take basic vital measurements. While the idea for a medical tricorder has been mostly hypothetical until May 2013, there are reports that a firm named Scanadu has built one which they call the Scanadu Scout. While the device is not yet on the mass market, there are numerous reports of other scientists and inventors also working to create such a device as well as improve it. A common view is that it will be a general-purpose tool similar in functionality to a Swiss Army Knife to take health measurements such as blood pressure and temperature, and blood flow in a noninvasive way. It would diagnose a person's state of health after analyzing the data.
TEXT.French: A medical tricorder is a handheld portable scanning device to be used by consumers to self-diagnose medical conditions within seconds and take basic vital measurements. While the idea for a medical tricorder has been mostly hypothetical until May 2013, there are reports that a firm named Scanadu has built one which they call the Scanadu Scout. While the device is not yet on the mass market, there are numerous reports of other scientists and inventors also working to create such a device ainsi que improve it. A common view is that it will be a general-purpose tool similar in functionality to a Swiss Army Knife to take health measurements such as blood pressure and temperature, and blood flow in a noninvasive way.It would diagnose a person's state of health after analyzing the data.

W Polsce weteranem może zostać żołnierz lub funkcjonariusz, który pełnił służbę poza granicami kraju nie krócej niż sześćdziesiąt dni. Dzień 25 maja ustanowiono jako Dzień Weterana Działań poza Granicami Państwa. W 2012 roku weszła w życie ustawa, która wprowadza dwa statusy Weteran i Weteran poszkodowany. Każdy żołnierz i funkcjonariusz, który spełnia kryteria może się ubiegać o przyznanie statusu.

TEXT.English: Megatower (Hotel Level)

A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis. The provision of basic accommodation, in times past, consisting only of a room with a bed, a cupboard, a small table and a washstand has largely been replaced by rooms with modern facilities, including en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning or climate control. Additional common features found in hotel rooms are a telephone, an alarm clock, a television, a safe, a mini-bar with snack foods and drinks, and facilities for making tea and coffee. Luxury features include bathrobes and slippers, a pillow menu, twin-sink vanities, and jacuzzi bathtubs. Larger hotels may provide additional guest facilities such as a swimming pool, fitness center, business center, childcare, conference facilities and social function services.
TEXT.French: A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis. The provision of basic accommodation, in times past, consisting only of a room with a bed, a cupboard, a small table and a washstand has largely been replaced by rooms with modern facilities, including en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning or climate control. Additional common features found in hotel rooms are a telephone, an alarm clock, a television, a safe, a mini-bar with snack foods and drinks, and facilities for making tea and coffee. Luxury features include bathrobes and slippers, a pillow menu, twin-sink vanities, and jacuzzi bathtubs. TEXT.English: Megatower (Research Level)

Research and experimental development comprise creative work undertaken on a systematic basis in order to increase the stock of knowledge, including knowledge of man, culture and society, and the use of this stock of knowledge to devise new applications. It is used to establish or confirm facts, reaffirm the results of previous work, solve new or existing problems, support theorems, or develop new theories. A research project may also be an expansion on past work in the field. To test the validity of instruments, procedures, or experiments, research may replicate elements of prior projects, or the project as a whole. The primary purposes of basic research (as opposed to applied research) are documentation, discovery, interpretation, or the research and development of methods and systems for the advancement of human knowledge. Approaches to research depend on epistemologies, which vary considerably both within and between humanities and sciences. There are several forms of research: scientific, humanities, artistic, economic, social, business, marketing, practitioner research, etc.
TEXT.French: Research and experimental development comprise creative work undertaken on a systematic basis in order to increase the stock of knowledge, including knowledge of man, culture and society, and the use of this stock of knowledge to devise new applications. It is used to establish or confirm facts, reaffirm the results of previous work, solve new or existing problems, support theorems, or develop new theories. A research project may also be an expansion on past work in the field. To test the validity of instruments, procedures, or experiments, research may replicate elements of prior projects, or the project as a whole. The primary purposes of basic research (as opposed to applied research) are documentation, discovery, interpretation, or the research and development of methods and systems for the advancement of human knowledge. Approaches to research depend on epistemologies, which vary considerably both within and between humanities and sciences. There are several forms of research: scientific, humanities, artistic, economic, social, business, marketing, practitioner research, etc.

TEXT.English: Megatower (Theme Park Crown Section)

An amusement park or theme park is a group of entertainment attractions, rides, and other events in a location for the enjoyment of large numbers of people. An amusement park is more elaborate than a simple city park or playground, usually providing attractions meant to cater specifically to certain age groups, as well as some that are aimed towards all ages. Theme parks, a specific type of amusement park, are usually much more intricately themed to a certain subject or group of subjects than normal amusement parks.
TEXT.French: An amusement park or theme park is a group of entertainment attractions, rides, and other events in a location for the enjoyment of large numbers of people. An amusement park is more elaborate than a simple city park or playground, usually providing attractions meant to cater specifically to certain age groups, ainsi que some that are aimed towards all ages. TEXT.English: Mercantilism Bonus(Gold)
TEXT.Italian: Bonus del mercantilismo (Oro)

TEXT.English: If you have access to Gold and are running Mercantilism, this automatically gets built and gives more gold.
TEXT.French: Si vous avez accès à de l'Or, la doctrine Mercantilisme permet d'obtenir un bonus pécunier
TEXT.Italian: Se hai accesso all'oro e stai usando la forma di governo Mercantilismo, questo edificio viene costruito automaticamente; produce più ricchezza.
TEXT.Polish: Merkantylizm lub ustrój merkantylny - system poglądów ekonomiczno-politycznych, który pojawił się we wczesnym okresie nowożytności, wywodzący się z bulionizmu - teorii mówiącej, że posiadanie metali szlachetnych równa się bogactwu. Termin merkantylizm pojawił się w 1664 r. w O zasadach merkantylizmu Jeana Baptiste Colberta, rozpropagowany został w 1776 r. przez słynnego ekonomistę Adama Smitha, który wywiódł go z łacińskiego słowa mercari, oznaczającego "handlować", "prowadzić handel", które z kolei pochodzi od słowa merx (dopełniacz mercis) oznaczającego "towar". Początkowo używany był wyłącznie przez swoich krytyków, do których zaliczał się też Adam Smith. Okres, gdy merkantylizm święcił największe triumfy, był epoką dominacji bogacącej się warstwy kupieckiej oraz silnej władzy państwa terytorialnie scentralizowanego. Był to system charakterystyczny głównie dla państw zachodnioeuropejskich, które posiadały dostęp do morza oraz silną flotę.

TEXT.English: Mercantilism Bonus (Gold)

TEXT.English: Mesa Verde
TEXT.French: Le Parc National Mesa Verde

TEXT.English: Mesa Verde National Park is a U.S. National Park and UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Montezuma County, Colorado, United States. It is the largest archaeological preserve in the United States. The park was created in 1906 by President TheodoreRoosevelt, to protect some of the best-preserved cliff dwellings in the world, or as he said, "preserve the works of man". As a result, it is the first, and still only, cultural National Park set aside by the National Park System. It occupies 81.4 square miles (211 km2)near the Four Corners and features numerous ruins of homes and villages built by the Ancestral Puebloan people, sometimes called the Anasazi. There are over four thousand archaeological sites and over six hundred cliff dwellings of the Pueblo people at the site.
TEXT.French: Mesa Verde un Parc national:Parcs nationaux is a U.S. un Parc national:Parcs nationaux and UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Montezuma County, Colorado,United States. It is the largest archaeological preserve in the United States. The park was created in 1906 by President TheodoreRoosevelt, to protect some of the best-preserved cliff dwellings in the world, or as he said, "preserve the works of man". As a result,it is the first, and still only, cultural un Parc national:Parcs nationaux set aside by the un Parc national:Parcs nationaux System. It occupies 81.4 square miles (211 km2)near the Four Corners and features numerous ruins of homes and villages built by the Ancestral Puebloan people, sometimes called the Anasazi.There are over four thousand archaeological sites and over six hundred cliff dwellings of the Pueblo people at the site.
TEXT.Polish: Park Narodowy Mesa Verde (ang. Mesa Verde National Park) - park narodowy położony w USA, w południowo-zachodniej części stanuKolorado. Mesa verde (hiszp. zielony stół) to nazwa nadana temupłaskowyżowi przez Hiszpanów w XVIII wieku. W dniu 29 czerwca 1906teren ten został uznany za park narodowy, a 6 września 1978 roku został wpisany na listę światowego dziedzictwa UNESCO.

TEXT.English: Temple of Tlaloc

TEXT.English: In Civilization IV, a religious pyramid is defined as an especially large and ornate religious building where the faithful worship. Only the most prosperous cities can afford to create pyramids, as they require huge amounts of raw material and years of dedicated labor by skilled craftsmen.

Only the most prosperous cities can afford to create pyramids, as they require huge amounts of raw material and years of dedicated labor by skilled craftsmen.

Jedynie najbardziej majętne miasta mogą sobie pozwolić na wybudowanie piramid, jako że ich postawienie wymaga olbrzymiej ilości surowców do budowy oraz lat wytężonej pracy licznych, wprawnych w swym fachu rzemieślników.

TEXT.English: Pyramid of the Magician
TEXT.French: La Pyramide du Mage

TEXT.English: The Pyramid of the Magician is a Mesoamerican step pyramid located in the ancient, Pre-Columbian city of Uxmal, Mexico. The structure is also referred to as the Pyramid of the Dwarf, Casa el Adivino, and the Pyramid of the Soothsayer. The pyramid is the tallest and most recognizable structure in Uxmal.
TEXT.French: La Pyramide du Mage is a Mesoamerican step pyramid located in the ancient, Pre-Columbian city of Uxmal, Mexico. The structure is also referred to as the Pyramid of the Dwarf, Casa el Adivino, and the Pyramid of the Soothsayer. The pyramid is the tallest and most recognizable structure in Uxmal.
TEXT.Polish: Świątynia Wróżbity jest to piramida schodkowa o wysokości ok. 38,0 m i eliptycznej podstawie. Zbudowana została w starożytnym pre-Kolumbijskim mieście Uxmal w Meksyku. Na niej zbudowano w sumie pięć świątyń dostępnych z różnych stron. Przy wejściu od strony zachodniej - świątynia pierwsza, od wschodniej znajdują się świątynie druga i trzecia w wewnętrznej komorze na poziomie drugim. Wyżej, od strony zachodniej znajduje się świątynia czwarta, której wejście zbudowano w formie maski boga deszczu Chaca. Na szczycie piramidy znajduje się piąta świątynia.

TEXT.English: Teotihuacan
TEXT.French: Teotihuacan

TEXT.English: The Aztecs believed Teotihuacan was where the Sun had been created and that the city was built by the gods.
TEXT.French: The Aztecs believed Teotihuacan was where the Sun had been created and that the city was built by the gods.
TEXT.Polish: Aztekowie wierzyli, że Teotihuacan zostało zbudowane tam gdzie Słońce zostało stworzone, a miasto było zbudowane przez bogów.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Temple of Quetzalcoatl
TEXT.French: Temple de Quetzalcoatl

TEXT.English: In Civilization IV, a temple is defined as a building where the faithful come to worship. Christians call their temples "churches," while Muslims call theirs "mosques," and Jews call theirs, simply, "temples." Temples are far more common than cathedrals, but much less large and ornate. Even the smallest village can possess a temple.
TEXT.French: Dans Civilization IV, un petit lieu de culte est défini comme un édifice dans lequel les fidèles viennent pratiquer leur religion: "églises" pour les chrétiens, "petites mosquées" pour les musulmans et "petites synagogues" pour les juifs. Ces petits lieux de culte sont bien plus courants que les grands lieux de culte mais sont de taille plus réduite et sont bien moins richement ornés. Même le village le plus petit peut posséder un petit lieu de culte.
TEXT.Polish: W Cywilizacji IV świątynia stanowi budynek, w którym wierni gromadzą się w celu oddawania czci swojemu bóstwu. Chrześcijanie nazywają swoje świątynie "kościołami", muzułmanie "meczetami", zaś Żydzi po prostu "świątyniami". Świątynie są znacznie powszechniejsze od katedr, jednakże również znacznie mniejsze i mnie przyozdobione. Świątynia może się znajdować nawet w najmniejszej wiosce.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temples[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's happiness and culture. They are especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
TEXT.French: Un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple de Quetzalcoatl[COLOR_REVERT] améliore le bonheur et la culture des villes. Ces édifices sont notamment utiles pour agrandir vos frontières culturelles au début du jeu.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Templos[COLOR_REVERT] aumentan la felicidad y la cultura de una ciudad. Son especialmente útiles para expandir las fronteras de tu civilización durante la fase inicial de la partida.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Świątynie[COLOR_REVERT] podnoszą w mieście poziom zadowolenia i kultury. Szczególnie przydatne okazują się dla poszerzania granic kulturowych własnego państwa na wczesnym etapie gry.

TEXT.English: Metamaterial Foundry

Metamaterials are artificial materials engineered to have properties that may not be found in nature. They are assemblies of multiple individual elements fashioned from conventional microscopic materials such as metals or plastics, but the materials are usually arranged in periodic patterns. Metamaterials gain their properties not from their composition, but from their exactingly-designed structures. Their precise shape, geometry, size, orientation and arrangement can affect the waves of light or sound in an unconventional manner, creating material properties which are unachievable with conventional materials. These metamaterials achieve desired effects by incorporating structural elements of sub-wavelength sizes, i.e. features that are actually smaller than the wavelength of the waves they affect.
TEXT.French: Metamaterials are artificial materials engineered to have properties that may not be found in nature. They are assemblies of multiple individual elements fashioned from conventional microscopic materials such as metals or plastics, but the materials are usually arranged in periodic patterns. Metamaterials gain their properties not from their composition, but from their exactingly-designed structures. Their precise shape, geometry, size, orientation and arrangement can affect the waves of light or sound in an unconventional manner, creating material properties which are unachievable with conventional materials. These metamaterials achieve desired effects by incorporating structural elements of sub-wavelength sizes, i.e. features that are actually smaller than the wavelength of the waves they affect.
TEXT.Polish: Odlewnia - zakład przemysłowy (lub jego część), w którym wytwarzane są odlewy. Istnieją odlewnie staliwa,żeliwa, żeliwa ciągliwego oraz metali nieżelaznych. Mogą produkować odlewy w celach usługowych lub artystycznych.

TEXT.English: Build a Metamaterial Foundry to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fonderie de Méta-matériaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Metamaterial Foundry by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Meteorology Lab

Meteorology is the interdisciplinary scientific study of the atmosphere. Studies in the field stretch back millennia, though significant progress in meteorology did not occur until the 18th century. The 19th century saw breakthroughs occur after observing networks developed across several countries. After the development of the computer in the latter half of the 20th century, breakthroughs in weather forecasting were achieved. Meteorological phenomena are observable weather events which illuminate, and are explained by the science of meteorology. Those events are bound by the variables that exist in Earth's atmosphere; temperature, air pressure, water vapor, and the gradients and interactions of each variable, and how they change in time. Different spatial scales are studied to determine how systems on local, regional, and global levels impact weather and climatology.
TEXT.French: Meteorology is the interdisciplinary scientific study of the atmosphere. Studies in the field stretch back millennia, though significant progress in meteorology did not occur until the 18th century. The 19th century saw breakthroughs occur after observing networks developed across several countries. After the development of the computer in the latter half of the 20th century, breakthroughs in weather forecasting were achieved. Meteorological phenomena are observable weather events which illuminate, and are explained by the science of meteorology. Those events are bound by the variables that exist in Earth's atmosphere; temperature, air pressure, water vapor, and the gradients and interactions of each variable, and how they change in time. Different spatial scales are studied to determine how systems on local, regional, and global levels impact weather and climatology.
TEXT.Polish: Meteorologia - nauka zajmująca się badaniem zjawisk fizycznych i procesów zachodzących w atmosferze, szczególnie w jej niższej warstwie -troposferze. Bada, jak te procesy wpływają na przebieg procesów atmosferycznych i stan pogody na danym obszarze.

TEXT.English: Build a Meteorology Lab to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de Météorologie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Meteorology Lab by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Meth Lab

Clandestine chemistry is chemistry carried out in secret, and particularly in illegal drug laboratories. Larger labs are usually run by gangs or organized crime intending to produce for distribution on the black market. Smaller labs can be run by individual chemists working clandestinely in order to synthesize smaller amounts of controlled substances or simply out of a hobbyist interest in chemistry, often because of the difficulty ascertaining the purity of other, illegally synthesized drugs obtained on the black market. The term clandestine lab is generally used in any situation involving the production of illicit compounds, regardless of whether the facilities being used qualify as a true laboratory.
TEXT.French: Clandestine chemistry is chemistry carried out in secret, and particularly in illegal drug laboratories. Larger labs are usually run by gangs or organized crime intending to produce for distribution on the black market. Smaller labs can be run by individual chemists working clandestinely in order to synthesize smaller amounts of controlled substances or simply out of a hobbyist interest in chemistry, often because of the difficulty ascertaining the purity of other, illegally synthesized drugs obtained on the black market. The term clandestine lab is generally used in any situation involving the production of illicit compounds, regardless of whether the facilities being used qualify as a true laboratory.
TEXT.German: Clandestine chemistry is chemistry carried out in secret, and particularly in illegal drug laboratories. Larger labs are usually run by gangs or organized crime intending to produce for distribution on the black market. Smaller labs can be run by individual chemists working clandestinely in order to synthesize smaller amounts of controlled substances or simply out of a hobbyist interest in chemistry, often because of the difficulty ascertaining the purity of other, illegally synthesized drugs obtained on the black market. The term clandestine lab is generally used in any situation involving the production of illicit compounds, regardless of whether the facilities being used qualify as a true laboratory..
TEXT.Polish: Metamfetamina została po raz pierwszy zsyntetyzowana w 1893 r. zefedryny przez japońskiego chemika Nagayoshi Nagai. W roku 1919, krystaliczna metamfetamina została zsyntetyzowana przez Akira Ogatę. Pokrewny związek chemiczny, amfetamina została zsyntetyzowana w Niemczech w roku 1887 przez Lazara Edeleanu.

TEXT.English: Build a Meth Lab to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de prod. de Méthamphétamine[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Meth Lab um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Meth Lab by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Metropolitan Administration
TEXT.Italian: Amministrazione metropolitana

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Metropolia - duże miasto, które stanowi centrum gospodarcze i kulturalne większego obszaru (zobacz też:obszar metropolitalny)

TEXT.English: Mezcal Worm Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de larves Mezcal

TEXT.English: Agave worms are large, fleshy caterpillars rather than worms. They develop into a butterfly known as mariposa. Agave worms are on the brink of extinction because of overharvesting for food and mescal. Most agave worms do not survive until adulthood to perpetuate the species. These worms are canned and eaten as a snack in Mexico. According to the University of Nebraska, agave worms, when fried, taste similar to sunflower seeds. Also known as the maguey worm, these larvae of either the Hypopta agavis moth or the Aegiale hesperiaris are sometimes included in tequila bottles as proof of authenticity and alcohol content (tequila must be of high enough proof to preserve the worm). In Mexico, they are also eaten as part of a meal, and are highly nutritious.
TEXT.French: Agave worms are large, fleshy caterpillars rather than worms. They develop into a butterfly known as mariposa. Agave worms are on the brink of extinction because of overharvesting for food and mescal. Most agave worms do not survive until adulthood to perpetuate the species. These worms are canned and eaten as a snack in Mexico. According to the University of Nebraska, agave worms, when fried, taste similar to sunflower seeds. Also known as the maguey worm, these larvae of either the Hypopta agavis moth or the Aegiale hesperiaris are sometimes included in tequila bottles as proof of authenticity and alcohol content (tequila must be of high enough proof to preserve the worm). In Mexico, they are also eaten as part of a meal, and are highly nutritious.
TEXT.Polish: Mezcal (lub mescal) - narodowa wódka meksykańska o lekko słomkowym kolorze. Odmianą mezcalu najbardziej znaną poza granicami Meksyku jest tequila. W przeciwieństwie jednak do tequili tradycyjny mezcal jest nie destylatem sporządzonym ze sfermentowanego soku, lecz z całego rdzenia (pina) agawy. Różnica dotyczy również gatunku agawy użytego do produkcji, mezcal wytwarza się z wielu gatunków agaw zielonych, natomiast tequilę wyłącznie z agawy niebieskiej (Agave tequilana) i to tylko w określonym regionie kraju. Do tequili nigdy nie dodaje się gąsienic, natomiast niektóre mezcale (oznaczone często jako "con gusano") zawierają larwę ćmy z gatunku Hypopta agavis (hiszp. chilocuil, chinicuil,tecol), żerującej na agawie bądź larwę owada z gatunku Scyphophorus acupunctatus.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Peyote[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mezcal Worm Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Peyotes[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de larves Mezcal[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Factory (Microgenerators)

Researchers at Georgia Tech have built a micro generator 10 mm wide, which spins a magnet above an array of coils fabricated on a silicon chip. The device spins at 100,000 revolutions per minute, and produces 1.1 watts of electrical power, sufficient to operate a cell phone. Their goal is to produce 20 to 50 watts, sufficient to power a laptop computer. Scientists at Lehigh University are developing a hydrogen generator on a silicon chip, which can convert methanol, diesel, or gasoline into fuel for a microengine or a miniature fuel cell.
TEXT.French: Researchers at Georgia Tech have built a micro generator 10 mm wide, which spins a magnet above an array of coils fabricated on a silicon chip. The device spins at 100,000 revolutions per minute, and produces 1.1 watts of electrical power, sufficient to operate a cell phone. Their goal is to produce 20 to 50 watts, sufficient to power a laptop computer. Scientists at Lehigh une Université are developing a hydrogen generator on a silicon chip, which can convert methanol, diesel, or gasoline into fuel for a microengine or a miniature fuel cell.

TEXT.English: Build a Microgenerator Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de Microgénérateurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Microgenerator Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Microlith Workshop
TEXT.Italian: Bottega dei microliti

TEXT.English: Build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Microlith Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] to increase the military production in your cities.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atelier de Microlithes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production militaire de votre ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller de microlitos[COLOR_REVERT] para aumentar la producción de unidades militares de tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Warsztat Wytwórcy Mikrolitów[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć produkcję wojska w swoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Microsatellite Constellation
Miniaturized satellites or small satellites are artificial satellites of low mass and size, usually under 500 kg (1,100 lb).
TEXT.French: Miniaturized satellites or small satellites are artificial satellites of low mass and size, usually under 500 kg (1,100 lb).
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczny satelita - satelita wykonany przez człowieka poruszający się po orbicie wokół ciała niebieskiego. Pierwszym sztucznym satelitą był Sputnik 1, wyniesiony na orbitę wokół Ziemi przez Związek Radziecki w 1957.

TEXT.English: Build a Microsatellite Constellation to increase your cities espionage.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Constellation de Microsatellites[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'espionnage dans votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Microsatellite Constellation to increase your cities espionage.

TEXT.English: Factory (Microwave Ovens)

A microwave oven, often colloquially shortened to microwave, is a kitchen appliance that heats food by bombarding it with electromagnetic radiation in the microwave spectrum causing polarized molecules in the food to rotate and build up thermal energy in a process known as dielectric heating. Microwave ovens heat foods quickly and efficiently because excitation is fairly uniform in the outer 25-38 mm of a dense (high water content) food item; food is more evenly heated throughout (except in thick, dense objects) than generally occurs in other cooking techniques.
TEXT.French: A microwave oven, often colloquially shortened to microwave, is a kitchen appliance that heats food by bombarding it with electromagnetic radiation in the microwave spectrum causing polarized molecules in the food to rotate and build up thermal energy in a process known as dielectric heating. Microwave ovens heat foods quickly and efficiently because excitation is fairly uniform in the outer 25-38 mm of a dense (high water content) food item; food is more evenly heated throughout (except in thick, dense objects) than generally occurs in other cooking techniques.
TEXT.German: Ein Mikrowellenherd, auch Mikrowellenofen oder Mikrowellengerät (kurz: Mikrowelle), ist ein Gerät zum schnellen energiesparenden Erwärmen von Speisen, Flüssigkeiten und anderen geeigneten Stoffen. Seine Wirkung beruht auf der Umwandlung elektromagnetischer Feldenergie in Wärmeenergie bei der Absorption von Dezimeterwellen (Mikrowellen).
TEXT.Polish: Kuchenka mikrofalowa (potoczna nazwa: mikrofalówka, mikrofala) - urządzenie kuchenne służące do ogrzewania przedmiotów znajdujących się w jej wnętrzu poprzez poddanie ich działaniumikrofal. Za wynalazcę kuchenki mikrofalowej uważa się Percy'ego Spencera. Pierwszą komercyjnie dostępną kuchenką mikrofalową była wyprodukowana w 1947 Radarange.

TEXT.English: Build a Microwave Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de micro-ondes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Mikrowellen Fabrik um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Microwave Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Academies[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's military unit production.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]académies militaires[COLOR_REVERT] augmentent la production d'unités militaires de la ville.
TEXT.Italian: Questa [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accademia militare[COLOR_REVERT] incrementa la produzione di unità militari della città.
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Academias militares[COLOR_REVERT] aumentan la producción de unidades militares de una ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Akademia Wojskowa[COLOR_REVERT] zwiększa produkcję jednostek wojska w mieście.

TEXT.English: Achievement (Military)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement Militaire
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo militare

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives 2 experience points to land units built in all cities, as well as a +25% great general growth rate.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives 2 experience points to land units built in all cities, as well as a +25% great general growth rate.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro militar[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da 2 puntos de experiencia adicionales a las unidades terrestres entrenadas en todas las ciudades, además de un aumento del 25% de la tasa de formación de Grandes generales.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Wojskowe[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Jednostki lądowe otrzymują +2 punkty doświadczenia we wszystkich miastach oraz zwiększa o +25% szansę pozyskania wielkiego generała.

TEXT.English: Military Airbase
TEXT.Italian: Base aerea militare

TEXT.English: An airbase (sometimes referred to as an airfield, military airport, or Air Force Station) is a military base that provides basing and support of military aircraft. They are different to civilian airports in that they do not provide for large volume of passenger transits, and cargo handling is not processed by the customs and immigration facilities. Some military air forces combine use of civilian airports with the hosting of military units. However, military aircraft usually use substantially different support equipment, and require facilities sufficiently isolated from civilian operations due to issues of aviation safety involving the weapon ordnance they use. [PARAGRAPH:2]While some airbases provide facilities very like civilian airports, for example RAF Brize Norton in Oxfordshire, England which has a terminal which caters for passengers for the Royal Air Force's scheduled flights, e.g., the TriStar to the Falkland Islands, most do not. Most military airbases are located remotely from populated areas due to the ever-present potential of in-flight accidents that may cause a crash and significant infliction of damage and casualties on civilian population.[PARAGRAPH:2]However, due to growth of urban centres, many military bases built during the Second World War are now located on the outskirts of large cities, and lack of required remoteness has cause constraints on flight operations to be introduced due to the noise pollution generated by the operation of military aircraft, such as night flying restrictions.[PARAGRAPH:2]The airbase operation is generally organised around its operational areas divided into the air command operations, air traffic control operations which are either towered or non-towered based, runways, taxiways, and ramps used in military operations to dislocate troops to be airlifted, or to stockpile cargo for loading. Refuelling is conducted in the pre-flight and inspection area.[PARAGRAPH:2]More substantial maintenance and repair is conducted in the squadron maintenance operations, usually in or close to their squadron hangars which are usually Hardened Aircraft Shelters to protect individual aircraft from aerial strikes. Maintenance is also carried out in the intermediate maintenance operations or the depot maintenance operations areas, the latter usually concerned with more substantial structural work such as changing an engine, crash repair, or field upgrades. A large part of the airbase surface is devoted to the maneuvering area used by aircraft to move around the different areas as they return from an air mission or prepare for one.[PARAGRAPH:2]Military flight operations often require a higher level of airbase security, and in recent years, many countries have adopted higher levels of security due to threats of terrorist attacks. This security in wartime is augmented by basing of air defence systems and their units, usually on the periphery of the airbase, which use anti-aircraft weapons such as surface-to-air missiles and their fire control radars, to protect from air attack. Other units located at the military airbase may be runway repair troops.
TEXT.French: An airbase (sometimes referred to as an airfield, military airport, or Air Force Station) is a military base that provides basing and support of military aircraft. They are different to civilian airports in that they do not provide for large volume of passenger transits, and cargo handling is not processed by the customs and immigration facilities. Some military air forces combine use of civilian airports with the hosting of military units. However, military aircraft usually use substantially different support equipment, and require facilities sufficiently isolated from civilian operations due to issues of aviation safety involving the weapon ordnance they use. [PARAGRAPH:2]While some airbases provide facilities very like civilian airports, for example RAF Brize Norton in Oxfordshire, England which has a terminal which caters for passengers for the Royal Air Force's scheduled flights, e.g., the TriStar to the Falkland Islands, most do not. Most military airbases are located remotely from populated areas due to the ever-present potential of in-flight accidents that may cause a crash and significant infliction of damage and casualties on civilian population.[PARAGRAPH:2]However, due to growth of urban centres, many military bases built during the Second World War are now located on the outskirts of large cities, and lack of required remoteness has cause constraints on flight operations to be introduced due to the noise pollution generated by the operation of military aircraft, such as night flying restrictions.[PARAGRAPH:2]The airbase operation is generally organised around its operational areas divided into the air command operations, air traffic control operations which are either towered or non-towered based, runways, taxiways, and ramps used in military operations to dislocate troops to be airlifted, or to stockpile cargo for loading. Maintenance is also carried out in the intermediate maintenance operations or the depot maintenance operations areas, the latter usually concerned with more substantial structural work such as changing an engine, crash repair, or field upgrades. A large part of the airbase surface is devoted to the maneuvering area used by aircraft to move around the different areas as they return from an air mission or prepare for one.[PARAGRAPH:2]Military flight operations often require a higher level of airbase security, and in recent years, many countries have adopted higher levels of security due to threats of terrorist attacks. This security in wartime is augmented by basing of air defence systems and their units, usually on the periphery of the airbase, which use anti-aircraft weapons such as surface-to-air missiles and their fire control radars, to protect from air attack. Other units located at the military airbase may be runway repair troops.
TEXT.Polish: Baza wojskowa - specjalnie przygotowany rejon (ośrodek), wyposażony w lotniska (lądowiska), przystanie, koszary, magazyny, warsztaty, szpitale itp., zaopatrzony w zapasy żywności, amunicji, materiałów pędnych i innych oraz mający stałe garnizony; służy do okresowego stacjonowania i bieżącego zaopatrywania wyznaczonych jednostek odpowiednich rodzajów sił zbrojnych oraz stanowi podstawę wyjściową do prowadzenia działań bojowych.

TEXT.English: Increases the amount of air units city can hold and new air units will be more experienced. Slightly also increases defense against air attacks.
TEXT.French: Increases the amount of air units city can hold and new air units will be more experienced. Slightly also increases defense against air attacks.
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la cantidad de unidades aéreas que pueden estacionarse en la ciudad, y las nuevas unidades aéreas estarán más experimentadas. También incrementa ligeramente la defensa frente a ataques aéreos.

TEXT.English: Military Base
TEXT.Italian: Base militare

TEXT.English: A military base is any facility directly owned and operated by a military for its own purposes, mostly the accommodation and training of units. Bases became the primary centers of military force with the development of globe-spanning empires and modern warfare that required great amounts of supplies and logistics. Some bases rival small cities in their size and population.
TEXT.French: A military base is any facility directly owned and operated by a military for its own purposes, mostly the accommodation and training of units. Bases became the primary centers of military force with the development of globe-spanning empires and modern warfare that required great amounts of supplies and logistics. Some bases rival small cities in their size and population.
TEXT.Italian: Una base militare è qualunque proprietà posseduta e amministrata direttamente dai militari, perlopiù per l'addestramento delle truppe. Le basi divennero centri importanti per i militari con lo sviluppo di imperi estesi a tutto il mondo e con la guerra moderna, che richiedono grandi quantità di rifornimenti e supporti logistici; alcune basi raggiungono le dimensioni di piccole città.
TEXT.Polish: Baza wojskowa (również: baza wojenna) - specjalnie przygotowany rejon (ośrodek), wyposażony w lotniska(lądowiska), przystanie, koszary, magazyny, warsztaty, szpitale itp., zaopatrzony w zapasy żywności, amunicji,materiałów pędnych i innych oraz mający stałe garnizony; służy do okresowego stacjonowania i bieżącego zaopatrywania wyznaczonych jednostek odpowiednich rodzajów sił zbrojnych oraz stanowi podstawę wyjściową do prowadzenia działań bojowych.

TEXT.English: Build a Military Base to increase the production and experience of your units.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Base militaire[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production et l'expérience de vos unités.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una base militare per incrementare produzione ed esperienza delle tue unità
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una Base militar para aumentar la producción y experiencia de tus unidades.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Military Base to increase the production and experience of your units.

TEXT.French: Satellite Militaire
TEXT.Italian: Satelliti militari
