Muiderslot Castle
TEXT.French: Le Château de Muiderslot

TEXT.English: The Muiderslot is a castle in the Netherlands, located at the mouth of the river Vecht, some 15 kilometers southeast of Amsterdam, in Muiden, where it flows into what used to be the Zuiderzee. It's one of the better known castles in the Netherlands and has been featured in many television shows set in the Middle Ages.
TEXT.French: The Muiderslot is a castle in the Netherlands, located at the mouth of the river Vecht, some 15 kilometers southeast of Amsterdam, in Muiden, where it flows into what used to be the Zuiderzee. It's one of the better known castles in the Netherlands and has been featured in many television shows set in the Middle Ages.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Factory (Ammunition)
TEXT.Italian: Fabbrica di munizioni da artiglieria

TEXT.English: As weapons systems became more complex, dedicated factories arose to produce them, housing their specialized labor and machinery. Many industrialists became wealthy and influential through selling weapons to many different nations. During the World Wars, the pace of munitions production increased as nations moved to strategies of total war. After World War II, the increasing combination of the production of weapons with the desire to use them became known as the "military-industrial complex."
TEXT.French: Usine de munitions
TEXT.Italian: Mentre le armi diventavano sempre più complesse, vennero costruite nuove fabbriche apposta per produrle, con macchinarie e lavoratori specializzari. Molti industriali divennero ricchi ed influenti vendendo armia molte nazioni differenti. Durante le Guerre mondiali, la produzione di munizioni continuò a crescere dato che le nazioni avevano sviluppato strategie di guerra totale. Dopo la Seconda Guerra mondiale, la combinazione della produzione di armi e del desiderio di utilizzarle divenne nota come "complesso militare-industriale".
TEXT.Polish: Amunicja - ogół rakiet, nabojów artyleryjskich, min, bomb lotniczych, torped, bomb głębinowych, granatów ręcznych oraz naboje do broni strzeleckiej. Służy do niszczenia i obezwładniania siły żywej, punktów ogniowych, sprzętu, burzenia umocnień, szkolenia, treningów.

TEXT.English: Build Munitions Factory to be able to produce Artillery units.
TEXT.French: Usine de munitions
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci questo edificio per produrre unità di artiglieria
TEXT.Spanish: Construye la Fábrica de munición de artillería para poder producir unidades de artillería.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Munitions Factory to be able to produce Artillery units.

TEXT.English: Murder Holes
TEXT.Italian: Trabocchetti

TEXT.English: A murder-hole or meurtrière is a hole in the ceiling gate through which the defenders can fire, throw or pour dangerous or noxious substances at attackers. As a result, the defenders would be able to rain rocks and arrows down on the attackers' heads. They also allowed water to be poured onto fire started within the gate passage. Similar holes, called machicolations, were often located in the curtain walls of castles, fortified manor houses and city walls. The parapet would project over corbels so that holes would be located over the exterior face of the wall, and arrows could be shot at, rocks dropped on, or boiling water poured over, any attackers near the wall.
TEXT.French: A murder-hole or meurtriere is a hole in the ceiling gate through which the defenders can fire, throw or pour dangerous or noxious substances at attackers. As a result, the defenders would be able to rain rocks and arrows down on the attackers' heads. They also allowed water to be poured onto fire started within the gate passage. Similar holes, called machicolations, were often located in the curtain walls of castles, fortified manor houses and city walls. The parapet would project over corbels so that holes would be located over the exterior face of the wall, and arrows could be shot at, rocks dropped on, or boiling water poured over, any attackers near the wall.
TEXT.Italian: Un trabocchetto è un buco nel soffitto attraverso il quale i difensori possono sparare, lanicare o rovesciare sostanze pericolose o tossiche contro gli attaccanti. Come risultato, i difensori potevano far piovere rocce e frecce diretteamente sulle teste degli attaccanti. Permettevano anche di gettare acqua sui fuochi accesi nei passaggi. Trabocchetti simili, chiamati merlature, venivano costruiti nelle mura dei castelli, nelle case fortificate o nelle mura cittadine. I parapetti erano aggettanti, cosicchè i buchi erano situati sopra il lato esterno delle mura, e si poteva gettare rocce e acqua bollente, oltre che sparare frecce, ai nemici che attaccavano le mura.
TEXT.Polish: Wilcze doły - element średniowiecznych fortyfikacji polowych; zamaskowane rowy, czasami z ostrymi palami wbitymi pionowo w ziemię; miały na celu zatrzymanie ciężkiej jazdy przeciwnika, co umożliwiłoby dobry ostrzałłucznikom bądź też artylerii, ale również unieszkodliwienie przeciwnika poprzez wpadnięcie do dołu. Użyte przez Rosjan w bitwie pod Borodino w roku 1812.

TEXT.English: Rain down Stones and Liquid Fire on your enemies!
TEXT.French: Faites pleuvoir des pierres et du liquide emflammé sur vos ennemis!
TEXT.Italian: Getta pietre e olio bollente addosso ai tuoi nemici!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Tira piedras y líquido ardiente a tus enemigos!
TEXT.Polish: Obrzuć swych wrogów kamieniami i palącą się cieczą!

TEXT.English: Museum
TEXT.French: Musée
TEXT.Italian: Museo

TEXT.English: A museum is a "permanent institution in the service of society and of its development, open to the public, which acquires, conserves, researches, communicates and exhibits the tangible and intangible heritage of humanity and its environment, for the purposes of education, study, and enjoyment", as defined by the International Council of Museums.
TEXT.French: A museum is a "permanent institution in the service of society and of its development, open to the public, which acquires, conserves, researches, communicates and exhibits the tangible and intangible heritage of humanity and its environment, for the purposes of education, study, and enjoyment", as defined by the International Council of Museums.
TEXT.Polish: Muzeum -- instytucja powołana do gromadzenia, badania oraz opieki nad obiektami posiadającymi pewną wartość historyczną bądź artystyczną. W większych muzeach niewielka część z tych obiektów jest udostępniana publiczności w postaci wystaw stałych lub czasowych, natomiast reszta jest przechowywana w specjalnie do tego przystosowanych magazynach.

TEXT.English: A place for your people to go to learn about their history and cultural heritage. Ticket sales give small income bonus.
TEXT.French: A place for your people to go to learn about their history and cultural heritage. Ticket sales give small income bonus.
TEXT.Spanish: Un lugar de aprendizaje sobre su historia y patrimonio cultural para tu pueblo. Las ventas de pases proporcionan algunos ingresos.

TEXT.English: Mussel Rafts

Scientists from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) set up an experimental raft at the mouth of New York City's Bronx River last spring. Hanging beneath it were long, sock-like tendrils that had been seeded with Geukensia demissa, commonly known as ribbed mussels.
TEXT.French: Scientists from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) set up an experimental raft at the mouth of New York City's Bronx River last spring. Hanging beneath it were long, sock-like tendrils that had been seeded with Geukensia demissa, commonly known as ribbed mussels.
TEXT.Polish: Omułek jadalny (Mytilus edulis) - gatunek kosmopolitycznego małża z rodziny omułkowatych (Mytilidae), szeroko rozprzestrzeniony w morzachpółkuli północnej z wyjątkiem strefy arktycznej. W Bałtyku omułek jadalny jest jedynym przedstawicielem małży nitkoskrzelnych (Pteriomorphia). Występuje tam w postaci skarlałej. Nie jest zaliczany do fauny Polski.

TEXT.English: Build Mussel Rafts to increase your cities water quality.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bouchots de Moules[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la qualité de l'eau de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Mussel Rafts to increase your cities water quality.

TEXT.English: Nanite Defuser
TEXT.French: Diffuseur de Nanites
TEXT.Italian: Diffusore di naniti

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Defuses all nuclear weapons from all civilizations (one time effect)
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Détruit l'ensemble des armes nucléaires de toutes les civilisations (effet unique)
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Elimina tutte le armi nucleari da tutti i giocatori (funziona una sola volta)
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Desactiva todas las armas nucleares de todas las civilizaciones (una sola vez)

TEXT.English: A nanite dfeuser simply deactivates nanites that are out of service.
TEXT.French: A nanite dfeuser simply deactivates nanites that are out of service.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Nanite Defuser disarms all nukes from all players, increases defense in all cities and decreases enemies' war weariness.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]un Diffuseur de Nanites disarms all nukes from all players, increases defense dans toutes les villes and decreases enemies' war weariness.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]El Difusor de nanoides desmantela todas las armas nucleares de todos los jugadores, aumenta las defensas de todas las ciudades y reduce el hastío bélico hacia los enemigos.

TEXT.English: Nanite Lab
TEXT.French: Laboratoire à Nanites
TEXT.Italian: Laboratorio di naniti

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: W teorii są to mechanizmy bardzo małe (kilka nanometrów) służące do celów medycznych, tudzież bojowych. Mogą działać jak Chmura Naprawcza (reperować struktury budynków i pojazdów). Specjaliści od Nanotechnologii często krytykują pomysły pisarzy gatunków Cyberpunk czy Wojennej Fantastyki że Nanoboty ( popularna nazwa Nanomaszyn) mogą być używane do celów przestępczych lub wojny, choć inni specjaliści twierdzą że: "Armia i Ulica znajdą zastosowanie do wszystkiego". Obecnie najbardziej prawdopodobne jest zastosowanie Inżynierów z książek naukowych Dexlera. są to Nanomaszyny stworzone z Białek, min kultur E-coli.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Nanite Lab produces Nanobots which are required for Nanofactory and Nanite Clouds.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]un Laboratoire à Nanites produces Nanobots which are required for une Usine de Nano-Composants and Nanite Clouds.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]El Laboratorio de nanoides produce Nanorobots, que se requieren para la construcción de la Fábrica de nanocomponentes y las Nubes de nanoides.

TEXT.English: Utility Fog
TEXT.French: Brouillard Utile
TEXT.Italian: Nuvola di nanorobot

TEXT.English: Utility Fog is a collection of tiny robots together performing a certain function. The idea of nanobotic swarms was detailed as early as in 1964 by Stanislaw Lem in the novel The Invincible, and explored in some recent SciFi novels, such as Prey (2002), written by Michael Crichton. When self-replication is taken as an additional feature of such devices, the possibility of losing control of the swarm is the basis of post-apocalyptic scenarios such as the Grey goo.
TEXT.French: un Brouillard Utile is a collection of tiny robots together performing a certain function. The idea of nanobotic swarms was detailed as early as in 1964 by Stanislaw Lem in the novel The Invincible, and explored in some recent SciFi novels, such as Prey (2002), written by Michael Crichton. When self-replication is taken as an additional feature of such devices, the possibility of losing control of the swarm is the basis of post-apocalyptic scenarios such as the Grey goo.
TEXT.Polish: Mgła Nanobotów jest zbiorem małych robotów. Pomysł roju nanobotów było szczegółowo opisany już w 1964 roku przez Stanisława Lema w powieści Invincible, i w kilku ostatnich powieści science fiction, takich jak Prey (2002), napisana przez Michaela Crichtona. Kiedy samodzielnego rozmnażanie się jest traktowana jako dodatkowa funkcja tych urządzeń, z możliwością utraty kontroli roju jest w oparciu o post-apokaliptycznym sytuacjach.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Utility Fog increases city's production, defense and health.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]un Brouillard Utile increases city's production, defense and health.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]La Niebla de nanoides de trabajo aumenta la producción, la defensa y la salud de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Nano Research Department
TEXT.French: Département de Recherche Nano
TEXT.Italian: Dipartimento di ricerca nano-tecnologica

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Nanotechnologia - ogólna nazwa całego zestawu technik i sposobów tworzenia rozmaitych struktur o rozmiarach nanometrycznych, czyli na poziomie pojedynczych atomów i cząsteczek. Rozmiary nanometryczne nie są jednoznacznie zdefiniowane. Powszechnie znany przedział 1,5 - 100 nm nie znajduje potwierdzenia praktycznego. Obecnie uważa się iż granice rozmiarów nanometrycznych leżą tam, gdzie rozmiar struktury koreluje z właściwościami fizycznymi materiału.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Nano Research Department increases city's science and produces Nanotubes.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]un Département de Recherche Nano increases city's science and produces Nanotubes.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]La Agencia de investigación nanotecnológica aumenta la investigación en la ciudad, y produce Nanotubos.

TEXT.English: Factory (Nanoactuators)

An actuator is a type of motor for moving or controlling a mechanism or system. It is operated by a source of energy, typically electric current, hydraulic fluid pressure, or pneumatic pressure, and converts that energy into motion. An actuator is the mechanism by which a control system acts upon an environment. The control system can be simple (a fixed mechanical or electronic system), software-based (e.g. a printer driver, robot control system), or a human or other agent. Nanoactuators do basically the same - just in nanoscale.
TEXT.French: An actuator is a type of motor for moving or controlling a mechanism or system. It is operated by a source of energy, typically electric current, hydraulic fluid pressure, or pneumatic pressure, and converts that energy into motion. An actuator is the mechanism by which a control system acts upon an environment. The control system can be simple (a fixed mechanical or electronic system), software-based (e.g. a printer driver, robot control system), or a human or other agent. Nanoactuators do basically the same - just in nanoscale.

TEXT.English: Build a Nanoactuator Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de Nano-actionneurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nanoactuator Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Nanofactory
TEXT.Italian: Fabbrica di nano-componenti

TEXT.English: A nanofactory is a system in which nanomachines (resembling molecular assemblers, or industrial robot arms) would combine reactive molecules via mechanosynthesis to build larger atomically precise parts. These, in turn, would be assembled by positioning mechanisms of assorted sizes to build macroscopic (visible) but still atomically-precise products.
TEXT.French: A nanofactory is a system in which nanomachines (resembling molecular assemblers, or industrial robot arms) would combine reactive molecules via mechanosynthesis to build larger atomically precise parts. These, in turn, would be assembled by positioning mechanisms of assorted sizes to build macroscopic (visible) but still atomically-precise products.
TEXT.Polish: Nanofabryka jest systemem, w którym nanomaszyny (przypominające molekularne roboty lub przemysłowe ramiona robota) łączyłby reaktywnych cząsteczek poprzez synteze do budowy większych atomowo precyzyjnych części. Te z kolei mają być montowane przez mechanizmy pozycjonowania różnych rozmiarów do budowy makroskopowych (widoczne) ale atomowo-precyzyjnych wyrobów.

TEXT.English: Nanofactory increases city's production.
TEXT.French: une Usine de Nano-Composants increases city's production.
TEXT.Spanish: La Fábrica de nanocomponentes aumenta la producción de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Factory (Nanogenerators)

Professor Zhong Lin Wang of the Georgia Institute of Technology said his team of investigators had developed a "nanometer-scale generator (which) is based on arrays of vertically aligned zinc oxide nanowires that move inside a "zigzag" plate electrode." Built into shoes, it could generate electricity from walking to power small electronic devices. It could also be powered by blood flow to power biomedical devices. Per an account of the device which appeared in the journal Science, bending of the zinc oxide nanowire arrays produces an electric field by the piezoelectric properties of the material. The semiconductor properties of the device create a Schottky barrier with rectifying capabilities. The generator is estimated to be 17% to 30% efficient in converting mechanical motion into electricity. This could be used to power biomedical devices which have wireless transmission capabilities for data and control. A later development was to grow hundreds of such nanowires on a substrate which functioned as an electrode. On top of this was placed a silicon electrode covered with a series of platinum ridges. Vibration of the top electrode caused the generation of direct current. A report by Wang was to appear in the August 8, 2007 issue of the journal "Nano letters," saying that such devices could power implantable biomedical devices. The device would be powered by flowing blood or a beating heart. It could function while immersed in body fluids, and would get its energy from ultrasonic vibrations. Wang expects that an array of the devices could produce 4 watts per cubic centimeter. Goals for further development are to increase the efficiency of the array of nanowires, and to increase the lifetime of the device, which as of April 2007 was only about one hour. By November 2010 Wang and his team were able to produce 3 volts of potential and as much as 300 nanoamperes of current, an output level 100 times greater than was possible a year earlier, from an array measuring about 2 cm by 1.5 cm.
TEXT.French: Professor Zhong Lin Wang of the Georgia Institute of Technology said his team of investigators had developed a "nanometer-scale generator (which) is based on arrays of vertically aligned zinc oxide nanowires that move inside a "zigzag" plate electrode." Built into shoes, it could generate electricity from walking to power small electronic devices. It could also be powered by blood flow to power biomedical devices. Per an account of the device which appeared in the journal Science, bending of the zinc oxide nanowire arrays produces an electric field by the piezoelectric properties of the material. The semiconductor properties of the device create a Schottky barrier with rectifying capabilities. The generator is estimated to be 17% to 30% efficient in converting mechanical motion into electricity. This could be used to power biomedical devices which have wireless transmission capabilities for data and control. A later development was to grow hundreds of such nanowires on a substrate which functioned as an electrode. On top of this was placed a silicon electrode covered with a series of platinum ridges. Vibration of the top electrode caused the generation of direct current. A report by Wang was to appear in the August 8, 2007 issue of the journal "Nano letters," saying that such devices could power implantable biomedical devices. The device would be powered by flowing blood or a beating heart. It could function while immersed in body fluids, and would get its energy from ultrasonic vibrations. Wang expects that an array of the devices could produce 4 watts per cubic centimeter. Goals for further development are to increase the efficiency of the array of nanowires, and to increase the lifetime of the device, which as of April 2007 was only about one hour. By November 2010 Wang and his team were able to produce 3 volts of potential and as much as 300 nanoamperes of current, an output level 100 times greater than was possible a year earlier, from an array measuring about 2 cm by 1.5 cm.

TEXT.English: Build a Nanogenerator Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de nano-générateurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nanogenerator Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Nanosatellite Constellation

The term "nanosatellite" or "nanosat" is applied to an artificial satellite with a wet mass between 1 and 10 kg (2.2 and 22 lb). Designs and proposed designs of these types may be launched individually, or they may have multiple nanosatellites working together or in formation, in which case, sometimes the term "satellite swarm" or "fractionated spacecraft" may be applied. Some designs require a larger "mother" satellite for communication with ground controllers or for launching and docking with nanosatellites.
TEXT.French: The term "nanosatellite" or "nanosat" is applied to an artificial satellite with a wet mass between 1 and 10 kg (2.2 and 22 lb). Designs and proposed designs of these types may be launched individually, or they may have multiple nanosatellites working together or in formation, in which case, sometimes the term "satellite swarm" or "fractionated spacecraft" may be applied. Some designs require a larger "mother" satellite for communication with ground controllers or for launching and docking with nanosatellites.

TEXT.English: Build a Nanosatellite Constellation to increase your cities espionage.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Constellation de Nanosatellites[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'espionnage dans votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Nanosatellite Constellation to increase your cities espionage.

TEXT.English: National Aerospace Agency
TEXT.French: Agence Nationale Aérospatiale (NASA)

TEXT.English: The Aerospacial national agency is an agency of the government, responsible for the nation's public space program. In addition to the space program, it is also responsible for long-term civilian and military aerospace research. Is to "pioneer the future in space exploration, scientific discovery, and aeronautics research."
TEXT.French: The Aerospacial national agency is an agency of the government, responsible for the nation's public space program. In addition to the space program, it is also responsible for long-term civilian and military aerospace research. Is to "pioneer the future in space exploration, scientific discovery, and aeronautics research."
TEXT.German: Nationale Weltraumorganisationen wie die US-amerikanische NASA sind Regierungsbehörden, die sich hauptsächlich mit der Erforschung und Nutzung des Weltalls befassen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die NASA selbst ist nicht nur eine reine Raum-, sondern auch eine Luftfahrtbehörde. Sie wurde am 29. Juli 1958 gegründet und hat ihren Hauptsitz in Washington, D.C. Ihr erklärtes Ziel ist es, "unseren Heimatplaneten zu verstehen und zu schützen, das Universum zu erforschen und nach Leben zu suchen und die nächste Generation von Forschern zu begeistern".
TEXT.Polish: NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration) (pol.Narodowa Agencja Aeronautyki i Przestrzeni Kosmicznej) - agencja rząduStanów Zjednoczonych, odpowiedzialna za narodowy program lotów kosmicznych, ustanowiona 29 lipca 1958 r. na mocy National Aeronautics and Space Act, zastępując poprzednika - National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics. NASA nie wchodzi w skład struktury żadnego ministerstwa (departamentu). Ma status niezależnej agencji podległej bezpośrednio Prezydentowi USA.

TEXT.English: National Academic Database

A bibliographic database is a database of bibliographic records, an organized digital collection of references to published literature, including journal and newspaper articles, conference proceedings, reports, government and legal publications, patents, books, etc. In contrast to library catalogue entries, a large proportion of the bibliographic records in bibliographic databases describe analytics (articles, conference papers, etc.) rather than complete monographs, and they generally contain very rich subject descriptions in the form of keywords, subject classification terms, or abstracts.
TEXT.French: A bibliographic database is a database of bibliographic records, an organized digital collection of references to published literature, including journal and newspaper articles, conference proceedings, reports, government and legal publications, patents, books, etc. In contrast to library catalogue entries, a large proportion of the bibliographic records in bibliographic databases describe analytics (articles, conference papers, etc.) rather than complete monographs, and they generally contain very rich subject descriptions in the form of keywords, subject classification terms, or abstracts.

TEXT.English: Build a National Academic Database to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Base de données Nationale Académique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Academic Database by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: National Alcohol Prohibition
TEXT.French: Prohibition Nationale de l'Alcool

TEXT.English: Prohibition of alcohol, often referred to simply as prohibition, is the legal act of prohibiting the manufacture, transportation and sale of alcohol and alcoholic beverages.
TEXT.French: Prohibition of alcohol, often referred to simply as prohibition, is the legal act of prohibiting the manufacture, transportation and sale of alcohol and alcoholic beverages.
TEXT.Polish: Prohibicja (fr. prohibition, z łac. prohibitio) - częściowy lub pełny zakaz produkcji i dystrybucji napojów alkoholowych. Najczęściej rozumie się pod tym pojęciem okres w historii USA (lata 1920-1933). W szerszym znaczeniu może odnosić się także do podobnego zakazu dotyczącego narkotyków.

TEXT.English: Pass Alcohol Prohibition to remove Pubs and Breweries.
TEXT.French: Faire appliquer le décret de la Prohibition de l'alcool supprimera tous les Pubs et les Brasseries.

TEXT.English: National Aquarium
TEXT.French: Aquarium National

TEXT.English: An aquarium built by the goverment for the enjoyment of the people.
TEXT.French: An aquarium built by the goverment for the enjoyment of the people.
TEXT.Polish: Akwarium (łac. aquarium - naczynie na wodę) - sztuczny zbiornik wodny o zróżnicowanych rozmiarach i kształtach, z co najmniej jedną ścianą z materiału przezroczystego, zwykle ze szkła, służący do hodowlioraz prezentacji organizmów żyjących w środowisku słodko- lubsłonowodnym.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: National Belief (Karma)

Karma means action, work or deed; it also refers to the principle of causality where intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual. Good intent and good deed contribute to good karma and future happiness, while bad intent and bad deed contribute to bad karma and future suffering.
TEXT.French: Karma means action, work or deed; it also refers to the principle of causality where intent and actions of an individual influence the future of that individual. Good intent and good deed contribute to good karma and future happiness, while bad intent and bad deed contribute to bad karma and future suffering.
TEXT.Polish: Karma - w buddyzmie, hinduizmie i religiach dharmicznych jest to przyczyna - rozumiana w sensie prawa przyczyny i skutku. Filozoficzne wyjaśnienie karmy różni się pomiędzy tradycjami, jednak główna idea głosi, że czyny tworzą przyszłe doświadczenia i przez to każdy jest odpowiedzialny za własne życie, cierpienie i szczęście jakie sprowadza na siebie i innych.

TEXT.English: Build a National Belief Karma to decrease your cities crime.
TEXT.French: Construisez la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Croyance Nationale (Karma)[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer la criminalité de vos villes.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Belief Karma to decrease your cities crime.

TEXT.English: National Belief (Reincarnation)

Reincarnation is the religious or philosophical concept that the soul or spirit, after biological death, begins a new life in a new body that may be human, animal or spiritual depending on the moral quality of the previous life's actions.
TEXT.French: Reincarnation is the religious or philosophical concept that the soul or spirit, after biological death, begins a new life in a new body that may be human, animal or spiritual depending on the moral quality of the previous life's actions.
TEXT.Polish: Reinkarnacja (również: metempsychoza, transmigracja; łac. re+in+caro, carnis - ponowne wcielenie) - pogląd, według którego dusza (bądź świadomość) po śmierci ciała może wcielić się w nowy byt fizyczny. Np. dusza jednego człowieka może przejść w ciało nowonarodzonego dziecka lub zwierzęcia czy nawet według niektórych poglądów rośliny. Samo słowo reinkarnacja jest zestawieniem dwóch członów: inkarnacja (wcielenie) i przedrostka re (oznaczającego powtórzenie czegoś). Dosłownie więc reinkarnacja oznacza powtórne wcielenie.

TEXT.English: Build a National Belief (Reincarnation) to decrease your cities crime and war weariness.
TEXT.French: Construisez la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Croyance nationale (Réincarnation)[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer la criminalité de vos villes et le mécontentement lié à la guerre.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Belief (Reincarnation) to decrease your cities crime and war weariness.

TEXT.English: National Belief (Resurrection)
Resurrection (anglicized from Latin resurrectio) is the concept of a living being coming back to life after death.
TEXT.French: Resurrection (anglicized from Latin resurrectio) is the concept of a living being coming back to life after death.
TEXT.Polish: Koncepcja będąca jedną z ważniejszych prawd wiary w zaratusztrianizmie,judaizmie, chrześcijaństwie i islamie, zgodnie z którą - w eschatologii tych systemów wyznaniowych - wszyscy zmarli zostaną wskrzeszeni przez Boga w czasach ostatecznych. Elementy wiary w zmartwychwstanie występują również w hinduizmie i wielu religiach animistycznych.

TEXT.English: Build a National Belief (Resurrection) to decrease your cities War Weariness.
TEXT.French: Construisez la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Croyance nationale (Résurrection)[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer le mécontentement lié à la guerre.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Belief (Resurrection) to decrease your cities War Weariness.

TEXT.English: Central Breeder - Camel
TEXT.Italian: Allevamento nazionale di cammelli

TEXT.English: The Central Breeder - Camel is an alternative way to get Camels in your city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Designer Note:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]1. The National animal Breeder buildings are designed to allow players who have the resource in their nation but not in the work vicinity of any city access to it in one city. The building is equivalent to the farm building for the animal opening up the chain of buildings in that city only.[PARAGRAPH:2]2. This means that if you do have the animal in the working area of a city then you can use this wonder to allow the animal in another city as well. The turn slow down in insisting that at least one of the animal resources is not in the work radius of a city was not worth the effort required to implement.
TEXT.French: The Central Breeder - Camel is an alternative way to get Camels in your city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Designer Note:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]1. The turn slow down in insisting that at least one of the animal resources is not in the work radius of a city was not worth the effort required to implement.
TEXT.Italian: L'allevamento nazionale di cammelli è un modo alternativo per ottenere i cammelli nella tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Wielbłąd (Camelus) - rodzaj dużych ssaków z rodziny wielbłądowatych. Fizjologicznie przystosowane do życia w warunkach suchego i gorącego klimatu, są w wielu krajach wykorzystywane jako zwierzęta użytkowe.

TEXT.English: Build a Central Breeder - Camel to increase your cities pride.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eleveur National de Chameaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la fierté de vos villes.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un allevamento nazionale di cammelli per incrementare l'orgoglio della tua città.

TEXT.Polish: Stadnina koni - ośrodek zajmujący się hodowlą lub reprodukcją koni, który jest wyposażony w stajnie i odpowiednie zaplecze gospodarcze. Zwykle ośrodki hodują jedną rasę lub typ konia. Stadniny zarodowe mają głównie na celu hodowlę ogierów reproduktorów dla Stad Ogierów (dawniej Państwowe Stado Ogierów), które utrzymują wartościowe ogiery hodowlane różnych ras i rozsyłają je do punktów krycia klaczy.

TEXT.English: Build a Central Breeder - Horse to increase your cities pride.
TEXT.French: Construisez l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eleveur National de Chevaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la fierté de vos villes.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un allevamento nazionale di cavalli per incrementare l'orgoglio della tua città.

TEXT.English: National Drug Prohibition
TEXT.French: Prohibition Nationale de la Drogue

TEXT.English: The prohibition of drugs through sumptuary legislation or religious law is a common means of attempting to prevent drug use.
TEXT.French: The prohibition of drugs through sumptuary legislation or religious law is a common means of attempting to prevent drug use.
TEXT.Polish: Handel narkotykami w wielu krajach jest zabroniony. Odgrywa też nieprzeciętną rolę w prowadzeniu wojen lokalnych jak np. w Afganistanie przeciwko interwencji radzieckiej. Dostawy broni CIA dla powstańców afgańskich były opłacane przez nich przy pomocy opium. To doprowadziło do takiego rozwoju uprawy opium, że Afganistan stał się największym światowym producentem tego narkotyku.

TEXT.English: Pass Drug Prohibition to remove Opium, Marijuana and other such drug producing farms.
TEXT.French: Pass Drug Prohibition to remove Opium, Marijuana and other such drug producing farms.

TEXT.English: National Epic
National Fire Service
TEXT.French: Service National du Feu
TEXT.Italian: Servizio antincendio nazionale

TEXT.English: The National Fire Service (NFS) was the single fire service created in Great Britain in 1941 during the Second World War; a separate National Fire Service (Northern Ireland) was created in 1942.
TEXT.French: The National Fire Service (NFS) was the single fire service created in Great Britain in 1941 during the Second World War; a separate National Fire Service (Northern Ireland) was created in 1942.
TEXT.Italian: Il National Fire Service (NFS) fu fondato in Gran Bretagna nel 1941 durante la seconda guerra mondiale; un altro servizio antincendio venne fondato in Irlanda del Nord nel 1942.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Fire Service by poprawić jakość zdrowia Twoich poddanych w miastach.

TEXT.English: Build a National Fire Service to increase your cities health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Service National du Feu[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé de toutes les villes.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un servizio antincendio nazionale per incrementare la salute in tutte le tue città.
TEXT.Polish: Straż pożarna, dawniej straż ogniowa - zorganizowana formacja zajmująca się prewencją i walką z pożarami oraz pozostałymi zagrożeniami (innymi niż przestępczość) dla zdrowia i życia ludzkiego, dobytku oraz środowiska naturalnego. Do zadań straży pożarnej należy także usuwanie skutków klęsk żywiołowych i katastrof.

TEXT.English: National Gambling Ban
TEXT.French: Prohibition Nationale de la mendicité

TEXT.English: Gambling is the wagering of money or something of material value (referred to as "the stakes") on an event with an uncertain outcome with the primary intent of winning additional money and/or material goods. Gambling thus requires three elements be present: consideration, chance and prize.
TEXT.French: Gambling is the wagering of money or something of material value (referred to as "the stakes") on an event with an uncertain outcome with the primary intent of winning additional money and/or material goods. Gambling thus requires three elements be present: consideration, chance and prize.
TEXT.Polish: Urządzanie i prowadzenie działalności hazardowej Polsce reguluje ustawa z dnia 19 listopada 2009 r. o grach hazardowych. Określa ona katalog gier hazardowych jakie są w Polsce dozwolone oraz miejsce i warunki ich urządzania.

TEXT.English: Pass a Gambling Ban to remove Casinos and Gambling Dens.
TEXT.French: Pass a Gambling Ban to remove Casinos and un Tripots.

TEXT.English: National Legal Database

The Iraqi Legal Database (ILD) is the first comprehensive and electronic legal database to be created in the Arab region. The project to create the ILD was launched in 2004 by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), through its Programme on Governance in the Arab Region (POGAR), and is being implemented in coordination with the Higher Judicial Council.The objective behind the project is to make the entire corpus of Iraqi law available to judges, lawyers, academics, lawmakers, and all other individuals or institutions that rely on legal knowledge in a single, freely accessible source. In keeping with this objective, the ILD was published online in September 2008, and makes available to users 27,433 legal texts altogether, including 7,136 laws, 4,265 ministerial instructions, 3,268 regulations, 5,029 declarations, etc., which is to say every single Iraqi legal text that has been passed since 1917. The ILD is entirely free-of-charge and does not require users to subscribe in any way. The Iraq Country Office of the United Nations Development Programme is the source of most of the funding for the ILD.The ILD is available only in Arabic. Iraqi law was not translated into any other language in a systematic manner, and so therefore legal researchers and other jurists that are interested in Iraqi law must carry out their research in Arabic. Non-Arabic speaking researchers who are interested in learning more about the ILD's features may download the following powerpoint presentation which illustrates (and translates into English) the ILD's various functions.
TEXT.French: The Iraqi Legal Database (ILD) is the first comprehensive and electronic legal database to be created in the Arab region. The project to create the ILD was launched in 2004 by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), through its Programme on Governance in the Arab Region (POGAR), and is being implemented in coordination with the Higher Judicial Council.The objective behind the project is to make the entire corpus of Iraqi law available to judges, lawyers, academics, lawmakers, and all other individuals or institutions that rely on legal knowledge in a single, freely accessible source. In keeping with this objective, the ILD was published online in September 2008, and makes available to users 27,433 legal texts altogether, including 7,136 laws, 4,265 ministerial instructions, 3,268 regulations, 5,029 declarations, etc., which is to say every single Iraqi legal text that has been passed since 1917. The ILD is entirely free-of-charge and does not require users to subscribe in any way. The Iraq Country Office of the United Nations Development Programme is the source of most of the funding for the ILD.The ILD is available only in Arabic. Iraqi law was not translated into any other language in a systematic manner, and so therefore legal researchers and other jurists that are interested in Iraqi law must carry out their research in Arabic. Non-Arabic speaking researchers who are interested in learning more about the ILD's features may download the following powerpoint presentation which illustrates (and translates into English) the ILD's various functions.
TEXT.Polish: Kodeks (z łac. codex: księga, spis) - akt normatywny zawierający logicznie usystematyzowany zbiór przepisówregulujących określoną dziedzinę stosunków społecznych. Obecnie w Polsce kodeksy są wydawane w formieustaw; w II RP kilka kodeksów wydano w formie rozporządzenia z mocą ustawy. Kodeks może mieć moc prawną równą ustawie zwykłej (tak jest obecnie w polskim prawie), ale w niektórych systemach prawnych jego pozycja może być wyższa, wskutek czego przepisy innych ustaw sprzeczne z kodeksem podlegają uchyleniu. Normy kodeksowe, nawet jeśli są równe innym ustawom, mają jednak szczególne znaczenie ze względu na kompleksowość normowanych spraw i proces interpretacji przepisów.

TEXT.English: Build a National Legal Database to increase your cities espionage.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Base de données Nationale Légale[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'espionnage dans vos villes.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Legal Database to increase your cities espionage.

TEXT.English: National Library Service
TEXT.French: Le Service National des Bibliothèques

TEXT.English: National Library Service
TEXT.French: National une Bibliothèque Service
TEXT.Italian: Istituto nazionale che gestisce le tue biblioteche.
TEXT.Spanish: La Biblioteca nacional.

TEXT.English: This National Wonder provides a free Library in all cities, and increases science output of its city by 5%.
TEXT.French: Merveille nationale qui procure une bibliothèque gratuite, et augmente le taux de science de la ville de 5%.
TEXT.Italian: Meraviglia nazionale che fornisce una biblioteca gratuita in tutte le tue città, oltre a fornire un bonus del 5% alla ricerca nella città in cui è costruita.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta es una maravilla nacional que da una Biblioteca gratis a todas las ciudades, e incrementa la producción científica de la ciudad en un 5%.

TEXT.English: National Mint
TEXT.French: Monnaie Nationale
TEXT.Italian: Zecca Nazionale

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]If a National Mint is captured by the enemy, they will receive 10 times the normal amount of plunder
TEXT.French: Si la Monnaie Nationale est capturée par l'ennemi, il recevra un 10x le montant standard de pillage
TEXT.German: Wenn eine staatliche Münzanstalt vom Feind eingenommen wird, so erhalten sie das 10fache der üblichen Beute
TEXT.Italian: Se una zecca nazionale viene conquistata dal nemico, otterrà dieci volte il normale bottino.
TEXT.Spanish: Si la Casa de moneda nacional es capturada por el enemigo, este recibirá 10 veces la cantidad de oro saqueado normal.
TEXT.Polish: Jeśli mennica jest przejęta przez wroga, mogą splądrować 10 krotnie więcej niż normalnie.

TEXT.English: A mint is an industrial facility which manufactures coins for currency.[NEWLINE]The history of mints correlates closely with the history of coins. One difference is that the history of the mint is normally related in a fashion that more closely ties to the political situation of an era. For example, when discussing the history of the New Orleans Mint, the usage of that mint by the Confederate States of America beginning in 1861 is a notable occurrence. The origins of the Philadelphia Mint, which began operations in 1792 and first produced circulating coinage in 1793, are often related within the political context of the time.[NEWLINE]In the beginning, hammered coinage or cast coinage were the chief means of coin minting, with resulting production runs numbering as little as the hundreds or thousands. In modern mints, coin dies are manufactured in large numbers and planchets are made into milled coins by the billions.[NEWLINE]With the mass production of currency the production cost is weighed when minting coins. For example, it costs the US Mint much less than 25 cents to make a quarter, and the difference in production cost and face value (called seigniorage) helps fund the minting body.
TEXT.French: A mint is an industrial facility which manufactures coins for currency.[NEWLINE]The history of mints correlates closely with the history of coins. One difference is that the history of the mint is normally related in a fashion that more closely ties to the political situation of an era. For example, when discussing the history of the New Orleans Mint, the usage of that mint by the Confederate States of America beginning in 1861 is a notable occurrence. The origins of the Philadelphia Mint, which began operations in 1792 and first produced circulating coinage in 1793, are often related within the political context of the time.[NEWLINE]In the beginning, hammered coinage or cast coinage were the chief means of coin minting, with resulting production runs numbering as little as the hundreds or thousands. In modern mints, coin dies are manufactured in large numbers and planchets are made into milled coins by the billions.[NEWLINE]With the mass production of currency the production cost is weighed when minting coins. For example, it costs the US Mint much less than 25 cents to make a quarter, and the difference in production cost and face value (called seigniorage) helps fund the minting body.
TEXT.Italian: Una zecca è un complesso industriale che produce monete.[NEWLINE]La storia delle zecche è strettamente correlata con quella delle monete. La differenza è che la storia della zecca è normale più correlata alla situazione politica dell'epoca. Per esempio, riguardo alla zecca di New Orleans, l'uso di quella zecca da parte degli stati Confederti d'America, iniziato nel 1861, è un caso esemplare. Lde origini della zecca di Filadelfia, che iniziò le ue operazioni nel 1972 e stampò le prime monete nel 1793, sono spesso correlate con la situazione politica del tempo.[NEWLINE]In the beginning, hammered coinage or cast coinage were the chief means of coin minting, with resulting production runs numbering as little as the hundreds or thousands. In modern mints, coin dies are manufactured in large numbers and planchets are made into milled coins by the billions.[NEWLINE]With the mass production of currency the production cost is weighed when minting coins. For example, it costs the US Mint much less than 25 cents to make a quarter, and the difference in production cost and face value (called seigniorage) helps fund the minting body.
TEXT.Polish: Mennica to zakład zajmujący się produkcją (biciem) monet, medali oraz stempli. Pojęcie mennicy jest z reguły utożsamiane z pojęciem mennicy państwowej mającej monopol na bicie monet obiegowych i medali oraz odznaczeń państwowych.W zależności od formy ustrojowej państwa można też mówić o mennicy królewskiej lub książęcej.Pierwsze znane dziś mennice powstały w VII w. p.n.e. w Azji Mniejszej.

TEXT.English: Build A Mint when you have access to lots of rare metals
TEXT.French: Faites Frapper la Monnaie nationale lorsque vous avez accès à beaucoup de métaux rares
TEXT.German: Errichte eine Münzanstalt wenn DU Zugang zu vielen seltenen Metallen hast
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una zecca quano hai accesso a molti metalli rari
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una Casa de moneda cuando tengas acceso a multitud de metales preciosos.
TEXT.Polish: Buduj mennice jeśli chcesz mieć dostęp do rzadkich metali

TEXT.English: National Park
National Prostitution Ban
TEXT.French: Prohibition Nationale de la prostitution

TEXT.English: Prostitution is the business or practice of providing sexual services to another person in return for payment.
TEXT.French: Prostitution is the business or practice of providing sexual services to another person in return for payment.
TEXT.Polish: Jednym z instrumentów prawa międzynarodowego w tej kwestii jest Konwencja w sprawie zwalczania handlu ludźmi i eksploatacji prostytucji przyjęta przez ONZ 2 grudnia 1949 roku, która weszła w życie 25 lipca 1951 roku. Konwencja została ratyfikowana przez 82 państwa.

TEXT.English: Pass a Prostitution Ban to remove Brothels and other such buildings.
TEXT.French: Mettez en place la Prohibition nationale de la Prostitution pour fermer tous les bordels et autres bâtiments du même genre dans toutes vos villes.

TEXT.English: National Science Foundation
TEXT.Italian: Fondazione scientifica nazionale

TEXT.English: The National Science Foundation (NSF) is a government agency that supports fundamental research and education in all the non-medical fields of science and engineering.
TEXT.French: The National Science Foundation (NSF) is a government agency that supports fundamental research and education in all the non-medical fields of science and engineering.
TEXT.Italian: La National Science Foundation (NSF) è un'agenzia governativa che supporta le ricerche in tutti i campi non medici dell'ingegneria e della scienza.
TEXT.Polish: Państwowa instytucja naukowa realizująca działania służące rozwojowi, promocji, integracji i upowszechnianiu nauki oraz przyczyniające się do rozwoju edukacji i wzbogacania kultury narodowej. Akademia realizuje swoje cele w ramach korporacji uczonych oraz poprzez sieć instytutów i jednostek naukowych, prowadzących badania na możliwie najwyższym poziomie naukowym.

TEXT.English: Build the National Science Foundation to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Augmente la science dans votre ville.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Fondazione scientifica nazionale per incrementare la ricerca nella tua città.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj National Science Foundation by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Security Bureau
National Shield
TEXT.French: Bouclier Atm. National
TEXT.Italian: Scudo nazionale

TEXT.English: A national shield is a rather a collection of shields over all of a nations cities rather than one large shield. It protects against nuclear and conventional attacks.
TEXT.French: A national shield is a rather a collection of shields over all of a nations cities rather than one large shield. It protects against nuclear and conventional attacks.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]National Shield gives Advanced Shielding to all your cities and upgrades all Anti-Missile Batteries, Arcologies and Arcology Shielding buildings to Advanced Shielding.
TEXT.French: [SPACE]un Bouclier Atm. National gives un Bouclier Atm. Avancés to all your cities and upgrades all une Batteries Anti-Missiles, Arcologies and une Arcologie Shielding buildings to un Bouclier Atm. Avancés.
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]El Escudo nacional proporciona un Escudo arcológico avanzado a todas tus ciudades, que reemplazará todas las Baterías antimisiles, Arcologías y Escudos arcológicos que tengas.

TEXT.English: Ordinance - National Smoking Prohibition
TEXT.French: Prohibition Nationale du Tabac

TEXT.English: Smoking bans (or smoke-free laws) are public policies, including criminal laws and occupational safety and health regulations, which prohibit tobacco smoking in workplaces and other public spaces. Legislation may also define smoking as more generally being the carrying or possessing of any lit tobacco product.
TEXT.French: Smoking bans (or smoke-free laws) are public policies, including criminal laws and occupational safety and health regulations, which prohibit tobacco smoking in workplaces and other public spaces. Legislation may also define smoking as more generally being the carrying or possessing of any lit tobacco product.
TEXT.Polish: Zgodnie z obowiązującym prawem zabrania się sprzedaży wyrobów tytoniowych (papierosów) młodzieży do lat 18. Sprzedaż wyrobów tytoniowych niepełnoletnim jest według prawa polskiego zakazana i grozi grzywną od 20 do 5000 złotych. Na dole paczki papierosowej umieszczony jest napis dotyczący skutków palenia tytoniu. Zakazana jest sprzedaż papierosów w opakowaniach zawierających mniej niż 20 sztuk, bez opakowania oraz na sztuki. Nielegalny jest także handel papierosami z marihuaną.

TEXT.English: Pass Smoking Prohibition to reduce air pollution a bit.
TEXT.French: Pass Smoking Prohibition to reduce air pollution a bit.

TEXT.English: National Sports League
TEXT.Italian: Campionato sportivo nazionale

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Rozgrywki ligowe (system ligowy) - regularny cykl meczów w dyscyplinach drużynowych, prowadzony według modelu dwurundowego ("jesień-wiosna" lub "wiosna-jesień") "każdy z każdym - mecz i rewanż", w celu wyłonienia najlepszej drużyny w kraju, regionie itd.

TEXT.English: National Sports League increases culture in all cities by 10% and grants +2 free celebrities in the city it's built.

TEXT.English: The National Standard of Measurement
The National Standard of Measurement specifies how different units of measurement are defined.
TEXT.French: Le Bureau National des Etalons specifies how different units of measurement are defined.
TEXT.Polish: Układ SI - Międzynarodowy UkładJednostek Miar zatwierdzony w 1960 (później modyfikowany) przezGeneralną Konferencję Miar. Jest stworzony w oparciu o metryczny system miar. Jednostki w układzie SI dzielą się na podstawowe ipochodne.

TEXT.English: Build the National Standard of Measurement to increase your cities yields.
TEXT.French: Construisez les the National Standard of Measurement to increase your cities yields.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj the National Standard of Measurement to increase your cities yields.

TEXT.English: National TV-Station
TEXT.Italian: Stazione televisiva nazionale

TEXT.English: A television station is a type of broadcast station that broadcasts both audio and video to television receivers in a particular area. Traditionally, TV stations made their broadcasts by sending specially-encoded radio signals over the air, called terrestrial television. Individual television stations are usually granted licenses by a government agency to use a particular section of the radio spectrum (a channel) through which they send their signals. Some stations use LPTV broadcast translators to retransmit to further areas. Many television stations are now in the process of converting from analogue (NTSC, PAL, or SECAM) to digital TV (ATSC, DVB, or ISDB).
TEXT.French: A television station is a type of broadcast station that broadcasts both audio and video to television receivers in a particular area. Traditionally, TV stations made their broadcasts by sending specially-encoded radio signals over the air, called terrestrial television. Individual television stations are usually granted licenses by a government agency to use a particular section of the radio spectrum (a channel) through which they send their signals. Some stations use LPTV broadcast translators to retransmit to further areas. Many television stations are now in the process of converting from analogue (NTSC, PAL, or SECAM) to digital TV (ATSC, DVB, or ISDB).
TEXT.Polish: Telewizja, TV - dziedzina telekomunikacji przekazująca ruchomy obraz oraz dźwięk na odległość. W jednym miejscu za pomocą kamery telewizyjnej i mikrofonu rejestruje się sygnał, który następnie jest transmitowany do dowolnego miejsca w zasięgu transmisji. Sygnał odbierany jest przez odbiornik telewizyjny i przetwarzany na obraz oraz dźwięk.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: National Weather Service
TEXT.French: Service météorologique national
TEXT.Italian: Servizio meteorologico nazionale

TEXT.English: The National Weather Service (NWS), is one of the six scientific agencies that make up the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) of the United States government. It is tasked with providing "weather, hydrologic, and climate forecasts and warnings for the United States, its territories, adjacent waters and ocean areas, for the protection of life and property and the enhancement of the national economy." This is done through a collection of national and regional centers, and 122 local weather forecast offices (WFOs).
TEXT.French: The National Weather Service (NWS), is one of the six scientific agencies that make up the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) of the United States government. It is tasked with providing "weather, hydrologic, and climate forecasts and warnings for the United States, its territories, adjacent waters and ocean areas, for the protection of life and property and the enhancement of the national economy." This is done through a collection of national and regional centers, and 122 local weather forecast offices (WFOs).

TEXT.English: The National Weather Service organizes all weather forecasts and models for all other cities. It will grant all existing and new units the ability to use weather forecasting to aid their combat abilities, a sizeable advantage in any war.
TEXT.French: Le Service météorologique national coordonne toutes les prévisions météorologiques pour toutes les autres villes. Il accordera à toutes les unités la capacité d'utiliser les prévisions météorologiques pour améliorer de leurs habiletés au combat, un avantage non négligeable en cas de guerre.
TEXT.Spanish: El Servicio meteorológico nacional coordina todos los modelos y previsiones del tiempo para las demás ciudades. Dará a las unidades nuevas y existentes la capacidad de utilizar las previsiones meteorológicas en favor de sus habilidades de combate, una ventaja considerable para cualquier guerra.
TEXT.Polish: Le Service mźtźorologique national coordonne toutes les prźvisions mźtźorologiques pour toutes les autres villes. Il accordera a toutes les unitźs la capacitź d'utiliser les prźvisions mźtźorologiques pour amźliorer de leurs habiletźs au combat, un avantage non nźgligeable en cas de guerre.

TEXT.English: Totem Pole
Natural Insecticide Sprayers
Natural Insecticides are bacteria living on plants which produce poisons toxic to harmful insects. These poisons are specifically designed so they have no effect on humans or non-harmful insects.
TEXT.French: Natural Insecticides are bacteria living on plants which produce poisons toxic to harmful insects. These poisons are specifically designed so they have no effect on humans or non-harmful insects.
TEXT.Polish: Insektycydy, środki owadobójcze (łac. insecta - owady, caedo - zabijam) - substancje z grupy pestycydówużywane do zwalczania szkodników w uprawach rolnych, lasach, w magazynach z żywnością, a także w mieszkaniach. Zależnie od składu chemicznego insektycydy zabijają owady lub jedynie ograniczają ich rozród, co również wpływa na ilość owadów.

Taniec można też nazwać formą komunikacji niewerbalnej. W tym sensie ktoś powiedział (o tańcu religijnym), że: "Taniec jest modlitwą nóg".

TEXT.English: Naval Shipping Warehouse

Much shipping is done aboard actual ships. An individual nation's fleet and the people that crew it are referred to as its merchant navy or merchant marine. Merchant shipping is the lifeblood of the world economy, carrying 90% of international trade with 102,194 commercial ships worldwide. On rivers and canals, barges are often used to carry bulk cargo.
TEXT.French: Much shipping is done aboard actual ships. An individual nation's fleet and the people that crew it are referred to as its merchant navy or merchant marine. Merchant shipping is the lifeblood of the world economy, carrying 90% of international trade with 102,194 commercial ships worldwide. On rivers and canals, barges are often used to carry bulk cargo.
TEXT.Polish: Magazyn - miejsce przeznaczone do składowania i przemieszczania zapasów na wyodrębnionej przestrzeni, która może zajmować plac nieosłonięty (składowisko), plac półosłonięty (wiata), część budowli, całą budowlę lub kilka budowli magazynowych.

Początkowo ich wyposażenie składało się z dwóch barek warsztatowych oraz dźwigu torowego. W tym czasie wykonywano głównie remonty okrętów, które stacjonowały w Porcie Wojennym Puck. Po przeniesieniu Portu Wojennego do Gdyni podobnie uczyniono latem 1927 roku z Warsztatami Portowymi, które rozmieszczono w czterech budynkach przy nabrzeżu.

TEXT.English: Nest Thief

A nest is a structure built by animals to hold its eggs, its offspring, or occasionally the animal itself. Although nests are most closely associated with birds, members of all classes of vertebrates and some invertebrates construct nests. They may be composed of organic material such as twigs, grass, and leaves, or may be a simple depression in the ground, or a hole in a rock, tree, or building. Human-made materials, such as string, plastic, cloth, or paper, may also be used. Nests can be found in all types of habitat.
TEXT.French: A nest is a structure built by animals to hold its eggs, its offspring, or occasionally the animal itself. Although nests are most closely associated with birds, members of all classes of vertebrates and some invertebrates construct nests. They may be composed of organic material such as twigs, grass, and leaves, or may be a simple depression in the ground, or a hole in a rock, tree, or building. Human-made materials, such as string, plastic, cloth, or paper, may also be used. Nests can be found in all types of habitat.
TEXT.Polish: Prehistoryczny członek plemienia wyspecjalizowany w okradaniu ptasich gniazd.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nest Thief[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] production at the cost of [COLOR_RED]Unhealthiness[COLOR_REVERT] if [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cooking[COLOR_REVERT] hasn't been researched yet. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Eggs[COLOR_REVERT] which is one of the resources that can help enable the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Omega Child Crew[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs to be in the vicinity of [COLOR_CYAN]Poultry[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nest Thief[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] production at the cost of [COLOR_RED]Unhealthiness[COLOR_REVERT] if [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cooking[COLOR_REVERT] hasn't been researched yet. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Eggs[COLOR_REVERT] which is one of the resources that can help enable the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Omega Child Crew[COLOR_REVERT]. To build it a city needs to be in the vicinity of [COLOR_CYAN]Poultry[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Neuroscience Center

Neuroscience is the scientific study of the nervous system. Traditionally, neuroscience has been seen as a branch of biology. However, it is currently an interdisciplinary science that collaborates with other fields such as chemistry, computer science, engineering, linguistics, mathematics, medicine and allied disciplines, philosophy, physics, and psychology. It also exerts influence on other fields, such as neuroeducation and neurolaw. The term neurobiology is usually used interchangeably with the term neuroscience, although the former refers specifically to the biology of the nervous system, whereas the latter refers to the entire science of the nervous system.
TEXT.French: Neuroscience is the scientific study of the nervous system. Traditionally, neuroscience has been seen as a branch of biology. However, it is currently an interdisciplinary science that collaborates with other fields such as chemistry, computer science, engineering, linguistics, mathematics, medicine and allied disciplines, philosophy, physics, and psychology. It also exerts influence on other fields, such as neuroeducation and neurolaw. The term neurobiology is usually used interchangeably with the term neuroscience, although the former refers specifically to the biology of the nervous system, whereas the latter refers to the entire science of the nervous system.
TEXT.Polish: Neurologia - dziedzina medycyny zajmująca się schorzeniamiobwodowego układu nerwowego i ośrodkowego układu nerwowego. Neurologia i psychiatria są dziedzinami pokrewnymi, a niektóre choroby są domeną zarówno neurologa jak i psychiatry. Neurologia zajmuje się głównie schorzeniami, których podłożem jest proces uszkadzający układ nerwowy, a psychiatria z kolei zajmuje się głównie chorobami, których podłożem jest biochemiczne zaburzenie funkcjonowania mózgu jako całości.

TEXT.English: Build a Neuroscience Center to increase your cities science.

Binary psychoactives are biotechnology nanobots that mimic and greatly enhance drug induced experiences. Somatosensory Manipulators (artificial senses) truly give the feeling of being in another world. A new technology branch called Cyber Counterculture is possible in the future.

TEXT.English: Neuschwanstein
TEXT.French: Château du Neuschwanstein

TEXT.English: Neuschwanstein is a 19th-century Bavarian palace on a rugged hill near Hohenschwangau and Füssen in southwest Bavaria, Germany. The palace was commissioned by Ludwig II of Bavaria as a retreat and as an homage to Richard Wagner, the King's inspiring muse. Ludwig did not allow visitors to his castles, but after his death in 1886 the castle was opened to the public.
TEXT.French: Le château de Neuschwanstein est un château bavarois situé près de Füssen dans l'Allgäu. Louis II de Bavière l'a fait construire au XIXe siècle, comme lieu de retraite, et en hommage à Richard Wagner, le musicien très proche du monarque. Louis II n'a jamais autorisés de visiteurs dans ses châteaux, mais après sa mort en 1886, le château a été ouvert au public.
TEXT.Polish: Neuschwanstein, Nowy Łabędzi Kamień, XIX-wieczny zamek neoromańsko-pseudomauretańsko-neogotycki położony w Bawarii, nad przełomem rzeki Pollak w Alpach Bawarsko-Tyrolskich, na pograniczu Niemiec i Austrii, dwa kilometry od Hohenschwangau.Jego fundatorem był król Ludwik II Bawarski. Pierwsze prace nad budową Neuschwanstein rozpoczęły się 5 września 1869 roku od zbudowania bramy wjazdowej. Następnie wzniesiono część mieszkalną w skład której wchodziły pomieszczenia dla kobiet, wejście boczne i liczne wieże. Na szczególną uwagę zasługują niezwykle dopieszczone przez młodego króla wnętrza. Każda komnata została starannie dopracowana przez malarzy historycznych z całego kraju. Z całego pałacu można wyróżnić Salę Tronową, Sypialnię Króla oraz Salę Śpiewaków. Pierwsza z wymienionych komnat jest niemal w całości wypełniona złotem, podłogę zdobi mozaika. Niestety tron z kości słoniowej, który miał stanąć na podeście nigdy nie trafił do zamku.Sypialnia królewska, w której Ludwik uwielbiał czytać i modlić się została urządzona w stylu neogotyckim. Ściany komnaty zdobione freskami przedstawiającymi jak żyli legendarni Tristan i Izolda. Uwagę w pokoju zwraca wielkie łoże ze zdobieniami na szczycie baldachimu w kształcie katedry. W Sali Śpiewaków odbywały się liczne koncerty muzyki wagnerowskiej. Freski zdobiące salę ukazują życie legendarnego Parsifala. Jest to największa z komnat w całym zamku. Król nie wpuszczał do zamku całego dworu jedynie nieliczni wybrańcy mogli podziwiać bizantyjski przepych rezydencji.Astronomiczna suma pieniędzy przeznaczona na budowę zamku oraz dziwne zwyczaje króla na tyle bulwersowały rząd, że postanowił on obalić niewygodnego władcę. 9 czerwca 1886 rząd dojrzał do decyzji o pozbyciu się króla udowadniając mu chorobę psychiczną. Ludwik przebywał w swej sypialni w Neuschwanstein, kiedy do komnaty weszła straż i komisja lekarzy oraz psychologów. Pojmali władcę i kazali podpisać akt abdykacji. W trzy dni po całym zdarzeniu ciało Ludwika II znaleziono w jeziorze Starnberg (wtedy noszącym jeszcze nazwę Wurmsee) niedaleko zamku Berg, w którym go umieszczono.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] Initiates a Golden Age and gives all cities on the continent +1 Happiness.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Château du Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] démarre un Age d'Or et accorde +1 de Bonheur à toutes les Villes du continent.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] Beginnt ein Goldenes Zeitalter und gibt allen Städten auf dem Kontinent +1 Zufriedenheit.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] Initiates a Golden Age and gives all cities on the continent +1 Happiness..
TEXT.Spanish: El Palacio de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] iniciará una Edad de Oro y dará +1 felicidad a todas las ciudades situadas en el mismo continente.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Neuschwanstein[COLOR_REVERT] Rozpoczyna złoty wiek i daje Ci +1 do zadowolenia we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: Isaac Newton's College
TEXT.French: Le Collège d'Isaac Newton
TEXT.Italian: College di Isaac Newton

TEXT.English: Sir Isaac Newton, a mathematician and physicist, is considered to be one of the greatest scientists of all time. He is credited with many important discoveries including the laws of gravity, the color spectrum of light, calculus, fluid dynamics, and an understanding of ocean tides. He also built the world's first reflecting telescope. For 32 years, he held the position of Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at Cambridge University, an important teaching post, where he continued his own research while instructing a generation of students.
TEXT.French: Sir Isaac Newton, a mathematician and physicist, is considered to be one of the greatest scientists of all time. He is credited with many important discoveries including the laws of gravity, the color spectrum of light, calculus, fluid dynamics, and an understanding of ocean tides. He also built the world's first reflecting telescope. For 32 years, he held the position of Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at Cambridge University, an important teaching post, where he continued his own research while instructing a generation of students.
TEXT.Polish: Jako pierwszy wykazał, że te same prawa rządzą ruchem ciał na Ziemi jak i ruchem ciał niebieskich. Jego dociekania doprowadziły do rewolucji naukowej i przyjęcia teorii heliocentryzmu. Podał matematyczne uzasadnienie dla praw Keplera i rozszerzył je udowadniając, że orbity (w większości komety) są nie tylko eliptyczne, ale mogą być też hiperboliczne i paraboliczne. Głosił, że światło ma naturę korpuskularną, czyli że składa się z cząstek. Był pierwszym, który zdał sobie sprawę, że widmo barw obserwowane podczas padania białego światła na pryzmat jest cechą padającego światła, a nie pryzmatu, jak głosił 400 lat wcześniej Roger Bacon.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Newton's University[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large science boost in the city where it is built. Can not be built in same city as Copernicus Observatory or Leonardo's Workshop.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Newton's une Université[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large science boost in the city where it is built. Can not be built in same city as Copernicus un Observatoire or un Atelier de Léonard de Vinci.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colegio de Isaac Newton[COLOR_REVERT] da un buen impulso a la investigación en la ciudad donde se construya. No se puede construir en la misma ciudad que el Observatorio de Copérnico o el Taller de Leonardo.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Enemy Units will not be able to invade the city until the defenses have fallen to %d1%
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Les unités ennemies ne pourront pas envahir la ville tant que les défenses seront supérieures à %d1%

TEXT.English: Nok Sculpture Workshop
TEXT.French: L'Atelier de Sculpture de Nok

TEXT.English: The Nok culture appeared in Nigeria around 1000 BC and vanished under unknown circumstances around 300 AD in the region of West Africa. This region lies in Northern and Central Nigeria. Its social system is thought to have been highly advanced. The Nok culture was considered to be the earliest sub-Saharan producer of life-sized Terracotta. It has been suggested that theNok culture eventually evolved into the later Yoruba Culture of Ife based on similarities seen in the artwork from these two cultures. The refinement of this culture is attested to by the image of a Nok dignitary at theMinneapolis Institute of Arts. The dignitary is portrayed wearing a "shepherds crook".The dignitary is also portrayed sitting with flared nostrils, and an open mouth suggesting performance. Other images show figures on horseback, indicating Nok culture had tamed the horse. Iron use, in smelting and forging for tools, appears in Nok culture in Africa at least by550 BC and possibly earlier. Christopher Ehret has suggested that iron smelting was independently discovered in the region prior to 1000 BC.
TEXT.French: The Nok culture appeared in Nigeria around 1000 BC and vanished under unknown circumstances around 300 AD in the region of West Africa. This region lies in Northern and Central Nigeria. Its social system is thought to have been highly advanced. The Nok culture was considered to be the earliest sub-Saharan producer of life-sized Terracotta. It has been suggested that theNok culture eventually evolved into the later Yoruba Culture of Ife based on similarities seen in the artwork from these two cultures. The refinement of this culture is attested to by the image of a Nok dignitary at theMinneapolis Institute of Arts. The dignitary is portrayed wearing a "shepherds crook".The dignitary is also portrayed sitting with flared nostrils, and an open mouth suggesting performance. Other images show figures on horseback, indicating Nok culture had tamed the horse. Iron use, in smelting and forging for tools, appears in Nok culture in Africa at least by550 BC and possibly earlier. Christopher Ehret has suggested that iron smelting was independently discovered in the region prior to 1000 BC.
TEXT.Polish: Nok, kultura Nok - kultura ludu zamieszkującego niegdyś tereny na południe od Sahary, między rzekami Niger i Benue (tereny dzisiejszej środkowej Nigerii). Lud ten prowadził osiadły tryb życia oraz zajmował się rolnictwem i hodowlą bydła. Istnienie kultury Nok datuje się na okres od około 500 roku p.n.e. do około 200 roku n.e.. Pozostałe po niej ślady są najstarszymi rozpoznawalnymi dowodami istnienia zorganizowanego społeczeństwa na tym terenie Afryki.

TEXT.English: Nonsuch Palace
TEXT.French: Le Palais Nonsuch

TEXT.English: Nonsuch Palace was a Tudor royal palace, built by Henry VIII in Surrey, England; it stood from 1538 to 1682-3. Its ruins are in Nonsuch Park.
TEXT.French: Le Palais Nonsuch was a Tudor royal palace, built by Henry VIII in Surrey, England; it stood from 1538 to 1682-3. Its ruins are in Nonsuch un Parc.
TEXT.Polish: Pałac Nonsuch - wiejska rezydencja angielskiej rodziny królewskiej istniejąca w XVI i XVII wieku. Pałac znajdował się niedaleko dzisiejszego miasteczka Epsom w hrabstwie Surrey. Aby zrobić miejsce pod jego budowę, z ziemią została zrównana istniejąca wcześniej w tym miejscu wioska Cuddington.

TEXT.English: Noria
A noria is a machine for lifting water into a small aqueduct, either for the purpose of irrigation or, in at least one known instance, to feed seawater into a saltern.
TEXT.French: A noria is a machine for lifting water into a small aqueduct, either for the purpose of irrigation or, in at least one known instance, to feed seawater into a saltern.
TEXT.Polish: Noria - urządzenie służące do podnoszenia wód w celu irygowania pól uprawnych. Wyróżnia się trzy typy norii; najbardziej rozpowszechniony składa się z pionowego koła z podwieszonymi łańcuchem wiadrami. Wiadra sięgają do studni nawet na głębokość 8 metrów. Prymitywne modele norii były napędzane przez muły, osły lub woły. W takim układzie zwierzę chodzi dookoła koła napędowego, które wytwarza siłę przemieszczającą wiadra.

TEXT.English: Build a Noria to increase your cities food.

TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Noria by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Nuclear Laboratory
TEXT.Italian: Laboratorio Nucleare

TEXT.English: Nuclear laboratories are facilities in which nuclear physics are studied.
TEXT.French: Nuclear laboratories are facilities in which nuclear physics are studied.
TEXT.German: Kernforschungszentren sind hochmoderne, wissenschaftliche Anlagen, in denen Forschung auf dem Gebiet der Kernphysik betrieben wird, einem Teilbereich der Physik, der sich mit dem Aufbau und dem Verhalten von Atomkernen beschäftigt. Die auf der Kernspaltung beruhenden Technologien sowohl für militärische (Kernwaffen) als auch zivile Zwecke (Kernkraftwerke) wurden aus entsprechenden Kernforschungsergebnissen entwickelt.
TEXT.Italian: I laboratori nucleari sono impianti in cui viene studiata la fisica nucleare.
TEXT.Polish: Laboratoria nuklearne są obiektami w których studiuje się fizyke nuklearną.

TEXT.English: Build a nuclear lab in your city to build a nuclear powerplant or a nuclear silo. It also allows the construction of most nuclear weapons.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire Nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] pour pouvoir y construire ensuitre une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrale Nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] ou un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Silo Nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT]. Permet la fabrication des armes nucléaires.
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kernforschungszentrum[COLOR_REVERT] wird für den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kernkraftwerken[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atomraketensilos[COLOR_REVERT] benötigt. Es ist außerdem eine Grundvoraussetzung für den Bau der meisten Atomwaffen.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un laboratorio nucleare nella tua città per costruir una centrale o un silo nucleare. Permette anche la costruzione di molte armi nucleari.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un laboratorio nuclear en tu ciudad para poder construir una central o un silo nuclear. También permite la creación de la mayoría de armas nucleares.
TEXT.Polish: Buduj Laboratoria nuklearne w swoich miastach by budować elektrownie jądrowe lub silosy. Umożliwia budowe większości broni nuklearnych.

TEXT.English: A missile silo is an underground, vertical cylindrical container for the storage and launching of intercontinental ballistic missiles. They typically have the missile some distance under the surface, protected by a large "blast door" on top. -Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A missile silo is an underground, vertical cylindrical container for the storage and launching of intercontinental ballistic missiles. They typically have the missile some distance under the surface, protected by a large "blast door" on top. -Wikipédia
TEXT.German: Ein Atomraketensilo ist eine unterirdische Abschussvorrichtung für militärische, insbesondere nukleare Interkontinentalraketen. Neben der Möglichkeit einer schnellen Abfeuerung der Raketen ist der wichtigste Zweck eines solchen Silos der Schutz der Raketen vor gegnerischen Angriffen. Selbst nach Einwirkung feindlicher Atomwaffen in der Nähe des Silos soll ein Rückschlag jederzeit möglich sein.
TEXT.Italian: Un silo missilistico è un contenitore verticale, cilindrico e sotterraneo per l'immagazzinamento e il lancio di missiili balistici intercontinentali. I missili sono solitamente a una certa distanza dalla superficie, protetti da grandi paratie. -Wikipedia
TEXT.Polish: Silosy rakietowe znajdują się pod ziemią, pionowy cylindryczny pojemnik do przechowywania i odpalania międzykontynentalnych rakiet balistycznych. Typowo trzymany pod ziemią, dla ochrony przed samowybuchem

TEXT.English: Nuclear Silo allows the construction of intercontinental nuclear missiles.

TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atomraketensilo[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau von nuklearen Interkontinentalraketen.
TEXT.Italian: Un silo nucleare permette la costruzione di missili nucleari intercontinentli.
TEXT.Spanish: El silo nuclear permite la creación de misiles balísticos intercontinentales.
TEXT.Polish: Wybagany do budowy międzykontynentalnych rakiet balistycznych.
