TEXT.Spanish: El Tren rápido personal aumenta la salud y la felicidad de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Petra
TEXT.French: Petra

TEXT.English: Petra is an archaeological site in southwestern Jordan, lying on the slope of Mount Hor in a basin among the mountains which form the eastern flank of Arabah (Wadi Araba), the large valley running from the Dead Sea to the Gulf of Aqaba. It is renowned for its rock-cut architecture. [PARAGRAPH:1]The site remained unknown to the Western world until 1812, when it was discovered by Swiss explorer Johann Ludwig Burckhardt. It was famously described as "a rose-red city half as old as time" in a Newdigate prize-winning sonnet by John William Burgon. UNESCO has described it as "one of the most precious cultural properties of man's cultural heritage." In 1985, Petra was designated a World Heritage Site. It is one of the "New Seven Wonders of the World" as determined by the New Open World Corporation (not affiliated with UNESCO).
TEXT.French: Petra is an archaeological site in southwestern Jordan, lying on the slope of Mount Hor in a basin among the mountains which form the eastern flank of Arabah (Wadi Araba), the large valley running from the Dead Sea to the Gulf of Aqaba. It is renowned for its rock-cut architecture. [PARAGRAPH:1]The site remained unknown to the Western world until 1812, when it was discovered by Swiss explorer Johann Ludwig Burckhardt. It was famously described as "a rose-red city half as old as time" in a Newdigate prize-winning sonnet by John William Burgon. UNESCO has described it as "one of the most precious cultural properties of man's cultural heritage." In 1985, Petra was designated a World Heritage Site. It is one of the "New Seven Wonders of the World" as determined by the New Open World Corporation (not affiliated with UNESCO).
TEXT.Polish: Petra to obecnie ruiny miasta Nabatejczyków, znajdujące się w południowo-zachodniej Jordanii. Położona jest w skalnej dolinie, do której prowadzi jedna wąska droga wśród skał - wąwóz As-Sik. Petra słynie z licznych budowli wykutych w skałach. W czasach antycznych, w okresie od III w. p.n.e. do I w. n.e., miasto przeżywało czasy swojej świetności, będąc stolicą królestwa Nabatejczyków. Sami Nabatejczycy zwali Petrę Rqm (Rakmu), co oznacza "wielobarwna".

TEXT.English: Petra grants +1 free trade route in all cities and 1 free priest in the city where it's built.
TEXT.French: Petra grants +1 free trade route in all cities and 1 free priest in the city where it's built.
TEXT.Spanish: Petra otorga +1 ruta comercial gratis a todas las ciudades, y 1 Sacerdote gratis en la ciudad donde se construya.

TEXT.English: Factory (Pharmaceuticals)

A pharmaceutical drug, also referred to as a medicine or medication, can be loosely defined as any chemical substance - or product comprising such - intended for use in the medical diagnosis, cure, treatment, or prevention of disease. The word pharmaceutical comes from the Greek word Pharmakeia. The modern transliteration of Pharmakeia is Pharmacia.
TEXT.French: A pharmaceutical drug, also referred to as a medicine or medication, can be loosely defined as any chemical substance - or product comprising such - intended for use in the medical diagnosis, cure, treatment, or prevention of disease. The word pharmaceutical comes from the Greek word Pharmakeia. The modern transliteration of Pharmakeia is Pharmacia.
TEXT.Polish: Lek - każda substancja, niezależnie od pochodzenia (naturalnego lub syntetycznego), nadająca się do bezpośredniego wprowadzania do organizmu w odpowiedniej postaci farmaceutycznej w celu osiągnięcia pożądanego efektu terapeutycznego, lub w celu zapobiegania chorobie, często podawana w ściśle określonej dawce. Lekiem jest substancja modyfikująca procesy fizjologiczne w taki sposób, że hamuje przyczyny lub objawy choroby, lub zapobiega jej rozwojowi. Określenie lek stosuje się też w stosunku do substancji stosowanych w celach diagnostycznych (np. metoklopramid w diagnostyce hiperprolaktynemii) oraz środków modyfikujących nie zmienione chorobowo funkcje organizmu (np. środki antykoncepcyjne).

TEXT.English: Build a Pharmaceutical Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de produits Pharmaceutiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Pharmaceutical Fabrik um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Pharmaceutical Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Pharmacy
TEXT.Italian: Farmacia

TEXT.English: A pharmacy (commonly the chemist in Australia, New Zealand and the UK; or drugstore in North America; retail pharmacy in industry terminology; or Apothecary, historically) is the place where most pharmacists practice the profession of pharmacy. It is the community pharmacy where the dichotomy of the profession exists-health professionals who are also retailers. [PARAGRAPH:2]Community pharmacies usually consist of a retail storefront with a dispensary where medications are stored and dispensed. The dispensary is subject to pharmacy legislation; with requirements for storage conditions, compulsory texts, equipment, etc., specified in legislation. Where it was once the case that pharmacists stayed within the dispensary compounding/dispensing medications; there has been an increasing trend towards the use of trained pharmacy technicians while the pharmacist spends more time communicating with patients.[PARAGRAPH:2]All pharmacies are required to have a pharmacist on-duty at all times when open. In many jurisdictions, it is also a requirement that the owner of a pharmacy must be a registered pharmacist (R. Ph.). This latter requirement has been revoked in many jurisdictions, such that many retailers (including supermarkets and mass merchandisers) now include a pharmacy as a department of their store.[PARAGRAPH:2]Likewise, many pharmacies are now rather grocery store-like in their design. In addition to medicines and prescriptions, many now sell a diverse arrangement of additional household items such as cosmetics, shampoo, office supplies, confectionery, and snack foods.
TEXT.French: A pharmacy (commonly the chemist in Australia, New Zealand and the UK; or drugstore in North America; retail pharmacy in industry terminology; or Apothecary, historically) is the place where most pharmacists practice the profession of pharmacy. It is the community pharmacy where the dichotomy of the profession exists-health professionals who are also retailers. [PARAGRAPH:2]Community pharmacies usually consist of a retail storefront with a dispensary where medications are stored and dispensed. The dispensary is subject to pharmacy legislation; with requirements for storage conditions, compulsory texts, equipment, etc., specified in legislation. Where it was once the case that pharmacists stayed within the dispensary compounding/dispensing medications; there has been an increasing trend towards the use of trained pharmacy technicians while the pharmacist spends more time communicating with patients.[PARAGRAPH:2]All pharmacies are required to have a pharmacist on-duty at all times when open. In many jurisdictions, it is also a requirement that the owner of a pharmacy must be a registered pharmacist (R. Ph.). This latter requirement has been revoked in many jurisdictions, such that many retailers (including supermarkets and mass merchandisers) now include a pharmacy as a department of their store.[PARAGRAPH:2]Likewise, many pharmacies are now rather grocery store-like in their design. In addition to medicines and prescriptions, many now sell a diverse arrangement of additional household items such as cosmetics, shampoo, office supplies, confectionery, and snack foods.
TEXT.Polish: Apteka - placówka, zajmująca się głównie sprzedażą leków i innych produktów medycznych (np. opatrunków, środków higienicznych). Apteki recepturowe zajmują się także przygotowywaniem leków recepturowych zgodnie z przepisaną przez lekarza receptą. W praktyce pacjenci korzystają w aptekach także z konsultacji medycznych w sprawie stosowania poszczególnych leków w przypadku konkretnych dolegliwości, a nawet, w nagłych przypadkach, z najbardziej podstawowej pomocy medycznej, polegającej na udzieleniu pierwszej pomocy i wezwaniu innego wykwalifikowanego personelu (lekarza, felczera, zespołu pogotowia ratunkowego itp.).

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Phenotype Studio

A phenotype is the composite of an organism's observable characteristics or traits, such as its morphology, development, biochemical or physiological properties, phenology, behavior, and products of behavior (such as a bird's nest). Phenotypes result from the expression of an organism's genes as well as the influence of environmental factors and the interactions between the two. When two or more clearly different phenotypes exist in the same population of a species, it is called polymorph. A Phenotype Studio can select the gender of a baby, design basic designer babies, and create blueprints that can alter the genome in a limited manner.
TEXT.French: A phenotype is the composite of an organism's observable characteristics or traits, such as its morphology, development, biochemical or physiological properties, phenology, behavior, and products of behavior (such as a bird's nest). Phenotypes result from the expression of an organism's genes as well as the influence of environmental factors and the interactions between the two. When two or more clearly different phenotypes exist in the same population of a species, it is called polymorph. A Phenotype Studio can select the gender of a baby, design basic designer babies, and create blueprints that can alter the genome in a limited manner.
TEXT.Polish: Fenotyp (gr. phainomai - przejawiać; typos - wzór, norma) - zespół cech organizmu, włączając w to nie tylkomorfologię, lecz również np. właściwości fizjologiczne, płodność, zachowanie się, ekologię, cykl życiowy, zmiany biologiczne, wpływ środowiska na organizm. Fenotyp jest ściśle związany z genotypem, bowiem to właśnie oddziaływanie między genotypem a środowiskiem daje fenotyp. Dlatego ten sam genotyp może dać różne fenotypy w różnych środowiskach (tzw. plastyczność fenotypowa), lub odwrotnie - mimo odmiennych genotypów uzyskać podobny fenotyp.

TEXT.English: Build a Phenotype Studio to increase your cities health.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Studio de Phénotype[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Phenotype Studio by poprawić jakość zdrowia Twoich poddanych w miastach.

TEXT.English: Factory (Skis)
TEXT.French: Factory (Skis)

TEXT.English: A ski is a narrow strip of semi-rigid material worn underfoot to glide over snow. Substantially longer than wide and characteristically employed in pairs, skis are attached to ski boots with ski bindings, with either a free, lockable, or partially secured heel. For climbing slopes, ski skins (originally made of seal fur, but now made of synthetic materials) can be attached at the base of the ski.[NEWLINE]Originally intended as an aid to travel over snow, they are now mainly used recreationally in the sport of skiing.
TEXT.French: A ski is a narrow strip of semi-rigid material worn underfoot to glide over snow. Substantially longer than wide and characteristically employed in pairs, skis are attached to ski boots with ski bindings, with either a free, lockable, or partially secured heel. For climbing slopes, ski skins (originally made of seal fur, but now made of synthetic materials) can be attached at the base of the ski.[NEWLINE]Originally intended as an aid to travel over snow, they are now mainly used recreationally in the sport of skiing.

TEXT.English: Build a Skis Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Build a Skis Factory to increase your cities gold.

TEXT.English: Factory (Phonographs)

The phonograph, record player, or gramophone is a device introduced in 1877 for the recording and reproduction of sound recordings. The recordings played on such a device consist of waveforms that are engraved onto a rotating cylinder or disc. As the cylinder or disc rotates, a stylus or needle traces the waveforms and vibrates to reproduce the recorded sound waves.
TEXT.French: The phonograph, record player, or gramophone is a device introduced in 1877 for the recording and reproduction of sound recordings. The recordings played on such a device consist of waveforms that are engraved onto a rotating cylinder or disc. As the cylinder or disc rotates, a stylus or needle traces the waveforms and vibrates to reproduce the recorded sound waves.
TEXT.Polish: Fonograf - jedno z pierwszych urządzeń służących do zapisu i odtwarzania dźwięku, poprzednik gramofonu. Został skonstruowany przez Thomasa Alva Edisona. Edison swój wynalazek zademonstrował 29 listopada 1877 r., a opatentował19 lutego 1878 r.

TEXT.English: Build a Phonograph Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de phonographes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Phonograph Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Photography Studio
TEXT.French: Studio de Photos
TEXT.Italian: Studio di fotografia

TEXT.English: Portrait photography was a popular use for cameras almost as soon as they were developed. The rising middle class during the Industrial Revolution wanted portraits, and painters could not meet the demand. Early cameras were bulky and needed long exposure times, as well as needing specialized chemical processes for developing the photographs. The artist's studio evolved into the photographic studio to meet these needs.
TEXT.French: Studio de Photos
TEXT.Italian: La fotografia ritrattistica era molto popolare quando la fotografia venne inventata. Le classi medie in ascesa durante la Rivoluzione Industriale volevano ritratti, e i pittori non erano in grado di soddisfare tutta questa domanda. Le prime camere erano complesse e richiedevano lunghi tempi di esposizione, oltre a speciali processi chimici per lo sviluppo delle fotografia. Lo studio dell'artista diventò uno studio fotografico per andare incontro a questi bisogni.
TEXT.Polish: Fotografia - zbiór wielu różnych technik, których celem jest zarejestrowanie trwałego, pojedynczego obrazu za pomocąświatła. Potoczne znaczenie zakłada wykorzystanie układu optycznego, choć nie jest to konieczne np. przy rayografii.

TEXT.English: Build Photography Studio for a bonus to gold, culture, and happiness and an Artist specialist slot.
TEXT.French: Build Photography Studio for a bonus to gold, culture, and happiness and an Artist specialist slot.
TEXT.Italian: Fornisce un bonus a oro, cultura e felicità; inoltre, può trasformare un cittadino in uno specialista Artista.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye el Estudio de fotografía para obtener oro, cultura, felicidad y la posibilidad de convertir a un ciudadano en Artista.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Photography Studio for a bonus to gold, culture, and happiness and an Artist specialist slot.

TEXT.English: Photosynthesis Boutique
Fashion created with "artificially photosynthesizied" fabrics that can collect solar energy to power the cybernetics of its wearer, and have an asymmetrical "alien botany" designs.
TEXT.French: Fashion created with "artificially photosynthesizied" fabrics that can collect solar energy to power the cybernetics of its wearer, and have an asymmetrical "alien botany" designs.

TEXT.English: Build a Photosynthesis Boutique to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boutique de luminaires à photosynthèse[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Photosynthesis Boutique by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Piercer

Body piercing, a form of body modification, is the practice of puncturing or cutting a part of the human body, creating an opening in which jewelry may be worn. The word piercing can refer to the act or practice of body piercing, or to an opening in the body created by this act or practice. Although the history of body piercing is obscured by popular misinformation and by a lack of scholarly reference, ample evidence exists to document that it has been practiced in various forms by both sexes since ancient times throughout the world.
TEXT.French: Body piercing, a form of body modification, is the practice of puncturing or cutting a part of the human body, creating an opening in which jewelry may be worn. The word piercing can refer to the act or practice of body piercing, or to an opening in the body created by this act or practice. Although the history of body piercing is obscured by popular misinformation and by a lack of scholarly reference, ample evidence exists to document that it has been practiced in various forms by both sexes since ancient times throughout the world.
TEXT.Polish: Kolczyk - niewielki, ozdobny przedmiot, część biżuterii noszona w uchu (najczęściej) oraz innych miejscach ciała. Zwykle stworzony z tytanu, stali chirurgicznej, srebra, złota, PTFE lub z bioplastu; spotyka się także artystycznie robione kolczyki kościane lub drewniane. Popularne są również kolczyki zrobione z rogu bawoła azjatyckiego - Bubalus bubalis - są odpowiednikiem ludzkich paznokci czy też włosów, zawierają keratynę, przez co ciało ludzkie je akceptuje i nie wytwarza nieprzyjemnego zapachu.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piercer's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and provides [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] at the cost of raising [COLOR_RED]Unhealthiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cabane de Piercing[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Piercing Hütte um die Kultur in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Piercing Hut by zwiększyć kulturę w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Piercing Shop

Body piercing, a form of body modification, is the practice of puncturing or cutting a part of the human body, creating an opening in which jewelry may be worn. The word piercing can refer to the act or practice of body piercing, or to an opening in the body created by this act or practice. Although the history of body piercing is obscured by popular misinformation and by a lack of scholarly reference, ample evidence exists to document that it has been practiced in various forms by both sexes since ancient times throughout the world.
TEXT.French: Body piercing, a form of body modification, is the practice of puncturing or cutting a part of the human body, creating an opening in which jewelry may be worn. The word piercing can refer to the act or practice of body piercing, or to an opening in the body created by this act or practice. Although the history of body piercing is obscured by popular misinformation and by a lack of scholarly reference, ample evidence exists to document that it has been practiced in various forms by both sexes since ancient times throughout the world.
TEXT.Polish: Kolczyk - niewielki, ozdobny przedmiot, część biżuterii noszona w uchu (najczęściej) oraz innych miejscach ciała. Zwykle stworzony z tytanu, stali chirurgicznej, srebra, złota, PTFE lub z bioplastu; spotyka się także artystycznie robione kolczyki kościane lub drewniane. Popularne są również kolczyki zrobione z rogu bawoła azjatyckiego - Bubalus bubalis - są odpowiednikiem ludzkich paznokci czy też włosów, zawierają keratynę, przez co ciało ludzkie je akceptuje i nie wytwarza nieprzyjemnego zapachu.

TEXT.English: Build a Piercing Shop to increase your cities culture.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Echoppe de Piercing[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue einen Piercing Shop um die Kultur in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Piercing Shop by zwiększyć kulturę w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Pillbug Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Cloportes

TEXT.English: Also known as sowbugs, roly-polies, woodlice, these are actually terrestrial crustaceans, closely related to lobsters, crab and shrimp. When boiled, they are said to turn red.
TEXT.French: Also known as sowbugs, roly-polies, woodlice, these are actually terrestrial crustaceans, closely related to lobsters, crab and shrimp. When boiled, they are said to turn red.
TEXT.Polish: Oniscus - rodzaj lądowych skorupiaków z rzędu równonogów, w języku polskim określanych nazwą stonoga. Określenie to jest często mylnie przypisywane wijom lub prosionkom. Występują na wszystkichkontynentach. W Polsce występuje stonoga murowa - jest gatunkiem pospolitym.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Shrimp[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pillbug Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Crevettes[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Cloportes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ping Pong Arena

Table tennis, also known as ping pong, is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth using table tennis rackets. The game takes place on a hard table divided by a net. Except for the initial serve, players must allow a ball played toward them only one bounce on their side of the table and must return it so that it bounces on the opposite side. Points are scored when a player fails to return the ball within the rules. Play is fast and demands quick reactions. Spinning the ball alters its trajectory and limits an opponent's options, giving the hitter a great advantage. When doing so the hitter has a good chance of scoring if the spin is successful.
TEXT.French: Table tennis, also known as ping pong, is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth using table tennis rackets. The game takes place on a hard table divided by a net. Except for the initial serve, players must allow a ball played toward them only one bounce on their side of the table and must return it so that it bounces on the opposite side. Points are scored when a player fails to return the ball within the rules. Play is fast and demands quick reactions. Spinning the ball alters its trajectory and limits an opponent's options, giving the hitter a great advantage. When doing so the hitter has a good chance of scoring if the spin is successful.
TEXT.Polish: Tenis stołowy (znany jako ping-pong) - gra, w której uczestniczą 2 (gra pojedyncza - singel) lub 4 osoby (gra podwójna - debel, mikst), polegająca na odbijaniu piłeczki rakietką tak, by przeleciała nad siatką na drugą połowę stołu. Piłeczka musi uderzyć o stół tylko raz, niedozwolone jest odbijanie piłeczki z powietrza, tak jak to ma miejsce w tenisie. Punkty przyznawane są za uderzenia, których przeciwnik nie odebrał. Tenis stołowy jest jedną z najpopularniejszych gier na świecie, biorąc pod uwagę liczbę zawodników uprawiających ten sport.

TEXT.English: Build a Ping Pong Arena to increase your cities health and happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arêne de Ping Pong[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé et le bonheur de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Ping Pong Arena to increase your cities health and happiness.

TEXT.English: Leaning Tower of Pisa
TEXT.French: La Tour de Pise
TEXT.Italian: Torre pendente di Pisa

TEXT.English: Although intended to stand vertically, the tower began leaning to the southeast soon after the onset of construction in 1173 due sandy soil. In 1272, construction resumed under Giovanni di Simone, architect of the Camposanto. In an effort to compensate for the tilt, the engineers built higher floors with one side taller than the other. This made the tower begin to lean in the other direction. Because of this, the tower is actually curved.
TEXT.French: Bien que prévu à l'origine pour etre verticale, la Tour a commencé à pencher vers le sud-est après sa construction en 1173. Construite sur une plaine alluviale, elle a donc commencé à s'incliner très vite, soit en raison d'un défaut de fondation, soit à la suite d'un affaissement de terrain dû à une roche: la marne. À partir de 1272, les quatre étages supérieurs furent donc posés en diagonale pour compenser l'inclinaison. La construction s'interrompit alors à nouveau de 1301 à 1350 et ce n'est qu'en 1372 que le dernier étage des cloches, de diamètre moins important, fut achevé.
TEXT.Italian: Anche se ideata per stare in verticale, la torre iniziò a pendere nel 1173 all'inizio della costruzione a causa del suolo sabbioso. Nel 1272 la costruzione ricominciò sotto la guida di Giovanni di Simone, architetto del Camposanto. In un tentativo di compensare la pendenza, gli ingegneri costruirono fondamenta più alte da una parte rispetto all'altra; tuttavia, la torre cominciò a inclinarsi nell'altra direzione. A causa di questo, la torre è attualmetne inclinata.
TEXT.Polish: Krzywa Wieża w Pizie (Torre pendente di Pisa) - jedna z najbardziej znanych budowli świata, odwiedzana rocznie przez ok. 10 milionów turystów; symbol miasta Pizy. W istocie jest dzwonnicą (kampanilą) katedralną i należy do kompleksu zabudowań w stylu romańskim na Campo dei Miracoli. Wkrótce po rozpoczęciu budowy w 1174 wieża zaczęła odchylać się od pionu, co próbowano korygować w czasie budowy (np. wydłużając kolumny po jednej stronie wieży). Mimo niebezpieczeństwa, jeszcze w 1350 dodano ostatnie piętro, w którym umieszczono dzwony. W XIX wieku zaczęto podejmować pierwsze próby powstrzymania przechylania się wieży, co przyniosło jednak przeciwny skutek.Wieża jest zbudowana z białego marmuru, liczy osiem kondygnacji. Jej masę ocenia się na 14 tysięcy ton.W 1990 wieżę zamknięto dla zwiedzających i powołano specjalny komitet, który miał wybrać najlepszy sposób zabezpieczenia przed dalszym odchylaniem się wieży. Od 2001 wieża jest ponownie otwarta dla turystów.Obecnie wieża ma wysokość około 55 m, odchyliła się zaś od pionu o około 5 m (średnio o 1 mm rocznie). Od 1911 pomiary te są co roku aktualizowane.Dzięki odchyleniu wieży od pionu, Galileusz mógł wykorzystać ją w roku 1600 do zademonstrowania niezależności czasu spadania ciał od ich masy (zob. eksperyment Galileusza ze spadkiem swobodnym ciał).

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Leaning Tower of Pisa[COLOR_REVERT] Increases Great Person and Culture rates in all cities.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tour penchée de Pise[COLOR_REVERT] Augmente la génération des Personnages Illustres et le taux de Culture de toutes les Villes.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Schiefer Turm von Pisa[COLOR_REVERT] Beschleunigt die Bildung von Großen Personen und erhöht den Kulturwert in allen Städten.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Torre pendente di Pisa[COLOR_REVERT] incrementa i tassi della cultura e della nscita dei Grandi personaggi in tutte le città.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Torre inclinada de Pisa[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la tasa de aparición de Grandes personajes y la cultura en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Krzywa Wieża[COLOR_REVERT] Zwiększa ilość narodzin WL oraz kulturę we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: A plague hospital is an old institution where victims of various contagions are quarantined. The Abbassids realized that disease spread from person to person, and wrote the first accurate descriptions of measles and smallpox. To respond to this, they built clean hospitals to treat victims of disease. Lazzaretti in Italy where used to quarantine sailors to stop the spread of the Bubonic Plague; eventually, any plague victims where placed there. Lazzaretti were also used as a model for quarantining syphilitics after it spread to Italy in 1494.
TEXT.French: A plague hospital is an old institution where victims of various contagions are quarantined. The Abbassids realized that disease spread from person to person, and wrote the first accurate descriptions of measles and smallpox. To respond to this, they built clean hospitals to treat victims of disease. Lazzaretti in Italy where used to quarantine sailors to stop the spread of the Bubonic Plague; eventually, any plague victims where placed there. Lazzaretti were also used as a model for quarantining syphilitics after it spread to Italy in 1494.

TEXT.English: Increases Health, greatly increases Health with resources. This building requires Charity civic.
TEXT.French: Augmente la santé, en particulier celle provenant des Ressources. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charité[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la salud, permite aumentar esta bonificación mediante recursos. Este edificio requiere el principio Caridad.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa zdrowie, dodatkowo zwiększa go jeszcze dzięki surowcom. Wymaga doktryny charytatywność.

TEXT.English: Planning Office
Legions of bureaucrats and party members are required to run a planned economy. Quotas need to be created and monitored, and these offices are in charge of this important task.
TEXT.French: Legions of bureaucrats and party members are required to run a planned economy. Quotas need to be created and monitored, and these offices are in charge of this important task.

TEXT.English: Reduces Maintenance, but also Commerce. Slight Production increase. This building requires Planned civic.
TEXT.French: Réduit l'entretien, mais également le commerce. Légère augmentation de la production. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Planifié[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Reduce el mantenimiento, pero también el comercio. Leve incremento de la producción. Este edificio requiere el principio Planificación.
TEXT.Polish: Zmniejsza utrzymanie ale również handel. Lekki wzrost produkcji. Wymaga doktryny E.Planowana

TEXT.English: Factory (Plasma Generators)

Plasma is one of the four fundamental states of matter (the others being solid, liquid, and gas). It comprises the major component of the Sun. Heating a gas may ionize its molecules or atoms (reducing or increasing the number of electrons in them), thus turning it into a plasma, which contains charged particles: positive ions and negative electrons or ions. Ionization can be induced by other means, such as strong electromagnetic field applied with a laser or microwave generator, and is accompanied by the dissociation of molecular bonds, if present. Plasma can also be created by the application of an electric field on a gas, where the underlying process is the Townsend avalanche.
TEXT.French: Plasma is one of the four fundamental states of matter (the others being solid, liquid, and gas). It comprises the major component of the Sun. Heating a gas may ionize its molecules or atoms (reducing or increasing the number of electrons in them), thus turning it into a plasma, which contains charged particles: positive ions and negative electrons or ions. Ionization can be induced by other means, such as strong electromagnetic field applied with a laser or microwave generator, and is accompanied by the dissociation of molecular bonds, if present. Plasma can also be created by the application of an electric field on a gas, where the underlying process is the Townsend avalanche.
TEXT.Polish: Generator magnetohydrodynamiczny, generator magnetogazodynamiczny - urządzenie do przetwarzaniaenergii cieplnej gazu w energię elektryczną. W urządzeniu zamiana energii cieplnej w energię mechaniczną przebiega bez wprawiania w ruch elementów urządzenia. Zamiana energii następuje poprzez zamianę energii cieplnej na energię kinetyczną plazmy, a ta na energię elektryczną. W celu łatwiejszej jonizacji gazu stosuje się tzw. posiew, czyli wprowadzenie do gazu metali alkalicznych o niskich potencjałach jonizacji, jak cez,rubid, potas, sód, w ilości 0,1-1%.

TEXT.English: Build a Plasma Generator Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de générateurs à plasma[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Plasma Generator Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Plastic Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Do wad tworzyw polimerowych zalicza się bardzo długi czas rozkładu, jeśli człowiek dokonuje zaśmiecania nimiśrodowiska naturalnego, czy też podczas składowania ich na składowiskach odpadów. Tymczasem tworzywa polimerowe stanowią doskonałe materiały wtórne do ponownego przerobu w technologiach recyklingu, gdzie na samym końcu powinny one kończyć "swoje życie" jako materiał opałowy, ze względu na wysoką wartość opałową, często porównywalną do węgla. Pomimo zaawansowanych technologii w spalarniach odpadów, które eliminują emisję szkodliwych związków do środowiska, wciąż obserwuje się wysoki opór społeczny podczas wyboru lokalizacji spalarni odpadów. Spalanie tworzyw polimerowych w gospodarstwach domowych jest zabronione, m.in. ze względu na za niską temperaturę spalania, może powodować to emisję do atmosfery silnie trujących związków.

TEXT.English: Build a Plastic Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de recyclage des plastiques[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à la ressource correspondante.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Plastic Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: Platinum Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Platyna jest metalem wyjątkowo rzadkim. Występuje w skorupie ziemskiej w ilościach ok. 4 ppb, w postaci rodzimej (zob. platyna rodzima), w stopie zirydem (platynoiryd) oraz w postaci rudy i jako zanieczyszczenie rud niklu imiedzi. Platyna występuje w: Stanach Zjednoczonych, Kanadzie, Zimbabwe,Republice Południowej Afryki, Etiopii. Po odkryciu platyny w Kolumbii duże znaczenie miało odkrycie platyny na Uralu(1819). W niedługim czasie platyna rosyjska znalazła się na pierwszym miejscu produkcji światowej, utrzymując się na nim przez cały wiek XIX, aż do odkrycia złóż w Republice Południowej Afryki (wielkie złoża typu magmowego na wyżuBushveld, gdzie zawartość platyny jest wyjątkowo wysoka i dochodzi do 10-30 g na tonę) i Kanadzie (Sudbery wOntario, gdzie platynę wydobywa się ubocznie w złożach niklonośnego pirotynu).

TEXT.English: Build a Platinum Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de recyclage de Platine[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à la ressource correspondante.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Platinum Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: Plato's Academy

The word "academy" is used today to refer to any institution of higher learning, but the name originally referred to the "Akademeia," a school in Athens, created approximately in 385 BC by the philosopher, Plato - having just returned to Athens after traveling across the Mediterranean, Plato founded the school so that he could disseminate his philosophy to a larger group of scholars. Plato's school was located in a grove of sacred olive trees; it was named after a legendary hero called, "Akademos."[PARAGRAPH:1]Plato's Academy was one of the earliest known schools in Western civilization. Among the many intellectuals who studied at the Academy, perhaps the most famous is Aristotle, who would become a legendary philosopher himself - and one of the primary developers of what is called "western thought." Plato's Academy continued to operate for many centuries until it was closed by the Emperor Justinian in 529 AD, who saw it as a pagan institution and a threat to the propagation of Christianity.
TEXT.French: Le terme "académie" peut aujourd'hui être utilisé pour évoquer toute institution d'enseignement supérieur, mais à l'origine, ce mot fait référence à l'Akadémia, une école d'Athènes crée vers 385 av. J.-C. par le célèbre philosophe Platon, juste après son retour d'un voyage à travers la Méditerranée, ayant pour but de répandre sa philosophie au sein d'un groupe élargi de lettrés. L'académie de Platon se trouve dans une oliveraie d'arbres sacrés et son nom évoque celui d'un légendaire héros appelé Akademos.[PARAGRAPH:1] L'académie de Platon est une des premières écoles connues de la civilisation occidentale. Parmi les nombreux intellectuels qui y étudient, le plus célèbre est sans doute Aristote qui devient lui-même un grand philosophe, et une des sources principales de la pensée occidentale. L'académie de Platon continue à fonctionner pendant des siècles avant d'être fermée par l'empereur Justinien en 529 AD, qui la considère comme une institution païenne et un obstacle à la propagation du Christianisme.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff "Akademie" beschreibt heutzutage eine höhere Bildungseinrichtung, ursprünglich war damit jedoch die "Akademeia" in Athen gemeint. Hierbei handelte es sich um eine Schule, die der Philosoph Platon nach seiner Rückkehr von einer Reise durch den Mittelmeerraum im Jahr 385 vor Christus gegründet hatte, um seine Lehren einem größeren Studentenforum nahe bringen zu können. Das Wort "Akademeia" rührte daher, dass sich Platons Schule auf einem geweihten Olivenhain befand, der nach dem legendären griechischen Helden "Akademos" benannt war. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Platonische Akademie war eine der ersten bekannten Schulen in der westlichen Welt. Der vielleicht berühmteste der vielen Intellektuellen, die an dieser Akademie studierten, war Aristoteles, der später selbst ein legendärer Philosoph und einer der stärksten Verfechter des so genannten "westlichen Denkens" werden sollte. Trotz ihres mehr als 900-jährigen Bestehens ordnete Kaiser Justinian I. im Jahr 529 nach Christus die Schließung der Platonischen Akademie an, weil er sie als eine heidnische Institution betrachtete, die eine Bedrohung für die von ihm geplante weitere Christianisierung darstellte.
TEXT.Italian: La parola "accademia" viene oggi utilizzata per indicare un qualsiasi istituto superiore di istruzione, ma originariamente indicava solo la "Akademeia", una scuola ad Atene creata intorno al 385 a.C. dal filosofo Platone, appena tornato in città da un viaggio intorno al Mediterraneo. Platone fondò la scuola per diffondere la sua filosofia tra un numero più ampio di allievi. La scuola di Platone si trovava all'interno di un bosco di ulivi sacri e il suo nome deriva da quello di un famoso eroe, Akademos.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'Accademia di Platone fu una delle prime scuole della civiltà occidentale. Tra i tanti intellettuali che studiarono all'Accademia, forse il più famoso e Aristotele, il quale sarebbe diventato egli stesso un leggendario filosofo e uno dei primi sviluppatori del cosiddetto "pensiero occidentale". L'Accademia di Platone continuò a operare per molti secoli, finché nel 529 d.C. non venne chiusa dall'imperatore Giustiniano, il quale la vedeva come un'istituzione pagana e una minaccia alla diffusione del cristianesimo.
TEXT.Spanish: La palabra "academia" se usa en la actualidad para referirse a cualquier institución de educación superior, pero el nombre originariamente se refería a la "Akademeia", una escuela de Atenas creada aproximadamente en el 385 a. C. por el filósofo Platón. Tras regresar a Atenas después de viajar por todo el Mediterráneo, Platón fundó una escuela en la que pudiera impartir filosofía a un grupo mayor de estudiantes. La escuela se encontraba en un olivar sagrado que recibía su nombre de un héroe legendario llamado "Akademos."[PARAGRAPH:1]La Academia de Platón se encuentra entre las primeras escuelas conocidas de la civilización occidental. Entre los muchos pensadores que estudiaron en la Academia, quizá el más famoso sea Aristóteles, que se convertiría en un legendario filósofo y en uno de los primeros impulsores del llamado "pensamiento occidental". La Academia siguió funcionando durante muchos siglos hasta que el emperador Justiniano la cerró en el 529 d. C., pues la veía como una institución pagana y una amenaza para la propagación del cristianismo.
TEXT.Polish: Akademia była przedmieściem Aten położonym ok. 3 km na północny wschód od Agory, wzdłuż drogi na przedmieście Keramejkos. Wzięła nazwę od ateńskiego herosa Akademosa - poza murami miasta znajdował się poświęconu mu święty gaj. Archaiczna nazwa dzielnicy brzmiała Hekademeia, w czasach klasycznych nazywano ją Akademeia.[PARAGRAPH:1] Platon założył Akademię po pierwszej poróży na Sycylię, ok. 387 p.n.e. Założenie Akademii mogło być inspirowane przez instytucjonalne formy bractwa pitagorejskiego, z którymi Platon zapoznał się w Italii. Na tle filozofii platońskiej założenie Akdademii można interpretować jako[PARAGRAPH:1]Do niedawna sądzono, że Akademia powstała jako stowarzyszenie religijne czcieli Apollina i Muz - hipotezę tę wysnuwał m. in. Ulrich von Wilamowitz-Moellendorf, który sądził, że skoro Akademia była pierwszą uczelnią i prawa ateńskie nie przewidywały możliwości powstania instytucji tego rodzaju, można uznać za zrozumiałe na gruncie umysłowości greckiej, że Platon założył Akademię właśnie jako stowarzyszenie religijne. Obecnie tezę tę uznaje się za domysł i twierdzi, że Platon mógł założyć Akademię jako stowarzyszenie nieformalne.

TEXT.English: Playing Fields
TEXT.Italian: Campi da gioco

TEXT.English: The history of sport is as old as the history of civilization itself. The first sports fields were likely simple cleared fields with room to run and jump.
TEXT.French: L'histoire du sport est aussi vieille que l'histoire de la civilisation elle-même. Les premières pistes de sport étaient de simples champs défrichés avec de l'espace pour courir et sauter.
TEXT.Italian: Lo sport è vecchio come le civiltà. I primi campi da gioco erano semplici spazi aperti dove era possibile correre e saltare.
TEXT.Polish: Boisko - nazwa boisko pochodzi od ludowego określenia płaskiej przestrzeni w środkowej części stodoły położonej między dwoma sąsiekami, miejsca młocki zboża, zwanego także bojewica, bojewisko, klepisko. Dziś boisko to miejsce przeznaczone do ćwiczeń gimnastycznych, gier, rozgrywek i zawodów sportowych.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Playing Fields[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that provides a city with [COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aire de jeu[COLOR_REVERT] procure un léger bonus de bonheur.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci questo edificio per ottenere un piccolo bonus alla felicità.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye los Campos de juego para obtener una pequeña bonificación a la felicidad.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Playing Fields by zwiększyć zadowolenie w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Polar Hotel

Igloo Village in Kakslauttanen, the Ice Hotel in Jukkasjärvi, Sweden, and the Hotel de Glace in Duschenay, Canada, melt every spring and are rebuilt each winter; the Mammut Snow Hotel in Finland is located within the walls of the Kemi snow castle; and the Lainio Snow Hotel is part of a snow village near Ylläs, Finland.
TEXT.French: Igloo Village in Kakslauttanen, the Ice Hotel in Jukkasjärvi, Sweden, and the Hotel de Glace in Duschenay, Canada, melt every spring and are rebuilt each winter; the Mammut Snow Hotel in Finland is located within the walls of the Kemi snow castle; and the Lainio Snow Hotel is part of a snow village near Ylläs, Finland.
TEXT.Polish: Hotel - obiekt wchodzący w skład infrastruktury turystycznej, w którym świadczone są odpłatnie usługi noclegowe (przede wszystkim krótkookresowe).

TEXT.English: Build a Polar Hotel to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hotel Polaire[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Polar Hotel by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Police Drone Control Center
Police Drones can detect crimes and are also so intimidating that their appearance helps to prevent crimes.
TEXT.French: Police Drones can detect crimes and are also so intimidating that their appearance helps to prevent crimes.

TEXT.English: Build a Police Drone Control Center to reduce your cities crime.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de Contrôle de Drones Policiers[COLOR_REVERT] pour réduire la criminalité de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Police Drone Control Center to reduce your cities crime.

TEXT.English: Police Station
TEXT.Italian: Stazione di polizia

TEXT.English: A police station is a building which serves as the headquarters of a police force or unit which serves a specific district. These buildings typically contain offices, various accommodations for their personnel and their vehicles such as locker rooms, temporary holding cells, and interview and interrogation rooms.
TEXT.French: A police station is a building which serves as the headquarters of a police force or unit which serves a specific district. These buildings typically contain offices, various accommodations for their personnel and their vehicles such as locker rooms, temporary holding cells, and interview and interrogation rooms.
TEXT.Polish: Policja - umundurowana i uzbrojona formacja przeznaczona do ochrony bezpieczeństwa ludzi i mienia oraz do utrzymywania bezpieczeństwa i porządku publicznego. Do jej głównych zadań należy pilnowanie przestrzegania prawa i ściganie przestępców, jak również zapewnienie ochrony i pomocy w sytuacjach kryzysowych zarówno wobec ludzi jak i mienia. Jeżeli jest to konieczne, policja nadzoruje na poziomie operacyjnym także wszelkie służby ratownicze.

TEXT.English: Police Station increases city's espionage and helps thwart rival spies. Reduces War Weariness in the city.
TEXT.French: une Station de Police increases city's espionage and helps thwart rival spies. Reduces War Weariness in the city.
TEXT.Spanish: La Comisaría de policía aumenta el espionaje de la ciudad, y auyda a desenmascarar a los espías rivales. Reduce el hastío bélico en la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Polis Council

A polis is a city, a city-state and also citizenship and body of citizens. When used to describe Classical Athens and its contemporaries, polis is often translated as "city-state." The word originates from the ancient Greek city-states, which developed during the Archaic period, the ancestor of city, state and citizenship, and persisted well into Roman times, when the equivalent Latin word was civitas, also meaning 'citizenhood', while municipium applied to a non-sovereign local entity. The term city-state which originated in English does not fully translate the Greek term. The poleis were not like other primordial ancient city-states like Tyre or Sidon, which were ruled by a king or a small oligarchy, but rather a political entity ruled by its body of citizens.
TEXT.French: A polis is a city, a city-state and also citizenship and body of citizens. When used to describe Classical Athens and its contemporaries, polis is often translated as "city-state." The word originates from the ancient Greek city-states, which developed during the Archaic period, the ancestor of city, state and citizenship, and persisted well into Roman times, when the equivalent Latin word was civitas, also meaning 'citizenhood', while municipium applied to a non-sovereign local entity. The term city-state which originated in English does not fully translate the Greek term. The poleis were not like other primordial ancient city-states like Tyre or Sidon, which were ruled by a king or a small oligarchy, but rather a political entity ruled by its body of citizens.
TEXT.Polish: Senat - jedna z najczęściej spotykanych nazw izb wyższych parlamentów.

TEXT.English: Increases Happiness and decreases city Maintenance
TEXT.French: Augmente le bonheur et réduit le coût d'entretien de la ville
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la felicidad y reduce el mantenimiento de la ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa szczęście i obniża utrzymanie mista
