TEXT.English: Reflecting Pool
TEXT.Italian: Specchio d'acqua

TEXT.English: A reflecting pool or reflection pool is a structure often used in memorials. It generally consists of a shallow pool of water, usually quite calm. A design with edges being slightly deeper than the center of the pool is often used to suppress wave formation. It is sometimes designed to inspire solemnity and reflection, though, as any piece of art, the final interpretation is in the mind of the viewer.
TEXT.French: A reflecting pool or reflection pool is a structure often used in memorials. It generally consists of a shallow pool of water, usually quite calm. A design with edges being slightly deeper than the center of the pool is often used to suppress wave formation. It is sometimes designed to inspire solemnity and reflection, though, as any piece of art, the final interpretation is in the mind of the viewer.
TEXT.Italian: Uno specchio d'acqua è una struttura spesso usata nei memoriali. In generale consiste di una bassa piscina d'acqua, di solito abbastanza calma. Un design con gli angoli appena più profondi del centro della vasca viene spesso usato per impedire la formazione di onde. Spesso viene progettata per ispirare solennità e riflessione anche se, come ogni opera d'arte, l'interpretazione finale è nella mente dell'osservatore.
TEXT.Polish: Płytkie, sztuczne jezioro służące do refleksji i medytacji nad jego brzegiem.

TEXT.English: A Reflecting Pool is monument to the success of your civilizations culture.
TEXT.French: Un Mirroir d'eau is monument to the success of your civilizations culture.

TEXT.Spanish: Un Espejo de agua es un monumento al éxito de la cultura de tu civilización.
TEXT.Polish: Jezioro Refleksyjne jest monumentem sukcesu kulturowego Twojej cywilizacji.

TEXT.English: Rice Beetle Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Charançon du riz

TEXT.English: Lemon ants are found in the Amazon jungle and are said to taste like just that: lemons.
TEXT.French: Lemon ants are found in the Amazon jungle and are said to taste like just that: lemons.
TEXT.Polish: Żukokształtne są w większości roślinożerne. Żywią się różnym pokarmem roślinnym: od humusu i rozkładających się szczątków roślin po ich żywe tkanki i soki. Część gatunków jest padlinożerna. Ponadto zdarzają się gatunki drapieżne, jak Spilophorus maculatus polujący na pluskwiaki. W literaturze często błędnie określa się gatunki z rodzajów Trichillum i Uroxys jako ektopasożyty. Błąd ten wynika z występowania tych chrząszczy w futrze leniwców. Gilmore i inni określili ich związek z leniwcami jako komensalizm.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Rice[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rice Beetle Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Riz[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Charançon du riz[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: LL Richardson Island
TEXT.French: L'Ile de Richardson

TEXT.English: Richardson Island is an early Holocene site, located in south-eastern Haida Gwaii, off the west coast of British Columbia. The earliest occupation of the site occurred when sea levels were on the rise, and repeated sediment deposition on this raised beach site resulted in a very well-stratified record of at least 23 separate occupations. The Richardson Island site is located today about 100 meters inland, in a denselyforested area. Radiocarbon dates from the earliest level indicate that the site was first occupied about 9290 ±50 years BP. The artifacts found at that level consist of simple flake tools, biface tools and large unifacially flaked tools. The artifacts from a later occupation, beginning about 9080Ã-±60 years BP, indicate that a significant shift frombifacial tools to microblade technology had occurred.The only animal remains that have survived at the site are a few fragments of burnt bone from fish, birds and possibly caribou.
TEXT.French: un L'Ile de Richardson is an early Holocene site, located in south eastern Haida Gwaii, off the west coast of British Columbia. The earliest occupation of the site occurred when sea levels were on the rise, and repeated sediment deposition on this raised beach site resulted in a very well-stratified record of at least 23 separate occupations. The un L'Ile de Richardson site is located today about 100 meters inland, in a denselyforested area.Radiocarbon dates from the earliest level indicate that the site was first occupied about 9290 Ã-±50 years BP.The artifacts found at that level consist of simple flake tools, biface tools and large unifacially flaked tools. The artifacts from a later occupation, beginning about 9080Ã-±60 years BP, indicate that a significant shift frombifacial tools to microblade technology had occurred.The only animal remains that have survived at the site are a few fragments of burnt bone from fish, birds and possibly caribou.
TEXT.Polish: Richardson Island to miejsce odkryć archologicznych pochodzących z wczesnego Holocenu. Położone na zachodnim wybrzeżu Kanady (Kolumbia Brytyjska). Na miejscu znaleziono setki małych narzędzi kamiennych.

TEXT.English: LEGENDARY LANDSCAPES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.
TEXT.French: LEGENDARY LANDSCAPES, Group Wonder. Only one from the group can be built by a nation.

TEXT.English: River Authority
TEXT.Italian: Amministrazione del fiume

TEXT.English: The River Authority is a government agency dedicated to management of an area's fresh water supply. It's duties include managing water supplies, flood management, wastewater utilities, and community and economic development services to rural and suburban communities near fresh water sources. It futher enables a greater police presence on a region's rivers, improving overall commerce and quality of life for the citizens living on its banks.
TEXT.French: L'Administration de la rivière is a government agency dedicated to management of an area's fresh water supply. It's duties include managing water supplies, flood management, wastewater utilities, and community and economic development services to rural and suburban communities near fresh water sources. It futher enables a greater police presence on a region's rivers, improving overall commerce and quality of life for the citizens living on it's banks.
TEXT.Polish: Urząd odpowiedzialny za dostawę świeżej wody, dbanie o czystośc rzeki oraz o transport wodny.

TEXT.English: Construct a River Authority to increase the production and commerce of your waterways. However, It will also increase the maintenance costs associated with operating the city.
TEXT.French: Construire une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Administration des rivières[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la production et le commerce de vos axes fluviaux. Cependant, cet établissement augmente le coût d'entretien de la ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una Administración de la cuenca para incrementar la producción y el comercio de tus zonas de río. Sin embargo, al operar en la ciudad también hará crecer el coste de mantenimiento asociado.
TEXT.Polish: Buduj Urzędy Gospodarki Wodnej by zwiększyć produkcję oraz dochody z Twoich rzek. Zwiększa koszt utrzymania miasta.

TEXT.English: River Port
TEXT.French: Port de Rivière
TEXT.Italian: Porto fluviale

TEXT.English: A river port is a small port for delivering picking up goods for, generally, a land locked city.
TEXT.French: A river port is a small port for delivering picking up goods for, generally, a land locked city.
TEXT.Polish: Port rzeczny - obszar na brzegu rzeki, kanału rzecznego lub jeziora (zarówno na lądzie, jak i na wodzie) wyposażony w zespół urządzeń umożliwiających przybijanie jednostek pływających - barek i holowników, wymianę z lądem osób i towarów, a także wykonania typowych czynności związanych z eksploatacją danej jednostki (uzupełnianie zapasów, usunięcie nieczystości itp.)

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]River Port[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that raises a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Trade Route Yield[COLOR_REVERT] while also increasing the total amount of [COLOR_GREEN]Commerce[COLOR_REVERT] in river tiles albeit with the downside of causing [COLOR_RED]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_RED]Water Pollution[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Donne un bonus pour les routes commerciales. Peut être construit dans les villes ayant un accès à une rivière. La Construction d'un Port dans la même ville désactivera ce bâtiment.
TEXT.Spanish: Proporciona una bonificación del 20% a las rutas comerciales. Se puede construir en ciudades que tengan acceso a un río. Este edificio se desactivará si construyes un Muelle en la misma ciudad.

TEXT.English: River Rafting Dock

Rafting or white water rafting is the challenging recreational outdoor activity of using an inflatable raft to navigate a river or other bodies of water. This is usually done on white water or different degrees of rough water, in order to thrill and excite the raft passengers. The development of this activity as a leisure sport has become popular since the mid-1970s. It is considered an extreme sport, as it can be dangerous.
TEXT.French: Rafting or white water rafting is the challenging recreational outdoor activity of using an inflatable raft to navigate a river or other bodies of water. This is usually done on white water or different degrees of rough water, in order to thrill and excite the raft passengers. The development of this activity as a leisure sport has become popular since the mid-1970s. It is considered an extreme sport, as it can be dangerous.
TEXT.Polish: Rafting - turystyczna odmiana flisu (spływu) rzecznego, do której używa się różnych rodzajów tratw, łodzi, pontonów, kajaków itp. (często kulturowo charakterystycznych dla danego regionu). Rafting oferuje się na wodach śródlądowych o różnym stopniu trudności, odpowiednio do potrzeb i możliwości pasażerów. Od połowy lat 80. XX wieku jako usługa turystyczna wypromowana i identyfikowana globalnie.

TEXT.English: Build a River Rafting Dock to increase your cities health and happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Club de Rafting[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la santé et le bonheur de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj River Rafting Dock to increase your cities health and happiness.

TEXT.English: Roasting House

Coffee is usually sold in a roasted state, and with rare exceptions all coffee is roasted before it is consumed. It can be sold roasted by the supplier, or it can be home roasted. The roasting process influences the taste of the beverage by changing the coffee seed both physically and chemically. The seed decreases in weight as moisture is lost and increases in volume, causing it to become less dense. The density of the seed also influences the strength of the coffee and requirements for packaging.The actual roasting begins when the temperature inside the seed reaches approximately 200 °C (392 °F), though different varieties of seeds differ in moisture and density and therefore roast at different rates. During roasting, caramelization occurs as intense heat breaks down starches, changing them to simple sugars that begin to brown, which alters the color of the seed. Sucrose is rapidly lost during the roasting process and may disappear entirely in darker roasts. During roasting, aromatic oils and acids weaken, changing the flavor; at 205 °C (401 °F), other oils start to develop. One of these oils, caffeol, is created at about 200 °C (392 °F), which is largely responsible for coffee's aroma and flavor.
TEXT.French: Coffee is usually sold in a roasted state, and with rare exceptions all coffee is roasted before it is consumed. It can be sold roasted by the supplier, or it can be home roasted. The roasting process influences the taste of the beverage by changing the coffee seed both physically and chemically. The seed decreases in weight as moisture is lost and increases in volume, causing it to become less dense. The density of the seed also influences the strength of the coffee and requirements for packaging.The actual roasting begins when the temperature inside the seed reaches approximately 200 °C (392 °F), though different varieties of seeds differ in moisture and density and therefore roast at different rates. During roasting, caramelization occurs as intense heat breaks down starches, changing them to simple sugars that begin to brown, which alters the color of the seed. Sucrose is rapidly lost during the roasting process and may disappear entirely in darker roasts. During roasting, aromatic oils and acids weaken, changing the flavor; at 205 °C (401 °F), other oils start to develop. One of these oils, caffeol, is created at about 200 °C (392 °F), which is largely responsible for coffee's aroma and flavor.
TEXT.Polish: Kawa - napój sporządzany z palonych, a następnie zmielonych lub poddanych instantyzacji ziaren kawowca, zwykle podawana na gorąco. Pochodzi z Etiopii, w Europie pojawiła się około XVI wieku. Jedna z najpopularniejszych używek na świecie i główne źródło kofeiny. Działa pobudzająco i orzeźwiająco oraz przyspiesza przemianę materii. Zawiera przeciwutleniacze, które zapobiegają powstawaniu wolnych rodników. Spożywana w dużych ilościach może jednak być szkodliwa dla zdrowia. Rocznie produkuje się około 6,7 miliona ton kawy.

TEXT.English: Build a Roasting House to increase your cities food.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rotisserie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la nourriture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Roasting House by zwiększyć produkcję żywności w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Robotic Pet Shop

A robotic pet is an artificially intelligent machine made in the image of an animal commonly kept as a pet. So far, these animals include dogs, cats, rabbits, and birds. Some people even treat these robots as actual pets. Robotic pets may also include things not normally considered pets, like Pleo, a simulation robotic dinosaur. Some people treat domestic robots such as the Roomba as pets. They keep elderly people from being depressed and also keep them active.
TEXT.French: A robotic pet is an artificially intelligent machine made in the image of an animal commonly kept as a pet. So far, these animals include dogs, cats, rabbits, and birds. Some people even treat these robots as actual pets. Robotic pets may also include things not normally considered pets, like Pleo, a simulation robotic dinosaur. Some people treat domestic robots such as the Roomba as pets. They keep elderly people from being depressed and also keep them active.

TEXT.English: Build a Robotic Pet Shop to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boutique d'animaux-robots[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Robotic Pet Shop um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Robotic Pet Shop by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Rock Art

Rock art is an archaeological term used to refer to human-made markings placed on natural stone; it is also largely synonymous with parietal art. A global phenomenon, rock art is found in many regions of the world, having been produced in many contexts throughout human history, although the majority of rock art that has been ethnographically recorded has been produced as a part of ritual. Such artworks are often divided into three forms: petroglyphs which are carved into the rock surface, pictographs which are painted onto the surface, and earth figures engraved into the ground.
TEXT.French: Rock art is an archaeological term used to refer to human-made markings placed on natural stone; it is also largely synonymous with parietal art. A global phenomenon, rock art is found in many regions of the world, having been produced in many contexts throughout human history, although the majority of rock art that has been ethnographically recorded has been produced as a part of ritual. Such artworks are often divided into three forms: petroglyphs which are carved into the rock surface, pictographs which are painted onto the surface, and earth figures engraved into the ground.
TEXT.Polish: Malarstwo jaskiniowe, malarstwo naskalne - rysunki i malowidła wykonane na ścianach lub sklepieniach jaskiń, najczęściej w czasach prehistorycznych. Powstawały od okresu górnego paleolitu, datowanego od 40 tys. lat p.n.e. W przypadku niektórych rysunków z Zachodniej Australii użyty pierwotnie pigment z biegiem czasu został zastąpiony koloniami grzybów (z rzędu Chaetothyriales) i bakterii dzięki czemu zachowały one intensywne kolory.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rock Art[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Science[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also raises [COLOR_GREEN]Education[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Oeuvre d'Art rupestre[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la culture de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Rock Art by zwiększyć kulturę w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Rock N Roll
Royal Monument

Monuments built to monarchs serve the purpose of securing a legacy for the monarch and their dynasty. They are commonly built to remember great conquerors and reformer, who intern, help preserve or expand the kingdom.
TEXT.French: Monuments built to monarchs serve the purpose of securing a legacy for the monarch and their dynasty. They are commonly built to remember great conquerors and reformer, who intern, help preserve or expand the kingdom.
TEXT.Polish: Monument - posąg, rzeźba, obelisk, pomnik, zwykle dużych rozmiarów, imponujący, wspaniały, wystawiony ku czci osoby (osób) albo na pamiątkę jakiegoś wydarzenia.

TEXT.English: Provides a little Culture and lowers war weariness
TEXT.French: Procure un peu de culture et réduit le mécontentement lié à la guerre.
TEXT.Spanish: Proporciona algo de cultura y reduce el hastío bélico.
TEXT.Polish: Daje mały bonus do kultury i obniża zmęczenie wojną.

TEXT.English: Factory (Rubber)
TEXT.Italian: Fabbrica di gomma

TEXT.English: The production of synthetic rubber in the United States expanded greatly during World War II, since the Axis Powers controlled nearly all the world's limited supplies of natural rubber by mid-1942 once Japan conquered Asia. [PARAGRAPH:2]Military trucks needed rubber for tires, and rubber was used in almost every other war machine. The U.S. government launched a major (and largely secret) effort to improve synthetic rubber production. A principal scientist involved with the effort was Edward Robbins. [PARAGRAPH:2]B.F. Goodrich Company scientist Waldo Semon developed a new and cheaper version of synthetic rubber known as Ameripol in 1940. Ameripol made synthetic rubber production much more cost effective, helping to meet the country's needs during World War II. [PARAGRAPH:2]By 1944, a total of 50 factories were manufacturing it, pouring out a volume of the material twice that of the world's natural rubber production before the beginning of the war. Operation Pointblank bombing targets of Nazi Germany included the Schkopau (50K tons/yr) plant and the Hüls synthetic rubber plant near Recklinghausen (30K, 17%), the Kölnische Gummifäden Fabrik tire and tube plant at Deutz on the east bank of the Rhine. The Ferrara, Italy, synthetic rubber factory (near a river bridge) was bombed August 23, 1944. Three other synthetic rubber facilities were at Ludwigshafen/Oppau (15K), Hanover/Limmer (reclamation, 20K), and Leverkusen (5K). A synthetic rubber plant at Oswiecim, Poland, was under construction on March 5, 1944.
TEXT.French: The production of synthetic rubber in the United States expanded greatly during World War II, since the Axis Powers controlled nearly all the world's limited supplies of natural rubber by mid-1942 once Japan conquered Asia. [PARAGRAPH:2]Military trucks needed rubber for tires, and rubber was used in almost every other war machine. The U.S. government launched a major (and largely secret) effort to improve synthetic rubber production. A principal scientist involved with the effort was Edward Robbins. [PARAGRAPH:2]B.F. Goodrich Company scientist Waldo Semon developed a new and cheaper version of synthetic rubber known as Ameripol in 1940. Ameripol made synthetic rubber production much more cost effective, helping to meet the country's needs during World War II. [PARAGRAPH:2]By 1944, a total of 50 factories were manufacturing it, pouring out a volume of the material twice that of the world's natural rubber production before the beginning of the war. Operation Pointblank bombing targets of Nazi Germany included the Schkopau (50K tons/yr) plant and the Hüls synthetic rubber plant near Recklinghausen (30K, 17%), the Kölnische Gummifäden Fabrik tire and tube plant at Deutz on the east bank of the Rhine. The Ferrara, Italy, synthetic rubber factory (near a river bridge) was bombed August 23, 1944. Three other synthetic rubber facilities were at Ludwigshafen/Oppau (15K), Hanover/Limmer (reclamation, 20K), and Leverkusen (5K). A synthetic rubber plant at Oswiecim, Poland, was under construction on March 5, 1944.
TEXT.Polish: Wulkanizacja - chemiczny proces sieciowania cząsteczek polimeru prowadzący do otrzymania gumy. Proces wulkanizacji, oprócz produkcji gumy, jest też stosowany do sklejania z sobą dwóch lub więcej ich rodzajów (np. w trakcie produkcji opon), powlekania gumą tkanin i tworzyw, oraz naprawiania i regenerowania opon.

TEXT.English: Rubber factory produces Vulcanized Rubber from Rubber and Sulphur.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fabrique de Gomme[COLOR_REVERT] produit du Caoutchouc vulcanisé, à partir du [COLOR_GREEN]Caoutchouc[COLOR_REVERT] et du [COLOR_GREEN]Soufre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La Fábrica de tratamiento del caucho produce Caucho vulcanizado a partir del Caucho y el Azufre.

TEXT.Italian: Fabbrica di gomma

TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Przemysł chemiczny wytwarza bardzo wiele rodzajów gumy. Poprzez mieszanie szeregu polimerów tworzących medium oraz bardzo różnorodnych wypełniaczy można uzyskać materiały o całkowicie przeciwstawnych własnościach. W zależności od użytych surowców rozróżnia się gumę naturalną produkowaną z kauczuku otrzymywanego z żywicy drzewa Hevea brasiliensis - lateksu, zawierającą cis-poliizopren oraz gumę syntetyczną produkowaną z polibutadienu i innych syntetycznych poliolefin.

TEXT.English: [SPACE]Rubber Plant produces Synthetic Rubber from Chemicals.
TEXT.French: une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fabrique de Caoutchouc[COLOR_REVERT] produit du Caouthcouc synthétique à partir de [COLOR_GREEN]Produits chimiques[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]La Fábrica de caucho produce Caucho sintético a partir de los Productos químicos.

TEXT.English: Rubber Reclamation Plant

Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.French: Recycling is a process to change materials (waste) into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (from incineration) and water pollution (from landfilling) by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production. Recycling is a key component of modern waste reduction and is the third component of the "Reduce, Reuse, Recycle" waste hierarchy.
TEXT.Polish: Guma - rozciągliwy materiał, elastomer chemicznie zbudowany z alifatycznych łańcuchów polimerowych (np. poliolefin), które są w stosunkowo niewielkim stopniu usieciowane w procesie wulkanizacji. W przemyśle, terminem "guma" obejmuje się czasami w uproszczeniu wszystkie rodzaje stałych elastomerów.

TEXT.English: Build a Rubber Reclamation Plant to get access to resources.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre de recyclage de Caoutchouc[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à la ressource correspondante.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Rubber Reclamation Plant by zdobyć dostęp do nowego źródła surowców.

TEXT.English: Sacrificial Altar
TEXT.Italian: Altare dei sacrifici

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacrificial Altar[COLOR_REVERT] is any structure upon which sacrifices or other offerings are made for religious purposes, or some other sacred place where ceremonies take place. Altars are usually found in shrines, temples, and other sacred places. They were features of temple furniture in many cultures worldwide from ancient times to the present day, particularly in ancient Pagan religions.
TEXT.French: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Autel de sacrifices[COLOR_REVERT] is any structure upon which sacrifices or other offerings are made for religious purposes, or some other sacred place where ceremonies take place. Altars are usually found in shrines, temples, and other sacred places. They were features of temple furniture in many cultures worldwide from ancient times to the present day, particularly in ancient Pagan religions.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ołtarz Ofiarny[COLOR_REVERT] to znane we wszystkich religiach miejsce składania ofiar. Pierwszymi naturalnymi miejscami na składanie ofiar i pojawianie się praform ołtarzy były góry i wzgórza, źródła życiodajnej wody lub szczególne drzewa. Na wybór miejsca miały wpływ określone elementy takie jak teofanie, inne nadprzyrodzone znaki lub szczególne przeżycia człowieka. W tych miejscach składano ofiary początkowo na powierzchni naturalnej skały, bloku skalnego lub głazie, a nawet naturalnych wzniesieniach. Były to formy ołtarzy naturalnych, w których człowiek nie podejmował się żadnej działalności, lecz wykorzystywał elementy zastanego miejsca. Z czasem zaczęto dostosowywać miejsca bezpośredniego składania ofiar przez przetaczanie głazów, układanie stosów kamieni, ręczne obrabianie skały lub usypywanie z ziemi kopców i wzniesień, w końcu tworzenie platform. Pojawiają się różnorodne formy ołtarzy budowanych wraz z adaptacją jego otoczenia i utworzenia strefy sacrum (przeznaczonej do kultu). Przykładem takich miejsc są starożytne wyżyny zbliżające do nieba lub zigguraty przypominające schody dla bogów. W ten sposób ołtarz stawał się jednym z elementów miejsca, które możemy dziś określać terminem sanktuarium, następnie rozwiniętych do form świątynnych.

TEXT.English: Build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacrificial Altar[COLOR_REVERT] to reduce anger from sacrificing people. It also turns 1 happy citizen if you have the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paganism Civic[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Autel de sacrifices[COLOR_REVERT] pour réduire le mécontentement lié au sacrifice de la population. Il procure même du bonheur avec la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paganisme[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Altar de sacrificios[COLOR_REVERT] para reducir la infelicidad por sacrificar población. También vuelve feliz a un ciudadano si estás bajo el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paganismo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ołtarz Ofiarny[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć zadowolenie w mieście.

TEXT.English: Saddler

The saddle is a supportive structure for a rider or other load, fastened to an animal's back by a girth. The most common type is the equestrian saddle designed for a horse, but specialized saddles have been created for camels and other creatures.
TEXT.French: The saddle is a supportive structure for a rider or other load, fastened to an animal's back by a girth. The most common type is the equestrian saddle designed for a horse, but specialized saddles have been created for camels and other creatures.
TEXT.Polish: Rymarstwo - dział rzemiosła zajmujący się wytwarzaniem uprzęży konnych, siodeł, akcesoriów jeździeckich i skórzanych pasów pędnych. Tradycyjnie wyroby szyte były ręcznie ze skór, a następnie wykańczane metalowymi okuciami. Część pracowni zachowało ten sposób pracy, pozostałe wykorzystują szycie maszynowe. Rymarze posiadali własne cechy regulujące zwyczaje, zasady zdobywania zawodu i rozsądzające spory.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Saddler[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also gives [COLOR_CYAN]Saddles[COLOR_REVERT] which enable some buildings ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stable[COLOR_REVERT], for example).
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bourrelier[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Saddler um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Saddler by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Safari Hotel
A Safari Hotel is a hotel in the Savanna where people stay between Safaris.
TEXT.French: Un Hotel Safari is a hotel in the Savanna where people stay between Safaris.
TEXT.Polish: Safari - wyprawa myśliwska, ewentualnie dłuższa podróż karawanowa w Afryce Wschodniej. Obecnie, wraz z rozwojem globalnej turystyki, coraz częściej terminem tym określa się formę zorganizowanego wypoczynku i rekreacji poprzez podziwianie i fotografowanie naturalnej przyrody, a zwłaszcza świata zwierząt.

TEXT.English: Build a Safari Hotel to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hotel Safari[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Safari Hotel by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Achievement (Safety)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement de Sécurité

TEXT.English: Safety is the state of being "safe" (from French sauf), the condition of being protected against physical, social, spiritual, financial, political, emotional, occupational, psychological, educational or othertypes or consequences of failure, damage, error, accidents, harm or any other event which could be considered non-desirable. Safety can also be defined to be the control of recognized hazards to achieve an acceptable level of risk. This can take the form of being protected from the event or from exposure to something that causes health or economical losses. It can include protection of people or of possessions.
TEXT.French: Safety is the state of being "safe" (from French sauf), the condition of being protected against physical, social, spiritual, financial, political, emotional, occupational, psychological, educational or othertypes or consequences of failure, damage, error, accidents, harm or any other event which could be considered non-desirable. Safety can also be defined to be the control of recognized hazards to achieve an acceptable level of risk. This can take the form of being protected from the event or from exposure to something that causes health or economical losses. It can include protection of people or of possessions.
TEXT.Polish: Bezpieczeństwo to stan, który daje poczucie pewności istnienia i gwarancje jego zachowania oraz szanse na doskonalenie. Jest to jedna z podstawowych potrzeb człowieka. Odznacza się akceptowalnym poziomem ryzyka utraty czegoś dla podmiotu szczególnie cennego - życia, zdrowia, pracy, szacunku, uczuć, dóbr materialnych i dóbr niematerialnych. Bezpieczeństwo jest naczelną potrzebą człowieka i grup społecznych, jest także podstawową potrzebą państw i systemów międzynarodowych; jego brak wywołuje niepokój i poczucie zagrożenia. Człowiek, grupa społeczna, państwo, organizacja międzynarodowa starają się oddziaływać na swoje otoczenie zewnętrzne i sferę wewnętrzną, by usuwać a przynajmniej oddalać zagrożenia, eliminując własny lęk, obawy, niepokój i niepewność. Zagrożenia mogą być skierowane na zewnątrz i do wewnątrz; tak samo powinny być skierowane działania w celu ich likwidowania.

TEXT.English: Safety (National Legal Database)

The Iraqi Legal Database (ILD) is the first comprehensive and electronic legal database to be created in the Arab region. The project to create the ILD was launched in 2004 by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), through its Programme on Governance in the Arab Region (POGAR), and is being implemented in coordination with the Higher Judicial Council.The objective behind the project is to make the entire corpus of Iraqi law available to judges, lawyers, academics, lawmakers, and all other individuals or institutions that rely on legal knowledge in a single, freely accessible source. In keeping with this objective, the ILD was published online in September 2008, and makes available to users 27,433 legal texts altogether, including 7,136 laws, 4,265 ministerial instructions, 3,268 regulations, 5,029 declarations, etc., which is to say every single Iraqi legal text that has been passed since 1917. The ILD is entirely free-of-charge and does not require users to subscribe in any way. The Iraq Country Office of the United Nations Development Programme is the source of most of the funding for the ILD.The ILD is available only in Arabic. Iraqi law was not translated into any other language in a systematic manner, and so therefore legal researchers and other jurists that are interested in Iraqi law must carry out their research in Arabic. Non-Arabic speaking researchers who are interested in learning more about the ILD's features may download the following powerpoint presentation which illustrates (and translates into English) the ILD's various functions.
TEXT.French: The Iraqi Legal Database (ILD) is the first comprehensive and electronic legal database to be created in the Arab region. The project to create the ILD was launched in 2004 by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), through its Programme on Governance in the Arab Region (POGAR), and is being implemented in coordination with the Higher Judicial Council.The objective behind the project is to make the entire corpus of Iraqi law available to judges, lawyers, academics, lawmakers, and all other individuals or institutions that rely on legal knowledge in a single, freely accessible source. In keeping with this objective, the ILD was published online in September 2008, and makes available to users 27,433 legal texts altogether, including 7,136 laws, 4,265 ministerial instructions, 3,268 regulations, 5,029 declarations, etc., which is to say every single Iraqi legal text that has been passed since 1917. The ILD is entirely free-of-charge and does not require users to subscribe in any way. The Iraq Country Office of the United Nations Development Programme is the source of most of the funding for the ILD.The ILD is available only in Arabic. Iraqi law was not translated into any other language in a systematic manner, and so therefore legal researchers and other jurists that are interested in Iraqi law must carry out their research in Arabic. Non-Arabic speaking researchers who are interested in learning more about the ILD's features may download the following powerpoint presentation which illustrates (and translates into English) the ILD's various functions.
TEXT.Polish: Kodeks (z łac. codex: księga, spis) - akt normatywny zawierający logicznie usystematyzowany zbiór przepisów regulujących określoną dziedzinę stosunków społecznych. Obecnie w Polsce kodeksy są wydawane w formie ustaw; w II RP kilka kodeksów wydano w formie rozporządzenia z mocą ustawy. Kodeks może mieć moc prawną równą ustawie zwykłej (tak jest obecnie w polskim prawie), ale w niektórych systemach prawnych jego pozycja może być wyższa, wskutek czego przepisy innych ustaw sprzeczne z kodeksempodlegają uchyleniu. Normy kodeksowe, nawet jeśli są równe innym ustawom, mają jednak szczególne znaczenie ze względu na kompleksowość normowanych spraw i proces interpretacji przepisów.

TEXT.English: Once the National Legal Database is built, the crime in your cities will reduce.
TEXT.French: Once the une Base de données Nationale Légale is built, the crime in your cities will reduce.

TEXT.English: Safety (Orbital Prison)
Orbital Prisons are very expensive, high security prisons for the most dangerous criminals on earth.
TEXT.French: une Prison orbitales are very expensive, high security prisons for the most dangerous criminals on earth.

TEXT.English: Build an Orbital Prison to make your cities saver.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Prison orbitale[COLOR_REVERT] pour rendre votre ville plus sûre en réduisant la criminalité.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Orbital Prison to make your cities saver.

TEXT.English: Salt Evaporation Pont
TEXT.French: Ponton d'évaporation du Sel

TEXT.English: Evaporation Pont are small ponts near the coast. They are filled with seawater. When the water evaporates, the salt remains and can be collected.
TEXT.French: Evaporation Pont are small ponts near the coast. They are filled with seawater. When the water evaporates, the salt remains and can be collected.
TEXT.Polish: Salina - zakład przemysłowy produkujący sól kamienną poprzez odparowanie wody z solanki pochodzącej z mórz lub słonych jezior ewentualnie podziemnych złóż lub źródeł mineralnych. Najczęściej spotykane saliny mają postać płytkich zbiorników zlokalizowanych w strefie przybrzeżnej mórz lub słonych jezior i oddzielonych od nich groblami.

TEXT.English: Build an Evaporation Pont to get access to Salt.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]ponton d'évaporation pour avoir accès à du Sel.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Evaporation Pont to get access to Salt.

TEXT.English: Salt Evaporation Works
TEXT.French: Atelier d'évaporation de Sel

TEXT.English: Salt is extracted from salt water using fire.
TEXT.French: Salt is extracted from salt water using fire.

Najczęściej spotykane saliny mają postać płytkich zbiorników zlokalizowanych w strefie przybrzeżnej mórz lub słonych jezior i oddzielonych od nich groblami.

TEXT.English: Build an Evaporation Works to get access to Salt.
TEXT.French: Build an Evaporation Works to get access to Salt.

TEXT.English: Salt Flat Quarry
Salt Flat Quarry mine Salt from near salt flats.
TEXT.French: une Carrière de Lac de Sel mine Salt from near salt flats.
TEXT.Polish: Solnisko - obszar lądowy, zwykle bagienny lub wilgotny, charakteryzujący się znacznym zasoleniem wód zasilających lub stagnujących.

TEXT.English: Build a Salt Flat Quarry to get access to Salt.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carrière de Lac de Sel pour avoir accès au [COLOR_GREEN]Sel[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Salt Flat Quarry to get access to Salt.

TEXT.English: Piazza San Marco

The Piazza originated in the 9th century as a small area in front of the original St Mark's Basilica. It was enlarged to its present size and shape in 1177, when the Rio Batario, which had bounded it to the west, and a dock, which had isolated the Doge's Palace from the square, was filled in. The rearrangement was for the meeting of Pope Alexander III and the Emperor Frederick Barbarossa. The Piazza has always been seen as the centre of Venice. It was the location of all the important offices of the Venetian state, and has been the seat of the archbishopric since the 19th century. It was also the focus for many of Venice's festivals. It is a greatly popular place in Italy even today.
TEXT.French: The Piazza originated in the 9th century as a small area in front of the original St Mark's Basilica. It was enlarged to its present size and shape in 1177, when the Rio Batario, which had bounded it to the west, and a dock, which had isolated the Doge's Le Palais, Siège de la Civilization from the square, was filled in. The rearrangement was for the meeting of Pope Alexander III and the Emperor Frederick Barbarossa. The Piazza has always been seen as the centre of Venice. It was the location of all the important offices of the Venetian state, and has been the seat of the archbishopric since the 19th century. It was also the focus for many of Venice's festivals. It is a greatly popular place in Italy even today.
TEXT.Italian: La Piazza ebbe origine nel 9° secolo come una piccola area di fronte alla Basilica di San Marco originale. Fu allargata alle forme e dimensioni attuali nel 1177, quando il Rio Batario, che l'aveva delimitata ad ovest, ed un bacino, che la isolava dal palazzo del doge, vennero riempiti. La ristrutturazione avvenne in occasione dell'incontro di Papa Alessandro III e l'Imperatore Federico Barbarossa. La Piazza è sempre stata il centro di Venezia. E' stata la sede di tutte le manifestazioni più importazioni dello stato Veneziano, ed è stata la sede dell'arcivescovado sin dal 19° secolo. Era anche il centro di molte feste veneziane. Attualmente, è un posto molto popolare in Italia.
TEXT.Polish: Plac św. Marka (wł. Piazza San Marco) - znajduje się w najstarszej części Wenecji i jest najbardziej znanym placem tego miasta. Jego historia zaczyna się w IX wieku i wiąże się z budową pierwszej bazyliki św. Marka. W tym czasie plac ograniczał się do niewielkiego obszaru znajdującego się w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie bazyliki. Przez teren obecnego placu przepływał jeden z kanałów weneckich, dzieląc go na dwie części, z których jedną zajmował sad klasztoru św. Zachariasza. Pod koniec XII wieku plac został powiększony do obecnych rozmiarów. Przebudowa wiąże się ze spotkaniem papieża Aleksandra III z cesarzem Fryderykiem I Barbarossą.Plac od samego początku był miejscem wielu ważnych wydarzeń i uroczystości. Od czasów Pietro Orseolo II na nim obchodzono uroczystość "zaślubin z morzem" podczas świąt Wniebowstąpienia,Plac św. Marka połączony jest z Piazzettą San Marco. Ograniczają je budynki pałacu Dożów i bazyliki św. Marka. Na wprost bazyliki znajduje się klasycystyczny budynek skrzydła Napoleona (Ala Napoleonica). Budynek łączy ze sobą budynki Starej i Nowej Prokuracji (Procuratie Vecchie i Procuratie Nuove). Napoleon Bonaparte był zachwycony architekturą placu św. Marka. Polecił wybudować skrzydło zamykające zabudowę placu i uznał plac za najpiękniejszy salon Europy.Do budynku Starej Prokuracji przylega wieża zegarowa (Torre dell'Orologio) a przy Nowej Prokuracji góruje dzwonnica św. Marka Campanile. Na przedłużeniu placu za wieżą zegarową, obok bazyliki św. Marka znajduje się Piazzetta dei Leonici - placyk, przy którym usytuowany jest budynek kurii biskupiej.Większość budowli znajdujących się wokół placu została zbudowana w XVI wieku. Nawierzchnie zmieniono w pierwszych latach XVIII wieku.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piazza San Marco[COLOR_REVERT] Free Market in all cities.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Place Saint Marc[COLOR_REVERT] un Marché Gratuit dans toutes les Villes.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Markusplatz[COLOR_REVERT] Freies Gebäude Markt in allen Städten.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Piazza San Marco[COLOR_REVERT] fornisce un mercato gratuito in tutte le città.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plaza de San Marcos[COLOR_REVERT] proporciona un Mercado gratis en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plac św. Marka[COLOR_REVERT] Darmowy rynek we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: Sanitation Chamber
Sanitation Chambers are modern, highly automated restrooms for public use.
TEXT.French: une Chambre d'Assainissement corporels are modern, highly automated restrooms for public use.
TEXT.Polish: Komora Sanitarna to ultra nowoczesne publiczne toalety.

TEXT.English: Build a Sanitation Chamber to reduce your cities disease.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chambre d'Assainissement corporel[COLOR_REVERT] pour réduire les maladies dans votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Sanitation Chamber to reduce your cities diease.

TEXT.English: Scarab Beetle Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Scarabées

TEXT.English: Scarabs are a mesmerizingly diverse family of beetle found in every part of the world except in the oceans and on Antarctica. There are about 30,000 scarab species comprising about 10 percent of all known beetles.
TEXT.French: Scarabs are a mesmerizingly diverse family of beetle found in every part of the world except in the oceans and on Antarctica. There are about 30,000 scarab species comprising about 10 percent of all known beetles.
TEXT.Polish: Poświętnik, skarabeusz (Scarabaeus) - rodzaj chrząszczy z rodziny poświętnikowate. Jest ich ponad 30 gatunków. Są stosunkowo duże w porównaniu do innych chrząszczy, są czarne i mają metaliczny połysk. Występują w Północnej Afryce, Południowej Europie i Azji Mniejszej. W starożytnym Egipcie skarabeusz był uważany za zwierzę święte. Stał się symbolem wędrówki słońca po niebie i symbolem odrodzenia. Bóstwo Starożytnego Egiptuznane pod nazwą Chepri było czczone pod postacią skarabeusza. Imię tego boga znaczy "Ten, który się rozwija". Egipcjanie wierzyli, że skarabeusze rodzą się z niczego (niejako same z siebie), ponieważ ich młode pojawiały się jakby z nicości, wychodząc z kulki gnoju, w której się rozwijały. Skarabeusz w Egipcie, potężny symbol ponownych narodzin, należał do najczęstszego wyposażenia grobowców. Wytwarzany z kamienia, fajansu, drogich metali, często z kości słoniowej lub kości innych zwierząt, pełnił funkcję amuletu. Zazwyczaj noszony był w postaci naszyjnika lub obrotowego pierścienia. W okresie Średniego Państwa upowszechniły się jako forma pieczęci; na podstawie zazwyczaj wyryte było imię urzędnika. Skarabeusze stanowiły popularne obiekty wymiany i są odnajdywane we wszystkich krajach, z którymi Egipt utrzymywał kontakty. Rysunki i symbole skarabeusza przedstawiane były w uproszczonej formie, z typową ząbkowaną główką i wypukłym pancerzykiem.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Incense[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scarab Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Encens[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Scarabées[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Scarab Beetle Sanctuary
TEXT.French: Refuge pour Scarabées

TEXT.English: Scarabs are a mesmerizingly diverse family of beetle found in every part of the world except in the oceans and on Antarctica. There are about 30,000 scarab species comprising about 10 percent of all known beetles.
TEXT.French: Scarabs are a mesmerizingly diverse family of beetle found in every part of the world except in the oceans and on Antarctica. There are about 30,000 scarab species comprising about 10 percent of all known beetles.
TEXT.Polish: Poświętnik, skarabeusz (Scarabaeus) - rodzaj chrząszczy z rodziny poświętnikowate. Jest ich ponad 30 gatunków. Są stosunkowo duże w porównaniu do innych chrząszczy, są czarne i mają metaliczny połysk. Występują w Północnej Afryce, Południowej Europie i Azji Mniejszej. W starożytnym Egipcie skarabeusz był uważany za zwierzę święte. Stał się symbolem wędrówki słońca po niebie i symbolem odrodzenia. Bóstwo Starożytnego Egiptuznane pod nazwą Chepri było czczone pod postacią skarabeusza. Imię tego boga znaczy "Ten, który się rozwija". Egipcjanie wierzyli, że skarabeusze rodzą się z niczego (niejako same z siebie), ponieważ ich młode pojawiały się jakby z nicości, wychodząc z kulki gnoju, w której się rozwijały. Skarabeusz w Egipcie, potężny symbol ponownych narodzin, należał do najczęstszego wyposażenia grobowców. Wytwarzany z kamienia, fajansu, drogich metali, często z kości słoniowej lub kości innych zwierząt, pełnił funkcję amuletu. Zazwyczaj noszony był w postaci naszyjnika lub obrotowego pierścienia. W okresie Średniego Państwa upowszechniły się jako forma pieczęci; na podstawie zazwyczaj wyryte było imię urzędnika. Skarabeusze stanowiły popularne obiekty wymiany i są odnajdywane we wszystkich krajach, z którymi Egipt utrzymywał kontakty. Rysunki i symbole skarabeusza przedstawiane były w uproszczonej formie, z typową ząbkowaną główką i wypukłym pancerzykiem.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Incense[COLOR_REVERT] in a city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scarab Sanctuary[COLOR_REVERT]. It also requires its Gatherer Building from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sericulture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Encens[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de la ville pour pouvoir construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refuge pour Scarabées[COLOR_REVERT]. Il faut également avoir le bâtiment de récolteur provenant de [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sériculture[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: School Of Scribes
TEXT.Italian: Scuola di scribi

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Scribe[COLOR_REVERT] is a person who writes books or documents by hand as a profession. The profession, previously found in all literate cultures in some form, lost most of its importance and status with the advent of printing. The work could involve copying books, including sacred texts, or secretarial and administrative duties such as taking of dictation and the keeping of business, judicial and historical records for kings, nobility, temples and cities. Later the profession developed into public servants, journalists, accountants and lawyers.
TEXT.French: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Scribe[COLOR_REVERT] is a person who writes books or documents by hand as a profession. The profession, previously found in all literate cultures in some form, lost most of its importance and status with the advent of printing. The work could involve copying books, including sacred texts, or secretarial and administrative duties such as taking of dictation and the keeping of business, judicial and historical records for kings, nobility, temples and cities. Later the profession developed into public servants, journalists, accountants and lawyers.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Skryba[COLOR_REVERT] osoba zajmująca się zawodowo odręcznym przepisywaniem ksiąg lub dokumentów. Zawód skryby występował w zróżnicowanych formach we wszyskich kulturach posługujących się pismem. W starożytnym Egipcie skryba (sesh) był osobą wyedukowaną w zakresie posługiwania się pismem hieroglificznym, hieratycznym oraz od II połowy I tysiąclecia p.n.e. pismem demotycznym. Egipscy skrybowie najczęściej reprezentowani byli przez płeć męską oraz przynależeli do grupy społecznej, którą można określić jako średnią klasę wyższą. Zatrudnienie znajdowali zarówno w zbiurokratyzowanej administracji państwa faraonów, jak i w egipskich świątyniach i armii. Synowie skrybów wychowywani byli w tej samej co ich ojcowie tradycji - wysyłano ich do szkół, po ukończeniu których dziedziczyli ich zawód.

TEXT.English: Build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]School of Scribes[COLOR_REVERT] to increase the science output rate from your cities.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ecole des Scribes[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le taux de science de votre ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Escuela de escribas[COLOR_REVERT] para incrementar la producción científica de tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Wybuduj [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szkołę Skrybów[COLOR_REVERT] że by zwiększyć przyrost nauki w mieście

TEXT.English: Achievement (Scientific)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement Scientifique
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo scientifico

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Commercial Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives a +8% research bonus in all cities, as well as a health bonus in all cities.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accomplissement Commercial[COLOR_REVERT] requiert [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi qu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héro National[COLOR_REVERT] pour être construit. Il donne +8% bonus en science dans toutes les villes, ainsi que bonus de santé dans toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro científico[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da una bonificación a la investigación (+8%) y a la salud en todas las ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Naukowe[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Zwiększa naukę o +8% oraz zwiększa zdrowie o 1 we wszystkich miastach.

TEXT.English: Scorpion Gatherer
TEXT.French: Récolteur de Scorpions

TEXT.English: Scorpions strike terror in many people and have been both hated and admired since ancient times. This is probably due to their fearsome look, with pincers called pedipalps at one end and a stinger filled with venom at the other. Scorpions are not insects but arachnids, like spiders, and have eight legs and two main body regions, the prosoma, or cephalothorax, and the opisthosoma, or abdomen. The prosoma has two eyes on top and two to five lateral eyes along each side (as many as five pairs).
TEXT.French: Scorpions strike terror in many people and have been both hated and admired since ancient times. This is probably due to their fearsome look, with pincers called pedipalps at one end and a stinger filled with venom at the other. Scorpions are not insects but arachnids, like spiders, and have eight legs and two main body regions, the prosoma, or cephalothorax, and the opisthosoma, or abdomen. The prosoma has two eyes on top and two to five lateral eyes along each side (as many as five pairs).
TEXT.Polish: Skorpiony (Scorpiones) - rząd pajęczaków (Arachnida) o wielkości od 13 do nawet ponad 180 mm (skorpion cesarski), zamieszkujących zarówno obszary tropikalne (od lasów deszczowych po tereny pustynne), jak i wysokogórskie tereny okresowo przykrywane śniegiem. Skorpiony charakteryzują się obecnością kolca jadowego na ostatnim segmencie odwłoku.

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Cocoa[COLOR_REVERT] in your city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scorpion Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Cacao[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de votre ville pour pouvoir construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]un Récolteur de Scorpions[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Scorpion Sanctuary
TEXT.French: Refuge pour Scorpions

TEXT.English: Scorpions strike terror in many people and have been both hated and admired since ancient times. This is probably due to their fearsome look, with pincers called pedipalps at one end and a stinger filled with venom at the other. Scorpions are not insects but arachnids, like spiders, and have eight legs and two main body regions, the prosoma, or cephalothorax, and the opisthosoma, or abdomen. The prosoma has two eyes on top and two to five lateral eyes along each side (as many as five pairs).
TEXT.French: Scorpions strike terror in many people and have been both hated and admired since ancient times. This is probably due to their fearsome look, with pincers called pedipalps at one end and a stinger filled with venom at the other. Scorpions are not insects but arachnids, like spiders, and have eight legs and two main body regions, the prosoma, or cephalothorax, and the opisthosoma, or abdomen. The prosoma has two eyes on top and two to five lateral eyes along each side (as many as five pairs).

TEXT.English: You must have the resource [COLOR_GREEN]Cocoa[COLOR_REVERT] in a city vicinity in order to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scorpion Sanctuary[COLOR_REVERT]. It also requires its Gatherer Building from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sericulture[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Vous devez avoir la ressource [COLOR_GREEN]Cacao[COLOR_REVERT] aux alentours de la ville pour pouvoir construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refuge pour Scorpions[COLOR_REVERT]. Il faut également avoir le bâtiment de récolteur provenant de [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sériculture[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Scotland Yard
Scriptorium
TEXT.French: Scriptorium
TEXT.Italian: Scrittoio

TEXT.English: A scriptorium is a room or building where religious texts are copied. Frequently, these scriptoria were found attached to monasteries, and the monks did the work of copying the text. Before the invention of the printing press, virtually all books were hand-copied. This was about the only way many books survived the collapse of the Greek and Roman Empires.
TEXT.French: Scriptorium
TEXT.Italian: Uno scrittoio è una stanza dove vengono copiati i testi religiosi. Erano spesso siti nei monasteri, dove i monaci svolgevano il loro lavoro di copiatura dei testi. Prima dell'invenzione della tipografia, tutti i libri venivano copiati a mano. Questo è stao l'unico modo in cui molti libri sono sopravvissuti al collasso dell'Impero Romano.
TEXT.Polish: Skryptorium (łac. scriptorium od scribere "pisać") - średniowieczna nazwa pulpitu do pisania i czytania oraz całości warsztatu pisarskiego. W klasztorach skryptoriami nazywano pomieszczenia, w których przepisywano ręcznie księgi. Zakonników zajmujących się rękopiśmiennictwem nazywano skryptorami lub skrybami. Z czasem powstały dzięki nim takie specjalizacje, jak kaligrafia i iluminacja (miniatura).

TEXT.English: Build a Scriptorium for a small bonus to Culture and Science and gain extra Priests and cheaper Missionaries.
TEXT.French: Scriptorium
TEXT.Italian: Quest'edificio fornisce un bonus alla cultura e allas scienza; fornisce sacerdoti e diminuisce il costo di produzione dei missionari
TEXT.Spanish: Construye un Scriptorium para obtener algo de cultura y ciencia, junto con Sacerdotes gratis y una reducción del coste de producción de los misioneros.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Scriptorium for a small bonus to Culture and Science and gain extra Priests and cheaper Missionaries.

TEXT.English: Sculptor's Workshop
TEXT.Italian: Negozio dello scultore

TEXT.English: A sculptor is a person who models or carves figures of clay, stone, metal, wood, or any similar material to create three-dimensional representations.
TEXT.French: A sculptor is a person who models or carves figures of clay, stone, metal, wood, or any similar material to create three-dimensional representations.
TEXT.Polish: Rzeźbiarze wykonują rozmaite rzeźby z drewna, metalu, gipsu a najczęściej z gliny. Rzeźby są głównie wykonane do oglądania dookólnego, a rzadziej np. do spoglądania na nie z góry czy z dołu. Oprócz tych cech rzeźba może posiadać fakturę (w zależności od użytego materiału) lub kolor (tzw. rzeźba polichromowana). Może być również klasyfikowana ze względu na swoją skalę (np. miniaturowa lub monumentalna). W dawnych wiekach ukształtowały się niezwykle skomplikowane techniki tworzenia rzeźby.

TEXT.English: Provides Gold and Culture. Allows for an Artist specialist early on.
TEXT.French: Procure de l'or et de la culture. Permet également très tôt un spécialiste Artiste.
TEXT.Spanish: Proporciona oro y cultura. Permite convertir pronto a un ciudadano en Artista.
TEXT.Polish: Daje złoto i kulture. Udosępnia wcześnie artystę.

TEXT.English: Sea Tree
TEXT.French: Arbre de mer

TEXT.English: This Sea Tree is a floating structure that hold in many layers green habitats for only animals. This structure is not accessible by man. The sea tree is built by offshore technology quite similar to the oil storage towers which can be found on open seas. They provide additional habitats for birds, bees, bats and other small animals could bring a lot of positive green effects to the environment of a city. Under water the sea tree provides a habitat for small water creatures or even when the climate allows it for artificial coral reefs.
TEXT.French: This un Arbre de mer is a floating structure that hold in many layers green habitats for only animals. This structure is not accessible by man. The sea tree is built by offshore technology quite similar to the oil storage towers which can be found on open seas. They provide additional habitats for birds, bees, bats and other small animals could bring a lot of positive green effects to the environment of a city. Under water the sea tree provides a habitat for small water creatures or even when the climate allows it for artificial coral reefs.

TEXT.English: Build a Sea Tree to decrease your cities pollution.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arbre de mer[COLOR_REVERT] pour diminuer la pollution de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Sea Tree to decrease your cities pollution.

TEXT.English: Myth - Steller's Sea Eagle
Myth Effect - Steller's Sea Eagle
Stories - Steller's Sea Eagle
Stories Effect - Steller's Sea Eagle
Story - Steller's Sea Eagle
Achievement (Seafaring)
TEXT.French: Accomplissement d'Exploration maritime
TEXT.Italian: Obiettivo marinaresco

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seafaring Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives 5 experience points to all naval units built in the city, as well as 2 sea trade routes globally. It also increases the yield of all water tiles in one's territory by 1 food.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seafaring Achievement[COLOR_REVERT] requires [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] as well as a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]National Hero[COLOR_REVERT] in order to be built. It gives 5 experience points to all naval units built in the city, as well as 2 sea trade routes globally. It also increases the yield of all water tiles in one's territory by 1 food.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Logro marítimo[COLOR_REVERT] requiere la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT], además de un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Héroe nacional[COLOR_REVERT] disponible, para poder ser creado. Da 5 puntos de experiencia adicionales a todas las unidades navales creadas en la ciudad. Además, da 2 rutas comerciales a todas las ciudades y +1 alimento a todas las casillas acuáticas.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Osiągnięcie Morskie[COLOR_REVERT] wymaga [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bohatera Narodowego[COLOR_REVERT] żeby zostało zbudowane. Jednostki morskie otrzymują +5 punktów doświadczenia we wszystkich miastach oraz dadaje 1 morski szlak handlowy we wszystkich przybrzeżnych miastach. Zwiększa również żywność na polach wody o 1.

TEXT.English: Secret Army Base
TEXT.Italian: Base militare segreta

TEXT.English: Area 51 is a nickname for a military base that is located in the southern portion of Nevada in the western United States (83 miles north-northwest of downtown Las Vegas). Situated at its center, on the southern shore of Groom Lake, is a large secretive military airfield. The base's primary purpose is to support development and testing of experimental aircraft and weapons systems. The base lies within the United States Air Force's vast Nevada Test and Training Range. Although the facilities at the range are managed by the 99th Air Base Wing at Nellis Air Force Base, the Groom facility appears to be run as an adjunct of the Air Force Flight Test Center (AFFTC) at Edwards Air Force Base in the Mojave Desert, around 186 miles (300 km) southwest of Groom, and as such the base is known as Air Force Flight Test Center (Detachment 3). The intense secrecy surrounding the base, the very existence of which the U.S. government barely acknowledges, has made it the frequent subject of conspiracy theories and a central component to unidentified flying object (UFO) folklore.
TEXT.French: Area 51 is a nickname for a military base that is located in the southern portion of Nevada in the western United States (83 miles north-northwest of downtown Las Vegas). Situated at its center, on the southern shore of Groom Lake, is a large secretive military airfield. The base's primary purpose is to support development and testing of experimental aircraft and weapons systems. The base lies within the United States Air Force's vast Nevada Test and Training Range. Although the facilities at the range are managed by the 99th Air Base Wing at Nellis Air Force Base, the Groom facility appears to be run as an adjunct of the Air Force Flight Test Center (AFFTC) at Edwards Air Force Base in the Mojave Desert, around 186 miles (300 km) southwest of Groom, and as such the base is known as Air Force Flight Test Center (Detachment 3). The intense secrecy surrounding the base, the very existence of which the U.S. government barely acknowledges, has made it the frequent subject of conspiracy theories and a central component to unidentified flying object (UFO) folklore.
TEXT.Polish: Strefa 51 (ang. Area 51, Dreamland ang. "Kraina marzeń" lub "Kraina snów", bądź Groom Lake, oficjalna nazwa: Air Force Flight Test Center, Detachment 3) - amerykańska baza wojskowa, zbudowana w roku 1957. Znajduje się w zachodniej części hrabstwa Lincoln na południu stanu Nevada, w Strefie Sił Powietrznych Nellis.

TEXT.English: Secret Army Base increases city's espionage by 100%, doubles military production and gives +2 free experience to units. Allows building SR-71 spy planes.
TEXT.French: une Base Militaire Secrète increases city's espionage by 100%, doubles military production and gives +2 free experience to units. Allows to build SR-71 spy planes.
TEXT.Spanish: La Base militar secreta aumenta el espionaje de la ciudad en un 100%, dobla la producción de unidades militares y proporciona +2 puntos de experiencia a las unidades entrenadas. Permite construir los aviones espía SR-71.

TEXT.English: Myth - Secretary Bird
TEXT.French: Mythe du Messager sagittaire

TEXT.English: Myth Effect - Secretary Bird
TEXT.French: Effet (Mythe du Messager sagittaire)

TEXT.English: Stories - Secretary Bird
TEXT.French: Histoires des Messagers sagittaires

TEXT.English: Stories Effect - Secretary Bird
TEXT.French: Effet (Histoires des Messagers sagittaires)

TEXT.English: Story - Secretary Bird
TEXT.French: Histoire du Messager sagittaire

TEXT.English: Security Center
TEXT.French: Centre de Sécurité
TEXT.Italian: Centro di sicurezza

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Rządowe Centrum Bezpieczeństwa - państwowa jednostka budżetowapodległa Prezesowi Rady Ministrów, zapewniająca obsługę Rady Ministrów, Prezesa Rady Ministrów, Rządowego Zespołu Zarządzania Kryzysowego i ministra właściwego do spraw wewnętrznych w sprawach zarządzania kryzysowego oraz pełniąca funkcję krajowego centrum zarządzania kryzysowego.

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Seminary

A seminary, theological college, or divinity school is a specialized and often live-in higher education institution for the purpose of instructing students (seminarians) in philosophy, theology, spirituality and the religious life, usually in order to prepare them to become members of the clergy. The English word is taken from the Latin seminarium, translated as seed-bed, the image from the Council of Trent document Cum Adulescentium Aetas which called for the first modern seminaries. As such, in the West, the term historically refers to Christian educational institutes for "clergy" as that term is understood by Roman Catholic, Eastern Orthodox and Anglicans, as many Protestant denominations preferred another term for their theological colleges. The Jewish equivalent to a Christian seminary is known as a Yeshiva. The term Madrasah is often used to describe an Islamic equivalent, although strictly speaking, this is just the Arabic word for school, and does not necessarily mean a theological establishment.
TEXT.French: A seminary, theological college, or divinity school is a specialized and often live-in higher education institution for the purpose of instructing students (seminarians) in philosophy, theology, spirituality and the religious life, usually in order to prepare them to become members of the clergy. The English word is taken from the Latin seminarium, translated as seed-bed, the image from the Council of Trent document Cum Adulescentium Aetas which called for the first modern seminaries. As such, in the West, the term historically refers to Christian educational institutes for "clergy" as that term is understood by Roman Catholic, Eastern Orthodox and Anglicans, as many Protestant denominations preferred another term for their theological colleges. The Jewish equivalent to a Christian seminary is known as a Yeshiva. The term Madrasah is often used to describe an Islamic equivalent, although strictly speaking, this is just the Arabic word for school, and does not necessarily mean a theological establishment.
TEXT.Polish: Seminarium duchowne (z łac. szkółka roślin, od semen - nasienie, seminis - narybek, latorośl) - w Kościołach chrześcijańskich specjalny dom, w którym kandydaci do stanu duchownego odbywają intensywną formacjęteologiczną, moralną i naukową.

TEXT.English: Provides a little Culture and a free Priest. This building requires State Church civic.
TEXT.French: Procure un peu de Culture et un Prêtre gratuit. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religion d'Etat[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Proporciona algo de cultura y un Sacerdote gratis. Este edificio requiere el principio Iglesia nacional.
TEXT.Polish: Daje malutki bonus do kultury i darmowego proroka. Wymaga doktryny Kościół Państwowy.

TEXT.English: Factory (Service Bots)

Service robots assist human beings, typically by performing a job that is dirty, dull, distant, dangerous or repetitive, including household chores. They typically are autonomous and/or operated by a build in control system, with manual override options. The term "service robot" is less well-defined. The International Federation of Robotics (IFR) has proposed a tentative definition, "A service robot is a robot which operates semi- or fully autonomously to perform services useful to the well-being of humans and equipment, excluding manufacturing operations."
TEXT.French: Service robots assist human beings, typically by performing a job that is dirty, dull, distant, dangerous or repetitive, including household chores. They typically are autonomous and/or operated by a build in control system, with manual override options. The term "service robot" is less well-defined. The International Federation of Robotics (IFR) has proposed a tentative definition, "A service robot is a robot which operates semi- or fully autonomously to perform services useful to the well-being of humans and equipment, excluding manufacturing operations."
TEXT.Polish: RoboSłużących to roboty usługujące w domach ludzi. Elektroniczni kamerdynarzy i sprzątaczki.

TEXT.English: Build a Service Bot Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de Robots de Service[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Service Bot Fabrik um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Service Bot Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: SETI Program
TEXT.French: Le Programme SETI
TEXT.Italian: Programma SETI

TEXT.English: SETI, the Search for Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence, is the collective name for a number of organized efforts to detect intelligent alien life. The generic approach of SETI projects is to survey the sky to detect the existence of transmissions from a civilization on a distant planet. In 1960, Cornell University astronomer Frank Drake performed the first modern SETI experiment, named "Project Ozma", after the Queen of Oz in L. Frank Baum's fantasy books. Drake used a 25-meter-diameter radio telescope at Green Bank, West Virginia, to examine the stars Tau Ceti and Epsilon Eridani. In 1974, the 305-meter Arecibo Radio Telescope in Puerto Rico was used to send a coded message of 1,679 bits towards the Globular Cluster M13, about 25,100 light years away. The pattern of 0s and 1s contained in the message defines a 23 times 73 two-dimensional grid which when plotted reveals some data about our location in the Solar System, a stylized figure of a human being, chemical formulae and an outline of the radio telescope itself. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1992, the U.S. government finally funded an operational SETI program, in the form of the NASA "Microwave Observing Program (MOP)". MOP was planned as a long-term effort, performing a "Targeted Search" of 800 specific nearby stars, along with a general "Sky Survey" to scan the sky. MOP was to be performed by radio dishes associated with the NASA Deep Space Network, as well as a 43-meter dish at Green Bank and the big Arecibo dish. The signals were to be analyzed by spectrum analyzers, each with a capacity of 15 million channels. MOP drew the attention of the U.S. Congress, where the program was strongly ridiculed, and was canceled a year after its start. However, SETI advocates did not give up, and in 1995 the nonprofit "SETI Institute" of Mountain View, California, resurrected the work under the name of Project "Phoenix", backed by private sources of funding. To date SETI has detected no confirmed alien signals, and the project itself remains controversial. Although the program has yet to find any proof of extraterrestrial life, it has produced many useful benefits to astronomy, telecommunications, and other high-tech fields.

The pattern of 0s and 1s contained in the message defines a 23 times 73 two-dimensional grid which when plotted reveals some data about our location in the Solar System, a stylized figure of a human being, chemical formulae and an outline of the radio telescope itself. [PARAGRAPH:2]In 1992, the U.S. government finally funded an operational SETI program, in the form of the NASA "Microwave Observing Program (MOP)". MOP was planned as a long-term effort, performing a "Targeted Search" of 800 specific nearby stars, along with a general "Sky Survey" to scan the sky.
