TEXT.English: Tradition Inheritance
TEXT.Italian: Trasmissione delle tradizioni

TEXT.English: Traffic Cameras

A traffic camera is a video camera which observes vehicular traffic on a road. Typically, these are put along major roads such as highways, freeways, motorways, autoroutes and expressways, as well as arterial roads, and are connected with optical fibers buried alongside or even under the road, with electrical power either provided by mains power in urban areas, or via solar panels or another alternate power source which provides consistent imagery without the threat of a power outage during inclement conditions.
TEXT.French: A traffic camera is a video camera which observes vehicular traffic on a road. Typically, these are put along major roads such as highways, freeways, motorways, autoroutes and expressways, ainsi querterial roads, and are connected with optical fibers buried alongside or even under the road, with electrical power either provided by mains power in urban areas, or via solar panels or another alternate power source which provides consistent imagery without the threat of a power outage during inclement conditions.
TEXT.Polish: Monitoring - oznacza regularne jakościowe i ilościowe pomiary lub obserwacje zjawiska czy obecności np. substancji, przeprowadzane przez z góry określony czas. Programy monitoringu są często stosowane w celu gromadzenia informacji na temat stanu ilościowego oraz jakościowego atmosfery i hydrosfery lub rozprzestrzeniania się zanieczyszczeń w czasie i przestrzeni. Zgromadzone dane ułatwiają wybór właściwych działań w przypadku szkodliwego wpływu tego stanu na życie i mienie człowieka czy stan środowiska. Pozwalają także na podjęcie akcji naprawczych lub usuwania skutków w już istniejącej sytuacji np. zagrożenia powodziowego czy ekologicznego.

TEXT.English: Build Traffic Cameras to increase your cities espionage.
TEXT.French: Construisez des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caméras de surveillance du Trafic[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'espionnage dans votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Traffic Cameras to increase your cities espionage.

TEXT.English: Trance Hut

Trance denotes a variety of processes, ecstasy, techniques, modalities and states of mind, awareness and consciousness. Trance states may occur involuntarily and unbidden. A Trance Hut is a hut where people take various drugs to get in trance.
TEXT.French: Trance denotes a variety of processes, ecstasy, techniques, modalities and states of mind, awareness and consciousness. Trance states may occur involuntarily and unbidden. A une Hutte de Transe is a hut were people take various drugs to get in trance.
TEXT.Polish: Trans - jeden z rodzajów odmiennych stanów świadomości. Stan umysłu charakteryzujący się zmienioną świadomością, co oznacza również zmienioną wrażliwość na bodźce. Trans może wywoływać stan obniżonej lub podwyższonej świadomości. Osoby pogrążone w transie mogą wykonywać określone czynności podświadomie, w sposób niekontrolowany przez świadomość.

TEXT.English: Build a Trance Hut to increase your cities happiness.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hutte de Transe[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le bonheur de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Trance Hut by zwiększyć zadowolenie w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Transgenics Lab

A genetically modified organism (GMO) is an organism whose genetic material has been altered using genetic engineering techniques. Organisms that have been genetically modified include micro-organisms such as bacteria and yeast, insects, plants, fish, and mammals. GMOs are the source of genetically modified foods, and are also widely used in scientific research and to produce goods other than food. The term GMO is very close to the technical legal term, 'living modified organism' defined in the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety, which regulates international trade in living GMOs (specifically, "any living organism that possesses a novel combination of genetic material obtained through the use of modern biotechnology").
TEXT.French: A genetically modified organism (GMO) is an organism whose genetic material has been altered using genetic engineering techniques. Organisms that have been genetically modified include micro-organisms such as bacteria and yeast, insects, plants, fish, and mammals. GMOs are the source of genetically modified foods, and are also widely used in scientific research and to produce goods other than food. The term GMO is very close to the technical legal term, 'living modified organism' defined in the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety, which regulates international trade in living GMOs (specifically, "any living organism that possesses a novel combination of genetic material obtained through the use of modern biotechnology").
TEXT.Polish: Organizmy modyfikowane genetycznie (GMO, z ang. genetically modified organisms) - organizmy, których genomzostał zmieniony metodami inżynierii genetycznej w celu uzyskania nowych cech fizjologicznych (lub zmiany istniejących). Pierwsze GMO zostało stworzone w 1973 roku, a pierwsze próby polowe miały miejsce w 1986 roku i dotyczyły tytoniu. Pierwsze komercyjne GMO zaczęto sprzedawać w USA - w pomidorach FlavrSavr zmniejszono aktywność genu odpowiadającego za proces dojrzewania i mięknięcia pomidora.

TEXT.English: Build a Transgenics Lab to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoire de Transgénique[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Transgenics Lab by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Factory (Transistors)

A transistor is a semiconductor device used to amplify and switch electronic signals and electrical power. It is composed of semiconductor material with at least three terminals for connection to an external circuit. A voltage or current applied to one pair of the transistor's terminals changes the current through another pair of terminals. Because the controlled (output) power can be higher than the controlling (input) power, a transistor can amplify a signal. Today, some transistors are packaged individually, but many more are found embedded in integrated circuits. The transistor is the fundamental building block of modern electronic devices, and is ubiquitous in modern electronic systems. Following its development in the early 1950s, the transistor revolutionized the field of electronics, and paved the way for smaller and cheaper radios, calculators, and computers, among other things.
TEXT.French: A transistor is a semiconductor device used to amplify and switch electronic signals and electrical power. It is composed of semiconductor material with at least three terminals for connection to an external circuit. A voltage or current applied to one pair of the transistor's terminals changes the current through another pair of terminals. Because the controlled (output) power can be higher than the controlling (input) power, a transistor can amplify a signal. Today, some transistors are packaged individually, but many more are found embedded in integrated circuits. The transistor is the fundamental building block of modern electronic devices, and is ubiquitous in modern electronic systems. Following its development in the early 1950s, the transistor revolutionized the field of electronics, and paved the way for smaller and cheaper radios, calculators, and computers, among other things.
TEXT.Polish: Tranzystor - trójelektrodowy (rzadko czteroelektrodowy) półprzewodnikowy element elektroniczny, posiadający zdolność wzmacniania sygnału elektrycznego. Nazwa urządzenia wywodzi się od słów transkonduktancja(transconductance) z "półprzewodnikowym" przyrostkiem -stor jak w warystor (varistor).

TEXT.English: Build a Transistor Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de transistors[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Transistor Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Treadmill Crane
TEXT.Italian: Gru medievale

TEXT.English: A treadwheel crane (magna rola) is a wooden, human powered, hoisting and lowering device. It was primarily used during Roman times and the Middle Ages in the building of castles and cathedrals. The often heavy charge is lifted as the individual inside the treadwheel crane walks. The rope attached to a pulley is turned onto a spindle by the rotation of the wheel thus allowing the device to hoist or lower the affixed pallet.
TEXT.French: A treadwheel crane (magna rola) is a wooden, human powered, hoisting and lowering device. It was primarily used during Roman times and the Middle Ages in the building of castles and cathedrals. The often heavy charge is lifted as the individual inside the treadwheel crane walks. The rope attached to a pulley is turned onto a spindle by the rotation of the wheel thus allowing the device to hoist or lower the affixed pallet.
TEXT.Polish: Żuraw Kieratowy to urządzenie dźwignicowe obsługujące przestrzeń ograniczoną stożkiem, którego wysokość określa maksymalna wysokość podnoszenia żurawia, a promień podstawy - wysięg. Żurawie dostępne są w różnych wielkościach od niewielkich, ręcznie napędzanych jednostek posiadających zasięg i wysokość podnoszenia rzędu paru metrów, do olbrzymich o zasięgu ponad stu metrów w obu kierunkach. Zawsze łączy je kilka wspólnych cech. Dwoma podstawowymi elementami konstrukcji żurawia jest kolumna i wysięgnik. Kolumna w wielu przypadkach zredukowana jest do obrotowej podstawy żurawia na której zainstalowany jest wychylny wysięgnik, niekiedy o budowie teleskopowej. Na końcu wysięgnika zainstalowany jest cięgnik. Taką konstrukcję mają żurawie samobieżne, żurawie portowe, żurawie stoczniowe oraz żurawie pływające. Innym rozwiązaniem jest gdy kolumna przyjmuje postać wysokiej (zwykle kratownicowej) wieży. Na jej szczycie zamontowany jest wychylny wysięgnik z cięgnikiem na końcu, bądź stały, (poziomy) z ruchomym cięgnikiem. Takie rozwiązanie konstrukcyjne stosowane jest w żurawiach wieżowych.

TEXT.English: Increases Production for Buildings.
TEXT.French: Augmente la vitesse de Construction des Bâtiments.
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la producción de edificios.

TEXT.English: Treasury
TEXT.Italian: Tesoreria

TEXT.English: A treasury is any place where the currency or items of high monetary value are kept. The term was first used in Classical times to describe the votive buildings erected to house gifts to the gods, such as the Siphnian Treasury in Delphi or many similar buildings erected in Olympia, Greece by competing city-states to impress others during the ancient Olympic Games. [PARAGRAPH:1]The head of a Treasury is typically known as a Treasurer. This position may not necessarily have the final control over the actions of the Treasury particularly if they are not an elected representative.
TEXT.French: A treasury is any place where the currency or items of high monetary value are kept. The term was first used in Classical times to describe the votive buildings erected to house gifts to the gods, such as the Siphnian Treasury in Delphi or many similar buildings erected in Olympia, Greece by competing city-states to impress others during the ancient Olympic Games. [PARAGRAPH:1]The head of a Treasury is typically known as a Treasurer. This position may not necessarily have the final control over the actions of the Treasury particularly if they are not an elected representative.
TEXT.Polish: Skarbiec - specjalne pomieszczenie lub budynek przeznaczony do gromadzenia i przechowywania cennych dokumentów, kosztowności. Skarbce budowano w pałacach, zamkach - przeznaczone do przechowywania skarbów i dokumentów państwowych lub właściciela zamku; skarbce w klasztorach, kościołach - przeznaczone do przechowywania klejnotów sakralnych, darów wotywnych, pamiątek narodowych. Część zgromadzonych w skarbcach dzieł sztuki często jest eksponowana na wystawach. Znane skarbce:

TEXT.English: Treasury increases wealth in your capital by 20% and in all other cities by 10%
TEXT.French: une Trésorerie increases wealth in your capital by 20% and in all other cities by 10%
TEXT.Spanish: La Tesorería aumenta el oro en tu capital en un 20%, y en un 10% en todas las demás ciudades.

TEXT.English: Tree Carvings
A tree that has been carved by fine edged tools to express a picture.
TEXT.French: A tree that has been carved by fine edged tools to express a picture.
TEXT.Polish: Do rzeźbienia w drewnie używa się specjalnych dłut, pobijanych knyplem. Dłuta te mogą być płaskie (proste lub skośne) albo o ostrzu w kształcie litery V lub U, dodatkowo dla wykonywania specjalnych cięć używa się dłut odpowiednio wyprofilowanych.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tree Carvings[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tree Carvings[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la production de [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production.

TEXT.English: Tree Platforms

Tree platforms have a variety of uses. Tree platforms cans be quiet getaways for children or adults, or a high-up space to feed and invite wildlife and birds. Smaller versions provide seating for vantage-point views and hunting stand. In Ancient Era they were used as lookout posts in forests.
TEXT.French: Tree platforms have a variety of uses. Tree platforms cans be quiet getaways for children or adults, or a high-up space to feed and invite wildlife and birds. Smaller versions provide seating for vantage-point views and hunting stand. In Ancient Era they were used as lookout posts in forests.
TEXT.Polish: Domek na drzewie lub dom na drzewie to platforma i/lub niewielki budynek zbudowany na gałęziach, w jego wnętrzu lub wokół pnia. Używane w celach społecznych (Lud Korowai lub Papuasi), rekreacyjnych, obserwacyjnych a także jako miejsce pracy

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tree Platforms[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] production. It also makes it more likely to catch enemy spies while making enemy espionage actions more expensive as well.
TEXT.French: Procure un bonus d'[ICON_ESPIONAGE].

TEXT.English: Triumph Column
TEXT.French: L'Arc de Triomphe

TEXT.English: Triumphal columns were one of the first forms of commemoration for great victories in battle. The column typically stands on a base and is crowned with a victory symbol, such as a statue. One such example is Trajan's column, commemorating the Roman emperor's victory in the Dacian Wars. The column is sculpted with spiral bas-reliefs representing the wars between the Romans and Dacians.
TEXT.French: Triumphal columns were one of the first forms of commemoration for great victories in battle. The column typically stands on a base and is crowned with a victory symbol, such as a statue. One such example is Trajan's column, commemorating the Roman emperor's victory in the Dacian Wars. The column is sculpted with spiral bas-reliefs representing the wars between the Romans and Dacians.
TEXT.German: Bei Sieges- oder Ehrensäulen handelt es sich um säulenförmige Denkmale, die zur Erinnerung an gewonnene Schlachten oder Kriege errichtet wurden. Sie sind rund um die Welt verbreitet und haben meist einen identischen Aufbau. Oben auf dem Säulenschaft, der auf einem Sockel oder einer Basis ruht und manchmal mit eingemeißelten Schlachtszenen oder Symbolen geschmückt ist, steht eine beeindruckende Siegesfigur. Dabei kann es sich z.B. um eine Siegesgöttin, ein Wappentier, einen Friedensengel oder eine Statue eines berühmten Feldherren handeln.[PARAGRAPH:2]Schon die alten Römer errichteten zu Ehren ihrer größten Helden Siegessäulen. Die berühmteste ist sicherlich die Trajanssäule auf dem gleichnamigen Forum in Rom. Sie wurde 113 n. Chr. zu Ehren von Kaiser Trajan errichtet und diente seither als Vorbild für viele weitere Ehrensäulen auf der ganzen Welt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die bekannteste deutsche Siegessäule ist die Berliner Siegessäule, die als Nationaldenkmal der Einigungskriege zwischen 1864 und 1873 errichtet wurde. Sie wird von einer goldenen Statue der Siegesgöttin Viktoria gekrönt, die im Volksmund auch Goldelse genannt wird.
TEXT.Polish: Innym zastosowaniem kolumny jest wykorzystanie jej jako części składowej pomnika, na głowicy której umieszcza się posąg. Jednym z najbardziej znanych pomików starożytnych jest Kolumna Trajana znajdująca się w Rzymie, natomiast najbardziej znanym polskimpomnikiem, z wykorzystaniem kolumny, jest barokowy pomnik Zygmunta III Wazy określany jako Kolumna Zygmunta w Warszawie.

TEXT.English: Truck Shipping Warehouse

Land or "ground" shipping can be by train or by truck (International English: lorry). In air and sea shipments, ground transport is required to take the cargo from its place of origin to the airport or seaport and then to its destination because it is not always possible to establish a production facility near ports due to limited coastlines of countries. Ground transport is typically more affordable than air, but more expensive than sea especially in developing countries like India, where inland infrastructure is not efficient.
TEXT.French: Land or "ground" shipping can be by train or by truck (International English: lorry). In air and sea shipments, ground transport is required to take the cargo from its place of origin to the airport or seaport and then to its destination because it is not always possible to establish a production facility near ports due to limited coastlines of countries. Ground transport is typically more affordable than air, but more expensive than sea especially in developing countries like India, where inland infrastructure is not efficient.

TEXT.English: Build a Truck Shipping Warehouse to increase your cities trade.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Entrepôt routier[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter le commerce de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Truck Shipping Warehouse by zwiększyć przychody z handlu w Twoich miastach.

TEXT.English: Tumen Amugulang Palace
TEXT.French: Le Palais Tumen Amugulang

TEXT.English: In the centre of the city was situated the palace of the Great Khaan-the Tumen Amugulang palace. Based on the records of William of Rubruck, most scholars maintain that in front of the palace was the Silver Tree fountain. However, there is a group of researchers who conclude that the famous fountain was inside the palace. According to Rubruck, there were 4 silver sculptures of lionsat the foot of the Silver Tree, and fermented mare's milk-airag, favourite drink of the Mongols, would run from their mouths. Four golden serpents twined round the tree. Wine would run out from the mouth of one serpent, airag-from the mouth of the second serpent, mead from the third, and rice beer from the fourth. The top of the tree was crowned by an angel blowing a bugle. The branches, leavesand fruits of the tree were all made of silver. The fountain was designed by a captive sculptor William of Paris. The Khaan himself would sit on the throne in the north of the yard in front of the palace. Men would sit in a row at the right hand of the Khaan and women would sit to the left.
TEXT.French: In the centre of the city was situated the palace of the Great Khaan-the Tumen Amugulang palace. Based on the records of William of Rubruck, most scholars maintain that in front of the palace was the Silver Tree fountain. However, there is a group of researchers who conclude that the famous fountain was inside the palace. According to Rubruck, there were 4 silver sculptures of lionsat the foot of the Silver Tree, and fermented mare's milk-airag, favourite drink of the Mongols, would run from their mouths. Four golden serpents twined round the tree. Wine would run out from the mouth of one serpent, airag-from the mouth of the second serpent, mead from the third, and rice beer from the fourth. The top of the tree was crowned by an angel blowing a bugle. The branches, leavesand fruits of the tree were all made of silver. The fountain was designed by a captive sculptor William of Paris. The Khaan himself would sit on the throne in the north of the yard in front of the palace. Men would sit in a row at the right hand of the Khaan and women would sit to the left.

TEXT.French: TBD

TEXT.English: Tumulus
TEXT.French: Tumulus
TEXT.Italian: Tumulo

TEXT.English: A tumulus (plural tumuli) is a mound of earth and stones raised over a grave or graves. Tumuli are also known as barrows, burial mounds, Hügelgrab or kurgans, and can be found throughout much of the world. A tumulus composed largely or entirely of stones is usually referred to as a cairn. A long barrow is a long tumulus, usually for numbers of burials. The method of inhumation may involve a dolmen, a cist, a mortuary enclosure, a mortuary house or a chamber tomb. Examples of barrows include Duggleby Howe and Maeshowe. The word tumulus is Latin for 'mound' or 'small hill', from the Proto-Indo-European root *teuh- with extended zero grade *tum-, 'to bulge, swell' also found in tumour, thumb, thigh and thousand. Tumulus can also refer to a formation caused by the uplift of lava on a pahoehoe flow field. The lava pushes up against the recently solidified surface creating tumuli along the surface.
TEXT.French: A tumulus (plural tumuli) is a mound of earth and stones raised over a grave or graves. Tumuli are also known as barrows, burial mounds, Hügelgrab or kurgans, and can be found throughout much of the world. A tumulus composed largely or entirely of stones is usually referred to as a cairn. A long barrow is a long tumulus, usually for numbers of burials. The method of inhumation may involve a dolmen, a cist, a mortuary enclosure, a mortuary house or a chamber tomb. Examples of barrows include Duggleby Howe and Maeshowe. The word tumulus is Latin for 'mound' or 'small hill', from the Proto-Indo-European root *teuh- with extended zero grade *tum-, 'to bulge, swell' also found in tumour, thumb, thigh and thousand. Tumulus can also refer to a formation caused by the uplift of lava on a pahoehoe flow field. The lava pushes up against the recently solidified surface creating tumuli along the surface.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Kurhany[\BOLD], rodzaj mogiły, w kształcie kopca o kształcie stożkowatym lub zbliżonym do półkolistego, z elementami drewnianymi, drewniano-kamiennymi lub kamiennymi (zobacz dolmen), w którym znajduje się komora grobowa z pochówkiem szkieletowym lub ciałopalnym. Pomieszczenia grobowe, nieraz bardzo rozbudowane, mają zwykle konstrukcję kamienną bądź drewnianą, czasem są kute w litej skale. Wschodnioeuropejskiemu słowu -kurhan odpowiada, używane w językach zachodnioeuropejskich, określenie -tumulus.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tumulus[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that increases a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] production and lowers [COLOR_GREEN]War Weariness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Les Tumulus abaissent le mécontentement lié à la guerre et ajoute de la culture.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Túmulos reducen el hastío bélico y proporcionan cultura.
TEXT.Polish: Kurhany obniżają niezadowolenie z wojny i zwiększają kulturę.

TEXT.English: Factory (Typewriters)

A typewriter is a mechanical or electromechanical machine for writing in characters similar to those produced by printer's type by means of keyboard-operated types striking a ribbon to transfer ink or carbon impressions onto the paper. Typically, one character is printed per keypress. The machine prints characters by making ink impressions of type elements similar to the sorts used in movable type letterpress printing. After their invention in the 1860s, typewriters quickly became indispensable tools for practically all writing other than personal correspondence. They were widely used by professional writers, in offices, and for business correspondence in private homes. By the end of the 1980s, word processors and personal computers had largely displaced typewriters in most of these uses in the Western world, but as of the 2010s the typewriter is still prominent in many parts of the world including India.
TEXT.French: A typewriter is a mechanical or electromechanical machine for writing in characters similar to those produced by printer's type by means of keyboard-operated types striking a ribbon to transfer ink or carbon impressions onto the paper. Typically, one character is printed per keypress. The machine prints characters by making ink impressions of type elements similar to the sorts used in movable type letterpress printing. After their invention in the 1860s, typewriters quickly became indispensable tools for practically all writing other than personal correspondence. They were widely used by professional writers, in offices, and for business correspondence in private homes. By the end of the 1980s, word processors and personal computers had largely displaced typewriters in most of these uses in the Western world, but as of the 2010s the typewriter is still prominent in many parts of the world including India.
TEXT.Polish: Maszyna do pisania - urządzenie mechaniczne o napędzie ręcznym lub elektrycznym, posiadające klawisze, które naciskane powodują wydrukowanie metodą typograficzną określonych znaków na umieszczonym w maszynie podłożu drukowym (najczęściej papierze). Urządzenie może być również wspomagane modułem elektronicznym umożliwiającym zapamiętywanie wpisywanego tekstu.

TEXT.English: Build a Typewriter Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine de machines à écrire[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Typewriter Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Ultrafuel Refinery
TEXT.French: Raffinerie d'Ultra-carburant

TEXT.English: An Ultrafuel Refinery produces Ultrafuel which is a technologically advanced source of massively enhanced biofuel.
TEXT.French: An un Raffinerie d'Ultra-carburant produces Ultrafuel which is a technologicaly advanced source of massively enhanced biofuel.

TEXT.English: Ultrafuel Refineries produce the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ultrafuel[COLOR_REVERT] necessary for mid-transhuman flight, spaceflight, and shockwave engines.
TEXT.French: Ultrafuel Refineries produce the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ultrafuel[COLOR_REVERT] necessary for mid-transhuman flight, spaceflight, and shockwave engines.

TEXT.English: Catacombs
TEXT.Italian: Catacombe

TEXT.English: A secret passage (or hidden passage or a secret tunnel) is a hidden route that is used to travel stealthily. Such passageways may be inside a building leading to a secret room, or be a way of entering (or exiting) somewhere without being seen. Hidden passages are a common feature of fiction, but have also served a variety of purposes throughout history. Hidden rooms have helped people evade capture or carry out illegal, religious, political, or smuggling activities.
TEXT.French: A secret passage (or hidden passage or a secret tunnel) is a hidden route that is used to travel stealthily. Such passageways may be inside a building leading to a secret room, or be a way of entering (or exiting) somewhere without being seen. Hidden passages are a common feature of fiction, but have also served a variety of purposes throughout history. Hidden rooms have helped people evade capture or carry out illegal, religious, political, or smuggling activities.
TEXT.Italian: Un passaggio segreto è un percorso nascosto, usato per muoversi di nascosto. Questi passaggi possono essere all'interno di un edificio, portando a una stanza segreta, o possono essere una via di entrata (o uscita) per passare senza essere visti. I passaggi segreti sono una caratteristica comune dei racconti di finzione, ma hanno avuti vari utilizzi nella storia. Le stanze segrete hanno evitato le persone a evitare la cattura o a condurre attività illegali, religiose, politiche o di contrabbando.
TEXT.Polish: Katakumby - cmentarz podziemny (starożytny etruski, rzymski, żydowski i starochrześcijański) w postaci nieregularnie rozplanowanego systemu korytarzy biegnących zazwyczaj w kilku kondygnacjach, rozgałęziających się, rozszerzających w komory, wydrążonych bardzo głęboko w ziemi.

TEXT.English: Catacombs allow discrete forms of trade, but possibly at the cost of your cities defense.
TEXT.French: les Catacombes permettent des formes discrètes d'échanges, mais au détriment de la défense de vos cités.
TEXT.Italian: Le catacombe permettono una limitata quantità di commercio, ma al prezzo delle tue difese cittadine.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Catacumbas permiten intercambios comerciales discretos, pero posiblemente a costa de la defensa de tus ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Katakumby pozwalają na dyskretną formę handlu, ale zwiększa utrzymanie obrony miasta.

TEXT.English: Underwater Hotel

Some hotels have accommodation underwater, such as Utter Inn in Lake Mälaren, Sweden. Hydropolis, project cancelled 2004 in Dubai, would have had suites on the bottom of the Persian Gulf, and Jules' Undersea Lodge in Key Largo, Florida requires scuba diving to access its rooms.
TEXT.French: Some hotels have accommodation underwater, such as Utter Inn in Lake Mälaren, Sweden. Hydropolis, project cancelled 2004 in Dubai, would have had suites on the bottom of the Persian Gulf, and Jules' Undersea Lodge in Key Largo, Florida requires scuba diving to access its rooms.
TEXT.Polish: Podwodny hotel to dwadzieścia pokoi, z których widok z okna będzie prawdziwie unikalny - gość będzie mógł obserwować to, co dzieje się za szklaną szybą. Nie zabraknie więc ryb czy pięknych raf koralowych. Panorama morska będzie też widoczna z kuchni, znajdującej się w dysku nadwodnym. Nad bezpieczeństwem pasażerów będzie czuwać system monitoringu, aktualizujący na bieżąco zagrożenia pogodowe i sejsmiczne. Z kolei na dachu nie będzie problemu z tym, by wylądował na nim helikopter. Warto wspomnieć o stałym dostępie do szybkiego internetu czy zestawie radiostacji uzupełnionym o linie telefonii satelitarnej.

TEXT.English: Build an Underwater Hotel to increase your cities gold
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hotel sous-marin[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter les revenus de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Underwater Hotel to increase your cities gold

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Units defending the city gain a %D1_Amount%% Combat Modifier against attacking %s2_Unit_Combat.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Les Unités défendant la ville gagnent un bonus de %D1_Amount%% contre des attaquants %s2_Unit_Combat.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Adds One Experience Point to the least trained %s1_UnitCombat Unit present in the city every %d1_Amount rounds.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Ajoute un point d'EXP à l'unité %s1_UnitCombat la moins entraînée présente dans la ville, tous les %d1_Amount rounds.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Aggiunge un punto esperienza all'unità addestrata di tipo %s1_UnitCombat presente in città ogni %d1_Amount turni.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Dodaje jeden punkt doświadczenia do szkolonych jednostek: %s1_UnitCombat w mieście w każdej turze przez %d1_Amount tur.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Builds %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% Slower
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Construit %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% fois plus lentement
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Costruisce %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% più lentamente

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Builds %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% Faster
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Construit %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% fois plus rapidement
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Costruisce %s1_Unit_Combat %d2_Amount%% più velocemente

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Units defending the city gain %D1_Amount%% additional Repel value against attacking %s2_Unit_Combat.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Les Unités défendant la ville gagnent un bonus de %D1_Amount%% en expulsion contre des attaquants %s2_Unit_Combat.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Le unità che difendono una città ottengono %D1_Amount%% al valore di Respinta contro %s2_Unit_Combat.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Jednostki broniące miasta otrzymują %D1_Amount%% dodatkowej wartości odepchnięcia przeciwko atakującym jednostkom: %s2_Unit_Combat.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]%d1_Amount%% additional Repel value to local defending %s2_Unit_Combat.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]%d1_Amount%% de Répulsion supplémentaire à l'unité %s2_Unit_Combat se défendant.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]%d1_Amount%% di Respinta supplementare a %s2_Unit_Combat che difendono.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]%d1_Amount%% dodatkowej wartości na odepchnięcie do lokalnie broniących jednostek: %s2_Unit_Combat.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Mod%% [ICON_GOLD] to Upgrade Units
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Mod%% [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer les Unités
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Mod%% [ICON_GOLD] per Aggiornare la/le Unità
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Mod%%[ICON_GOLD] para mejorar unidades

TEXT.English: % Strength to defending[SPACE]

TEXT.Italian: % Forza difensiva[SPACE]
TEXT.Spanish: % de fuerza defensiva[SPACE]

TEXT.English: United Nations
Universal Church

Unitarian Universalism is a theologically liberal religion characterized by its support for a "free and responsible search for truth and meaning." Unitarian Universalists do not share a creed; rather, they are unified by their shared search for spiritual growth. Unitarian Universalists draw on many theological sources and have a wide range of beliefs and practices. Both Unitarianism and Universalism trace their origins to Christian Protestantism and thus Unitarian Universalism has its historical roots in the Christian faith. But by the time they decided to combine their efforts at the continental level, the theological significance of these terms had expanded beyond the traditional Christian understanding. Today-s Unitarian Universalists appreciate and value aspects of other religions ranging from Judaism to Buddhism. Although Unitarian Universalist congregations and fellowships tend to retain some Christian traditions, such as Sunday worship with a sermon and the singing of hymns, they do not necessarily identify themselves as Christians, nor do they necessarily subscribe to Christian beliefs. The extent to which the elements of any particular faith tradition are incorporated into one's personal spiritual practices is a matter of personal choice in keeping with Unitarian Universalism's creedless, non-dogmatic approach to spirituality and faith development.
TEXT.French: Unitarian Universalism is a theologically liberal religion characterized by its support for a "free and responsible search for truth and meaning." Unitarian Universalists do not share a creed; rather, they are unified by their shared search for spiritual growth. Unitarian Universalists draw on many theological sources and have a wide range of beliefs and practices. Both Unitarianism and Universalism trace their origins to Christian Protestantism and thus Unitarian Universalism has its historical roots in the Christian faith. But by the time they decided to combine their efforts at the continental level, the theological significance of these terms had expanded beyond the traditional Christian understanding. Today-s Unitarian Universalists appreciate and value aspects of other religions ranging from Judaism to Buddhism. Although Unitarian Universalist congregations and fellowships tend to retain some Christian traditions, such as Sunday worship with a sermon and the singing of hymns, they do not necessarily identify themselves as Christians, nor do they necessarily subscribe to Christian beliefs. The extent to which the elements of any particular faith tradition are incorporated into one's personal spiritual practices is a matter of personal choice in keeping with Unitarian Universalism's creedless, non-dogmatic approach to spirituality and faith development.
TEXT.Polish: Unitarianizm - obok luteranizmu, kalwinizmu i anglikanizmu, jeden z głównych nurtów reformacji. Jego nazwa pochodzi od łacińskich słów "unus", czyli jeden i "unitas", czyli jedność. Jednym z pierwszych jego głosicieli był hiszpański lekarz i teolog Miguel Servet, który pod naciskiem Jana Kalwina został przez władze Genewy skazany na karę śmierci i spłonął na stosie. Do Polski unitarianizm dotarł na początku lat 60. XVI wieku. W latach 1562-1563 wyznający go bracia polscy, stworzyli własny zbór, tzw. zbór reformowany mniejszy, który był owocem rozłamu w małopolskim kalwinizmie. Ośrodkiem działania braci polskich, wśród których najbardziej znani byli Piotr z Goniądza, Grzegorz Paweł z Brzezin czy Szymon Budny. Odrzucali oni panujące powszechnie porządki feudalne i sami uprawiali ziemię. Sprzeciwiali się również służbie wojskowej, a na znak pacyfizmu nosili drewniane miecze.

TEXT.English: Increases Culture, Happiness, Health, and War Weariness. This building requires Secular civic.
TEXT.French: Augmente la culture, le bonheur, la santé, et le mécontentement lié à la guerre. Requiert la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Séculier[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Aumenta la cultura, la felicidad, la salud y el hastío bélico. Este edificio requiere el principio Secular.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa kulturę, zadowolenie, zdrowie i znużenie wojną. Wymaga doktryny Sekularyzm.

TEXT.English: Universal Translator
TEXT.French: Le Traducteur Universel
TEXT.Italian: Traduttore universale

TEXT.English: The Universal Translator's purpose is to offer an instant translation of any language. As a rule, a universal translator is instantaneous, but if that language has never been recorded, there is sometimes a time delay until the translator can properly work out a translation.
TEXT.French: The Le Traducteur Universel's purpose is to offer an instant translation of any language. As a rule, a universal translator is instantaneous, but if that language has never been recorded, there is sometimes a time delay until the translator can properly work out a translation.
TEXT.Polish: Uniwersalny Translator ma za zadanie natychmiastowe tłumaczenie w dowolnym języku. Co do zasady, uniwersalny tłumacz jest natychmiastowy, ale jeśli ten język nie zostałzapisany mogą być opóźnienia.

TEXT.English: Universal Translator grants two free technologies and increase wealth, science and culture in all cities.
TEXT.French: Le Traducteur Universel grants two free technologies and increase wealth, science and culture dans toutes les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El Traductor universal da dos tecnologías gratis y aumenta el oro, la investigación y la cultura en todas las ciudades.

TEXT.English: University
Factory (Unmanned Aircrafts)

An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), colloquially known as a drone, is an aircraft without a human pilot on board. Its flight is controlled either autonomously by computers in the vehicle or under the remote control of a pilot on the ground or in another vehicle. There are a wide variety of UAV shapes, sizes, configurations, and characteristics. Historically, UAVs were simple remotely piloted aircraft, but autonomous control is increasingly being employed. They are deployed predominantly for military and special operation applications, but also used in a small but growing number of civil applications, such as policing and firefighting, and nonmilitary security work, such as surveillance of pipelines. UAVs are often preferred for missions that are too "dull, dirty, and dangerous" for manned aircraft.
TEXT.French: An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), colloquially known as a drone, is an aircraft without a human pilot on board. Its flight is controlled either autonomously by computers in the vehicle or under the remote control of a pilot on the ground or in another vehicle. There are a wide variety of UAV shapes, sizes, configurations, and characteristics. Historically, UAVs were simple remotely piloted aircraft, but autonomous control is increasingly being employed. They are deployed predominantly for military and special operation applications, but also used in a small but growing number of civil applications, such as policing and firefighting, and nonmilitary security work, such as surveillance of pipelines. UAVs are often preferred for missions that are too "dull, dirty, and dangerous" for manned aircraft.

TEXT.English: Build an Unmanned Aircraft Factory to get access to Unmanned Aircrafts.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine d'Aéronefs sans pilotes[COLOR_REVERT] pour avoir accès à ces unités.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Unbemannte Flugzeug Fabrik um Zugang zu unbemannten Flugzeugen zu erhalten.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Unmanned Aircraft Factory to get access to Unmanned Aircrafts.

TEXT.English: Uterine Replicator

Massively decreases android cloning time, and inefficient for organic life cloning, since it lacks the abiogetic chemicals produced in Gestation Tanks. Cybernetic circuitry used in Androids cannot be built by a Gestation Tank because the use of abiogenetic chemicals corrupts the circuitry.
TEXT.French: Massively decreases android cloning time, and inefficient for organic life cloning, since it lacks the abiogetic chemicals produced in Gestation Tanks. Cybernetic circuitry used in Androids cannot be built by a Gestation Tank because the use of abiogenetic chemicals corrupts the circuitry.

TEXT.English: Build a Uterine Replicator to increase your cities growth.
TEXT.French: Construisez un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Réplicateur d'environnement in utéro[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la richesse de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Uterine Replicator to increase your cities growth.

TEXT.English: Vacation Resort
TEXT.French: Village de Vacances
TEXT.Italian: Villaggio vacanze

TEXT.English: A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishment operated by a single company. Such a self-contained resort attempts to provide for most of a vacationer's wants while remaining on the premises, such as food, drink, lodging, sports, entertainment, and shopping. The term "resort" sometimes is misused to identify a hotel that does not provide the other amenities required of a full resort. However, a hotel is frequently a central feature of a resort, such as the Grand Hotel at Mackinac Island, Michigan. A resort is not merely a commercial establishment operated by a single company, although in the late twentieth century this sort of facility became more common.
TEXT.French: A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishment operated by a single company. Such a self-contained resort attempts to provide for most of a vacationer's wants while remaining on the premises, such as food, drink, lodging, sports, entertainment, and shopping. The term "resort" sometimes is misused to identify a hotel that does not provide the other amenities required of a full resort. However, a hotel is frequently a central feature of a resort, such as the Grand Hotel at Mackinac Island, Michigan. A resort is not merely a commercial establishment operated by a single company, although in the late twentieth century this sort of facility became more common.
TEXT.Polish: Ośrodek wczasowy to kompleks domów wczasowych, ale także zespół domków kempingowych. Miejscowość wczasowa to wczasowisko.

TEXT.English: Vacation Resorts boost coastal cities' commerce, culture and happiness but decreases science. Maintenance costs increase slightly as well. If city has Safaris or Forest Preserves inside its radius, those improvements add free specialist to city.
TEXT.French: un Village de Vacancess boost coastal cities' commerce, culture and happiness but decreases science. Maintenance costs increase slightly as well. If city has Safaris or Forest Preserves inside it's radius, those improvements add free specialist to city.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Complejos vacacionales impulsan los ingresos, la cultura y la felicidad de las ciudades, pero reducen la producción científica. A su vez, los costes de mantenimiento aumentan ligeramente. Si la ciudad posee Zonas de safari o Reservas forestales en su radio, cada una de ellas añadirá un especialista gratis a la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Factory (Vacuum)

A vacuum cleaner is a device that uses an air pump to create a partial vacuum to suck up dust and dirt, usually from floors, and optionally from other surfaces as well. The dirt is collected by either a dustbag or a cyclone for later disposal. Vacuum cleaners, which are used in homes as well as in industry, exist in a variety of sizes and models' small battery-operated hand-held devices, domestic central vacuum cleaners, huge stationary industrial appliances that can handle several hundred litres of dust before being emptied, and self-propelled vacuum trucks for recovery of large spills or removal of contaminated soil.
TEXT.French: A vacuum cleaner is a device that uses an air pump to create a partial vacuum to suck up dust and dirt, usually from floors, and optionally from other surfaces as well. The dirt is collected by either a dustbag or a cyclone for later disposal. Vacuum cleaners, which are used in homes as well as in industry, exist in a variety of sizes and models' small battery-operated hand-held devices, domestic central vacuum cleaners, huge stationary industrial appliances that can handle several hundred litres of dust before being emptied, and self-propelled vacuum trucks for recovery of large spills or removal of contaminated soil.
TEXT.Polish: Odkurzacz - urządzenie elektryczne służące do oczyszczania przedmiotów, powierzchni lub powietrza z kurzu, innych sypkich zanieczyszczeń (np. okruchów, pyłu, wiórów) lub zbierania rozlanych płynów poprzez zasysaniepowietrza razem z zanieczyszczeniami.

TEXT.English: Build a Vacuum Factory to increase your cities gold.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine d'aspirateurs[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter l'or de votre ville.
TEXT.German: Baue eine Vacuum Fabrik um die Goldproduktion in deiner Stadt zu erhöhen.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Vacuum Factory by zwiększyć ilość złota w Twoim mieście.

TEXT.English: Venetian Arsenal
TEXT.French: L'Arsenal Vénitien

TEXT.English: The famous Grand Arsenal of Venice, world's first true industrial shipyard. At the peak of its efficiency in the early sixteenth century, the Arsenal employed some 16,000 people who apparently were able to produce nearly one ship each day, and could fit out, arm, and provision a newly-built galley with standardized parts on a production-line basis not seen again until the Industrial Revolution.[PARAGRAPH:2]Building graphics by Walter Hawkwood, Movie by Arian. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.French: The famous Grand Arsenal of Venice, world's first true industrial shipyard. At the peak of its efficiency in the early sixteenth century, the Arsenal employed some 16,000 people who apparently were able to produce nearly one ship each day, and could fit out, arm, and provision a newly-built galley with standardized parts on a production-line basis not seen again until the Industrial Revolution.[PARAGRAPH:2]Building graphics by Walter Hawkwood, Movie by Arian. Made into a module for RoM by Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.German: Das berühmte Venezianische Arsenal war Schiffswerft, Zeughaus und gleichzeitig Flottenstützpunkt der Republik Venedig. Es wird heute als größter Produktionsbetrieb Europas vor der Industrialisierung betrachtet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Mit dem Bau wurde bereits 1104 unter dem Dogen Ordelaf Falier begonnen. Aus den ursprünglichen zwei Grundstücken wurde durch mehrere Ausbauten zur Blütezeit Venedigs im 15. und 16. Jahrhundert ein insgesamt 32 ha großes Areal, das heute etwa ein Zehntel des historischen Zentrums der Stadt einnimmt. Zu Hochzeiten seiner Effizienz arbeiteten bis zu 30000 Menschen im Arsenal. Durch straff organisierte Arbeitsabläufe und genormte Bauteile war es möglich, eine Galeere pro Tag zu bauen. Im Krieg gegen die Türken wurden 1570 sogar 100 Galeeren in nur zwei Wochen fertiggestellt.[PARAGRAPH:2] Gebäudegrafik: Walter Hawkwood, Film: Arian. RoM-Modul von Dancing Hoskuld.
TEXT.Polish: Ogromny kompleks stoczniowy Arsenału (wł. Arsenale) usytuowany jest we wschodniej części dzielnicy Castello. Jego budowę rozpoczęto na pocz. XII w., a w szczytowym okresie, przypadającym na XV i XVI w., na terenie Arsenału wodowano jeden statek dziennie. Wtedy także swoją siedzibę posiadało tu ponad 300 morskich kompanii handlowych, dysponujących łącznie ok. 3 tys. statków. Potężny Arsenał stanowił niejako miasto w mieście, w tutejszych dokach, odlewniach, szwalniach żagli czy fabrykach lin pracowało kilkanaście tysięcy ludzi. W XV w. Arsenał słynął w całej Europie z wydajności pracy, a to dlatego, że bardzo wcześnie wprowadzono tu dla robotników ścisłe specjalizacje. Tutejsi rzemieślnicy, tzw. arsenalotti, byli w mieście prawdziwą elitą, która nie tylko mogła liczyć na dożywotnie zatrudnienie, ale która także pełniła wiele zaszczytnych funkcji podczas najważniejszych uroczystości państwowych.

TEXT.English: The Venetian Arsenal greatly improves the construction speed of naval units.
TEXT.French: L'Arsenal Vénitien améliore grandement la vitesse de construction des unités navales.
TEXT.German: Durch das Arsenal wird die Produktionsgeschwindigkeit von Marineeinheiten drastisch erhöht.
TEXT.Spanish: El Arsenal Veneciano mejora notablemente la velocidad de construcción de las unidades navales.

TEXT.English: Versailles
Village Hall
TEXT.Italian: Sala del consiglio

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Village Hall[COLOR_REVERT] is the administrative center of a village. Villages are a small-sized human settlement with a population ranging from a few hundred to a few thousand. In the past, villages were a usual form of community for societies that practice subsistence agriculture. Nowadays a village are places often located in rural areas.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Village Hall[COLOR_REVERT] is the administrative center of a village. Villages are a small-sized human settlement with a population ranging from a few hundred to a few thousand. In the past, villages were a usual form of community for societies that practice subsistence agriculture. Nowadays a village are places often located in rural areas.
TEXT.Polish: Sołtys - przedstawiciel lokalnej społeczności, przeważnie wiejskiej. Jego rola począwszy od średniowiecza ulegała poważnym zmianom i od 1990 roku w Polsce jest organem wykonawczym sołectwa.

TEXT.English: DW - Vintage Red
TEXT.French: Vignoble - Vendange Rouge
TEXT.Italian: Azienda vinicola-Rosso d'annata

TEXT.English: DW - Vintage White
TEXT.French: Vignoble - Vendange Blanc
TEXT.Italian: Azienda vinicola-Bianco d'annata

TEXT.English: A "vintage wine" is made from grapes that were all or mostly grown in a particular year, and labeled as such. Some countries allow a vintage wine to include a small portion that is not from the labeled vintage. Variations in a wine's character from year to year can include subtle differences in color, palate, nose, body and development. High-quality wines can improve in flavor with age if properly stored. Consequently, it is not uncommon for wine enthusiasts and traders to save bottles of an especially good vintage wine for future consumption.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the United States, for a wine to be vintage-dated and labeled with a country of origin or American Viticultural Area (AVA) (e.g. Sonoma Valley), 95% of its volume must be from grapes harvested in that year. If a wine is not labeled with a country of origin or AVA the percentage requirement is lowered to 85%.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vintage wines are generally bottled in a single batch so that each bottle will have a similar taste. Climate's impact on the character of a wine can be significant enough to cause different vintages from the same vineyard to vary dramatically in flavor and quality. Thus, vintage wines are produced to be individually characteristic of the particular vintage and to serve as the flagship wines of the producer. Superior vintages from reputable producers and regions will often command much higher prices than their average ones. Some vintage wines (e.g. Brunello, are only made in better-than-average years.[PARAGRAPH:2]For consistency, non-vintage wines can be blended from more than one vintage, which helps winemakers sustain a reliable market image and maintain sales even in bad years. One recent study suggests that for the average wine drinker, the vintage year may not be as significant for perceived quality as had been thought, although wine connoisseurs continue to place great importance on it.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia.
TEXT.French: A "vintage wine" is made from grapes that were all or mostly grown in a particular year, and labeled as such. Some countries allow a vintage wine to include a small portion that is not from the labeled vintage. Variations in a wine's character from year to year can include subtle differences in color, palate, nose, body and development. High-quality wines can improve in flavor with age if properly stored. Consequently, it is not uncommon for wine enthusiasts and traders to save bottles of an especially good vintage wine for future consumption.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the United States, for a wine to be vintage-dated and labeled with a country of origin or American Viticultural Area (AVA) (e.g. Sonoma Valley), 95% of its volume must be from grapes harvested in that year. If a wine is not labeled with a country of origin or AVA the percentage requirement is lowered to 85%.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vintage wines are generally bottled in a single batch so that each bottle will have a similar taste. Climate's impact on the character of a wine can be significant enough to cause different vintages from the same vineyard to vary dramatically in flavor and quality. Thus, vintage wines are produced to be individually characteristic of the particular vintage and to serve as the flagship wines of the producer. Superior vintages from reputable producers and regions will often command much higher prices than their average ones. Some vintage wines (e.g. Brunello, are only made in better-than-average years.[PARAGRAPH:2]For consistency, non-vintage wines can be blended from more than one vintage, which helps winemakers sustain a reliable market image and maintain sales even in bad years. One recent study suggests that for the average wine drinker, the vintage year may not be as significant for perceived quality as had been thought, although wine connoisseurs continue to place great importance on it.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia.
TEXT.Italian: Un vino d'annata è prodotto con uva prodotta tutta nello stesso anno; in alcuni paesi, un vino d'annata può contenere piccole quantità d'uva che appartengono ad altre annate Le differenze diun vino da un anno all'altro si riflettono nel colore, nel gusto, nell'odore, nel corpo e nello sviluppo. I vini d'alta qualità possono migliorare nel corso degli alberi con la stagionatura, se vengono conserbati correttamente. Perciò è comune che gli appassionati di vino tengano da parte le bottiglie di una certa annata per essere consumata in futuro.[PARAGRAPH:2]Negli Stati Uniti un vino può essere definito d'annata e ottiene una denominazione d'origine (AVA, American Viticulture Area) se contiene almeno il 95% dell'uva prodotta nell'anno in questione. Se un vino non ha una denominazione d'origine, la percentuale richiesta scende all'85%.[PARAGRAPH:2]I vini d'annata sono imbottigliati in una botte singola, in modo che ogni bottiglia abbia un gusto simile. Il clima ha un grande impatto sulle qualità di un vino: annate diverse dello stesso vino possono avere differenze enormi. Per questo i vini d'annata sono prodotti per avere caratteristiche specifiche ed uniche, e per dare fama al produttore. I vini d'annata più importanti e quelli più rinomati costano solitamente molto più dei vini comuni. Alcuni vini, come ad esempio il Brunello, vengono prodotti sono in speciali annate. [PARAGRAPH:2] I vini non d'annata possono essere mescolati da più di un'annata, permettendo ai produttori di avere un mercato stabile e mantenere le vendite anche nelle cattive annate. Studi recenti hanno dimostrato che i bevitori di vino normali non hanno una differenza significativa rispetto al vino non d'annata, anche s i sommelier continuano a sostenere questa differenza. [PARAGRAPH:2] Fonte: Wikipedia.
TEXT.Polish: Lokal w którym głównie podaje się wszelakiego rodzaju wina.

TEXT.English: DELUXE WINERIES. Group Wonder - only one of these can be built in empire.[NEWLINE]In game terms "vintage" just means best of type in the world.
TEXT.French: DELUXE WINERIES. Group Wonder - only one of these can be built in empire.[NEWLINE]In game terms "vintage" just means best of type in the world.
TEXT.Italian: Un vino d'annata è, in termini di gioco, il miglior vino al mondo.

TEXT.English: Virotherapy Clinic

Virotherapy is a treatment using biotechnology to convert viruses into therapeutic agents by reprogramming viruses to treat diseases. There are three main branches of virotherapy: anti-cancer oncolytic viruses, viral vectors for gene therapy and viral immunotherapy. In a slightly different context, virotherapy can also refer more broadly to the use of viruses to treat certain medical conditions by killing pathogens.
TEXT.French: Virotherapy is a treatment using biotechnology to convert viruses into therapeutic agents by reprogramming viruses to treat diseases. There are three main branches of virotherapy: anti-cancer oncolytic viruses, viral vectors for gene therapy and viral immunotherapy. In a slightly different context, virotherapy can also refer more broadly to the use of viruses to treat certain medical conditions by killing pathogens.
TEXT.Polish: Terapia wirusowa polega na selektywnym zakażaniu i uśmiercaniu przez wirusy komórek nowotworowych. Badacze testują różne sposoby naprowadzania wirusów (zwłaszcza adenowirusów) na komórki rakowe, bez szkody dla zdrowych tkanek. Dzieje się tak m.in. dlatego, że przed wniknięciem do komórki wirus musi przyłączyć się do odpowiedniego receptora na jego powierzchni. Ta relacja gospodarz-wirus jest oparta naswoistości tego zjawiska.

TEXT.English: Build a Virotherapy Clinic to increase your cities science.
TEXT.French: Construisez une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clinique de Virothérapie[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter la science de votre ville.
TEXT.Polish: Zbuduj Virotherapy Clinic by zwiększyć rozwój naukowy w Twoich miastach.

Polega na multimedialnym kreowaniu komputerowej wizji przedmiotów, przestrzeni i zdarzeń. Może on reprezentować zarówno elementy świata realnego (symulacje komputerowe), jak i zupełnie fikcyjnego (gry komputerowe science-fiction).

TEXT.English: Wall Street
Walls
Wang Zhen's Workshop
TEXT.French: L'Atelier de Wang Zhen

TEXT.English: Wang Zhen was an official of the Yuan Dynasty (1271 - 1368 AD) of China. He was one of the early innovators of the wooden movable type printing system. His illustrated agricultural treatise was also one of the most advanced of its day, covering a wide range of equipment and technologies available in the late 13th and early 14th century.
TEXT.French: Wang Zhen was an official of the Yuan Dynasty (1271 - 1368 AD) of China. He was one of the early innovators of the wooden movable type printing system. His illustrated agricultural treatise was also one of the most advanced of its day, covering a wide range of equipment and technologies available in the late 13th and early 14th century.
TEXT.Polish: Wang Zhen (1271-1333) - mandaryn z czasów dynastii Yuan, wynalazca ruchomych czcionek drukarskich
