TEXT.English: Exile Practices
TEXT.French: Pratiques de l'Exil

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Exile Practices[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era building that lowers a city's [COLOR_GREEN]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] generation but decreases [COLOR_RED]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] production. Once built a city can then train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Exile[COLOR_REVERT] units that have hidden nationality, meaning that they can go inside other civilizations without the need for signing open borders or declaring war, making them a useful early-game unit for exploration and harming rivals. It can (albeit rarely) spawn a hidden barbarian [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Exile[COLOR_REVERT] unit that can further worsen a city's [COLOR_RED]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] situation if not caught.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pratiques de l'Exil[COLOR_REVERT] est un bâtiment de l'ère préhistorique qui réduit la génération de [COLOR_GREEN]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] d'une ville mais diminue la production [COLOR_RED]d'espionnage[COLOR_REVERT]. Une fois construite, une ville peut alors former des[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Exilés[COLOR_REVERT], des unités qui ont une nationalité cachée, ce qui signifie qu'elles peuvent pénétrer dans d'autres civilisations sans avoir besoin de signer un traité de frontières ouvertes ou de déclarer la guerre, ce qui en fait une unité de début de jeu utile pour l'exploration et qui peut nuire à ses rivaux. Il peut (quoique rarement) engendrer une unité barbare cachée [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Exilé[COLOR_REVERT] qui peut aggraver encore la situation au niveau [COLOR_RED]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] d'une ville si elle n'est pas capturée.

TEXT.English: To be in exile means to be away from one's home while either being explicitly refused permission to return or being threatened with imprisonment or death upon return. It can be a form of punishment and solitude. Exile is an early motif in ancient Greek tragedy. In the ancient Greek world, this was seen as a fate worse than death as sometimes being in exile meant being against the elements or wild beasts that could leave a person critically injured and consequently suffer for a long time before finally succumbing to their wounds.
TEXT.French: Être en exil signifie s'éloigner de son domicile tout en se voyant explicitement refuser l'autorisation de rentrer ou être menacé d'emprisonnement ou de mort à son retour. Cela peut être une forme de punition et de solitude. L'exil est un des premiers motifs de la tragédie grecque antique. Dans le monde grec ancien, cela était considéré comme un sort pire que la mort car parfois en exil signifiait être contre les éléments ou les bêtes sauvages qui pouvaient laisser une personne gravement blessée et par conséquent souffrir longtemps avant de finalement succomber à leurs blessures.

TEXT.English: Surgeon's Office
TEXT.French: Cabinet de chirurgien

TEXT.English: A surgeon's is where a surgeon resides while he works.
TEXT.French: Un cabinet de chirurgien est l'endroit où réside un chirurgien pendant qu'il travaille.

TEXT.English: Surgeon's Office provides health to the city and helps units recover health. It replaces the Doctor's Office and unlocks a new Surgeon Unit. But it does not get replaced by a Hospital and as an Outpatient Surgical center, it remains valid until proper Medical Clinics emerge in the Modern Era.
TEXT.French: Le cabinet du chirurgien fournit de la santé à la ville et aide les unités à retrouver la santé. Il remplace le bureau du médecin et déverrouille une nouvelle unité de chirurgien. Mais il n'est pas remplacé par un hôpital et en tant que centre de chirurgie ambulatoire, il reste valable jusqu'à ce que des cliniques médicales appropriées émergent à l'ère moderne.

TEXT.English: Snake Oil Sales
TEXT.French: Snake Oil Sales

TEXT.English: If you're willing to put up with a small amount of crime and added disease as well as reduced education from this source of public misinformation, you can benefit from the taxes from its sales and can assist your criminals and healers to gain valuable experience. Particularly good for cities specialized in training these units or in desperate need of a financial boost.
TEXT.French: If you're willing to put up with a small amount of crime and added disease as well as reduced education from this source of public misinformation, you can benefit from the taxes from its sales and can assist your criminals and healers to gain valuable experience. Particularly good for cities specialized in training these units or in desperate need of a financial boost.

TEXT.English: Snake oil is an expression that originally referred to fraudulent health products or unproven medicine but has come to refer to any product with questionable or unverifiable quality or benefit. By extension, a snake oil salesman is someone who knowingly sells fraudulent goods or who is themselves a fraud, quack, charlatan, or the like. [PARAGRAPH:2]The use of snake oil long predates the 19th century, and it was never confined to the Americas. In Europe, viper oil had been commonly recommended for many afflictions, including the ones for which rattlesnake oil was subsequently favored (e.g., rheumatism and skin diseases). [PARAGRAPH:2]William S. Haubrich, in his book Medical Meanings (1997, American College of Physicians), mentions the hypothesis that the term came from the eastern United States. The Seneca people, indigenous to the New York and Pennsylvania region, would rub cuts and scrapes with the petroleum collected from oil seeps. European settlers observed this habit, and in mid-nineteenth century they began bottling and selling the substance as a cure-all. They named the product for the local tribe as "Seneca oil". Supposedly through mispronunciation, this became "Sen-ake-a oil" and eventually "snake oil". Haubrich remarked, "This story is almost too good to be true - which means it probably isn't." It appears to be a case of folk etymology, since no known historical evidence supports this explanation.
TEXT.French: Snake oil is an expression that originally referred to fraudulent health products or unproven medicine but has come to refer to any product with questionable or unverifiable quality or benefit. By extension, a snake oil salesman is someone who knowingly sells fraudulent goods or who is themselves a fraud, quack, charlatan, or the like. [PARAGRAPH:2]The use of snake oil long predates the 19th century, and it was never confined to the Americas. In Europe, viper oil had been commonly recommended for many afflictions, including the ones for which rattlesnake oil was subsequently favored (e.g., rheumatism and skin diseases). [PARAGRAPH:2]William S. Haubrich, in his book Medical Meanings (1997, American College of Physicians), mentions the hypothesis that the term came from the eastern United States. The Seneca people, indigenous to the New York and Pennsylvania region, would rub cuts and scrapes with the petroleum collected from oil seeps. European settlers observed this habit, and in mid-nineteenth century they began bottling and selling the substance as a cure-all. They named the product for the local tribe as "Seneca oil". Supposedly through mispronunciation, this became "Sen-ake-a oil" and eventually "snake oil". Haubrich remarked, "This story is almost too good to be true - which means it probably isn't." It appears to be a case of folk etymology, since no known historical evidence supports this explanation.

TEXT.English: Conspirators' Hideout
TEXT.French: Repaire de Conspirateurs

TEXT.English: Most importantly, grants access to the Scoundrel Unit. Gives some experience to Criminals and Ruffians. Slightly reduces anarchy times for civic changes but can have an impressive effect if built in many cities. Increases Research and Education by a token amount to represent the benefits provided to society by free thinking revolutionaries. Adds a touch of happiness as those who have resentments are able to express them and plot to make change, even if in secret. However, imposes a costly amount of crime, reduces the city's defense against espionage, and costs a small amount of espionage commerce as the same revolutionaries may seek the assistance of enemy nations.
TEXT.French: Most importantly, grants access to the Scoundrel Unit. Gives some experience to Criminals and Ruffians. Slightly reduces anarchy times for civic changes but can have an impressive effect if built in many cities. Increases Research and Education by a token amount to represent the benefits provided to society by free thinking revolutionaries. Adds a touch of happiness as those who have resentments are able to express them and plot to make change, even if in secret. However, imposes a costly amount of crime, reduces the city's defense against espionage, and costs a small amount of espionage commerce as the same revolutionaries may seek the assistance of enemy nations.

TEXT.English: Conspiracy (civil), an agreement between persons to deceive, mislead, or defraud others of their legal rights or to gain an unfair advantage. [PARAGRAPH:2]Conspiracy (criminal), an agreement between persons to break the law in the future, in some cases having committed an act to further that agreement.[PARAGRAPH:2]Conspiracy (political), an agreement between persons with the goal of gaining political power or meeting a political objective.[PARAGRAPH:2]The late Renaissance Era saw an emergence of political resistance and movements for change unparalleled in history. Leading to the French and American Revolutions, the people who drove these revolutions were inspired by political ideologies that, according to the state, represented a divisive criminal element, but by our modern perspective, represented the birthing movement to improve human rights and dignities.
TEXT.French: Conspiracy (civil), an agreement between persons to deceive, mislead, or defraud others of their legal rights or to gain an unfair advantage. [PARAGRAPH:2]Conspiracy (criminal), an agreement between persons to break the law in the future, in some cases having committed an act to further that agreement.[PARAGRAPH:2]Conspiracy (political), an agreement between persons with the goal of gaining political power or meeting a political objective.[PARAGRAPH:2]The late Renaissance Era saw an emergence of political resistance and movements for change unparalleled in history. Leading to the French and American Revolutions, the people who drove these revolutions were inspired by political ideologies that, according to the state, represented a divisive criminal element, but by our modern perspective, represented the birthing movement to improve human rights and dignities.

TEXT.English: Shooting Club
TEXT.French: Shooting Club

TEXT.English: Adds valuable experience to new Gun equipped units. Continues to support Archery units to a lesser extent. Replaces the Archery Range. Opens up access to the first gun-based Strike Team unit, the Sharpshooter.
TEXT.French: Adds valuable experience to new Gun equipped units. Continues to support Archery units to a lesser extent. Replaces the Archery Range. Opens up access to the first gun-based Strike Team unit, the Sharpshooter.

TEXT.English: The first shooting clubs were formed by German-speaking peoples in the 13th and 14th centuries. Membership was limited to men only. At first, bows and wheel-lock muskets were shot from the standing position, but by the 16th century, firearms with rifled barrels were used in public matches. Early club competitions were festive one-shot matches fired at elaborately painted wooden targets. Matches and shooting festivals for one or more clubs were routinely held on New Year's Day, religious holidays, and other special occasions. Prizes of gold and money were frequently awarded.
TEXT.French: The first shooting clubs were formed by German-speaking peoples in the 13th and 14th centuries. Membership was limited to men only. At first, bows and wheel-lock muskets were shot from the standing position, but by the 16th century, firearms with rifled barrels were used in public matches. Early club competitions were festive one-shot matches fired at elaborately painted wooden targets. Matches and shooting festivals for one or more clubs were routinely held on New Year's Day, religious holidays, and other special occasions. Prizes of gold and money were frequently awarded.

TEXT.English: Firing Range
TEXT.French: Firing Range

TEXT.English: Increases experience to Gun and Throwing units but drops support for Archery entirely. Replaces the Shooting Club. Opens up access to the Sniper.
TEXT.French: Increases experience to Gun and Throwing units but drops support for Archery entirely. Replaces the Shooting Club. Opens up access to the Sniper.

TEXT.English: A shooting-range or firing range is a specialized facility designed for firearms practice. Each facility is typically overseen by one or more supervisory personnel, called variously a range master or "Range Safety Officer" (RSO) in the United States or a range conducting officer (RCO) in the UK. These supervisory personnel are responsible for ensuring that all weapon safety rules are followed at all times.[PARAGRAPH:2]Shooting ranges can be indoor or outdoor and possibly restricted to certain types of firearms, e.g. handguns only or rifles, or they can specialize in certain shooting sports such Skeet shooting or 10 m Air Pistol/Rifle.
TEXT.French: A shooting-range or firing range is a specialized facility designed for firearms practice. Each facility is typically overseen by one or more supervisory personnel, called variously a range master or "Range Safety Officer" (RSO) in the United States or a range conducting officer (RCO) in the UK. These supervisory personnel are responsible for ensuring that all weapon safety rules are followed at all times.[PARAGRAPH:2]Shooting ranges can be indoor or outdoor and possibly restricted to certain types of firearms, e.g. handguns only or rifles, or they can specialize in certain shooting sports such Skeet shooting or 10 m Air Pistol/Rifle.

TEXT.English: Pawn Shop
TEXT.French: Pawn Shop

TEXT.English: Increases experience for Criminal units and gives a substantial bonus to Gold income. Spreads crime in the city extensively as it is a harbor for stolen goods to be sold. Loss of a little culture as it disenfranchises the goods of the nation. Gives access to the Thug unit.
TEXT.French: Increases experience for Criminal units and gives a substantial bonus to Gold income. Spreads crime in the city extensively as it is a harbor for stolen goods to be sold. Loss of a little culture as it disenfranchises the goods of the nation. Gives access to the Thug unit.

TEXT.English: Obviously not all real world Pawn Shops are the front of a criminal fencing racket but the ones in the game are. The black market often hides in plain sight blended in with legitimate operation.
TEXT.French: Obviously not all real world Pawn Shops are the front of a criminal fencing racket but the ones in the game are. The black market often hides in plain sight blended in with legitimate operation.

TEXT.English: Motorcycle Club
TEXT.French: Club de Bikers

TEXT.English: Opens access to the Biker Gang unit. Adds a significant amount of experience for Criminals. Is a very effective hideout for criminals. Motorcycle Clubs often engage in very profitable crime so increase the gold for the nation. These clubs are often skilled at mechanical repair and offer their services to the community to present a profitable front of innocence. Also, is a strong source of additional crime.
TEXT.French: Opens access to the Biker Gang unit. Adds a significant amount of experience for Criminals. Is a very effective hideout for criminals. Motorcycle Clubs often engage in very profitable crime so increase the gold for the nation. These clubs are often skilled at mechanical repair and offer their services to the community to present a profitable front of innocence. Also, is a strong source of additional crime.

TEXT.English: Few criminal enterprises have been so notorious as Biker Gangs operating under the guise of a 'club'. Sure, there are innocent Motorcycle Clubs and even the majority of them are. This is how the Criminal ones blend into society in plain sight. But this game representation is NOT that innocent riding organization. From Wikipedia: The abbreviations MC and MCC are both used to mean "motorcycle club" but have a special social meaning from the point of view of the outlaw or one percenter motorcycling subculture. MC is generally reserved for those clubs that are mutually recognized by other MC or outlaw motorcycle clubs. This is indicated by a motorcyclist wearing an MC patch, or a three piece patch called colors, on the back of their jacket or riding vest. Outlaw or one percenter can mean merely that the club is not chartered under the auspices of the American Motorcyclist Association, implying a radical rejection of authority and embracing of the "biker" lifestyle as defined and popularized since the 1950s and represented by such media as Easyriders magazine, the work of painter David Mann and others. In many contexts the terms overlap with the usual meaning of "outlaw" because some of these clubs, or some of their members, are recognized by law enforcement agencies as taking part in organized crime.
TEXT.French: Few criminal enterprises have been so notorious as Biker Gangs operating under the guise of a 'club'. Sure, there are innocent Motorcycle Clubs and even the majority of them are. This is how the Criminal ones blend into society in plain sight. But this game representation is NOT that innocent riding organization. From Wikipedia: The abbreviations MC and MCC are both used to mean "motorcycle club" but have a special social meaning from the point of view of the outlaw or one percenter motorcycling subculture. MC is generally reserved for those clubs that are mutually recognized by other MC or outlaw motorcycle clubs. This is indicated by a motorcyclist wearing an MC patch, or a three piece patch called colors, on the back of their jacket or riding vest. Outlaw or one percenter can mean merely that the club is not chartered under the auspices of the American Motorcyclist Association, implying a radical rejection of authority and embracing of the "biker" lifestyle as defined and popularized since the 1950s and represented by such media as Easyriders magazine, the work of painter David Mann and others. In many contexts the terms overlap with the usual meaning of "outlaw" because some of these clubs, or some of their members, are recognized by law enforcement agencies as taking part in organized crime.

TEXT.English: Automated Firing Range
TEXT.French: Automated Firing Range

TEXT.English: Increases experience to Gun and Throwing units further still. Replaces the Firing Range. Opens up access to the Modern Sniper.
TEXT.French: Increases experience to Gun and Throwing units further still. Replaces the Firing Range. Opens up access to the Modern Sniper.

TEXT.English: As mechanical automations improve, target practice can now include popup and moving targets, momentary varying range challenges, as well as very complex scenarios where one must quickly determine friend from foe before pulling the trigger. This enhances the degree of effectiveness in training for both military and police personell as well as for civilian gun owners. A shooting-range or firing range is a specialized facility designed for firearms practice. Each facility is typically overseen by one or more supervisory personnel, called variously a range master or "Range Safety Officer" (RSO) in the United States or a range conducting officer (RCO) in the UK. These supervisory personnel are responsible for ensuring that all weapon safety rules are followed at all times.[PARAGRAPH:2]Shooting ranges can be indoor or outdoor and possibly restricted to certain types of firearms, e.g. handguns only or rifles, or they can specialize in certain shooting sports such Skeet shooting or 10 m Air Pistol/Rifle.
TEXT.French: As mechanical automations improve, target practice can now include popup and moving targets, momentary varying range challenges, as well as very complex scenarios where one must quickly determine friend from foe before pulling the trigger. This enhances the degree of effectiveness in training for both military and police personell as well as for civilian gun owners. A shooting-range or firing range is a specialized facility designed for firearms practice. Each facility is typically overseen by one or more supervisory personnel, called variously a range master or "Range Safety Officer" (RSO) in the United States or a range conducting officer (RCO) in the UK. These supervisory personnel are responsible for ensuring that all weapon safety rules are followed at all times.[PARAGRAPH:2]Shooting ranges can be indoor or outdoor and possibly restricted to certain types of firearms, e.g. handguns only or rifles, or they can specialize in certain shooting sports such Skeet shooting or 10 m Air Pistol/Rifle.

TEXT.English: Bivouac Grounds
TEXT.French: Bivouac Grounds

TEXT.English: Increases experience to all Combatants. Opens up access to Special Forces units.
TEXT.French: Increases experience to all Combatants. Opens up access to Special Forces units.

TEXT.English: Modern militaries often utilize large tracts of land for their most intensive training. From Wikipedia: A military camp or bivouac is a semi-permanent facility for the lodging of an army. Camps are erected when a military force travels away from a major installation or fort during training or operations, and often have the form of large campsites.
TEXT.French: Modern militaries often utilize large tracts of land for their most intensive training. From Wikipedia: A military camp or bivouac is a semi-permanent facility for the lodging of an army. Camps are erected when a military force travels away from a major installation or fort during training or operations, and often have the form of large campsites.

TEXT.English: Black Hat Hideout
TEXT.French: Repaire de "Chapeaux noirs"

TEXT.English: Increases experience to Criminals. As it is secretly state funded, it actually helps quite a bit with both gold and espionage. Opens up access to Cyber Criminal units. Unleashes a large amount of crime. Hackers are very good at overcoming all manner of computer glitches, so they can, at times, be called upon to repair damaged tech.
TEXT.French: Increases experience to Criminals. As it is secretly state funded, it actually helps quite a bit with both gold and espionage. Opens up access to Cyber Criminal units. Unleashes a large amount of crime. Hackers are very good at overcoming all manner of computer glitches, so they can, at times, be called upon to repair damaged tech.

TEXT.English: From Wikipedia: A black hat hacker is a hacker who "violates computer security for little reason beyond maliciousness or for personal gain." Black hat hackers form the stereotypical, illegal hacking groups often portrayed in popular culture, and are "the epitome of all that the public fears in a computer criminal". Black hat hackers break into secure networks to destroy, modify, or steal data; or to make the network unusable for those who are authorized to use the network. Black hat hackers are also referred to as the "crackers" within the security industry and by modern programmers. Crackers keep the awareness of the vulnerabilities to themselves and do not notify the general public or the manufacturer for patches to be applied. Individual freedom and accessibility is promoted over privacy and security. Once they have gained control over a system, they may apply patches or fixes to the system only to keep their reigning control. Richard Stallman invented the definition to express the maliciousness of a criminal hacker versus a white hat hacker who performs hacking duties to identify places to repair.
TEXT.French: From Wikipedia: A black hat hacker is a hacker who "violates computer security for little reason beyond maliciousness or for personal gain." Black hat hackers form the stereotypical, illegal hacking groups often portrayed in popular culture, and are "the epitome of all that the public fears in a computer criminal". Black hat hackers break into secure networks to destroy, modify, or steal data; or to make the network unusable for those who are authorized to use the network. Black hat hackers are also referred to as the "crackers" within the security industry and by modern programmers. Crackers keep the awareness of the vulnerabilities to themselves and do not notify the general public or the manufacturer for patches to be applied. Individual freedom and accessibility is promoted over privacy and security. Once they have gained control over a system, they may apply patches or fixes to the system only to keep their reigning control. Richard Stallman invented the definition to express the maliciousness of a criminal hacker versus a white hat hacker who performs hacking duties to identify places to repair.

TEXT.English: Orbital Targets
TEXT.French: Cibles Orbitales

TEXT.English: Replaces the Automated Firing Range with satellites placed in orbit to provide target practice for extremely long range targeting. Includes the ground version of the Firing Range in its definition but adds this extra layer of skill training now that hand held targeting systems have become so advanced and laser weaponry has become the mainstay. Unlocks the High Tech Sniper unit.
TEXT.French: Remplace le champ de tir automatisé par des satellites placés en orbite pour fournir une pratique ciblée pour un ciblage à très longue portée. Inclut la version au sol du champ de tir dans sa définition, mais ajoute cette couche supplémentaire de formation des compétences maintenant que les systèmes de ciblage portatifs sont devenus si avancés et que les armes laser sont devenues le pilier. Déverrouille l'unité High Tech Sniper.

TEXT.English: Satellites for Target practice from a standard Firing Range facility.
TEXT.French: Satellites pour la pratique des cibles depuis une installation de tir standard.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Can spawn a barbarian %s1_Unit.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Peut faire appaître un %s1_Unit barbare.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Can spawn a friendly %s1_Unit.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Peut faire apparaître un %s1_Unit amical.

TEXT.English: Spy Network
TEXT.French: Réseau d'Espions

TEXT.English: Build better espionage units
TEXT.French: Permet d'entraîner de meilleurs espions

TEXT.English: Know yourself and know your enemy
TEXT.French: Connais-toi toi-même, et connais tes ennemis...
TEXT.German: Kenne deinen Feind wie dich selbst.

TEXT.English: Spy Training Facility
TEXT.French: Centre d'entraînement d'Espions

TEXT.English: Build better espionage units
TEXT.French: Permet d'entraîner de meilleurs espions

TEXT.English: Trained spies are better.
TEXT.French: Les espions bien entraînés sont bien plus efficaces.

TEXT.English: Spy Hideout
TEXT.French: Repaire d'Espions

TEXT.English: Improve your counter intelligence.
TEXT.French: Améliore le contre-espionnage.

TEXT.English: In the game these are used to help train better spies and improve your defense against foreign espionage.
TEXT.French: Dans le jeu, ceux-ci sont utilisés pour aider à former de meilleurs espions et à améliorer votre défense contre l'espionnage étranger.
TEXT.Polish: W grze tego typu placówki są wykorzystywane do trenowania szpiegów i zwikszania twoich możliwości kontrwywiadowczych.

TEXT.English: Spy Safe House
TEXT.French: Planque sécurisée pour Espion

TEXT.English: Improve your counter intelligence.
TEXT.French: Améliore le contre-espionnage.

TEXT.English: In the game these are used to help train better spies and improve your defense against foreign espionage.
TEXT.French: In the game these are used to help train better spies and improve your defense against foreign espionage.
TEXT.German: Im Spiel hilft dies um Spione besser zu trainieren und verbessert die Abwehr gegen fremde Spionage.
TEXT.Polish: W grze tego typu placówki są wykorzystywane do trenowania szpiegów i zwikszania twoich możliwości kontrwywiadowczych.

TEXT.English: School of Rhetoric
TEXT.French: Ecole de Rhétorique

TEXT.English: School of Rhetoric
TEXT.French: Ecole de Rhétorique
TEXT.Italian: La retorica è l'arte di parlar bene (dal greco rhetorikè téchne, "arte del dire"). Essa è la disciplina che studia il metodo di composizione dei discorsi, ovvero come organizzare il linguaggio naturale (non simbolico) secondo un criterio per il quale a una proposizione segua una conclusione. Sotto questo aspetto essa è un metalinguaggio, in quanto cioè un "discorso sul discorso".Lo scopo della retorica è la persuasione, intesa come approvazione della tesi dell'oratore da parte di uno specifico uditorio. Da un lato, la persuasione consiste in un fenomeno emotivo di assenso psicologico; per altro verso ha una base epistemologica: lo studio dei fondamenti della persuasione è studio degli elementi che, connettendo diverse proposizioni tra loro, portano a una conclusione condivisa, quindi dei modi di disvelamento della verità nello specifico campo del discorso.
TEXT.Polish: Retoryka umiejętność przemawiania. Zgodnie z tym podstawowym znaczeniem terminu, uczy ona artystycznej budowy wypowiedzi w mowie i piśmie. Z czasem ta zarodkowa idea rozrosła się w specjalną dziedzinę nauki, stała się sztuką oraz ideałem życiowym, a nawet filarem kultury antycznej. W średniowieczu była jednym z podstawowych przedmiotów szkolnych, wykładanych w ramach sztuk wyzwolonych. Do XIX wieku, w kulturze europejskiej, była powszechnie uważana za niezbędny element wykształcenia.

TEXT.English: School of Rhetoric
TEXT.French: Ecole de Rhétorique
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci una scuola di retorica per fornire XP gratuita alle tue unità diplomatiche e alle tue spie.

TEXT.English: Elite Military Academies
TEXT.French: Elite Military Academies

TEXT.English: You may only build one Elite Military Academy (MA). Any Elite Military Academy may only be built once Globally. Thus, they are both World Wonders and limited to one from the set to each civilization. If you conquer one, you will keep it but if you haven't built one before you do, you will still be unable to build one of your own. Choose your Elite Military Academy wisely. There are Land, Water, and Air focused Military Academies within the set. You choose your nations strengths.
TEXT.French: You may only build one Elite Military Academy (MA). Any Elite Military Academy may only be built once Globally. Thus, they are both World Wonders and limited to one from the set to each civilization. If you conquer one, you will keep it but if you haven't built one before you do, you will still be unable to build one of your own. Choose your Elite Military Academy wisely. There are Land, Water, and Air focused Military Academies within the set. You choose your nations strengths.

TEXT.English: MA Accademia Aeronautica
TEXT.French: MA Accademia Aeronautica

TEXT.English: The Accademia Aeronautica is the Italian Air Force Academy, the institute for the training of Air Force officers. It's located in Pozzuoli in the province of Naples, in the Italian region of Campania. Among the oldest aviation academies in the world, it was founded in 1923.
TEXT.French: The Accademia Aeronautica is the Italian Air Force Academy, the institute for the training of Air Force officers. It's located in Pozzuoli in the province of Naples, in the Italian region of Campania. Among the oldest aviation academies in the world, it was founded in 1923.

TEXT.English: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accademia Aeronautica[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with six additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Accademia Aeronautica[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with six additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: MA Evelpidon Military Academy
TEXT.French: MA Evelpidon Military Academy

TEXT.English: The Evelpidon Military Academy "Military School for Aspirant [Officers]" is the Officer cadet school of the Greek Army and the oldest tertiary level educational institution in Greece. It was founded in 1828 in Nafplion by Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first Governor of the modern Greek State.
TEXT.French: The Evelpidon Military Academy "Military School for Aspirant [Officers]" is the Officer cadet school of the Greek Army and the oldest tertiary level educational institution in Greece. It was founded in 1828 in Nafplion by Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first Governor of the modern Greek State.

TEXT.English: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Evelpidon Military Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with four additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Evelpidon Military Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with four additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: MA Royal Air Force Academy
TEXT.French: MA Royal Air Force Academy

TEXT.English: The Royal Air Force College (RAFC) is the Royal Air Force training and education academy which provides initial training to all RAF personnel who are preparing to be commissioned officers. The College also provides initial training to aircrew cadets and is responsible for all RAF recruiting along with officer and aircrew selection. Originally established as a naval aviation training centre during World War I, the College was established as the world's first air academy in 1919. During World War II, the College was closed and its facilities were used as a flying training school. Reopening after the War, the College absorbed the Royal Air Force Technical College in 1966.
TEXT.French: The Royal Air Force College (RAFC) is the Royal Air Force training and education academy which provides initial training to all RAF personnel who are preparing to be commissioned officers. The College also provides initial training to aircrew cadets and is responsible for all RAF recruiting along with officer and aircrew selection. Originally established as a naval aviation training centre during World War I, the College was established as the world's first air academy in 1919. During World War II, the College was closed and its facilities were used as a flying training school. Reopening after the War, the College absorbed the Royal Air Force Technical College in 1966.

TEXT.English: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Royal Air Force Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with four additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Royal Air Force Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with four additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: MA Republic Naval Academy
TEXT.French: MA Republic Naval Academy

TEXT.English: The Republic Naval Academy is the military academy for the navy of the Republic of China (Taiwan), and is located at Zuoying District, Kaohsiung City, Taiwan
TEXT.French: The Republic Naval Academy is the military academy for the navy of the Republic of China (Taiwan), and is located at Zuoying District, Kaohsiung City, Taiwan

TEXT.English: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Republic Naval Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with six additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Admiral[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: All military units built in a city with a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Republic Naval Academy[COLOR_REVERT] building begin with six additional experience points. Further, its city is more likely to generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Admiral[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: MA Imperial Naval Academy
TEXT.French: MA Imperial Naval Academy

TEXT.English: The Imperial Naval Academy was a school established to train officers for the Imperial Japanese Navy. It was originally located in Nagasaki, moved to Yokohama in 1866, and was relocated to Tsukiji, Tokyo in 1869. It moved to Etajima, Hiroshima in 1888. Students studied for three or four years, and upon graduation were commissioned as midshipmen, attaining the rank of ensign after a period of active duty and an overseas cruise. In 1943, a separate school for naval aviation was opened in Iwakuni, and in 1944, another naval aviation school was established in Maizuru. The Academy was closed in 1945, when the Imperial Japanese Navy was abolished. The Naval Academy Etajima opened in 1956 and the site now serves as the location for Officer Candidate School of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.
TEXT.French: The Imperial Naval Academy was a school established to train officers for the Imperial Japanese Navy. It was originally located in Nagasaki, moved to Yokohama in 1866, and was relocated to Tsukiji, Tokyo in 1869. It moved to Etajima, Hiroshima in 1888. Students studied for three or four years, and upon graduation were commissioned as midshipmen, attaining the rank of ensign after a period of active duty and an overseas cruise. In 1943, a separate school for naval aviation was opened in Iwakuni, and in 1944, another naval aviation school was established in Maizuru. The Academy was closed in 1945, when the Imperial Japanese Navy was abolished. The Naval Academy Etajima opened in 1956 and the site now serves as the location for Officer Candidate School of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.

TEXT.English: Hippodrome

The Hippodrome of Constantinople (literally "Horse Path" in Greek) was constructed in 203 AD by the Emperor Septimius Severus. The building was a massive venue for chariot races. While the art of charioteering saw great advances in the Hippodrome - the first four-horse races were held here - much of the venue's renown would stem from its involvement in one of the most terrible massacres in Byzantine history. During the Nika Revolts, a brutal uprising between rival racing factions, nearly 30000 rioters were slain by Byzantine troops within the Hippodrome.
TEXT.French: L'hippodrome de Constantinople (littéralement "Chemin du cheval" en grec) fut construit en 203 ap. J.C. par l'empereur Septime Sévère. Ce bâtiment est un immense lieu consacré aux courses de chars. Tandis que la conduite des chars connut de grandes avancées dans cet Hippodrome - c'est ici qu'eurent lieu les premières courses à quatre chevaux - une grande partie de la célébrité de ce lieu est due à son rôle dans l'un des plus terribles massacres de l'histoire byzantine. Pendant l'insurrection Nika, révolte brutale qui opposa deux factions rivales, presque 30 000 insurgés furent tués par les troupes byzantines à l'intérieur de l'hippodrome.
TEXT.German: Das Hippodrom von Konstantinopel (wörtlich: griechisch "Pferdepfad") wurde 203 n. Chr. von Kaiser Septimius Severus errichtet. Das Gebäude war ein gewaltiger Veranstaltungsplatz für Wagenrennen. Obwohl die Kunst des Wagenlenkens im Hippodrom große Fortschritte machte - hier wurden die ersten Vierspännerrennen abgehalten - stammt viel von seiner Berühmtheit aus seiner Verwicklung in eines der schrecklichsten Massaker der byzantinischen Geschichte. Während des Nika-Aufstands, einer brutalen Revolte rivalisierender Parteien, wurden nahezu 30000 Aufständische im Hippodrom von byzantinischen Truppen getötet.
TEXT.Italian: L'Ippodromo di Costantinopoli (letteralmente "luogo dove corrono di cavalli", in greco) fu costruito nel 203 d.C. dall'imperatore Settimio Severo. L'edificio era una gigantesca sede per le corse coi carri. Mentre l'arte della corsa coi carri fece grandi passi avanti nell'Ippodromo (vi si tennero le prime corse con carri a quattro cavalli), gran parte della fama di questo luogo nacque dal suo coinvolgimento in uno dei più terribili massacri della storia bizantina. Durante la Rivolta di Nika, una brutale lotta tra fazioni rivali, quasi 30.000 riottosi vennero uccisi dalle truppe bizantine all'interno dell'ippodromo.
TEXT.Spanish: El hipódromo (en griego "camino de los caballos") de Constantinopla fue erigido en el año 203 d. C. por el emperador Septimo Severo. Era un colosal escenario en el que se celebraban carreras de carros. Aunque las carreras vivieron grandes avances en el hipódromo (se llegaron a celebrar carreras de cuatro caballos), parte de su fama derivaría de su relación con una de las más terribles masacres de la historia de Bizancio. Durante la revuelta de Nika, un brutal levantamiento entre facciones rivales, casi 30.000 personas fueron asesinadas en el interior del hipódromo por las tropas bizantinas.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippodrome[COLOR_REVERT], the Byzantine replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre[COLOR_REVERT], provides a bonus to happiness, an extra happiness for access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] and an increased happiness bonus from money dedicated to your cultural slider.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippodrome[COLOR_REVERT] (bâtiment byzantin qui remplace le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Théâtre[COLOR_REVERT]) confère un bonus de bonheur, un visage heureux supplémentaire dû à l'accès aux [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Chevaux[COLOR_REVERT] et un bonus de bonheur augmenté en raison de l'argent consacré à votre réglette de culture.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippodrom[COLOR_REVERT], die byzantinische Variante des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theaters[COLOR_REVERT], gewährt einen Zufriedenheitsbonus, einen zusätzlichen Zufriedenheitsbonus für den Zugang zu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pferden[COLOR_REVERT] sowie einen erhöhten Zufriedenheitsbonus für Goldinvestitionen in die Regelung des Kulturwertes.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ippodromo[COLOR_REVERT], l'equivalente bizantino del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Teatro[COLOR_REVERT], dà un bonus di felicità, un'ulteriore felicità se hai accesso ai [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cavalli[COLOR_REVERT] e un bonus maggiorato di felicità se assegni soldi all'indicatore della cultura.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hipódromo[COLOR_REVERT], el sustituto bizantino del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Teatro[COLOR_REVERT], da una bonificación a la felicidad, 1 más de felicidad por acceder a los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caballos[COLOR_REVERT] y un aumento de la bonificación a la cultura por el dinero destinado al control deslizante de cultura.

TEXT.English: Since the middle of the 20th century, the airplane has been one of the chief means of long-distance transport in the world. Nearly every major metropolitan area today has at least one airport, with facilities to handle passengers and ticketing, as well as facilities for refueling and repairing the aircraft that land there. Beginning in the 1940s, the growing role of airplanes as combat vehicles led to the widespread construction of military air bases. Nearly 400 of these facilities in the U.S. alone act as bases and maintenance facilities for aircraft assigned to all branches of the military.
TEXT.French: Depuis le milieu du XXe siècle, l'avion est devenu l'un des principaux moyens de transport longue distance dans le monde. Pratiquement toutes les grandes métropoles possèdent au moins un aéroport, disposant d'installations permettant d'accueillir les passagers et d'assurer la vente de billets ainsi que d'infrastructures de ravitaillement en carburant et de réparation pour la flotte aérienne qui y atterrit. Utilisés pour la première fois comme véhicules de combat dans les années 1940, les avions ont joué un rôle de plus en plus important, ce qui a conduit à la généralisation de la construction de bases aériennes militaires. A eux seuls, les Etats-Unis comptent près de 400 installations de ce type qui servent de bases et d'installations de maintenance pour les avions de tous les corps d'armée.
TEXT.German: Seit Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts zählt das Flugzeug zu den wichtigsten Langstreckentransportmitteln der Welt. Nahezu jede Großstadt unterhält mindestens einen Flughafen mit Passagierabfertigungshallen und Flugsteigen sowie Tankanlagen und Wartungshangars für die ankommenden Flugzeuge. Anfang der 40er Jahre führte die wachsende Bedeutung der Flugzeuge für das Militärwesen zur Errichtung zahlreicher militärischer Luftwaffenstützpunkte. Alleine in den Vereinigten Staaten gibt es fast 400 dieser Anlagen, die als Heimatbasen und Instandhaltungsstationen für Flugzeuge aller militärischen Bereiche dienen.
TEXT.Italian: Sin dalla metà del ventesimo secolo l'aeroplano si è affermato come uno dei più efficaci mezzi per viaggiare su lunghe distanze. Quasi tutte le città più importanti sono dotate di aeroporti in grado di accogliere i passeggeri, rifornire gli aerei di carburante e offrire la manutenzione necessaria alle riparazioni. Dal 1940 inoltre, l'aereo ha assunto un'importanza sempre maggiore anche dal punto di vista militare, il che ha portato inevitabilmente alla diffusione di aeroporti militari. Solo negli Stati Uniti esistono oltre 400 di queste strutture tutte gestite dai vari rami dell'esercito.
TEXT.Spanish: Desde mediados del siglo XX, el avión ha sido uno de los principales medios de transporte para larga distancia del mundo. La práctica totalidad de las zonas metropolitanas de hoy en día tienen por lo menos un aeropuerto, con instalaciones para el tránsito y embarque de pasajeros, así como para repostar y llevar el mantenimiento de los aviones que aterricen allí. A partir de los años 40, la creciente importancia de los aviones como vehículos de combate ha llevado a una construcción masiva de bases aéreas militares. Hay casi 400 de estas instalaciones solo en los Estados Unidos, utilizadas como bases y para el mantenimiento de los aviones asignados a todas las ramas de las fuerzas armadas.

TEXT.English: A major obstacle to population growth and expansion in early cities was the scarcity of water. In many cases, the solution to this problem was an aqueduct. Aqueducts were large, elevated stone "canals" through which water from nearby hills and mountains was channeled into the city. Aqueducts allowed cities to grow much larger by significantly increasing the amount of available water. At the same time aqueducts reduced the chance of contracting water-borne diseases, by reducing the dependence on stagnant ponds and wells as water sources. Aqueducts also allowed cities to be built in normally inhospitable environments, such as deserts, by providing an outside water source. Modern day Los Angeles, for example, obtains its water supply from the Colorado River, through a system of aqueducts over 200 miles long.
TEXT.French: Dans les premières villes, la rareté de l'eau constitue un obstacle majeur à l'expansion urbaine et à la croissance de la population. Souvent, les aqueducs permettent de résoudre ce problème. Les aqueducs sont de grands "canaux" en hauteur permettant d'acheminer l'eau depuis les collines et montagnes environnantes vers la ville. Ils permettent aux villes de s'agrandir en augmentant fortement la quantité d'eau disponible. Par ailleurs, les aqueducs réduisent les risques d'apparition de maladies d'origine hydrique, en réduisant l'utilisation de l'eau stagnante des mares et des puits. Les aqueducs permettent aussi aux villes de s'installer dans des environnements a priori inhospitaliers tels que des déserts, en fournissant une source d'eau extérieure. A l'heure actuelle, la ville de Los Angeles est ainsi approvisionnée en eau par un système d'aqueducs de plus de 320 km partant du fleuve Colorado.
TEXT.German: Das größte Hindernis für die weitere Ausdehnung der Stadtgebiete und gesundes Bevölkerungswachstum in den Städten der Antike war die vorherrschende Wasserknappheit. In vielen Fällen stellte das Aquädukt die ideale Lösung für dieses Problem dar: Diese erhöht gelegenen steinernen "Kanäle" leiteten das Quellwasser aus den umliegenden Hügeln und Bergen direkt in die Stadt und stellten damit eine umfassende Wasserversorgung sicher. Da in der Folge weniger Wasser aus den mit Krankheitserregern durchsetzten Teichen und Brunnen bezogen werden musste, sank gleichzeitig auch das Krankheitsrisiko. Darüber hinaus ermöglichten Aquädukte aber auch die Besiedelung von normalerweise unwirtlichen Gegenden wie Wüsten. Ein Beispiel dafür ist das heutige Los Angeles, dessen Wasserversorgung über ein mehr als 320 Kilometer langes Rohrleitungssystem bewerkstelligt wird, das Wasser aus dem Colorado River bezieht.
TEXT.Italian: Uno dei principali ostacoli alla crescita delle prime città era la scarsità d'acqua. In molti casi il problema venne risolto con la costruzione di acquedotti, grosse condutture di acqua sopraelevate, dove il prezioso liquido, proveniente dalle montagne o dalle colline circostanti, veniva incanalato verso le città. Uno degli innumerevoli vantaggi di queste strutture era quello di diminuire il rischio di malattie dovute alla presenza di batteri di varia natura negli stagni. Con questo sistema, inoltre fu anche possibile costruire città in luoghi tradizionalmente inospitali. La moderna Los Angeles, per esempio, si approvvigiona dalle acque del fiume Colorado grazie a una conduttura idrica lunga oltre 330 chilometri.
TEXT.Spanish: Un importante obstáculo para el crecimiento de la población y la expansión de las ciudades de la antigüedad era la escasez de agua. En muchos casos, la solución a este problema era un acueducto. Se trataba de grandes canales elevados por los que se conducía hasta la ciudad el agua de las colinas y montañas próximas. Los acueductos permitían que las ciudades crecieran de manera significativa gracias al aumento del agua disponible. Al mismo tiempo, reducían las posibilidades de contraer las enfermedades de las que era portadora el agua al reducir la dependencia de los estanques y pozos. También permitían construir ciudades en lugares normalmente inhóspitos, como desiertos, gracias a que proporcionaban una fuente de agua externa. Por ejemplo, la moderna ciudad de Los Ángeles obtiene su suministro de agua del río Colorado, gracias a un sistema de acueductos de más de 300 km de longitud.

TEXT.English: A highly developed banking system is one of the cornerstones of an advanced civilization. Banks lend money to individuals or groups, providing capital for industrial and real estate development. Banks also contribute to the economic growth of a city or region by stimulating the development of production facilities. Individual citizens can also benefit by investing their own surplus money in the bank and earning interest on it.
TEXT.French: Un système bancaire très développé constitue l'une des pierres angulaires d'une civilisation développée. Les banques prêtent de l'argent aux individus ou aux groupes, fournissant ainsi un capital permettant le développement industriel et immobilier. Les banques contribuent également à la croissance économique d'une ville ou d'une région en stimulant le développement d'infrastructures de production. Les citoyens individuels peuvent aussi tirer des bénéfices en investissant leur propre surplus d'argent dans la banque, touchant ainsi des intérêts.
TEXT.German: Ein hoch entwickeltes Banksystem stellt einen wichtigen Eckpfeiler für jede fortschrittliche Zivilisation dar. Banken verleihen Geld an Privatpersonen, Geschäftsleute oder Unternehmen und liefern damit Kapital für die industrielle Erschließung und die Landbebauung. Sie fördern Produktionsanlagen und Fertigungsstätten und tragen auf diese Weise auch zum Wirtschaftswachstum einer Stadt oder sogar einer ganzen Region bei. Und nicht zuletzt können auch einzelne Bürger von dieser Einrichtung profitieren, indem sie ihr überschüssiges Geld bei der Bank anlegen und dafür Zinserträge erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: Un sistema bancario evoluto è indice di un grado di civilizzazione molto avanzato. Le banche prestano i soldi a gruppi di individui o a singoli, fornendo i capitali necessari allo sviluppo edilizio e industriale. Anche la crescita economica di un'area dipende dagli stimoli all'apparato produttivo derivanti dalle banche. Il singolo cittadino vedrà i suoi capitali fruttare grazie agli interessi che queste gli forniscono.
TEXT.Spanish: Un sistema bancario sofisticado es una de las claves de una civilización avanzada. Los bancos prestan dinero a grupos o individuos y suministran el capital que necesitan las empresas industriales e inmobiliarias. Además, contribuyen al crecimiento económico de una ciudad o región, al estimular el desarrollo de las instalaciones productivas. Cualquier ciudadano puede obtener beneficios gracias a la inversión de sus ahorros en el banco y el ingreso de los intereses.

TEXT.English: Warfare has been a recurring phenomenon throughout the history of mankind, and it continues to plague the world today. Although war is not a desirable situation, it is important that even the most peaceful of societies be prepared for the possibility of war. When warring nations are closely matched in technology and manpower, the army with the best training usually wins battles. Military schools and academies exist all over the world, established for the purpose of training military personnel in the latest methods, tactics, and technology. Men and women who graduate from such facilities possess higher than average command and military and technological skills, making them more effective in combat situations.
TEXT.French: La guerre est un phénomène récurrent dans l'histoire de l'humanité et elle continue à affecter le monde aujourd'hui encore. Si la guerre n'est pas souhaitable, il est important que même les sociétés les plus pacifistes soient préparées à son éventualité. Lorsque des nations en guerre ont à peu près la même puissance technologique et le même nombre d'hommes, l'armée la plus entraînée est généralement victorieuse. Des écoles et académies militaires existent dans le monde entier ; elles ont été créées afin d'assurer l'entraînement du personnel militaire aux méthodes, tactiques et technologies les plus récentes. Les hommes et femmes diplômés de ces établissements disposent généralement de capacités de commandement et de compétences militaires et technologiques supérieures à la moyenne, les rendant plus efficaces au combat.
TEXT.German: Kriegerische Auseinandersetzungen hat es im Verlauf der menschlichen Geschichte bis zur Gegenwart gegeben. Wenngleich sich niemand einen Krieg wünscht, ist es dennoch wichtig, dass selbst die friedfertigsten Völker auf einen möglichen Kriegsausbruch vorbereitet sind. Wenn zwei Krieg führende Nationen über das gleiche technologische und militärische Potenzial verfügen, so ist für den Ausgang einzelner Gefechte in der Regel ausschlaggebend, wer die besser ausgebildeten Streitkräfte aufzuweisen hat. Militärschulen und -akademien, die militärisches Personal in den modernsten Militärtaktiken und -technologien unterweisen, existieren in allen Ländern der Welt. Die Absolventen besitzen nicht nur überdurchschnittliches Fachwissen, sondern verfügen auch über weit reichende militärische und technologische Fertigkeiten, die ihnen in Gefechtssituationen zugute kommen.
TEXT.Italian: Le guerre sono un fenomeno che ha interessato e continua a interessare la storia dell'uomo; è quindi importante che anche le società più pacifiche siano preparate a questo evento. Nel caso in cui due nazioni nemiche si trovino ad avere un livello tecnologico simile, è la preparazione dei soldati a fare la differenza. Le scuole e le accademie militari sono diffuse in tutto il mondo e hanno lo scopo di preparare le reclute agli equipaggiamenti e alle tecniche più avanzate. Coloro che si diplomano in questi luoghi possiedono abilità militari e cognizioni tattiche di alto livello, che li rendono più efficaci in situazioni di combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: La guerra ha sido un fenómeno recurrente a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad y sigue atormentándola en la actualidad. Aunque no es una situación deseable, es importante que hasta las más pacíficas sociedades estén preparadas para la posibilidad de que se produzca un conflicto así. Cuando las naciones en guerra se encuentran igualadas en tecnología y mano de obra, el ejército mejor entrenado es el que suele ganar las batallas. Las escuelas y academias militares existen en todos los lugares del mundo, creadas con el propósito de entrenar al personal en los métodos, tácticas y tecnologías más modernos. Los hombres y mujeres que se gradúan en estas instituciones poseen habilidades de mando, tecnológicas y militares por encima de lo normal, lo que les proporciona mayor efectividad en combate.

TEXT.English: A bomb shelter is a structure designed to protect the people inside from falling bombs. Today's bomb shelters are designed to shield one from the destruction of a nuclear attack. People have constructed bomb shelters since the first artillery piece was put into action. Sometimes these are rude caves dug in a hillside; sometimes they are elaborate and complicated affairs, self-sustaining for weeks, dug hundreds of feet below the surface.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the 1950s during the Cold War, American citizens began constructing bomb shelters in their back yards and basements, hoping to avoid destruction during the atomic war they were sure was coming. The US government embarked on an ambitious program to create large bomb shelters in all major cities, stocking them with food, water, blankets, and other essential supplies. These are mostly abandoned today, probably because of the realization that most of them are not strong enough to do much good in the event of a nuclear attack.
TEXT.French: Un abri antiaérien est une structure permettant à la population de s'y réfugier pour se protéger des attaques par bombes. Les abris antiaériens actuels sont conçus pour résister à une attaque nucléaire. Depuis l'introduction des premières pièces d'artillerie, les populations ont construit des abris antiaériens. Parfois, il s'agit de simples grottes creusées à flanc de coteau mais ces abris peuvent aussi être des constructions élaborées et complexes, permettant de subsister pendant des semaines et construites à plusieurs mètres sous terre. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dans les années 1950, pendant la guerre froide, les citoyens américains ont commencé à construire des abris dans les jardins et dans les caves, espérant ainsi échapper à la destruction lors de la guerre nucléaire qu'ils étaient sûrs de voir se déclencher. Le gouvernement américain s'est alors engagé dans un ambitieux programme de création de grands abris dans toutes les grandes villes, les approvisionnant en nourriture, eau, couvertures et autres réserves indispensables. La plupart d'entre eux sont désormais abandonnés, sans doute parce qu'ils ne seraient pas suffisamment efficaces dans le cas d'une attaque nucléaire.
TEXT.German: Luftschutzkeller schützen die darin versammelten Menschen vor Bombenangriffen. Moderne Luftschutzkeller wurden entwickelt, um Menschen im Fall eines Atomangriffs zu schützen. Die ersten Luftschutzkeller entstanden mit dem ersten Einsatz von Artillerie. Manchmal handelt es sich nur um in Hügel gegrabene Höhlen; manche sind ausgefeilte komplexe Anlagen hunderte Meter unter der Oberfläche, die wochenlang autark sein können. [PARAGRAPH:1]In den 50er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts entstanden in unzähligen amerikanischen Gärten und Kellern Luftschutzkeller, als die Menschen versuchten, sich vor den Folgen eines möglichen Atomschlags zu schützen. Die amerikanische Regierung ließ damals in allen Großstädten Luftschutzkeller bauen und diese mit Lebensmitteln, Wasser, Decken und lebensnotwendigen Vorräten ausstatten. Heute sind die meisten Luftschutzkeller verlassen, da sie einem Atomangriff nicht standhalten würden.
TEXT.Italian: Un rifugio antiaereo è una struttura pensata per proteggere le persone all'interno dai bombardamenti. I rifugi odierni sono stati realizzati in maniera tale da sopravvivere in caso di attacco nucleare. Le popolazioni hanno cominciato a costruire rifugi dai tempi della prima unità di artiglieria: molto spesso si trattava di caverne scavate sul lato di una collina, in altri casi invece si trattava di strutture più complesse, con autonomia di settimane, posizionate a centinaia di metri nel sottosuolo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Negli anni '50, durante la Guerra Fredda, i cittadini Americani cominciarono a costruire dei rifugi nei propri cortili e nelle cantine, nella speranza di evitare la distruzione durante l'imminente, presunta, guerra nucleare. Il governo degli USA avviò un programma ambizioso per la realizzazione di grandi rifugi nel cuore delle grandi città, forniti di cibo, acqua, coperte e altre scorte fondamentali. Al giorno d'oggi, la maggior parte di questi rifugi è abbandonata, probabilmente perché vennero costruiti in modo tale da non poter reggere un eventuale attacco nucleare.
TEXT.Spanish: Un refugio antiaéreo es una estructura diseñada para proteger a la gente de las bombas. En la actualidad pueden proteger incluso de una detonación nuclear. La gente ha construido refugios desde que aparecieron los primeros cañones. A veces son toscas cuevas excavadas en la ladera de una colina; otras, son complejos elaborados y sofisticados, capaces de sustentar a sus moradores durante semanas, a cientos de metros de la superficie.[PARAGRAPH:1]En la década de los 50, durante la Guerra Fría, la ciudadanía americana empezó a construir refugios en sus jardines y sótanos, para escapar a la destrucción de la guerra nuclear que, desde su punto de vista, era inevitable. El gobierno norteamericano se embarcó en un ambicioso programa destinado a crear grandes refugios en todas las ciudades importantes, donde se almacenó comida, agua, mantas y otros artículos esenciales. En la actualidad, la gran mayoría han sido abandonados, probablemente porque ha quedado constatado que no son lo bastante sólidos como para sobrevivir a un ataque nuclear.

TEXT.English: Although newspapers are published on a daily basis, they cannot often keep up to date on what is happening at the moment. Radio provides a means of doing that, as well as providing entertainment sources that would not otherwise be possible. With many events that occur in the world, it is important that the goverment be able to repudiate claims made by others, especially those that are true! Although radio has been superceeded by the television in most parts of the world, it is still a valuable tool to disseminate pro-government propaganda to the populace.
TEXT.French: Même si l'édition des journaux est quotidienne, ils ne peuvent souvent pas être à jour sur ce qui se passe au moment précis. La radio est un moyen de remédier à cela ; elle permet en outre de diffuser des spectacles auxquels on ne peut pas assister. Etant donné la quantité d'événements qui se passent dans le monde, il est important qu'un gouvernement puisse rejeter les affirmations faites par d'autres, notamment lorsque celles-ci sont fausses! La radio est supplantée par la télévision dans la majorité des régions du monde mais elle reste un outil précieux pour la diffusion de la propagande pro-gouvernementale à destination de la population.
TEXT.German: Obwohl Zeitungen täglich erscheinen, können sie oft nicht mit laufenden Ereignissen Schritt halten. Dies kann das Radio, und es bietet darüber hinaus eine ansonsten nicht vorhandene Unterhaltungsquelle. Da weltweit viele Ereignisse geschehen, ist es für die Regierung wichtig, Vorwürfe von dritter Seite zurückweisen zu können, vor allem die berechtigten! Obwohl das Radio in den meisten Teilen der Welt durch das Fensehen ersetzt wurde, ist es noch immer ein zuverlässiges Instrument, um Regierungspropaganda unters Volk zu streuen.
TEXT.Italian: Malgrado i giornali vengano pubblicati quotidianamente, non sono in grado di essere costantemente aggiornati su ciò che succede. Le radio invece possono diffondere notizie in tempo reale e proporre delle forme di intrattenimento che sarebbero altrimenti impossibili da fornire. Sebbene la radio sia stata soppiantata dalla televisione nella maggior parte del mondo, rimane sempre un ottimo strumento per fare della propaganda politica.
TEXT.Spanish: Aunque la prensa se publica con periodicidad diaria, es incapaz de mantenerse constantemente actualizada con los últimos sucesos del momento. La radio es un medio capaz de conseguir esto, además de proporcionar otras modalidades de entretenimiento características. En muchos casos de sucesos que ocurren en el mundo, es importante que el gobierno sea capaz de refutar las afirmaciones de otros, ¡especialmente si son verdaderas! Aunque en la mayor parte del mundo la radio ha sido sustituida por la televisión, sigue siendo una valiosa herramienta para la difusión de propaganda gubernamental.

TEXT.English: The term "bunker" is often used to denote military bomb shelters, often those housing high officials of the military and government. As shown in the second United States-Iraq War, a country with air dominance over a foe can do significant amounts of damage to a city with just a few bombs. Military and political leaders are prime targets for such attacks; often these officials will be protected in bunkers far below city streets. Bunkers are also used to protect communications networks, another important target. [PARAGRAPH:1]Any improvement in defense usually sparks an improvement in offensive weapons. The United States is building special "bunker-buster" bombs, designed to burrow deep into the ground before exploding. While such bombs may not destroy the deepest bunkers, they can cut off their communications, escape routes and air supply.
TEXT.French: Le terme "bunker" est souvent utilisé pour désigner les abris antiaériens militaires abritant généralement les hauts responsables de l'armée et du gouvernement. Comme le montre la seconde guerre entre les Etats-Unis et l'Irak, lorsqu'un pays dispose d'un avantage aérien sur son ennemi, il peut faire des dégâts importants dans une ville avec peu de bombes. Les responsables militaires et politiques constituent les principales cibles de ces attaques. Ils se mettent donc souvent à l'abri dans des bunkers situés bien en dessous du niveau des rues de la ville. Les bunkers servent également à protéger les réseaux de communication qui constituent une autre cible majeure. [PARAGRAPH:1]Toute amélioration de la défense entraîne généralement une amélioration des armes offensives. Les Etats-Unis construisent actuellement des bombes spéciales "anti-bunker", conçues pour s'enfoncer profondément dans le sol avant d'exploser. Si ces bombes ne parviennent pas à détruire les bunkers les plus profonds, elles peuvent néanmoins couper les communications, les routes d'évacuation et l'alimentation en air.
TEXT.German: Der Begriff "Bunker" bezeichnet im Allgemeinen Luftschutzkeller für hochrangige Mitglieder des Militärs und der Regierung. Der zweite Krieg zwischen den Vereinigten Staaten und dem Irak hat gezeigt, dass ein Land allein durch seine Lufthoheit einer Stadt mit nur wenigen Bomben schwere Schäden zufügen kann. Da militärische und politische Führer meist die Hauptziele eines Angriffs feindlicher Truppen sind, ziehen sie sich im Ernstfall in unterirdische Bunkersysteme zurück. Darüber hinaus sind in Bunkern nicht selten Kommunikationsnetzwerke und andere wichtige Ziele untergebracht. [PARAGRAPH:1]Jeder Fortschritt bei der Verteidigung bringt sofort verbesserte Angriffswaffen hervor. Inzwischen gibt es Spezialbomben für Angriffe auf Bunker (so genannte Bunker-Buster), die sich vor der Detonation tief in den Erdboden graben. Diese sind in der Lage, die Kommunikationssysteme, die Fluchtwege und die Luftversorgung einer Bunkeranlage abzuschneiden, auch wenn sie den Bunker selbst nicht immer zerstören.
TEXT.Italian: Il termine "bunker" viene spesso utilizzato per indicare i rifugi anti bombardamento, spesso residenza degli alti ufficiali dell'esercito e del governo. Come mostrato nella seconda guerra tra Stati Uniti e Iraq, una nazione con una massiccia forza aerea è in grado di infliggere con poche bombe danni significativi a una città. I leader politici e militari sono i primi bersagli di questo genere di attacchi: spesso, questi ufficiali vengono protetti in bunker sotterranei costruiti sotto le strade cittadine. I bunker sono inoltre utilizzati per proteggere le reti di comunicazioni e altri obiettivi importanti. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ogni miglioramento nelle difese determina un miglioramento nelle armi offensive: gli Stati Uniti stanno realizzando delle bombe desinate all'eliminazione specifica dei bunker, pensate per raggiungere una buona profondità prima di detonare. Malgrado bombe di questo tipo possono non bastare per distruggere i bunker più in profondità, sono in grado di tagliare la rete di comunicazioni e danneggiare eventuali condotti d'aerazione e via di fuga.
TEXT.Spanish: Suele emplearse el término "búnker" para hacer referencia a un refugio militar, como los que suelen utilizar los altos funcionarios del ejército y el gobierno. Como quedó demostrado en la segunda guerra entre los Estados Unidos e Irak, un país que cuente con la supremacía aérea puede causar daños significativos a las ciudades de su enemigo con pocas bombas. Los líderes militares y políticos son objetivos primarios para este tipo de ataques. A menudo, estos personajes buscarán refugios en búnkeres situados bajo las calles. También se utilizan para proteger las comunicaciones, redes y otros objetivos importantes. [PARAGRAPH:1]Cualquier avance en la defensa suele desencadenar otro en el armamento ofensivo. Los Estados Unidos están desarrollando bombas especiales "antibúnker", diseñadas para hundirse profundamente en la tierra antes de estallar. Aunque es posible que no sean capaces de destruir los búnkeres más profundos, pueden interrumpir las comunicaciones, las vías de escape y el suministro aéreo.

TEXT.English: Castles served many functions in medieval Europe; not only were they formidable defensive positions, but they served as administrative and judicial centers and as the seat of a lord's power. Since food and supplies could be stockpiled at castles, they exerted strong influence over very large surrounding territories. Secular lords were not the only ones to build castles; religious officials often did so as well, to provide themselves with stronger power bases. Early castles were usually little more than wooden stockades constructed on dirt mounds and perhaps surrounded by a shallow trench; by the time of the reign of Edward the Confessor in 13th century England, castle-building had become a much more elaborate affair, with hundreds of laborers and specialists constructing huge stone fortresses with intricate defenses in carefully selected geographic locations. After gunpowder brought cannons into widespread use, castles failed to provide the same protection from attack, and later rulers built palaces more along aesthetic than defensive lines.
TEXT.French: Dans l'Europe médiévale, le rôle des châteaux était multiple. Ils n'étaient pas seulement de formidables postes de défense mais ils servaient également de centres administratifs et judiciaires et de siège du pouvoir du seigneur. Nourriture et approvisionnement pouvant être stockés dans les châteaux, ils exerçaient une forte influence sur de vastes territoires des alentours. Les seigneurs laïques n'étaient pas les seuls à construire des châteaux, les responsables religieux en faisaient souvent de même afin de renforcer les fondements de leur pouvoir. Les premiers châteaux n'étaient souvent rien de plus que de simples palissades en bois construites sur des monticules de terre et parfois entourées de tranchées peu profondes. Dans l'Angleterre du XIe siècle, sous le règne d'Edouard le Confesseur, la construction de châteaux devint bien plus élaborée. Des centaines d'ouvriers et de travailleurs spécialisés bâtissaient, sur des emplacements géographiques soigneusement sélectionnés, d'immenses forteresses en pierre aux défenses complexes. Après la généralisation de l'utilisation des canons à poudre, les châteaux n'ont plus offert la même protection lors des attaques et les dirigeants suivants ont commencé à construire des châteaux aux qualités plus esthétiques que défensives.
TEXT.German: Schlösser und Burgen hatten im Europa des Mittelalters viele Funktionen. Sie waren perfekt zu verteidigende Festungen und dienten dem Burgherrn als Verwaltungs- und Rechtszentren. Da in Burgen Nahrungsmittel und andere Vorräte gelagert werden konnten, hatten sie großen Einfluss auf das Umland. Geistliche und weltliche Fürsten ließen Burgen nicht selten als Zeichen ihrer Macht errichten. Die Burgen der Frühzeit waren meist nur auf Hügeln errichtete Holzpalisaden, die von einem flachen Graben umgeben waren. Als Eduard der Bekenner im 13. Jahrhundert in England herrschte, entstanden bereits mächtige Steinfestungen mit komplexen Verteidigungsmechanismen. Nach der Erfindung des Schießpulvers und der Kanone boten Burgen nur noch bedingt Schutz vor angreifenden Feinden. Aus diesem Grund waren die späten Burgen eher Repräsentationsbauten als militärische Bollwerke.
TEXT.Italian: I castelli hanno ricoperto diverse funzioni durante il Medioevo in Europa; infatti, non servivano solamente da formbidabili posizioni difensive, ma erano adibiti anche a centro giudiziario e amministrativo oltre a fungere da residenza del sovrano. I castelli cominciarono a esercitare una forte influenza sui territori circostanti quando cibo e provviste iniziarono a venire stoccati all'interno delle mura. I sovrani secolari non furono gli unici a costruire i castelli; anche i funzionari ecclesiastici si produssero nella realizzazione di queste basi. I primi castelli erano poco più che barricate di legno issate su mucchi di terra, il più delle volte circondati da un fossato. Nel XIII secolo, sotto il regno di Edoardo il Confessore in Inghilterra, la costruzione di castelli divenne molto più difficoltosa: centinaia di lavoratori e specialisti erano chiamati a realizzare strutture complesse in pietra adibite alla difesa e in zone geografiche ben definite. Con la polvere da sparo apparvero i cannoni e i castelli non riuscirono a fornire la necessaria protezione agli attacchi. I successivi sovrani costruirono palazzi dall'estetica migliore piuttosto che strutture adibite unicamente alla difesa.
TEXT.Spanish: Los castillos de la Europa medieval tenían varias funciones. Además de ser formidables enclaves defensivos, ejercían como centros administrativos y judiciales y sede del poder de su señor. Como podían utilizarse también para almacenar víveres y pertrechos, proyectaban una gran influencia sobre territorios muy amplios. No solo los poderes seculares los construían; también los religiosos solían hacerlo, para contar con una base de poder más sólida. Los primeros castillos no solían ser más que empalizadas de madera construidas sobre montículos de tierra y, a veces, rodeados por un foso poco profundo; en tiempos de Eduardo el Confesor, en la Inglaterra del siglo XI, su construcción se había sofisticado sobremanera, y se empleaban cientos de trabajadores y especialistas para erigir inmensas fortalezas de piedra con intrincados sistemas defensivos en emplazamientos geográficos cuidadosamente elegidos. Después de que la pólvora generalizase el uso de los cañones, los castillos dejaron de proporcionar la misma protección contra los ataques y los gobernantes posteriores empezaron a construir palacios en una línea más estética que defensiva.

TEXT.English: Coal has been used sporadically as a fuel since ancient times, but it was not until the Industrial Revolution that the industrial applications of coal became understood. Most early factories used coal as a power supply, burning the fossil fuel to release the energy needed to drive the plant's machines. Coal power provided much more energy than relying on the strength of humans or animals, at the cost of releasing large amounts of toxic pollution into the atmosphere. Despite the environmental hazards associated with coal plants, they remain common today.
TEXT.French: Le charbon est utilisé sporadiquement comme combustible depuis les temps anciens mais ce n'est qu'à partir de la révolution industrielle que l'on comprend son importance dans les applications industrielles. La majorité des premières usines utilisent le charbon comme source d'énergie, cette énergie fossile étant brûlée afin de dégager l'énergie nécessaire au fonctionnement des machines. L'énergie fournie par le charbon est bien plus importante que celle fournie par la force des hommes ou des animaux mais elle entraîne l'émission de fumées toxiques polluantes dans l'atmosphère. En dépit des risques environnementaux associés aux usines à charbon, ces dernières sont encore courantes aujourd'hui.
TEXT.German: Kohle wurde bereits im Altertum sporadisch als fossiler Brennstoff eingesetzt. Allerdings erkannten die Menschen ihre Bedeutung erst während der Industriellen Revolution. In der Anfangszeit der Industrialisierung nutzten die meisten Fabriken Kohle als Energiequelle für ihre Maschinen. Energie aus der Verbrennung von Kohle war der Körperkraft von Mensch und Tier deutlich überlegen. Trotz der enormen Umweltbelastungen sind Kohlekraftwerke bis heute weit verbreitet.
TEXT.Italian: Nell'antichità il carbone è stato usato sporadicamente come combustibile, ma è solo con la Rivoluzione Industriale che si capirono le possibili applicazioni industriali di questo minerale. La maggior parte delle prime fabbriche utilizzava il carbone come combustibile primario, bruciando il fossile per produrre l'energia necessaria al funzionamento dello stabilimento. L'energia del carbone era maggiore e più affidabile di quella prodotta dagli esseri umani e dagli animali: unico problema, l'inquinamento atmosferico. Malgrado i rischi ambientali, le centrali a carbone sono tutt'oggi abbastanza diffuse.
TEXT.Spanish: El carbón se había utilizado esporádicamente como combustible desde la antigüedad pero no fue hasta la Revolución Industrial que empezaron a comprenderse sus aplicaciones industriales. Casi todas las primeras fábricas utilizaban el carbón como fuente energética y quemaban el combustible fósil para proporcionar la energía que necesitaban las máquinas de las plantas. La alimentación con carbón proporcionaba mucha más energía que la fuerza humana o animal, al precio de liberar grandes cantidades de polución tóxica a la atmósfera. Las centrales térmicas siguen siendo comunes hoy en día pese a los peligros medioambientales que suponen.

TEXT.English: The original colosseum provided entertainment for the common people of Roman society by presenting them with spectacles and events as a temporary escape from day-to-day life. This concept has been revived in the 20th Century. Modern-day stadiums and civic centers provide an arena for entertainment ranging from concerts to professional sporting events. Although the violent spectacle of gladiatorial combat is a thing of the past, today's colosseums still provide entertainment and diversion for the masses.
TEXT.French: Les premiers stades (autrefois appelés colisées) offraient des divertissements au peuple romain, les spectacles et les épreuves leur permettant de s'échapper temporairement de leur vie quotidienne. Ce concept est repris au milieu du XXe siècle. Aujourd'hui, les stades et les centres municipaux servent d'arènes pour les divertissements, qu'il s'agisse de concerts ou d'événements sportifs professionnels.
