[PARAGRAPH:1]Les édifices religieux taoïstes les plus élaborés et les plus grands sont souvent des pagodes, c'est-à-dire des tours à plusieurs niveaux comportant de nombreux avant-toits. Ce style architectural, originaire du Népal, s'est répandu ensuite dans une grande partie de l'Asie. Malheureusement, bon nombre des grandes pagodes taoïstes avaient été construites en bois, matériau qui revêt une signification religieuse particulière pour les taoïstes, et n'ont pas résisté à l'épreuve du temps. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les pagodes taoïstes sont généralement des édifices aux couleurs vives, dont les larges toits sont incurvés et décorés de figurines divines et de symboles traditionnels de la chance tels que le dragon et la carpe. Le taoïsme n'est pas une religion égoïste et les pagodes peuvent avoir plusieurs pièces ou sanctuaires dédiés à la méditation bouddhiste et/ou aux divinités hindoues.
TEXT.German: In Civilization IV sind Kathedralen große und prächtige Gotteshäuser, in denen Gläubige beten. Nur die reichsten aller Städte können sich den Bau einer Kathedrale leisten, da hierfür große Mengen an Baumaterial und die jahrelange Arbeit erfahrener Handwerker erforderlich sind. Die Kathedrale von Notre Dame in Paris wurde beispielsweise erst nach 200-jähriger Bauzeit fertig gestellt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Viele kunstvolle und große taoistische Gebäude sind Pagoden, also in Reihen angeordnete Türme mit zahlreichen Dachvorsprüngen. Dieser Baustil stammt ursprünglich aus Nepal und hat sich im Laufe der Zeit in fast ganz Asien verbreitet. Da viele taoistische Pagoden aus Holz errichtet wurden (dem im Taoismus eine besondere religiöse Bedeutung zukommt), sind nur wenige bis heute erhalten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Taoistische Pagoden sind im Allgemeinen helle und farbenfrohe Gebäude mit breiten, geschwungenen Dächern, die mit Götterfiguren und traditionellen Glückssymbolen, wie Drachen und Karpfen, verziert sind. Darüber hinaus enthalten taoistische Pagoden nicht selten Räume oder Schreine für die buddhistische Meditation und/oder Hindugötter.
TEXT.Italian: In Civilization IV, viene definito cattedrale un edificio religioso particolarmente grande e sfarzoso adibito a luogo di culto per i fedeli. Solamente le città più prosperose possono permettersi l'edificazione di cattedrali poiché sono necessari un'enorme quantità di materiali e operai esperti. Per esempio, per completare la cattedrale di Notre-Dame de Paris, in Francia, ci sono voluti più di due secoli. [PARAGRAPH:1]Molte degli edifici elaborati della religione Taoista sono pagode, delle specie di torri a scalini dai multipli cornicioni. Questo stile, originario del Nepal, si è molto diffuso in Asia: sfortunatamente, molte delle pagode Taoiste erano realizzate in legno (un materiale ricco di significati spirituali per i fedeli) e non sono sono sopravvissute allo scorrere inesorabile del tempo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le pagode Taoiste, sono strutture ricche di colori brillanti, tetti ricurvi ornati con immagini divine e simboli tradizionali della fortuna come dragoni e carpe. Il Taosimo non è una fede esclusivista e per questo motivo le pagode possono ospitare delle stanze o dei santuare dedicati alla meditazione dei Buddisti o alle divinità degli Indù.
TEXT.Spanish: En Civilization IV, una catedral se define como un edificio religioso especialmente grande y ornamentado en el que se reúnen los fieles para celebrar sus ritos. Solo las ciudades más grandes pueden permitirse el lujo de crear catedrales, puesto que requieren enormes cantidades de materias primas y años de dedicación por parte de trabajadores especializados. Por ejemplo, la catedral de Notre Dame, Francia, tardó dos siglos en completarse. [PARAGRAPH:1]Muchos de los edificios religiosos taoístas más elaborados y extensos son pagodas: torres de múltiples terrazas con saledizos. Este estilo constructivo se originó en Nepal y desde entonces se ha extendido por gran parte de Asia. Por desgracia, muchas de las grandes pagodas taoístas se construyeron en madera (la madera tiene un significado religioso especial para los taoístas) y no han soportado el paso del tiempo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Suelen ser estructuras brillantes y coloristas, con amplios tejados curvos adornados con figuras divinas y símbolos propiciatorios tradicionales, tales como los dragones y las carpas. El taoísmo no es una fe egoísta, y las pagodas pueden contener salas o capillas dedicadas a la meditación budista y/o alguna deidad hindú.

TEXT.English: The Taoist Dai Miao, or "Temple of the God of Mount Tai," is located on Mount Tai in Shandong Province, China. One of the "five sacred mountains of China," Mount Tai has been of great religious importance throughout Chinese history, and evidence suggests that pilgrims have been climbing the mountain for at least 3000 years. There are 22 temples, 97 ruins, and several thousand stone tablets and inscriptions scattered across its rugged shoulders.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Dai Miao is the largest temple complex on the mountain, covering an area of about a million square feet. The buildings within the temple have been built and rebuilt a number of times, the most recent major overhaul occurring about 2000 years ago during the Han Dynasty. [PARAGRAPH:2]In its latest incarnation, the temple is a replica of the Imperial Palace. The complex has five major halls and many small buildings. The most important building is the Palace of Heavenly Blessings, constructed in 1008. The building contains a mural titled, "The God of Mount Tai Making a Journey." The mural is 10 feet (3.05 m) in height by about 200 feet (60.96 m) long. It was painted in 1009, making it 1004 years old. [PARAGRAPH:2]Next to the Palace of Heavenly Blessings stand the Yaocan Pavilion and the entrance archway, as well as the Bronze Pavilion in the northeast corner. The Dai Temple is surrounded by the 2,100 year-old Han Dynasty cypresses. Beloved as much for its rugged beauty as for its religious significance, the Dai Miao remains one of the most important religious structures in the world.
TEXT.French: Le temple taoïste Daimiao, ou "Temple du dieu du mont Taishan" est situé sur le mont Taishan dans la province chinoise de Shandong. Considéré comme l'une des "cinq montagnes sacrées de Chine", le mont Taishan a toujours été d'une très grande importance religieuse dans l'histoire de la Chine et certaines preuves suggèrent que des pèlerins en font l'ascension depuis au moins 3 000 ans. 22 temples, 97 ruines et plusieurs milliers de tablettes de pierre et d'inscription sont éparpillés sur ses flancs escarpés.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le Daimiao est le plus grand complexe de temples de la montagne, s'étendant sur près de 96 km². Les bâtiments à l'intérieur du temple ont été construits et reconstruits à de nombreuses reprises, la plus récente reconstruction majeure ayant eu lieu il y a près de 2 000 ans sous la dynastie Han. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dans sa forme la plus récente, le temple est une réplique du Palais impérial. Il compte cinq pièces principales ainsi que d'autres bâtiments plus petits. L'édifice le plus important est le Palais des bénédictions divines (Tiankuang), construit en 1008. Il abrite une peinture murale intitulée "Le Dieu du mont Taishan fait un voyage". Elle mesure 3 m de haut et 62 m de long. Peinte en 1009, elle a donc 996 ans. [PARAGRAPH:2]A côté de ce Palais des bénédictions divines se trouvent le pavillon Yaocan et l'arche d'entrée, ainsi que le pavillon de Bronze dans l'angle nord-est. Le temple Daimiao est entouré par des cyprès de 2 100 ans plantés sous la dynastie Han. Apprécié tout autant pour sa beauté sauvage que pour sa signification religieuse, le Daimiao reste l'une des plus importantes constructions religieuses du monde.
TEXT.German: Der taoistische Dai Miao, oder "Tempel des Gottes vom Mount Tai", liegt auf dem Mount Tai in der Provinz Shandong in China. Der Mount Tai ist einer der "fünf heiligen Berge Chinas" und hatte in der Geschichte Chinas schon immer eine große religiöse Bedeutung. Es gibt Beweise, dass Pilger schon seit mehr als 3000 Jahren den Berg besteigen. Auf seinen felsigen Hängen gibt es 22 Tempel, 97 Ruinen und mehrere tausend Steintafeln und Inschriften.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Dai Miao ist der größte Tempelkomplex des Berges und umfasst ein Gebiet von mehr als 92000 Quadratmetern. Die Gebäude innerhalb des Tempels sind mehrmals wieder aufgebaut worden, zuletzt während der Han-Dynastie vor etwa 2000 Jahren. [PARAGRAPH:2]In seiner letzten Inkarnation ist der Tempel eine Replik des Kaiserpalastes. Der Komplex besteht aus fünf Haupthallen und mehreren kleinen Gebäuden. Das wichtigste Gebäude ist der um 1008 errichtete Palast der Himmelssegnungen mit dem Wandgemälde "Der Gott von Mount Tai macht eine Reise". Das 3 Meter hohe und 60 Meter breite Gemälde entstand im Jahr 1009. [PARAGRAPH:2]In der Nähe des Palastes der Himmelssegnungen standen der Yaocan-Pavillon, Torbögen sowie der Bronze-Pavillon (in der nordöstlichen Ecke). Der Dai-Tempel ist von 2100 Jahre alten Zypressen aus der Zeit der Han-Periode umgeben und ist bis heute eines der bedeutendsten religiösen Gebäude der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: Il Dai Miao Taoista, o anche il "Tempio del Dio del monte Tai", si trova in cima al monte Tai nella provincia di Shandong in Cina. Il monte Tai è una delle "cinque montagne sacre della Cina" ed è sempre stato di una grande importanza religiosa per la storia Cinese; ci sono prove indicanti pellegrinaggi risalenti almeno a 3000 anni fa. Sul monte ci sono 22 templi, 97 rovine e migliaia di tavole di pietra incise.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il Dai Miao è il tempio più grande del complesso architettonico montano che si estende per più di 300.000 metri quadrati. Gli edifici all'interno del tempio sono stati ricostruiti numerose volte anche se l'ultima grande opera risale a circa 2000 anni fa durante la dinastia Han.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nella sua ultima incarnazione, il tempio è una esatta replica del Palazzo Imperiale: il complesso è formato da cinque grandi sale e molti edifici minori. L'edificio più importante è la "Porta di colui che è associato al Cielo", costruito nel 1008: qui si trova un affresco dal nome "il Dio del monte Tai in viaggio". L'opera è alta 3 metri e lunga 60: dipinto nel 1009, il dipinto risale a 1004 anni fa. [PARAGRAPH:2]Vicino alla "Porta di colui che è associato al Cielo" si trova il padiglione Yaocan e l'ingresso ad arco, mentre nell'angolo nordorientale si trova il padiglione di bronzo. Il tempio Dai è circondato da cipressi che risalgono alla dinastia Han di 2.100 anni fa. Il Dai Miao è uno dei luoghi di culto più importanti del mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: El Dai Miao, o "templo del dios de la montaña Tai" se encuentra en el monte Tai, en la provincia de Shandong, China. Este monte, una de las "cinco montañas sagradas de China", ha tenido una gran importancia religiosa en la historia de este país y ciertos indicios evidencian que los peregrinos llevan al menos tres mil años ascendiendo sus laderas. Hay 22 templos, 97 ruinas y varios miles de tablillas e inscripciones de piedra diseminados por ellas.[PARAGRAPH:2]El Dai Miao es el mayor complejo de templos de la montaña, con más de 300.000 metros cuadrados. Los edificios que lo conforman han sido construidos y reconstruidos varias veces, la última en la importante revisión que tuvo lugar hace dos mil años, en tiempos de la dinastía Han. [PARAGRAPH:2]En su última encarnación, el templo es una réplica del Palacio Imperial. El complejo cuenta con cinco grandes salones y muchos edificios menores. El edificio más importante es el Palacio de las Bendiciones Celestiales, construido en 1008. El templo contiene un mural titulado "el Dios del monte Tai haciendo un viaje". El mural tiene diez metros de altura por unos doscientos de anchura. Se pintó en 1009, lo que quiere decir que tiene 1004 años de antigüedad. [PARAGRAPH:2]Junto al Palacio de las Bendiciones Celestiales se levanta el Pabellón Yaocan y el arco de entrada, así como el Pabellón de Bronce, en la esquina noreste. El templo de Dai está rodeado por los cipreses de la dinastía Han, de 2.100 años de antigüedad. Venerado tanto por su tosca belleza como por su significación religiosa, el Dai Miao es una de las estructuras religiosas más importantes del mundo.

TEXT.English: The Parthenon was constructed in 433 BC, in Athens, Greece, in honor of Athens' patron goddess, Athena. Measuring 100 feet (30.48 m) by 225 feet (68.58 m), the Parthenon is constructed almost totally of marble. The exterior of the Parthenon is ringed with Doric-style columns more than 30 feet (9.14 m) in height, and the center part of the temple, called the "cella," is a large open space which once held a statue of Athena. Much of the temple was decorated with beautiful marble statues and friezes celebrating Athena and the glories of Athens. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Parthenon has suffered much from the ravages of time. In the 5th century a Roman Emperor stole the statue of Athena and moved it to Constantinople, where it was subsequently destroyed. In the 13th century the Parthenon was converted to a Catholic church, which involved altering the internal structure and removing (and probably destroying) many statues dedicated to the old gods. In the 15th century Athens was captured by the Ottomans, and the temple was turned into a mosque. In the 17th century the Parthenon was partially destroyed during a war between the Ottomans and Venetians. Finally, in the 19th century, the British ambassador to Greece looted all the surviving marble friezes from the building, which he subsequently sold to the British museum. [PARAGRAPH:2]Despite the centuries of neglect, mutilation and pillaging, the Parthenon still stands - a remarkably powerful and beautiful symbol of the glories of ancient Greece.
TEXT.French: Le Parthénon a été construit en 433 av. J.-C. à Athènes, en Grèce, en l'honneur de la déesse Athéna, patronne d'Athènes. Mesurant 70 m sur 31 m, le Parthénon est construit pratiquement entièrement en marbre. A l'extérieur, il est entouré de colonnes doriques mesurant plus de 9 m de haut et au centre du temple, appelé "naos", se trouve un vaste espace abritant une statue d'Athéna. Une grande partie du temple était décorée de magnifiques statues de marbre et de frises célébrant Athéna et les gloires d'Athènes. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le Parthénon a beaucoup souffert des ravages du temps. Au Ve siècle, un empereur romain vola la statue d'Athéna et la transporta à Constantinople, où elle fut détruite. Au XIIIe siècle, le Parthénon fut transformé en une église catholique, ce qui entraîna une modification de la structure interne ainsi que la suppression (et sans doute aussi la destruction) de nombreuses statues consacrées aux anciens dieux. Au XVe siècle, Athènes fut prise par les Ottomans et le temple se trouva transformé en mosquée. Au XVIIe siècle, le Parthénon fut partiellement détruit lors d'une guerre entre les Ottomans et les Vénitiens. Enfin, au XIXe siècle, l'ambassadeur britannique en Grèce pilla toutes les fresques de marbre subsistantes, dans le bâtiment, pour les vendre au British Museum. [PARAGRAPH:2]En dépit des siècles de négligences, de mutilations et de pillages, le Parthénon subsiste, symbole magnifique et remarquablement fort des gloires de la Grèce antique.
TEXT.German: Der Parthenon wurde 433 vor Christus in Athen zu Ehren der Göttin Athene gebaut. Die Säulen des etwa 30 mal 70 Meter großen, im dorischen Stil erbauten Tempels sind über 8 Meter hoch. Der zentrale Teil des Tempels (Cella) ist eine große Fläche, auf der einst eine Athene-Statue stand. Ein Großteil des Tempels war mit Marmorstatuen und -fresken verziert, die Athene und den Ruhm Athens symbolisierten. [PARAGRAPH:2]Der Parthenon hat im Laufe der Jahrhunderte sehr gelitten. Im 5. Jahrhundert stahl ein römischer Kaiser die Statue der Athene und brachte sie nach Konstantinopel, wo sie schließlich zerstört wurde. Im 13. Jahrhundert wurde der Parthenon als katholische Kirche geweiht. Dabei wurden die inneren Strukturen verändert und viele heidnische Götterstatuen zerstört. Im 15. Jahrhundert besetzten die Ottomanen Athen und nutzten den Parthenon als Moschee. Im 17. Jahrhundert wurde der Parthenon teilweise zerstört. Schließlich raubte der britische Botschafter in Griechenland die noch erhaltenen Marmorfresken und verkaufte diese an das British Museum. [PARAGRAPH:2]Trotz der Vernachlässigung, Zerstörung und Plünderung steht der Parthenon noch immer... als mächtiges Symbol der Blütezeit Griechenlands.
TEXT.Italian: Il Partenone fu costruito ad Atene, in Grecia, intorno al 433 a. C. in favore di Atena. Alto circa 30 metri e lungo 70, il Partenone è completamente realizzato in marmo. L'esterno del Partenone è ricco di colonne doriche alte più di 10 metri e la parte centrale del tempio, chiamata la "cella", è un grande spazio aperto dove una volta di trovava una statua di Atena. Buona parte del tempio è decorato con meravigliose statue di marmo e fregi che celebrano Atena e la gloria di Atene. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il Partenone è stato danneggiato con il passare del tempo: nel V secolo, un Imperatore Romano rubò la statua di Atena e la spostò a Costantinopoli dove venne successivamente distrutta. Nel XIII secolo il Partenone fu convertito a chiesa Cattolica: per questo motivo vennero apportate molte modifiche alla struttura e vennero rimosse (probabilmente distrutte) molte delle statue dedicate alle antiche divinità. Nel XV secolo, Atene venne conquistata dagli Ottomani e il tempio venne adibito a moschea: nel XVII secolo, il Partenone fu distrutto parzialmente dalla guerra tra Ottomani e Veneziani. Infine, nel XIX secolo, l'ambasciatore Britannico in Grecia saccheggiò tutti i rimanenti fregi di marmo dall'edificio, che vennero successivamente venduti al British Museum. [PARAGRAPH:2]Malgrado secoli di trascuratezza, mutilazioni, saccheggi, il Partenone è ancora al suo posto, un simbolo che ricorda la potenza e la bellezza dell'antica Grecia.
TEXT.Spanish: El Partenón se construyó en el 433 a. C., en Atenas, Grecia, en honor a la diosa patrona de esta ciudad, Atenea. Mide unos 70 x 30 metros y está construido casi totalmente de mármol. El exterior está rodeado por un peristilo de estilo dórico de más de diez metros de altura y la parte central del templo, llamada "cella", es un espacio abierto en el que antaño se levantó la estatua de Atenea. Gran parte del templo estaba decorada con preciosos frisos y estatuas de mármol en honor de Atenea y las glorias de Atenas. [PARAGRAPH:2]El Partenón ha sufrido muchos pillajes con el paso del tiempo. En el s. V, un emperador romano robó la estatua de Atenea y se la llevó a Constantinopla, donde posteriormente fue destruida. En el s. XIII se convirtió en una iglesia católica, lo que supuso alterar su estructura interna y quitar (y probablemente destruir) muchas estatuas dedicadas a los antiguos dioses. En el s. XV, Atenas fue capturada por los otomanos, y el templo se convirtió en una mezquita. En el s. XVII fue parcialmente destruido durante una guerra entre otomanos y venecianos. Finalmente, en el s. XIX, el embajador británico en Grecia saqueó todos los frisos de mármol que quedaban y posteriormente se los vendió al British Museum. [PARAGRAPH:2]Pese a siglos de abandono, mutilación y pillaje, el Partenón aún se alza como un símbolo excepcionalmente poderoso y bello de las glorias de la antigua Grecia.

TEXT.English: Many monuments were created to honor Zeus, King of the Greek Gods, yet none could be as impressive as the Statue of Zeus at Olympia. Over forty feet tall, the Statue filled the temple in which it was constructed from floor to ceiling. Created by the master artisan Phidias between 438 and 446BC, the whole statue rested on a wooden frame built upon a cedarwood throne of appropriate size for a forty-foot deity. The frame was then draped in ivory and gold (ivory for skin, gold for clothing) and covered from head to toe in jewels. Before Zeus' feet, a shallow lake of olive oil reflected light into the temple, illuminating the otherwise closed building. Every four years, when the Olympic Games would be held in the town, Olympic competitors would approach the statue and make sacrifices to the King of the Gods with the hope of assuring their victory.
TEXT.French: Beaucoup de monuments ont été érigés pour honorer Zeus, roi des dieux grecs. Cependant, aucun ne saurait être aussi impressionnant que la statue de Zeus à Olympie. Mesurant plus de 12 mètres de haut, la statue atteignait le plafond du temple dans lequel elle a été construite. Créée par le maître artisan Phidias entre 438 et 446 av. J.C., la statue repose sur un cadre en bois construit sur un énorme trône en cèdre. Le cadre a ensuite été drapé d'or et d'ivoire (ivoire pour la peau, or pour les vêtements) et couvert de bijoux. Aux pieds de Zeus, un lac d'huile d'olive réfléchissait la lumière, illuminant le temple. Tous les quatre ans, lorsque les jeux olympiques avaient lieu en ville, les concurrents s'approchaient de la statue et faisaient des sacrifices au roi des dieux dans l'espoir qu'il leur assurerait la victoire.
TEXT.German: Viele Monumente wurden zu Ehren des griechischen Götterkönigs Zeus erschaffen, aber keins war so beeindruckend wie die Zeus-Statue von Olympia. Mit über zwölf Metern füllte die Statue die gesamte Raumhöhe des Tempels, in dem sie errichtet wurde. Sie wurde zwischen 446 und 438 v. Chr. vom Meistersteinmetz Phidias erschaffen und stützte sich auf ein hölzernes Gerüst, das auf einem in seinen Dimensionen der zwölf Meter hohen Gottheit angemessenen Thron aus Zedernholz fußte. Das Gerüst wurde mit Elfenbein und Gold verziert (Elfenbein für die Haut, Gold für das Gewand) und von Kopf bis Fuß mit Juwelen behangen. Vor Zeus' Füßen reflektierte ein seichter See aus Olivenöl das Licht in das Innere des Tempels und erhellte das ansonsten geschlossene Gebäude. Alle vier Jahre, während die Olympischen Spiele in der Stadt ausgetragen wurden, näherten sich die Wettkämpfer der Statue und brachten dem König der Götter Opfer dar, in der Hoffnung, er möge ihnen dafür den Sieg schenken.
TEXT.Italian: Furono eretti molti monumenti per onorare Zeus, il signore degli dei greci, ma nessuno è da considerarsi tanto maestoso quanto la Statua di Zeus a Olimpia. La Statua era alta più di 12 metri, raggiungendo il soffitto del tempio in cui era stata costruita. Creata dal maestro artigiano Fidia tra il 438 e il 446 a.C., l'intera statua era composta da una struttura di legno costruita su un trono di cedro di dimensioni appropriate per una divinità alta 12 metri. La struttura era poi coperta di oro e avorio (avorio per la pelle, oro per i vestiti) e coperta dalla testa ai piedi di gioielli. Davanti ai piedi di Zeus un lago poco profondo di olio d'oliva rifletteva la luce nel tempio, illuminando l'edificio altrimenti chiuso. Ogni quattro anni, quando si tenevano in città i Giochi Olimpici, i concorrenti si avvicinavano alla statua per fare sacrifici al Re degli Dei, nella speranza che concedesse loro la vittoria.
TEXT.Spanish: Hubo muchos monumentos consagrados a Zeus, rey de los dioses griegos, pero ninguno de ellos tan impresionante como la estatua de Olimpia. Con sus casi quince metros de altura, la estatua llenaba el templo en el que estaba construido desde el suelo hasta el techo. Creada por el maestro Fidias entre los años 438 y 446 a. C., la estatua descansaba sobre una estructura de madera construida encima de un trono de cedro del tamaño apropiado para una escultura de semejantes dimensiones. La estructura estaba luego revestida de marfil y oro (marfil para la piel, oro para la ropa) y cubierta de joyas de la cabeza a los pies. A los pies de Zeus, un estanque poco profundo de aceite de oliva reflejaba la luz hacia el interior del templo, que no contaba con otros medios de iluminación. Cada cuatro años, cuando se celebraban los Juegos Olímpicos en el la ciudad, los competidores se acercaban al rey de los dioses y depositaban sus ofrendas a sus pies con la esperanza de que les concediera la victoria.

TEXT.English: Totem Poles were a tradition of the Native American tribes of the Pacific Northwest. Built from Oregon to Alaska, the Totem Pole is a visual representation of various tribal legends or important occurrences. [PARAGRAPH:1]While not worshipped, Totem Poles were often revered as symbols of wealth and common heritage. Yet some Totem Poles acted as warnings, rather than testaments. "Shame Poles" could be constructed to remind a tribe of a particular debt or offense. One particularly controversial pole, now found in the Alaska State Museum, bears the image of President Abraham Lincoln. Some claim that the "Lincoln Pole" was built to honor the passage of the Emancipation Proclamation, while many believe that it was built to mourn the wealth lost by the Tlingits tribe when forced to free their slaves.
TEXT.French: Les totems sont une tradition des tribus amérindiennes du Nord-ouest du Pacifique. De l'Oregon à l'Alaska, le totem est une représentation visuelle de diverses légendes tribales ou d'événements importants.[PARAGRAPH:1]Même s'ils ne font pas l'objet d'un culte, les totems sont souvent révérés en tant que symboles de richesse et d'héritage commun. Toutefois, certains totems font office d'avertissement plutôt que de témoignage. Des "totems de la honte" étaient parfois érigés pour rappeler une dette ou un événement honteux survenu à une tribu. Un totem particulièrement controversé, aujourd'hui abrité par le musée de l'Etat de l'Alaska, porte l'image du président Abraham Lincoln. Certains prétendent que le "totem Lincoln" a été construit pour honorer le passage de la proclamation d'émancipation, tandis que d'autres croient qu'il a été construit pour déplorer la perte de la richesse perdue par la tribu des Tlingits lorsqu'ils furent forcés de libérer leurs esclaves.
TEXT.German: Totempfähle waren bei den Indianerstämmen an der Pazifikküste im Nordwesten üblich. Der Totempfahl, wie er von Oregon bis Alaska gebaut wurde, ist eine bildliche Darstellung verschiedener Stammeslegenden oder wichtiger Ereignisse.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl sie nicht verehrt wurden, wurden Totempfähle oft als Symbole für Wohlstand und das gemeinsame Erbe betrachtet. Einige Totempfähle waren jedoch als Warnung, nicht als Erinnerung, gedacht. "Schandpfähle" konnten errichtet werden, um einen Stamm an eine bestimmte Schuld oder Beleidigung zu erinnern. Ein besonders umstrittener Pfahl, der sich heute im Staatsmuseum von Alaska befindet, zeigt das Antlitz Präsident Abraham Lincolns. Manche behaupten, der "Lincoln-Pfahl" sei errichtet worden, um die Emanzipations-Proklamation zu würdigen, während viele glauben, er wurde errichtet, um den Wohlstand zu beklagen, den der Stamm der Tlingit einbüßte, als sie gezwungen wurden, ihre Sklaven freizulassen.
TEXT.Italian: I totem erano una tradizione delle tribù native americane della costa nord occidentale del Pacifico. Costruiti dall'Oregon all'Alaska, i totem erano una rappresentazione grafica di diverse leggende tribali o di eventi importanti. [PARAGRAPH:1]Pur non essendo adorati, i totem erano spesso onorati come simboli di ricchezza e di comune retaggio. Alcuni totem però servivano da avvertimento, più che da testamento. I "pali della vergogna" potevano essere eretti per ricordare una tribù, un debito o un'offesa particolare. Un palo particolarmente controverso, che ora si trova nel Museo Statale dell'Alaska, reca l'immagine del presidente Abramo Lincoln. Alcuni sostengono che il "Palo di Lincoln" sia stato eretto per onorare la Proclamazione di emancipazione, mentre molti altri credono che stia a indicare il dolore della tribù Tlingits quando fu costretta a liberare i propri schiavi.
TEXT.Spanish: Los tótems eran una tradición de las tribus indias del noroeste del Pacífico. Presentes de Oregón a Alaska, los tótems son representaciones visuales de leyendas tribales o sucesos importantes. [PARAGRAPH:1]Sin embargo, no eran objetos de culto, aunque sí, muy a menudo, símbolos de riqueza y herencia común. Algunos de ellos servían como advertencias, más que como testimonios. Los "postes de la vergüenza" podían levantarse para recordarle a una tribu una deuda u ofensa grave. Uno de ellos, especialmente controvertido y que se encuentra en el Museo del estado de Alaska, exhibe la imagen del presidente Abraham Lincoln. Algunos dicen que el "poste de Lincoln" se construyó para honrarlo por la proclamación de la emancipación, mientras que para otros es un lamento por la riqueza perdida cuando los tlingits se vieron obligados a liberar a sus esclavos.

TEXT.English: The Ziggurats were religious centers dedicated to the gods of ancient Sumeria. Each comprised a temple built upon of a series of tiered, earthen platforms, raising the building atop and dwarfing the surrounding structures. Every city's Ziggurat was dedicated to one specific god. These individual dedications sprung from the Sumerian belief that each temple was not a place of worship, but the actual home of the god. Belief held that the gods originated from the distant mountains, and it is thought that the ziggurats were raised in order to make the new dwellings of the gods a little more like home.
TEXT.French: Les ziggourats sont des centres religieux dédiés aux dieux de l'ancien Sumer. Chacune d'elle est dotée d'un temple construit sur une série de plateformes en terre disposées en gradins. Chaque ziggourat est dédiée à un dieu spécifique. Cela trouve son explication dans la croyance sumérienne selon laquelle les temples ne sont pas des lieux de culte, mais les résidences des dieux. En effet, les sumériens croient que les dieux proviennent des montagnes lointaines, et l'on pense que les ziggourat étaient érigées pour que les dieux se sentent un peu chez eux dans leurs nouvelles demeures.
TEXT.German: Zikkurate waren religiöse Zentren, die den Göttern des antiken Sumer geweiht waren. Jede beinhaltete einen auf einer Reihe gestufter Erdplattformen gebauten Tempel, der das Gebäude über allen umgebenden Gebäuden aufragen ließ. Die Zikkurat einer jeden Stadt war einer bestimmten Gottheit geweiht. Diese individuellen Zuschreibungen entstanden aus dem sumerischen Glauben, ein Tempel sei nicht nur eine Gebetsstätte, sondern die tatsächliche Behausung der Gottheit. Dem Glauben nach stammten die Götter aus den fernen Bergen und man nimmt an, dass die Zikkurate deswegen erhöht wurden, damit die neuen Wohnstätten der Götter heimeliger wirkten.
TEXT.Italian: Le Ziggurat erano centri religiosi dedicati all'idea dell'antica Sumeria. Ognuna era composta da un tempio costruito su piani sovrapposti, che si innalzavano al di sopra delle strutture circostanti. La Ziggurat di ogni città era dedicata a una specifica divinità. La consacrazione individuale nasceva dalla credenza dei Sumeri che il tempio non era un luogo di culto, ma la vera casa del dio. La credenza voleva che le divinità fossero originarie delle distanti montagne e si pensa che le Ziggurat fossero edificate per rendere la nuova abitazione della divinità più simile alla casa d'origine.
TEXT.Spanish: Los ziggurats eran centros religiosos consagrados a los dioses de la antigua Súmer. Cada uno de ellos constaba de un templo construido sobre una serie de plataformas de tierra escalonadas, de manera que empequeñecía todas las estructuras circundantes. El ziggurat de cada ciudad estaba dedicado a un dios concreto. Esta consagración individualizada derivaba del hecho de que los templos no se consideraban un lugar de culto, sino la casa real de cada dios. La creencia más generalizada sostenía que los dioses provenían de las lejanas montañas, por lo que es muy probable que los ziggurats se construyeran así para que se sintieran un poco más cerca de casa.

TEXT.English: Montreal Biodome
Animals are born every few turns to help defend their beloved homeland. Animals get tougher with advances in era.
TEXT.French: Animals are born every few turns to help defend their beloved homeland. Animals get tougher with advances in era.

TEXT.English: The Montreal Biodome is a facility located in Montreal that allows visitors to walk through replicas of four ecosystems found in the Americas. The Montreal Biodome is one of four facilities operated by the Montreal Nature Museum, which include the Montreal Insectarium, Montreal Botanical Garden, and Montreal Planetarium. It is an accredited member of both the Association of Zoos and Aquariums and the Canadian Association of Zoos and Aquariums.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The facility allows visitors to walk through replicas of four ecosystems found in the Americas:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Tropical Forest is a replica of the South American rainforest.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Laurentian Forest is a replica of the North American wilderness.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Saint Lawrence Marine Eco-system is an estuary habitat modelled on the Gulf of Saint Lawrence.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A polar area that is divided into Arctic and Antarctic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]All the exhibits are housed inside the former velodrome that was used for the cycling and judo events of the 1976 Summer Olympics, with each of the four environments taking up a portion of the stadium. A variety of animals live in each simulated habitat, ranging from the macaws in the Tropical Forest, to the lynx in the Laurentian Forest, to the penguins in the Antarctic and the different kinds of fish that inhabit the waters of the Saint Lawrence River.
TEXT.French: The Montreal Biodome is a facility located in Montreal that allows visitors to walk through replicas of four ecosystems found in the Americas. The Montreal Biodome is one of four facilities operated by the Montreal Nature Museum, which include the Montreal Insectarium, Montreal Botanical Garden, and Montreal Planetarium. It is an accredited member of both the Association of Zoos and Aquariums and the Canadian Association of Zoos and Aquariums.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The facility allows visitors to walk through replicas of four ecosystems found in the Americas:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Tropical Forest is a replica of the South American rainforest.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Laurentian Forest is a replica of the North American wilderness.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Saint Lawrence Marine Eco-system is an estuary habitat modelled on the Gulf of Saint Lawrence.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A polar area that is divided into Arctic and Antarctic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]All the exhibits are housed inside the former velodrome that was used for the cycling and judo events of the 1976 Summer Olympics, with each of the four environments taking up a portion of the stadium. A variety of animals live in each simulated habitat, ranging from the macaws in the Tropical Forest, to the lynx in the Laurentian Forest, to the penguins in the Antarctic and the different kinds of fish that inhabit the waters of the Saint Lawrence River.
TEXT.Polish: The Montreal Biodome to osrodek zoologiczny, który pozawala zwiedzac cztery biodomy ameryki pólnocnej. Zajmuje sie takze ochrona i rozmnazaniem zagrozonych gatunków zwierzat.

TEXT.English: Cyrus Cylinder
TEXT.French: Le Cylindre de Cyrus

TEXT.English: The Cyrus cylinder, also known as the Cyrus the Great cylinder, is a document issued by the Persian ruler Cyrus the Great in the form of a clay cylinder inscribed in Akkadian cuneiform script. The cylinder was created following the Persian conquest of Babylon in 539 BC, when Cyrus overthrew the Babylonian king Nabonidus and replaced him as ruler, ending the Neo-Babylonian Empire. The text of the cylinder denounces Nabonidus as impious and portrays the victorious Cyrus as pleasing to the chief Babylonian god Marduk. It goes on to describe how Cyrus had improved the lives of the citizens of Babylonia, repatriated displaced peoples and restored temples and cult sanctuaries.
TEXT.French: The Cyrus cylinder, also known as the Cyrus the Great cylinder, is a document issued by the Persian ruler Cyrus the Great in the form of a clay cylinder inscribed in Akkadian cuneiform script. The cylinder was created following the Persian conquest of Babylon in 539 BC, when Cyrus overthrew the Babylonian king Nabonidus and replaced him as ruler, ending the Neo-Babylonian Empire. The text of the cylinder denounces Nabonidus as impious and portrays the victorious Cyrus as pleasing to the chief Babylonian god Marduk. It goes on to describe how Cyrus had improved the lives of the citizens of Babylonia, repatriated displaced peoples and restored temples and cult sanctuaries.
TEXT.Polish: Cylinder Cyrusa (zwany tez Cylindrem Cyrusa Wielkiego) - gliniany cylinder, na którym król perski Cyrus II Wielki nakazal wyryc pismem klinowym napisy stanowiace jego deklaracje polityczna po zajeciu Babilonu.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cyrus Cylinder[COLOR_REVERT] generates great generals based on your empire's power.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cyrus Cylinder[COLOR_REVERT] generates great generals based on your empire's power.

TEXT.English: Nazca Lines

The Nazca Lines are a series of ancient geoglyphs located in the Nazca Desert in southern Peru. They were designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994. The high, arid plateau stretches more than 80 kilometres between the towns of Nazca and Palpa on the Pampas de Jumana about 400 km south of Lima. Although some local geoglyphs resemble Paracas motifs, scholars believe the Nazca Lines were created by the Nazca culture between 400 and 650 AD. The hundreds of individual figures range in complexity from simple lines to stylized hummingbirds, spiders, monkeys, fish, sharks, orcas, llamas, and lizards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Contrary to the popular belief that the lines and figures can only be seen with the aid of flight, they are visible from atop the surrounding foothills. They were first discovered by the Peruvian archaeologist Toribio Mejia Xesspe, who spotted them when hiking through the foothills in 1927. The Nazca "drew" several hundred simple but huge curvilinear animal and human figures by this technique. In total, the earthwork project is huge and complex: the area encompassing the lines is nearly 500 square kilometres, and the largest figures can span nearly 270 metres. The extremely dry, windless, and constant climate of the Nazca region has preserved the lines well. The Nazca desert is one of the driest on Earth and maintains a temperature around 25 °C all year round. The lack of wind has helped keep the lines uncovered and visible to the present day.
TEXT.French: The Nazca Lines are a series of ancient geoglyphs located in the Nazca Desert in southern Peru. They were designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994. The high, arid plateau stretches more than 80 kilometres between the towns of Nazca and Palpa on the Pampas de Jumana about 400 km south of Lima. Although some local geoglyphs resemble Paracas motifs, scholars believe the Nazca Lines were created by the Nazca culture between 400 and 650 AD. The hundreds of individual figures range in complexity from simple lines to stylized hummingbirds, spiders, monkeys, fish, sharks, orcas, llamas, and lizards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Contrary to the popular belief that the lines and figures can only be seen with the aid of flight, they are visible from atop the surrounding foothills. They were first discovered by the Peruvian archaeologist Toribio Mejia Xesspe, who spotted them when hiking through the foothills in 1927. The Nazca "drew" several hundred simple but huge curvilinear animal and human figures by this technique. In total, the earthwork project is huge and complex: the area encompassing the lines is nearly 500 square kilometres, and the largest figures can span nearly 270 metres. The extremely dry, windless, and constant climate of the Nazca region has preserved the lines well. The Nazca desert is one of the driest on Earth and maintains a temperature around 25 °C all year round. The lack of wind has helped keep the lines uncovered and visible to the present day.
TEXT.Polish: Rysunki z Nazca - system linii, które ogladane z góry przypominaja ksztaltem zwierzeta, rosliny lub figury geometryczne, bedacy dzielem kultury Nazca. Znajduja sie w poludniowo-zachodniej czesci Peru, niedaleko miasta Nazca, na obszarze ponad 50 km dlugosci i 14 km szerokosci. Linie znajduja sie na czterech plaskowyzach: Palpa, Ingenio, Nazca i Socos, polozonych pomiedzy 419 a 465 kilometrem autostrady panamerykanskiej. Zostaly stworzone przez Indian Nazca miedzy rokiem 300 p.n.e. a 900 n.e.

TEXT.English: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

French.Text: Les Catacombes de Kom el Shoqafa

TEXT.English: The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa (meaning 'Mound of shards' or 'Potsherds') is a historical archaeological site located in Alexandria, Egypt and is considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Middle Ages. The necropolis consists of a series of Alexandrian tombs, statues and archaeological objects of the Pharaonic funeral cult with Hellenistic and early Imperial Roman influences.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Due to the time period, many of the features of the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa merge Roman, Greek and Egyptian cultural points; some statues are Egyptian in style, yet bear Roman clothes and hair style whilst other features share a similar style. A circular staircase, which was often used to transport deceased bodies down the middle of it, leads down into the tombs that were tunneled into the bedrock during the age of the Antonine emperors (2nd century AD). The facility was then used as a burial chamber from the 2nd century to the 4th century, before being rediscovered in 1900 when a donkey accidentally fell into the access shaft. To date, three sarcophagi have been found, along with other human and animal remains which were added later. It is believed that the catacombs were only intended for a single family, but it is unclear why the site was expanded in order to house numerous other individuals. The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa is, according to some lists, also one of the seven medieval wonders of the world. One of the more gruesome features of the catacombs is the so called Hall of Caracalla. According to tradition, this is a mass burial chamber for the humans and animals massacred by order of the Emperor Caracalla.
TEXT.French: The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa (meaning 'Mound of shards' or 'Potsherds') is a historical archaeological site located in Alexandria, Egypt and is considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Middle Ages. The necropolis consists of a series of Alexandrian tombs, statues and archaeological objects of the Pharaonic funeral cult with Hellenistic and early Imperial Roman influences.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Due to the time period, many of the features of the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa merge Roman, Greek and Egyptian cultural points; some statues are Egyptian in style, yet bear Roman clothes and hair style whilst other features share a similar style. The facility was then used as a burial chamber from the 2nd century to the 4th century, before being rediscovered in 1900 when a donkey accidentally fell into the access shaft. To date, three sarcophagi have been found, along with other human and animal remains which were added later. It is believed that the catacombs were only intended for a single family, but it is unclear why the site was expanded in order to house numerous other individuals. The Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa is, according to some lists, also one of the seven medieval wonders of the world. One of the more gruesome features of the catacombs is the so called Hall of Caracalla. According to tradition, this is a mass burial chamber for the humans and animals massacred by order of the Emperor Caracalla.
TEXT.Polish: Katakumby Kaum asz-Szukafa - odkryte zostaly w Egipcie w Aleksandrii w 1900. Sredniowieczni mysliciele i filozofowie wybrali je za cud swiata sredniowiecznego.[potrzebne zródlo] Do naszych czasów pozostaly one w idealnym stanie.

TEXT.English: Famen Temple
Famen Inspired
TEXT.French: Famen Inspired

TEXT.English: Famen Temple is located in Famen town, Fufeng County, 120 kilometers west of Xi'an City, Shaanxi province. It was widely regarded as the "ancestor of pagoda temples in Guanzhong area".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]One theory, supported by unearthed eaves-tiles and carved bricks of Han Dynasty, is that the temple was built during the Northern Zhou Dynasty, by Emperor Huan and also by Emperor Ling of the Eastern Han Dynasty. The literature record indicates that during Northern Wei Dynasty, Famen Temple already existed on a quite large scale. However, Buddhism was greatly suppressed in Emperor Wu's years of Northern Zhou Dynasty, and Famen Temple was almost completely destroyed. After establishment of Sui Dynasty, Buddhism was venerated, and Famen Temple was rebuilt, although it couldn't be recovered to its heyday in Northern Wei Dynasty. Its name was changed to Cheng Shi Dao Chang and soon it merged with nearby Baochang Temple and became a temple-owned farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Famen Temple entered its halcyon days after formation of the Tang Dynasty. In AD 618, it was named Famen Temple, and monks were recruited next year. Later the temple took in homeless people from chaos caused by the war at the end of Sui Dynasty, and was unfortunately burnt. It was rebuilt later by the effort of monks. In AD 631, a man named Zhang Liang was appointed to demolish Wangyun Palace to build the pagoda. It was rebuilt in AD 660, and appeared to be a four-storied pavilion-like pagoda. It was named later by Tang Zhongzong "True Relic Pagoda". Tang Zhongzong actively advocated Buddhism, and along with Empress Wei buried their hairs under the pagoda (unearthed in autumn 1978). In AD 710, the temple was renamed "Grand Empire Carefree King Temple", and the pagoda "Grand True Relic Pagoda". In Yizong's years, it held the last activity of Buddha relic acquisition in Tang Dynasty. At that time, Famen Temple was rebuilt, and its underground palace has never been altered since then. The emperors of Tang Dynasty acquired Buddha relic 7 times here, and every time donated generously, which facilitated the expansion of the temple and pagoda. After being built and renovated multiple times, Famen Temple evolved into a scale of 24 courtyards.

It was widely regarded as the "ancestor of pagoda temples in Guanzhong area".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]One theory, supported by unearthed eaves-tiles and carved bricks of Han Dynasty, is that the temple was built during the Northern Zhou Dynasty, by Emperor Huan and also by Emperor Ling of the Eastern Han Dynasty. TEXT.Polish: Swiatynia Famen to buddyjska swiatynia z czasów dynastii Han. Jest zlokalizowana 120 kilometrów od Xi'an w prowincji Shaanxi.

TEXT.English: Empire State Building

The Empire State Building is a 102-story landmark skyscraper and American cultural icon in New York City at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and West 34th Street. It has a roof height of 1,250 feet (381 m) and with its antenna spire included, it stands a total of 1,454 ft (443.18 m) high. Its name is derived from the nickname for New York, the Empire State. It stood as the world's tallest building for 40 years, from its completion in 1931 until construction of the World Trade Center's North Tower was completed in 1972. Following the destruction of the World Trade Center in 2001, the Empire State Building reclaimed the position of tallest building in New York. Once the new One World Trade Center is completed, it will once again be demoted to second tallest building in New York.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The Empire State Building is designed in the distinctive Art Deco style, and has been named by the American Society of Civil Engineers as one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World. The building and its street floor interior are designated landmarks of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission, and confirmed by the New York City Board of Estimate. It was designated as a National Historic Landmark in 1986. In 2007, it was ranked number one on the List of America's Favorite Architecture according to the AIA. The Empire State Building is currently the third tallest skyscraper in the United States (after the Willis Tower and Trump International Hotel and Tower, both in Chicago), and the 15th tallest in the world. It is also the fourth-tallest freestanding structure in the Americas. The Empire State Building is currently undergoing a $550 million renovation, with $120 million spent in an effort to transform the building into a more energy efficient and eco-friendly structure. Receiving a gold Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design rating in September 2011, the Empire State Building is the tallest LEED certified building in the United States.
TEXT.French: The Empire State Building is a 102-story landmark skyscraper and American cultural icon in New York City at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and West 34th Street. It has a roof height of 1,250 feet (381 m) and with its antenna spire included, it stands a total of 1,454 ft (443.18 m) high. Its name is derived from the nickname for New York, the Empire State. The building and its street floor interior are designated landmarks of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission, and confirmed by the New York City Board of Estimate. It is also the fourth-tallest freestanding structure in the Americas. The Empire State Building is currently undergoing a $550 million renovation, with $120 million spent in an effort to transform the building into a more energy efficient and eco-friendly structure. Receiving a gold Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design rating in September 2011, the Empire State Building is the tallest LEED certified building in the United States.
TEXT.Polish: The Empire State Building - wiezowiec w Nowym Jorku w Stanach Zjednoczonych. Jeden z najbardziej rozpoznawalnych symboli nie tylko miasta, ale takze calego kraju. Oficjalne otwarcie poprowadzil prezydent Herbert Hoover, który 1 maja 1931 w Waszyngtonie nacisnal przycisk zapalajacy swiatla budynku. Od chwili wybudowania do 1973 ESB byl najwyzszym budynkiem w Nowym Jorku. Tytul najwyzszej budowli odzyskal 11 wrzesnia 2001 po zamachach terrorystycznych na wieze World Trade Center, które byly do tej pory na najwyzszych pozycjach. W calym kraju jest obecnie na 3. miejscu po Willis Tower i Trump International Hotel and Tower w Chicago. Jego oficjalna wysokosc wynosi 381 metrów. Jednak jesli liczyc równiez antene znajdujaca sie na dachu wysokosc ta wzrasta az do 443,2 metrów. Ma 103 pietra, w tym jedno podziemne. Zostal zaprojektowany w stylu art déco przez Shreve, Lamb and Harmon Associates. American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) zaliczylo go do 7 cudów wspólczesnego swiata. Nalezy do World Federation of Great Towers. Jego nazwa pochodzi od przydomku stanu Nowy Jork, który brzmi wlasnie Empire State.

TEXT.English: Pergamon Altar

The Pergamon Altar is a monumental construction built during the reign of King Eumenes II in the first half of the 2nd century BC on one of the terraces of the acropolis of the ancient city of Pergamon in Asia Minor. The structure is 35.64 meters wide and 33.4 meters deep; the front stairway alone is almost 20 meters wide. The base is decorated with a frieze in high relief showing the battle between the Giants and the Olympian gods known as the Gigantomachy. There is a second, smaller and less well-preserved high relief frieze on the inner court walls which surround the actual fire altar on the upper level of the structure at the top of the stairs. It depicts, in a series of consecutive scenes, events from the life of Telephus, legendary founder of the city of Pergamon and son of the hero Heracles and Auge, a daughter of the Tegean king Aleus.
TEXT.French: The Pergamon Altar is a monumental construction built during the reign of King Eumenes II in the first half of the 2nd century BC on one of the terraces of the acropolis of the ancient city of Pergamon in Asia Minor. The structure is 35.64 meters wide and 33.4 meters deep; the front stairway alone is almost 20 meters wide. The base is decorated with a frieze in high relief showing the battle between the Giants and the Olympian gods known as the Gigantomachy. There is a second, smaller and less well-preserved high relief frieze on the inner court walls which surround the actual fire altar on the upper level of the structure at the top of the stairs. It depicts, in a series of consecutive scenes, events from the life of Telephus, legendary founder of the city of Pergamon and son of the hero Heracles and Auge, a daughter of the Tegean king Aleus.
TEXT.Polish: Wielki Oltarz Zeusa - wolno stojacy (niezwiazany ze swiatynia) oltarz poswiecony Zeusowi i Atenie Zwycieskiej (gr. Nikeforos). Zbudowany zostal, wedlug projektów Menekratesa z Rodos, w latach (180-160 p.n.e.) w Pergamonie przez Eumenesa II dla upamietnienia zwyciestwa nad Galatami.

TEXT.English: Taipei 101

Taipei 101, formerly known as the Taipei World Financial Center, is a landmark skyscraper located in Xinyi District, Taipei, Taiwan. The building ranked officially as the world's tallest from 2004 until the opening of the Burj Khalifa in Dubai in 2010. In July 2011, the building was awarded LEED Platinum certification, the highest award in the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design rating system and became the tallest and largest green building in the world. The tower has served as an icon of modern Taiwan ever since its opening, and received the 2004 Emporis Skyscraper Award. Fireworks launched from Taipei 101 feature prominently in international New Year's Eve broadcasts and the structure appears frequently in travel literature and international media.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Taipei 101 comprises 101 floors above ground and 5 floors underground. The building was architecturally created as a symbol of the evolution of technology and Asian tradition. Its postmodernist approach to style incorporates traditional design elements and gives them modern treatments. The tower is designed to withstand typhoons and earthquakes. A multi-level shopping mall adjoining the tower houses hundreds of fashionable stores, restaurants and clubs.
TEXT.French: Taipei 101, formerly known as the Taipei World Financial Center, is a landmark skyscraper located in Xinyi District, Taipei, Taiwan. The building ranked officially as the world's tallest from 2004 until the opening of the Burj Khalifa in Dubai in 2010. In July 2011, the building was awarded LEED Platinum certification, the highest award in the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design rating system and became the tallest and largest green building in the world. The tower has served as an icon of modern Taiwan ever since its opening, and received the 2004 Emporis Skyscraper Award. Fireworks launched from Taipei 101 feature prominently in international New Year's Eve broadcasts and the structure appears frequently in travel literature and international media.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Taipei 101 comprises 101 floors above ground and 5 floors underground. The building was architecturally created as a symbol of the evolution of technology and Asian tradition. Its postmodernist approach to style incorporates traditional design elements and gives them modern treatments. The tower is designed to withstand typhoons and earthquakes. A multi-level shopping mall adjoining the tower houses hundreds of fashionable stores, restaurants and clubs.
TEXT.Polish: Taipei 101 - liczacy 509,2 m wiezowiec znajdujacy sie w Tajpej na Tajwanie, w dzielnicy Xinyi. Budynek, zaprojektowany w biurze C.Y.Lee and Partners i wzniesiony w przewazajacej czesci przez przedsiebiorstwa KTRT Joint Venture oraz Samsung Engineering and Construction. Do 4 stycznia 2010 (uroczyste otwarcie Burdz Chalifa w Dubaju, Zjednoczone Emiraty Arabskie) dzierzyl przyznawany oficjalnie przez Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat tytul najwyzszego ukonczonego budynku swiata. Wiezowiec posiada 101 kondygnacji nadziemnych oraz 5 podziemnych. Postmodernistyczna architektura budowli laczy w sobie elementy tradycyjne i nowoczesne, nawiazujac zarówno do azjatyckiego kregu kulturowego, jak i trendów ogólnoswiatowej architektury. Taipei 101 wyposazony jest w systemy zabezpieczen zdolne oprzec sie trzesieniom ziemi i huraganom, czesto nawiedzajacym te czesc swiata. Wielopietrowe centrum handlowe przylegajace do wiezowca miesci setki markowych sklepów, restauracji oraz klubów. Pokaz fajerwerków wystrzeliwanych z budowli stal sie stalym elementem relacji telewizyjnych z obchodów Nowego Roku, wiezowiec na dobre wniknal tez do kultury masowej - pojawia sie czesto w filmach, programach telewizyjnych, drukowanych publikacjach, grach komputerowych i przy wielu innych okazjach.

TEXT.English: Tsukiji Fish Market

French.Text: Le Marché aux poissons de Tsukiji

TEXT.English: The Tokyo Metropolitan Central Wholesale Market commonly known as the Tsukiji Market, is the biggest wholesale fish and seafood market in the world and also one of the largest wholesale food markets of any kind. The market is located in Tsukiji in central Tokyo, and is a major attraction for foreign visitors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The market handles more than 400 different types of seafood from cheap seaweed to the most expensive caviar, and from tiny sardines to 300 kg tuna and controversial whale species. Overall, more than 700,000 metric tons of seafood are handled every year at the three seafood markets in Tokyo, with a total value in excess of 600 billion yen (approximately 5.5 billion US dollars). The number of registered employees as of 25 January 2010 varies from 60,000 to 65,000, including wholesalers, accountants, auctioneers, company officials, and distributors.
TEXT.French: Montreal Biodome
TEXT.Italian: Montreal Biodome
TEXT.Spanish: Montreal Biodome
TEXT.Polish: Targ rybny Tsukiji - nazwa oficjalna: Centralny Tokijski Hurtowy Targ Metropolitalny. Najwiekszy na swiecie hurtowy targ rybny. Takze jeden z najwiekszych hurtowych targów zywnosciowych w ogóle. Sprzedaje sie na nim wszelkie rodzaje ryb - od sardynek po trzystukilogramowe tunczyki - oraz inne owoce morza. Targ zostal zalozony w 1923, choc tradycja targów rybnych w Tokio siega epoki Edo, kiedy to pierwszy zostal zalozony przez Ieyasu Tokugawe. Ogólnie, na trzech tokijskich targach rybnych sprzedaje sie rocznie ponad 700 tys. ton ryb i owoców morza, a obroty wynosza okolo 600 mld jenów (okolo 5,5 mld dolarów). Sam targ Tsukiji zbywa okolo 2 tys. ton dziennie, a liczba wszystkich zarejestrowanych pracowników waha sie miedzy 60 a 65 tysiacami.

TEXT.English: Zizkov Television Tower
TEXT.French: La Tour de Télévision de Zizkov

TEXT.English: The Zizkov Television Tower is a unique transmitter tower built in Prague between 1985 and 1992. It stands high above the city's traditional skyline from its position on top of a hill in the district of Zizkov, from which it takes its name. The tower is an example of high-tech architecture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Like many examples of communist-era architecture in Central and Eastern Europe, the TV tower used to be generally resented by the local inhabitants. It also received a spate of nicknames, mostly alluding to its rocket-like shape, e.g. "Baikonur" after Soviet cosmodrome, "Pershing" after the US IRBM, etc. Although official criticism during the time of its construction was impossible, unofficially the tower was lambasted for its 'megalomania', its 'jarring' effect on the Prague skyline, and for destroying part of a centuries-old Jewish cemetery situated near the tower's foundations. However, the official line remains that the cemetery was moved some time before the tower was conceived. Recently, the tower's reputation among Czechs has improved. Voted #2 on the World's Ugliest Buildings list.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Rumours have also circulated that the tower was planned to be used to jam incoming western radio and television transmissions and that it had a potential use as a communications facility for Warsaw Pact forces in the event of an attack on (or attack by) NATO.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Today, the tower management strives to attract Czech visitors by focusing on the tower's technological innovations.
TEXT.French: The Zizkov Television Tower is a unique transmitter tower built in Prague between 1985 and 1992. It stands high above the city's traditional skyline from its position on top of a hill in the district of Zizkov, from which it takes its name. The tower is an example of high-tech architecture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Like many examples of communist-era architecture in Central and Eastern Europe, the TV tower used to be generally resented by the local inhabitants. It also received a spate of nicknames, mostly alluding to its rocket-like shape, e.g. "Baikonur" after Soviet cosmodrome, "Pershing" after the US IRBM, etc. Although official criticism during the time of its construction was impossible, unofficially the tower was lambasted for its 'megalomania', its 'jarring' effect on the Prague skyline, and for destroying part of a centuries-old Jewish cemetery situated near the tower's foundations. However, the official line remains that the cemetery was moved some time before the tower was conceived. Recently, the tower's reputation among Czechs has improved. Voted #2 on the World's Ugliest Buildings list.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Rumours have also circulated that the tower was planned to be used to jam incoming western radio and television transmissions and that it had a potential use as a communications facility for Warsaw Pact forces in the event of an attack on (or attack by) NATO.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Today, the tower management strives to attract Czech visitors by focusing on the tower's technological innovations.
TEXT.Polish: Wieza telewizyjna Zizkov - wieza zelbetowa o wysokosci 216 m, zlokalizowana w praskiej dzielnicy Zizkov. Zostala zbudowana w latach 1985-1992. Zaprojektowali ja Vaclav Aulicky, Jirí Kozak i Alex Bem, a sama konstrukcja chroniona jest patentem. Z obiektu emitowanych jest szesc stacji radiowych oraz trzy multipleksy naziemnej telewizji cyfrowej. Na wysokosci 65 metrów znajduje sie restauracja i kawiarnia, natomiast na wysokosci 93 metrów zlokalizowano punkt widokowy, skladajacy sie z trzech kabin. Przy dobrej pogodzie widocznosc siega nawet 100 km. Wieza nalezy do Swiatowej Federacji Wielkich Wiez (World Federation of Great Towers).

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zizkov Television Tower[COLOR_REVERT] increases espionage in all cities. It also conceals the world map for rivals whom have not invented [LINK=TECH_SATELLITES]Satellites[\LINK] when built, and with a small chance may do so again each turn threafter. The per turn concealment chance depend on both world size and game speed. e.g. The chance per rival is 1 in 75 turns with "smallest/fastest", and 1 in 790 turns with "biggest/slowest". Chance Formula: 1 / (SIZE^2 + SPEED) [ICON_BULLET]Where SIZE range is 3-9 (small-big) and SPEED is, from fast to slow, [66,82,114,178,242,306,434,562,690].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tour de Télévision de Zizkov[COLOR_REVERT] disrupts trade and conceals the world map of rivals. Additionally, it increases espionage in all cities and reveals the world map.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Conceals World Map of Rivals when built. [ICON_BULLET]May conceal world map for rivals each turn. [ICON_BULLET]Rivals with [LINK=TECH_SATELLITES]Satellite[\LINK] Technology are Immune.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Révèle complètement la carte[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Dissimule la carte aux rivaux[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% de probabilité de dissimuler la carte chaque tour[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Les Rivaux possédant la Technologie des Satellites sont immunisés
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Odkrywa Mape Swiata[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Ukrywa Mape Swiata dla rywali.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]10% Mapy Swiata jest odkrywane rywalom co ture[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Rywale z odkryta technoligia Satelity sa odporni na ukrycie mapy.

TEXT.English: Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty
TEXT.French: Le Traité de Non-Prolifération nucléaire

TEXT.English: N/a
TEXT.French: N/a

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]All Players -1 Relationship with Nuke Owner for each Nuke Exploded[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Furious Rivals Declare War Immediately with Nuke Owner when Nuke Exploded[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires The Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, commonly known as the Non-Proliferation Treaty or NPT, is a landmark international treaty whose objective is to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and weapons technology, to promote cooperation in the peaceful uses of nuclear energy and to further the goal of achieving nuclear disarmament and general and complete disarmament. Opened for signature in 1968, the Treaty entered into force in 1970. On 11 May 1995, the Treaty was extended indefinitely. A total of 190 parties have joined the Treaty, including the five nuclear-weapon States: the United States, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, and China (also the five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council). More countries have ratified the NPT than any other arms limitation and disarmament agreement, a testament to the Treaty's significance. Four non-parties to the treaty are known or believed to possess nuclear weapons: India, Pakistan and North Korea have openly tested and declared that they possess nuclear weapons, while Israel has had a policy of opacity regarding its own nuclear weapons program. North Korea acceded to the treaty in 1985, but never came into compliance, and announced its withdrawal in 2003.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The NPT is often seen to be based on a central bargain: ¡°the NPT non-nuclear-weapon states agree never to acquire nuclear weapons and the NPT nuclear-weapon states in exchange agree to share the benefits of peaceful nuclear technology and to pursue nuclear disarmament aimed at the ultimate elimination of their nuclear arsenals¡±. The treaty is reviewed every five years in meetings called Review Conferences of the Parties to the Treaty of Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. Even though the treaty was originally conceived with a limited duration of 25 years, the signing parties decided, by consensus, to extend the treaty indefinitely and without conditions during the Review Conference in New York City on May 11, 1995.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]All Players -1 Relationship with Nuke Owner for each Nuke Exploded[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Furious Rivals Declare War Immediately with Nuke Owner when Nuke Exploded[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires The Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, commonly known as the Non-Proliferation Treaty or NPT, is a landmark international treaty whose objective is to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and weapons technology, to promote cooperation in the peaceful uses of nuclear energy and to further the goal of achieving nuclear disarmament and general and complete disarmament. Opened for signature in 1968, the Treaty entered into force in 1970. On 11 May 1995, the Treaty was extended indefinitely. A total of 190 parties have joined the Treaty, including the five nuclear-weapon States: the United States, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, and China (also the five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council). More countries have ratified the NPT than any other arms limitation and disarmament agreement, a testament to the Treaty's significance. Four non-parties to the treaty are known or believed to possess nuclear weapons: India, Pakistan and North Korea have openly tested and declared that they possess nuclear weapons, while Israel has had a policy of opacity regarding its own nuclear weapons program. North Korea acceded to the treaty in 1985, but never came into compliance, and announced its withdrawal in 2003.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The NPT is often seen to be based on a central bargain: ¡°the NPT non-nuclear-weapon states agree never to acquire nuclear weapons and the NPT nuclear-weapon states in exchange agree to share the benefits of peaceful nuclear technology and to pursue nuclear disarmament aimed at the ultimate elimination of their nuclear arsenals¡±. The treaty is reviewed every five years in meetings called Review Conferences of the Parties to the Treaty of Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. Even though the treaty was originally conceived with a limited duration of 25 years, the signing parties decided, by consensus, to extend the treaty indefinitely and without conditions during the Review Conference in New York City on May 11, 1995.
TEXT.Polish: Uklad o nierozprzestrzenianiu broni jadrowej (ang. Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons) - umowa miedzynarodowa zabraniajaca panstwom posiadajacym technologie budowy broni jadrowej sprzedazy jej do krajów, które tej technologii nie posiadaja i jednoczesnie zobowiazanie panstw, które jej nie posiadaja do zaprzestania prób jej rozwoju. Jest takze, w Artykule VI, obowiazek rozbrojenia jadrowego. Uklad ten zostal przedlozony do ratyfikacji 1 lipca 1968. Do konca 2003 roku ratyfikowalo go 189 panstw - wiecej niz jakikolwiek inny traktat.

TEXT.English: Ivy Mike
TEXT.French: Ivy Mike

TEXT.English: N/a
TEXT.French: N/a

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Damage Boost for Nukes[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 Radius of Fallout Created[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires The Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Ivy Mike was the codename given to the first United States test of a thermonuclear weapon in which a major part of the explosive yield came from nuclear fusion. It was detonated on November 1, 1952, by the United States on Enewetak, an atoll in the Pacific Ocean, as part of Operation Ivy. The device was the first full test of the Teller-Ulam design, a staged fusion bomb, and was the first successful test of a hydrogen bomb.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The test was carried out at 07:15 A.M local time on November 1, 1952. It produced a yield estimated in the range of 10.4¨C12 Megatons. However, 77% of the final yield came from fast fission of the uranium tamper, which meant that the device produced large amounts of fallout.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The blast created a crater 6,240 feet (1.9 km) in diameter and 164 feet (50 m) deep where Elugelab had once been; the blast and water waves from the explosion (some waves up to twenty feet high) stripped the test islands clean of vegetation, as observed by a helicopter survey within 60 minutes after the test, by which time the mushroom cloud and steam were blown away. Radioactive coral debris fell upon ships positioned 30 miles (48 km) from the blast, and the immediate area around the atoll was heavily contaminated for some time. Produced by intensely concentrated neutron flux about the detonation site were two new elements, einsteinium and fermium.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Damage Boost for Nukes[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 Radius of Fallout Created[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires The Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Ivy Mike was the codename given to the first United States test of a thermonuclear weapon in which a major part of the explosive yield came from nuclear fusion. It was detonated on November 1, 1952, by the United States on Enewetak, an atoll in the Pacific Ocean, as part of Operation Ivy. The device was the first full test of the Teller-Ulam design, a staged fusion bomb, and was the first successful test of a hydrogen bomb.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The test was carried out at 07:15 A.M local time on November 1, 1952. It produced a yield estimated in the range of 10.4¨C12 Megatons. However, 77% of the final yield came from fast fission of the uranium tamper, which meant that the device produced large amounts of fallout.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The blast created a crater 6,240 feet (1.9 km) in diameter and 164 feet (50 m) deep where Elugelab had once been; the blast and water waves from the explosion (some waves up to twenty feet high) stripped the test islands clean of vegetation, as observed by a helicopter survey within 60 minutes after the test, by which time the mushroom cloud and steam were blown away. Radioactive coral debris fell upon ships positioned 30 miles (48 km) from the blast, and the immediate area around the atoll was heavily contaminated for some time. Produced by intensely concentrated neutron flux about the detonation site were two new elements, einsteinium and fermium.
TEXT.Polish: Ivy Mike - nazwa kodowa (kryptonim) nadana pierwszej na swiecie, próbnej eksplozji termojadrowej przeprowadzonej 1 listopada 1952 roku na atolu Eniwetok nalezacym do Stanów Zjednoczonych. Byla to pierwsza eksplozja przeprowadzona w ramach Operacji Ivy. Moc wybuchu wynosila 10 megaton.

TEXT.English: Tomb of Cyrus
TEXT.French: La Tombe de Cyrus

TEXT.English: The Tomb of Cyrus is the burial place of the ancient Cyrus the Great of Persia. The tomb is located in Iran, at the Pasargadae World Heritage Site. Cyrus the Great was a Persian Shahenshah (or Emperor), who founded the Persian Empire under the Achaemenid dynasty. It is also said to be the oldest base-isolated structure in the world, and so is resilient to seismic hazards. This empire thence expanded under his rule, as Cyrus eventually conquered the majority of Southwest Asia as well as much of Central Asia, from Egypt and the Hellespont to the Indus River in the east, to create the most expansive nation the world had seen up until that era.
TEXT.French: The Tomb of Cyrus is the burial place of the ancient Cyrus the Great of Persia. The tomb is located in Iran, at the Pasargadae World Heritage Site. Cyrus the Great was a Persian Shahenshah (or Emperor), who founded the Persian Empire under the Achaemenid dynasty. It is also said to be the oldest base-isolated structure in the world, and so is resilient to seismic hazards. This empire thence expanded under his rule, as Cyrus eventually conquered the majority of Southwest Asia as well as much of Central Asia, from Egypt and the Hellespont to the Indus River in the east, to create the most expansive nation the world had seen up until that era.
TEXT.Polish: Cyrus II Wielki, zwany takze Starszym (ok. 590-529 p.n.e.) - król Persji z dynastii Achemenidów, syn króla Anszanu Kambyzesa I i medyjskiej ksiezniczki Mandane. Zjednoczyl w ramach swojego imperium wiele ówczesnych panstw. Znany nie tylko z wielkich osiagniec wojennych, lecz takze z tolerancji i sprawiedliwosci. W ciagu niespelna dwudziestu pieciu lat panowania Cyrus podbil wiekszosc krajów Bliskiego Wschodu z wyjatkiem Egiptu i plemion Wyzyny Iranskiej.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tomb of Cyrus[COLOR_REVERT] prevents the death of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Generals[COLOR_REVERT]. However, they need 8 turns to recover from their injuries.
