TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Bonus di +3 alle relazioni con tutti i leader già incontrati

TEXT.English: Leaders from around the world are gathering for the Field of the Cloth of Gold.
TEXT.French: Les Leaders du monde entier sont à la recherche du Camp du Drap d'Or.
TEXT.Italian: I leader di tutto il mondo si stanno radunando al Campo del Drappo d'oro

TEXT.English: You have completed the Field of the Cloth of Gold. Leaders from around the world are gathering for this grand event.
TEXT.French: You have completed the Field of the Cloth of Gold. Leaders from around the world are gathering for this grand event.
TEXT.Italian: Hai completato il Campo del Drappo d'oro. I leader di tutto il mondo si stanno rdunando per questo grande evento.

TEXT.English: This will build bonds of friendship between us.
TEXT.French: This will build bonds of friendship between us.
TEXT.Italian: Questo creerà nuovi legami d'amicizia fra di noi.

TEXT.English: Leaders from around the world are gathering for the Field of the Cloth of Gold.
TEXT.French: Leaders from around the world are gathering for the Field of the Cloth of Gold.
TEXT.Italian: Leader da tutto il mondo si stanno radunando per il Campo del Drappo d'oro

TEXT.English: Giverny
TEXT.French: Giverny

TEXT.English: Build Giverny to increase the culture and happiness of your Art Galleries and Art Patronage.
TEXT.French: Construire la Merveille de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Giverny[COLOR_REVERT], c'est un grand pas en avant pour l'art. Elle augmente la culture et le bonheur des vos [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Galeries d'Art[COLOR_REVERT] et vos [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mécénats d'Art[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci Giverny per incrementare cultura e felicità delle Gallerie d'arte e dei Patronati d'arte

TEXT.English: Giverny is a small commune in northwestern France. Giverny's population has never exceeded more than a few hundred people, but it is best known as the location of Claude Monet's home and garden. Monet moved to Giverny in 1883 (after starting the Impressionist movement in the 1870s) and would go on to paint numerous paintings of the garden and water-lily ponds. After Monet's death in 1926, the home and grounds were turned into a museum.
TEXT.French: Giverny is a small commune in northwestern France. Giverny's population has never exceeded more than a few hundred people, but it is best known as the location of Claude Monet's home and garden. Monet moved to Giverny in 1883 (after starting the Impressionist movement in the 1870s) and would go on to paint numerous paintings of the garden and water-lily ponds. After Monet's death in 1926, the home and grounds were turned into a museum.
TEXT.Italian: Giverny è una piccola tenuta nella Francia del nord-ovest. La popolazione di questo abitato non ha mai superato le poche centinaia di persone, ma è famosa in tutta il mondo come luogo della casa e del giardino di Claude Monet. Monet si stabilì a Giverny nel 1883 (dopo aver fondato il movimento impressionista negli anni 70) e continuò numerosi dipinti del giardino e delle ninfee. Dopo la morte di Monet nel 1926, la casa ed il terreno vennero trasformati in un museo.

TEXT.English: Golden Spike
TEXT.French: Le Piquet d'Or
TEXT.Italian: Golden Spike

TEXT.English: Build The Golden Spike to create a Transcontinental Railroad on completion and to speed up your production of Settlers and Workers thereafter.
TEXT.French: Build The Golden Spike to create a Transcontinental Railroad on completion and to speed up your production of Settlers and Workers thereafter.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Golden Spike per creare una ferrovia transcontinentale, oltre che per velocizzare la produzione di unità di coloni e di lavoratori.

TEXT.English: The Golden Spike was the name given to the ceremonial last spike driven to finish the first railroad line to cross the United States. The ceremony was held on May 10, 1869, at Promontory Point in Utah. Other great railroads include the Canadian Pacific Railway and the Trans-Siberian Railway.
TEXT.French: The Golden Spike was the name given to the ceremonial last spike driven to finish the first railroad line to cross the United States. The ceremony was held on May 10, 1869, at Promontory Point in Utah. Other great railroads include the Canadian Pacific Railway and the Trans-Siberian Railway.
TEXT.Italian: Golden Spike era il nome dato all'ultimo chiodo utilizzato per terminare la prima linea ferroviaria trascontinentale che attraversò gli Stati Uniti. La cerimonia fu tenuta il 10 maggio 1869 a Promontory Point, nello Otah. Altre grandi ferrovie includono la Canadian Pacific Railway e la Ferrocia Transiberiana.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Builds a Transcontinental Railroad on Completion
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Builds a Transcontinental Railroad on Completion
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Costruisce una ferrovia transcontinentale al completamento

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Golden Spike[COLOR_REVERT] lays rails across your continent.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Golden Spike[COLOR_REVERT] lays rails across your continent.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Golden Spike[COLOR_REVERT] costruisce ferrovie attraverso il tuo continente.

TEXT.English: Hill of Tara
TEXT.French: Colline de Tara
TEXT.Italian: Collina di Tara

TEXT.English: The Hill of Tara grants you a free Chief's Hut in every city and +1 happiness from your state religion.
TEXT.French: The Hill of Tara grants you a free Chief's Hut in every city and +1 happiness from your state religion.
TEXT.Italian: La collina di Tara fornisce una Capanna del capo gratuita in ogni città e +1 felicità dalla tua religione di stato.

TEXT.English: The Hill of Tara is the legendary seat of the High King of Ireland. The Hill of Tara may have served as a capital for the High King, or may have been the site of his coronation and sacred rituals. The first structures on the site were built around 3400 BC with the "Mound of the Hostages", a small tomb on the site. Later improvements include a pair of linked earthworks known as the "Royal Seat" and "Carnac's House". In the center of the "Royal Seat" stands the Stone of Destiny, which legend says will roar three times if touched by the true king.
TEXT.French: Dans la mythologie celtique irlandaise, Tara est la capitale mythique de l'Irlande, située dans la cinquième province de Meath, au centre ; en irlandais, c'est « Teamhair na Rí », la colline des rois. Le récit Suidigud Tellach Temra (Fondation du domaine de Tara) expose la suprématie de la ville sur le reste de l'île. source: wikipédia
TEXT.Italian: La collina di Tara è il leggendariof trono del Grande re d'Irlanda. La collina di Tara potrebbe essere servita come capitale per il Grande re, o potrebbe essere stata il sito della sua incoronazione e dei rituali sacri. Le prime strutture vennero costruite intono al 3400 a.C. con il "Tumulo degli ostaggi", una piccola tomba. Miglioramenti più recenti includono un paio di costruzioni legate fra loro, note come "Sesgio reale" e "Casa di Carnac". Al centro del "Seggio reale" c'e la Pietra del destino, che secondo la leggenda dovrebbe ruggire tre volte se toccata dal vero re.

TEXT.English: National Night of Hockey
TEXT.French: La Nuit du Hockey au Canada
TEXT.Italian: Notte dell'hockey in Canada

TEXT.English: Hockey Night In Canada has been a national institution since 1952, when Foster Hewitt's familiar "Hello, Canada!" ushered hockey fans into the era of television. It was the greeting he had been using on the radio broadcast of the same name since its first coast-to-coast coverage of a 1933 contest between the Detroit Red Wings and Toronto Maple Leafs, coming two years after the radio broadcast of the opening game at the new Maple Leaf Gardens on Carlton Street in downtown Toronto.[PARAGRAPH:1]Over the years, Hockey Night In Canada also began to use former NHL players and coaches as game analysts, including Bob Goldham, Howie Meeker, Gary Dornhoefer, John Davidson, Greg Millen, John Garrett and the outspoken Don Cherry, whose "Coach's Corner" intermission segment with Ron MacLean became the highest-rated spot on Canadian television.
TEXT.French: Hockey Night In Canada has been a national institution since 1952, when Foster Hewitt's familiar "Hello, Canada!" ushered hockey fans into the era of television. It was the greeting he had been using on the radio broadcast of the same name since its first coast-to-coast coverage of a 1933 contest between the Detroit Red Wings and Toronto Maple Leafs, coming two years after the radio broadcast of the opening game at the new Maple Leaf Gardens on Carlton Street in downtown Toronto.[PARAGRAPH:1]Over the years, Hockey Night In Canada also began to use former NHL players and coaches as game analysts, including Bob Goldham, Howie Meeker, Gary Dornhoefer, John Davidson, Greg Millen, John Garrett and the outspoken Don Cherry, whose "Coach's Corner" intermission segment with Ron MacLean became the highest-rated spot on Canadian television.
TEXT.Italian: Notte dell'hockey in Canada è un'istituzione nazionale dal 1952, quando il familiare "Hello, Canada!" di Foster Hewitt accolse i fan dell'hockey nell'era della televisione. Era il saluto che lui aveva usato sulla trasmissione radio con lo stesso nome sin dalla prima trasmissione nazionale del match del 1933 tra i Detroit Red Wings e i Toronto Maple Leafs, due anni dopo la prima trasmissione radio della partita di apertura al Maple Leaf Gardens a Carlton Street, nella città di Toronto.[PARAGRAPH:1]Durante gli anni, la Notte dell'hockey in Canada iniziò ad usare ex-giocatori e allenatori di NHL come analisti di gioco, come Bob Goldham, Howie Meeker, Gary Dornhoefer, John Davidson, Greg Millen, John Garrett e Don Cherry, il cui segmento "Coach's Corner" con Ron MacLean diventò lostacco pubblicitario più gradito in Canada.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hockey Night in Canada[COLOR_REVERT] provides [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]1 happiness[COLOR_REVERT] to all Broadcast Towers and Hockey Rinks of the building civilization and +25% gold to the city in which it resides. It contributes an improved chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hockey Night in Canada[COLOR_REVERT] provides [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]1 happiness[COLOR_REVERT] to all Broadcast Towers and Hockey Rinks of the building civilization and +25% gold to the city in which it resides. It contributes an improved chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notte dell'hockey in Canada[COLOR_REVERT] fornisce [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]1 felicità[COLOR_REVERT] a tutti i Ripetitori e ai Campi da Hockey della città che costruisce la meraviglia; inoltre fornisce +25% all'oro nella città dov'è costruita. Aumenta le chance di generare un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Artista[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: House of Wisdom
TEXT.French: Maison de la sagesse
TEXT.Italian: Casa della saggezza

TEXT.English: The House of Wisdom converts 1 gold from each Priest specialist you have into Science.
TEXT.French: Maison de la sagesse
TEXT.Italian: La Casa della saggezza toglie ai tuoi sacerdoti 1 oro e aggiunge 1 ricerca

TEXT.English: The House of Wisdom was a library and translation center in Baghdad in the 9th century, during the Islamic Golden Age. The House collected numerous manuscripts of Greek, Persian, and Indian literature and science, translating them all into Arabic. Hundreds of thousands of manuscripts were collected, helping to protect knowledge that might have been lost following the collapse of the Greek and Roman Empires. The House was destroyed during the Mongol sack of Baghdad in 1258.
TEXT.French: Maison de la sagesse
TEXT.Italian: La casa della saggezza era una biblioteca e centro di traduzioni a Baghdad nel 9° secolo, durante l'Età dell'oro islamica. La casa raccoglieva numerosi manoscritti di scienza e letteratura greca, indiana e persiana, con le relative traduzioni in arabo. Centinaia di migliaia di manoscritti vennero raccolti, aiutando a proteggere una conoscenza che sarebbe potuta svanire in seguito al collasso dell'Impero Romano. La casa fu distrutta durante il saccheggio di Baghdad effettuato nel 1258.

TEXT.English: Kentucky Derby
TEXT.French: Le Derby du Kentucky
TEXT.Italian: Derby del Kentucky

TEXT.English: The Kentucky Derby is a horse race for Thoroughbred racehorses and is probably the most famous horse race in the world. The race is held annually at the Churchill Downs racetrack in Louisville, Kentucky, in early May, and has been held every year since 1875. The race is 1.25 miles (2 km) long, and only three-year-old horses are allowed to run. Traditions of the race include the mint julep as the traditional beverage and a blanket of red roses being given to the winner, giving the event the nickname of The Run for the Roses.
TEXT.French: The Kentucky Derby is a horse race for Thoroughbred racehorses and is probably the most famous horse race in the world. The race is held annually at the Churchill Downs racetrack in Louisville, Kentucky, in early May, and has been held every year since 1875. The race is 1.25 miles (2 km) long, and only three-year-old horses are allowed to run. Traditions of the race include the mint julep as the traditional beverage and a blanket of red roses being given to the winner, giving the event the nickname of The Run for the Roses.
TEXT.Italian: Il derby del Kentucky è una gara di cavalli per cavalli da corsa Thoroughbred; probabilmente, è la gara di cavalli più famosa al mondo. La gara viene organizzata ogni anno al circuito di Churchill Downs di Loisville, in Kentucky, all'inizio di maggio; è stato organizzato ogni anno sin dal 1875. La gara è lunga un quarto di miglio, e sono ammessi alla corsa solo cavalli di tre anni. Tradizioni della gara sono l'abbeveratoio tradizionale e un mazzo di rose rosse che vengono date al vincitore, da cui deriva il nome Corsa delle rose.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kentucky Derby[COLOR_REVERT] provides 1 happiness and +2 gold to all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Animal Racetracks[COLOR_REVERT] of the building civilization. The Derby also provides a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subdued Horse[COLOR_REVERT] every 10 turns, allowing you to build more Horse Herds or upgrade them to Mounted units.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Derby du Kentucky[COLOR_REVERT] procure du bonheur et de l'or pour chaque [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippodrome[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette merveille fournit également un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cheval deompté[COLOR_REVERT] tous les 10 tours, vous permettant d'établir d'autres troupeaux, ou de les améliorer en unités montées.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Derby del Kentucky[COLOR_REVERT] fornisce +1 felicità e +2 oro a tutti gli edifici [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Circuito per gare di animali[COLOR_REVERT]. Il Derby fornisce anche un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavallo ammaestrato[COLOR_REVERT] ogni 10 turni, permettendoti di costruire più Recinti per cavalli o migliorarli in unità montate.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Provides a [LINK=UNIT_SUBDUED_HORSE]Subdued Horse[\LINK] Every 10 Turns
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Procure un [LINK=UNIT_SUBDUED_HORSE]Cheval dompté[\LINK] tous les 10 Tours
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Fornisce un [LINK=UNIT_SUBDUED_HORSE]Cavallo ammaestrato[\LINK] ogni 10 turni

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kentucky Derby[COLOR_REVERT] has produced a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subdued Horse[COLOR_REVERT]!
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Derby du Kentucky[COLOR_REVERT] a produit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cheval apprivoisé[COLOR_REVERT]!
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Derby del Kentucky[COLOR_REVERT] ha prodotto un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavallo ammaestrato[COLOR_REVERT]!

TEXT.English: King's Tournament
TEXT.French: Le Tournoi des Rois
TEXT.Italian: Torneo del Re

TEXT.English: King's Tournament grants additional experience to your Melee, Mounted, and Hero units.
TEXT.French: King's Tournament grants additional experience to your Melee, Mounted, and Hero units.
TEXT.Italian: Il Torneo del Re fornisce XP extra alle tue unità montate, da combattimento ravvicinato e agli eroi.

TEXT.English: During the Middle Ages, tournaments were popular among knights. Some of the largest tournaments were held by kings, who had the most money and resources available. Louis VII of France held a tournament in 1179 to celebrate the passing of the French crown to his son Philip II that attracted three thousand knights. Edward III of England also regularly held tournaments.
TEXT.French: During the Middle Ages, tournaments were popular among knights. Some of the largest tournaments were held by kings, who had the most money and resources available. Louis VII of France held a tournament in 1179 to celebrate the passing of the French crown to his son Philip II that attracted three thousand knights. Edward III of England also regularly held tournaments.
TEXT.Italian: Durante il Medioevo i tornei erano molto popolari fra i cavalieri. Alcuni dei tornei più importanti erano organizzati dai re, che avevano molti soldi e risorse. Luigi VII di Francia organizzò un torneo nel 1179 per celebrare il passaggio della corona francese a suo figlio Filippo II che attirò più di tremila cavalieri. Anche Edoardo III d'Inghilterra organizzava regolarmente dei tornei.

TEXT.English: Krak des Chevaliers
TEXT.French: Le Krak des Chevaliers

TEXT.English: Build the Krak des Chevaliers to increase your cities' defense while you hold your religion's holy city -- and increase your units' attack strength while heathens hold it.
TEXT.French: Le Krak des Chevaliers
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Krak des Chevaliers per incrementare le difese della tua città mentre controlli la sittà santa della tua religione; inoltre incrementa la forza in attacco delle tue unità quando la città santa è controllata dagli infedeli.

TEXT.English: The Krak des Chevaliers is a Crusader castle in western Syria. The site was originally inhabited in the 11th century by Kurds, and the current castle was built by the Knights Hospitaller in the 12th century. It housed a garrison of 2,000 men at its peak. The castle was conquered by the Mamluks in 1271.
TEXT.French: Le Krak des Chevaliers
TEXT.Italian: Il Krak des Chevaliers è un castello che fu costruito dai Crociati nell'ovest della Siria. Il sito era abitato nell'11° secolo dai Curdi, mentre il castello attuale fun costruito dai Cavalieri Ospitalieri nel 12° secolo. Ospitava una guarnigione di 2000 uomini nel suo periodo di massimo splendore; il castello fu conquistato dai Mamekucchi nel 1271.

TEXT.English: Las Vegas Strip
TEXT.French: Las Vegas
TEXT.Italian: Strip di Las Vegas

TEXT.English: Build the Las Vegas Strip to radically increase your gold production in the building city and get extra gold from all your Casinos.
TEXT.French: Build the Las Vegas Strip to radically increase your gold production in the building city and get extra gold from all your Casinos.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Strip di Las Vegas per incrementare radicalmente la tua produzione di oro, e ottenere altro oro da tutti i tuoi Casinò.

TEXT.English: The Las Vegas Strip is the name given to the collection of casinos along Las Vegas Boulevard, just outside the city of Las Vegas. These casinos are famous for their unique and dramatic architecture, and 19 of the world's 25 hotels with the most rooms are located on the Strip. The Las Vegas Strip's first major casino was the Flamingo, which opened in 1946 and was backed by organized-crime boss Bugsy Siegel. His murder less than a year later brought a blaze of publicity to the Flamingo and helped launch the Strip into the gambling mecca it is today.
TEXT.French: The Las Vegas Strip is the name given to the collection of casinos along Las Vegas Boulevard, just outside the city of Las Vegas. These casinos are famous for their unique and dramatic architecture, and 19 of the world's 25 hotels with the most rooms are located on the Strip. The Las Vegas Strip's first major casino was the Flamingo, which opened in 1946 and was backed by organized-crime boss Bugsy Siegel. His murder less than a year later brought a blaze of publicity to the Flamingo and helped launch the Strip into the gambling mecca it is today.
TEXT.Italian: Strip è il nome dato alla serie di Casinò costruiti lungo Las Vegas Boulevard, appena al di fuori della città di Las Vegas. Questi Casinò sono famosi per la loro architettura unica, e 19 dei 25 hotel con più camere di tutto il mondo sono costruiti sulla Strip. Il primo casinò costruito sulla Strip era il Flamingo, che aprì nel 1946 ed era gestito dal boss del crimine organizzato Bugsy Siegel. Il suo omicidio meno di un anno dopo portò molta pubblicità al Flamingo, ed aiutò a lanciare la Strip nella mecca del gioco d'azzardo che è oggi.

TEXT.English: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip.
TEXT.French: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip.
TEXT.Italian: Un fortunato giocatore d'azzardo di %s2_city ha vinto il jackpot sulla strip di Las Vegas.

TEXT.English: A gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip! Of course, our tax collectors stand ready for just such an event.
TEXT.French: A gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip! Of course, our tax collectors stand ready for just such an event.
TEXT.Italian: Un giocatore di %s2_city ha vinto il jackpot nella Strip di Las Vegas! Ovviamente, i nostri esattori delle tasse satvano aspettando un evento come questo.

TEXT.English: Send our tax collectors to pay the lucky gambler a visit.
TEXT.French: Send our tax collectors to pay the lucky gambler a visit.
TEXT.Italian: Manda i nostri esattori delle tasse a far visita a questo "fortunato" giocatore.

TEXT.English: Good fortune should be enjoyed.
TEXT.French: Good fortune should be enjoyed.
TEXT.Italian: Augurategli buona fortuna.

TEXT.English: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip.
TEXT.French: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has hit the jackpot on the Las Vegas Strip.
TEXT.Italian: Un fortunato giocatore d'azzardo di %s2_city ha vinto il jackpot sulla strip di Las Vegas.

TEXT.English: London Eye
TEXT.French: Le London Eye

TEXT.English: The London Eye grants a gold bonus to the city it is built on and +2 commerce from all Engineer specialists.
TEXT.French: The London Eye grants a gold bonus to the city it is built on and +2 commerce from all Engineer specialists.
TEXT.Italian: London Eye ofrnisce un bonus all'oro nella città in cui è costruita; fornisce anche +2 commercio dagli ingegneri.

TEXT.English: The London Eye is a huge Ferris wheel built on the banks of the River Thames in London, England. It was opened in 2000 and was for a time the tallest Ferris wheel in the world. The wheel is 135 meters tall and visitors can see up to 40 kilometers from the top. The wheel attracts over 3.5 million visitors each year.
TEXT.French: The London Eye is a huge Ferris wheel built on the banks of the River Thames in London, England. It was opened in 2000 and was for a time the tallest Ferris wheel in the world. The wheel is 135 meters tall and visitors can see up to 40 kilometers from the top. The wheel attracts over 3.5 million visitors each year.
TEXT.Italian: La London Eye è una grande ruota panoramica costruita sulle rive del fiume Tamigi a Londra, in Inghilterra. Fu aperta nel 2000 e fu per un breve periodo la più alta ruota panoramica del mondo. La ruota è alta 135 metri e i visitatori possono vedere fino a una distanza di 40 km dalla cima. La ruota attre più di 3,5 milioni di visitatori ogni anno.

TEXT.English: Advertising Agency
TEXT.French: Agence de Publicité
TEXT.Italian: Agenzia pubblicitaria

TEXT.English: Build Advertising Agency to increase your gold production.
TEXT.French: Améliore à la fois les revenus et la culture de votre ville
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci un'agenzia pubblicitaria per incrementare la tua produzione d'oro.

TEXT.English: Advertising is not new to history; commercial messages have been found in the volcanic ruins of Pompeii. The modern advertising agency dates to the late 1800s, when the first advertising agency, N. W. Ayer & Son, was founded. This agency was one of the first to offer the complete planning and executing of marketing for its customers. Advertising has since adapted to every new kind of media available, from the radio, to television, to the Internet.
TEXT.French: Agence de Publicité
TEXT.Italian: La pubblicità ha una lunga storia: messaggi commerciali sono stati ritrovati nelle rovine vulcaniche di Pompei. Le moderne agenzie pubblicitarie hannoa vuto origine alla fine dell'Ottocento, quando fu fondata la prima agenzia N. W. Ayer & Son. Quest'agenzia fu una delle prime ad offrire pianificazione ed esecuzione completa del marketing ai propri clienti. Da allora la pubblicità si è adattata ai nuovi mezzi di comunicazione, come radio, televisione ed internet.

TEXT.English: Madison Avenue
TEXT.French: L'Avenue Madison

TEXT.English: Madison Avenue increases the amount of gold produced by your shopping buildings and Advertising Agencies. It also allows you extra commerce from Artists.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Avenue Madison[COLOR_REVERT] augmente les revenus des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boutiques de shopping[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agences de pub[COLOR_REVERT]. Il donne également un bonus de commerce pour les spécialistes Artistes.
TEXT.Italian: Madison Avenue aumenta la quantità di oro prodotta dai tuoi edifici legati allo shopping e dalle Agenzie pubblicitarie. Fornisce anche commercio extra agli artisti.

TEXT.English: Madison Avenue in New York City became the heart of the American advertising industry in the 1920s. By 1861, there were 20 ad agencies in New York City, and the New York City Association of Advertising Agencies was founded there in 1911. The term "Madison Avenue" became a metonym for the advertising industry, and advertising managed to shape a substantial part of the world's culture in the 20th and 21st centuries.
TEXT.French: L'Avenue Madison
TEXT.Italian: Madison Avenue, situata a New York City, divenne il cuore dell'industria pubblicitaria negli anni venti del XX secolo. Già dal 1861 c'erano 20 agenzie a New York, e l'associazione cittadina delle agenzia pubblicitarie fu fondata qui nel 1911. Il termine "Madison Avenue" divenne sinonimo di industria pubblicitaria, mentre la pubblicità divenne parte della cultura mondiale nel XX e XXI secolo.

TEXT.English: Maginot Line
TEXT.French: La Ligne Maginot
TEXT.Italian: Linea Maginot

TEXT.English: Build the Maginot Line for a free Barricade in every city.
TEXT.French: Build the Maginot Line for a free Barricade in every city.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Linea Maginot per ottenere Barricate gratuite in tutte le città.

TEXT.English: The Maginot Line was a huge defensive line built by the French between World War I and World War II. The French drew on their experiences with the trench warfare of World War I to build a line of defense along the German border, from Switzerland to Luxembourg. The basic idea was to dissuade the Germans from attacking France directly, or at least buy time for a general French mobilization. Due to political considerations and the supposed difficulty of attacking through the Ardennes Forest, the fortifications facing the Belgian and Luxembourg borders were much lighter. The line itself was an interlocked system of concrete walls, gun turrets, antitank obstacles, and underground connections. Unfortunately for all the time, money, and effort put into the Maginot Line, it proved to be useless during World War II. The German forces swept through the Ardennes and the French surrendered in less than two months. The Maginot Line has since become a byword for a supposed solution to a problem that utterly fails in practice.
TEXT.French: The Maginot Line was a huge defensive line built by the French between World War I and World War II. The French drew on their experiences with the trench warfare of World War I to build a line of defense along the German border, from Switzerland to Luxembourg. The basic idea was to dissuade the Germans from attacking France directly, or at least buy time for a general French mobilization. Due to political considerations and the supposed difficulty of attacking through the Ardennes Forest, the fortifications facing the Belgian and Luxembourg borders were much lighter. The line itself was an interlocked system of concrete walls, gun turrets, antitank obstacles, and underground connections. Unfortunately for all the time, money, and effort put into the Maginot Line, it proved to be useless during World War II. The German forces swept through the Ardennes and the French surrendered in less than two months. The Maginot Line has since become a byword for a supposed solution to a problem that utterly fails in practice.
TEXT.Italian: La Linea Maginot era un'enorme linea difensiva costruita dai francesi tra la I e la II Guerra Mondiale. Basandosi sulle loro esperienze con la guerra in trincea della I Guerra mondiale, i francesi costruirono una linea difensiva lungo il confine tedesco, dalla Svizzera al Lussemburgo. L'idea base era dissuadre i tedeschi dall'attaccare la Francia direttamente, o almeno guadagnare tempo per una mobilitazione genrale della Francia. A causa di questioni politiche e della supposta difficoltà di attaccare attraverso la Foresta delle Ardenne, le fortificazoni lungo i confini con Belgio e Lussemburgo erano molto meno potenti. La linea stessa era un complesso sistema di muri in calcestruzzo, ostacoli anticarro, torrette con mitragliatrici e tunnel sotterranei.Sfortunatamente per tutti i soldi, il tempo e gli sforzi fatti per costruirla, la Linea Maginot si rivelò inutile nella II Guerra Mondiale. I tedeschi attaccarono attraverso le Ardenne e i francesi si arresero in meno di due mesi. La Linea Maginot è da allora l'esempio di qualcosa che dovrebbe essere la soluzione al problema, ma che in pratica è destinata a fallire.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Places Bunkers Along Your Frontiers On Completion
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Place des Bunkers le long de vos Frontières
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Piazza dei bunker lungo le tue frontiere quando viene completata

TEXT.English: Monte Carlo
TEXT.French: Monte Carlo

TEXT.English: Build Monte Carlo to increase your gold production.
TEXT.French: Build Monte Carlo to increase your gold production.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci Monte Carlo per incrementare la tua produzione di oro.

TEXT.English: The Monte Carlo casino was built in 1856 in Monaco for the House of Grimaldi. The government of Monaco and the ruling family have held a majority interest in the casino since its construction. For most of this time, the casino has been the primary source of income for the Monaco economy.
TEXT.French: The Monte Carlo casino was built in 1856 in Monaco for the House of Grimaldi. The government of Monaco and the ruling family have held a majority interest in the casino since its construction. For most of this time, the casino has been the primary source of income for the Monaco economy.
TEXT.Italian: Il Casinò di Monte Carlo fu costruito a Monaco nel 1856 dalla Casa dei Grimaldi. Il governo di Monaco e la famiglia regnante hanno sempre avuto un grande interesse nei confroti del Casinò, sin dalla sua costruzione. Per la maggior parte di questo periodo, il casinò è stata la principale fonte di entrate per l'economia di Monaco.

TEXT.English: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo.
TEXT.French: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo.
TEXT.Italian: Un fortunato giocatore di %s2_city ha sbancato la roulette a Monte Carlo

TEXT.English: A gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo! Of course, our tax collectors stand ready for just such an event.
TEXT.French: A gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo! Of course, our tax collectors stand ready for just such an event.
TEXT.Italian: Un fortunato giocatore di %s2_city ha sbancato la roulette a Monte Carlo! Ovviamente, i nostri esattori delle tasse stavano aspettando un simile evento.

TEXT.English: Send our tax collectors to pay the lucky gambler a visit.
TEXT.French: Send our tax collectors to pay the lucky gambler a visit.
TEXT.Italian: Mandate i nostri esattori a far visita al "fortunato" giocatore.

TEXT.English: Good fortune should be enjoyed.
TEXT.French: Good fortune should be enjoyed.
TEXT.Italian: Dovrebbe godersi la sua buona stella.

TEXT.English: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo.
TEXT.French: A lucky gambler from %s2_city has broken the bank at Monte Carlo.
TEXT.Italian: Un fortunato giocatore di %s2_city ha sbancato la roulette a Monte Carlo.

TEXT.English: Orient Express
TEXT.French: L'Orient Express

TEXT.English: Build the Orient Express to boost your trade income, as well as get additional happiness and espionage from your Railroad Stations.
TEXT.French: Build the Orient Express to boost your trade income, as well as get additional happiness and espionage from your Railroad Stations.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci l'Orient Express per aumentare il ricavato delle rotte commerciali, oltre a felicità e spionaggio bonus dalle tue Stazioni ferroviarie.

TEXT.English: The Orient Express was the name of a passenger train service that ran from Paris to Istanbul. It was first started in 1883 and ran until December 2009. A private version of the train still runs today. The Orient Express became famous for both luxury travel and intrigue, was and was used in numerous books, films, and TV shows.
TEXT.French: The Orient Express was the name of a passenger train service that ran from Paris to Istanbul. It was first started in 1883 and ran until December 2009. A private version of the train still runs today. The Orient Express became famous for both luxury travel and intrigue, was and was used in numerous books, films, and TV shows.
TEXT.Italian: Orient Express era il nome di un treno passeggeri che collegava Parigi a Istanbul. Fu iniziato nel 1883 e funzionò fino a dicembre 2009. Una versione privata del treno funziona ancora oggi. L'Orient Express divenne famoso sia per i viaggi lussuosi che per gli intrighi, dato che fu raffigurato in molti libri, fil e serie TV.

TEXT.English: Palace of the Soviets
TEXT.French: Le Palais des Soviets
TEXT.Italian: Palazzo dei Soviet

TEXT.English: Build the Palace of the Soviets to slash your cities' maintenance costs and increase the happiness from some buildings.
TEXT.French: Build the Palace of the Soviets to slash your cities' maintenance costs and increase the happiness from some buildings.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Palazzo dei Soviet per annientare i costi di mantenimento delle tue città e aumentare la felicità da akcuni edifici.

TEXT.English: The Palace of the Soviets was planned as a giant administrative center for the soviets (workers' councils) of the Soviet Union. Construction was started in 1937 but was interrupted by World War II and never resumed. The foundations were eventually converted to a giant open-air swimming pool.
TEXT.French: The Palace of the Soviets was planned as a giant administrative center for the soviets (workers' councils) of the Soviet Union. Construction was started in 1937 but was interrupted by World War II and never resumed. The foundations were eventually converted to a giant open-air swimming pool.
TEXT.Italian: Il Palazzo dei Soviet fu progettato come un gigantesco centro amministrativo per i sovie (assemblee dei lavoratori) dell'Unione Sovietica. La costruzione fu iniziata nel 1937, ma venne interrotta dalla Seconda Guerra mondiale e mai più ripresa. Le fondazioni vennero in seguito convertite in una gigantesca piscina all'aria aperta.

TEXT.English: Pearl Harbor
TEXT.French: Pearl Harbor

TEXT.English: Build Pearl Harbor as a forward military base to increase your line of sight and drastically increase the speed of your military unit repairs.
TEXT.French: Build Pearl Harbor as a forward military base to increase your line of sight and drastically increase the speed of your military unit repairs.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci Pearl Harbor come una base militare, per incrementare la tua linea di avvistamento e la velocità di riparazione dei danni per le tue unità.

TEXT.English: Pearl Harbor is a natural harbor on the island of O'ahu in Hawai'i. In the early 20th century, a United States Navy base was established there to serve as a supply station and later a repair yard. Pearl Harbor was attacked by Japanese forces on the morning of December 7, 1941. Of the ships in harbor, all eight battleships in harbor were sunk or damaged along with several other ships. This attack drew the United States into World War II. During the war, Pearl Harbor served as an important naval base for the Pacific Theater. When the carrier Yorktown was damaged at the Battle of the Coral Sea, workers at Pearl Harbor were able to repair the carrier to usable status in three days, in time for it to serve (and be sunk) at the Battle of Midway.
TEXT.French: Pearl Harbor is a natural harbor on the island of O'ahu in Hawai'i. In the early 20th century, a United States Navy base was established there to serve as a supply station and later a repair yard. Pearl Harbor was attacked by Japanese forces on the morning of December 7, 1941. Of the ships in harbor, all eight battleships in harbor were sunk or damaged along with several other ships. This attack drew the United States into World War II. During the war, Pearl Harbor served as an important naval base for the Pacific Theater. When the carrier Yorktown was damaged at the Battle of the Coral Sea, workers at Pearl Harbor were able to repair the carrier to usable status in three days, in time for it to serve (and be sunk) at the Battle of Midway.
TEXT.Italian: Pearl Harbor è un porto naturale dell'isola di O'ahu nelle Hawaii. All'inizio del XX secolo la Marina degli Stati Uniti vi costruì una base militare da usare come stazione di rifornimento e cantiere per le riparazioni.[TAB]Pearl harbor fu attaccata dai giapponesi il mattino del 7 dicembre 1941. Tutte le 8 corazzate nel porto furono affondate o danneggiate gravemente, assieme a molte altre navi. Questo attacco secgnò l'ingresso degli Stati Uniti nella II Guerra Mondiale. Durante la guerra, Pearl Harbor fu un'importante base navale nel teatro del Pacifico. Quando la portaerei Yorktown venne danneggiata durante la battaglia del Mar dei Coralli, i lavoratori dei cantieri di Pearl Harbor furono in grado di riparare la portaerei in 3 giorni, in tempo per combattere (ed essere affondata) nella Battaglia delle Midway.

TEXT.English: Pere Lachaise Cemetery
TEXT.French: Le Cimetière du Père Lachaise
TEXT.Italian: Cimitero di Père Lachaise

TEXT.English: Build Pere Lachaise Cemetery to gain a significant bonus to the Great Works of your Great Artists.
TEXT.French: Le Cimetière du Père Lachaise
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Cimitero di Père Lachaise

TEXT.English: Pere Lachaise Cemetery is a cemetery in Paris named for the confessor to Louis XIV. The cemetery itself was built in 1804 as a cemetery open to all. Today, it is the burial site of numerous famous people, including artists such as Molière, Georges-Pierre Seurat, Oscar Wilde and Jim Morrison.
TEXT.French: Le Cimetière du Père Lachaise
TEXT.Italian: Il cimitero di Père Lachaise è un cimitero di Parigi che prende il nome dal confessore di Luigi XIV. Il cimitero fu costruito nel 1804, in modo che fosse aperto a tutti. Al giorno d'oggi è il sito di sepoltura di molte persone famose, inclusi artisti come Molière, Georges-Pierre Seurat, Oscar Wilde e Jim Morrison.

TEXT.English: Pleistocene Park
TEXT.French: Le Parc de Pléistocene
TEXT.Italian: Parco del Pleistocene

TEXT.English: Build the Pleistocene Park to boost your civilization's happiness. It also improves the gold and science production of megafauna trainers that have survived to this day.
TEXT.French: Permet de booster le bonheur de votre civilisation. Il confère également un bonus d'or, de science aux éleveurs de mégafaunes qui ont survécu
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il parco del Pleistocene per incrementare la felicità della tua civiltà. Migliora anche la produzione di oro e scienza degli allevatori di grandi animali che sono sopravvissuti fino a questo punto.

TEXT.English: Pleistocene Park is an attempt to recreate the ecosystems of the last Ice Age in northern Siberia. Efforts are currently focused on currently-living herbivores, with some work being done with carnivores. It is possible that cloning technology may advance to the point where extinct megafauna can be recreated. While this is not possible to do with dinosaurs, as DNA is not stable over the geologic time scales required, some of these mammals may have survived until only a few millenia ago.
TEXT.French: Pleistocene Park is an attempt to recreate the ecosystems of the last Ice Age in northern Siberia. Efforts are currently focused on currently-living herbivores, with some work being done with carnivores. It is possible that cloning technology may advance to the point where extinct megafauna can be recreated. While this is not possible to do with dinosaurs, as DNA is not stable over the geologic time scales required, some of these mammals may have survived until only a few millenia ago.
TEXT.Italian: Il Parco del Pleistocene è un tentativo di ricreare gli ecosistemi dell'ultima Era Glaciale nel nord della Siberia. Gli sforzi attuali sono focalizzati sugli erbivori attualmente viventi, mentre poco è stato fatto per i carnivori. E' possibile che la tecnologia della clonazione possa avanzare fino al cui si possa ricreare la megafauna estinta; mentre questo non è possibile con i dinosauri, dato che il DNA non rimane stabile su scale di milioni di anni, il DNA di alcuni mammiferi può resistere per alcuni millenni.

TEXT.English: An accident has led to an escape of animals at Pleistocene Park!
TEXT.French: An accident has led to an escape of animals at Pleistocene Park!
TEXT.Italian: Un incidente ha causato una fuga di animali nel Parco del Pleistocene!

TEXT.English: An accident has led to an escape of animals at Pleistocene Park! Several people are dead and dozens are injured.
TEXT.French: An accident has led to an escape of animals at Pleistocene Park! Several people are dead and dozens are injured.
TEXT.Italian: Un incidente ha causato una fuga di animali nel Parco del Pleistocene! Molte persone sono morte e ci sono dozzine di feriti.

TEXT.English: Offer compensation to the affected families.
TEXT.French: Offer compensation to the affected families.
TEXT.Italian: Offri un risarcimento alle famiglie delle vittime.

TEXT.English: We don't have the money to spare.
TEXT.French: We don't have the money to spare.
TEXT.Italian: Non abbiamo soldi da perdere.

TEXT.English: River Rouge Complex
TEXT.French: Le Complexe Rivière Rouge
TEXT.Italian: Complesso di River Rouge

TEXT.English: Build the River Rouge Complex to increase your production. The more resources you have access to, the more effective it will be.
TEXT.French: Construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Complexe Rivière Rouge[COLOR_REVERT] va améliorer de manière importante votre production, en fonction des ressources dont vous disposez.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Complesso di River Rouge per incrementare la tua produzione. Più risorse hai a disposizione, più il complesso renderà.

TEXT.English: The River Rouge Complex was built by the Ford Motor Company as an automobile manufacturing center. It took 11 years (1917-1928) to build and was the largest integrated factory in the world, capable of going from raw materials to finished parts. The complete plant measured 1 mile (1.61 km) long by 1.5 miles (2.41 km) wide, and its buildings contained 16 million square feet of floor space.
TEXT.French: The River Rouge Complex was built by the Ford Motor Company as an automobile manufacturing center. It took 11 years (1917-1928) to build and was the largest integrated factory in the world, capable of going from raw materials to finished parts. The complete plant measured 1 mile (1.61 km) long by 1.5 miles (2.41 km) wide, and its buildings contained 16 million square feet of floor space.
TEXT.Italian: Il complesso di River Rouge fu costruito dalla Ford Motor Company come centro di produzione di automobili. Fu costruito in 11 anni, dal 1917 al 1928, ed era il complesso industriale più grande del mondo, trasformando materiali grezzi in parti finite. L'impianto era lungo 1 miglio e largo 1,5 miglia mentre gli edifici avevano una supericie calpestabile di 16 milioni di metri quadri.

TEXT.English: Rosetta Stone
TEXT.French: La Pierre de Rosette
TEXT.Italian: Stele di Rosetta

TEXT.English: The Rosetta Stone increases the culture and science output of your Museums, and increases the science output of your Anthropology and Archeology Labs.
TEXT.French: The Rosetta Stone increases the culture and science output of your Museums, and increases the science output of your Anthropology and Archeology Labs.
TEXT.Italian: La Stele di Rosetta aumenta la cultura e la ricerca dei tuoi musei, oltre ad incrementare la ricerca dei tuoi laboratori di archeologia e di antropologia.

TEXT.English: The Rosetta Stone is the name given to a 760-kilogram stone of black granite that was used to inscribe a decree of the Egyptian King Ptolemy V. The Stone was part of a temple stele and the decree was inscribed in 196 BCE to establish Ptolemy V's divine cult. The Stone was inscribed in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs, Egyptian Demotic script, and Ancient Greek. During Napoleon's campaign in Egypt in 1798, the Stone was discovered by technical experts accompanying the army. The Stone was recognized as having three inscriptions of the same text and taken to France, then surrendered to the British after the defeat of Napoleon's expedition. The Stone is still on display in the British Museum.The three languages used on the Rosetta Stone are the key to its importance. Because the three languages used the same text, and especially because it was possible to recognize proper names, within the text, scholars became able to translate from the well-known Ancient Greek to the previously-unknown Demotic and hieroglyphs. The name "Rosetta Stone" has now become a byword for a single clue that opens up an entire field of information.
TEXT.French: The Rosetta Stone is the name given to a 760-kilogram stone of black granite that was used to inscribe a decree of the Egyptian King Ptolemy V. The Stone was part of a temple stele and the decree was inscribed in 196 BCE to establish Ptolemy V's divine cult. The Stone was inscribed in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs, Egyptian Demotic script, and Ancient Greek. During Napoleon's campaign in Egypt in 1798, the Stone was discovered by technical experts accompanying the army. The Stone was recognized as having three inscriptions of the same text and taken to France, then surrendered to the British after the defeat of Napoleon's expedition. The Stone is still on display in the British Museum.The three languages used on the Rosetta Stone are the key to its importance. Because the three languages used the same text, and especially because it was possible to recognize proper names, within the text, scholars became able to translate from the well-known Ancient Greek to the previously-unknown Demotic and hieroglyphs. The name "Rosetta Stone" has now become a byword for a single clue that opens up an entire field of information.
TEXT.Italian: La Stele di Rosetta è una roccia di 760 Kg in granito nero che fu usata per l'inscrizione di un decreto del re egiziano Tolomeo V. La stele faceva parte di un tempio, dato che il decreto fu inscritto, nel 196, per stabilire il culto divino di Tolomeo. La Stele presenta inscrizioni in geroglifici antici, Demotico e Greco antico.Durante la campagna in Egitto di Napoleone del 1798 la stel fu scoperta da esperti che accompagnavano l'esercito. Si accorsero che la stele presentava la stessa inscrizione in 3 lingue diverse e fu portata in Francia, e poi ceduta agli inglesi in seguitoalla sconfitta di Napoleone. Attualmente, la Stele è esposta al British Museum. Le 3 lingue sulla Stele sono la chiave della sua importanza; dato che le tre lingue riportano lo stesso testo, e soprattutto perchè fu possibile isolare nomi propri all'interno del testo, gli studiosi furono in grado di tradurre dal ben conosciuto greco antico alle lingue sconosciute, Demotico e geroglifici egiziani. Il nome "Stele di Rosetta" indica ora una singola scoperta che apre un nuovo mondo di scoperte.

TEXT.English: Route 66
TEXT.French: La Route 66

TEXT.English: Route 66 Terminus
TEXT.French: Extremité de la Route 66
TEXT.Italian: Termine della Route 66

TEXT.English: Route 66 builds Highways between the building city and the largest remaining city on the same continent. Both cities also get +3 trade routes and +50% trade route income.
TEXT.French: Route 66 builds Highways between the building city and the largest remaining city on the same continent. Both cities also get +3 trade routes and +50% trade route income.
TEXT.Italian: Route 66 costruisce delle Autostrade tra la città che la costruisce e la città più grande sullo stesso continente. Entrambe le città ricevono 3 rotte commerciali e un bonus del 50% agli introiti dalle rotte commerciali.

TEXT.English: Route 66 Terminus cannot be built; when you complete Route 66, it is automatically placed in the largest remaining city on the same continent.
TEXT.French: Route 66 Terminus cannot be built; when you complete Route 66, it is automatically placed in the largest remaining city on the same continent.
TEXT.Italian: Il Termine della Route 66 non può essere costruito; viene costruito automaticamente nella città più grande sullo stesso continente.

TEXT.English: U.S. Route 66 was a United States highway connecting Chicago and Los Angeles. It was first built in 1926 and became one of the most famous roads in the United States, nicknamed the "Main Street of America". At over 2400 miles (ca. 3,862 km) long, it served as a major connection across the western United States and was heavily used during the Dust Bowl of the 1930s as farming families left the Great Plains for agricultural work in California. Later, it would be used to move workers to military jobs during World War II, and then traveled by vacationers to Los Angeles during the prosperity of the 1950s. Route 66 was decommissioned in 1985 after the Interstate Highway System bypassed much of the route. Organizations devoted to Route 66 still exist and the route is still remembered in songs and TV shows.
TEXT.French: U.S. Route 66 was a United States highway connecting Chicago and Los Angeles. It was first built in 1926 and became one of the most famous roads in the United States, nicknamed the "Main Street of America". At over 2400 miles (ca. 3,862 km) long, it served as a major connection across the western United States and was heavily used during the Dust Bowl of the 1930s as farming families left the Great Plains for agricultural work in California. Later, it would be used to move workers to military jobs during World War II, and then traveled by vacationers to Los Angeles during the prosperity of the 1950s. Route 66 was decommissioned in 1985 after the Interstate Highway System bypassed much of the route. Organizations devoted to Route 66 still exist and the route is still remembered in songs and TV shows.
TEXT.Italian: La Route 66 era un'autostrada americana che collegava Chicago ad Alaska. Fu costruita nel 1926 e diventò una delle strade più famose degli Stati Uniti, soprannominata la "Strada principale d'America". Longa più di 2400 miglia fu usata come collegamento principale attraverso gli Stati Uniti occidentali e fu molto utilizzata durante le Tempeste di polvere degli anni 30 quando le famiglia di contadini lasciarono le Grandi pianure per trasferirsi in California. In seguito, fu usata per spostare i lavoratori verso impieghi militari durante la II Guerra Mondiale e in seguito fu usata dai turisti che si recavano a Los Angeles durante la properità degli anni '50. La Route 66 fu decomissionata nel 1985 dopo che il Sistema di Autostrade Interstatali sostituì gran parte della strada. Esistono molte organizzazioni devote alla Route 66, che viene spesso citata in canzoni e show televisivi.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Places Route 66 Terminus in your largest city on the same continent, Builds Highway Between This City and Route 66 Terminus
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]Aide : [COLOR_REVERT]Place le Terminus de la Route 66 dans votre plus grande ville du même continent, construit une autoroute entre cette ville et le Terminus de la Route 66
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Piazza un Termine della Route 66 nella città più grande dello stesso continente[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Costruisce un'autostrada tra questa città e il termine della Route 66

TEXT.English: Scapa Flow
TEXT.French: Le Scapa Flow

TEXT.English: Build Scapa Flow to increase your cities' defense and to speed up repairing your naval units.
TEXT.French: Build Scapa Flow to increase your cities' defense and to speed up repairing your naval units.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Scapa Flow per incrementare le difese delle tue città e riparare le tue unità navali.

TEXT.English: Scapa Flow is the name given to a great natural harbor in the Orkney Islands off the northern tip of Scotland. During the two World Wars, this was the main naval base for the Grand Fleet of the United Kingdom. The German High Seas Fleet was also interned here after the German surrender in World War I. The German sailors eventually scuttled most of the ships. The naval base was closed in 1956 and the area is now used as a processing point for oil from the North Sea.
TEXT.French: Scapa Flow is the name given to a great natural harbor in the Orkney Islands off the northern tip of Scotland. During the two World Wars, this was the main naval base for the Grand Fleet of the United Kingdom. The German High Seas Fleet was also interned here after the German surrender in World War I. The German sailors eventually scuttled most of the ships. The naval base was closed in 1956 and the area is now used as a processing point for oil from the North Sea.
TEXT.Italian: Scapa Flow è il nome dato a un grande porto naturale nelle Isole Orcadi al largo delle coste settentrionali della Scozia. Durante le due guerre mondiali Scapa Flow fu la base navale principale della Royal Navy. La flotta tedesca fu tenuta prigioniera qui dopo la resa tedesca nella Prima Guerra mondiale; i marinai tedeschi riuscirono ada affondare in seguito la maggior parte delle navi. La base navale fu chiusa nel 1956 e l'area viene attualmente utilizzata come stabilimento di trattamento del petrolio del Mare del Nord.

TEXT.English: Scarborough Fair
TEXT.French: La Foire de Scarborough
TEXT.Italian: Fiera di Scarborough

TEXT.English: Build Scarborough Fair to increase the Culture output of your Bazaars, Grocers, and Markets.
TEXT.French: Build Scarborough Fair to increase the Culture output of your Bazaars, Grocers, and Markets.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Fiera di Scarborough per incrementare la cultura dei tuoi Bazaar, Droghieri e Mercati.

TEXT.English: "Are you going to Scarborough Fair? Parsley, sage, rosemary, and thyme." The original Scarborough Fair was a trading fair in England chartered by King Henry III of England in 1253. The Fair started in August of each year and ran for 45 days, from the Assumption to the Feast of St. Michael. It attracted merchants from England, Scandinavia, and even as far as the Byzantine Empire. The fair eventually ended in 1788 due to increasing competition and taxation. The name was later adopted for a traditional ballad of two lovers giving each other impossible tasks.
TEXT.French: "Are you going to Scarborough Fair? Parsley, sage, rosemary, and thyme." The original Scarborough Fair was a trading fair in England chartered by King Henry III of England in 1253. The Fair started in August of each year and ran for 45 days, from the Assumption to the Feast of St. Michael. It attracted merchants from England, Scandinavia, and even as far as the Byzantine Empire. The fair eventually ended in 1788 due to increasing competition and taxation. The name was later adopted for a traditional ballad of two lovers giving each other impossible tasks.
TEXT.Italian: "Are you going to Scarborough Fair? Parsley, sage, rosemary, and thyme." La Fiera originale di Scarborough era una fiera commerciale inglese istituita da re Enrico III di Inghilterra nel 1253. La Fiera iniziava nell'agosto di ogni anno e durava 45 giorni, dalla festa dell'Assunzione alla festa di San Michele. Attirava mercanti dall'Inghilterra, dalla Scandinavia e perfino dall'impero bizantino. La fiera si concluse nel 1788 a causa dell'eccessiva competizione e delle tasse. Il nome fu in seguito dato a una ballata tradizionale che parla di due amanti che si danno compiti impossibili da compiere.

TEXT.English: Serpent Mound
TEXT.French: Mont Serpent
TEXT.Italian: Tumulo del serpente

TEXT.English: Build Serpent Mound to gain science from building Tumuluses.
TEXT.French: Build Serpent Mound to gain science from building Tumuluses.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Tumulo del serpente per ottenere ricerca dai tumuli.

TEXT.English: Serpent Mound is a huge effigy mound of a snake located in what is now southwestern Ohio. This mound is 3 feet (0.91 meters) high and 1,348 feet (410.87 m) long, making it the largest serpent effigy in the world. Evidence suggests that the mound was built around 1070 CE, probably by the Fort Ancient culture. The significance of the mound is that the various coils are arranged to point to sunrise and sunset on the solstices and equinoxes, and the pattern of the Serpent Mound fits the arrangement of stars in the constellation Draco.
TEXT.French: Serpent Mound is a huge effigy mound of a snake located in what is now southwestern Ohio. This mound is 3 feet (0.91 meters) high and 1,348 feet (410.87 m) long, making it the largest serpent effigy in the world. Evidence suggests that the mound was built around 1070 CE, probably by the Fort Ancient culture. The significance of the mound is that the various coils are arranged to point to sunrise and sunset on the solstices and equinoxes, and the pattern of the Serpent Mound fits the arrangement of stars in the constellation Draco.
TEXT.Italian: Il tumulo del serpente è un grande tumulo a forma di serpente situato nel sud-ovest dell'attuale Ohio. Questo tumulo è alto 3 piedi e lungo 1348 piedi, rendendolo la più grande figura di serpente nel mondo. Le prove suggeriscono che il tumulo fu costruito introno al 1070 d.C. probabilmente dalla civiltà di Fort Ancient. Il significato di questo tumulo è che i vari vertici sono disposti per indicare l'alba e il tramonto dei solstizi e degli equinozi, e la forma del tumulo ricorda la disposizione delle stelle nella constellazione del Drago.

TEXT.English: Shaolin Monk
TEXT.French: Moine Shaolin
TEXT.Italian: Monaco Shaolin

TEXT.English: Shaolin Monks make excellent city defenders and healers.
TEXT.French: Shaolin Monks make excellent city defenders and healers.
TEXT.Italian: I monaci Shaolin sono ottimi difensori delle città e guaritori.

TEXT.English: The Shaolin Monks were the product of the Shaolin Temple. Their martial arts feats have become the stuff of legends across the globe.
TEXT.French: The Shaolin Monks were the product of the Shaolin Temple. Their martial arts feats have become the stuff of legends across the globe.
TEXT.Italian: I monaci shaolin erano addestrati nel Tempio Shaolin. Le loro arti marziali sono diventate leggendarie in tutto il mondo.

TEXT.English: Shaolin Temple
TEXT.French: Temple Shaolin
TEXT.Italian: Tempio Shaolin

TEXT.English: Build the Shaolin Temple to grant the Martial Arts promotions to your units for free and to train Shaolin Monks.
TEXT.French: Build the Shaolin Temple to grant the Martial Arts promotions to your units for free and to train Shaolin Monks.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci il Tempio Shaolin per fornire la promozione Arti Marziali I gratuita alle tue unità e per addestrare i monaci shaolin.

TEXT.English: The Shaolin Temple was established in 5th century China. Its name means "monastery in the woods of Mount Shaoshi". Famous for its martial arts training, the Temple was destroyed by the Qing dynasty because of the monks' political meddling.
TEXT.French: The Shaolin Temple was established in 5th century China. Its name means "monastery in the woods of Mount Shaoshi". Famous for its martial arts training, the Temple was destroyed by the Qing dynasty because of the monks' political meddling.
TEXT.Italian: Il Tempio Shaolin fu fondato nella Cina del V secolo; il suo nome significa "monastero nei boschi del Monte Shaoshi". Famoso per gli addestramenti nelle arti marziali il Tempio venne distrutto dalla dinastia Qing a causa delle idee politiche dei monaci.

TEXT.English: Svalbard Global Seed Vault
TEXT.French: La Réserve mondiale de Semences de Svalbard
TEXT.Italian: Deposito delle Isole Svalbard

TEXT.English: Build the Svalbard Global Seed Vault to provide your civilization with every food crop possible, as well as reducing the impact of disasters on your cities.
TEXT.French: Build the Svalbard Global Seed Vault to provide your civilization with every food crop possible, as well as reducing the impact of disasters on your cities.
TEXT.Italian: Il deposito delle Isole Svalbard fornisce alla tua civiltà ogni semenza possibile, oltre a ridurre l'impatto dei disastri nelle città.

TEXT.English: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault is a repository for seeds of food crops from across the globe. Opened in 2008, the Vault was built deep within the mountains of Svalbard, Norway, in the permafrost of the Arctic for maximum preservation. The seeds could someday be used to re-establish seeds lost to climate change, natural disaster, or warfare. By 2010, the Vault housed over 500,000 samples of seeds.
TEXT.French: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault is a repository for seeds of food crops from across the globe. Opened in 2008, the Vault was built deep within the mountains of Svalbard, Norway, in the permafrost of the Arctic for maximum preservation. The seeds could someday be used to re-establish seeds lost to climate change, natural disaster, or warfare. By 2010, the Vault housed over 500,000 samples of seeds.
TEXT.Italian: Il Deposito delle Isole Svalbard è un deposito di semi di piante da tutto il mondo. Aperto nel 2008, il deposito fu costruito nelle profondità delle isole Svalbard, in Norvegia, nel permafrost artico per una migliore conservazione dei semi. I semi potranno essere usati un giorno per ricreare le coltivazioni in seguito a cambiamenti climatici, disastri naturali o guerre. Nel 2010, il Deposito conteneva più di 500000 qualità di semi.

TEXT.English: Tokyo Sky Tree
TEXT.French: L'Arbre-Ciel de Tokyo
TEXT.Italian: Sky Tree di Tokyo

TEXT.English: Build Tokyo Sky Tree to increase the happiness of your cities with a Broadcast Tower or Communications Tower.
TEXT.French: Build Tokyo Sky Tree to increase the happiness of your cities with a Broadcast Tower or Communications Tower.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci lo Sky Tree per incrementare la felicità delle tue città con Ripetitori o Torri di comunicazione.

TEXT.English: Tokyo Sky Tree is a communications and observation tower in Tokyo, Japan. Built to replace Tokyo Tower, it is the tallest tower in the world and the second-tallest structure, only surpassed by Burj Khalifa. A new tower was needed because increasing congestion among Tokyo's skyline meant that Tokyo Tower was no longer tall enough to properly broadcast television and radio signals throughout Tokyo. Construction of the tower finished on 29 February 2012.
TEXT.French: Tokyo Sky Tree is a communications and observation tower in Tokyo, Japan. Built to replace Tokyo Tower, it is the tallest tower in the world and the second-tallest structure, only surpassed by Burj Khalifa. A new tower was needed because increasing congestion among Tokyo's skyline meant that Tokyo Tower was no longer tall enough to properly broadcast television and radio signals throughout Tokyo. Construction of the tower finished on 29 February 2012.
TEXT.Italian: La Sky Tree è una torre di comunicazione ed osservazione a Tokyo, in Giappone. Costruita per sostituire la Tokyo Tower, è la torre più alta del mondo ed il secondo edificio più alto, superaro solo dal Burj Khalifa. Una nuova torre era necessario perhcè la congestione dello skyline di Tokyo aveva reso la Tokyo Tower troppo bassa per trasmettere adeguatamente i seganli radio-televisivi. La costruzione della Sky Tree è terminata il 29 febbraio 2012.

TEXT.English: Tokyo Tower
TEXT.French: La Tour de Tokyo

TEXT.English: Build Tokyo Tower to increase the happiness of your cities with a Broadcast Tower.
TEXT.French: Build Tokyo Tower to increase the happiness of your cities with a Broadcast Tower.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Tokyo Tower per incrementare la felicità delle tue città con un ripetitore.

TEXT.English: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in Tokyo, Japan. It was originally built in 1958 to support NHK broadcasting throughout the Kanto region. The tower's design was based on the Eiffel Tower in Paris, but was 13 meters taller and 3,300 tons lighter. The tower serves as both a tourist attraction and a broadcast tower for radio and television signals. As Tokyo became more crowded and its skyscrapers rose higher, Tokyo Tower eventually became inadequate to support complete broadcasting to its service area. A second and taller tower, the Tokyo Sky Tree, was opened in 2012.
TEXT.French: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in Tokyo, Japan. It was originally built in 1958 to support NHK broadcasting throughout the Kanto region. The tower's design was based on the Eiffel Tower in Paris, but was 13 meters taller and 3,300 tons lighter. The tower serves as both a tourist attraction and a broadcast tower for radio and television signals. As Tokyo became more crowded and its skyscrapers rose higher, Tokyo Tower eventually became inadequate to support complete broadcasting to its service area. A second and taller tower, the Tokyo Sky Tree, was opened in 2012.
TEXT.Italian: La Tokyo Tower è una torre per comunicazioni e osservazioni a Tokyo, Giappone. Fu costruita nel 1958 per le tramissioni della NHK nella regione del Kanto, dove è situata Tokyo. Il design della torre era basato sulla Torre Eiffel di Parigi, ma era 13 metri più alta e 3300 tonnellate più leggera. La torre funziona isa come attrazione turistica, sia come stazione di trasmissione radio-televisiva. Mentre Tokyo divenne sempre più affollata e i grattacieli divennero più alti, la Tokyo Tower divenne inadeguata per supportare le comunicazioni nella sua area di servizio; perciò nel 2012 è stata costruita una nuova torre più alta, la Sky Tree.

TEXT.English: Troyes Trade Fair
TEXT.French: Foire d'échange de Troyes
TEXT.Italian: Fiera di Troyes

TEXT.English: Build Troyes Trade Fair to increase the gold production of your Bazaars, Grocers, and Markets.
TEXT.French: Build Troyes Trade Fair to increase the gold production of your Bazaars, Grocers, and Markets.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Fiera di Troyes per incrementare la produzione d'oro dei tuoi bazaar, droghieri e mercati.

TEXT.English: The Troyes Trade Fair was one of the six fairs of Champagne in the 11th to 13th centuries. The Troyes Fair, which happened every June, lasted about six weeks and was one of the most important fairs. Merchants came from all over Europe and even the Middle East and Africa to attend the fairs. The fairs became an international location for making loans and settling debts, eventually leading to a system of commercial law. The Champagne fairs began to decline after Champagne was united with the French crown in 1285 and eventually ended with the European wars of the 14th centuries. The influence of the Troyes Trade Fair still exists in the "troy weight" used to measure gold and silver.
TEXT.French: The Troyes Trade Fair was one of the six fairs of Champagne in the 11th to 13th centuries. The Troyes Fair, which happened every June, lasted about six weeks and was one of the most important fairs. Merchants came from all over Europe and even the Middle East and Africa to attend the fairs. The fairs became an international location for making loans and settling debts, eventually leading to a system of commercial law. The Champagne fairs began to decline after Champagne was united with the French crown in 1285 and eventually ended with the European wars of the 14th centuries. The influence of the Troyes Trade Fair still exists in the "troy weight" used to measure gold and silver.
TEXT.Italian: La Fiera di Troyes era una dlle sei fiere dello Champagne dall'XI al XIII secolo. La Fiera di Troyes, organizzata ogni giugno, durava circa sei settimane ed era una delle fiere più importanti. Arrivavano mercanti da tutta Europa e perfino dal Medioriente e dall'Africa. Le fiere divennero così un punto di ritrovo internazionale per fare affari e contrarre debiti, creando così un sistema di leggi commerciali. Le fiere dello Champagne iniziarono a perdere importanza dopo che lo Champagne venne unito al Regno di Francia nel 1285 e terminarono con le guerre europee del XIV secolo. L'influenza attuale della Fiera si riflette nel "peso troy", un'unità di misura per oro e argento.

TEXT.English: Walk of Fame
TEXT.French: Promenade de la célébrité

TEXT.English: Build Walk of Fame to increase the commerce and Happiness from your Artists, Great Artists, and Celebrities.
TEXT.French: Build Walk of Fame to increase the commerce and Happiness from your Artists, Great Artists, and Celebrities.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci la Walk of Fame per incrementare il commercio e la felicità dai tuoi Artisti, Grandi artisti e celebrità.

TEXT.English: A hall of fame is an attraction to honor individuals of achievement in a field. These halls can take many forms; one of them is the Hollywood Walk of Fame, stretching across 18 blocks of sidewalk along Hollywood Boulevard and Vine Street, in Hollywood, California. On the Hollywood Walk of Fame, over 2400 figures in the entertainment industry have embedded stars to honor their achievements in different fields of entertainment. Stars can represent achievement in motion pictures, television, broadcast radio, music, or live theatre. Some persons have stars in more than one category, and Gene Autry has stars representing all five categories.
TEXT.French: A hall of fame is an attraction to honor individuals of achievement in a field. These halls can take many forms; one of them is the Hollywood Walk of Fame, stretching across 18 blocks of sidewalk along Hollywood Boulevard and Vine Street, in Hollywood, California. On the Hollywood Walk of Fame, over 2400 figures in the entertainment industry have embedded stars to honor their achievements in different fields of entertainment. Stars can represent achievement in motion pictures, television, broadcast radio, music, or live theatre. Some persons have stars in more than one category, and Gene Autry has stars representing all five categories.
TEXT.Italian: Una hall of fame è un'attrazione creata per onorare alcuni individui in determinati campi. Possono assumere varie forme: una di esse è la Walk of Fame di Hollywood, disposta sui marciapiedi di Hollywood Boulevard e Vine in Street di Hollywood, in California. Sulla Walk of fame oltre 2400 figure dello spettacolo hanno delle stelle dedicate per onorare i loro risultati in differenti campi dell'intrattenimento. Le stelle possono indicare successi nel cinema, nella televisione, nella radio, nella musica o nel teatro. Alcune persone hanno stelle in più categoria, mentre Gene Autry ha una stella per ognuna delle cinque categorie.

TEXT.English: Warhol's Factory
TEXT.French: Studio-Usine de Warhol
TEXT.Italian: Studio di Andy Warhol

TEXT.English: Build Warhol's Factory to increase the commerce and production speed of your Art Galleries.
TEXT.French: Build Warhol's Factory to increase the commerce and production speed of your Art Galleries.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci lo studio di Andy Warhol per incrementare il commercio e la velocità di costruzione delle tue Gallerie d'arte.

TEXT.English: "The Factory" was Andy Warhol's name for his original New York City studio where he created his paintings and shot many of his films. The original Factory was located on the fifth floor of 231 East 47th Street in Manhattan, and Warhol worked there from 1962 to 1968. The Factory was known as the "Silver Factory" for its tin foil and silver paint decorations, and was famous for its red couch, constant stream of celebrities, and frequent orgies.
TEXT.French: "The Factory" was Andy Warhol's name for his original New York City studio where he created his paintings and shot many of his films. The original Factory was located on the fifth floor of 231 East 47th Street in Manhattan, and Warhol worked there from 1962 to 1968. The Factory was known as the "Silver Factory" for its tin foil and silver paint decorations, and was famous for its red couch, constant stream of celebrities, and frequent orgies.
TEXT.Italian: Il nome originale per lo studio di New York, dove creava i suoi dipinti e girava molti dei suoi filmati, era "The Factory". Lo studio originale era al 5° piano di 231 East 47th Street a Manhattan, dove Warhol lavorò dal 1962 al 1968. Lo studio era conosciuto come "Silver Factory" per le sue deocrazioni in stagno ed argento ed era famosa per il suo divano rosso, destinazione costante di molte celebrità e sede frequente di orgie.

TEXT.English: Westminster Abbey
TEXT.French: Abbaye de Westminster
TEXT.Italian: Abbazia di Westminster

TEXT.English: Build Westminster Abbey to increase the benefits from your Great People.
TEXT.French: Build Westminster Abbey to increase the benefits from your Great People.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci l'Abbazia di Westminster per incrementare i benefici derivanti dai Grandi Artisti.

TEXT.English: Westminster Abbey, properly known as the Collegiate Church of St. Peter at Westminster, is a large Gothic church in Westminster, England. It is famous as the coronation and burial site of English, British and Commonwealth monarchs, along with many national figures of Britain. The practice of memorializing national figures began in 1657 and has become one of Britain's highest honors.
TEXT.French: Westminster Abbey, properly known as the Collegiate Church of St. Peter at Westminster, is a large Gothic church in Westminster, England. It is famous as the coronation and burial site of English, British and Commonwealth monarchs, along with many national figures of Britain. The practice of memorializing national figures began in 1657 and has become one of Britain's highest honors.
TEXT.Italian: L'Abbazia di Westminster, nota anche come Chiesa Collegiale di San Pietro in Westminster, è una grande chiesa gotica di Westminster, in Inghilterra. E' famosa come luogo di incoronazione e sepoltura dei monarchi inglesi e del Commonwealth, oltre che luogo di sepoltura di molte figure nazionali inglesi di spicco. La pratica di rendere omaggio alla figure nazionali iniziò nel 1657 ed è diventato uno dei più grandi onori del Regno Unito.

TEXT.English: Willow Run
TEXT.French: Willow Run

TEXT.English: Build Willow Run for a bonus to production and a very large bonus to producing air units.
TEXT.French: Build Willow Run for a bonus to production and a very large bonus to producing air units.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci Willow Run per un bonus alla produzione, ed un bonus ancora maggiore alla produzione di aerei.

TEXT.English: Willow Run was a huge manufacturing plant built in 1940 as the United States increased its military production while World War II was raging in Europe. At its peak, Willow Run could produce 650 B-24 Liberator heavy bombers a month and could turn out one bomber every hour. The factory was so large that it incorporated a turntable to turn the assembly line so it would not cross a county border. The main production line was the world's largest single enclosed room when it was built. After the war, Willow Run would produce cargo planes, automobiles, transmissions, and military guns.
TEXT.French: Willow Run was a huge manufacturing plant built in 1940 as the United States increased its military production while World War II was raging in Europe. At its peak, Willow Run could produce 650 B-24 Liberator heavy bombers a month and could turn out one bomber every hour. The factory was so large that it incorporated a turntable to turn the assembly line so it would not cross a county border. The main production line was the world's largest single enclosed room when it was built. After the war, Willow Run would produce cargo planes, automobiles, transmissions, and military guns.
TEXT.Italian: Willow Run era un enorme stabilimento di produzione costruito nel 1940, quando gli Stati Uniti cercarono di incrementare la loro produzione militare mentre la II Guerra Mondiale infuriava in Europa. Willow Run poteva produrre fino a 650 bombardieri pesanti B-24 Liberator al mese, sfornando un bombardiere all'ora. La fabbrica era così grande che incorporava una piattaforma girevole per girare la catena di montaggio affinchè non attraversasse un confine di contea. La linea di produzione principale era la sala più grande del mondo quando venne costruita. Dopo la guerra, Willow Run continuò a produrre aerei, automobili, ingranaggi e armi militari.

TEXT.English: Woodstock
TEXT.French: Woodstock

TEXT.English: Build Woodstock for a huge culture bonus in your cities at the cost of some temporary unhappiness.
TEXT.French: Build Woodstock for a huge culture bonus in your cities at the cost of some temporary unhappiness.
TEXT.Italian: Costruisci Woodstock per un grande bonus alla cultura nelle tue città, al costo di infelicità temporanea.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]HELP: [COLOR_REVERT]Summer of Love Event Provides All Cities with +1000 [ICON_CULTURE] and 3 Temporary [ICON_UNHAPPY]
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET][COLOR_YELLOW]Aide : [COLOR_REVERT]Summer of Love Event Provides All Cities with +1000 [ICON_CULTURE] and 3 Temporary [ICON_UNHAPPY]
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]L'evento Summer of love fornisce +1000 [ICON_CULTURE] e 3 temporanee [ICON_UNHAPPY] a tutte le città.

TEXT.English: The Woodstock Music & Art Fair was held from August 15th to August 18th, 1969, at a dairy farm in upstate New York, a few miles from the town of Woodstock. Over the four days of the festival, 32 musical acts performed in front of 500,000 attendees. It was one of the biggest rock festivals of all time and one of the major events of the late-1960's counterculture. Some of the biggest acts in rock and roll performed at Woodstock, including Arlo Guthrie, Joan Baez, the Grateful Dead, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Janis Joplin, The Who, The Band, Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, and finally ending with Jimi Hendrix.
TEXT.French: The Woodstock Music & Art Fair was held from August 15th to August 18th, 1969, at a dairy farm in upstate New York, a few miles from the town of Woodstock. Over the four days of the festival, 32 musical acts performed in front of 500,000 attendees. It was one of the biggest rock festivals of all time and one of the major events of the late-1960's counterculture. Some of the biggest acts in rock and roll performed at Woodstock, including Arlo Guthrie, Joan Baez, the Grateful Dead, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Janis Joplin, The Who, The Band, Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, and finally ending with Jimi Hendrix.
